hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is located towards the edge of Waikiki, it's close to bars, restaurants, etc. Everything is very walkable. It was a very comfortable, clean room, that offered all the basic amenities. However, if you're looking for gigantic pools with pool parties, and crowded bars, that's not what you'll find. The hotel has a pool (but mostly for exercising and relaxing), and a restaurant for relaxing as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Housekeeping greeted us every morning. Room was very clean, beds comfortable, cold A/C and included a balcony which we didn't get a chance to enjoy. Valet were very helpful, carried our bags to check-in and assisted with bags upon check-out. Always assisted without being asked. They even had suggestions for local lunch spots. The entire staff was very helpful. The business center was very convenient as well for printing boarding passes, checking emails and printing items for work for no additional fee.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Business trip. My daughter tagged along to advantage of the opportunity to enjoy the island. Great location adjacent to, but not a victim to, the crush of Waikiki Beach. Once we parked, we walked everywhere else. Our room was more spacious than expected, well maintained and clean. Solid WiFi allowed her to "telework". Bathroom was perfect. Mandatory valet parking on par with NYC prices but access much more convenient. Valets were professional and efficient. Small but functional gym with free weights, weight machine, treadmills (2), and elliptical (2). Only disappointment was the breakfast menu and its price point. Recommend skip the hotel fare for something outside the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Mahalo to the Doubletree staff for a lovely stay during this challenging time. The hotel is located near many restaurants and shopping, and the room was very comfortable. Each staff member that assisted us was wonderful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came up with my ʻohana for a family funeral and we couldn’t be happier with the quality of service and ammenities offered. My elderly Aunty didn’t have to walk too far to get anywhere which we were certainly grateful for. I also appreciated the fitness Center that was available when we got back late at night - we definitely made use of that! Breakfasts were great - we had the continental and the hot breakfast - what a bargain! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Like the title says - clean rooms. a convenient way to find balance between business and leisure, and staff that is very helpful. Kudos to Jungmin and Elsa at the front desk, Earl and Alana at the restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location and hotel. I would love to go here again. The beach is really nice, and the people on the island are always so relaxed that it feels like a vacation, even when it's not! The gym could be bigger, but other than that it's awesome!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Be advised that this hotel charges a resort fee but does not actually have a resort. The items listed for the upcharge are standard at other properties in other cities. The hotel has a sister property at the beach with a resort but you can't use any of the benefits.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very convenient location. Good restaurants and only 10 minute walk to the beach. There also was a abc store a block away and a great burger place next door .a local breakfast joint within walking distance that was really good another one just next to the hotel. Very convenient location

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The stay was okay, clean room and decent hotel. I was caught off-guard with the $30 per night resort fee. I didn’t see any resort like amenities. I guess there was a swimming pool someplace, but the hotel is several blocks from the ocean and the real Hilton resort. I think it is a scam to advertise rooms at $30 less then they are actually charging. I would choose someplace else next time!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our group was welcomed and treated with friendliness, excellent and fast service. From check in to our daily breakfasts, housekeeping service, numerous questions about Waikiki, to a late check out, the service was exemplary and we experienced the Hilton Hawaiian Hospitality!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for one night at this hotel and were very satisfied with it. Because it was a few blocks from the beach, the price was very reasonable. We could see the beach and ocean from our room and had a decent view of a sunset from our balcony. The front desk staff went beyond our expectations. They accommodated us for both an early check-in to an upgraded room and a late check out and were very generous with the warm cookies. The room was about what you would expect from an older hotel in this class and very comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property is in a great location, with easy access to the beach, quick check-in/out, and terrific staff. It's my favorite place to stay while in Honolulu! Definitely less fuss than some of the other Waikiki resorts with the same "fun factor" and close appeal to all the city has to offer.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice clean hotel with lots of amenities. It's not on the beach but only a short walk to it and down the main strip. Close to shops and restaurants. The view is not too shabby either, I just wish the balconies were bigger

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff were all very nice, but there were feces smeared in toilet bowl when I arrived, bathroom ceiling paint was bubbling, headboard plastic was cracking, and worst of all, no hot water in bathroom. I told staff and they said they could move me the next day. Instead, I found that if I turned on bathroom sink hot water and shower hot water and let both run for 20 minutes, water got hot.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice property overall! Front-desk staff was always friendly, particularly Elsa and a 20-something male who worked mid-days (forgot his name). Room was a bit small, but clean and functional. Bottles of water were plentiful, in the rooms and front-desk, as well as apples and of course, The Cookies. Not the most convenient Waikiki hotel if you are just going to the beach daily. Is a 10-minute walk to the beach, or more depending on what part/area of the beach you're going to. Plenty of nearby restaurants and on-property ones too. Pool area was nice, comfortable. Pool is in the shade after about 3pm. Gym was your standard hotel gym, but worked. Resort Fee (about $25/day) is ... always annoying! Overall, very happy, will return!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here for business numerous times...and it has a good conference area. But what sets this hotel apart is their Concierge, Christina Basham. My experience with most Waikiki hotels is that the concierge is just handing out brochures and pushing events...sign up for this luau or that tour. Not, Christina! Her wealth of knowledge was stunning! We got insider tips not touristy trash. What a difference she made for our hotel stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were in Hawaii for a convention and the Double Tree was just a 7 minute walk from the convention centre. It is also close to many good restaurants and the beach as well. The room had a comfortable king bed and a small balcony which had an ocean view. It was clean and all the staff were very welcoming and friendly. The hotel restaurant served an okay breakfast as well. No complaints so we had a good stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I try to only stay at Hilton properties and can tell you this was disappointing. Hotel is in a good location close to lots of shopping and restaurants, however the property is very dated and could use a good remodeling. Staff was nice. Breakfast was average. Not sure I would stay here in the future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great central location in Honolulu, easy access to the beach at the Hilton resort or Fort Derussey. Also, the most comfortable bed I have slept in at a hotel in years. Plenty of restaurants nearby with great food and nightlife. Safe, walkable area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My mother and I recently stayed at the Double Tree in Waikiki for 3 weeks due to our house’s flooring needing to be redone. From the moment we step on property and checked in with Aina, she made us feel at home. Her professionalism and Aloha spirit welcomed us like nothing that we have experienced before. As a current Housekeeping Manager in Waikiki and previous Assistant Front Office Manager, I would do anything to have an employee like Aina on my team. She is hands down a true asset to the Double Tree Waikiki and I hope that she is recognized for all of her hard work. Thank you Aina for everything!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From check in to chekout it was great!When checking in, I believe a lovely lady named Lesli helped us out (name could be wrong :(). My brother and I stated we brought our mum along for this trip and it was our first time staying as DoubleTree as we usually stay at Hilton Hawaiin Villiage. We initially got the Alana Suit 2 double beds Mountain/ City view, she offered us an option of a small upgrade for the same room but the Partial Ocean View for a small price, we decided to do so and it was worth it! She offered 1 out of only 2 rooms that have the terrace available. There was a pull out sofa bed, where this room can be segregated into its own small room, with a TV and the double beds side also had its own TV. Clean rooms and spacious bathroom with plenty of mirrors to check out your Hawaiin tan.This room came with a fridge, kitchenette and coffee pod machine! The Partial ocean view rooms were beautiful, you got to see some action below with people walking and cars driving by plus ocean sunsets. Great location, right in the middle- Only 10-15 minute short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and closer walk to the beach via Hilton Hawaiin Village. In the other direction, again only a 10-15 minute short walk to the main strip (Kalakaua Ave). Their breakfast buffet was a little overpriced for us for what they offered and would recommend eating out elsewhere.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Amazing staff and the location is within walking distance to local restaurants, bars and shopping center. The cleanliness of the hotel was immaculate and the WiFi connectivity is exceptional. Whether is business or pleasure; the amenities are there to meet all desires.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree in Waikiki is in an incredible location manned by a very nice and accommodating staff that make it their business to ensure you have every requirement you need to have the best stay you can possibly have.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a treat on the top floor with the largest deck in Waikiki. We had the best view of New Year’s Eve fireworks from all over the island! We loved our 11 day stay and recommend this manoa suite to everyone. The gals in the bar made our trip the best. Mahalo...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stay at Hilton properties all the time. This location is in serious disrepair and I had cockroaches in my room. I checked out. Try another Hilton location in Honolulu. This hotel needs serious attention. The staff was very nice however.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this hotel before we took a cruise on the Norwegian. It was a good location, easy to get to and within walking distance of the beach and restaurants. Hotel staff were friendly and rooms are clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fast elevators, very walkable to Waikiki restaurants, shops and the beach. Henry at the front desk offered a great check in experience. Nice to be on Waikiki but not constantly in the middle of tons of people. The room decor felt a little dated, but it was clean. Didn’t wait more than 3 min for an Uber from the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I asked for a quiet room on the west side because I was on night shift. The rest of my group got quiet rooms, without asking, I did not.I had 18 holds or charges on my CC, which in the end disappeared and just two charges remained, but it was irritating to see a hold appear nearly every day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The DoubleTree by Hilton is a great hotel located near the beach and the Hilton Hawaiian Village in the Waikiki area. We enjoyed the luau at the Hawaiian village and this hotel was within walking distance to most attractions within the Waikiki area. It was clean and comfortable and we were able to book it at a very good price through Hilton Grand Vacations. We ate at both restaurants on property and they were good and reasonably priced. Our room was nice and had a good view from the balcony.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I wavered between a 3 and 4 * review. The hotel is fine. The service is great. The rooms are clean, large enough and some have nice balconies. My problem is the resort fee. Which only gives you the location, nothing else except a small pool. There are better and less expensive alternatives around Wakiki, even for HHonors members. The location is probably the #1 plus as you don't need a car, with just a short walk to all that wakiki has to offer. But that also means you won't be using the 'facilities' at the hotel that much, hence the annoying high resort fee. For Diamond members, the 'free breakfast' is continental and very limited - fruit, cereal, yogurt, breads. The full 'hot' breakfast is an additional $9. (In addition to that resort fee! - And yes, there is a theme here.) But once again, you probably will be enjoying breakfast somewhere else - like McDonalds!Not Recommended unless the other alternatives are booked or are more expensive, but don't forget to factor in that Resort Fee!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Starting off, checking in was like a zoo and chaos. Lobby was packed and only two people were checking guest in. One was checking in normal check in which was a line wrapped around the escalator and the one only checked in an cancelled flight. This cause a front desk and a customer to yell at each other and a customer started using profanity due to the chaos with kids around. No diamond recognition due tot he guy seems to be new and wasn’t too confident on using the system.Got to the room and smelled musky and had strong perfume smell to overcome to musky smell in the room. Feather blanket had blood stains on it.Went to get happy hour appetizer and stood in front of the bar for 5 minutes before being acknowledged by staff. Both would serve other surrounding guest. I was then handed a limited menu with 2-3 items only as they were all sold out from the free vouchers that was given that day. Decided to call the front desk to cancel the rest of the planned stayed due to our experience and ended up calling the diamond desk due to the front desk being too busy for someone to handle my request.This was an all bad experience for a Hawaii trip and first time staying at this location. Won’t be choosing this location for any future stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The resort fee adds no value if your attending a convention. And the hotel will not waive it. It is the closest to the convention center. Also close to shopping. Overall rooms are just average. They are updated, but already seem tired.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The resort charge is just a way to jack up the price.The staff is very pleasant and the room that we had was pleasant too. There was no view of anything except other hotels from our roomBreakfast buffet is pricey.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located. I stayed in a suite with a nice lanai overlooking a park and the city. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. It was exceptionally quiet, I did not hear noise from surrounding rooms or people talking in the hallway. Overall, one of the friendliest and most helpful staffs that I have encountered.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel several times. It is clean and comfortable. Location is walking distance to popular Waikiki venues. Staff is extremely friendly and professional. Make our stay very comfortable. Mahalo!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Arrived on Christmas Day 2019 for a week long stay in Waikiki. The hotel was without hot water for 2.5 days. The hotel staff was very lackadaisical and did not live up to the DoubleTree brand. We contacted the hotel to let them know there was no hot water only to be told the water temperature was 108 degrees. I can assure you, it wasn't. It was not even warm. We left and went out to walk around and came back. When we tried the hot water again, it was still cold. We called again to let the hotel know that there was no hot water. They sent a technician up to check on the hot water. The technician came in and checked and said yeah, there's no hot water you should call the front desk. We called the front desk and were informed that based on our call they learned that the hot water was out for the hotel. They said they would work on it. We left and went to dinner. When we came back there was still no hot water.We woke up the next day 12/26/19 and there was still no hot water. We called again to the front desk and were told that they were aware of the situation and were trying to get the problem fixed. We left for the day. Upon our return there was still no hot water. We again called and said that they were working on the problem. The next morning 12/27/19 we woke up and there was still no hot water. We called again and were told it was being worked on. We asked to speak to a manager about the issue and were told they would call us. We gave our cell phone and was assured someone would call us. We did not receive a phone call from the manager. We went out and upon our return there was no message from the manager, no call, but at least the hot water was working.The next morning we again called to speak to a manager. One happened to be nearby so they put her on the phone. We explained the situation without any hot water and asked for compensation from the hotel for the lack of hot water. We were told they were not giving any compensation. We pressed a bit harder and were offered $50 for the complete stay as compensation. We asked for at least the resort fees and valet parking fees to be waived for the two days. We were told no. She then offered $100 for the complete stay and that was it. In addition to the water issue above, we were called early one morning by the front desk and informed that the maintenance guy was outside our door and needed to enter the room due to a leak. We got up and let the maintenance guy in to check for a leak, there was none, and he left. The climate control for the room was horrible. Either too hot or too cold, no happy medium. The carpet felt damp all the time, the windows fogged up, and the towels and linens felt damp and musty. We have stayed at other properties in Waikiki and did not experience similar issues. One night the elevator stopped working and they had to get someone to come and fix it. This is a busy hotel and even with 3 elevators it's barely enough. Losing one meant it took a long time to get an elevator to your room.The only way to park here is by valet parking at the rate of $40 per day. Way too high in my opinion. There is also a resort fee.The hospitality, or lack thereof, at this DoubleTree property does not live up to expectations. The hotel staff exhibit no customer service whatsoever. What happened to the Aloha spirit? The nicest person working in the hotel was the cleaning lady who at least greeted us each morning, and provided extra towels, albeit damp towels, when asked. As a Hilton Honors member that stays in a lot of DoubleTree properties this is by far the worst we have stayed in. It does not live up the brand, or the cost. For the price you will pay to stay here, I would encourage you to stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has a good location and provides easy access to multiple options for tourists. Easy to shop, get to the beach or to restaurants. The bar/restaurant is only open from 4:30 pm which we found unusual. After a day of sightseeing a beer at 3pm would have been nice but there is a good bar next door that we frequented. The rooms are fine. They are clean and big enough. The bathroom is too small but we made do for 4 nights. The trolley stop is close by and got us where we needed to go. We found the staff very, very pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was spur of the moment stay for New Year’s Eve & day. Location of hotel was perfect and I booked my reservations same day that I was lucky it was still available online when I was searching for a hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is nice if you prefer not to be on the beach in Waikiki, but the hotel does not provide the same amenities as one would expect. For example the bar is not open during the day. If you want to enjoy a holiday cocktail while at the pool, you are not able to. The $30 per day resort fee is too high based on what you receive which is nothing different than anywhere--Internet, fitness room and pool.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is ok. The location is ok. The housekeeping staff- outstanding. I was happy to come back to the room every evening. The breakfast is a C at best- to be honest. But of course what can you say about those delicious cookies?? Yum.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is located at the center of Waikiki vis a vis a green park. If you do not have a room at the high floors, you will have no see view. The hotel has a swimming pool and a small fitness facilities. There is only one bar/restaurant that you can have your breakfast and other meals. The hotel offers daily happy hours which you will have some reduced price food and beverages in between 16:30-19:30. The hotel also offers vale parking service. The personel are very helpful and the facilities are sufficient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Not up to the quality that you would expect from a Hilton Brand. More like a Super 8 or a Motel 6. Over priced. I don't know why there is a resort fee for this place. Way over priced, rooms are shabby. My room had old screw holes in the wall. I also slipped in the shower and almost broke my back. You can't reach the towels when you come out of the shower. The towel rack is behind the shower door and you have to get out wet to reacha towel. This place is very bad. I would never recommend this place and I will never stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I would like to commend you on the excellent and professional services that I have received from Christina Basham throughout the years that I have visited Hawaii and stayed at your hotel location. Christina is a very knowledgeable, friendly, and dependable professional that has helped me with my itineraries in setting up and arranging tours, dinners, and excursions for me and my family/guests. Annually, my family and I visit Hawaii, and I always can depend on Christina's excellent and diligent customer service. Christina is one of the reasons why my family and I are repeat customers to your company. I look forward to her help in my future visits to Hawaii and would like to let you know that she is a great representative/asset for Expedia and the Concierge Office at the Double Tree by Hilton Alana-Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is a great hotel, everything exceeded my expectations. The view, the amenities, the accessibility and the helpfulness of the staff. This would've been a perfect hotel if they had 3 things:1. Free parking - it was so hard to find a spot in Honolulu, and the hotel charged 40$ for valet. 2. Microwave and water dispenser - would've been a great addition to each room. Going down to the lobby to get water was such a hassle, especially coming from the 16th floor.3. Free breakfast - most of the hotels I have been to had free, and it was almost a deal breaker for me not having it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location not great - 15 mins walk to Waikiki beach. Hotel is very average. Will not choose the hotel in the future. Hotel charge resort fee but it’s not a resort ?! We only used the internet access and that’s about it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: DoubleTree is always a mystery to me because their quality differs so much. This one, however, did not meet my expectations.Location: It's located in a funny place, half way between downtown Waikiki and Ala Moana center. You can argue that both are within walking distance, but for some people, both are not. The hotel is not located on major bus/trolley routes, and most tour companies does not pick you up at this hotel (you need to walk to a nearby hotel). Walking back from Waikiki at late night may be a bit concerning. Overall I think this hotel is less convenient than most other hotels in this area. There are multiple convenience stores nearby just like everywhere else at Waikiki.Facility: This is a very small hotel. One major benefit is you don't need to walk very far from your room to the street outside. You are also less likely to be buried by crowds. However, that also means this hotel has very limited facilities. There's only a small pool almost nobody uses, and a small gym. Making the resort fee feel extra expensive. They do offer an interesting benefit which allows you to rent movies using a machine at lobby level. They have some pretty new movies but you need to be able to find the machines first. This hotel has 19 floors, but only 3 small elevators. During busy hours people staying at lower floors may have trouble getting out. Also my room keys rarely worked. The staff gave me extra cards but then I had to carry multiple card with me because only some of them works at a given time.Room: The room was on the smaller side, but I can expect that in Waikiki. It felt a bit old and plain. But mostly OK. And I did appreciate the oversized TV. My standard room came with a balcony, but the bathroom was shower only. The city view was not bad. However one of Waikiki's main street is nearby so expect things like sirens. The water tasted a bit strange. It didn't make me sick but I certainly didn't like it.Members: If you are a gold/diamond member. This hotel doesn't want to please you. Room upgrade costs money. And you only get cold food for breakfast. Hot food costs extra. The restaurant is pretty small so I guess they just want to discourage people from using it.Overall speaking this hotel is not terribly bad (I'm more inclined to give it 2.5 stars instead of 2 if that's possible) However there are many other choices nearby, Hilton or not. And this hotel is not particularly cheap either. So I will certainly try a different hotel next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff was very kind and helpful but details to cleanliness was lacking. We did see roaches. Location was handy to good variety of eateries of varying cost. Walking distance to the beach and ABC stores every few feet!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff service made up for what was lacking in the facilities. The resort charge is a bit high considering the benefits available, i.e., small pool, etc. The facilities are a bit tired and need updating especially the breakfast bar where the counters are sloping and a child's plate slid off. The intent is probably to have a beachy feel, but the steel blue chairs make the place look like a cheap corner café, not a restaurant in a mid-range hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I chose the DoubleTree for a short stay before and after a cruise. It’s nowhere near any beach but in a good area with plenty of shopping and restaurants. Kalakaua Avenue is nearby and has every designer store imaginable. If you’d like to cheap out on a few meals and get prepared sandwiches, salads, etc. to enjoy in your room there are a 7-11 and an ABC store within easy walking distance.The room was a good size and pleasant. Amenities included a Keurig coffeemaker and good lighting on BOTH sides of the bed. The thermostat was set to a chilly and energy-wasting 60 degrees but I soon set that right. On my second stay I just shut it off entirely and opened the balcony door and enjoyed the fresh air. There was a mini-fridge but no microwave.The gym was an average size, with windows and proper ventilation. The pool was a disappointment given the beautiful climate- definitely on the small side. Wi-Fi worked well.The Hikers Cafe adjacent to the hotel has healthy food in a laid-back atmosphere (closes at 3 PM) and there's a 10% discount for hotel guests.As long as you understand that this hotel is nowhere near a beach and the pool is no compensation for that, this hotel is a good choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really, the staff and location of this DoubleTree made our stay. Henry at the front desk was so kind. He made sure that we were happy with our room. The location was great for our group, who wanted different activities. Valet staff was always on the ball.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a fantastic visit. Henry was so welcoming. He explained all amenities provided and gave suggestions for our first visit to the island. Thanks also go to Susan she was very welcoming and friendly!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I guess I had high expectations because of the Hilton brand but I could see some molds in shower head holder, and there was a leak from the shower hose. There was a coffee machine in the room but no completely water. I could clearly hear the conversation from next door. Just don’t expect too much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently I spent x6 nights at the property. The centrally-located Waikiki location is about the only positive for this property. The restaurant is dirty, loud, and chaotic. The $9 up charge (even with diamond status) to receive eggs and meat is ridiculous. Cups had caked on food. Food and trash was all over the floor. Waitstaff was more interested in watching college football, then assisting guests. The resort fee is a joke. The pool is tiny. The gym has 7’ ceilings and is barely air conditioned. This seems like an underhanded tactic to inflate the nightly rate, then provide added service beyond the doubletree standard. Lobby and public areas are dirty and need updating. Rooms were serviced well by cleaning staff, but they need updating to be at a level commensurate with most Hilton properties. The issues with this property are well passed a call to the front desk to resolve... I will find a different property for future business trips.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Henry the front desk clerk was fantastic! He took the time to explain and make suggestions thoroughly with each guest. I had a long week of travel and work and was exhausted by the time I got to the hotel, but Henry greeted me warmly and gave me a nice room on a high floor so I could get some peace and quiet. I definitely needed that after facing a parking lot on a low floor at a previous hotel. He also gave me some nice suggestions for a late dinner. Great stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked a room on getaroom.com and were charged extra for breakfast and a $30/night resort fee. but when we got to the hotel we were told the room did not include breakfast and we had to pay the resort fee again... so basically we had to pay about $30/night again for the resort fee and paid an extra $30/night for a room with breakfast that we never got. So we were ripped off $60/night. and we had a 5 night stay and our room was only cleaned twice, after we kept asking. we were constantly running out of towels and soap... never got refills of water, juice, or coffee. bed was super worn, soft and lumpy, very uncomfortable.on the plus side, the staff were wonderfully nice and warm and honestly felt bad for us but couldn't do anything about it. the cleaning staff was short-staffed, overworked, underpaid, and constantly running around cleaning on our floor... they really didn't mean not to get to us, they just only had one person in charge of cleaning a whole floor that was completely full and it was just too much. we really felt bad for her. she was working the whole time and never was able to take a break. we just wish they treated the workers better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We went to Honolulu and checked-in at Doubletree Alana with my husband, daughter and grandson. It was a 10-minute walk to the beach, and we chose it that way. The hotel staff were very friendly, valets were super nice.. they told us where to find what we were looking for. There were souvenir shops beside the hotel so you don't have to go very far.. The hotel is near grocery and convenience stores. The pool was awesome, towels were all clean and freshly washed. There was also a gym but we didn't go inside...Our room was clean, we got the room with a king bed and sofa bed (for my daughter and grandson). There was a divider between the living room and the bed (if you want some privacy). The bathroom was also clean, and coffees and teas were free (you won't be charged separately if you consume it). Housekeeping staff were so nice and friendly, the staff always greeted us whenever we see them... my only complaint was that the ice machines were situated on even-numbered floors (we were on the 9th floor) so we had to go to other floors to get ice.Overall, we are so happy we stayed at Doubletree! It was a very pleasant experience and we will definitely choose to stay there again when we come back and visit Honolulu!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Was a plus one for someone attending a national convention. We got the Penthouse room, overlooking mostly the street below but you would see the ocean in the distance. The warm chocolate chip cookies the hotel provides at the reception area is definitely very delicious. We also happened to get two small bottles of water in the welcome bag.There was a large dispenser of fruit infused water or coffee service, at the reception area as well. Bring your clean and empty water bottle and refill - just kindly use the cups provided to prevent cross contamination . Swimming Pool is on the mezzanine floor, and it was all mine for the day. I noticed there is a lift to lower persons with disability, so that is a plus. The pool looks right into the gym/workout area, which is a separate enclosed space. Towels provided.Bellhop/luggage storage was very efficient. Our bags were delivered within minutes of check in.The entrance is the second driveway, rather than the first. Parking is charged per day. Uber and other tour buses will stop in front of the hotel for pick up or drop off. Very excellent receptionist and concierge service ( I needed something printed and a tour booked through them). Housekeeping was accommodating (we preferred to have clean up at the end of our stay, saving our towels for a day or two.)Restaurant on premises (be aware of higher than usual prices).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Felt like the property needs a little TLC. Resort fee for this hotel not justified in my opinion. Stayed here for business and that was fine but would definitely not choose this hotel for vacation purposes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If your travels bring you to the city of Honolulu, Hawaii - whether on business or for other reasons (tourism, family etc) - I strongly recommend this DoubleTree - Waikiki Beach Hotel.It is centrally located within walking distance of the Ala Moana Mall (0.8 of a mile) as well as other hotels, where your friends/family might be staying.The staff were VERY friendly and appeared sincere in their desire to assist.Check in was done remotely and I've used the digital key, so that other than saying 'hi' to the front desk people and getting 2 complimentary bottles of water, there was really no need to do anything other than just take one of the three elevators up to the room and use the digital key to enter it.The room was nicely laid out - with 2 queen size beds and a hide- a-bed. It featured a keurig coffe/tea maker, a microwave oven, a small refrigerator and a faucet with a sink on the countertop.There was a completely separate part with a work desk, very spacious closet space, a spacious bathroom and sensible bathroom amenities - shampoo, conditioner, body-wash etc.The bed was very comfortable. The complimentary WiFi did NOT require a renewed 24 hours registration, and worked flawlessly!Being a Hilton Honors - Diamond member - a continental breakfast was included. For an extra $9 or $10 one could add a personally made to order omelet and other hot breakfast items.The hotel has a pool, which I didn't use, and so can't report on it. Likewise for the GYM. My understanding was that there was no whirlpool - pity.I would recommend against renting a car during your stay, since that would set you back close to $40 per day in parking fees.To summarize - I definitely enjoyed my stay at this hotel - staff and management seem to be making the extra effort to ensure that their guest have the best, most enjoyable stay possible.
user_name:
Henry K
Box Elder, South Dakota

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked this hotel to stay while attending a conference to be held at the Hawaii Convention Center. Although the conference had a shuttle service, the hotel is within walking distance of the convention center. It’s next to beautiful beaches, it has a pool and a great gym. There are two places to eat on the premises; one is a cafe that offers gluten free and healthy items, great breakfast and service. The other is another great place with daily happy hour and specials. The staff was very attentive, the rooms were clean and the double included two queen sized beds! Fantastic stay. Definitely recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: this was a short visit for fsmily. it was personal and some shopping too.. everyone at hotel was friendly and gave super service. we shall return again next year. maybe we ewill use hotel food service
user_name:
Yoshio N
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved this hotel, I felt service was even better than in the mainland US DoubleTree. Staff attention to its guests was amazing, especially Mary Anne and Henry. Many of my coworkers staying at the same hotel had also a great experience here. Room was clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here so family could use my home for my husbands memorial. Great hotel & location. Close to food, shops, and the beach with reasonable room rates. Parking fees are high in Waikiki if you rent a car. Would stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check in was easy - I had the app and digital key did not work but I could pick my room from my phone. It would have been super if the digital key would work. the staff was great location super . Would stay there again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I tried to write a review earlier saying what a great stay I had, but Trip Advisor didn't like my review, they wanted me to write more characters; they wanted me to write what they wanted, not what I wanted, and sent me an email asking me to revise my review to conform to their standards. The link they included didn't contain my original text so I had to start all over; hence this great review of the Double Tree and negative review of Trip Advisor. Needless to say, this will be my last review for Trip Advisor!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I would stay here again when flying solo. the bed and pillows were very comfortable. the bathroom was clean. the kurig was clean and offered a nice selection of coffees. I appreciate the bottled water I was given.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pick a different place. Small. Smells. Mold. No benefits whatsoever for bring a diamond member. Location isn't even great compared to other Hilton properties at the same rate. A colleague found a giant cockroach in his room. Staff said ... Oh that happens. Ok then.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very clean room, comfortable bed and excellent service. Double tree never disappoints when it comes to cost, comfort and cleanliness. It also helps that the staff is always so friendly. I will for sure stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everything about this hotel was over promise and under deliver. I have been a Hilton Diamond Member for years, and this has been my worst experience ever with any brand of hotel. I booked the stay using Hilton Honors points and it still cost me close to $900 with no food or beverage fees.First when we checked in I had noted that it was our anniversary, and they did recognize this. They offered us an upgraded room for an additional $75 a night. When it was pitched too us they said that this room has a full Ocean view and an oversized Jacuzzi. They also claimed that this room was 3 times larger than the room we had booked. The room did not have a fill ocean view. At best it was a partial or obscured ocean view. When going on the balcony you had to look to your right at least 45 degrees to see the ocean. The majority of the view was of the pools of multiple apartment buildings. The oversized jacuzzi was in the same footprint of a standard tub which made it much smaller because of all of the plumbing. It was impossible for either myself or my wife to get in the jacuzzi and fully extend our legs. The room did seam to be larger than a standard room, but they dropped a couch from the 80s that lumpy and the armrest had sags in the center. My college dorm couch was in better shape and much more comfortable. Breakfast was fine if you paid an additional amount, but if you wanted the included Diamond breakfast get ready for stale bread, bagels and muffins, "not" fresh fruit, and dry cereal. Don't get me started on the resort fee $30. This included a bunch of things that is already included as a Diamond member. Free water, premium internet towels at the pool free DVD rentals? My pool at home is bigger than this pool, but I guess you are not going to Hawaii to stay at a hotel pool, and free DVD rentals why when I and most everyone has Netflix etc. A resort fee should be reserved for a resort not a hotel 2 miles from the beach just trying to squeeze a few more bucks out of you.The staff as a whole was subpar, there were 2 individuals in the Valet staff, which is the only way to park at $40 a night, that were attentive and nice. During our stay I went to the desk and stated I had dinner reservations at a certain time so they could have the car in an accessible spot. They said we don't do that just come down when you are ready. If it was me in a customer service position even if this is something that you don't do, I would have replied something like thank you we will ensure to have your vehicle close so we can retrieve it as soon as your ready.I am currently debating never staying at a Hilton property again because of this one bad apple.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Let me start by saying that I travel often and I never write reviews. My work requires me to be away from home more than I’m there. But when I visit Oahu, the only place I will stay is the Doubletree in Waikiki because it feels like family. The rooms are nice and water is hot. This last visit I spent time after a long day of work and hiking and listened to the sounds of the city on my balcony. The beds and cookies from the front desk definitely are the highlights. I could fall asleep in seconds just laying on those heavenly pillows. Being able to sleep in a quiet room is unmeasurable. But the highlight of this hotel is the staff. Henry at the front desk welcomes you in. He and I share California residency knowledge and it’s nice to talk about home with someone who understands. He has a great smile and is quick to help with anything you need. I’ve only met him 1 time and yet it felt like we were old friends. And then there’s Qian. She is the epitome of what guest service should be. I was fortunate enough to have met her my first visit in July due to a small mistake which she quickly took action to fix and called me several times after to make sure I was happy with my stay. During my most recent visit, she remembered me and chatted with me even though she definitely had better things to take care of. She made sure everything was perfect this visit. I love hiking and she told me of a few different places to visit. She even remembered I’m from the 9th Island and that was such a small detail. I feel honored to have met such a kind person. All things considered. I always review the places I’m potentially going to be staying at online and without a doubt, the Double Tree is worth every penny. I can only tell you that it’s the place to stay when visiting Waikiki and feel like you’re seeing old friends. Thanks again Henry and Qian.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was the first time I stayed at this location. As a Forever Diamond Member I was more than satisfied with the location of the hotel, the views from my room and the size of the room. I would stay there again.
user_name:
Joseph L
San Diego, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice clean rooms,good customer service well trained staff and centrally located to Waikiki Beach, restaurants,surfboard rentals, car rentals and shops! Bellhops are extremely well trained friendly and full of knowledge! I would definitely recommend staying here!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everyone was so wonderful from the moment we checked in. Nice location easy walk to the beach or restaurants and entertainment. The cookies are always a nice extra! Overall I have no complaints and am satisfied with my trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I find it easy to stay at this hotel and walk to Waikiki and the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Easy to visit the Halekulani Hotel and Hilton Hawaiian Village. Two US Post offices are nearby, too! Easy to have Uber pick-ups. Great, helpful staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great rooms for small families. Walking distance to the beach, food, and shopping. Great burgers and beers next door to hotel. Nice size pool. Valet parking only, but we used uber this trip to get to and from the hotel. Saved on parking since everything we did was within walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Disappointed, Because we have stay many times at your hotels And usually we are very very satisfied. But from the time we checked in to checked out it was a bad experience, The worst thing that I snub my toe on the door stop Which was located on the floor directly across from the door of the bathroom and very very very bad location to have it I thought I broke it but after sitting on the edge of the bed for 10 minutes or so it was OK...This is why I did not report it

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were checked in by Henry (super nice guy) at the front desk, he gave us great advice for where to watch the Seahawks game and where to eat (poke nachos on site were fantastic!). Hotel was only a short walk to the beach, we loved the location. Room was clean and comfortable!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Do not be fooled by the location of “Waikiki Beach” in the hotel name. It is certainly not a beach front property and by no means a resort however you will be charged a resort fee. Luckily we had a ton of tours planned so we were hardly at the hotel so it was manageable but I won’t be returning.The breakfast buffet was mediocre (they don’t do poached eggs) and the Hawaii hiking cafe downstairs was closed to host an AA meeting when we tried to enter. The rooms were average, the bathrooms had small showers that were elevated and despite our best efforts left huge puddles outside the glass door. The walls were thin so each morning I awoke to the conversation of the neighbors at 4:30 am. The sliding doors to the balcony were very difficult to open and close. Anyone in an adjacent balcony could be heard through your room as well. There is only valet parking, and no other parking options on the property. It is very difficult to get in and out of in a rental car, especially a larger car. We were able to work things through with Clinton to check out early so we could get to another hotel on the north shore.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After checking out early that morning, then spending a day at the beach, Henry and Christie at the front desk went out of their way to locate a hospitality suite to allow us to clean up before catching our late night flight home. In general, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and we very much appreciated the bottled water and cookies each day. Special kudos to Henry and Christie!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice Mgmt and clean location. Close walk to the Hilton resort. Close walk to the Beach. Location smells great. Good rooms and Fitness facilities. Close to stores, drug stores and grocery. Great Concierge!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Valet only parking, the valets for the most part are the friendliest of folks. The trees restaurant has a good mix of food and sometimes live music. Rooms are clean and most have a balcony (yay!!!) even the city/Mountain View has a great panoramic view. If you need anything, just ask the staff. I only had 1 issue and it was 1 staff member who should not be in customer service industry. 1 key point - elevator requires room key access but DIGITAL KEY works perfectly on the elevator, fitness center, pool and room!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was clean for me, the location isn't too far from a lot of restaurants/the beach/attractions, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. HENRY and Michael were very helpful and knowledgeable in helping me book my stay and assisting me with anything I needed while staying here. Would definitely come back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff! Great food at Trees. This was our 2nd visit to Waikiki; the 1st was ten years ago. The hotel was great, the cookies greater! We had a great time at the hotel, on the beach or in town. This was a great vacation; very relaxing and oh so beautiful!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Having visited the island previously was a great experience except I was not as pleased with the accommodations for that stay. I was determined this time not to make the same mistake.Because reviews tend to be highly subjective I believe it's best to temper expectations based on need and what you're willing to pay. I actually used points for this particular stay which allowed me to upgrade the accommodations to a better room @ nominal cost. And I requested (and received) a late check out which also proved helpful. As an Hhonors Gold member I received the standard amenities which come with being a Loyalty member and yes, everything you've read about the complimentary cookies are accurate. I made it a point to ask for no less than 2 cookies each day of my stay (yeah, they're that good).All the staff from check-in to check-out were excellent - friendly, professional and always accommodating. We ate @ Trees Lounge everyday either for breakfast or dinner depending on how our schedule was running with no complaints. Breakfast is complimentary or you can upgrade for a nominal cost and we also took advantage of Happy Hour most days cutting down on eating costs elsewhere.The location is also ideal (and another reason I chose this property) as it's close to everything without the expense of some of the larger chains and it's offerings are on par with what other area hotels in the category offer. Although the hotel was busy and filled with guests it somehow didn't feel overly crowded.Housekeeping service was also very good and the few times we encountered staff in the hallways they were friendly and always left our room well stocked with water and juice. Valet also stored our luggage for us upon checkout since we had an evening departure that day.We really didn't spend a great deal of time in the hotel given that we were out and about everyday of our stay but upon return we had the reassurance that everything would be fine from the long days exploring & touring.I look forward to returning to Doubletree Alana for my next visit. This hotel fit our needs perfectly and the staff works hard to accommodate your needs and oh yeah... the chocolate chip cookies. Kudos to staff and management for a great stay. A big mahalo nui loa!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been staying in this hotel for the last 8 months regularly, every other week. All the hotel staff are very friendly and very helpful. Best of all is, the valet parking team, are always active and willing to help.The location of this hotel is apt for every corner of the city. I can get to downtown area during the busy hours in about 15 minutes, which is really good. I have always enjoyed my stay in this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my 3rd stay at the Doubletree. One reason I return there is the concierge. Her name is Christina. She helped us have the most amazing trip. She is knowledgeable about the island and listens to what you want. If something changes about an event she is right on it. The staff at the hotel are extremely nice and friendly and make you feel welcome. The rooms are comfortable and if you like sitting on the lanai in the morning having coffee and watching the start of the day it's the perfect place for you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Typical Doubletree experience. Good quality, but a little expensive for the brand. Location is perfect for Waikiki. Everything in the beach area is walking distance. We had no problems except for a little inattentiveness by the cleaning staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had horrible service and was charged many additional charges from what we were given during confirmation. We also was harassed by the assistant manager regarding our service dog. We've stayed there many times and loved the hotel, however we were very dissatisfied and disappointed this time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved every minute of it! The Front desk reception were amazing, everyone was so friendly and helpful. As were the Housekeepers, the lady that refreshed our room was very lovely.The bed was extremely comfortable.I would 10/10 recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel once during business trips to Honolulu. I normally prefer the Hilton properties closer to the beach. However this time I walked in and before I even got the to front desk, Michael welcomes me back stating, “I remember you from your last visit!”I work in the airline field where Customer Service is paramount to our success. So I always have a high standard when it comes to how Customers are treated. Michael floored me. This was my 4th hotel in 4 days, not the fanciest, but by far the best. When I came down to grab a bite I found a lovely man named Ricky giving Ukulele lessons for free! On my last Kona trip I bought a Uke so I sat down and had a great time! Then I headed in to eat and sat at the bar, such a great experience with the bar tender (I can’t remember his name). He told great stories and has a great skill to bring Customers into conversations so they all start talking. All the while Ricky, the Ukulele teacher has set up in the corner and is entertaining us with country, rock and Hawaiian music. Just a great experience after a very long week. It doesn’t take much to turn a very tiring trip into a great experience. Michael, Ricky and my very sweet bartender did just that. I will be back for sure! See you in 6 weeks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I give it 4.5 stars because it does not have the Double Tree glitz but it does have all the Double Tree services and treatment. Be aware there is a resort fee per night ($30). Valet parking only for $40 @ day. That is the going rate for self park in Waikiki. At the edge of Waikiki so it is easy to go in and out without navigating all the Waikiki tourist, and the one way streets. Walking distance to many restaurants/fast food/Kalakauwa Ave. You get all the Hilton Honors perks if you are a member. You get all the Hilton services on a smaller scale. If you do not like huge hotels, this is a good one as there is no tourist hustle & bustle.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Made a last minute booking to this hotel. Was a fair price for a hotel in the area I needed. Arrived after 11:00 pm staff where nice and friendly. Got room quickly no hassle and two cookies. Stay was nice and stress free. Valet staff are the best I have had the pleasure to meet

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Front desk staff is helpful and accommodating. I got off a 20+ hr flight back from Saipan and they did what they could to let me check in early. Comfortable bed, clean room, and great g-rate options for those of you who qualify! Valet is always quick as they can be. And yes, they still have the cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in Aug 2019 for business. I was talked into an upgraded room where room dividers didn't work. The power went out and it was 90 degrees outside. No communication from front desk and I had to take a shower in the dark. Never returning!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: so many issues came up and nothing was addressed or attempted to be addressed. brown colored water from the shower and sink faucets, uncleaned room when requested, long waits at valet to get car and drop car off. it was just bad.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is at a good location. It’s very clean. The staff is very friendly. I wish there was a jacuzzi to get in after my husband and I walked around Honolulu all day long. My husband’s favorite is they still give out the cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Two rooms for 5 for three nights conclude a wonderful vacation. This spot served the purpose without any problems. There are certainly more hotels one can choose from, but look here and compare before you decide.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed staying at this location of the Double Tree. It's close to the mall and the beach. What impressed me most is the services provided by all staff.I look forward to staying here again and would recommend it to my friends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everything was on point. Great location - close enough walk to the ocean and other hotels with activities, but off the beaten path and therefore fairly quiet. perfect for business travel. Clean, safe, and friendly staff

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here on a family vacation. Rooms large and very accommodating. Staff friend and very willing to help with transportation and day trip recommendations. Location close to beach, restaurants, shopping!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Although this hotel was in a good location for visiting Waikiki, it was a bit disappointing. The room was much smaller than I expected for the price and had a damp smell the entire stay. The restaurant was rather small and the breakfast choices were limited. For the most part Staff were friendly and helpful. Not the worst hotel I’ve stayed in but far from the best.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a loyal Hilton member, staying at this hotel was a must because of the decent location and relatively cheap price. Everything was great at this location, but the front desk staff did push to upgrade to a suite for an additional nightly fee, and it was not worth the price. Other than that, the location is relatively close to the beach and to the major highways. I would recommend staying here if one of the other Hiltons are overbooked are pricey.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There were no bathtub in our room. Talked to the front desk and they worked out for us and ended up giving us what we want. They tried to make sure we are happy. They even called other Hilton’s for availability.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this property for many years. The staff is always very welcoming and kind. I have never had any issues with cleanliness or the staff. The guys parking the cars are always in a great mood and are very knowledgeable of the surrounding area. The older gentleman that runs the bar is always smiling and making you laugh. I absolutely love staying at this hotel. It has been my first choice for over 5 years now.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful location, wonderful staff, very comfortable rooms. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to church great proximity to the downtown and commercial areas of Honolulu. Incredible place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Double Tree by Hilton Alana is centrally located and is within walking distance to the Ala Moana Mall and many restaurants. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and very welcoming and exuded the "aloha spirit". The hotel was also close to many local shops where you can find many local crafts and island souvenirs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been a Diamond or Gold member with Hilton for many years and have been in Hilton’s all over the US and overseas. This was a disappointment. I am hyper aware of hotel cleanliness due to serious health concerns. I watched housekeeping move their cart with the vacuum cord well taped to the sweeper. Difficult to use in that position.The representatives at the desk when asked if I could extend another day said yes until they realized I was using points. Their response was, “we might be having some people coming in. We’re booked.”Needless to say this was not the best experience with the Hilton brand and certainly not reflective of their policies and procedures.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I like the location of this hotel--easy to walk to Waikiki beaches, etc. (and Hilton Hawaiian Village) but not in the parade of tourists. VERY nice front desk staff (in particular, Henry greeted us so warmly and made us feel very welcome) and housekeeping. Fun to have free DVDs to watch. We enjoyed sitting our balcony watching Honolulu wake up.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Perhaps the friendliest hotel staff I’ve ever encountered while traveling all over the world. Their hospitality is anchored by Earl who runs the bar and restaurant in the evenings. Wonderful staying there!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent our last night here, After spending 4 nights at a horrible Airbnb. Henry was so accommodating. Upgraded us to a nicer room and waived the resort fee. Henry made the end of our trip wonderful and we were finally able to get a good nights sleep. The room was clean and the bed was a very comfortable!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel location was near Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of the convention center. The continental breakfast was minimal, and only valet parking is allowed. My AC didn't work well (too cold), and it took two trips to correct the problem. I was awarded bonus points for two nights of inconvenience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: basically we booked 5 months ago. We lived here in 2011-2015 so we knew how busy it was going to be for transfer season/tourist season. We requested a queen size basic room. We got there and they gave us a $270 (I think) suite. Credit card kept declining and we found out why....they didn't give us the TLA rate. So we got it squared away and were told we'd have to move rooms. Next 2 days, and we got a phone call, same thing. Found out they'd been lying to us that we requested that room. Even called us a list and said we inconvenienced them. Said we were moving rooms that day to a basic room with a full bed I think. The people there are NASTY and sooooo rude. Valet is insane. Regular parking is insane. Cont. Breakfasts are hard to find in Waikiki and we didn't want to pay $22/plate so it wasn't worth it at all. Crap kept happening almost every single day so it got to the point where I got online and talked to a person on their website chat thing. He directed me to the Director of Rooms. He called my husband, and he was HUMILIATED that my husband was treated with such disrespect and all the eye rolls. He said no military members deserve that because he knows PCSing is not fun. He was livid. Went into their system himself and made it to where the room was the price we were going to pay originally for the basic room. He also added a military discount for him. They were on the phone for maybe 30 minutes too. The elevators are hot and cannot accommodate a lot of people. People were getting mad at us each day that our stroller was too big and they had to catch the next one. It was awful. Housekeeping was disgusting. My son pooped through his diaper one day, and I wrote a note to housekeeping. We came back to the room, and it was the same comforter folded up with poop stains. The bathroom had hair in it the day we moved in. Sand all over the floor. Worst cleaning I've ever seen, so I complained about the experience on Facebook. The Director of Rooms saw my post, and called my room asking personally to talk to me. He asked me to send him pictures of our whole stay. Thank God I had 10-20 pictures for him. He said he'd give us $75 in credit to use at the restaurant and asked for a training course to be done with the housekeeping managed in my room. We came back and they missed some stuff. It was horrible. Then, my dad sent my one year old son and myself a card for each of us. Was supposed to be there by last Thursday or Friday. We checked out and moved into housing later Friday. I've called a few times, and it seems they just get annoyed with me, and they can't find my present. If any of you are PCSing, do not stay there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Whilst the actual room facilities were of a good standard, we did not have a positive experience at this hotel. The morning reception staff were not helpful and I was charged more than the amount that was stated when I booked the room - staff could not explain why.In addition, although I made the booking for 2 rooms (we are a family of 5), we did not have adjacent or adjoining rooms, and even had to alter our booked rooms to stay on the same floor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Doubletrees were my go-to place. Notice the past tense!Dirty towels, mold in a much-too-small-shower, no usb ports that work for phones made after 2005, and I got stuck in the elevator. That's right! With two other hotel employees, no one's key card worked, doors wouldn't open, elevator would not move. Thankfully, the system worked well enough that we involuntarily traveled to the first floor. This is why I give this property two stars, for the AI that saved us.When I tried to go to the incredibly mediocre buffet I was stopped and asked if I was on "the list." Upon realizing I was not (the list is for members with status who can eat the food for free) the gatekeeper was anything but welcoming. Instead of saying, You are more than welcome to join us for the cost of $x, he simply looked at me and said, You're not on the list. Perhaps he was having a bad day; the other staff were quite nice and accommodating (I got a bunch of clean towels)In short, I won't be back. While the warm cookie came in handy since I couldn't eat breakfast, there are far better places to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: HVAC system was able to cool but not dehumidify. I realize it is a humid area but other newer hotels do not have this issue. In this hotel the HVAC units are unique to each room so perhaps it was just mine. Damp sheets, damp carpet, damp paperwork...not a comfortable experience.Reported after first day....no change. Good luck.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: One day room service is avaible and then the next day its not. Room was over priced! stayed here after having surgery and needed the amenitys you would think you would get with a suite & room service but unfortunately did not.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff here is exceptional. The rooms are nice but not very “user” friendly. I was is a King standard city view and there is no shelf to put toiletries out on except the back of the toilet. There is only one mirror in the bathroom to get ready at with no counter or anything so things lay in the sink - curling iron make up etc.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Bathrooms are too small, they clean my rooms after 2pm daily...It was very inconvenient for me. Overall, everything was ok, the location is great then I was charge a resort fee when clearly the hotel was not a resort.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I want to file a complaint against check in lady at Doubletree By Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach breakfast area this morning. I went to the breakfast at 6:30am this morning and she could not find my name on the roster instead of me repeating my name multiple times.She also did not inform me that there is a $7.5 per person surcharge for *hot item* in the breakfast and was very very rude when we questioned about it. I am a Hilton Gold member and have always stayed at Hilton properties and with work and personal travel spend more than 100 nights a year in Hilton hotels.I am surprised to see this horrible customer service by Hilton. I was treated very badly and the worst part is she was not apologetic about it and showed me attitude.I hope Hilton does something about this. I am extremely disappointed with this behavior.
user_name:
ABHINAV_PANDE
Los Angeles, California, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’m a returning guest to this property for the second time and must say the staff was quite knowledgeable for my request for an early checkin, so I patiently waited after 12noon, to avoid being charge $25. However, when I made my request to Ms. Jung at the front desk to have maintenance look into the light switch at the entrance to my room, the problem was never addressed within 4 hours and therefore couldn’t sleep at all. In addition to that, the toilet kept making noise throughout the night too! With these issues, I hope this Hilton Honors member can be compensated in some way, for I was not a happy camper the next morning attending an annual event.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Super disappointing in this out dated property. King room ( city view) facing run down trashy large apartments. Bathroom set up very weird, no room at sink for amenities. Shower door creaky and shower step dangerous. Doesn’t have a real restaurant, just a small room with a bar we’re they wheel a cart of food from a kitchen located elsewhere. Valet parking only which is a crazy $40 per day plus tax. Pool small, exercise room small. I am used to nice Hilton properties such us Embassy suites or Hilton in California. This was very overpriced and out dated for my taste. The only saving grace is the staff. Everyone was over the top nice and did their best to make us comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice people - friendly, approachable, courteous, fast service.Nice hotel - clean. Nice room - good air conditioning as it was a muggy day in Honolulu.Nice price - corporate account, direct billing excellent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We went to Honolulu as a last minutes X'mas trip. We were very lucky to find a room through hotel.com. We paid around $NZD430+ for a 2 X Queen beds room, which was a pretty decent size for family of 3 (2 adults and 1 kid). Price was a little bit pricey, but it was the peak holiday season, so I think it is reasonable.Room was clean and cozy, and I really liked the in-room coffee machine! Location was OK, about 15 mins walk to Waikiki Beach. They also provided beach towel for guests to take to the beach. But in one occasion, the beach towel shelve was empty, we probably too late (in the afternoon).They also had a pool and gym, but we didn't have time to go.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms are really clean although showers leak all over the floor. Rooms could be better lit. We found ourselves losing things all the time because there isn't any overhead light. But that's just being picky really. Staff are super friendly and the restaurant is good with happy hour from 4.30 to 7.30. it's about a 10 min walk to the main strip of Waikiki which suited us fine

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visited Waikiki to see my daughters Navy Ship return from a 7 month long deployment so we expected our hotel to be nothing short of perfect. This hotel staff was very subpar, rude to say the least. They ALWAYS had a rebuttal for everything and took responsibility for nothing. We had an unclean sofa pull out couch and a filthy chair in our "UPGRADED" room that we paid for ourselves. The furniture was dirty and made us itchy to say the least. The room furniture looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years. We paid a resort fee for a 1 star treatment.The parking attendants were always AMAZING so no complaints about the 40.00 per night parking. Step your quality back up Doubletree.I brought my daughter there for comfort yet we got the opposite. The couched had ants and other bugs that invaded our clothes and other personal belongings...YUCKPicture us of the Ants feasting off food in the dirty chair

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Guest beware. This hotel has black mold. They moved me to two different rooms in both rooms had black mold in there. I was sick most of my vacation and all they offered me was a measly $25 credit. I can’t believe I flew 5000 miles to be subjected to this type of treatment. Stay elsewhere.
user_name:
Lymar C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fairly generic hotel with nice staff and typical facilities. Comfortable room and decent sized fitness centre, food fairly standard for a US hotel and a little pricey when there are multiple off-site restaurants within minutes walk, but generally good. Internet connection awful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with kids = ages 4 and 6. Easy check in - helped us upgrade to a suite and easy checkout. Great location - a long block from the beach - but easy to walk to. Nice clean rooms - loved the view/ocean. We only slept in the room - we were out and about early every day - but would def. come back here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am here on Navy biz, the hotel has modern touches, good gym, great location, but resort fees and valet only fees are high. Henry at the desk was very professional, courtesy and helpful. Since I am here on Navy biz he helped me adjust my stay dates w/o any issues.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Be aware of the "Resort Fee" which will add to the cost of your room. I don't believe any ethical motel should 'resort' to using this bait and up-charge dodge. It's a nice place and a wonderful location. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room was very nice - clean & quiet! My only complaint was carrying my luggage up the front stairs! The lobby is above street level. When I was dropped off at street level, I discovered there wasn't a ramp up to the lobby to check-in. So, I had to carry my suitcases up a flight of stairs to the lobby. Not fun.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
