review_body: Hotel is a nice hotel, however, parking is EXTREMELY expensive and they mandate you use their parking because of no where else to park and resort fee is applied and the only thing close to resort is the pool on the property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Even though I checked in digitally I still had to stop by front desk to get my digital key, which ended up not working. Digital check out didn't work either & had to call front desk (as I had already left the hotel) to make sure they checked me out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff were friendly and helpful.The rooms are average.Bed comfort is average.Close to convention centre.Not the place to say if you have a family.Our toilet decided to overflow at 9:30pm at night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel location is perfect; near the heart of Waikiki without the pain of the busy traffic. You are minutes away from shops, tasty restaurants, and even the beach! The hotel itself was very clean and filled with plenty of amenities, and the rooms were clean and modern. Staff was super friendly! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Only valet parking is provided by the hotel and the fee is very high. Otherwise we have to park our car to public parking places which are not close and look not safe for overnight parking. So we still decided to park at hotel, but it was not convenient especially we need to go in and out several times a day. I understand that everything is expensive at Waikiki, but still hope it could be improved.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff is welcoming. I appreciated the onsite dining, and the cookies are yummy! The room was always clean and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel is in walking distance to the beach and other activities.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is a short walk to Waikiki Beach. Food at the hotel was very good, especially the Hiking Cafe - although they close at 3pm. Parking is exclusively valet at $38 a night, no other option. Hotel staff are very friendly and polite.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great stay at Double tree in waikiki, location is amazing and short walk from Beach and other areas. We walked almost to all places. Hotel have a small restaurant Trees for breakfast and other meals, good deals in restaurant during happy hours and live music. We chooses the suite as it was helpful with family with a microwave and fridge and small sink, you can rent movies from lobby for free in English and Japanese. They have a small station in lobby where you can grab and go with some drinks and snacks, 24 hours Precor gym with good equipments and a nice pool outdoors. Easy ride from airport and free wifi for Hilton Honors members, Staff was helpful and Michael at front desk and Clinton director of Rooms were friendly, accommodated our needs and helpful! Would definitely come back to stay here!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good location, close to car rental companies, restaurants and Hilton resort Waikiki village. There is not free breakfast at the hotel unfortunately.About 5 min walk to Waikiki beach.Had a great time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel hallways and rooms had an unpleasant odor. Toilet was located too close to wall so that toilet paper holder and toilet paper jabs customer in ribs when sitting. Staff was very friendly. Rooms clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I went there at the end of April, beginning of May for 6 days. They did not honor the priority check-in benefit although I waited it in the priority check in side. It didn't matter much as there was only one person ahead of me but the point is they didn't honor it as a Gold member, so if there is a line....They never offered my a complementary upgrade room either. At the end I ask for one, and they told me they were very full for the next 5 days so he finally looked and offered me to change my standard room for another standard with a partial ocean view. He said that was the best he could do. I accepted. It's not much of an upgrade but it's something, but my question is? Should he tried to do this from the beginning without me asking?If you are planning on getting a rental car during your stay I would not recommend the hotel as you will be charged $40 a day (after taxes) for valet parking and there are better options out there with no parking fees. Continental breakfast was free and $7 per person extra for the hot breakfast.The hotel, is also just that, a double tree hotel, with a tiny pool and small gym which satisfies, a quick and casual swim or morning run, but this place is not a resort. It's just another decent Double Tree hotel. The problem is the it carries a resort fee like all the other resorts in Hawaii, but this one is not a resort. All and all if you are planning on coming here and enjoy your HH benefits there is a good chance you will be disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is nicely located, has a family run feeling but amenities of a larger hotel. It does the Hilton brand proud with pleasant east-west breakfast and a fun happy hour. Staff goes beyond tye call of duty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very, very nice place. Clean, warm, friendly!!! Well worth the price. The view was nice the staff were very accommodating and the guys helping with the luggage and valet are a great source of information. They also made us feel at home!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Seriously, hotels have gone too far...way too far! The definition of resort: “a place designed to provide recreation, entertainment, and accommodation especially to vacationers.” The Doubletree is a hotel, not a resort since they don’t offer recreation, entertainment and only accommodation! This hotel barely offers a pool, has a workout space not any bigger than my room, one very casual/basic food space, and literally nothing else. Therefore, charging a “resort fee” is completely ludicrous and nothing short of screwing over their guests for an extra buck...well, $21 to be exact. There is NOTHING that I get from the resort fee that I don’t get by being a very loyal Hilton guest. There was a time I liked this hotel and have stayed here numerous times, but have no intention of ever returning while they are charging this fee. I’ve been a Diamond member for 15+ years and this just annoys me completely.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This wasn't a bad place to stay. It's an enjoyable short walk to the beach. The staff couldn't have been friendlier. The room was ok for the price point. We had a partial ocean view. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We did a single night here as we were transiting home from the Big Island. So to be clear- I'm not the greatest of fans of Waikiki. It's Commercial and loud. Double Tree is walking distance from all the excitement though, without being so close that you have to deal with all the noise. The beds were comfortable enough and we were given a freshly baked cookie on arrival (nice touch). Lots of people on a budget stay here, so be prepared to hear older people arguing with the staff about pricing, their room in relation to their friends and general service. The rooms are very aged. I'm talking Popcorn ceiling aged. Our room had heaps of mould on the ceiling and it smelt musty. Had I have been there longer, I'd have bothered to complain.Our King sized room wasn't ready, so we were "upgraded" to a twin Queen room with Partial Ocean Views. Don't fall for the Partial Ocean views. You're no where near the water and we actually had a view of the side of the building next to us and the car park across the road.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The place was awesome but it is not a resort. I have stay at resorts this is merely a regular hotel. I am not knocking their service as they are very accommodating it's just that there are all these extra fees for no reason

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had an amazing stay here! From the time we walked in, we were treated with great hospitality and kindness. Michael at the front desk upgraded our room, and when he realized the room he had promised was booked for a night, he upgraded us to the penthouse for the same price as our original upgrade! He checked in on us consistently, and was endlessly considerate. Chris at the concierge was incredibly helpful as well. He even took our snorkel gear back to the place we rented it from (something not inherently offered by the hotel!), and recommended some great spots. Pedro at valet was awesome as well; he helped us with our bags and always greeted us with warmth. I would 100% recommend this place to anyone, the location and hospitality were incredible!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After traveling 14 hours we checked in a 1am to the hotel. They had given our room away and couldnt even find our reservation for about 15 minutes. Then they put me in a 2 queen room when we booked a king room with ocean view. Eventually we got a king bed on the 5th floor (which is the lowest level) -- I am a diamond member and travel hilton frequently.. Upon requesting a room upgrade NOT a downgrade I was told they could give me a king room on the 18th floor if I wanted to pay additional. Tired / Pregnant and frustrated I just took the King bedroom on the 5th floor ---- WHAT A MISTAKE!!!! The room was above the pool area and the walls are anything BUT soundproof -- I could hear everything. Then in the evening it was next to an emergency room entrance and so we heard sirens ALL NIGHT long..... UHHHHGGG!!! So frustrated and honestly dont think this room was worth $50 a night... The worst stay of my life and I have spent more than 500 nights in hilton hotels in the last 4 years. Never again will I stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great experience for me and my family. Will definitely recommend to family and friends. Spacious rooms. Room came with ps3 game console with free dvd movie and ps3 games down stairs in the kiosk. Help keep the kids busy. Tv was decent size. Staff was very friendly. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our seven night stay was a good base from which to explore Oahu. The room was comfortable, with a balcony, and mini fridge. Free cookies and water on request at the desk. Bed was comfortable, bath was good, and housekeeper did a nice job. If you can get a decent rate, the property is fine. Charging a resort fee here is just plain stupid, so factor that in to the total cost. This is not a resort.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked in at 3 o’clock on a weekday. Was told there was no diamond upgrade available because they were already gone. Was disappointed in the view from the back of the hotel – – the street’s kind of ugly. Tried for two days to move to another room. The location is not great if you want to experience downtown Waikiki. If you’d like to be out of the way, but still in a noisy spot, this is the place for you. It wasn’t until our third day when I spoke to a friend who had been upgraded at the Waikiki Hilton to a beach view, that I mentioned it to the front desk. They then were able to move us to the beach side of the hotel, although the room was much smaller. On Thursday, April 18 we were greeted by a different server for breakfast who was very rude. She scolded my wife when I let her taste my undercooked omelette. “Please don’t eat off of other peoples plates without paying for the upgrade,“ she said loudly in front of everybody to my family and I. I then mentioned to her that the coffee pot, cereal milk, And half-and-half We’re empty. She misunderstood and brought me a glass of milk. She was chatting with the other employees the whole time. Since I knew our regular server would not be returning till Saturday we ate breakfast elsewhere on Friday. (Go to eggs ‘n things – – it’s delicious!) Saturday things are back to normal.  Also on Thursday, our room was not cleaned, which we discovered when we return to the hotel at 4 PM. I mentioned it to housekeeping who was still in the hallway, but was then required to negotiate with them to find somebody to clean the room, and was told by the person that showed up there if we didn’t leave the room immediately she would not be able to clean it. I’m pretty sure this is it not how it works at a Hilton.It’s not a bad hotel, but I do expect more of the Hilton experience, especially when the woman I spoke with in March on the phone assured me that of the three Hilton properties, we were most likely to get an upgrade at the Doubletree. Not true. If I stay at a Hilton next time, it will be one of the other properties. The DVD machine in the lobby is very cool, though. And Henry and Elsa were a blessing at the front desk — they actually appeared available and were very helpful. The others not so much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is on a good location, about 3 blocks from the beach, I got a room on the 16th floor facing the mountains and it was decent, although the bathroom was small in comparison with other of the same DT by Hilton I've stayed. There was an awkward position of the toilet paper holder that with the roll on it, it would bump my knee, the sink although modern an nice, offers very littler counter space. There are tons of storage in the room and has a large chair that turns in to a bed ideal for 1 kid. There is a mandatory resort fee of like $22, that has nothing for you other than a play station in the room, this is a business hotel with the same amenities they offer elsewhere, yet they charge a resort fee for nothing, and on top of that, if you rented a car be prepared to disburse $38+Tax/day for valet parking (in-n-out privileges), no self parking is offered. The pool is on the smaller side, but has plenty space and chairs for taking on the sun. I would suggest the hotel that If you're charging a resort fee, then have at least more than pool towels and a play station, they should have a shuttle to the mall and the beach parks around the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: You know what you're getting with Double Tree. I've stayed at the DT Dallas, TX and Westminster, UK previously so felt this was a safe bet for my first time in Hawaii. Wasn't disappointed. Good location, reasonably priced and, as ever, the welcome cookie is a cute touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Conveniently located within walking distance to many amenities. Hotel was nice and clean. Free dvd was a bonus. Elevator special use was not explained but easy to figure out. Staff was always pleasant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel with and excellent location. They also have a restaurant on site which is convenient. The room are really spacious and the hotel staff was very friendly. Check in was fast and I was provided with up grade options.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Getaway from the mega-hotels. Rather than stay at one of the many monster hotels with 10,000 of your closest friends... this is more of a boutique experience. Easy walking distance to great shops and restos.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I missed my flight connection and I had no choice to fly out the next day. Therefore, I called DoubleTree’s reservations to see if I can get a room last minute. Which I was lucky to confirm a room style. I have a Hilton points card.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved our stay. Modern hotel, spotlessly clean rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great too, walking distance to the beach and city center. And then the wonderful chocolate chip cookies, loved them!! Great stay, would definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Located close to the beach and within easy walking distance of many places to dine, drink or enjoy the evening. Staff was outstanding and very friendly. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Rooms have a small fridge and safe and coffeemaker - all incredibly handy. Enjoyed the lanai and view of the ocean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The DoubleTree Alana is a nice hotel near the beach, restaurants and stores. They have a separate building dedicated to meetings which keeps the sleeping area of the hotel relatively quiet. We held a meeting there and our event manager Brett Akimoto was the best! The hotel is about a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Hawaiian Village beach and located right next store to Cheeseburgers restaurant. There is an ABC Store and Tony Roma's within a 3 to 5 minute walk. The sleeping rooms are very clean and the hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay away from the larger hotels in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Welcoming and clean. They treat guests with respect and location is great very near the beach and you can walk to a lot of restaurants and shopping places. Area seems safe and does not feel threatening. Highly recommended. Poolside was small but you go there for the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had to leave our 1st hotel and this Hitel had availability in an pinch. We we greeted with cookies and bottles of water, which was so nice to have for our 4 children at midnight when we've been trvaleing for 8 hours and now moving hotels. The hotel room is spacious, clean, and comfortable. The balcony looks out at the iconic Mural of humpback whales. We extended our over night stay to a week's worth. Thank you Double Tree! Especially the front desk staff

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff are great they gave my 10 year old son a fresh hot cookie while we where checked in. My son was hungry and ate the cookie quick so they gave him 4 more to take to the room. The location is not that great and the view from our room was the roof of another building but the room was very nice. They have a restaurant there called "Hiking" unless you are a hippy you will probably feel out of place. No one will seat you and no one will take your order. The food choice was very limited and not great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Showed up late about 11pm(I contacted the front desk to ensure they knew I was running late). The valet was MIA for about 15min, so I parked at valet stand and checked in. The front desk agent was nice but seemed bothered I was just showing up, even asking if I had contacted the hotel about the late check in. I told the front desk I wanted the free bfst(gold-HH). I go get bfst the next AM or to be told I didn't choose that benefit. I even insisted I told the front desk the night before and they still didn't believe me. I walked to the front desk and told them I am ready to check out and I told them about the issue with bfst, and they double checked and there it was, I picked bfst. They apologized and offered zero compensation for a missed bfst. It gets better, 8-working days later they finally charged my amex-plat. I called the desk and talked to the MGR and they say one thing and Amex-Plat says something different. After all the issues I had with this DTree I would say it's a systemic issue of just go through the motions attitude. The room was Ok, AC works and the room was clean. Management could of followed up if they choose too, I left them message and even talked to one of them. Won't stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in a big room on the top floor. Very nice staff. We were positioned right next to the elevators, but I did not hear them at all, which was a great relief! The hotel is an easy walk to most any destination in Waikiki, including what seems to be several hundred ABC Stores.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is located in the middle of everything you might want to do. If your willing to walk five minutes to the beach the the location is great for you then. Shops and food in every direction. If you have your own car then get a map from the desk and get directions from the staff at the desk. The lady there gave me directions and mapped out all of my destinations for me. She was amazing and gave great detail and sites and activities I wanted to do.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at this hotel made our stay just wonderful. The location is great. Access by automobile is easy. Check in and check out were seamless. Breakfast was very nice and our server, Kyri, made it fun! The front desk staff and Qian made us feel special and welcome. They went above and beyond to make our stay perfect.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was more than accommodating with last minute bookings for multiple rooms for all my family visiting from all over the mainland to attend our mother's celebration of life. Yolanda in group sales was brilliant and we will definitely be back for many more occasions. Mahalo nui!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really enjoyed the warm hospitality that the staff conducted themselves. The restaurant offerings were phenomenal as well as the service. I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Waikiki. The location also puts you in walking distance to the many attractions and tourist spots.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I don't have a negative thing to say about our stay. The hotel staff was amazing and made us feel like we were special guests. From valet, to check-in, to cleaning and check-out, it was a fantastic experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was clean and we recieved some cookies as we checked in. The fitness room is not really big but all right. The pool area is very windy so we didn't really stay there. The hotel is near to the beach, just around 5-10 minutes. They will store your baggage before you check-in and after you check-out for free whitch is really helpful. For breakfast I recommend the Hiking Cafe whitch is located in the lower lobby. They have really good Acai Bowls and paninis.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: So, on the positive side, as Diamond Members we were given a nice demi-suite. The front desk was efficient, if not overly effusive. No help with bags, but valet staff was excellent. The demi-suite was a little wonky: if you can imagine a large room with a nice balcony and a beautiful view, but this large room is laid out in an odd shape. The bed is set back against the "maka'i" wall, with a sliding partition door to separate it from the living area, which could be closed if desired. The TV is all the way against the "mauka" wall, and on the other side of a sofa - so if you want to lie in bed and watch TV ... you really can't. Room dated - which we didn't mind. Room needed a very thorough cleaning - which we did mind. The large size, coupled with a refrigerator made the room fairly pleasant, however. Breakfast ... well, if you want the full buffet, there is an upcharge. This seems to be inconsistent around the Doubletree brand, but okay. However, the breakfast area is WOEFULLY understaffed, and we didn't see a server until it was time for her to bring the bill. Cost-cutting by employee is a HUGE pet peeve of mine. Conversely, the selection and flavor were quite good. So, while the product and presentation are average (at best), the location and views more than make up for much of that. I'm also inclined to give a pass on the (lack of) cleanliness, because here in the US, folks have been conditioned to believe that "okay" is acceptable. Anyone who has done any sort of international travel would be (and should be) embarrassed at the state of cleanliness in the US.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall not a bad stay. Housekeeping needs some work with attention to detail of tending to the rooms. ..........,............................. friendly staff with every interaction I had. Parking a bit steep but not much you can do.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in the doubletree by hilton over Christmas and New Years. Really liked the location being at the top end of the strip and close to Ala Moana centre. Easy to walk to all the bars and restaurants. Staff were excellent and the cookies from reception were amazing. Room was great for us and the level of cleanliness was fanstatic. Staff were really helpful and made our stay incredibly enjoyable. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If your looking for another boring, over priced hotel, look no further. You have found it. Nothing stands out from this hotel except it’s lack of services that you’ll find at other hotels in the area.Knowing this, it should be cheaper and not charge the same as other hotels with more amenities in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A great hotel with a very reasonable price, in a great location. Just a short walk away from all of the major Waikiki milestones. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly! Clean facilities, decent amenities, and the location is just out of the way enough to be both in the Waikiki "thick of it" without being overly crowded. Would definitely recommend this. Only negatives were the some-what dated interiors, although the room seemed to have recent decor updates and the breakfast buffet was a little pricey if you were not a higher tier Hilton Honors rewards member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location was very good. The hotel is across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and within walking distance for all of Waikiki Beach and the shopping nearby. There is a McDonalds a block away. The The rooms are nicely appointed and clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is NOT on/near the beach. Do not pay for the “partial ocean view” room type. Not worth it. This is certainly a busy, business hotel. Rooms were good, humid. Need to have air on all times. Breakfast is a joke. Chaos during 6:30-8am. Diamond/Gold members forget about hot food, they charge a fee of $7 for the upgrade. They need an expansion of the area. This is not recommended for families or couples. While you certainly can walk to other resorts and restaurants in the area, it is not the typical Hawaiian “resort” type feel to it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel does a good business thanks to its proximity to Waikiki. While we have enjoyed staying in Doubletree in many cities, this location doesn't quite live up the Hilton standard. The lobby is tiny and the elevators are small. The room was clean (except for a stopped up toilet) but nothing special--our city view room turned out to be of a rundown apartment building next door. The staff did a good job, except for the waiter at breakfast who seemed to be inconvenienced by our request to order off the menu instead of going to the buffet. It also seemed odd that toast was an extra charge to a breakfast meal order. Overall, I'd say this hotel has a great location but little else to recommend it.
user_name:
BeverlyF637
Sugar Land, Texas, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: 2nd or 3rd time staying at this property..It has always suited my needs. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The property is located in a great area. I have never encountered a problem during my stays here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've seen better and "fresher" DoubleTrees. This one is obviously old and in need of a face lift. It's not bad, but no longer good, either. Rooms are of standard size, beds and bathrooms rather basic. They do have a feature that sets them apart from many other hotels: the TV is connected to a PS-3 game console that lets you play games and movies (DVD rental kiosks are located in the lobby).The hotel operates a bar/restaurant. The bar is okay, the restaurant is mediocre. I didn't expect much of the food, but it was topped off by an extremely slow service, too.There's an outdoor pool.The staff was helpful - that's a plus.
user_name:
lubger
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: great location from convention center, less than 10minute walk. staff busy, but helpful. Not a far walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. they don't charge for motorcycle parking, it is by security if you decide to rent one during your stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall this is a decent quality doubletree hotel with clean room, nice bed sheets, but slightly small bathroom. What surprised me is there is no hottub but only a small pool. I thought hot tub is standard for double tree if I had known this I would book somewhere else with a hot tub. It means a lot to rest your whole body after a day's walk. We get continental breakfast which can be upgraded to hot breakfast for $7 extra. The location is really good, very central and close to ala monoa, waikiki, aquarium, zoo, etc.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent 4 nights here prior to and after our Hawaiian cruise. The staff was extremely friendly and made us feel like “ohana” (Family). We were greeted with warm delicious chocolate macadamia nut cookies when we checked in. The staff was very accommodating. Henry, at front desk, made us feel special and took care of any needs we had. Everyone at front desk did an awesome job, but I forgot all the names. Awesome bell staff especially Rynie (not sure of spelling) and Chris. The concierge did an excellent job helping us with different details from things to do to places to eat and how to find the right transportation. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The cleaning staff was great. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree boy Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach is located in the best part of Waikiki. The Breakfast that is complimentary for Gold and Diamond Member is fabulous. The chocolate chip cookies are always a welcome treat for desert.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this property several times and each time they do a good job of ensuring that I receive the room I paid for, other hotels on Hawaii are not so good at that simple accomplishment. The room are standard sized or a little bigger than what a normal hotel room in the continental US is. The rooms are a standard price for the area. The location is always clean and comfortable. The cookies are fantastic and the staff is very accommodating. I would recommend them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location at its best. This strip sincerely is surrounded by it all. You have to book & walk out the Hotel yourself, to see what I mean! Sincerely, no need to give your money away to the big dogs, unless you're rich of course, by all means, "Rock On"! Not mad at you, but until you get to that big money, staying here is so perfect & convenient to everything you want & a cool little walk to the beach, where the other Resorts definitely sit on. Trust me, it's perfect, you would not be disappointed. The ABC Stores are on every corner, your restaurants on the strip, clothing shopping. I always over do it when I get to this Hotel & start the shopping outside! You will have the time of your life! Please go & splurge!✈️. This Hotel was made for you indeed. From it's "Top Notch Service", from Check In, to Check Out"! The rooms are cozy are all essentials are in it at your finger tips! Get to your Balcony & take in the Hawaii fresh Air & beach in the distance, according to the Top Floor you're on! You just cannot go wrong here my friends! Trust me! A restaurant to fill your pallets when you don't feel like being on the trip & just want to hang in, whether in your room for "Room Service" or a Drink at their "Bar"! What more could you want my people? I am here whenever I come to Hawaii! You will be pleasantly surprised! Enjoy every bit of your stay!
user_name:
Mary M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service is good and the hotel is okay in general, but not one of the best Hilton hotels I have stayed.- The room is located in the 11th floor and close the street. It gets noisy in the early morning will last until late night, which make it hard to have a good sleep. - Daily bottled water is not available, and extra fee will be charged for hot food (for Hilton Diamond member).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Aloha Spirit found HereThis is a wonderful hotel at the less busy end Waikiki. It borders on Fort Debussy park which you can walk through to get to the quieter end of the beach. Every staff member we met was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was super not worth my money and my points. I always request a High-Floor room and I never got it at this Hilton hotel. I'm a silver Hilton member and I really don't think I was treated as one for such a low-floor room. The front desk is super outdated and makes you feel like your in a motel and not an actual high-class hotel. I really think they need to renovate the hotel and the hotel rooms. Breakfast is super expensive. This hotel is really not close to anything at all. It's at least a 15 minute or so walk to the beach and the mall. Like, It's not a big deal, I like walking but at least give me a high floor. It was on my Hilton member information and it wasn't provided to me. So unacceptable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed four nights here and was a wonderful stay. Check in was quick and easy. Room was clean and very comfortable and quiet which allowed for good quality sleep in a comfortable bed. I would stay again if ever I visited again .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I had staycation here for 2 days. We stayed in room 1711.Pros:It was a pretty nice size room. Very clean roomComfortable bed. Small love seat has a fold out bed. Flat screen tv, mini fridge and a safe Nice size closet. Bathroom not that big, but worked out for us. Stand up shower was pretty small. Can't forget the infamous chocolate chip cookies at time of check in. Now for the cons:Hotel only offers valet parking which we don't like at all. Extremely high cost for parking. ($38 per night)All said and done we had a great stay and would stay here again if the price is right.Peace out!Maiava Adventures

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Could be the last time we travel together as a family unit, so I took advantage of a bonus trip and treated them all to Hawaii—a Christmas present of sorts. We took in many of the amazing sites Ohahu has to offer. We had an amazing experience. Hopefully, we will do something similar again, some day. Here’s hoping.
user_location: North Las Vegas, Nevada, United States
user_name:
Carl G
North Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for a week Dec 26, 2018 to Jan 2,2019. Only problem we had was at check in with our room not being available, that was due to my brother and changing his reservation which messed up ours. After everything was worked out, we were given our room. The elevators work by your key card, meaning before you push the button to go up, you enter your room key card first then push the floor you want. Depending on the time of day you will wait for a ride. There are only three elevators for I think eighteen floors. The hotel is not close to the beach so there are no ocean views. But the view of the mountains and the landscape is still breath taking. There is a restaurant that has live music in the evening. I am sorry I forgot the name of the artist, but he is very good. Henry worked the front desk and he is very professional. Will definitely stay there again if we ever go to Hawaii again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: These people will over charge your card. Ruin your family vacation. Tell you your free to go at check out. Give you a receipt saying so and then when you get home find out they keep stealing from you. Their rooms smell of sewage and they will do nothing to fix anything. Check your Cc when you are there and just watch how your vacation and ty is ruined. Don't believe me just watch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree is nicely located in Waikiki. It’s only a couple of blocks from the beach. The hotel was clean and well kept up with. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the front desk to the restaurant to the cleaning crew. They all went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. The concierge team was fantastic and gave us great recommendations for tours and events to take advantage of from hiking diamond head to touring the island and paying our respects at Pearl Harbor. The only issue we had was a consistent problem with the room keys in the elevators and doors. We had to get replacement keys quite frequently. That was only issue we ran into.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was really good place. I stayed christmas week. Location was Close to Waikiki beach, shops and good restaurants. Hotel staffs and Valet Staffs were very friendly. Breakfast was not bad. I highly recommend y'all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Service was downright horrible and rude! Not too mention the old rusted doors and lack of professionalism by the staff. Housekeeping never actually cleaned. Everyone on staff just doesn’t want to be there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki for about a week over the Christmas Holidays. It was a very nice stay. The location is perfect - we walked to the shops, the beach, restaurants and the mall! We are in our seventies and we did not find the walking to be too much. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel location was awesome. Great food and shopping near by. I live in Hawaii and this was the perfect staycation for my friend and I. I would highly recommend this place and I would totally stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful hotel for family with 2 grown children (18 and 22). We stayed for 8 nights over Christmas and the suite was perfect for our family. It had 2 queen beds and a separate sitting area with a very comfortable pull out bed. Both areas had a television plus there were 2 closets and separate changing area with a mirror and counter which was perfect for our 22 year old daughter! For those wanting to make lunches or have snacks, the separate bar area was great with a kuerig, microwave, mini fridge and sink. Fridge was very small though. The staff at the breakfast area were wonderful and helpful!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room is old and dirty. Smell is also bad in the room. Room cleanness is bad. Sheet is left on the chair and no shampoo or bath soap refill. Front desk are friendly and helpful, which is the only positive during the stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When I walked in, an asian looking receptionist greeted me so I went to her for check in. She was nice at first, at least she seemed nice. She asked me for my passport so I gave her mine. She asked where i'm from and I said i'm from where i'm from. I wish not to expose myself too much here. Then her tone suddenly changed. (with rbf) She was also from my country. I was surprised at first but soon relieved because of language. It took about two hours to get checked in because of miscommunication. But because of that, she blackmailed me and my whole family. I don't think there's anyone who can take neither mine or her side at the reception because the whole conversation was in our mother language. However I clearly heard how she tried to deal with the miscommunication with her manager. The manager was sitting inside the room next to counter, which I couldn't see properly. She kept walking in and out of the room to discuss the issue. The second before she blackmailed me she walked out of the room saying that's a great idea hahaha. Then she printed out the rules and regulations and threw it to my parents. She asked us to apologise otherwise she'll do whatever she had against us. I'll say it's a fancy hotel but if you bump into that receptionist, say sorry first just in case cuz it seems like she loves to hear that from someone else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location for overseas visitors. Right next to all attractions. Basically walk to all places including shopping and mijor outlets.Pool is great and very good size.Fitness centre can have few more machines In room dining times are too short. Can be made available after 10pm

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location, value and cleanliness were fine. The check in process was frustrating. I was meeting e friend and added her name to my reservation as I wanted to be able to check in to her room upon arrival. I was clear that I just needed to add her name. Reservation was under my number, my credit card and made on my account in Hilton app but I could not check in. They had moved he reservation to her name and I needed to wait for her arrival, four hours later, to be able to check in. Very frustrating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had dinner and breakfast at the trees restaurant on consecutive days, and the food and service was amazing. Keikilani was so nice, genuine and very helpful with our ordering process. Even took it to the extent to call us on our room phone to let us know our order was ready. Always greeted us with a smile! You guys got a very good employee doubletree! And too future guests lookout for keikilani at the restaurant she’s exceptional. Mahalo!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked one room but the fan in the bathroom was always on, then I communicated with the staff the next day. They helped us to change a room and upgraded it to a suite! We didn't expect that and were thankful for their sweetness. The breakfast there is also good. The best thing is the location, walking to best reviewed food within 15 minutes!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very beautiful property about 10 minutes walk from the beach. Very friendly and welcoming staff. I was welcome late at night with a warm cookie and a friendly smile.I will definitely be back for work or leisure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We've been staying at this property 1-3 times a year since 2003. The people are the asset that makes this property wonderful. The building itself is just another building, and unless you're on the Penthouse level or in one of the end-cap rooms on the 14th-18th floors, the hotel itself is no different than any other building. The porter valets are your first welcome to the hotel, and many of them, like Jeff and Bill, have been there the entire time we've been staying there. Then you go to the front desk, and if you're there in the morning and early afternoon, you're greeted by Elsa, Ewa, and/or Rebecca, three ladies full of aloha. In the restaurant you'll be greeted in the morning by Susan, Lyndon, Kylie, and many others who will take phenomenal care of you. And the housekeepers are wonderful. Ask for an end-cap or ocean view, OR upgrade to 1911 or 1912 on the penthouse level - it's well worth it. Try the Hiking Café downstairs, too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Easy walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Laundry around the corner with drop-off or self service. Valet is very quick to park and retrieve your vehicle. Rooms are very clean and updated. The beds and pillows were very comfortable.
user_name:
Eric B
Colorado Springs, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel in September 2017 and really liked it. Unfortunately this recent stay wasn’t as great. The first room I was assigned to was on a floor of high school travelers. They were constantly shutting doors and conversing in the hall. The hotel staff was wonderful and moved me to another room. Unfortunately this room has a strong musty odor. They tried changing the air filter and using an excessive amount of air fresheners to no avail. I woke up with a headache both mornings and was looking forward to check out. The staff was friendly and helpful but apparently didn’t have many options on empty rooms. As a diamond member I thought they would have been able to set me up in a great room on the first try. Two Rooms later and I left disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good location - close to both Waikiki and the ala Moana center. Biki bike share just across the street. Room was laid out well. Mattress was a bit too soft, likely had worn springs. The shower was also very leaky. Tasty cookies though!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Went there for a single night stay by myself and got to say I quite like this place. Staffs are helpful and accommodating (I checked out around 11am but they were kind enough to take care of my luggage until 4pm). The room is very clean + spacious and comfortable bed (the pillow is not very good though - too fluffy and I ended up using all 4 for proper support). All the basic amenities were up to standard and am very pleased with their usb charger (no need adapter) and dvd rental (the room has a ps3). All in all decent value for money and will return again for a longer stay next time. Recommended

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We would have liked to stay where the American Contract Bridge League was holding their nationals but this hotel was only a couple of blocks away at a lesser price. We enjoyed our accommodations as a Hilton honors diamond member and all the perks that came with it

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a Hilton Diamond and travel often. The hotel was clean and had all the standard amenities of a Doubletree hotel. The building and rooms are showing their age. The staff (front desk, restaurant, and valet) was not as friendly as I have grown accustomed to at Hilton brand hotels. However, they did help me with a package that arrived after I checked out and allowed for a late checkout on the day we left for the cruise. Overall, it was an ok stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A sub-par quality Motel. Absolutely the worst of Hilton's DoubleTree hotels. Never, ever going there again. This place is best for middle schoolers going on a field trip with no valuables. Aloha? Not for this Motel. Avoid at all costs!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights.. Room had a weird smell may be because of how old it is.. Bedding has stains and pillow has blood stains. I spoke to front desk and they replaced immediately. Couch inside is dirty and pretty old.. didnt even want to sit on it by the looks. Also parting is 36$ per day which is insane and they charge $18 for resort fee.. For all the extra charges i would say this place is not worth it.. Only positive is front desk and room service. They are really helpful and gave recommendations on what places to see and popular restaurants. Also had to change payment method after our stay and April helped us without any issues.. If not for the service this is a straight 0 star int erms of stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Alana at the beginning and end of an NCL cruise and were very happy with the hotel. The location is wonderful, staff is super friendly, rooms are comfy, and price was good. Special mention goes to the valet staff, who are just the best, and the staff in the small lobby restaurant, who were super friendly and speedy. The hotel is not one of the Waikiki monsters that surround it: smaller, personable, and just right.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is just outside of the congestion of Waikiki, the staff there have a lot of aloha, there is a great fitness center and pool, and the hotel layout is great for getting where you want to go without much walking. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a repeat customer, this hotel meets my needs and expectations. Very friendly staff (the valet parking attendant has worked there for 22 years and the lounge waitress rides her bike to work and enjoys hiking), great accommodations, and nicely located for shopping or sightseeing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best Bartenders Hilton has to offer in Waikiki!! Great Breakfast! Affordable proximity to all Waikiki has to offer! The staff is superb, and as always the cookies are yummy! Easy drive or Uber/Lyft from HNL.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had the best experience by far as a Diamond member. I want to personally thank Henry at the Front Desk who did an amazing job and made me feel truly welcomed. He went out of his way to accommodate me. He is the definition of Hawaiian hospitality. I also want to thank Christina who booked some tours for me. She had many suggestions on things to do, had the patience to answer all my questions and helped me lock down the exact experience I wanted for my stay. I am definitely coming back!
user_name:
John L O
Henderson, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I don’t have a negative thing to say about this property. My group utilized this property for both the sleeping rooms and meeting room space. The customer service received from the time we stepped foot onto the property until our departure was above reproach. We didn’t spend much time in our rooms, but everything was great. No complaints at all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is very nice and the staff was wonderful. The made to order omelets were great! Valet parking is mandatory but we enjoyed talking to the valet parking folks. The Hawaiian coffee in the room and in the lobby was very good!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Top notch service. Friendly staff. Great location. Clean facilities and rooms. Walking distance to the beach. Free ice cold water and coffee 24/7. Delicious cookies. Free newspaper. Great overall experience!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The front desk has two gentleman named Henry and Brandon and both are exceptional and their service provided to us. These two men went out of the way to ensure that we got whatever we needed. As far as I'm concerned two of the best in the last several years of international traveling.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed numerous times at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and usually stay in the Alii tower. For a change we thought we’d try the Doubletree just off the the beach and were so happy with the decision. We are only part way through our stay and for the same price as an Alii standard room we were able to grab a deal on the Manoa suite with a huge outdoor deck on the 19th floor of the hotel.Each night we have cocktails and watch the sunset from the deck. Each day we spend it in our chaise lounges catching sun and having the huge deck to relax on. The suite also includes a large balcony with chairs that have a beautiful view of the mountains. Really exceptional views!!The staff has been exceptional and attentive. They also treat their Diamond guests better than some of the other Hilton properties we’ve stayed at. Breakfast is well done and efficiently run with a staff that hustles. Bottom line: if you’re not sure of whether to jump ship from the HHV and get off the beach, it’s worth the risk and hopefully you’ll be as pleased as we have been so far with our stay!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good hotel for business in the area as it is on the edge of Waikiki but you don't have to drive in Waikiki to get there. Front desk staff are very nice, particularly Jungmin and Elsa at this hotel. Bar is pleasant with bartenders Earl and Alona. Only real negative is the $18/day resort fee as this hotel is definitely not a resort.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’ve stayed at this property numerous times and it’s a wonderful landing pad. Elsa! Not enough words to describe how delightful she is and sets the tone at the front desk. Rebecca is such a pleasure. Not much better than ending the work day with Earl in the lounge. This year music in the lounge was an amazing add! I could listen to this vocalist for hours. Well done Doubletree team!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: In my opinion, this hotel is mainly for business purposes only. Those who are looking to spend time just to sleep not to enjoy the actual hotel. They have a very basic amenities. The room has a good shower and complete cable channels. The room I was staying in was in the fifth floor. It felt small for the room but the balcony was pretty large. I honestly don't understand why they have such a large balcony. There is a lot of flies or mosquitoes as well due to the stagnant water sitting on the plants space. They do offer Playstation 3, keurig cofee/green tea maker, nice shower system, and comfortable bed. I feel the price is somewhat expensive for what they offer compare to other hotels such as alohilani resort or Ala Moana Hotel. The parking available is only for valet parking and charges $36 a night. That is horrendous in my opinion. I stayed there under TLA and didn't get confirmation email nor a membership email as I had requested. They offer towels and water inside the gym though. They gym was small but equipped with nice equipments. The swimming pool is small but the terrace is quite nice. The hotel itself is pretty small.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had a stopover and booked this hotel for just one night. I had 2 deliveries sent and Norman not only brought them to my room he took them to my car. Room was super comfortable,clean and funtional. Keurig coffee maker with an assortment of Hawaiian coffee was a bonus. Although not right on the beach the location was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Dad-son quick trip to Oahu for a sporting event. Hotel was well located and staff was excellent and friendly. Room was very clean. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: On arrival we were greeted with a big smile and warm welcome. Couldn’t have had a more pleasant check in experience (thank you!) and our every need was attended to. We were upgraded to a penthouse suite and other than having two double beds instead of a king bed, it’s pretty good for Hawaiian standards (not many hotels here have been modernized!) Spacious rooms, two bathrooms, spa bath, big screen tv and the usual Hilton amenities. Heated outdoor pool. Would stay here again and highly recommend the friendly staff. Special thanks to Jumgmtu (apologies if I spelled your name incorrectly!)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good service, clean rooms, they even found us a room when we arrive early. I guess the only thing I would comment on is the restaurant, not that the food was bad, it is just a bit "sterile" with bright lights at night and no "soul" anytime. This is despite some very good live music.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had to change some plans at the last minute because of delayed flights and ended up in Honolulu instead of Hilo as we anticipated. The room in Hilo was a wrap around oceanfront view and this one was a wrap around city view with an ocean view... same price. I expected something a little cheaper since the view was less but all in all it was a beautiful room, comfortable beds and on the main shopping center strip.It had all the amenities you need. Free drinks at check in and pool with more free drinks on the Exclusive reception floor (4).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We will definitely stay here again. It’s away from all the heart of Waikiki noise. Everything is within walking distance and there is a 7-11 and abc store around the corner. Next to Cheeseburger in Paradise and Hilton Hawaiian Village. Warm delicious cookies when you check in. nice pool and weight room. We sat on lanai and loved the view of Ft DeRussy park and the ocean as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful hotel within walking distance to everything. Remodeled room. Rm 1025 was on main Street with balcony with great view of city and ocean. Underground parking for a $. On-site restaurant. No free breakfast or shuttle svc. Great bed. Very comfy. Beautiful sheets and cases. Coffee and refrig. Would definitely stay again. Oh, yummy chocolate oatmeal cookie upon check in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Most of the staff was nice! They did not communicate to us about the big firework show on Friday night or the parade on Saturday, both of which we would have loved to have seen. No bottled water in the room and we were not advised of it and the tap water was horrific.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were on the nineteenth (top floor). It was a nice and roomy penthouse suite. There was a table large enough for a conference. Sofa, coffee table and large screen TV. We were rented a great movie. The bathtub was amazing with jacuzzi jets… Relaxing! Great view of the full moon that night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was great except for the restaurant. I would not waste my time by eating there. They serve mostly frozen items and it's way overpriced for what you get. Theres other great restaurants that are close by.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is in a good location to the beach and cheaper than staying on the beach. The rooms were clean the gym is in good shape and clean. The food was good and the staff is very nice and professional. Parking is by valet only because there is no parking in the area. The beach is a 10 minute walk away, nice place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was disappointing to stay here for our 25th anniversary! I've stayed at other Hilton Double Tree locations and many other Hilton brand properties without disappointment, but not here. The rooms were clean, the size was okay, but everything at this location is minimal. I will say that the staff treated us well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant. When I checked in I asked the young man if My room had a good view and he said yes. I did have a great view of the back of the buildings next door. That is when I realized how jam packed everything is in Waikiki. If you want a view might want to stay closer to the beach lol. Breakfast is ok but the staff was great! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location of the hotel is on the outskirts of Waikiki. There is a small but nice pool. Just wished there was a jacuzzi. The fitness room is small, but clean and with enough machines to make it useful. There are a few restaurants in the area. The hotel restaurant, Trees, was nice. Staff accomodating and always willing to help.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a great location! This hotel is across the street from the Hilton Hawaii Village where you can access Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed all the things that were at the Hilton. We were able to relax at the DoubleTree because there were not as many guests.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you like the type of cleaning crew that makes stuff you left in the wardrobe disappear (you call the hotel 2h after checkout - the room is not even given to the next customer but nothing can be found?) But worst of all: management that refuses to talk to you or even acknowledge there might be an issue? By al means: stay here. If not pick one of the many options with real Hawaiian friendliness. I used to be a Diamond member: this cancels out 90+ stays over the last 3 years.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed the location, convenience, and service provided by the Alana DoubleTree for our weekend attendance at the Okinawa Festival at the nearby Hawaii Convention Center. Definitely made our weekend experience fun and memorable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a fine, simple hotel within close proximity to the beach, restaurants, and shops. If you are looking for a hotel with amenities for the tourist, this is not the place to be. However, if you're simply looking for a place to sleep after a day of work or fun, this is a good choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel room was clean. The bed was very comfortable and clean. The service is great and staff very accomodating. The AC was very cold which was a plus. The hotel is centered in a great location in walking distance to shopping and great restaurants. This is a great place to stay.
user_name:
Brenda O
Horn Lake, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the hotel while looking for a place to move. The staff was AWESOME during the stay. The valet(s) know the area and will steer you in the right direction. The bar and room service provided a good selection of their menu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hurricane Lane heads towards Hawaii and these hotel heroes step up.During a very trying time for travelers as flights cancelled, vacation plans changed, and windstorms threatened, I watched the staff of the Doubletree by Hilton Alana handle nervous vacationers with competence, grace, and good humor. They really went above and beyond to stay flexible and meet the needs of their guests under unsettled conditions. Real character is revealed not when the sun is shining but when the dark clouds gather. A special shout-out to Michael at the Front Desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The first time we stayed at the hotel there were some security issues and the rooms weren't up to par. This time we stayed only for one night and after checking in I thought I was going to have another security issue again as there was another guest on the elevator with me that was either drunk or high on drugs. When I got to my floor, he almost followed me out of the elevator. Stayed for less than 12 hours for this visit and usually as a gold level member we get free breakfast in the morning. However because I had to catch a flight early in the morning - this was not even offered to me. It would have been nice to have been offered the 1000 bonus points instead since they knew I was not going to be able to utilize the breakfast. The Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki had done just that the day before .... The checkout process was easy and the valet and team members at the desk made it quick to check out so I wouldn't miss my flight. Was even given an extra cookie (which are always delicious) in the morning. So overall, some improvement - but I would still choose a different Hilton to stay at in Waikiki before this one.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I know the level of amenities to expect from a Doubletree and this one definitely delivers. Check-in/ check-out were super efficient and friendly. The location is good and within walking distance (for me) of Waikiki. My room was great - everything worked as promised, super clean and quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Except for the friendly staff, this hotel is dated and in need for upgarding facilities especially quality of restaurant & reception areas. Rooms are small and old-fashioned and in need of a lighter color scheme. Elevators are small and can be inconvenient during busy times. Breakfast choices minimal and very pricey. Anyway, even as a loyal and very frequent Hilton customer, I am sorry that this review is not more upbeat. Henk

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: On our last two visits to Oahu we have stayed at the Ilikai suites but this time thought we would give another hotel a try. We like the location because it is a 5-10 minute walk into the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but allows you to walk away from it. It is also 10-15 minute walk to the Ala Moana Centre. The main problem with the hotel was the room. Everything was damp, the bedsheets, the pillowcases and after a couple of days staying there everything in the wardrobe (clothes etc). We spoke to other people staying there and they had the same problem. When we mentioned it at reception we were just told that it is an ongoing problem and it couldn't be helped. The air conditioning has to be left on 24 hours a day because if it is turned off within 10 minutes the temperature if the room rises to 85 plus degrees, this makes the room very cold at night. We were there for 14 nights and hated the damp smell whenever you went back to the room. Also dressing in the clothes from the wardrobe was uncomfortable on a daily basis. The other problem with the room was the cleaning staff. One day they would knock on our door at 8:30 wanted access to the room, then on another day you would return to your room at 16:00 and your room hadn't been serviced. No consistentcy The trees restaurant was also a disappointment. For a hotel of this size and belonging to the Hilton group I expected something better than what could only be described as a school canteen. All in all the stay at this hotel ruined my wife's 60th birthday trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From beginning to end, unfortunately nothing great to say. Rude valet as a first impression. Bell service took over 30 minutes and two phone calls to get luggage and the hotel was not even busy. Room is very outdated, junk room amenities, not extras, bad location, horrible views. Would not stay again or recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everything within Waikiki was in walking distance of the hotel. The rooms where very clean. Hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the area. The Tree restaurant offered great food and a wonderful happy hour in the evenings. Breakfast was awesome as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is close to the mall and walking distance to Waikiki. There is a small brewery and a restaurant right next door that was nice, a 7-11, laundromat and ABC store across the street. Another positive, our king bed and bedding were SO comfortable. The room was a decent size. Coffee and apples in the lobby was nice. Having a PlayStation in the room for movie and Netflix access was a nice touch. There was an interesting smell to the hallways and rooms, musky? We were very bummed there was not a hot tub and the pool was very small. The shower head is amazing. There is nearly zero counter space in the bathroom, and the toilet paper roll is squeezed in between the wall and toilet making it impossible to sit on the toilet without touching the toilet paper roll. They should really be moved. We were on floor 16 and had a partial ocean view.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is centrally located to shopping, food, fun, and the beach.. Some of the higher up floors will allow you amazing views of the ocean. This a great home away from home for business or pleasure..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights, in a double queen roomNice and clean, helpful desk staff and great location for everything.If you get chance, go to the Hiking Cafe for breakfast ( or lunch) next door - amazing place!Restaurant is a bit canteen-ish but the food is good and the service prompt Didn’t have breakfast there because we were up and out before it started most daysNo piano bar now

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Sadly Hilton has taken a turn for the worse. I always stay with Hilton but i have been very disappointed lately. A lot of hotels on Oahu, and Hawaii in general, are out dated and need a remodel. This location appears to have been remodeled within Day the last five ten years however where ascetics seem appealing the comfort has been thrown out the window.Two beds in our room and they are both very uncomfortable as the head board appear to have stains i don’t even want to imagine about.I suggest spending more on a more modern hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has a great location, friendly and welcoming staff, and overall was a pleasure! The room was clean, and the grounds were well maintained. Anything I requested, the staff quickly accommodated me. I will definitely be staying again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Guests need to be aware that the WiFi password provided at checkin periodically changes. If you are staying multiple days and cannot connect to the internet be sure to ask for the new password. Staff will not voluntarily share this crucial piece of information with you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms/apartment was very nice and well supplied with needed items. Two bedrooms with two baths suited our needs for two couples well. Centrally located, great staff, but pricey. Pool was nice, View from balcony of the ocean enjoyable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean room. Nice location. Good staff. Internet is not stable and slow. Breakfast is little pricy. 4 people’s room could be bigger. 7 minutes walking to Hilton firework. Resort fee is $36 everyday. Hope have free breakfast with the it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel good for price. Nice area for tours. Staff friendly. Room was nice. Housekeeping fair, hotel very busy when we were there but I cleaned our bathroom myself twice and we are very tidy guests. Toilet blocked on our last day. Lauderette across the road which was handy. This was the third Doubletree we stayed in in a month long stay in US. Hotel could do with a renovation especially corridors, too much air freshener. Pool area shaded really and noisy but beautiful Waikiki beach nearby so we didn’t spend anytime there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Hilton Alana Waikiki Beach Hotel was such a great stay. Room service was perfect, all employees were very curtious and caring, especially the manager at TREES Bar and Grill. Brandon Mezurashi ensured, along with other customers, that all our expectations and needs were met. Such good food and specials at the TREES!! Great job and I will definately be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a great hotel with an even better staff. The front desk was always helpful. The valet team was exceptional. They always greeted the us with a smile. The room was good. It was a basic room with a nice bathroom and good beds.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We host our Woman to Woman event here for the past several years. I wanted our men and women from our group to feel and experience what we get to enjoy yearly. From the staff, room, and Food! Thank you!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our second stay here (first in April 2017). Since our room wasn't ready the first time until about 2pm, I called from the HHV where we were staying and had received a late 2 pm check out due to our Diamond status?? and asked if by any chance our room was ready. It wasn't, of course, at 10 am, but the nice lady texted my just after noon that it was so we checked out of the HHV and walked over. We were again on the 16th floor, but we were given a regular room and not a suite this time. We had a better view as the room faced the HHV and the water, but after the previous stay, I felt cramped. The bathroom was especially small with a toilet put in too small of an area between the shower and the sink. There was no bathtub as we had the previous year in a much more spacious bathroom! Since it was a regular room, it had the standard items: king sized bed, dresser with TV, desk, and chair plus coffee/tea station and a safe. I don't remember if there was a microwave and/or fridge. The only unique item here was the chair, which included a pullout single bed. It was a busier time this stay so I am not upset about not receiving a suite, but I was looking forward to a soaking bath on my last night in Hawaii and missed out on that. Last year, we were upgraded to omelets for breakfast at check-in as I have carb issues and usually only eat a large omelet plus a little more. This time we received it, but it was a much bigger production as we had to tell this person and that person where as the prior year, we were added to the list so we just had to tell one person on arrival! Diamonds should be given the full breakfast anyway, IMO as at the Doubletree near the Las Vegas airport where Golds receive the buffet but Diamonds get the buffet plus the hot, made to order items! Just a suggestion for the management to reward the top Hilton members automatically! This is even more significant now for Diamonds because there is a new $18 resort fee so the Doubletree and the Hilton Garden with its new $25 resort fee have joined the gang! Again, as a Diamond, I should receive most of these, especially the Internet, complimentarily! This hotel is a great Hilton brand base on this end of Waikiki. It's an easy walk to the Ala Moana shopping area, several less touristy restaurants once you cross the canal, the Iliki for Cinnamon's, even the HHV, and more. I have given up on the HHV and will use the Doubletree for my stay on this end of Waikiki only unless, of course, there are future Hilton brands in the area to try out. Mahalo!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Ridiculously high costs for things that should be included with the room rate. Why should we have to pay $20.00 for a breakfast that should cost half as much? Parking is also very expensive as are the

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room we had seemed small and the immediate area of town where hotel is located seemed a little sketchie but very close to downtown Waikiki. Everything walking distance and price probably reflects that.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is located close to where many of the tours depart so for us it worked well. We did fine without a rental car, given only valet parking is available, a good choice.Not worth paying extra for the ocean view, to my mind, you are too far away for it to be worth the extra cost. The cafe downstairs was great for breakfast, the buffet was way more food than we wanted.Room was comfortable, not really big. Bathroom was a little small. Front desk staff and concierge were very helpful and friendly. Be sure to pick up water on the way out, nice to have during the day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is ideally positioned right between a la Moana shopping centre and the centre of Waikiki centre and walking distance to the beach. The room we had reserved and paid had been given to an other customer and we ended up in a “special need” room. After querying why this had happened on the next day. The reception manager offered us to re allocate us to our initial room and as we didn’t want to move for 1 day , this gentleman gave us a voucher to use in the bar and the all team was so apologetic that we really can’t complain and it is probably the best problem resolution that we have ever experienced in an hotel of the Hilton Group.well done Double Tree Hawaii team your attitude we loved it with you!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked in and the staff were friendly. The room had empty beer cans in it from the previous guest, however thr bed was made and comfy. Shower and wifi was good. My credit carf was used as guarantee when i checked in and promised not to be charged for the room costs. I just returned from my trip to see that it has been charged. Overall facilities were good, staff were very friendly, just needs a bit more attention to detail

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Only praise for this incredible team ! Service was perfect, the rooms were cleaned beautifully , a coffee pod machine that had the best coffee on my 14 day stay. The free double tree warm chocolate cookies were incredibly yummy and worth staying for ! The restaurant food was very nice and great value for money, especially happy hour.
