The hotel smelled amazing! The staff were all very helpful and attentive without fault. I stayed at 3 Hilton’s in Honolulu and this Hilton won hands down. We were very tired when we arrived with 2 younger children so we appreciated the fact that they let us check in early. Thank you to all the staff! Great hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at the front desk were so helpful and knew a lot about tours in the area. Henry was really knowledgeable about hiking on the island as well. The doubletree cookies are fantastic, and even the people at the valet desk knew about the island, good tourist spots, and dinner recommendations. The room was clean, although the shower was a little small, and I wish the "partial ocean view" room had a better view of the ocean, but overall, we would stay there again and look forward to it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon in June. The staff could not do enough to make sure our stay was special, which we can't thank you enough for (Michael & Hendrik and the rest of the front desk staff). Great location and easy to get to all main areas. Pool area is lovely in the morning, the afternoon doesn't tend to catch the sun but that didn't matter to us. Would definitely recommend for anyone staying in the Waikiki beach area. Thank you! Nicola & Grant

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff were friendly. Property run down and room smelled like smoke. Poor flushing toilets. Old! Does not represent Hilton quality. Not sure how Hilton has not removed brand name from this location. Worth further drive/walk. Will not be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were very surprised and happy we got the top floor at the hotel. It had a terrace, balcony, and great view of Honolulu. We were asked several times how we liked the penthouse. It was outstanding. And Henry, who check us in was 110% helpful all the time. Very good attitude, professional and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had to do a Fred Pryor workshop at this property and decided to do a staycation. Booked a standard city view king bedded room. It wasn't a bad stay. The hotel is not in central Waikiki which for me is a good thing. Slightly less noise and don't need to hear the roar of the motorcycles and cars ripping up Kuhio or Kalakaua. Grant it, there is still noise but just less of it. It's pretty much across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village (about a 5 minute walk). Our room was pretty standard Hilton; super comfy bed; and workstation with plenty of electrical outlets. Good size big screen TV. The bathroom wasn't a bad size (not tiny like other Waikiki properties) and the shower has one of those "rainshower" shower heads so lots of water comes out! (Actually surprised that there was this type of showerhead for Hawaii since it's a "conservation" state so hopefully the hotel is conserving water/energy to make up for all that water coming out of the showerhead. Mind me I'm not complaining but I hope the showerhead is somehow eco-friendly. My only real complaint is that there was not free wifi in the room (you would think these days it's standard) but luckily I have unlimited data on my phone. I didn't hear anyone outside our room (even though it seemed like the hotel was filled with every high school soccer team from the mainland). So thumbs up on the soundproofing of the room. The pool is in the mezzanine level and not a bad size (not huge either). The lobby is also not on ground floor (a good thing to keep the riff raff out) and I like that there seems to be unlimited coffee all day. Also some apples in the morning. I wasn't there when the afternoon cookies come out but I hear there were pretty delicious. The Fred Pryor workshop was actually in another building (there was a walkway) and it seemed to only have meetings rooms. The space was decent but the a/c was hard to control (hot, cold , hot cold, etc) The presenter himself was getting annoyed but we survived. Meeting rooms have bathrooms close by too so thumbs up.Overall it was a nice stay; much prefer the location of this hotel than other centrally ,located Waikiki hotels of the same standard. Most staff that I encountered seemed friendly and nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful place with great and helpful staff. Very clean and the daily texts to ensure our stay was up to par and to see if we needed anything was the best. I would stay here over and over again. I highly recommend this property!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Me and my wife heard about the live music they have and amazing food thru a friend so we had to check it out for ourselfs. They did not dissapoint, all the staff at the double tree was very friendly and warm. Me and my wife sat down and was greeted immediately, the waitress let us know about all their happy hour food and drinks. My wife got a lychee tree and it was surprisingly very tasty. We ordered a classic pepperoni pizza, gyoza and some calamari. All the food was wonderful but me and my wife were raving about how good the pizza was, we couldn't get enough! There was a musician by the name of ricky kamai, he had the most amazing voice and could really play that guitar. We really enjoyed the fun atmosphere and had a great time without breaking the bank. We will definitely be back again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: You'll be awaken by a rooster every morning, as early as 3amdo not disturb sign= WE WILL DISTURB YOUHotel stankManagement is a joke.Wing [--] made me feel like a terrorist. Not even a sorry from her.Clinton is no help at all. Doesn't keep his word until you have to call and complain. Website says self parking.....there is no self-parking at all.I felt that my privacy was violated.They need to address their new dnd policy somewhere better, not on a folded wifi paper, pathetic. Watch out for this as its not advertised. Overall this stay & service was so bad I don't think I'll ever stay in a Hilton again, and I am a Hilton honors member. This is sad.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very small suite, fridge did not work, room was stuffy whole time I was there, bedroom smelled like vomit and all front desk did was spray air freshener, Yvette is terrible host at breakfast, Mgr Clinton is not a very helpful person at front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you’re contemplating a trip to Oahu and are super confused about where to stay and what the different sides of the island offer, you should know that Waikiki is VERY busy. It’s NYC on a beach. And the resorts here do a good job trying to give you the island experience but some feel just as busy inside as they do outside. NOT the case here at the Doubletree Waikiki. The staff is amazing and so personable. From Valet to the Front desk to Housekeeping, they all go out of their way to do anything extra for you they can. They share tips, ask about your plans and interject ideas for how they can make it easier on you. Case in point, when we checked into this location from a prior stay at the megatropolis Hilton Waikiki across the street, Rebecca rushed our room setup so we could get in there faster and even moved us to a suite so we would have more room with the kiddos. And when she heard we were headed out early one day, she suggested we let them set up a to-go breakfast. This was done the following night and Leslie at the front desk even texted me to confirm. Housekeeping was AMAZING. Not only did they have us in our room quickly, but they left us extras like water and juice and slippers, as well. This hotel doesn’t have the oceanfront views as other Hilton across the street. But what it may lack in direct ocean view, it more than makes up for in service and accommodations. I never felt run over with people here and all of my Honors benefits were bestowed to me, unlike the larger property across the street - likely due to their size and undeniable ocean views. When given the choice, I would stay here every time, though. When I travel, I want to be comfortable and feel like my life is less busy than it is at home. This Doubletree fits the bill for me. I highly recommend giving them your business.
user_name:
Mindy B
Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel extremely outdated. The hallways had old wallpaper and carpet. They smell old, like someone sprayed airfreshener to try and cover smell. Room furniture, carpet, wallpaper were old and worn. Need a remodel badly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love Hilton. But this was more like another brand....No microwave in room. Even a cheap motel has microwaves! Pool was dirty. The valet guys were awesome though! High five to them!!!Just didn’t have that Hilton touch. The staff at front were nice. But usually they’re more like a friend. Asking me what I’m doing, if I plan on sightseeing or surfing. Like talking with a buddy excited to see me. This Hilton didn’t have that feel. And I couldn’t pop some popcorn for my buddy because..... no microwave!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent one week at this location which was in walking distance to the strip. The room was very nice and I enjoyed my stay. The front desk was very helpful when inquiring on things I wanted to do or places that were good to eat at.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our room was clean, spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I used the work out facilities and room service. Both were very good. We were not in our room much -which was the point of getting a comfortable enough room that worked for our purpose. It was good for what we paid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: LocationThe location of this hotel is not too bad, it is located somewhere in between the Ala Moana mall, the convention center and Waikiki beach. It is about 1 block away from the Hilton Hawaii Village. Walking to the other places takes about 20-30 mins depending on where you want to go. Check InArrived just before the rush hour, so after about 10 mins wait, I was helped. Front desk staff was in general friendly. Check-in was fast and I was off to my room after 5 mins. During check-in I was informed about the ridiculous resort fees (~18$) which I have zero idea why, just because it has Waikiki in the name? Worst of all it does not even cover the ridiculous compulsory valet parking of $36+. Therefore in total above the already expensive room, you have to pay $54+ additional fees. [If anyone knows about alternatives for parking in the area, it would be nice to know]. Resort fees is said to cover internet, complimentary water and coffee and fruits located next to the lobby area. In my opinion, this is daylight robbery. RoomI guess due to the high occupancy, I was luckily upgraded to a junior suite with views towards Waikiki beach. The room was spacious and had a small balcony. The sitting area in the room was nice and spacious. There was a small bar/kitchenette area. There was however only 1 TV in the room, so if close the partition door between the room and living room, you are not able to watch tv from bed.Bed was comfortable and the room climate control was good and luckily a central AC unit, so minimal noise.Bathroom was very spacious and for once, the shower head was more of European style rather than the US standard of a fixed shower head. Amenities were as other Doubletrees. DiningThey do have a not too shabby Pupus hour with some not too bad offereings and price (for hotel standard).Breakfast offering was buffett style with an egg station. The offerings are mainly typical DT's offerings with 2-3 Asian items. In general it was ok from quality point of view, however if I had to pay for the breakfast (~$25+ pp) I would say it was not worth the value (but again this is Waikiki) and I just spend it on other options at a better place for breakfast.ServiceIn general service was good with some staff being more friendly. One of the front desk staff that was really an assett to the hotel is Leslie (I hope I remembered her name correctly). She was genuinely friendly and welcoming to the different guests and always trying her best to solve issues. Hopefully she can be an example to the rest of the associates especially those interacting directly with guests.OverallAn OK hotel in general mainly for first time visitors to the area or need to be in the area. As indicated earlier, the only big downside of the hotel are the crazy (and improper) Resort fees and compulsory Valet parking. Too bad for guests that wants to stay loyal to the Hilton brand there are limited options available when in Oahu - it would be nice to have properties outside of the Honolulu/Waikiki area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful customer service for an affordable price. It’s the perfect place for a family and for groups or even just for yourself. There’s an awesome view from rooms at a central location. Wonderful staff and delicious cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is very nice, clean and comfortable for a family trip. It was close to the beach and in a good area. The staff was very friendly and accommodating plus they were very knowledgeable about the area around the hotel and some of the local restaurants.I used the concierge service to book several excursions during my stay and they turned out very nicely. They were smaller excursions and more personal than the larger tours would have been.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff was excellent, the building is older and could probably be updated. I switched form my assigned room because when I walked in I wasn’t happy with the room condition. The front desk person accommodated me to another room that was better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I wouldn’t recommend staying here especially for the price of this hotel. You can find way better hotels for the same rate! The rooms are small and smell like mold. The location of the hotel is great and the staff tried to be as accommodating as possible even though the hotel itself falls short terribly for the cost of staying there!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff. They let us use the hospitality suite even after we had checked out. My only concerns is that it is a bit pricey ($250 / night), and the swimming pool is small. But that doesn't detract from the quality of the hotel and service provided.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a last minute trip to Oahu for a funeral. I belong to Hilton Grand Vacations Club and my advisor found this gem of a hotel for me using their club point system. We had daily free breakfast and chocolate chip cookies which were nice amenities. The penthouse suite was large and slept 4 comfortably. No full kitchen, but there was a microwave, a mini fridge, and k-cup coffee. We visit Hawaii every year to see our family and we will plan on staying here again next year. It is in a great and easily accessible location.
user_name:
Lindy Minei P
Waikiki, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I needed a place to stay at the end of my weekend trip with Family and Doubletree is in a perfect location for me traveling alone! I felt safe, had a movie bing night with their in house dvd/blue ray friendly PSP SO YES YOUNG GAMERS you can get your gaming fix on too! With in this hotel there is a cute breakfast place called a Hiking Hawaii! They do give tours which I will review next Ouhu visit! But I ate at there cafe and loved their Ashi bowl .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was an unexpected trip for my mother and I. We came home to Hawaii for a family matter. We were pleasantly surprised with our room, the hotel amenities and the wonderful accommodating staff. Oh and the free fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and free breakfast we got daily. We plan on staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice location and very friendly employees. Rooms were nice, not overly extravagant, but you don't want to hang out in your room when you're just a short walk from lot's of dining, sightseeing and of course Waikiki Beach, right?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was clean and very close to the beach! The restaurant left a bit to be desired but I definitely suggest getting out of the hotel for these kinds of experiences anyways! For the price and the location, it couldn’t had been much better!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First i want to thank Kristin My Hawaii mom from Whittier ! She made my experience at this location great last year and even better this year! Upon arriving i had planned on purposing and wanted everything to be perfect for my fiancee. Everything from the room, to the staff was great, i felt right at home in every way! The also added benefit was the ability to be away from the Waikiki beach traffic but still in walking distance to walk to several restaurants and shops.This is my favorite Hilton to stay at given the Staff, Rooms and location.Thank you again Kristin and Staff ! i am grateful for all the help and friendliness. I cant wait till the next stay !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property is just a few blocks from the ocean. Seems like it is an older building that’s has been renovated, except the rooms’ A/C system, which doesn’t seem very efficient: the room stayed warm and humid. The bathroom is very small with a small shower. The decor is pretty basic, but the bed was comfortable. The “dining” room is open for breakfast and drinks after. The staff was all very pleasant and helpful. This hotel is nothing special but it has the basics.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here during a conference. The rooms are very big and clean. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the conference centre and about 15 from Ala Moana which was very convenient. It is away from all the buzz from the main street of Waikiki so it was quiet but still accessible. It is about 5 minutes from the beach so everything is close. The reason I only gave 4 stars is because of housekeeping - they left used coffee cups and our tip! They came in and changed towels and made the bed and that was it... No attention to detail which was disappointing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel to Hawaii for business every few months and have stayed at several hotels all over the island. The Doubletree Alana is the best hotel I have found for business or pleasure! In addition to the spacious and modern décor of the rooms, the close proximity to everything in Waikiki / Honolulu, beautiful views, and great value, the best part about the Alana is the warm and welcoming staff. When greeted by the staff and their big smiles, it's apparent that they aren't smiling because it's their job, they are smiling because they are just happy and friendly people. It's employees at the Alana such as Kristi in Reservations, Tasha in Sales, and Todd in Valet that make my business trips feel like home.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for 8 nights as part of a large business group, and came to really love this hotel. The staff are very helpful, my room (after moving) was large and comfortable and the location was good. It’s not on the beach, though only 10mins walk away, but is a convenient walk from the Honolulu conference centre and the main shopping areas. First impressions weren’t great as the views are of car parks, busy roads and other concrete tower blocks. The public areas are functional rather than comfortable. The first room I was allocated was very small and opposite a large vent from a restaurant (noisy and smelly). However I was moved to a much better room, large and you could see glimpses of the mountains between the buildings. Breakfasts were excellent. All rooms have a balcony. I’m a big fan of the Doubletree chain and this was a very good example.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location to Waikiki beach, far enough from the beach activity that it's a little quieter. However, the mountain view rooms are very noisy all day and most of the night. There is a bar directly underneath the rooms that on a weekend has rowdy people in until the early hours and unfortunately the doors offer no noise cancellation. Rooms are clean but a little outdated. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. We had an issue with our payment option which included funds being taken for our entire stay on a card that was not authorised to go through and took over 8 business days for it to be reversed which left a sour taste at the end of our stay.Overall a nice place but can be noisy on the main road, I would recommend possibly paying extra for a room facing the other way from the mountains.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was very helpful in all matters. Clean and safe area with easy access to Waikiki beach and near to the airport. Staff was wonderful and attentive. Rooms are standard but clean which matters most. Overall, a nice place to stay).
user_name:
Isaac F
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Love them cookies!!! The rooms are clean and service is great as well. The location is right at the beginning of Waikiki. It's close to shopping malls and just a great spot, easy to find on Google maps.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly and helped make my experience pleasant. I was attending a convention at the convention center which is a quick 8 minute walk from the hotel. Housekeeper was very attentive and took pride in her work

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Slow elevators humid hallways. Slept with indoor light that switch did not work. Had to put a sock over my eyes to sleep. Mattress was bad. Woke up with a back ache and sore neck. Awful view. Dingy balcony.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 14 days here and can say that it was very nice. The staff went out of their way to make things right. Everything is within walking distance but the car was easy enough with valet parking. Very clean

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is the dirtiest Doubletree I’ve ever seen. Stuck here on business for 3 weeks. I had to call the manager to get the sheets changed! The room is not serviced daily. Managers want to argue with you about it! Go anywhere else!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Although the hotel was kind of busy, I believe their was proms and a military ball near by at another Hilton. I felt the stay was comfortable and relaxing. The internet speed was faster than other hotels I've been at and the king suite was nice. It's also close enough to the main strip to walk, as well as far enough not to be bothered with large groups of people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Easy access to everything! No need to drive a car when you can walk to everything from this location. Close to beach, restaurants, bars/pubs, and shopping. Hotel has everything you need, staff top knotch!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Please was nice and clean. Was greeted right away when I pulled in with my rental. Checking in was a breeze and the ladies were very nice. I had a partial ocean view but was disappointed by all the buildings between. Not what I expected Breakfast, served and valet were all great. I would stay here again if I was going on business trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed for one week at this hotel and although it wasn't without issue the staff really work tirelessly to make your stay perfect. I appreciate that. Throughout the whole stay they sent daily texts checking on us and if there was ever anything we needed, we simply replied to the last text and they took care of it. Talk about easy!!The rooms were very clean and spacious enough. I enjoyed the updates to the bathrooms with the nice showers but i did think the beds were a little hard. The room stayed hot as the thermostat only went down to 68 but I called the front desk and they came and reset it to go down to 62 degrees. The room had a fridge and they brought a microwave up to us upon our request. Digital key was very convenient as well. Because I am Hilton Honors Gold, I enjoyed free breakfast daily in the Trees restaurant. Honestly, breakfast was very good and we ate there most mornings because of that! Cookies were always available and if you caught the lady with the cookie cart she always handed you gobbs of cookies. We always got a kick out of that. LOL One day we walked up to our room with 4 packs of cookies! We used valet for a couple days and they were pretty easy to work with. They got our car to us pretty quickly and they were friendly enough even giving us walking directions when asked. I also had no issue with being charged the parking fee on the days I had no car to park. The resort fee charged covers beach towels, dvd rental and wifi. There is also a nice business center to use if needed. The hotel is convenient to the pink line shuttle stop and although it is on the out skirts of Waikiki, you can easily walk to shops, restaurants, beach etc...My one complaint about this hotel is that there is no self laundry. There is a laundromat around the corner behind the seven eleven but who wants to pack all of their clothes up in a suitcase and roll them around the block then sit in a laundromat? Having the comfort of just heading downstairs and having a lazy moment in the room would be more desirable. They do offer laundry services but the prices were CRAZY!Without a doubt I would stay here for another week!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms very clean and staff was very friendly and i would stay there again. Issues thou i dis not like was no microwave, no 10 cup coffeemaker, internet could of been faster and AC only goes to 68 unless you have maintence reset controller every 3 days. Also no onsite laundry but there is one 2 blocks away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel upgrades are getting better and better. I stay here 4 times a year and like the changes the have been applying. The rooms are always clean and up to standards. The only single issue for me is I like my room on the colder side when sleeping and the A/C units only go down to 68 degrees.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this hotel in February of 2018 for 4 nights. BE AWARE: This is a valet only parking hotel. You should check your vehicle every time for ANY marks or dents and report it right away. We noticed a dent in the middle of our passenger door and were hesitant to say something at that moment. We were hit with over a $1,000 in damages from the rental car company and the hotel refuses to pay for it. Be aware!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. Good location with plenty of bars, restaurants, and activities within walking distance. Close to the beach and the park, and easy access from the street. Breakfast was great, and don't skip the delicious cookie!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I used to stay here often many years ago, and it has been a while since I've been here. I like the location because it isn't in Waikiki, but just on the outskirts so if you wanted to walk into Waikiki, you could do so without having to get stuck in traffic. It was nice to see that the rooms were updated. However, the room was just above the parking structure. If my car was parked there, I could jump off my balcony to get to it. The room also smelled very badly. It was disappointing considering I paid over $200/night for this room. The maid service was nice, but one evening we came back to the room and the room had not been cleaned at all and the bed unmade. We had to call for them to do it. All the staff was lovely and kind, I was just not that impressed with the room considering what I paid for it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at most Hilton property's in Oahu and its my favorite. My least favorite is Hilton Viliage. DoubleTree recknoize Diamond members and will upgrade if available. The village will not upgrade but they let you pay the extra charge on the app if you want to be upgraded. DoubleTree gives free Buffett breakfast for gold & higher members, The villiage only give a $10 room credit which is insane as its barley enough to buy a Mai Tau at happy hour. The villiage Buffett breakfast is $40 or if you want a basic omelet is $25! Double Tree rooms are new, clean and upgraded; the Village rooms are outdated and dirty. Parking at DoubleTree is Valley and cheaper; Villiage self park far from the room is $42. DoubleTree is just across the street from the Villiage. Hands down I would recommended the Double Tree its just 1 block from the beach but if your really stuck on being connected to the beach and are OK for paying ALLOT more (room, parking, food, resort charge, etc..) for outdated room with zero benfits as Diamond member then stay at the Villiage. If you want a clean place that upgrades members and includes breakfast buffet for much less and 1 block from the beach then stay at DoubleTree. If you want a better location for walking the Waikiki strip stay at Hilton Waikiki Beach but they also do not have breakfast nor do they upgrade Members.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location of the Double Tree Hilton Alana, was not where I anticipated. However, I followed family there without doing more research. Now that I've had the experience. I know the next time to book a hotel on Wakiki Beach proper. Although, not a far walk-- the location was, just ok. But don't expect any beautiful views from the Doubletree Alana from your windows.
user_name:
StephAR533
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed with a friend here for a few days. Nice clean room, we had a mountain/city view. Hotel is near the beginning of Waikiki so it wasn't as crowded. Great location for either walking to Waikiki or Ala Moana. Downside is valet parking only. Enjoyed the warm chocolate chip cookie at check-in. Cooked to order omelets and fresh fruit were delicious in the morning. They had an array of fruit juices also, love the guava! Also the beds were so comfortable, would love to have slept all day but had so much to do. Overall a great stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Double tree Hilton in Waikiki. The location and service were excellent. The room was comfortable and well maintained. The place needs some updating, especially the small bathroom. This is a reasonable alternative to higher priced hotels. The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly
user_name:
Richard K
El Dorado Hills, California

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed overnight while attending a concert in town. Hotel was very clean and has many amenities that anyone could need or want. The room was beautifully decorated with newer fixtures and top-of-the-line Hilton towels, sheets, and bedding. As a Hilton gold member, we were upgraded to the executive floors on a higher floor and did not hear any of the bustle/noise of a typical Waikiki evening; however this particular property does not have an executive lounge. We had cocktails and drinks in the lobby restaurant which had a delicious menu and clean atmosphere. The same restaurant served our buffet breakfast with an espresso/cappuccino machine. Every employee provided professional, friendly service from valet parking, to the front desk, to the restaurant staff, and the hotel maids. This cozy hotel in the corner of Waikiki is in a great location for sightseeing, visiting the beach, or eating and shopping. Not a Five Star property, but you definitely receive Five Star service! Room 1613 offered a quiet room with a partial Ocean View. We will definitely visit again for the service and value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Alana is a cozy little hotel off the Waikiki strip but within walking distance to many restaurants and beaches. The staff is very friendly and helpful and there’s a pool and gym onsite. The breakfast buffet was overpriced with little variety so I suggest taking a walk a block away in any direction for better choices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this location between March 7th - March 10th and were satisfied with our visit. All staff from Bell Desk to concierge and front desk were polite and accommodating. Our toilet was clogged from the moment we arrived, but was quickly fixed with no further issues after that. The room was clean and a good size for a family of 3 though we found the walk in shower a little on the small side. There is also no grip in the shower and the floor will be come slippery quick. The hotel is within walking distance to Waikiki and there are plenty of restaurants and trinket shops nearby.My only true complaint is the buffet. Breakfast is only free for the higher tiers of Hilton rewards members and we spent $70 for 3 people on the buffet which was hardly worth it. Pricing for the buffet is $25 per adult and I believe $16 per child. The small selection of food was lukewarm and I am not entirely sure how long it had been sitting there. I would highly suggest utilizing the “Hiking Trails” cafe located on the Bell desk level. Reasonably priced and good food. There is also an ihop within walking distance and a “Cheeseburger Waikiki” next door which offers a $6 breakfast. Overall we were satisfied with the stay. Honorable mentions are Michael at the front desk for the consistent friendliness we received from him and the gentleman working the concierge at 7am on Saturday for helping us get a last minute rental car at a great price for our visit to the north shore.Mahalo!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed there for 4 nights and regret every single day of our stay there. The room had faulty Air Conditioning unit and even after multiple requests, it was not fixed and caused us highly inconvenience. I am highly disappointed with their staff too. Staff, in general, was not friendly and Miss Colleen working in their Tree's restaurant specifically ruined our breakfast and should be trained properly with what does breakfast menu entails. The hotel charges resort fee by adding services like Movies and Games rentals, beach towels etc. which is highly undesirable and gives excuses that everyone charges these fees and then there are additional charges for Parking. Considering the fee, options & the quality offered, none of these services are worth it. All in all, don't waste your money and ruin your vacation by staying at this Hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is by far the worst experience I've had with Hilton. The room smelled of must due to the air conditioning. I am a nurse practitioner with asthma and had to use my inhaler several times due to the smell of both the air conditioning and the strong cleaning supplies used to mask the odor. The hidden charges were absurd!! There are daily fees including an $18 "resort fee", $35 parking fees, $25 continental breakfast charges (per person). It was not what we were expecting when we booked the hotel for our vacation. We had a view that faced another high rise (the partial view of the ocean can only be seen by the balcony) and was charged $756.18 for two nights. The staff were friendly but not helpful. I travel a lot for work and use to live in Hawaii; I am still applauded by this experience. I travel a lot for work and use to live in Hawaii; I am still applauded by this experience. I am very discouraged by the experience and the negative impact it had on my vacation. In contrast, the doubletree in Hilo was very accommodating and did not include the extra valet fees. The fees were straightforward, convincing me that this particular hotel is not guest friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is our second stay at this DoubleTree. Everything was clean and the hall had a lovely but muted scent. While we heard the city noise we never heard our neighbors above or next to us. We weren’t able to use the pool Sat because a wedding had booked it for a chunk of the day but we’re sure to hit it early on Sunday. It’s outside with lovely landscape and is heated.There are plenty of shops/restaurant and beach within walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 3 weeks while moving to Hawaii. We liked the Doubletree brand and didn't want to stay in the heart of Waikiki, and this place was within our budget, so we ended up here.The hotel is a little funky. It's on Ala Moana Boulevard near where it ends. When you walk or drive up and go inside, you aren't in the lobby. Instead you have to go up one level to get to the lobby. It's fairly small and the escalator takes up a lot of room. There's a few tables and chairs, a travel agent, and the front desk; a DVD rental machine, a bar/restaurant and a very small convenience store are off to the side. We checked in; Michael was a pleasure to work with, and we always enjoyed the free cookies we got. When we went up to our room, the first thing I immediately noticed was that it was extremely humid. This was a problem throughout our stay. Eventually someone came to "fix" it, but his fixing it consisted of him making the room cold - low 60s cold. The room was a little on the small side, but it was reasonably nice. I liked that the room had a PS3 that we could watch rented movies on. What I didn't like was the bathroom. Whoever designed the bathrooms at the Doubletree needs to be fired. The door to the bathroom is made of plexiglass or something similar; there's also a window in the wall between the bathroom and the rest of the room. You can't see through it, but light can easily pass through. As a result, anything you do in the bathroom can be clearly heard in the main room. Also, if you use the bathroom in the middle of the night and you turn on the light in there, it will flood the main room with light. We had to get a nightlight to deal with this issue. Other than that, the bathroom was big enough that there was room for a tub. However, there was only a shower. It really is too bad; I'd expect a room like this to have a tub, plus with all the extra room in the bathroom, it makes the main part of your room smaller.So our room was good, even if it was a little small and either humid or cold, plus the bathroom situation. The hotel was nice, but there were some problems. The hotel has 3 elevators. Despite the fact they are all together, you have to push 2 buttons to call them. Also, one was not working the entire time we were there. The gym was decent but a bit small. The pool looked nice but I never went in. The restaurant off the lobby offers breakfast, but you have to pay unless you are a gold or diamond level member of Hilton Honors, which we became while staying here. Unfortunately nobody bothered to tell us, so I didn't find out about it until I heard the front desk tell someone else a day or two before we checked out. Breakfast was pretty good, especially if it was free. There's another restaurant on the lower level by where you walk in called the Hiking Hawaii Cafe. Although not open for dinner, we found it a great place to have lunch.The Doubletree is a good hotel. We thought it was a solid option, though there were some things that were screwy about it. Above all else though, I felt that they tried harder. Our room cost about $245/night; about $47 of this is taxes and fees. This is about $40 less/night than the Hilton Hawaiian Village a little over a block away, but right on the beach. I guess what I'm trying to say is the Doubletree is a good hotel with access to all Waikiki has to offer. It's still not cheap though but it's better than the cheap hotels in the area. I thought the resort fee was ridiculous for what you get. It also seems that this hotel gets a lot of business travelers; I saw flight crews from multiple airlines while staying here. So here it is: it's not on the beach, it's a little small, and the bathroom sucks. But it's still nice enough (in some ways nicer than a room at the Hilton) and it's less than the Hilton. Is it worth it or is it better to pay the extra amount to stay at the Hilton? That's for you to decide, but if you have the room in your budget and you're here for vacation, I suggest you splurge on the Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A nice hotel with a good location. The rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable. The breakfast in the hotel restaurant was a little pricey. They have valet parking only which is 30 per day. The gym and pool were nice. This hotel is not too far from the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: To be fair, let me start with the positives... The Bell/Door persons were extremely friendly and helpful. The Banquet guy, Tony, was also very helpful and went out of his way to help with changing the room set up, adding more chairs, and even grabbed menus for me. I used the Hilton app to check in, when I arrived the room I reserved was not available. When checking in, I did not realize that I had received a text while I was enroute about the room change, so I asked why??? I was told in so many words that I did not qualify for the room. The front desk agent did check with the MOD or supervisor, who did not come out of the office, which was behind the open door she stuck her head in. I'm sure he could hear the conversation, but he left it to her to explain the reasoning, which did not sound great. I found out from the manager, Clinton the next day, that I had selected an accessible room which they needed for a guest who required an accessible bathroom. A much better explanation... wish I was told that the night before. They should probably not allow guests to select those rooms using the app to check in. I was also told that I did not pay for breakfast and that I was paying a discounted rate for the resort fee. I felt the entire convo was about what I was not getting.I'm guessing this is a better location for vacationers.The room was clean and comfortable. And the cafe downstairs, not a part of the hotel is awesome!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a warm welcome by the staff, room was clean and quiet, great location. Good breakfast but would have liked a few options for those that are gluten free and the resturant could have been a little more clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The desk staff was very pleasant. The property was older abut had been totally updated. The bath products were very nice. We had come from a long flight and slept like babies. It was very quiet! The location was great for walking to many restaurants, etc, but far enough away from the busy areas. They did have a mandatory resort fee which we found at every place we stayed in the Hawaiian islands. I would return here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Thanks. It was a good experience overall. The free cookies were great. The room was very pleasant. The bDVD rental was awesome. They had a wide selection of movies and video games. I cannot wait to book my hotel room again with them next time I go to Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The front desk lady was great and she upgraded me after a day, which was nice. That said, that was the highlight except the omelete guy does a good job. Everyone else, not so much. Room was dirty, it just never got clean. I wiped the toilet down behind the seat because it was gross. The linens were fine, the bar area was ok, but the room needed a deep clean. carpet was gross too. Common areas are small, but this is a very well located hotel that is just not that big. If you want lots of common space go to a hotel closer to the beach and pay more money. This is a necessary hotel for guys and families that want to keep the cost down. No problem with that approach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a good place to stay for work or pleasure. It is pretty good quality for price. I was frustrated with their elevator situation at the time and hopefully they will have that fixed ASAP. The breakfast was great but not included in the stay unless you're a Hilton Honors members!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We used this hotel for vacation and had wonderful service. The front desk was so helpful and friendly and the employee taking care of our room, Susan was phenomenal. She went above and beyond every day to ensure we were having the best experience. The facility was very clean, the workout center and pool area were great. Great food and drinks and friendly valet service. Great experience! I used this hotel for business previously and was very satisfied for personal use. Good location close to everything that you would need.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 5 days, enjoyed the buffet breakfast one of the best, the gym was fitted out nice, room was nice and comfy. Special call out to Hendrik who went above and beyond customer service for my Lady friend. It’s customer service like he displayed that keeps my loyalty nice job. The ladies at the front desk are sweet and kind as well. Mahalo!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel looks old and located in a very crowded and busy corner of the cross road. During the time of our stay, one side of the elevators was under repair or upgrade and caused a lot of inconvenience and confusion. The parking is mandatory valet. However the staff, front desk and bell counter, especially the chef and his coworkers were exceptional nice. You could have different styles of breakfast each morning. This is the first Doubletree buffet breakfast provided this way. This location is very close to the Hilton Village, a nice place to enjoy a market place and beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We are frequent travelers.. Waikiki is typically an overpriced market for what you get.. the location is excellent, and while accomidations are good upper average for the price our highest marks go to the staff who made us feel very appreciated as both guests and Hilton honors members. Non-pressure suggestions like Charlie's taxi proved the self.. etc.Definitely return customers who would recommend it to our friends., (and those cookies are delicious!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have not stayed here in over a year, mainly due to room pricing and my budget. They were upgrading the elevators (not a bad thing) but it takes longer than usual to get to and from your room. The breakfast offered now is a full breakfast (I left early due to flight) The cookies are smaller now :( but still nice and warm. one thing I noticed different that I 'recall' from last year is the 'resort' fee, yes almost ALL of the Waikiki properties charge this. I wish that it was 'waived' if you are just an overnight guest, since that is simply money in the pocket of the hotel. Rooms are nice and clean and this property is quiet, unlike others as you get further in to Waikiki. I stayed on a higher floor in the back, which was fine.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this DoubleTree hotel for a recent business trip. It’s in a decent location for walking to the beach or dinner/shopping but it’s an older, tired property. They gave me a room immediately next to the elevator and across from the ice machine. Gee, thanks. While the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was tiny and the room had very poor lighting. I figured it would be okay for just two nights, but when I laid down in bed I saw that there was a trail of ANTS crawling across the nightstand. This is on the 14th floor! I called the front desk and the clerk offered to spray insecticide on the nightstand. I declined (who wants bug spray right next to their head all night) and he sent a maintenance guy up to investigate. After showing him the ant trail, they agreed to move my room about 3 doors down. Very similar room, but much better location and no ants (I would have appreciated having this room in the first place - rather than being nestled among the elevators and ice machine). The staff were courteous, but the property was just so so. There’s a small restaurant in the lobby that has an overpriced breakfast buffet and a bar. But the lack of any decor or theme makes it look like a hospital waiting room. The little cafe next door however was pretty decent for breakfast. It wasn’t the worst place I’ve stayed in Waikiki, but I’ll find a nicer place for the next business trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visited in December 2015 and knew that we would return if we went again to Waikiki.The staff are fantastic. The room (with 2 queen beds) was spacious; I say this because we did hit the shops pretty hard and managed to keep our shopping out of the way plus 4 large suitcases and 4 people. It's only 1 bathroom so we were cosy in the morning. The room is not a white sterile "modern" suite but a warm room with wood tones that we love.We had a couple of things we needed help with and the staff were all really great with helping us.They are upgrading their elevator system so only 2 elevators out of the 3 were in action which made for a slow trip a few times. Breakfast was great with real coffee, including decaf. I only wish the coffee machine in the breakfast room was available all day in the lobby.There is a resort fee which I wish they would just include in the nightly cost as it just doesn't make sense to me to pay it separately.Valet parking was always quick to deliver our vehicle and they never rushed us to get ourselves out of the car when we came home with a boot/trunk of shopping.The Cheeseburger Restaurant is a great eating venue right next door. The hotel restaurant is great too and the weekly bar tender, Earl, is (still) a great guy who makes a great cocktail (just ask if your drink preference isn't on the menu!)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Because I came here for business, and cost was a consideration, I picked the DoubleTree because it was cheaper than many close to Waikiki Beach. I wasn't expecting much, but I was happy at the customer service, room and the hotel accommodations. While I was not extremely close to the beach (it was a little bit of a walk), I had an ocean view. My room was nice with all the amenities one would need for a few days in paradise. Customer service at the front desk and housekeeping was excellent. The breakfast staff was as friendly but were friendly enough. Breakfast options were pretty good. I was able to get fruit and potatoes. The pool is rather small but it was well-maintained and had a wonderful view. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our stay at the double tree Alana waikiki was an amazing one! As soon as we reached there, valet was just so personable and so easy to talk to, checked in and front desk was so friendly. I got to meet one of the housekeepers and she was also friendly. I tip what I receive!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice, clean hotel. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the hotel’s location is awesome! It’s not on the beach, but it is within easy walking distance to a ton of activities and fun places. Enjoyed the stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Please update the rooms here! Great lobby. Great Breakfast buffet. Rooms are below average for price offered. Stayed in the premiere suite with rooftop patio/balcony. Old tiled floor was awful. Throw rug unclean. Rust in bathroom? For the money I paid for 4 nights, it was a rip off. Far below standard for Hilton and the Doubletree brand.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family of four thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the DoubleTree Hilton Alana.The front desk staff was always helpful and smiling offering us chocolate chip cookies daily. Although there was no self-parking, the valet staff was warm and helpful and we rarely waited more than a couple of minutes for our car ($35/day with in and out privileges)The rooms were reasonably sized and beds comfortable. It's like they knew my craft beer-loving husband was checking in as they assigned us a room overlooking the Waikiki Brewing Company (highly recommend!).Best part of the hotel was its location. A bit further away from the busiest part of Waikiki, it was walking distance from Ala Moana Shopping Center and across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. You can access Kahanamoku Beach through the lobby of the HHV. It is a public beach on the other side of the HHV that is frequently seen in Hawai'i Five-O.Would have liked a continental breakfast included but they had Kona Coffee blend, fruit water and fresh fruit available 24/7. Great find.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Thank you Leslie for an amazing check in experience. Thank you to Erik, Jason, and Todd for entertaining us while we waited on our late night flight! Great concierge service providing private island tour! Our guide, Daniel, was great too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good location, about one block nice walk to Waikiki beach. Nice clean, comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. Breakfast is an excellent value and the service was outstanding. I would recommend this to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki at a value price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: In a quieter area but within walking distance (10 min to beach) and (5 min)shops. Visit the sister resort the Hilton for beach rentals (or nearby KOA rental on the beach) for chairs/paddleboard) shopping, Luau, Friday fireworks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check in was a breeze, the staff was great, but unfortunately the front desk staff had no idea how to give directions to get anywhere. They also did not volunteer the information that you did not need to drive ANYWHERE, and in fact if you took a car it would take you 45 minutes to get there due to one-way streets, but only 10 minutes to walk. Also for example, when it was time for me to leave for the airport, one of the front desk clerks gave me directions that had literally 5 turns before you could get on the major HI road, HI1. However, the parking valet gave simple directions: " Turn right onto this road, and drive until you hit the airport. It is a little slower, but a straight shot". There is NO street parking almost everywhere, to include the hotel, and the only parking garage the hotel had was Valet only, at almost $39.00 per night, but the valets were great. One got to know me, as after the first day there, I never used my car. When I would get down to street level, he would joke about me not needing my car today. I had an 11th floor room, which gave a decent view of Waikiki. There was a small private balcony with 2 chairs and a small table, which was nice to sit and enjoy the view, as well as hang out my scuba gear. The bedroom was a standard size, but large flat screen TV, very comfortable bed, and a comfy overstuffed chair and desk. The lighting was good, and I did not have to use the 100 watt light bulb I usually bring with me. The bathroom was modern, but no tub, just a shower. Those of you with little children should ask if there is a room with a tub. The hot water was quick to kick in, and there was plenty of it. The coffee pot in the room was a Kuerig coffee maker, with tea as well as coffee included.In the common areas, there were a couple of nice lounge areas. They did have a breakfast area, but I was not sure if it was an included breakfast or not, as they did not advertise dinner. I do not think there was a bar there, but there might have been.These are questions you need to ask while making reservations.It did have a fitness room as well as pool. I did not use either of these facilities as I was basically exploring the city. It is located approximately 20 minutes or less to the beach, depending on how fast you walk and how much "junk" you carry with you.One thing you NEED to know, to save money is DO NOT RENT A CAR. You do not need it. Most things are within walking distance, and the public transportation is GREAT. I was traveling alone, had a few days layover after being on a remote island 2500 miles away, so decided to stop and take a tour of Pearl Harbor, and other must-do sights, as well as a scuba dive trip. I was there December 23rd-27th, so had a solo Christmas dinner at a small Sicilian restarurant which again, was within walking distance. The island had a large mall , with a central area that was gorgeously decorated for Christmas.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good:- warm cookies!- Free fruit infused water, coffee and fresh fruit in lobby - Free wifi with h honors - Good location, minutes walk to Waikiki strip and beach Not so Good- Hair found in bed, either meaning bedding wasn’t changed or not cleaned properly - Toilet broke down twice during 5 night stay - AC broke down once - Toiletries and towels weren’t replenished several times - 3 elevators servicing 19 floors that were extremely slow, long waits and sometimes it was you couldn’t get on cause it was so full Overall it was a comfortable stay , the hotel is showing its age but it wouldn’t return

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good location, 5-10min walk to Waikiki area, rooms showing age. Not the cleanest. Great cookies! Free Fruit, coffee and fruit infused water in lobby! Would be nice to have free airport Shuttle or at least shuttle to Waikiki area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service was amazing as well as the rooms were very comfortable. Away from all the busy hotels. No lines..but still close to beaches and shops....hotel will hold your bags of you have a later flight

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful time, blessed with good weather. Water is cold but still can get in. Lots to see and do. Just a deluge one day while doing AZ memorial. Very crowded but it’s probably this way all the time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location is good ... Rooms spacious and in general kept clean ... Front desk staff were efficient and helpful . Valet and housekeeping have an attitude problem and unless you are a Hilton Honours member not good value at all .. The highlight of the stay was the Expedia concierge service given by Christina

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very cleanGood breakfast buffet and happy hourEasy walk to VillageEasy access to yoursGreat Hawaii hiking tour Shop in lobby with healthy smoothies Next door to ChessburgersBombay Palace great neighborhood Indian restaurant next door to Buffalo Wild Wings

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stay was great and staff very friendly with a special mention to Jayleen in Reservations. Enjoyed Hilton Honors benefits provided. All Hilton Branded hotels are excellent with a thought to customer's comfortable stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room was clean and spacious, staff was friendly and cookies are a fabulous touch!! Location was in walking distance to few eating places. Sleep was comfortable with no outside noises. We would highly recommend anyone stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved this hotel. It was close to everything, especially the best spot to view a sunset and we had a great experience. We arrived way before or check in time and left way after, they held our bags after check out and before check in and actually brought them up to our room. Amazing hotel. Beautiful, clean and best staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Doubletree Alana Waikiki is my favorite hotel. The staff is outstanding. Check in was a breeze especially with Leslie at the front desk. She was very accommodating. The rooms are clean and the shower is great. Bath products are great. As a Hilton Gold member, they exceeded my expectations. I will be staying here again. And this is my second review for this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The entry and lobby are modest enough, and the neighborhood - while near a busy corner, is not bustling. There's a very pleasant park across the street, the best brew pub in Waikiki next door. You're a 10 minute walk to the monstrous Hilton property and the beach. Probably just best to stay their (Hilton Hawaiian Village) except that it's typical Waikiki - 1000s of rooms, and made to feel like a cruise ship. Very nice beach, though, and that's the main (only) attraction to Waikiki itself. Otherwise it's all one big shopping mall and skyscraper condos/hotels.The Doubletree rooms are standard hotel rooms. I had a problem with a previous occupant's garbage on the lanai, which took 2 days for the hotel to address.There is an $18 resort fee which includes nothing. The pool is extremely modest, and there's an adequate fitness center. Other than that the fee includes a beach towel, apples, cups of water, and very good coffee, at the front desk.$35/day for parking is actually not bad - as I found out when I paid $80 in Honolulu for 9 hours.All in all, a nice staging area for the rest of Oahu. And let's face it, you can only spend so much time in this 1960's version of 1970's Miami Beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at the hotel were nice and friendly. The property was well kept, and the room was extremely comfortable. I will stay here every time I come to Honolulu.The cookie at check-in was delicious! Was a nice extra after traveling all day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Staff is the Best, from when the valet greets you all the way through the simple check out. Rooms are very nice and the remodeled bathroom has the shower fixtures I want in my house. I have a back condition so I cannot fault the beds that are used. Other guests I spoke with liked the beds, I was just used to my adjustable one at home.
user_name:
Larry G
Newport News, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed the restaurant, room and room service, the lobby and the service provided by the front office. I can't wait for another trip which is scheduled to May of 2018. I am hoping to book any personal trip in the Double Tree hotel for its best services.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I just returned from another stay at the Alana Doubletree hotel. I highly recommend it for many reasons. We were warmly welcomed and given our warm cookie and water. Our room was very clean and so comfortable. We always had plenty of towels and other amenities. The location is right on a huge park and at the quiet end of Waikiki. The pleasant walk through the part to the beach only took about 10 minutes. The best part of this hotel is the warm and friendly staff. They always greeted us with a smile and a friendly chat. We felt comfortable and as though they really cared about us the entire time. The hotel staff here definitely have and share the Aloha Spirit!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I think the photos and headline speak for themselves. I was taking a shower on my last day of my business trip in Honolulu and as I was reaching for my towel, lo and behold! A cockroach on the wall. Truly, for a Hilton brand, this is UNACCEPTABLE and DISGUSTING. Perhaps if I was paying for a much much lower tier accommodation I could expect something like this. But a Hilton? My gosh. As I needed to leave immediately, I accepted a 100 USD comp on my bill (They also gave me 25 USD as they forgot to clean my room the night before) but now thinking about it, I think I may have been short changed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I come to the islands 3-4 times per year on business and have stayed at almost all of their properties on Oahu (Diamond HHonors member). This is by far the best. Quieter and less crowded than their beachfront properties and better service too. Dinner and drinks at the onsite restaurant Trees was a complete pleasure due to the attentive service and lively chitchat from Earl (longtime pro) and Alana (the new girl). Breakfast was excellent and is free with status.Parking is $35.00 per day and the nick you for an $18.00 per day resort fee but the overall rates have been decent for a hotel in this area. Super helpful and friendly staff all around.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I only spent 1 night here, however the stay was nice and short. Check in was nice and given that delicious, famous double tree cookie! The room was nice but small and the whole hotel was rather ordinary, but if you are looking for a quiet hotel this might be your pick! The pool was nice and we watched a parade from the rooftop terrace there. The location though was not what I would want on a vacation, it is on the edge of downtown Waikiki so again if you want a quiet stay this might be for you. However, we found that we walked a long way for something to eat and everything we wanted to see was far away. Overall a great hotel for a nice quiet vacation, however average.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms are small. Elevators are slow. Forgot some items and they have a set up with a website that never emails you back. We had to call for service because our door wouldn't open, without being a body builder.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Thank you DoubleTree! Such a wonderful hotel to stay in and staff were amazing from the time we arrived and left. Michael thank you for your great service we were made welcome and treated with a smile (GREAT SERVICE Mate!). Room was comfortable and it was cleaned everyday (thank you house keeping!).What can i say about this hotel in terms of there location.1. you're 5 min walk to the beach.2. a 2-5 min to iHOP (must eat here for breakfast! if you haven't done so.)3. You must try the Cheeseburger restaurant next door to the hotel.4. If you like to shop the location is perfect (for us yes, that's because we like to walk a lot), you are about a 10min walk to Alao Moana Shopping Centre (when you walk out of the hotel you will need to turn left). If you want to go to International Market Place is about 15min walk (depends how fast you walk!).5. Would recommend hiring a car if you want to see the island. Also if you want to see Diamond head i recommend take a bus and walk (15-20min walk from the bus stop to the entrance). If you are driving beware that parking may be limited because it can get full pretty quickly.I would stay at this hotel again without any doubt.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’m a Hilton gold member and I stayed here and Hilton Hawaiian Village over the Thanksgiving week: If you like peace and quiet, better service, quick check-in, and nicer staff, choose this hotel! Doubletree by Hilton Alana upheld the Hilton values and delivered them - unlike Hilton Hawaiian village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We originally were going to Hawaii because of a convention in one of the hotels on the beach. We did not want to spend as much money as they were so chose the DoubleTree that was not a far walk. It was a great choice. The lanai was fabulous. I could see the ocean and some of the mountains when I sat out each day. The room was comfortable and the staff exceptionally nice. The only flaw I found was that the bathroom was a bit on the small side and the toilet paper holder was extremely close to the toilet. Other than that this was a perfect place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I thought this hotel was great. My family stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village for double the per night stay I did, and this was just as good. Also, it is literally across the street from that. Excellent!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’ve stayed here for six weeks at the Doubletree Inn in Waikiki service is great all the people are friendly have stayed at different hotels in the area I definitely think this is the best especially if you were here on business

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family and I recently stayed at these hotel, as soon as we checked in we were greeted by a friendly staff, our room wasn't ready yet, but the guy took the time to actually find another room that was available, so we can rest, which we didn't rest by the way, . These hotel is only a 10min walk to ala moana mall, depends how fast or slow you walk, and 8-10min walk to Waikiki shops. You can also catch a bus or what they call a trolley. Room was a good size for us. There's a restaurant called "cheeseburger", next to the hotel or you can go to IHOP. Overall, it was a good hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'm the type that is always too lazy to write reviews, but I have to give a shout-out to the amazing service provided to me by Leslie at the front desk. I had to cut my stay at the doubletree short and cancel a non-refundable pre-paid room bought through priceline. I was pretty sure that I wouldn't be able to get my money back, but Leslie went far above and beyond and patiently spoke with Priceline on my behalf and was able to get me a full refund. The process took forever, but she was so patient and understanding through the whole ordeal. This experience definitely sold me on the doubletree/hilton brand for my future travels (I usually stay at Marriotts). As far as the actual hotel goes, it is very conveniently located to shopping/restaurants/beach. The room we have is updated and quite comfortable, with a wide outdoor balcony overlooking the city and mountains. The hotel and service is unpretentious, and feels as nice and homey as the delicious, warm, soft-baked chocolate cookie that you are greeted with. You will not reget staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this hotel because it is small and well managed and has what I need! I am not fond of large resorts because there are lines for everything from checking in to grabbing a drink at the bar. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was like being at a boutique hotel and not having to wait for things. Breakfast was outstanding, the POG was delicious. The room was well lit and nicely sized with lots of outlets, and the balcony had a good amount of space and a great city view. The fitness center was well stocked. The hotel is a short walk from the top notch bars at the Modern and the Ala Moana center.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a wonderful stay in a wonderful city. We were fortunate enough to have two fantastic Front Desk Agents, Wing Fung-Asst. Mgr. and Rebecca London check us in, upgrade our room and give us great tips of the city. They made us feel so special and made our trip. Thank you again for a warm welcome!!!
user_name:
Karyn M
San Diego, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location is decent not in the middle of the craziness. But if you are on business other Hilton properties do not have resort fee which they added last month. It would be nice if it was more clear when booking thru the app. Just do not need any perks when working as no time to use them.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was just Ok, room was never really cleaned . Elevators took a long time and lines formed to get on, wait time about 10 to 15 minutes. Lots of noise outside my room after midnight. The fact the bar doesn't open until 5 is another issue when you want to have an afternoon beer.
user_name:
Ellen M
Huntington Beach, CA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hilton usually is a decent choice however this one fell a bit short. $35 for daily valet parking with no other choice? Plan for that because it’s not mentioned during the reservation process. Hotel is dated but to be expected. Front desk staff is wonderful and very helpful. Cookies rule!Close to most everything so it’s okay. Be aware that the walls are thin.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: "A wonderful hotel. Can't say enough about this establishment. I can start by congratulating the entire staff for their excellent service and their warm and friendly welcome! Very comfortable rooms. Great location. Can't wait for our next visit! We highly recommend this hotel as it fulfilled our every need and expectations. A+"

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Alana Hilton Hotel may be small in size, but big on providing the best guest experience. The staff is always available to make your stay perfect and make you feel at home. Whether you are planning a convention, staycation, or traveling you can count on every one there to exceed your expectations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We opted for this hotel because it ticked so many boxes. Location - walking distance to sister hotel, Hilton Village with great pools and beach lagoon, Ala Moana shopping one direction and the all that Waikiki has to offer the other directions, nearby restaurants, convenience stores and car rentals at Discovery Centre and access to nearby bus routes. Room Configuration - there were 3 of us, all females so the room design with 2 very comfortable queen sized beds, a small kitchenette with microwave and fridge, a bathroom with wide mirror and bench top and a small change room also fitted with a mirror and PowerPoint worked well. The seperate small lounge area with a second tv was also very appreciated as were the balconies with additional seating with one looking directly over to the Fort Derussy Park. Price point - we got all this space for slightly cheaper than the resorts on the beach offering much smaller rooms. The wifi was complimentary as I was a Hilton member. Conveniences/amenities coffee, water and fresh cookies on offer 24/7 in the lobby station. Two choices of food places.valet parking was available at $35 a night. Swimming rooftop pool. So it ticked all the boxes for us and we were not disappointed. The decor in the room was a little tired and dated but very clean. The aircon was set to a low of 20c which was on occasion not cool enough but when there was a breeze the two balconies afforded us a cross breeze however there were no screens on the doors and although on the 16th floor street noise could still be heard and was at times quite loud. Also if you are in a rush current work upgrading on the elevators means that you may be held up for a considerable time and the stairs become a viable quicker option. Staff were very pleasant. There was an Expedia tour and activity desk in the reception area and we were able to book our whole week of tours and activities with the very knowledgeable and friendly Josh. Would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First time stay with this brand and was pleasantly surprised. The location is excellent as it allows for multiple access into and out of Waikiki. The value of the suite was excellent. The customer service at check-in and check-out was superb. Unfortunately the parking is valet however the service is quick and assistance with the luggage was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed 7 nights at this hotel and the staff was very welcoming, friendly, and professional. They were very attentive to my needs and proactive to ask if I needed anything. The cleaning staff was excellent. I was offered a warm cookie and bottled water at check-in. It was a nice perk to be able to ask for a cookie and water at my pleasure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall the hotel is quite good. It is at the quieter end of Waikiki which was a plus for me, though if you want to be in the thick of it try somewhere else. The hotel is quite old from the outside however is well presented and quite new inside. The elevators are not very good, as they are not all connected to one button and are quite slow, this is not helped by the fact that most of the time one of the elevators seemed to be out of service. They had a sign up referring to renovations that they were doing on the inside of elevators, but that does not excuse the fact that you have to push two buttons and then wait quite a bit of time (often in the minutes) for the elevator to show. The room was quite good, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small and the WiFi worked well. The power went out due to a storm on my first night and I was unable to get cable channels for the remainder of my trip there. Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was pleasant though very meat heavy. There also appeared to be no lactose free/soy milk option for milk. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly and helped me organise a shopping trip the the outlet centre. The escalator that you have to take from the lower lobby was quite narrow and the floors inside the lobby and lower lobby were slippery when it was wet outside.
