I tried to use the pool the first day of my trip and was told that it was under renovation and that I would need to walk to another Hilton property, I declined and did not try again to use the pool area. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for people needing to be in Waikiki but needing some quiet time. It is within reasonable walking distance to most things and there are some nice restaurants around. If you want to be somewhere closer to the action or the beach I would recommend that you try another Hilton property; of which there are several in the area. Pricing was about average for a Hilton hotel and as with most hotels in Waikiki nothing is cheap. Having said that I think it is a touch overpriced given the location and the age of the property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Friendly staff. Clean surroundings. Had to wait for the valet a bit but it's ok. The breakfast buffet was above average. The egg omelets were the best. Please work on the bacon, it was kinda soggy. Bacon should be served nice and crispy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Waikiki, closeby the massive Hilton Waikiki complex, is steps away from the main roadway but quiet and yet convenient to major shopping areas, inclusive of the Ala Moana Shopping Center --- about 15 minutes away on foot. Famous brewery and eateries within a half-mile radius.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Love staying at the Doubletree Alana Hotel--the staff are always friendly and welcoming. The cookies are always waiting for me too! Stayed for a weekend, upgraded to the suite, very nice, roomy, and comfortable. slept like a log! Great location at the beginning of Waikiki so I didn't have to deal with traffic. Would definitely stay here again and again....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree Alana is a very welcoming hotel with service staff that is friendly and accommodating. The conference rooms were perfect for our group and food absolutely delicious. I would highly recommend the Double Tree Alana for your business and personal stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: as titled. outside humidity in honolulu is roughly 70% humidity, but the room humidity runs 85-90% even with the air conditioning on. the system cools the room temperature; however, does not remove the humidity like it is supposed to. the hotel staff was unable to assist during my stay, unfortunately. i asked for a dehumidifier to be put in the room but it was an older model that runs fairly noisy. i would stay away from this hotel until the property properly fixes the hvac system to remove humidity during operation of the air conditioning. a bug was also found between the sheets. the staff and quality of service, overall, is average when comparing to the mainland, but a little lower than average across the honolulu/waikiki area hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed the Doubletree by Hilton. The pool What is under construction so they allowed us to use the Hilton Village pool area which is about a five minute walk. The Hilton Village is right next to the ocean which made it nice. As far as the rooms the best rooms are the even numbered rooms since they have a partial ocean view and it looks towards the Hilton village. We also enjoyed the balcony which has two chairs and a small table. The breeze is stronger on the off numbered rooms which have a partial Mountain View. The hikers cafe in the hotel was quite quaint. The hotel had complementary fruit, water and coffee available throughout the day. Loved the service from the front desk and the bellhop. We requested to have a different room and they assisted us in moving. We would stay at this location again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wet, damp room including floors and beds.Dirty room daily. Bathroom not cleaned. Inaccurate charges. Sheets were so wet we were moved to a new room. Drain was clogged so water built up when showering

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome service!! Loved our suite and affordability. Our wheelchair accessible room and shower provided more than enough room for all 4 of us including my toddler son. Upon arrival until our departure it was easy. We didn't have any problems at all!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is disappointing how poor the quality of service is and how much this establishment goes out of its way to nickel-n-dime you to simply enjoy your stay. Whether for business or leasure I would not recommend or use the services of the hotel in the future. And simply saying the price is good for the location (Waikiki) is a moot argument. The only good thing about this hotel is the Hiking Hawaii Cafe which is a separate business on the property grounds.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Quite ok hotel and location is quite good. Hotel is a bit older and equipment shows it. Service was indeed very good and friendly but parking for hotel guests overpriced. Other than that, however, good value for money

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree Alana Waikiki is the place I stay when in HI for business. The staff is great, very akamai / friendly, and helpful and quickly addressed any issues or questions that I had while there. The breakfast was superb and I have been in most breakfast places recommend in Waikiki. The custom made omelets were the best - and real maple syrup was available each day. No that is something you rarely see on the mainland let alone in HI. Always happy to stay here and I will be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We got a really good deal, hotel, parking and breakfast. I would stay again if the price is the same. Mattress was too soft for us, but we tolerated it. The view of the burnt Marco Polo condo wasn't pleasing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Alana has nice, spacious rooms with comfortable work desks and good TVs and refrigerators. The bathrooms are updated and clean. The fitness room is standard Hilton and aside from being fairly small and having a low ceiling (cannot do stand up military press or pull-ups without hitting it), it's adequate. The breakfast buffet is good and there's a cook to order omelet station included. The staff is very friendly and seem to genuinely want to make their guests feel welcome.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location but the rooms were very outdated. Staff was friendly but the cleaning service didn't arrive until almost evening. Construction noise started at 8 am Monday morning. Good value if using Hilton points.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Another flawless stay at the doubletree alana waikiki. Everything was great, always consistent. Unfortunately the pool was closed for renovation however the hotel had great views and delicious cookies. I will be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our room was nice and breakfast was very good, served 6 a.m. To 10:30 a.m. Eggs to order, bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes, toast and bagels, muffins, fruit, oatmeal, juice and coffee. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Good shower. Balcony with a view. Big closet with iron and board.. small fridge. Great TV. Fast wifi. The only negative is that the bathroom is quite small. The TP is literally 1/2 inch from your cheek (yes, THAT cheek) and there's no counter space. You have to take turns, for sure, but the fixtures are nice. All in all a nice hotel and we'd certainly come back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here two nights for a short holiday. As soon as you walk in, the reception staff are friendly and check you in quickly. Naoki was particularly helpful about any questions about the hotel and tips about Hawaii in general. The hotel was located in a convenient location, short walk to the beach! The rooms were clean, which is a big deal for me. Small offering of basic necessities in the lobby, in case you get the munchies, or an ABC Mart just around the corner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had a large room on a high floor with two balconies with peek a boo views of the ocean. Room was clean and inviting. Hotel was a few walkable blocks from the beach. Restaurant inside the hotel was very small with limited seating. Their was a concierge available in the lobby to help with local activity planning or restaurant recommendations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel staff provided excellent customer service. Wonderful location: walking distance to Ala Moana mall, Waikiki beach, and many restaurants. The room we had was recently renovated. Overall we had a wonderful stay. We definely would recommend this hotel to family and friends. This would be our hotel of choice on our next visit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: On the edge of Ala Monana, closest to the main Waikiki strip, it is easier to find street parking. If you shoud choose to have parking on-site, it will cost you 35 USD. Room had a couple minor shortcomings, nothing serious.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great Service!!! Delicious, warm chocolate chip cookies at check in and as much as you want during your stay. The check out process was a breeze. I was greeted by text message in the evening and told that I could text when I leave to check out. Simple and they even texted me back to say how much they appreciated my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at this property are what you would find at a five star resort. They are very friendly, very courteous and helpful. The location is equally good as getting in and out of the hotel is rather simple. The two negatives are the parking and accommodations. It is valet only which is somewhat of a hassle. The rooms is the hotel's black eye. The rooms desperately need to be updated. The furniture and carpet is worn out and the hallways smell of either chemicals or of a musty scent. I love Hilton and I am an extremely loyal Hilton customer. However I can not recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Hotel and staff made our vacation even more great. Our tours were ready to go when we checked in. Breakfast was wonderful. We will be staying there again next year! They made you feel like familyand at home.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: great location, next to resturaunts. very friendly staff, vallet and ballet service was great. housekeeping and resturaunt staff very friendly. we loved the balcony in the room. very clean rooms. breakfast was very good and included eggs or omlets of your choice. breakfast included expresso and specialty coffee choices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff did everything they could to accommodate me and they were extremely kind. Hotel was a couple of blocks off the beach, but only a few minutes walk from some excellent beach access. Just down the street from the main strip with plentiful restaurant options. Microbrew restaurant right next door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for three weeks. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel staff from the front desk personnel to the cleaning ladies were extremely pleasant. This is a hotel that I would stay at again.
user_name:
Michael P
Prospect Park, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: hotel and staff are excellent. the look and feel of the hotel is excellent. only complaint is the size of the pool and no hot tub. loved the location and set up. conference room and convenience of the rooms was outstanding. would rate 5 stars but the pool was very poorly thought out and no hot tub

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Before I share my opinion, let me provide some context. I travel a lot for work and pleasure. I am not easy to please because I have high expectations when it comes to service. Double Tree Hilton in Honolulu is STELLAR. The hotel has truly outstanding customer service. It felt like family. The room was clean, the bed was just wonderful, and the staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. I received so much from the staff-- the valet, the front desk, the housekeeping -- They all seem to love their job. Elsa is a true gem. What a great ambassador for Hilton and Hawaii she is! I loved that this hotel is about a 7 minute walk from the Hawaiian Village and the other Hilton Hotels right on the beach. Double Tree has its own special charm. I would definitely stay at this hotel every time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My company stayed here for 2 nights recently with about 50 people. They made the experience of checking that many people in and out extremely efficient. We have all been there when you are standing around and waiting when you just want to get something to eat or go to bed after a long trip. The staff was amazing and even went out of their way to consolidate all individual receipts delivering them via email to my administrative staff. This again made checking out a breeze. Would gladly stay here again and would definitely recommend for large group reservations.Thank you,Jason

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my second stay and each time it was great. The staff was so helpful and I loved the valet parking. The location is walking distant to several good restaurants and bars. Only issue was the $25 breakfast fee if you're not gold or above hilton honors, but the coffee was free.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location and awesome hospitality....they checked me in early and also allowed me for a late checkout. The welcome cookie was awesome. The beach is at a walking distance and also there are great restaurants around the corner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Smaller hotel on edge of Waikiki which makes for quick and easy in and out. If u want to be in middle of Waikiki this is not the location for you. Valet parking only, but getting your car is very quick. Friendly staff. We like it for these reasons. But, shower only, no tub. Not much Hawaiian motif/feeling in lobby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel rooms are comfortable and the beds are easy to get a good night sleep. The staff here are always friendly, helpful and have always assisted with requests of all sorts that may come up when traveling on business. One of my favorite hotels to stay in while traveling in the region

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: TV in room didn't work. Air conditioning temperature couldn't be controlled and room was freezing. No hotel van for airport pick up or drop off. Had to walk the entire length of a huge terminal to look for a non English speaking Uber driver that hotel sent. Tried to check out and was told by the guy at front desk that he couldn't give a receipt because he had only worked there for 3 days and didn't know how. He was left alone without help or supervision for the night. My credit card was double billed last month. This hotel is FAR below any Double Tree standards.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is outside the mega resorts of Waikiki but close enough that you can be there in a couple of minutes. The DoubleTree is an oasis in a sea of pricey hotels. It's small but very comfortable. The staff is very attentive and very friendly. The rooms are so comfortable and quiet. As an added benefit they give you a warm chocolate chip cookie when you check in. (And they will give you another if you ask!) There's free wifi in the lobby and your room. They have an app that you can use as your room key! And also in your room. Breakfast buffet every morning! We so enjoyed it here and we're sure you will too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Have stayed here numerous times in the past on biz. Needed a break after 7 weeks on business travel. Hotel has been remodeled since my last stay. Great rooms, excellent aircon! Staff is very friendly! I like the fact that it is not in the middle of Waikiki. Tons of stores in walking distance and some good restaurants. As a Diamond HHonors member, I was offered comp bkfst, but those comfy beds and great aircon made me sleep in and relax. Just what I needed! Something I never get to do when traveling for business!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good hotel somewhat close to the hot spots of Waikiki. You have to walk to Waikiki Beach and the resorts/restaurants/shopping, but it IS a walkable distance. This hotel is a little older, but updated and clean. The restaurant downstairs is great-lots of healthy food to enjoy. Staff is nice also. It worked for our 3 days in Oahu before we went to our resort in Maui, it was a good place to base ourselves out of for our daily adventures.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is away from the bustle of the strip, but still well within walking distance of anything you might be after. Near by restaurants are nice, close enough to walk to Ala Moana mall, and we even managed to walk to, up and from Diamond head from Double Tree. Parking costs are quite high, so consider the need of a car over taking the bus. Doors seem thin, so guests in rooms next to elevators beware - you will hear every time someone calls or exits the elevator, and if you enjoy sleeping in, cleaning staff and their carts.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Andrew and JeanetteMy wife and I have visited this hotel many times. The attitude of the staff and particularly at the front desk and housekeeping was wonderfully caring and always made us feel as we were at home with dear friends. The location is excellent because the hotel is walking distance from Waikiki beach but away from the frenzy of the beach front hotels. We found the rooms spacious and clean with exceptionally comfortable beds. It's reasonable prices make the experience of staying at this Hilton property additionally alluring.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff here is very personable and friendly. Everyone goes out of their way to give you the best experience ever. Site is in a perfect location to many restaurants, shops, beaches and public transportation. I highly recommend this hotel and their staff. :)
user_name:
Denise A
La Palma, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of the worst hotel experiences I have had to date. I do travel alot with my job, so I have seen it all, or at least I thought! Ok, the normal gripes, my a/c went out 3 times and internet went down multiple times. The 30 minutes I spent in a broken elevator was a new experience, and not one I want to repeat! When eating breakfast, I was places at a over crowded bar. Now if all tables were taken than I could understand, but there was a table. Unfortunately, the owner of the hotel instructed his staff to not let anyone sit there, he was going to be entertaining a Hilton regional manager. Apparently, they are too good to sit at a bar. With that being said, as a paying customer, I think my comfort should come first, but that is my opinion, one that is not shared by Hilton management.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: While not located "on the beach", this Doubletree is within short walking distance of Waikiki Beach. Service was excellent -- with everyone from the housekeeping to valet very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were quiet, clean, and very comfortable. The dining area was newly renovated, and very bright and sunlit. I'll be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff, food, service, comfort and location Across from HHV which has best beach in Waikiki. Rooms very nice quiet clean & comfortable. Food was great and staff was outstanding. I highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a good and nice time at this hotel during our Hawaii trip. Very nice staff, updated rooms and facilities! Nicely located with convenient stores and a restaurant beside it. It is 15 min walk to the strip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is very old. You can observe that they made upgrades to modernize their lobby and pool area. However the room I occupied smell of mold and the A/C unit barely worked. Very expensive to park, the current rate without taxes was $35.00. The staff at the front desk were friendly. I have stayed a many DoubleTree hotels before and developed a certain level of expectations when it comes to this brand of hotels; particular hotel just missed the mark.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location was convenient although not on the beach, balcony room was spacious with a good view.The staff was very responsive the conceirge desk was convenient and helpful all in all a very well managed property

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stay here for business over 100 times. Not once have I left not feeling completely satisfied with the service. The front staff is super friendly, helpful, and will go above and beyond to lend a helping hand. The restaurant crew always greets you with a warm smile and will tend to your needs immediately - just a super friendly down to earth group of people. Props to Kyri for going above and beyond ALL the time. YOU ROCK! Last but certainly not least, the valet crew is just as amazing!!! Highly recommend this hotel to all travelers!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. The rooms are very nice (and smell nice), the Hilton Honors breakfast was really good (made to order omelets and buffet), and the staff was very attentive. Claire at the front desk rearranged our rooms to get my family next to each other. She then texted me later to tell my family about the fireworks on Waikiki beach and the best place to view them. All-in-all, the staff made my family feel very important.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body:  Stayed at the Doubletree and had a very comfortable and clean room for five days. I give an outstanding rating largely due to the very friendly staff at the front desk and at the valet counter. I am writing this review primarily to acknowledge the excellent service provided by Rebecca at the front desk. She always had a smile, was engaging, and proved to be very knowledgeable with many fine recommendations on local restaurants, beaches to visit, hikes on the island, and much more -- she never ceased to provide helpful tips and greet guests with warmth and friendliness. I usually try to stay at the Hawaiian Hilton Village, which is also a great place to stay, but I will be returning to the Doubletree for the great staff (and excellent cookies).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times when I am on Oahu for business. I do think it is the best "business" hotel on the island. Staff very friendly and quick to help. Work out and business facilities are good, not great. Menu needs some updating but all in all, I would recommend it and return to this facility.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The front desk staff were very friendly and helped in any way they could. The housekeepers created a pleasant place to come "home" to every night. Felt like an honored guest, not a pest. Loved it. And Breakfast...oh the Breakfast was great. Not some nasty re-hydrated eggs, delicious omelets with quality ingredients. And the chef's plate....who knew that a meat and cheese tray was so awesome to start the day. Spend the money and stay at the DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location and amenities, for our purposes. On the edge of Waikiki, with easy access to the military exchange at the Hale Koa, Ala Moana shopping center, as well as downtown Honolulu, this was the perfect location, for our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of the best interactions between guests and the staff. I had no problems enjoying my time here. Perfect location to go shopping I Waikiki or go to the Ala Moana mall. All within walking distance.!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Convenient location. Easy walk, friendly staff. Decor is a little worn but some renovation being worked when I was there. The breakfast area reopened when I was there, however service was done with a smile. order was lost when they reopened. I felt it was alot of wasted time standing since waiting. Most Hilton dining take orders and give table numbers. This hotel had minor issues?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Doubletree Alana. The staff was extra friendly with lots of smiles and greetings each day. The high speed internet really was high speed1 Our room was ample size, very clean, with a great shower.We also had a lanai that offered ocean and city views. Waikiki Beach, lots of restaurants and shops are a short 5 minute walk. The valet service is very prompt and courteous staff. I would stay here again easily and highly recommend iT.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked last minute and were pleasantly surprised. This was a good deal and comfort was important since we had an early flight the next day. We arrived late but had a good shower, rest and the staff were very nice and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful Experience from day one on arrival! Clean room designed beautifully and up to date. Ideal location to beach and shopping and tour pickup!!! Excellent bed!!!! Will stay again on return! Great cafe downstairs at the Hiking cafe!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights while in Waikiki. Checked in to hotel and the view from our room was the side of a building, not the city/mountain view I thought I booked. Called front desk but they stated they were full and we could not be moved. Room was very dated and tired looking. Carpets were worn and needed a paint job. Pool area was decent and not crowded. Wifi was spotty and could not get service from balcony of room. I was disappointed in this hotel, but they have no resort fees. I had hoped better for a Hilton property. Would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved our stay at this hotel. The room was lovely. The breakfast was delicious and their cookies are to die for. All the staff are so friendly and helpful. Its closed to the beach and the main shopping area. The bus stop was convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I do not recommend this hotel if you have options. The room we stayed in on the sevetnh floow was very small and dated. The carpets were not the cleanest. The bathroom did not have a counter, only a pedestal sink which made it difficult to use. The shower took 8 minutes for the water to heat up and the design of the door shower caused it to flood the bathroom floor every time it was used. The upsides were the signature Double Tree cookies and Hilton beds/pillows.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was a little weary to be so far away from the epicenter of Waikiki for this trip, but being just a little outside of the middle was a blessing. We stayed in the Penthouse Suite and had a view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The room had the benefit of a lanai and balcony. Early mornings taking in the tropical air and scenery was a highlight of this trip. The service was top notch. We dropped off our bags before check-in. I also loved that the front desk checked in with me via text, before my arrival and allowed me to check out via text. This saved some time. There were plenty of restaurants in the area and the crowded part of Waikiki was within easy walking distance. My only minor complaints were that there was a small part of the bathroom that didn't get cleaned before we arrived. The weekdays were really quiet on our floor; however, on Friday night, the guest across the hall were really loud in the hallway, right in front of our door. My advice to anyone going to Waikiki is to upgrade to the Penthouse suite here and stay out of the fray from the resort hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is walking distance to the beach, but not overlooking the beach. I stayed on the 5 th floor and had the benefit of large veranda, furnished with two chairs and small table. Very handy for chilling out with the drink.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here on a combination business and pleasure trip. The room was clean and appeared recently remodeled with updated furnishings. However the update did not consider requirements for plenty of electrical outlets for today's electronic filled life. I take a star off for the bathroom, which was clean and updated but.... the toilet was so close to the wall one has to almost sit sideways. And, no, we are not huge people. The toilet paper holder was an updated design that made the roll fall off at least half dozen times per seating. Very frustrating to have to constantly chase after the roll under the circumstances. The shower was probably a 10" step up - awkward for me but I can imagine a greater challenge for the elderly. The worst part of the bathroom experience was the 1.5" cockroach that stared me down as I sat there. Near panic ensued during the heat of battle as a wounded cockroach charged me at full speed as I sat. Awful. The good news is it only happened once. There is a small, simple exercise room with dumbbells and a few machines. There is a token pool, large enough for kids to splash around in. Parking was $35/day with in and out privilege. Valet was usually fast and attentive though there were some exceptions. Room had small refrigerator and coffee maker. Maid service was ok, but didn't seem to have their mind in their work when refilling used coffee and tea and replacing towels. The location provided limited access and use to the nearby Hilton Hawaii Village, 10 minutes walk, where I usually stay. The real bright spot was the front desk. Chilled flavored water and fruits available. Front desk staff was super pleasant and service oriented, always smiling and always helpful, full of aloha spirit. Front desk here is industry best. Hiking cafe in the building was ok, but expensive and slow. I am not a fan of chains but a Starbucks there would be nice. Overall, this is a clean, updated, well run establishment, very comfortable stay, great front desk, with some room for minor improvement.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel many times for the past few years and have not reviewed it until this point. The hotel is situated on the western edge of the Waikiki area, down the street from Hilton Hawaiian Resort complex. I have always stayed here on business and it is a favorite for many of my colleagues.First, I would like to say that every time I have stayed at the hotel, the staff has been top notch. They are always friendly and willing to assist. Nice job. The hotel itself is old and probably could use some updating in areas. The rooms are a good size and the layout is good. Your views are not the greatest, but the higher up you go, the better things are if you are on the south side. I have had the privilege to stay in on of the suites and it is very spacious. Also, the air-conditioning seemed to have a hard time keeping my room at the set temp, so, you may want to set it a bit lower than you really want to get that desired temperature.Second, it being in Waikiki, it is a very busy area. Thus, hearing sirens multiple times of the day is the norm. If you are a light sleeper then, you may want to reconsider another location. Third selecting your rooms. If you are a Hilton Honors member, they do have dedicated Hilton Honors areas on the upper floors. Having stayed on higher floors, I have a tendency now to stay in the mid-range area because I found the higher up you go, the more stops you make on the way up and down. As I mentioned, getting a room on the south side, gives you partial oceanview. The north side of the building, allows you to see the apartment building next door along with a city view. Conveniences. WiFi is free for Hilton Honors members, I believe silver and above. This is where I think DT could use some improvement. The servers don't seem very strong and are spotty depending on the time of day. Whatever you do, don't expect to get WiFi on the balcony. I was never able to get it. The gym is pretty decent. Breakfast is pricey, but, this is Hawaii, so I guess that's to be expected. The spread could be a little bigger. They are currently going through a renovation of the normal breakfast/bar area, so perhaps we will see a change. The pool...eh, nothing really big here. I always look for a hot tub, but, not here.Local area. Cheeseburger Waikiki is right next door if you want a quick bite without going too far. One of my favorite places to go is the Grand Harue around the corner. It serves Thai food and is never crowded, and the food is really good. This has been a bit lengthy, so I apologize for the dissertation. The bottom line is you're not in the heart of all activity, but everything is still within walking distance. You will enjoy the stay here. It's not the Ritz, but, it is still a nice hotel and the staff makes it well worth it. I would also say that the cookies are phenomenal, so if you stay, make sure you get one every day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been staying here for work and this has been the very best ever. It is quiet, peaceful yet so close to anything you want in Honolulu. It is steps from the beach and action yet away enough that you are not bothered. The service and staff are the best ever, always there to help or offer any advice or tip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is a very nice and clean hotel. Staff were very friendly and hotel is well located near Waikiki. Ala Moana Shopping center is in walking distance and there are many restaurants near by the hotel. Mahalo.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you stay for business like I do at Double Tree then it basically is the same comfortable, and quiet stay. It was my Grandmother's 84th birthday so she stayed here with me as she was treated to the trip. Ladies at checkin sent cookies and a card to the room. Added a fridge no issues, room was comfortable and hotel breakfast was on point. Special Thanks to Michelle and all the ladies at check in for all the aloha they shared with us on our stay! Fyi parking is valet and you need to pay daily. There is a pool and it may not be beach front but its close to what you want and need without all the crazy traffic and chaos of Honolulu's tourist traffic and busy Waikiki/Ala Moana night life.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hawaii, especially Honolulu is an expensive road trip. This hotel gives good value and location still lets me enjoy having to "work" in Honolulu. I brought my wife and daughter this trip they have plenty to do with out the car.
user_name:
Jerery B
Orange Park, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Solid hotel in convenient location. Staff were friendly and efficient. Room and amenities were also clean and spacious. Our room had a pretty partial ocean view across the park. Would recommend for business stays.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Double Tree is very nice for the business traveler. Everyone is friendly. From the gentlemen that worked down stairs to provide valet parking to the very nice people in the breakfast area. Every employee is very friendly and willing to help with any question or request. I have stayed at this hotel several times per year over the past 7 years and I have to say that I receive excellent service and it is simply a nice place to stay when traveling to Honolulu on business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Service is so awesome! They have the Best Customer Service!!Rooms are clean. Location so perfect because you can walk to Ala Moana Mall and Waikiki Beach and Waikiki shops and Restaurants. Waikiki Shops and Restaurants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Third time to Oahu...first time at the Doubletree. I required adjoining rooms which resulted in several phone calls prior to arrival to secure the reservation. The two rooms were perfect. The facility is under construction for remodeling. We opted for breakfast which was consistent and good. Security was terrific. Location was ideal being a few blocks from the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Honolulu Double Tree as part of a traveling group of EF students. I was an adult chaperone. I noticed that other groups use this hotel, so if that is something you want to avoid, be aware. Unlike other group hotels though, this one kept our group breakfast around back in a conference area, and kids were not milling about causing noise etc. One of the reasons for that, is that the location of this hotel is excellent. Right outside the door is an excellent hamburger wikiki place with $5.00 pina colada and mai tais happy hour every day. They also have a craft brewery next store, Honolulu brewing company, so beer lovers be aware. You can walk a few blocks to reach the beaches and shopping galore. Across the street is a beautiful park with loads of tropical blooming trees and plants, many with labels. The staff was kind enough to hold our luggage at check in and check out as we had differing flight requirements than check in/out. My room , 711, was cool, comfortable, had a balcony view, ironing board, hair dryer and in room safe. Free wifi and nice outdoor pool and gym. I would return in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We just returned from our week-long stay at the Double Tree. We are a family of 4 with 2 teenage children...I miss it already. The hotel, staff, and service was awesome!! The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The location was totally perfect-its not a luxury resort, but we were looking for a place to stay to get out and see the island, not to stay in the room or the hotel. The location is close enough to walk to Waikiki, but far enough out where you don't have to battle the traffic from the big hotels (a definite plus during the 4th of July week!!) For the price, it could not be beat-very affordable!STAFF: The service was WONDERFUL! The staff was very accommodating and gracious. At one point I couldn't figure out how to manage the wifi on my phone, and they offered to send up a Technician to help me with my screwup...I thought that was really great! They offered dining options that are close by-their restaurant was being revamped during our stay... (the Hiking Cafe right outside the front doors was wonderful, as was the Aloha Kitchen, located right behind the hotel). Warm cookies, fruity water & apples were always waiting for us upon return from our travels. They also have a concierge that is ready & willing to help you with making plans for your trip (at a discount, I might add). The valets were so wonderful, speedy & helpful. Eric was especially kind-greeted us by name & had our car within a minute each time we needed it.ROOMS: Room was very clean and comfortable. We had a small lanai with a partial ocean view. Our room was cleaned promptly every day & had plenty of storage, as well as a microwave and a mini refrigerator. It was perfect for us as we typically left pretty early in the morning and returned later in the evening.LOCATION: Our daughter attends UH, so we have stayed in several places in Waikiki. The Double Tree location was great b/c you are walking distance to Waikiki, but you can get out of it fairly easily as well....the traffic on heavy weekends can be crazy getting out from the "strip" of resorts-we appreciated being slightly outside of that mess. You can easily walk to the lagoon, Waikiki, the Beachwalk, or any other options that you would like to get to. We walked to Duke's in about 20 minutes, the Hilton Hawaiian Village is diagonally across the street. It was perfect for us!!Overall, we had an exceptional experience at the Double Tree. Would totally stay there again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has a good staff and good cookies. It is only two blocks from Waikiki beach but that makes a difference. If you can, stay at the Hilton Hawaiian. The government price is about the same but big difference. The extra two blocks puts you in a mildly seedier part of town. The rooms are fine but the elevators are really slow and the lobby is not much. It is a good hotel but not great. If you are with your family, I would pay the extra money and get on the beach in a nicer property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was impressed by the service from valet to check in/out process and room cleanliness. I slept very well as the area is in a much quieter side of Waikiki. For its category, I think it's a very good option.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Upon check in, greeted with a great staff and cookies. Can't go wrong with that. I stayed on the 18th floor, facing across the street to a large mural painting of whales. Room is really nice. The only thing I didn't like too much was that the shower leaked water at one specific spot but it would be a lot of water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a very nice hotel close to the beach in Waikiki. Its smaller than the other Hilton on the beach and cheaper, but provides I find a more quiet, personal stay that I prefer. The Hiking Waikiki Cafe is great - try the bowls and smoothies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The property is located in close proximity to a sister property where the pools are much nicer for the kids. It is also in a more quiet location in Waikiki and in walking distance to the Ala Moana Center and to eateries close by without "Waikiki pricing". Although the hotel is "older" in appearance, the rooms are nice and clean. Microwaves would be a good addition to the rooms in the future. However, overall for the price, this hotel is great value and does not charge a daily resort fee.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff was wonderful,personable and helpful. Perfect location, but not right in the middle of the chaos. I was here for work but would come back and stay here for a vacation. Rooms were spacious, very clean and well furnished. Bathroom was super nice.
user_name:
wvumu
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great place, location was 1 block from Pearl Harbor tour pick up. Nice pool, family friendly and yummy cookies. The staff was now and courteous . If you stay on a frid take a walk across the street by the Hilton, great fireworks display at sunset in Friday nights
user_name:
Cassie P
DREXEL HILL, PA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: very sad looking hotel very much in need of major upgrade Location is nice, that's about it Breakfast facilities were horrible, appreciate they are doing some renovations but staff is unattentative, food is below average at best

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel for business travel. Real grocery store only 10 minute walk away. Brewpub next door. Parking is good. Easy to drive to downtown for business. Relatively small hotel and not as packed as heart of Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff are very friendly and will go out of there way to ensure that they meet or exceed your expectations. The only thing that caught me off guard is that I was unaware that the restaurant was under renovation which means you have to go to one of two bedrooms on the 19th floor and order from a menu. Then they phone the order in and you wait until it comes up to you. It is not that big of a problem but I am use to the awesome atmosphere sitting in the restaurant enjoying a couple drinks while talking to Earl at the bar. Now you feel like you are in someone's bedroom eating the food.
user_name:
II M
Virginia Beach, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, convenient to the beach, Waikiki and Ala Moana. Positioned away from Ala Moana so the rooms are fairly quiet. No resort fee! Only caution: restaurant is undergoing renovations. Food on-site is available, but limited.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I would suggest getting the updated room to best enjoy this hotel. It is not close to the beach. It has no beach access. You can walk thru their sister Hilton hotel to a small lagoon type beach Hilton built but that's it. Rooms are modern. Free wifi. $30 resort fee per day plus $35 parking per day. Diamond head can be seen next to the high rises next door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really loved my stay at the Doubletree. Very strategically located and a short walk to the Ala Moana Mall and many restaurants on the main drag. The folks here are very friendly and helpful to suggestions on sightseeing and great eats.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stay at Doubletree as often as possible. The cookies really are a prime incentive to return because they are so tasty and consistent no matter what Doubletree location. Beds are always comfortable and the tv control is responsive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Arrived on the early flight from New Zealand and so got to hotel at 9.30am (ish). Staff were happy to look after our bags for us and said the room wasn't ready yet. Sometimes we've been lucky and the room has been available, but this time we had to wait and were told to come back at 3pm. My partner came back at 2 to see if it was ready and no still not ready, so he was happy to wait in the lobby. The male receptionist said he would come and get him when it was ready and due to his disability, they'd have a room more suitable. Front desk was busy checking a lot of people in, so no one came to get him, so at 3pm he went back and hey presto the room was just ready. The female receptionist gave us free internet for our time there (12 days) to make up for the fact that we weren't getting a more suitable room. Oh well the free internet made up for it.During our stay at 8.30am we were often asked by the cleaner if they could clean our room, so it pays to put the sign on the door to come back later. Although we did this once and they never came back. When we returned at 4pm and rang to ask why the room hadn't been cleaned, they said it was because we had the sign on our door, but it had been removed at 10.30 when we went out. We asked if they could clean it while we went out for dinner so it wasn't a problem, but there should be better ways of checking off the rooms as to whether they have been serviced or not.  There was a high step into the shower, and although there was a hand rail, it was not that easy for my partner to get in and out. And once wet, the tiled floors were quite slippery especially for him who has trouble walking. Shower pressure is very rain shower like, quite low pressure, and sometimes the temperature fluctuated. There was a lack of amenities that are common in most hotels, I had to ask for a shower cap, and had to go to reception to pick it up. Lighting also wasn't the best, there is no main light in the room. So the double tree brand seems like it is HIlton's budget brand. The fridge in the room was small but empty, so a quick trip round the corner to the ABC shop for cold drinks, water, beer, wine to fill it up was really handy. It was nice also to sit out on the lanai/balcony, not much privacy and not the greatest of views, but nice to relax with a beer/wine.Bed and pillows were nice and comfy and we had no other issues with housekeeping, they did a great job, other than that small hiccup on one of the days, but it was put right very quickly. Location was good, turn right and a short walk up the road, past the traffic lights were bus stop and trolley stop. Or turn left and go to the Waikiki Cheese burger then head up the street for about 12 minutes and you're in Waikiki central. So a very handy location indeed. Lifts were sometimes quite a while to wait, so make sure you get on and off at LL. Would I stay here again, possibly but maybe I'd try somewhere closer to the beach, but then again, it was nice that the hotel wasn't so busy. It's a $5 bus ride for 2 to Ala Moana shopping centre, and a $10 - 12 return trip in a taxi if you can't be bothered waiting for the bus/trolley, so location was as I say pretty handy and not expensive in a taxi.Out of 10 I'd rate it a 7 for this type of hotel, there's better out there, but then again it's pretty good for what it has to offer and for Hawaiian prices not too bad, and no rip off resort fee was welcome.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Besides the renovations taking place, we had a good stay. Our room was clean, we asked for a microwave at checkin and it was delivered quickly. Great location to some really great restaurants. Friendly and helpful staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed here for two nights on Hilton Honors points. We had a spacious suite on an upper floor with a view of the ocean. Room was very clean but the couch and chair were a touch worn. Rebecca at the front desk was amazing. She got us into our room early, was very personable and gave some good recommendations. Valet staff was also very good. Pleasant stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Booked with Alana Waikiki Hilton expecting the quality service & accommodations, that we had experienced on MANY occasions on the past. The room we were given had problems with the shower & electrical outlet in the bathroom (didn't work). The front desk/reservation insisted on charging us the standard $28 parking fee to my son's room, although he did not have a vehicle. We were refused a request for bottled water & cookies by a woman at the front desk. Only 2 out of the four elevators were in operation. The ATM machine was out of order during our entire stay ( this made it very frustrating, when trying to obtain cash to leave gratuity for housekeeping & valets. All in all we found the staff either unaccommodating or unresponsive. We have decided to NEVER stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was disappointed because my boyfriend and I, along with two of our friends made a group booking to book a king room for both couples, and I did not get a king room, we got stuck with a queen, My boyfriend and I were on a completely different floor level to our friends which we wanted to be next to them hence why we made our booking together, I was disappointed that, the sheets on the bed were dirty with what was human poo stains, after the first night, the same sheets were re applied to the same bed after asking for them to be changed. It wasn't until I had to remove them my self and through them outside the door that new ones were applied. It took 3 days for this to happen, I asked for new ones straight away. I was disappointed that when speaking to staff members about this. I was not offered any compensation. The internet was terrible it would continually drop out

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Don't park at the hotel! They will charge you for every little thing! It should be called the nickel and dime you hotel! My stay ended horribly where I had to prove that I did t park my vehicle in valet!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great accommodations, location, and decent pricing. I stayed here for 1 day and it was a very good experience. A lot of clothing stores and food places are in walking distance. There's around the clock service even during after hours.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Looking at a map, I thought for sure we would have to walk and walk and walk to get to the beach, but I was wrong. A short stroll to the corner, and you are looking at the Hilton Village Resort, Alana's big sister, which welcomes you on its property to enjoy the amenities there. The shopping is fantastic, the pools looked so inviting, and there is access to the lagoon - a lovely place for families to picnic and swim without threat of ocean waves and the crowd of surfers and their boards. The beach is there, and it goes on forever, where a paved walkway offers easy walking and biking. On the north end of Waikiki, where the action is at a slower pace, It is ideal for families. The Alana Doubletree is shadowed by this larger resort Hilton, but still, it has its appeal. The rooms are decent, the staff very helpful and polite, and the location perfect to an array of restaurants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: So booked our room through Expedia 3 months prior to our trip. At check in turns out they don't have the room we had booked available. We had booked a large suite, they gave us a smaller suite and another room for the first night. We get to the second room after dinner, it's not even cleaned, towels on the floor, tv is on. Managements first response is to tell us the room is dirty because of us. We are now being forced to change rooms the second night. Terrible experience, stay away

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had activities at the Hilton and at the convention center and this hotel is right in the middle so very convenient to walk to both. Of course, the cookies are always good ;) The parking guys, bell hops, are very very nice! We did have a message on our machine telling us to go to the concierge for a welcome packet and I asked for it and it was a sheet of paper with a list of items so that wasn't worth the stop. Also, those prices were higher than you can get on expedia's website and they are representing expedia so I didn't understand that very much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had recently stayed at this hotel because of my 10 year class reunion. It's a bit on the pricey side. I would of thought they would have had more to offer with those prices. but it was still a good experience. The room was very clean and very comfy beds and pillows. Wish i got to taste those cookies that i read about. I guess another time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel staff were exceptional, very professional and polite. The room was lovely, although may of the fixtures were in desperate need of dusting. It would have been great if more towels were left my housekeeping. Also ice machines were only available on the even numbered floors. I was on an odd numbered floor and had to take the stairs or elevator for ice! Very inconvenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Was a clean room a few blocks away from the beach construction was going g on in the hotel that I was not made aware of friendly staff valet parking only need a sign to let you know that there is a charge

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel isn't the best for the price that is offered. if your looking to spend a whole lot of money with no amenities offered to you other than a free cookie and water this is the best hotel for you. If your looking for more like complimentary breakfast, room space etc. for the price this may not be the best for you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: While the room was clean, the TV was located in a sitting room, and not viewable from the bedroom area. There was space above the chest of drawers, but no tv??? Even discount motel chains have a tv in the bedroom. I would stay elsewhere given a choice again. Overpriced for the location, and room quality
user_name:
Alan S
Oak Dale, Il, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I loveDoubletree Waikiki. I've stayed here few times before. Love the privacy in this little hotel. Makes me feel at home, it's super cozy! Staff is friendly and easiest and fastest check in I've had so far. Warm choc chip cookies just topped it all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Right off the main road, walking distance to shops and restaurants (Hilton Hawaiian Village across street) and nice staff. Along with other hotels in the area, this one also has a parking fee of $34/day. Breakfast is $15 but the place right next door is very good and has a breakfast for $5.99! One thing to consider is there is no on-site self laundry on site.Also will note that the small pool is only in sunlight in the mornings and afternoon until about 1:30.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If I had a choice, I would not stay at this hotel on the island. It is inconvenient and not at all memorable. It's too far from the beach. No real beach views that I know of. No hotel activities. It has a neighborhood feel in an island setting, with no charm.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good Waikiki location if you're up for a ten minute walk to the beach. Usually has rooms for less than Hilton Hawaiian Village. The property is a little tired by Hilton standards, and we did have a couple problems with the room that required attention. The front desk staff, especially Michelle, was extremely responsive and helpful, even sending an update text while we were off on an outing. Everyone we talked to repeated the "We want to make it right" mantra and acted like they meant it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed for a week vacation with my husband. The hotel has the typical amenities for the brand and was clean and comfortable. There was lots of noise outside during the night that woke me up several times. This might have been less so on the higher floors. Bar and restaurant doesn't open until 5 pm. Hotel location is a couple of blocks from the beach and the main shopping district which was quite convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: At Doubletree, it's not just a hotel, there are also many things to keep you occupied if you don't feel like leaving the hotel or that it's too hot. The service is quite good and the meals served here taste superb. Would come again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at the Hilton doubletree Alana while visiting Oahu. The staff was excellent, they were very friendly when we checked in and happy to answer any questions and even offered us some delicious cookies! The room was awesome, it was super clean and had its own balcony that overlooked the city. The room was super modern and updated and had a very comfortable bed which was a plus after a long day of sun and surf. I highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good but modest hotel. The bar here does not open until 5 PM so find yourself other places for a quick drink upon arrival. More like a corporate workers hotel than a vacation hotel. Staff though makes up for all building shortcomings as they are more than friendly and helpful. Location is okay so a slight walk to beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great people working at a great property. Definitely would stay again. I enjoyed great nights of sleep while I was there and the desk personnel were attentive and friendly. Would love to bring the wife wit me during my next business trip out there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel with close access to the beach. Room was clean and updated. Customer service was outstanding. Access to and from the hotel was easy but does have valet parking only (normal for most hotels on Waikiki). Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Booked a city view unit and checked in on the Hilton Honors app-chose a 9th floor room but upon check in they were able to upgrade me! To a one bedroom suite. The front desk staff was so sweet and constantly checked in with me via text throughout my stay. We didnt want housekeeping service but when I asked for towels via text, someone came up to my room to deliver them within literally 2 minutes. I work at the front desk of a different hotel and I was so impressed with their speed here! Our room was right next to the elevator but I was so shocked at how quiet the room was the entire stay. The front office manager checked us out because we checked out at 11:00am (busy time), he was so sweet and offered us more cookies. Thank you for such a great stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Hotel is a great hotel for all travelers. The hotel is at a convenient location and only a block from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has a lot to offer as well. The front staff is very accommodating and takes care of all guests. My second time here and will stay again. Valet service is one of the best in Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for a week with my husband and daughter, the stay was wonderful. Our room was always clean. The staff was always helpful and polite, not to mention they always had a smile. We had a room on one of the top floors so we did have a nice view of the mountains. The location is perfect with the beach, Ala Moana Mall, and Convention Center all within a 10-15 min walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great prices for a 'close to the Waikiki' area. I've stayed at many hotels in the area, and you can't beat Double Tree for service, quality, and cleanliness. Government rates usually mean cheap hotels - but not here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel carries the Hilton name but when it come to cleanliness it's far from the standards. I'm finding that to be the case more and more with Hilton brand properties. I travel often all over the world, and I was in this property after a trip to Japan, and left early because the hotel was awful. Try Holiday Inn over this place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for business in April 27. I like staying here for business trips as the staff is very courteous and accommodating. I had to reschedule my meeting at the last minute and the manager was very accommodating with allowing me to switch dates without charge. Prior to my trip the hotel sent me a text to let them know if I needed anything. The hotel restaurant is small and the food is limited, but it's a great place to have a one on one dinner meeting. The restaurant is also open early for breakfast. The only drawback is that parking is valet only and, at $35 per night, a little steep,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location was great, about a 10 min walk to the beach once the traffic crossings are accounted for. Prior to booking here I had read a number of complaints about the noise, yes there was noise however can now say it would be the same anywhere in Waikiki. This wasn't really an issue anyway as we were out all day and so worn out by the time we retuned to our room we didn't notice and conked out! Diners and 7/11s all within a few mins walking distance. Room for improvement would be the room service cleaning. We were missed entirely one day and just about missed for a 2nd consecutive day in a row until I bought it to the hotels attention very late into the second day. We did not use the Do Not Disturb sign at all so it was annoying that this would happen. Frustrating as I really look forward to the simple pleasures of having a nice clean refreshed room to return to, let alone we expect it given we pay for this. Rooms are dated for a Hilton. Desk staff were friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a reasonable hotel, located conveniently in downtown Honolulu, not far from Waikiki Beach. It's proximity to the cruise port makes it perfect for cruise layovers, either before or after. Typical Doubletree amenities include the famous cookies, bottled water, a nice pool, a small fitness center, great wi-fi and a good breakfastThis hotel is right on Ala Moana Blvd and is good for downtown business stays. You can get to anywhere down with a short rideRoom are nice, a little dated, but very clean and comfortable with nice bedding. Depending on which side you stay on, there can be a view, but mostly it's downtown, with no sweeping ocean or mountain views.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean and close to beach. Great breakfast. Air conditioner wasn't that good. Staff was helpful. The activities person provided assistance with all reservations for fun activities. Enjoyed the view from my room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were visiting to celebrate my parents wedding anniversary, and from the moment I spoke to Becky in reservations she made me feel welcome and at ease. Rebecca at the front desk made checking in and out seamless. Our stay was wonderful, the location was close to everything, even walking distance. We will be back to stay! Thank you team Double Tree Hilton Alana!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a wonderful experience at the DoubleTree by Hilton Alana Waikiki Hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful with questions about sightseeing and places to eat. We may not have had all the super amenities like the super fancy hotels, but cleanliness and great customer service was important to us. And the room rate was very good for our budget. We recommend staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had two stays in Honolulu before we went to the big island and afterwards. One was at the embassy suites and the other here. Such opposites! The DoubleTree is on a very busy street and has a busy urban feel to it from the second you are dropped of. There is an immediate awareness of wear on everything. Yes it has the Hilton brand polish to it but it has been polished so many years that the brass look is gone as they have polished through it. The elevators groan and creak, the carpeting is becoming thread bare, the paint on the wall corners had been rubbed through, the sofa cushions are tired after so many years of hosting guests. There is a smell of tiredness to it; not to the point of mustiness but you know it is around the corner.Sleeping was another matter altogether as it is very, very loud! The windows aren't very effective at blocking the sound, the doors to the hallway are as thin as the partiers were loud. Shower was okay but once again the shower head was getting up in age with poorer performance. Hilton, you need to but this old mare to pasture. Let someone else but this property and rename it as the "Grandest of Grand Hotels" or "Ambassador Suites" where everyone knows it is an old and tired property put out to rest. Alternatively a top to bottom renovation with proper sound insulating, carpeting, paint, elevator refurb, etc. Finally, the staff were very friendly, attentive, and overall excellent. You can only polish a nut so long until you polish through its shell.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I received a welcome text from the staff and they accommodated my needs beyond measure. I would recommend this hotel because the staff went the extra mile for me. I have stayed at over 25 Double Tree properties in my time of travel and this was the first that offered this level of customer service.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check-in: Because of not being given an extended check-out at our prior hotel, we arrived just before noon after we walked down Kuhio plus a few more blocks to the hotel. The lady at the front desk was so very welcoming and friendly. I explained my dietary issues and she made sure our complimentary breakfast that we receive for our Diamond status was sufficient. This was a great touch. Our 16th floor room wasn’t ready yet so we checked our luggage downstairs with the valet and took another mile hike to a great little local, Chinese restaurant called the Maple Garden, which had a great lunch buffet where we were the only non-locals but welcomed and invited back on our next visit. We had not received a phone call to let us know our room was ready so we walked over to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and hung out with the ducks for a while and then returned to the Doubletree. Our room was still not ready at 2 pm, but a different, but still very welcoming and friendly lady, said she would take care of us and 15 minutes later, the room was ready. One bright spot about 2 arrivals was that we received 4 of the delicious cookies-2 from each lady. Our room was a suite. It was nice to have a large room after the Hilton Garden Inn’s small European-like compact space. The king sized bed was just the right firmness and had good pillows. The bathroom had a tub with hand held device also, which is always a great thing to have. Bathroom had sink and toilet and plenty of room so not cramped. The suite provided a large area with sink, microwave, fridge, and safe. Large closet for hanging clothes, as well as drawers in TV stand for less formal clothing, storage, etc. Large screen tv with many channels. Great extended balcony with view towards inland so could see golf course directly ahead with park off to right and mountains in distance. Could see fireworks’ reflection in condo next door but not directly from our room. Room next to elevator bank but never heard elevator. It could be noisy at times with sirens (mostly ambulances) below, but we had no trouble when we were trying to sleep. Bed on far side of room from elevator so no issue with noise while sleeping. Ice machine 10-15 feet away on other side of elevator doors.Breakfast was great (much better in most ways than that at HGI). Omelets and eggs were made to order along with other choices like scrambled eggs, meats, waffles, and more, if desired. I had egg white omelets each day. They made sure we were taken care of as Diamond members. One thing missing was peanut butter for toast. They had several types of breads, fresh fruit, and several choices for juice (the pineapple was from the Dole can so added sugar?). Service was efficient and done as teamwork. The coffee was strong Hawaiian type and was better here than that at the HGI. In conclusion, since we stayed at two Hilton brand properties on this Hawaiian vacation, I am comparing the two as I write my reviews. Overall, the Doubletree won out between the two. We felt cramped at the HGI plus the staff wasn’t as welcoming and friendly but more robotic. The room comparison was a definite winner for the Doubletree. Location has its pluses and minuses for each, but we like to stay part time on each end of Waikiki so that worked out as last time when we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Holiday Inn, both of which have resort fees unlike each of these where we stayed this time although I have read that the Holiday Inn now has them but waives them for status which I have! The Doubletree will probably be our first choice on our next visit for the Ala Moana end of Waikiki. It was convenient to the great restaurants at the Ilikai, close enough for an easy walk to the Ala Moana mall with Long’s Drugs (part of CVS chain) for the best priced souvenirs, and access to the Hilton Hawaiian Village to visit and enjoy without paying their high resort fees! So besides the missing peanut butter at breakfast, I have no complaint with the Doubletree. WE WILL RETURN!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was an excellent hotel and the staff were exceptionally friendly. They made me feel at home and did not rush when I asked a question. The hotel experience was great, with great beds (perfect mattress) and towels that were not of a postage stamp size. The towels were soft and smelled clean. Though I did not eat there during this trip, I was there the week before and had their breakfast. The food was great. I love staying at this hotel and I love the people that work there, from the front desk people, to the housekeepers, to the maintenance people you see in the halls at times. They all great you and are very friendly. Great hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First of all the front desk and the valet team are exceptional. Really appreciated their support and service. The Breakfast staff is chaotic. We used points and $ for the room,but $34 for parking. Free breakfast for Diamond member, but an up charge for a fried egg or omelet. We stayed twice in the last week, first for four days and second for one night. Our first room the air conditioner would not follow the thermostat. They made it right by waiving the parking fee. Second night was a great room no issues.
user_name:
Ell T
Lakeland, Florida, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed a total of four days at this hotel. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the staff superb. My only negative comment is the fact a person has to step up to get into the shower. I can see that being an issue for some guests. LOVE the warm cookies you get at the front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at the DoubleTree Alana three times so far, and have always been happy with it. I will be staying again December of 2017. I just like this place. It's not too big and fancy, but it's welcoming and the location is great. We loved the suite we had on our last trip and requested the same room for our next trip. Great staff, great breakfast and just an overall great experience. I have only good things to say.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived at the Honolulu airport around 1:30 on a Thursday from Las Vegas and took a taxi to the hotel. The cost was about $40.00. The hotel is about 35 minutes from the airport in moderate traffic. Upon arrival to the hotel the bell desk is downstairs and they were waiting to assist. We were only in Waikiki for 3 days and we had booked the Paradise Cove Luau for that evening so we had to hurry up and get changed to go meet the bus to transport us there. The front desk lady was very nice and helpful. As we were honors members she asked if we wanted extra points or if we wanted continental breakfast. We selected the breakfast and had that each morning. It was well worth it! I asked where the Ileki hotel was as that was where we were to meet the bus for the luau and for the two other tours we booked. She said it was about an 8 minute walk from the hotel. We went to our room and changed from our flight clothes into more comfortable shorts and we were off. We started walking from the hotel and reached the corner where we saw the huge Hilton Waikiki Village hotel right on the water. Keep in mind that this Doubletree hotel is not on the water and you will have to walk to reach the water. Also know that even though it is not on the water they are a great hotel and there are way fewer people than at the other hotels on the water. This is a benefit as far as I am concerned. The rooms are also very nice at this hotel. The maid staff was fantastic and there wasn't anything to complain about. We walked to the Ileki hotel each day to the three flag poles where our tours departed from. You could also pick up the pink line which is the trolley at this location as well. It was convenient to most Waikiki activities/tours. Next to the hotel are two restaurants and we ate at the cheeseburger one, the burgers were good. The brewing company next door was very lively and we stopped for a beer one night. There are a lot of little 7-eleven touristy stores around that area for souvenir shopping as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for one night. It was great. We ordered breakfast and it was decent. Love that check out is at noon. The room was really nice and clean. The price was a bit more than what we think it was worth, but it was still a great time!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a frequent traveler and customer of Hilton - I have Diamond status and usually stay at Doubletrees, Hamptons, Garden Inns, and Home2 properties.This particular Doubletree is not up to normal standards. It is outdated, musty-smelling (not just the rooms but even the business office smells like damp socks), and dark. Carpet is old and stained.I usually rely on 24-hour coffee in the lobby - this trip particularly since I had CST meetings as early as 2am Hawaii time. There is coffee in the restaurant starting at 6am and the lobby at 10am. Not acceptableBreakfast was weak, only cold items were included as complimentary (no eggs, meat, potatoes). Upgrade to hot items was $8. The first I've ever had this situation at a Doubletree. I skipped and went elsewhere for breakfast.Pool was good and the fitness center was also nice. Location was good, walking distance to the beach and plenty of restaurants. We did not utilize the parking services.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
