review_body: I have now stayed at this hotel twice for business. The hotel location is convenient, the staff and service is good, and the rooms are clean and decent. The bed is comfortable and the size of the room is ok if traveling with 1-2 people but would be crowded if traveling with more. The hotel is within walking distance (a few blocks) to the Beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I would recommend this hotel to anyone that I knew that would be visiting the Waikiki Hi area. I will be returning to this area for business multiple times and plan on staying at this hotel each time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel in a decent part of town. My big complaint is the wifi signal. It's awful on the upper floors. Staff couldn't help fix the problem. They gave me a 1-800 AT&T number to call but it was of no help since it was a signal strength issue. Please update your hardware guys!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I thought this hotel was situated in a great area, close to the mall, the beach, shopping, restaurants and just a few minutes from everything in downtown Waikiki, and was reasonably priced considering all this. Not sure how most travelers get around, but seemed like having a car was unusual or something.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was the 2nd stay at the Doubletree Alana and was made to feel at home once again. From Check in with Mayra too, getting a bite to eat recommendations from the concierge Ken, to the smell of cookies in the lobby. Pool was great and everyone I talked to had been enjoying their stay. I will return again . .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just spent three weeks at this hotel and enjoyed every minute! Location is perfect with the beach, Ala Moana Mall, and Convention Center all within a 10-15 min walk. Everybody on the staff was helpful and very friendly and made sure our stay was pleasant. Only recommendation is to request a room on the upper floors 12-18 for better views.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Furnishings in room were 'newer', but one could tell that the rooms have seen better times. Beds were comfy enough. safe was provided in the room, which was nice. Gym was adequate with decent workout facilities. BF was not too bad....with a selection of pastries, fruit, yoghurt and oatmeal/porridge. However, the staff at the restaurant need to be more service oriented. I did not feel welcomed, - seems they were more keen in letting you know that the price of breakfast was $16/- and an additional $8/- to be tagged on for the 'hot' breakfast option. Turns out, my membership level with Hilton Honors did provide for a free continental breakfast, - which the greeting staff made sure to verify with the front desk (you'd have thought they would have this down), then waved me to a table. 2nd day I went there, they didn't even ask if I wanted tea / coffee......waited patiently till I almost finished, then I had to help myself. 4-5 waiting staff just walked back and forth, chatted......totally ignored me. Hmmm !!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've had a problem with this property in the past but the Director of Rooms, C.Y., went above and beyond to make it right on may past stay in March and my most recent stay a few days ago and then some. He provided me with excellent customer service and made sure his staff did as well I will definitely stay here again the the future! Love this hotel!
user_name:
Dawn D
Newport Beach, California, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel to Hawaii about once every 3 months for business and have stayed at a few of the other Hilton properties (which have all been great), but the Doubletree Alana stands above the rest. The rooms are modern and clean, the facilities and amenities are exceptional, but the best part is the service from the staff. The front desk agent Megan, Reservation agent Kristi, and the entire valet staff are the best I've encountered at any hotel. I highly recommend this property for business or leisure.
user_name:
J2125UNmariob
Long Beach CA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: While not on the beach, it does offer quick access to nearby beach. Within walking distance to most tourist locations or a taxi ride away. Clean hotel, good service, and local foods offered. Very helpful staff with deciding where and when to visit other areas.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Comfortable well appointed rooms in this slightly dated small hotel with dining room open for breakfast and dinner only. Good not on the beach location within walking distance of the beach and shopping areas as well as bus routes There are many eateries nearby. The only drawback is the heavy traffic noise caused by the surrounding roads.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my wife's and my fourth visit to Honolulu together. Hendrik was able to upgrade us to a wonderful corner room with a partial ocean view and a private balcony. My wife and I enjoyed our stay in Hawaii even more because of having such a great room! Even though this hotel is not directly on the beach (better value), it is only a block from the Hawaiian Village, and you can walk there and enjoy all of the shopping and dining options. It is also a short walk to the central Waikiki shopping and dining center. Very nice gym, great concierge service, and a really good breakfast. Walk two blocks to the Aloha Kitchen for the Wagyu Loco Moco, our favorite in town! We will stay here again our next time in Honolulu for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my fourth time in Honolulu, but first at the DoubleTree Alana. I recommended this hotel to my colleagues and plan to stay during my next trip to the area. The staff were friendly, polite, and extremely helpful. I felt so welcomed and cared for during my entire stay from all staff (from front desk, housekeeping, valet service, and even the Expedia trip consultant posted in the hotel lobby). The rooms were really clean - I work in public health, and used to do hotel inspections for a local health dept. I've developed some neuroses around cleanliness, but had no concerns here! The amenities in the room (like toiletries) were underwhelming, but I brought and used my own. I did not eat at the hotel's restaurant, and cannot comment on other amenities like the pool or workout room. The cost was higher than I expected to pay, but the service and location made it absolutely worth it.
user_name:
Alexandra B
Washington DC, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff was always helpful. Even with recommendations for food in the area. Staff sent me texts before and during my stay. The room was always clean. Bed was always made and I never ran out of anything. I had no issues while staying there. The valet was always on top of getting your car for you or to go park it. They helped me load and unload my luggage.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel offers excellent accommodations in a great location. Close to everything but street was quiet. Could walk through and take advantage of offerings at larger Hilton resort property a couple of blocks away. Good restaurants and sites were close by. Hotel restaurant offered excellent breakfast. Continental breakfast was comped as we are Hilton Honors Gold Members.
user_name:
sasin
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Decent room on 12th floor. Small bathroom. Glass shower door creeks loudly when open as if glass is going to break. Served it's purpose for our pre cruise stop. Poor housekeeping. Didn't change out dirty glasses and didn't sweep bathroom floor. I could tell as piece of plastic was still on bath floor when we came back from being out. Good bell hop service and quick check in at front desk. Good breakfast restaurant, "Trees". Convenient location to area stores and tour bus pickup point. A few restaurants are within walking distance. Beach is several blocks away. Expensive for what it offers, but the location is why.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Alana is a nice hotel in a good location. It's within walking distance to shopping, dining and the beach. The staff is friendly and helpful. If you plan to take any tours, stop by and talk to the concierge. Doug was able to setup our entire week and we had a blast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Consistently excellent with accommodating the needs of their guests. Doubletree is quickly becoming our favorite place to stay. Aside from the warm cookies, we particularly like the location and the room was awesome! The staff was great :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel staff is great. I have been staying here off and on for the past 5 years when I come to Honolulu for business. It has a good workout facility and pool. I find all of Waikiki within walking distance. The rooms are nice but if you get one with an ocean view it is great. Everyone at the hotel is friendly and takes care of you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed our long stay. Housekeeping was especially understanding when I was under the weather and had to stay back at hotel one day - left chocolates and flowers by my bedside when I felt yucky and that made my day (though family ate the chocolate instead of me) - valet guys were super helpful and we used the enterprise car share which was great to have a rental car to use -drove around the whole island (car was conveniently in the hotel parking garage). Loved the cookies of course, and breakfast was nice in the morning - omelette station and eggs made to order were the best part of it - other breakfast waitstaff brought coffee while the food was self-serve buffet style. Choice of fruits, pastries, and juices at breakfast. Overall we had a pleasant stay and enjoyed the 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach and location close to Ala Moana Mall and Sam's club/walmart for some forgotten items. Thanks for the hospitality. Mahalo Doubletree!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff, Service, Location, Mai Tai's by Earl. This place is awesome for the business traveler and darn good for a relaxing vacation too. Highly recommend the location, just a very short walk to the beach and shopping.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed 4 days in this hotel in mid March 2017. The room was beautiful with partial ocean view which was great. The staff was helpful and courteous. We especially liked the valet staff. VERY ACCOMMODATING.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I want to shoutout to Helmut the Front Desk Mgr for saving me from losing my ID on way to airport. I forgot to checkout of hospitality room (great offer to clean up after checkout but before departure!), and left my drivers license behind. On way to airport by taxi he called to alert me before I got to airport and would have most likely missed my flight back to Mainland.Check out Doubletree Alana when needing a quick, reasonable Hilton property near Waikiki,Mahalo

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree provided quick access to the conference I was attending and all that the Waikiki area had to offer. The hotel food was excellent and the staff members were amiable. The internet was not as reliable as I would've liked but it sufficed for the short time that I was there. The fitness room was adequate though the pull up bar could not be used because the ceiling was too low. The temperature in the room was constantly below the setting despite trying to fix the problem multiple times. The room was very clean and the hotel overall was well kept.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Definite value for the money. There are a lot of good restaurants nearby. Never had to walk to far to some good food. Staff very friendly. Would definitely stay again. Cons: You have to pay for WIFI if you are not a Hiltons Honors member (sign up, its free) or an ATT customer (can use your own ATT login). I just don't believe anyone should be charging for WIFI.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice, clean hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. Valet service is efficient. The beds were very comfortable. Little difficulty adjusting the water temperature and pressure of shower. There are a lot of places to eat close by. Warm chocolate chip cookies are delicious

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Seems like a poorly run motel not a hilton owned property. Was old and in need of renovations. it was dirty and smelly and I had a view of the where homeless people lived. The staff was rude and insisted multiple times that my room pkg did not include breakfast when it did. Then said they didn't know because I was the first to use this pkg.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel as a whole, the location and the friendly staff. The ONLY downfall I can think of was the warm humid hallways and the location of the AC in my room. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a great staycation with one of my besties! So relaxing and fun to get away. The hotel is close to everything, easy car access. Super great place to relax and tune everything out. Wailana Coffee Hose is a block away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for my 2nd time the 4th week of February and I am happy to report that nothing has changed from my first visit last year. Hendrik was very accommodating again on making sure I had the right room to suit my needs and Myra was very accommodating and efficient as well on my Check Out Process. The Valets downstairs as well ROCK! The whole TEAM ROCKS! Folks, when visiting Waikiki this is the place you want to stay as they make sure you are One Happy Camper! Thank You again Hilton Alana Double Tree!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed 2 nights. My room was cool and clean. Sheets were nice and crisp. Staff were awesome in answering questions and giving directions. Check-in and check-out were efficient and easy. Short walk to the beach and main shopping area. Close to restaurants and yacht marina.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: While attending a conference in Hawaii, we stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton. The rooms were nice, clean, and decent sized. However, during the week we were there, the hotel had to shut off the water for an entire day when we were told it would be out for a few hours in the afternoon. There was also a fire alarm pulled in the middle of the night. Maybe it was just by happenstance these two events occurred within a few days of each other, but it left a bad taste in my mouth about the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Centrally located in Waikiki but on main route into area for emergency vehicles. Be prepared for lots of sirens throughout night. Easy access to Ala Moana and Hawaiian Village area. Location means you may have to circle a block to get to the hotel depending on direction of approach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent our first night in Oahu here, getting in late and hanging out at Waikiki before moving to our house for the next couple weeks. This hotel is good but the rooms are tired for the price. Location is great, easy in and out, and the kids loved the pool area.Suggest an update or fix of some furnishings but that would be it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is in good location and hotel rooms are a decent size (although bathrooms are very small). However lack of proper maintenance, cooling issues with the AC, and safety and security concerns resulted in a disappointing stay. A room was left unlocked with the door propped open by housekeeping putting personal safety and security of belongings at risk. After this issue was reported to front desk, staff refused to report issue to manager and the issue was never resolved or rectified.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For the value you can find another hotel with better standards. Don't bother with the breakfast. Food was cold and staff is not friendly. When you have an issue the staff doesn't address the issue. Overall just go to another hotel. I typically always use Hilton and this property is just below the standard I typically receive at their properties.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights in March. The room was small and I don't think it had any ducted outside air, and so it had a stuffy sort of smell. The room did have a lanai so I was able to have fresh air via the sliding glass door. Sort of glad was a short stay. Hawaii is way too nice to pinch pennies on this place. My advise stay somewhere else. Try Ilikai.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome hotel and awesome staff! The hotel and staff were both very accommodating. Very clean and very pleasant atmosphere as well! If I return to Honolulu this will absolutely be my hotel of choice!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: DoubleTree's Front Desk staff were very friendly and made me assured me that I made the right correct decision to stay at their hotel. All my interaction and service from Ms. Claire, Ms. Elsa, Ms. Michelle, Ms. Meagan, and Ms. Leslie were very professional and polite to all the guests. They took the time to ensure my stay was a great experience though I was there on business it felt like a vacation. I am grateful for the desk staff, the bar tender (Earl), the valet team, and house keeping for making my stay a memorable experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First off, I had a room that I booked with points that had an amazing view and patio. Great view of beach, city. The breakfasts were good, typical high standard for Doubletree. Valet parking was pricy, but par for course of Honolulu. Great room for our stay. Let's not forget those cookies which are amazing. Huge fan of Doubletree brand, this doesn't disappoint.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for the second time from Feb 14 to Feb 20. During the week we had contact with various departments-engineering, security, housekeeping,and front desk. Everyone was friendly and professional. The hotel was very clean. The only observation I would make is that there is very little space for toiletries in the bathroom, and yet we survived. The location is a good compromise for walking to various areas such as the beach, Ala Moana Centre, and the downtown. This hotel is in our price range and we would definitely stay again in the future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my first stay at the Double Tree. The hotel was clean but showed it's age. The staff were friendly and responsive. There were several different high school groups - not sure if that's the norm. I could hear them in the hallway and at the pool but they weren't disruptive. You are a short walked to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and world famous Waikiki Beach. It was a business trip so Beach access wasn't a priority. Valet parking only but they were very prompt and parked onsite. Nice location with several quality restaurants within reasonable walking distance from the Cheese Burger for casual dining to the Chart House for upscale dining.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good, reasonably priced hotel within easy walk of Waikiki Beach and Hilton Hawaiian Village. Good neighborhood. "Hidden" but accessible grocery store (Food Pantry) within 10 minute walk. CheeseBurger restaurant next door is fun.
user_name:
Andrew W
San Rafel, CA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is a quick walk to the beach and the rooms are nice. It would be nice if there was a hot tub but no big deal. Suggestion is don't rent a car parking is 35$ a night. We took a shuttle which was only $15 one way and there is a local bus that will take you everywhere for only $2.50

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Its always great to go back to a hotel where you are remembered from the last stay. Front Desk staff is very friendly and makes you feel welcomed. Service from Ms. Claire, Ms. Elsa, Ms. Michelle, Ms. Meagan, and Ms. Marya (pronounce Maiya) was great. They take the time to ensure your stay is a great experience. I found out from this last stay that you can learn other languages from the front desk staff. Ms. Claire speaks Korean (learned a few phrases from the last stay), Ms. Elsa speaks Fillipino (Tagalog), Ms. Marya speaks Japanese. Overall, all the services (parking valet, front desk, house keeping, restaurant) was outstanding.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, convenient, good location. Hilton Honors can check in digital and pick room. Overall highly recommend! Affordable as well :). Valet is a little pricey so be ready to pay, but also very convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was comfortable and modern. The staff, including maids, desk staff, parking attendants and bar staff were all friendly and helpful. Bartender Earl made me some awesome drinks and Loco Moco and Steak Frites I ordered during my stay was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Doubletree Hotel is conveniently located and is in easy walking distance to the beaches and shopping. A great fast food diner is next door and a café is one block away. Hotel provides very good accommodations and very good meeting space for small groups. Good choice .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Front desk staff was extremely helpful especially the manager, believe his last name was Werner. They had a group checking out late and gave us the option of checking in now or waiting an hour and getting vouchers for the restaurant. Wasn't in a hurry so took the vouchers. Restaurant was great, and manager brought our room keys right to us once everything was ready.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall ok we had stayed at Hilton Village 5 days before so of course didn't have the things they had. Only things is the Elevators are small and take forever when you call them also Internet is slow. Rooms are nice I love the bathroom in teh 1 bedroom Suite.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel well maintained, but rooms are pretty small. Smoke free with no smoking area established. Decent views of mountains/ocean from top level floors. Located between both malls so access to shopping is good and relatively close to beach. Decent restaurant options close by. Do not order the fried fish, it was horrid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first stay at this property in Waikiki having stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on several occasions and a number of other properties. Access is more convenient than the Village with the same proximity to all the same restaurants and attractions. Check in/out was efficient, with a gracious front desk host each time. We received warm chocolate chip cookies at check in, not a feature at some other properties. The parking is valet only, but that being said most properties seem to be headed that way in Waikiki. Besides it offsets the cost of the parking by not having to lug your bags through a garage in tropical weather. The valets were very fast and friendly, and with a smaller hotel = you in your car much quicker! Our room was on the 11th floor at the end of the hall, which was very quiet. The room itself was clean, updated and had a coffee/tea station, safe ($) and a hairdryer. The bathroom behind a pocket door, featured a step up shower and a sit down vanity with light up mirror, featuring Crabtree & Evelyn bath products. There were plenty of hangers, which is my pet peeve in most hotels, but not here!! Also an iron and board. Our room featured a mini fridge and flat screen tv. There were ample usable plugs that were easily accessible and a docking station for older iPhone models. The desk and desk chair where good shape and size. Also in our room was an oversized convertible chair (opening to a single bed) and ottoman. The king bed was comfortable and had good quality pillows. The housekeeping was very friendly and accommodated us with clean towels daily, as we forgo room cleaning to every few days being that we use the room as an office on certain days.My husband had the breakfast buffet once which he said was okay, but you're so close to many other better choices if you walk a little bit. All in all we would book here again and be quite content.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed on points, room rate a little high for location/condition of room. Room environmental control not working in first room, shower head broken in 2nd room. Both rooms clean, staff excellent. both rooms next to elevator, different floors, heard elevator in first, sounded like the elev. counterweight in the 2nd.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What an excellent hotel. Close to beach and everything else in Wakiki. Easy valet parking.You can walk to everywhere sore , resteraunt. Also it's an easy drive to the freeway and to other parts of the island.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our stay. Pool and location were excellent. Hospitality was not thorough but, when reported, would respond quickly. GREAT beach only a five minute walk. Excellent restaurants nearby. We'll be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice off the beach hotel. Quit but convenient. Rooms were very nice. Breakfast was good. Rooms have doom view on water side. Walking distance to beach, shopping, and restaurants. Great friendly staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Would not recommend nor stay there again The best part was its proximity to the Hilton Waikiki Village, it was also walking distance to the convention center. The pool area was small and not "inviting". the gym was adequate but nothing special,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here many times thru 2016 and jan 2017 while on business. The valet staff, front desk, always greet me with a smiling face and a "Welcome Back Mr I". Hotel Manager, Hendricks, personally greets me when he sees me. David, Claire, Rebecca, at the front desk, all know me by name and go out of their way to make sure I am well taken care of, the cookies are always warm !!!. I like the way they keep in contact by text message the week before, during, and even after my stay, to make sure all my needs and requests are met and taken care of. Being a rewards member they always do their best to accommodate upgrade requests when available. The property is in a good location close enough to Waikiki but away from the crowds and noise of Kalakawa st. Close enough to the beach to catch some sun after a long work day. Earl and Alana run a very clean and friendly lounge, Great Pupus, beer, Maitai's I look forward to the Poke' and happy hour after working a long day.The rooms are well designed, always clean and well kept. the only drawbacks the pool looses sun after 13:00 parking fees went up after Jan 1. Other than that, as a business traveler to Oahu on a limited Per Diem, this is the best bang for the buck.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff, conveniently located property. This was my third stay at this property, and I will keep coming back. Small pool and fitness room, but neither are usually crowded, so easy to enjoy. Concierge has provided great trip recommendations every visit

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I expected a hotel associate with the Elton name to be turnkey and ready to go. Choosing the room on line with a "ocean view" was not a representative. If you still doubt on what felt like a shaky balcony on tiptoe you could see the ocean off in the distance. The air conditioning was set

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful hotel, helpful staff, and only a few blocks to a beach. Earl the bartender makes a wonderful Mai Tai and the calamari was superb! Easy walk to numerous restaurants and the convention center, and close to trolley and bus stops if you want to venture further.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The only thing I was disappointed in was our room was next to the elevators which you could hear go up and down till late in theevening. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. The bedswere very comfortable. Everything was very accessible from thislocation

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Returned to the DoubleTree for our 10 year anniversary. David at the desk was great in helping out with our room. Room was spacious with a great ocean view. Walking distance to Waikiki beach. Great place to stay. All the employees that I came in contact with were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my first time staying at the Doubletree Alana and it won't be my last. The staff was very accommodating. The room we had was on the 11th floor with a great view of the city. Elsa at the front desk was great. I recommend this place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staying here was a pleasure and I would stay here again. With all that the staff do to make you comfortable and welcome I would stay here for a vacation. Use of the Hilton beach resort is a bonus and walking to shops and restaurants makes the location great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We've stayed there about 4 times over the years (primarily on business) and have it to always be pleasant. Staff is wonderful and the entire building is clean and nice. The tubs in the standard rooms really suck however if you can stay in one of the penthouse suites (like we were able to on two occasions) with it's jetted tub, wow!!! just wow!!!. The terraces off the PH (front facing DeRussy, left side PH, can't remember room #) was stunning, larger than the room even!!!!!! Restaurants are all around as is Ala Moana Mall and the beaches convenient. Some street noise but hey, this is in the heart of Waikiki. Valet is super fast and super friendly. All in all, it's a great hotel and will always be our first choice when we go to Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is great and relatively easy to find. It is within walking distance of several restaurants, an ABC store (convenience store on island), and the beach. The restaurant/bar inside is staffed by great folks and has some simple, solid dishes. My room was pleasant and clean. Overall, a great place; I plan on staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Convenient. Everything is walking distance. On this stay, the room is too small for me though. I do love room 1421 but I didn't get it this time because I needed two beds. I'd stay again. I have a lot of memories on this hotel for the past decade. I love it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel on business, and had a very nice experience. While it was not one of the mega-hotels with lots of shopping and right on the beach, it was a very short walk to that area. It was only a few blocks to the beach, and a short walk to the main shopping and dining area. The hotel itself had a good feel. The staff was very friendly. The room was adequate. Furniture was getting a little outdated but it was still fine. The room had a balcony which was a nice touch. Fitness center was in good shape and had plenty of available equipment. There was an outdoor pool, but no hot tub, which was the one disappointment.
user_name:
Tracy Z
Westford, Vermont, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really amazing hotel that has surpassed my expectations in every way!!! My sister booked this hotel for us, attending a conference and was too slow to book the Hilton Village which i was initially sad about. However, the Doubletree actually turned out to be a much better, clearly superior choice! We had a really smooth check in last night after awful 7 hour flight during which my niece barfed on me... staff were amazing esp the the lady at the front desk who was so nice and personable, also the bellman who brought our luggage. A Plus service all the way. I was super happy with my room! Everything is modern, updated, extremely clean and smells nice. Very efficient air conditioning. The toiletries provided smell lovely- from Crabtree and Evelyn. Very nice bedding and beds are amazing and comfy. There is a mini fridge to keep drinks cool and great location, 7-11 and ABC stores down the street. Wifi is reliable and speedy. If you sign up for HIlton Honors club, the wifi is free! The pool is quite large and very nice. Shaded in later day which is great. Pool area is immaculate and there are super nice chairs on the deck area to hang out and relax. The other really good thing is the resturant - we got a package that included breakfast, and this is the best deal ever! They have loads of hot food selections- eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereal and milk, yougart, fresh fruits, even an omlet station! The ham was amazing and so tender... honestly some of the best ham I have ever had at a hotel! Everyone who works at this hotel is great. Full of good suggestions on things to do and see. Housekeeping does a really good job. Super efficient and thorough.I enjoy the attention paid to being environmentally friendly at this hotel. Location is AMAZING. 15 min walk to Ala Moana Mall if you are into shopping.Also quick walk to the HIlton Village down the street. You can use the lagoon if you are staying at this Hilton, however not the pools. Which is fine, cause the pools I did see were absolutely chock-full of screaming children and was terrifying rather than relaxing. The area is very busy and safe. Most of the people staying at the Doubletree look like business travellers or international tourists. Pretty quiet, not a huge number of children. We do have young children in our group and everyone has been super nice. I honestly cannot think of any downsides to this hotel other than a bit of a walk to the beach (if you have very poor mobility then better to stay right on the beach), or if you care about a view - this one consists mostly of other concrete buildings.Overall this is an awesome hotel and I would come back here in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's hard finding an affordable long-term stay in the Waikiki area...especially during the holidays. If you're looking at this hotel, it's in the lower range but that also means that the suites are cheaper. We got a spacious suite upgrade to the penthouse facing mauka. It had a coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge.Because of its location, the DoubleTree never gives you a breathtaking view of the ocean. There are buildings around it and it's a few blocks from the beach. The best you can do is a partial ocean view or face mauka. The location isn't too bad...closer to a lot more local haunts than the higher dollar touristy ones. Your Hhonors status will get you a decent buffet breakfast with fresh fruit, an omelet station, pastries, oatmeal and even congee.
user_name:
InternationalPursuit
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Took me awhile to right but the Doubletree Alana is a wonderful Hotel for any type of traveler. I really didn't care for the location but its near two main rds in Waikiki, beach just 10 min walk, Front Desk staff was kind, housekeeping to standard, I didn't have a car so cant say much about that. One great feature is the Concierge that's Expedia. I had Ken help me out with things to do in the area and everything he told me meet my needs and budget most things in Waikiki are overpriced. I was worried till Ken pointed out some Local Expert knowledge. . I have already been telling my friends and family to stay at the DoubleTree where the smell of Cookies and Friendly Staff made me fell at home. . Thank you again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome personal attention, very nice, clean and big rooms, great location close to Waikiki beach. Internet speed very good and easy to establish a connection, it has coffee maker and fridge, maybe the only missing appliance is a microwave.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 4 nights. Staff very friendly and efficient. Rooms are quite nice and clean. Had the sense that this is an older building, but is fully updated and comfortable. It is not a luxury hotel, but is also not mediocre.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree by Hilton Hotel Alana Waikiki is located on the northern end of the main drag in Waikiki, Kalakaua Avenue. It’s located about two blocks from Duke Kahanamoku Beach, which is behind the Hilton Hawaiian Village resort. The average Doubletree Waikiki hotel room is relatively small, especially compared to a room at the Hawaiian Village. They feature less attractive views of the surrounding area. The rooms were relatively recently updated, which can especially be seen in the bathrooms; my bath had a large-head shower elevated from the floor by a step, and a shelf for cosmetics and bathroom accessories opposite a sink and a toilet. The lighted vanity mirror provided too little illumination to be of much use. The bed was comfortable, up to mid-range Hilton standards, and the entire room was clean and showed little wear. The room also featured a settee, a desk, a bureau, a small refrigerator, and a safe.Wi-fi was slow and nearly useless. Hotel management needs to address that as a priority. The television had the usual cable channels, including an HBO offering. The channels also included Asian-language selections. One may also avail oneself of pay-per-view movies.The hotel has a convenient restaurant on the lobby level (which is on the second floor, per U.S. standards). There is the usual overpriced $18 buffet at breakfast. One block away is the Wailana Coffee House, which is open 24/7 and provides a Hawaiian take on an IHOP-level-of-quality and price. (If you insist on IHOP, there’s one right next to the Wailana Coffee House.) The rooms offer coffee machines that are clearly little used; much more convenient and better tasting would have been Keurig machines. You’ll have to walk a block-and-a-half to get to a Starbucks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village; three blocks away, northbound on Kalakaua, is a Hawaiian Coffee Experience Center. The hotel is adjacent to the Waikiki Brewing Company--a nice outdoors place to watch a sports game and drink a decent beer. You are a couple of blocks north from the start of shopping on Kalakaua.There’s no self-parking. For about $35 dollars a day you will have to use valet-only parking.Like many visitors to Hawaii, you may just want a place to sleep that isn’t far from the beaches and the shopping. This hotel, then, may work for you. But if you want to be steps from the beach and close to shopping--and don’t mind paying the additional resort fees--then choose one of the beach hotels.
user_name:
dc888traveller
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a smaller hotel located in Waikiki. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and go out of there way to make sure you have a great stay. Great views of the beautiful sunset from my lanai. Oh did I say no resort fee!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall it's a good hotel, with nice clean rooms, comfortable beds, great pool area and wonderful staff. the manager Hendrik is warm & friendly and really makes an effort for guests to make the stay as comfort as possible. If you want to be close to the beach and Waikiki strip but away from the crowds and hustle bustle, and don't mind the extra walk, this is perfectly located. Unfortunately I've had no choice but to reduce my rating because of a huge error thanks to Ken at the tours desk who, in essence ruined our holiday. Initially we booked all our tours through hoku and she was excellent, professional and through. Unfortunately on Xmas day, it was ken at the desk, and aside from giving really bad advice about driving around the island, he lost our booking for a 7 seater hire car! we had set aside the day to drive around the island and he put our booking on hold without finalising it!! I went to see him 2 times to be assured the booking was there, only to find on the day That we had nothing! it was a Tuesday so we couldn't go to Hanauma Bay and it was too late to book anything else. We managed to book a 5 seater on our last day, but it was too rushed as we had to combine it with Hanauma Bay and couldn't drive out as long. What was worse is that one of our kids had to stay back, splitting the family up. We have been so upset abt this...it ruined our trip..don't understand how he could be so disorganised and careless. Whatever you do not let Ken book anything for you!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I saw on my credit card some duplicate charges and called the hotel accounting department. The employee who answered my phone was very rude and talked extremely fast and loud over me whenever I intended to ask a question.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location was awesome. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When I had an accident with a glass bottle dropping on the floor. The front end manager Eric came to the room and he was very helpful by vacuuming up the glass and replaced the tea. Thank you so much.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: THe hotel staff is excellent! Very helpful. It was clean and convenient.This was probably my 5 or 6th stay there. Ask for the hotel special on the taxi fare.. a good deal. The food in the small dining room was tasty and not pricey! I would recommend it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you're looking for a cheapish place to stay in Waikiki and don't need to be near the beach and can find a good rate, this is worth a look. I ended up getting an ADA-compliant room and it was pretty dreary and the bed was much too soft, but it was OK. Lobby is much too small so it's crowded and staff seems overworked. Parking is valet only and expensive. It's clean, which mattered, but I was hoping for less depressing decor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during new years eve 2016-2017 and it completely saved my trip, as I was coming from another hotel not far here that was a total disaster. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They not only let us do an early check-in as after hearing our frustrated story with the other hotel, but gave us an upgrade to a suite! The room was fantastic, big, clean, bed and pillows very comfortable, nice suite, nice shower. The gym is ok and the pool is very small. Vallet parking is $32 per day, I believe internet is paid but they gave us complimentary internet and there's a restaurant in the lobby. Service is very slow and maybe slightly pricy, but in general, I would highly recommend that you stay at this hotel. Very worth for the price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room we chose with the package tour was no longer available and was given DoubleTree by HIlton - Waikiki. I was hesitant, but I was glad we stayed at Double Tree. Check in went smoothly and our room was better than we expected with partial ocean view and lanai I couldn't ask for more. The hotel met our needs, being about a 10 minute walk back down to Waikiki beach along Kalakaua best thing. Mahalo for everything!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, convenient, fast valet car retrieval. Don't ever stop offering the cookies! It is a big consideration for me and my family when we travel. Beds are comfortable. Iron is good but would like something that is smoother like the brands seen on QVC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this location with my family. Great location, close to shopping and beaches. Very good value for money. Breakfast was a little disappointing. Very few options and the service was not that good either. Coffee was not hot enough and we asked for a glass of water which never arrived.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a frequent Hawaii visitor, I've stayed at many of the Waikiki hotels, so when selecting the Doubletree I was looking for great value, and a property mid way between the Ala Moana Centre and downtown Waikiki itself. The hotel met these needs, being about a 10 minute walk back down to Waikiki beach along Kalakaua, and about the same to the shopping centre via Ala Moana Blvd. The Hilton Hawaiian village is just 5 minutes away.Upon arrival at 12.30pm we were delighted to find our room for 9 nights available, although I wasn't afforded my usual Hilton Honors gold benefits (as I had booked via Agoda), so ended up in the standard room on the 7th floor, which stunk of cigarette smoke, so we requested it to be changed and got another standard on the 8th level which was comfortable, spacious, and realively modern in its renovation. Our view was mildly dissappoitimg, overlooking a carpark, but did have a pool view to one side. Our room came with cable tv, no mini bar, some basic toiletries and iron, hairdryer etc. we did get free wifi which was useless and very slow, needing to log back in continually. There was an ice machine on our level also.The hotel has a pool and cafe, and valet car parking, which is a whopping. 35 dollars a day, thankfully there is no resort fee. There are a couple of good choices of restaurants, next door there is Cheeseburger Waikiki is right next door, so is the Waikiki brewing company. Tony Roma's is right across the road and seems popular, and right around the corner is an ABC store, plus 2 x 7-11's, and Long drugs has a big store half way down Kalakaua. The staff were very friendly and overall this property is a reasonable choice for those wanting to stay in a quieter area of Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: 2 day business trip and this hotel couldn't have worked out better. I didn't rent a car, so I can't speak for the parking situation, but it's located on a fairly busy street.Check in went smoothly and my room was bigger than I expected. King size bed with a bathroom set of the entryway. Super large shower with powerful water flow, a desk and small couch with plug ins everywhere. I did not eat at the lobby restaurant, rather went out for my meals. About 2 blocks is the entrance to the Hilton Village, you can charge things to your room at a few places, like the restaurant, however cannot use the facilities (pool, etc.) the beach is gorgeous if you walk the 2 blocks away from the Alana. Just follow the tourist! Water super warm and clean. I bought a towel and book at the ABC store near the hotel and enjoyed the sun for a few hours. You can spot the business peeps a mile away. We all have hotel or Hawaii towels, are alone with a book and about to get sunburned! The Alana does have a small pool located on one of the floors above the lobby, with plenty of chairs to sit and enjoy the warm air, however the hamburger restaurant located nearby will cause you to smell burger cooking, clearly depending on the flow of the wind! And the pool is very small. The rooms have a small fridge and if you walk to the local grocery store about 3 blocks you can buy extra waters or snacks for later. I liked the huge glass water with cucumbers they had out one day and mixed fruit with ice they provided at the reception desk to refill water bottles. Nice touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: You need it - they'll take care of it! The staff, from management down to housecleaning were extremely helpful and very friendly. They are proactive in taking care of your needs. The breakfast was very good and the price similar to every other nice hotel in Waikiki. Parking appears to be challenging but there valet service was always on top of the flow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room and furniture very drab and old. Sink had a hair in it. Constant noise from emergency vehicles thru out every night made it hard to sleep. Employees were very polite and happy. Bartender at night was really good
user_name:
Michael A
Portage, Mi, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We typically would stay at the Hilton Prince Kuhio in Waikiki, which is a much nicer hotel. The DoubleTree is about forty dollars cheaper and a little further from the beach, although still walking distance. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Normal company hotel unavailable so stayed on this property just around the corner. Very nice staff. Great location. Loved the Tom, with walk in shower. Great bed and overall very nice room. Def recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As with a lot of Waikiki hotels of this age, the Double Tree Alana has had a decor and furniture upgrade in the last 10 years, but it is the front entrance and lobby that work needs to be done to maintain parity in this busy market. Notwithstanding the hotel remains comfortable and with reasonable facilities

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed in the Double Tree my first night in HNL. Able to check in online without issue and only had to show up to the front desk to verify identity and stuff. Digital Key was on point. Friendly staff, had no issues at all! Room was clean and put together, no issues there. No issues with loudness or with the elevators being outside of the room

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I used this hotel to extend my business trip a couple of days. It was the only reasonably priced hotel anywhere near Waikiki beach during the 2016 Pearl Harbor Anniversary remembrance week. Stay was good both weekends; uneventful. Loved the new digital key feature that allows you to use your smart phone as the e-key for your room. No more misplacing of the pesky plastic key card!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Was clean and well maintained however didn't have the Hawaiian flair I was looking for. This hotel could have been located anywhere in the country. I wanted a Hawaiian experience. Thee price was $235 a night plus $35 a night to park (valet only). The valets were excellent and got the car quickly and were very nice. There were other hotels nearby (closer to the beach) that were cheaper and nicer. It was about a 10 minute WLK to Waikiki Beach and the nice shops at the Hilton Hawaiian Village.I wouldn't stay here again because of the better choices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is in a good location. The rooms are spacious and clean and offer lanais with nice views. The staff is very friendly and always there to assist with any request you may have. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you choose to stay at this property just go with the mind set that's it's not 5 Star....that is up the road on the beach. The public area's look nice and as per my title for us yes this hotel offered all that.Negatives - the hallway that our room was on the carpet smelled stale as did our room. I opened the doors each morning to allow for some fresh air and sunshine to flow through and repeated the process during our stay each day.Positive - Aside from that, we used the pool - yes it's small but it was cool and refreshing.Negatives - We did eat breakfast I guess the continental on the day of arrival. The food was disappointing and it was humid - the air conditioning did not appear to be working. I really felt sorry for the staff and the next day the same issue. Imagine being a FOH staff member trying to welcome guests and sweating to death - just awful! This was clearly a management issue that should have been rectified and fixed. Not just a duty of care for your staff but also your paying guests.Positives - That said the FOH team were amazing! They really went out of there way to make us feel welcomed and assisted in anyway they could. I found House Keeping staff to be the same, although I had to call a few times to ask for Tea Bags to be put in our room when they did maid service (not sure what that was about, maybe they think everyone drinks coffee) but they were very kind and did a great job cleaning which to me is a very important aspect of my stay.Our first trip to Hawaii so I probably would not stay at this property again only because I would like to see what else is out there in order to conduct a proper comparison of what other hotels are offering but for the price we paid as a 2 to 3 star hotel it was not too bad overall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed at the Alana Doubletree by Hilton and were once again extremely satisfied. The staff are the most friendly and kind that we have experienced! The hotel is in a good location across from the park and within about a 10 minute or less walk to the beach. The room was comfortable and clean and the beds allow one to have a great night's sleep. The staff at breakfast are the best; friendly and efficient, especially Susan! Thank you Susan!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: overall conference room and event coordinators were excellent. Hotel check in agents were horrible. They were uninviting and pretty rude. They seemed almost irritated that our check in did not go as smoothly as they wanted it to go. I had to keep checking with the guest agent if she received the credit card authorization form. The rooms were comfortable. again the food was awesome and super flavorful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: WITH the quality of a HILTON, THIS hotel is perfectly situated. Walking distance to the beach, a 24 HR. coffee shop next door, this place makes for a great stay. As an added bonus, this hotel does not charge a resort fee like most of the others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived via taxi & for whatever reason, the main drive was blocked off by yellow tape. We had to unload curbside. As we were unloading, there were 2 bell hops that saw us unloading but never came down the stairs to give us a hand. During the check in, the gentleman behind the counter could not answer simple questions regarding airport shuttle service or cab service. He did direct us to someone else but the process was painful. He also seemed confused during the check in process. I couldn't get our key cards quick enough. The room was not worth the price paid. The view was great but that was it. The room had a full size bed that was sagging in the middle. The hotel is in a good location but you would be better off spending your money at either another hotel or save some money & stay at an Airbnb.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From pickup to arrival excellent - On entering the hotel we were astonished at the decorative presentation of the hotel.Tge architecture of the place is beautiful,so we knew immediately that we were going to enjoy our short stay.Very "art nouveau " which was a pleasant change from all these latest modern hotels with no character.All together a great experience staying in a hotel withsuch a history,coupled with the way all the staff took time in makingsure we were happy and well served throughout our stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic service. Superior location for all your Honolulu and Waikiki desires. The food was amazing... not a bad thing on the menu. I strongly recommend this property, I have stayed at most of the properties in Waikiki and this is a great one.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came for one night but wish I had more! With lovely scenic views overlooking Waikiki, it was a great hotel for both a comfortable stay as well as access to great activities. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Valet parking - easy, with pleasant attendants. Check-in was a breeze. Room was very nice with great views. Breakfast in the morning was good too. Be warned though. Parking is about $36 a day, and it is probably your only option. They is a nice restaurant & brewery next door called the Waikiki Brewing Company. Also it's about a 5-10 minute walk to Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is very well maintained with inviting lobby once you drop your vehicle off with the valet. Your greeted by a smiling knowledgeable check in staff. Room was very nice and clean with a small balcony that had 2 chairs and a small table; a great place to relax after a day of work. Breakfast was above average; however, I have had better. Everything I ordered from the dinner menu during my 4 night stay was excellent and the wait staff was superb.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: About 1/2 mile from the beach, to me some of the best service I have ever received at a hotel. Yes I'm a Diamond member but I saw how they treated everyone. Valet attendants very helpful in keeping bags there because I got there early and checked in early. Got my cab when needed. Mind you the beaches in Hawaii are not all that big so staying there isn't as cracked up to be. Good location with convenience stores nearby to pick up things that you forgot. Staff is knowledgeable and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a nice hotel. It is in a good area. The food in the restaurant is excellent. The drink prices are very high which leads to not many people using this service. The rooms are nice. Not much of a view for the upgrade price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent location - not in downtown Waikiki Beach crowd! Close to Trollyt buses, large Ala MOna shopping center and hition hotel. Local resturants all rated very good to excellet on facebook and web surveys.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for four nights when my husband was in Honolulu on business. Because the room was paid for by the meeting he attended, I cannot speak to affordability or parking as we didn't have a car. I can say that the front desk staff was friendly, the concierge was very helpful, and our room was quiet and clean. We were on the second floor with only a city view from our lanai, but it was still lovely to sit outside in the morning before the afternoon sun hit. Hey, you're in Hawaii, after all! The (small) lobby offered abundant cold fruit-infused water and the warm Doubletree cookies (by request from the desk). The hotel was a short walk to its beachfront sister property, the Hilton Hawaiian Village, whose pool was far superior to the Doubletree's small mezzanine-level rooftop pool. It was a also very convenient to ABC stores where one could buy inexpensive breakfast or lunch staples as well as alcoholic beverages.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is not really a Doubletree. It must have been purchased from another chain. The parking was rediculous being more than the cost to rent the car. The personnel were the saving grace. Very friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Musty interior, terrible wifi, and the restaurant and parking pricing borders on extortion, compared to the many, better options available on the same block. I won't be staying at this hotel next time - when you spend this much on a hotel night you expect better, no matter the location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check in was flawless and fast. Valet met me on the spot and took care of vehicle. As is the Double Tree tradition I was also presented with a warm and delicious cookie. My room on 12th floor was very convenient, clean, had good water pressure, and a great ac unit. This is what I look for. Looking forward for any possible return.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Love coming to the Doubletree Alana hotel. always a warm welcome from the minute the valet opens my car door to when I get my warm cookie at check in. Comfortable beds, clean hotel, great location at the beginning of Waikiki. Staff always make me feel welcome.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The reception manager was arrrogant, rude and with a bad attitude. Simply because the chip on my credit cad was not working on THEIR machines. I spend almost one week in Honolulu and the card worked everywhere else, except at the hotel. The manager could just enter the card number manually in the system, but he didn't. I explicitly asked him to do it but he said no. I travelled across the world to stay at this hotel and that was not a pleasant reception as one should expect from a Hilton hotel. It was past 11pm and I had no place else to stay, because if it was earlier I would go somewhere else. Instead I felt obliged to go to an ATM machine in the hotel lobby and withdraw more that 1000USD to pay cash in advance. I wonder Why I managed to withdraw money out of the ATM machine and could not pay with the same card in hotel machines... Maybe the reception manager can answer this one... I'm also an SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) member for several years, have accomulated lots of points and I never had this kind of experience. With them, I always feel a valued and cheriched costumer. Although I've stayed at Hilton Hotels several times in different locations (Washington, New Yourk, Paris), I never registered as a HHonors member. This time, I decided to give them a chance. And guess what: It was really disappointing... I dont know about the Hiton standards, but this man is clearly below the minimum required for a front desk manager. He managed to ruin my stay at the hotel. If it was my hotel, he would be fired immediatly. I expect no less from Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We chose to stay here because they had queen beds and nice suite for our family as opposed to the Hilton Village that is close which had double beds. You can use the Hilton Resort properties that are there but we went out and traveled to other beaches and places on the Island. It was fun to be so close to great shopping and restaurants. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent one night at the Double Tree to catch any early flight from Oahu the following day.We were dropped off by a transportation service and upon arrival you have to walk up a handful of steps with your heavy luggage. The valet staff was clearly not interested in helping guest if you didn't drive up in a car. The three men. just watched my husband and I struggle up the steps. The front desk woman was very nice and kind and offered to upgrade our room for $20. Unfortunately the upgraded room on the 5th floor had an odor and we went to the 3rd floor room. The room looked beat with paint chipped off doorways, torn seat cushion on the chair, and wood chips off the bench. The bathroom was very small with no counter space and had this narrow bathroom door.. Outside our room at the end of the hallway was an exit door that was propped open with string and gave us any uneasy feeling of the hotel being secure. The downtown location might be conveinant , but the street noise is annoying. Overall, I felt like this was a tired, old hotel that needs major overhall and cleaning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel location, Beach was a block away mall close by, a good restaurant selection. We would definitely stay here again and recommend family and friends. The hotel staff was friendly. We wanted a microwave and called down to front desk they bought it right away and extra towel and wash clothes. Hotel was quiet we were able to rest and enjoy being in our room at night. Overall experience was very good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed just one night but the first impression of this place was such a pleasant surprise.  We are used to staying at the Hilton but never gave this place a chance until the Hilton Village was sold out. We arrived and it's valet only but the price is half than what it is at larger resorts. The front desk was kind and very helpful. She gave us recommendations for late night restraunts since we arrived at 2300. The entire hotel is modern, clean and gorgeous. The cookies we got at check in were delicious. The hallways smell of vanilla. The room was beautiful. The bathroom was very modern and had a shower instead of a bathtub. I really liked the "no resort fee". It's a great place with amazing service. I am definitely looking forward to staying here again. Mahalo Honolulu Alana Double Tree!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Perfect location and room was clean. Bathroom is a little small but still nice. And there's a mini fridge!! Walking distance to IHOP and other restaurants and convenient stores. Even had a warm cookie given upon arrival.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and the accommodations and location are terrific for travelling on business. The location is convenient to major attractions, shopping and the beach with straight forward access to highways and the airport. The hotel restaurant, Trees offers a quality menu especially for those nights where ...you just have to cool out.The real stars of this property are the staff. Everyone from the reception desk to housekeeping to restaurant staff make every determined effort to guarantee your enjoyable stay. Just a great property and a terrific value. You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After having been "Strongly Suggested" by my Company's Travel Agency to Stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village (a Wonderful Place - BTW) at a rather higher price point (one that I knew my boss would have had a heart attack) I booked myself into DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach - it was Fabulous! Excellent Balcony view of both Mountains AND Ocean - excellent amenities, and a staff that was personable and professional. A great secret - a great price point, and a better experience for a business trip than the huge size and scale of the "Village" - time and convenience for business is important and the DoubleTree had everything that I needed to make it so. Additionally, you gotta meet Earl and his staff at the "Trees Restaurant" there - 10 out of 10 scale for a great experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is located at the beginning of Waikiki which is in walking distance to ALL that you need but yet far enough away from the traffic and congestion. Staff is absolutely AMAZING. Front desk welcomes you with genuine kindness and attention. Valet staff was very aware of your needs and quick. Hotel was clean and rooms were comfortable and quiet despite the outdoor noise. I would definitely give this place more than an EXCELLENT rating on everything if I could.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Only two blocks from the beach, this hotel offers a reasinable price for its location. Would definitely stay here for all business trips while in Waikiki area. Although you must use valet parking, it was easy to get your vehicle whenever you needed it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for one night and the location was fantastic! Rooms were nice, clean, and modern. Only a few minutes walk from the beach and some rooms do have a partial ocean view. Right next to Cheeseburger in Paradise for a good meal. Great stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent hotel! It is in a great location with easy access to everything. The staff was wonderful and very good at their jobs. The food and amenities at this location were top notch. Earl the bartender is a great guy and one of the best I experienced in the island.
user_name:
S5167NCadamm
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am fortunate in that my job causes me to travel to Hawaii twice a year; my colleagues and I always stay at this hotel. It's a great location - close enough to walk to the shops and restaurants but not so close that you are trapped by traffic and crowds. Even better than the location, however, is the service you experience. From the reception desk to the food and beverage staff to the housekeepers, everyone lets you know that they really want you to enjoy your stay. I am already looking forward to my next visit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been meaning to write this review for the longest as I stayed here 1 day shy of 3 weeks from August thru September of this year and all I can say is that they accommodated my every needs. Hendrek and Myra were super and very patient specifically when I wanted to change rooms on account I did not want a connecting room they changed it on the spot! Also since I was a Gold Member I choose the free breakfast and it was all I needed to get my day started. Last, the Valet Employees were super as well and very nice to talk to. If you want a great place to stay that is right in Wakiki with employees who are going to cater to your every needs then this is the place. Thank you again Hendrek and Myra and for your patience with me:)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good for sightseeing . There is good hamburger shop and convenience store near the hotel. The service is normal, but you cannot expect better one. From some rooms, you can see Pacific Ocean,which is far from the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I prefer small boutique hotels or B&Bs but sometimes on business trips this doesn't happen, especially in Honolulu. But, this Double Tree is in an excellent location for the business traveler or someone who doesn't have to be on the beach - it is very close to excellent restaurants, the convention center, Ala Moana Mall, etc and so it is much cheaper and less crowded. And, the beaches of Waikiki are a short walk away if you do want the crowds and sand; I prefer to go to the north shore for beaches and waves.It's not new and some furnishings show their age, but overall it is very well kept and the bed and linens were very comfortable. The fitness room is excellent; didn't try the pool but it is the usual small size - nothing fancy or with a good view. The bar is pretty small and plain (it is also the dining room), but good, relatively cheap drinks, and excellent staff, so 2 thumbs up. We had a dinner event in the hotel's large meeting room - excellent hors d'oeuvres, way too expensive drinks, and a rather minimally decorated room - the ambiance was non-existent. But for most people staying here this is irrelevant; just included this as a business traveler review.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently PCS'd to Hawaii and stayed at the DoubleTree for 74 days. The hotel is in a great location near several restaurants and shops. Here's a breakdown of my experience across the areas:Front Desk Staff and Management: Phenomenal! The staff and management were very professional and courteous throughout my 74 day stay. I had the opportunity to meet almost everyone on the day and night shifts. Elsa, Claire, Marya, Michelle, Jim, Wing as well as many others always greeted us with a smile and those awesome warm cookies! My daughter and I enjoyed the conversations we had after work and school. Everyone definitely made us feel welcome. The staff was also knowledgeable regarding the military and TLA. Valet: The valet staff was awesome! Always very helpful and responsive. Greeted my daughter with a warm hello everyday. They set the tone for the hotel. Can't remember all the names but I do thanks Pedro, Shane and the rest of the crew. Appreciated your assistance moving all the items I accumulated over my stay. Restaurant Staff: Staff was very nice. We enjoyed the breakfast. Great selection of foods. Also had room service several times and the food was timely and good.Check out: The staff was very nice during out checkout. Although we were happy to finally move into our home, we were also sad to leave the wonderful staff that made our initial months on the island pleasant. Housekeeping: The room and hotel were always clean. The housekeeping staff was always pleasant and responsive.Follow up: Claire was nice enough to send a note to check up on my daughter and I after we checked out. I thought that was very thoughtful. Resort Fee: NONE!!!!! No resort fee is charged which is a plus for military members on TLA. Parking: Valet parking is available. The cost is expensive for extended stay. Fortunately, the hotel is conveniently located near the Hale Koa so I purchased a monthly parking pass there. Wifi: As a Hilton Honors Member I had free WiFi.Business Center: Computers available for printing and faxing. Scanning was available at the front desk. Overall, I had a great experience and I would definitely recommend it to my family and friends. Keep up the great work!Mahalo!Letitia Bryant

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Although I have stayed in Waikiki before, I booked this hotel as it was just myself and 16yr old daughter. We had come to chill, eat & shop and that's just what we did. I like to stick with the Hilton brand as you tend to know what you're getting and I feel safe with that. The hotel was in a great location for us, inbetween the shopping centre and main eateries of Waikiki. We didn't hire a car, it was convenient enough to walk either way. I wouldn't class this hotel as an ideal family stay as its not really geared up for young children (need to go to the Hilton Hawaiian Village for that) although it has a good pool. It was all that we needed, clean rooms, bedding, helpful & cheerful staff etc. Not much of an atmosphere but wasn't looking for that and enjoyed the fact there was no banging of doors etc in the early/late hours by children. Had a few drinks in the bar during happy hour before heading off out to dinner, but it was quite a sombre affair. We didn't have breakfast either, although it smelt great, we were on an Acai bowl quest, to test and rate as many as possible in the vicinity! The location is on a busy road, but this didn't affect our stay and we felt safe at night walking back, although make sure you know where you are going beforehand, as with all tourist places, they have their homeless etc. This hotel is good value in comparison to some other hotels in Waikiki and I would probably stay here again. I really enjoyed having coffee in the room and a warm cookie at check in after a ten hour flight!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wow, totally impressed the staff. Simply outstanding and for a new to Hawaii business traveler I've found my go to place on the first trip. Nice breakfast, good food at the bar and service matches the Hotel staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very friendly staff, fast check in and a nice clean room. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip. We were traveling with friends and all enjoyed the stay. Location was great for the activities and shuttle pick ups.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Modern hotel in a central city location: 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, near restaurants, shopping and bus stops. We used public transportation throughout our stay and was ok. Staff was warm,friendly, welcoming, and very helpful. Room was a standard (good) and air conditioning was good. Room 1515 had a great ocean view. We ate all meals as locals do (isn't that what traveling is all about?) and did not eat at the hotel. Great value if you don't mind walking to beach as compared to higher priced hotels that are right on the beach. Pool was great although small (this a city type hotel) so we didn't mind. Free internet for Hilton Honors members and it was good. We are middle of the road travelers and seek good value but do like to stay in nice hotels. This was a good fit!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night on the way back from the mainland. The room was quite okay and the pool area was very welcoming. We had arrived on an early flight and even though our room wasn't ready we were able to use the pool facilities. The rooms are not large but do the job nicely and the bed was comfortable and the rooms clean.On the downside, the Business Centre/ Room does not seem to be air conditioned and it is very hot and uncomfortable to do any work in there.Also generally there's not enough staff on at reception to accommodate guest check in or queries.Overall good standard, but then again it is a Hilton and that is what I would expect from this hotel chain.
