hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was well maintained and easily meets Doubletree expectations. The room was compact (typical for Waikiki), clean, nicely appointed, and the staff was courteous and helpful. The geographical location is the outskirts of Waikiki - it definitely feels grungier and less safe than the main part of Waikiki. The plus side is the hotel does not charge a resort fee (which is atypical for Waikiki) and the main part of Waikiki is close enough to walk to. Overall, I have no complaints about this property. It is definitely a deal if you don't mind being outside of the heart of Waikiki. It is also much more quiet and easier to sleep when you're not right in the center of Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were here at the end of our holiday for a bit of R & R. This is the perfect place. The front desk were courteous and efficient. The breakfast was ample and fresh. Only gripe I would have is that the furniture in the suite was very very threadbare, in bad need of a refurbishment. I had to get extra sheets from housekeeping because the lounge was so grubby. The 2 sided lanai made for a beautiful breeze in the evening. The only glitch in the hotel stay was a power outage for an hour where we couldn't have our pre paid full breakfast and had to walk with 2 children under 8 down 17 flights of stairs. All in all we were happy with our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I checked in with my wife on Sep.11th for our honeymoon there, after moved into the room we found it is not the kingsize room we previously reserved on-line but a double room, so we headed back to the front desk and double check with the staff there and she did have us changed accordingly. We settled down in our room and ready to refresh ourselves after long time flight by taking a shower. Then a guest opened our door and entered in with a luggage case. You can imagine how embarressed we are .Of course, this is not his fault, he were wrongly assigned a room which already we had checked in, that guest were terribly sorry for his rudeness but this however cannot relieve our discomfort caused by this highly expected event......... at one point, I did think this ruined our honeymoon ........but we try our best managed to overcome and put this case behind so as to carry on our trip anyway

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has exceptional service! All staff are courteous, knowledgeable and go out of their way to extend their services to help you. We were able to check in early and given a room with an ocean view. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at this DoubleTree. I cannot wait to come back here. They went above and beyond for absolutely everything. I didn't get to try the restaurant but the pool is nice and clean. There is no spa which was really my only disappointment of my entire stay. The room was very spacious and the separated living room with fold out couch was very well done.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here due to the proximity to the convention center. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted warmly by the front desk staff and checked in promptly. We took our luggage up to the room ourselves and we were given the same room I picked out when I checked in early via that Hilton app. Our room was also quite musty. It was also apparent that it wasn't like the other rooms I saw on the website. The bathroom was very small and cramped. There was little room to keep anything in the bathroom and a very small shelf in the shower for any toiletries. The beds were comfortable. We found the small fridge by accident, but it didn't keep anything cold even though it was turned to the highest setting. What was consistently inconsistent was the housekeeping service. One day the room was cleaned, the next day it wasn't. One day we asked a staff member in the hall that was cleaning another room if she would be able to clean our room that day, and she told us her card didn't work in our door so she wouldn't be able to clean it. We offered to open it for her, and again she stated her card didn't work. We again offered to open it for her and she asked if we wanted her to clean the room right then? We offered to wait in the room, and then she said, no, she could clean the room right away. We went downstairs and waited about 45 minutes until my husband went back upstairs to check her progress and she had just finished. The day after that, our room wasn't cleaned. I fully realize this is a very large hotel and by no means was I expecting housekeeping by a certain time, but I didn't understand the service only every other day. We never put out a door sign refusing service or "do not disturb" if we left for the day. I also want to note that I spoke to several other conference attendees that were staying at other large hotels, and they also had a musty odor in their rooms. I even noticed it in some restaurants while we were there. Many of the hotels, business, etc. don't have A/C throughout the whole building; Doubletree does not have A/C in the hallways. We did not patronize the restaurant; we went to other places close by as we found them less expensive. We also didn't check out the pool or fitness center. We didn't rent a car, but the bell/concierge desk staff were always very pleasant. and the baggage storage between check-out and our cab ride to the airport later that day was excellent. Overall, we had a nice stay at the Doubletree. At check-out, I did discuss the inconsistent housekeeping with the woman at the front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Out of all of the hotels I stayed at during my trip, this was the one I least liked. I had great views of a parking garage and other buildings. Pool looked nice but I did not use. Breakfast buffet was well nice but a little on the expensive side. Overall the property and rooms were clean. Staff were excellent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here many, many times and I will stay at this hotel many more times. Thanks to all the staff or their warm and welcoming spirit and providing a comfortable place to stay while away from home. I do appreciate the staff's attention to detail.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My stay at this hotel was average. While I have no complaints, I was not impressed. The room temperature was either stuffy or freezing cold, no in-between. Furniture was visibly worn and lighting was not great. The gym was nice but small and the restaurant was good. Overall I have to say it was average, not the rating I was looking to give for Hawaii.
user_name:
Ramona H
North Brunswick, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was located close enough to walk to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the beach. Went there for business conference. We walked to Roy's Waikiki and the marina for dinners. Cheeseburger Waikiki was next door. I did not try the fitness center or pool. The staff was very friendly and my room was clean every day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived to this hotel around 12:30pm. We were greeted with warm cookies and bottle waters. We were able to check in early. Our room was great. It came with a microwave and refrigerator. The bathroom had 3 hooks for towels. The shower had good water pressure. The closet was a good size. We enjoyed the city view from the balcony.The location of this hotel is about a 30 mins walk to the Ala Moana Mall, The Don Quijote grocery store is 15 mins walk. Walking to Waikiki area will take 1 hour and 30 mins. or walk to Ala Moana Mall and take the Pink Trolley for a sightseeing tour to the Waikiki area.There was a business center with 2 computers, where we printed out our boarding pass. Since we had an evening flight, our luggage was held in a locked area. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel, not on the beach, but within walking distance. Room was large, but bed was small (felt smaller than a queen). Hotel has one restaurant/bar and no pool. Hotel was also a bit dated. Staff was very attentive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great Stay! Very good Staff. Valet, service desk, housekeeping and restaurant staff were great. My room was wonderful. I even had a small living room! It was a great place to stay for my trip. Thank you
user_name:
Elizabeth C
west chester, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: VERY CLEAN. Shower was excellent for pressure. Our room was very nice, recently remodeled and spacious for a King room. All hotel staff were extremely polite and helpful. Our a/c worked efficiently but the other areas of the hotel were warm and humid. A note about the refrigerators in the room: they only run for 2 hours at a time. It shuts off for electricity conservation so don't expect to keep left over meals in it. There are great restaurants nearby and you can easily walk to the beach. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful when asked about excursions.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Suggest booking direct with hotel instead of through Hilton general booking over phone it was very busy when we were there. Elevator is very fast and service people very nice. They had a excellent breakfast an you could get an omelet made to order. The hotel was about 4 normal blocks from beach

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hilton is my companies preferred hotel chain, so I was booked at this property when in Honolulu for business. Lobby is small and cramped, and always seemed to be full of people waiting to check in (fairly typical in Hawaii due to flights, etc). Front desk staff was very nice, but poorly trained. Everything took a long time. Room was very comfortable, and bath had been recently remodeled. Good AC in the room, poor in the rest of the facility.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was fine. It was clean, the staff was very friendly, and the beds were comfy. I didn't like the layout of my particular room -- not enough mirrors, dresser space, and a very small shower. I reserved it because it was near the Convention Center, which worked out, as it was a short walk over there. I didn't spend much time shopping other area hotels, so I'm not sure the value of this hotel for the cost.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Terrible room HVAC and air quality due to moisture. Expect some mustiness, but this was terrible. Even though I don't have any allergies or hay fever, had to take allergy medication and anti-histamines while in the room. Losing battle in the rooms since the hallways nor the lobby have A/C. Internet access was terrible. Had to login each time a device was used making it very inconvenient. Pool area was clean, but BORING. So much potential to make the hotel nicer, but not being exploited. VERY disappointing for a Double Tree property.
user_name:
Leslie S
Henderson, NV, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I spent the weekend here just to get off my ship. I was upgraded to a penthouse suite and enjoyed my room with a wide open view. Nice room with a refrigerator and a couch. I also had a large spacious balcony. The only this I did not like much was the bed. It was very low to the ground.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The rooms are fine--clean, comfy beds, and nice views. You're near the Convention Center, which is great for business. But it's also an easy walk to Waikiki and enjoy the madness over there. I found the staff friendly overall--but the restaurant and bar can be chaotic at breakfast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed in this hotel several times and have always been satisfied with the facility and the service. Probably not the perfect location for those on a Waikiki Beach vacation but for the business traveler that still want all that Waikiki has to offer it's Ideal.
user_name:
ddavis4040
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: my husband checked in few days before me, he complained about the wifi, the staff was very helpful..they did what they can..but couldn't do anything..but it was very nice of them to give us $50 restaurant credit for the inconvenience.. when i got there 2 days after, the place from the outside looks really nice, the front desk was very helpful..when i got in the room, i wasn't happy..the view was the roof of another building(which basically nothing we can do really) the room was small, it was clean, but for a Hilton hotel, I was a bit dismayed..for the price that we paid for, I wasn't impressed

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Air conditioning in entire hotel has not functioned properly in 2 weeks. They do not bother to tell guests. Hilton should be embarrassed. They have a neat printed sign at checkin. Staff wonderful. Food good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived on Sunday, 28 AUG and departed Friday, 09 AUG. The trip was a combination of business and pleasure. Hilton Properties is the provider of choice for my employer. This was our third stay at this hotel. On arrival, we were told that the AC was down but that they expected it to be up and running in a day or two. Until the AC was back, we were provided a fan to help keep the room cool. Unfortunately, the AC never did get repaired and we used the fan the entire stay. No offer was made to relocate us to another hotel (the Hilton Hawaiian Village is a block away), though there was a big convention/meeting/symposium in town and perhaps there were no other rooms available. Still, the fact that every time I asked, the reply was that they expected to have the AC back up in a day or two. I finally stopped asking!As I indicated, this was our third stay at the Doubletree Alana-Waikiki. The stays were about 1 1/2 to 2 years apart. On the two previous stays, the facility appeared to be well-maintained - no major repairs needed, things kept nice and tidy, etc. This time, however, the facility had an overall 'tired' feel to it. Wall coverings were just a little dingy and a bit frayed here and there, the carpet on our floor was stretched out & wrinkled, woodwork had seen a few too many baggage carts bounced off, the plaster in the room had several cracks in it, the pop-up drain in the bathroom sink didn't work. All-in-all, as I said: Just sort of tired.Now, as Paul Harvey would say, 'the rest of the story: Beyond any shadow of a doubt, the staff was amazing! From front desk to housekeeping (our housekeeper (18th floor)was without a doubt one of the nicest, most outgoing and EFFICIENT I have run across lately...she always had a smile, always talked to my wife, asked if we needed anything, etc...OUTSTANDING), from the restaurant to the parking valets, the staff was among the best I have ever dealt with...courteous, obliging, they followed through, they were always outgoing and pleasant. For that reason alone, we will use the DoubleTree Alana - Waikiki again if we ever get to go back. I just hope that the give the place a good 'freshening up!'

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: pros: good service, clean room, yummy warm cookies available all the time!cons: fire alarm kept going off at 4am but there was no fire. overall, for the price I paid, it was a nice hotel. I woul recommend this hotel to my friends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great Waikiki location, with all the expected traffic and noise of course, 3 blocks from the beach at Hilton Hawaiian Village and very near to Ala Moana shopping center and park, ABC convenience stores and restaurants everywhere. Better than most in the hotel class, suites are nice for family stays, adequate fitness center, staff is excellent and many thanks to Rebecca at the front desk for taking such good care of us during our one week visit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was a disaster with fire alarms going off on a repeated cycle for 30 min at 4 AM, hotel staff acted as if it was not there fault. Then we had broken air conditioners and non functional bathroom lights in my room. This place is a dump.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Typical hotel, room had comfortable bed, closet space for hanging items and storing bags. Bathroom had soaps, shampoos, and lotions. Towels large enough and washcloths standard. TV had sufficient channels. AC took several hours to cool to 74 Fahrenheit although 72 was selected. There were two fans in the rooms to help with circulating the AC. Staff was pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: nice huge room.. cookies ofcourse are the best.. a little further away from the main area but thats a healthy distance....awesome staff.. we had an issue with the safe and the manager and security guys came around and fixed it right away.... huge bathroom fit for a king the 1 bedroom suites is perfect for a family with young children.. maybe my only suggestion is to add an extra panel for the partition between the rooms for extra privacy in the bedroom... city view is decent but its right front of an apartment complex if that bothers you.....and the whale mural across is pretty good.. short walk to the beach...the valet team is awesome

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: So was a bit worried to stay here after the comments about the a/c and should have taken it a bit more serious. A/C was till not working and it gets quite warm. Staff just shrugged it off and said we can get you a fan. Thanks but think you should do a bit more for this type of thing especially at the rates we are paying. Maybe this was just the front desk as the valets were great and had no issues. Overall hotel was very clean. It smelled musty and is probably due to the a/c but watch now they'll have mold. Rooms are out dated looks like the hotel is stuck in the 80's/90'sIf I had to I'd stay again but would like to go elsewhere.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a multi-year Diamond member who stays exclusively at Hilton properties, this location was far & above my worst experience.-Long black hair sitting in my bathroom soap dish-1st hand towel that I unfolded to use, long black hair in it-2nd hand towel that I unfolded to use, long black hair in it-Informed front desk, offered to comp me breakfast, but I already get a complimentary breakfast-Bathroom sink clogged. Ran water for approx. ten seconds to wash my hands, filled up the sink. Took two days to resolve.-A/C set at 68 degrees as room was uncomfortably warm. Never opened a door or window, was gone all day, most of the evening. Room never cooled below 76 degrees over six days. Three others in my group, with different rooms on different floors, had the same issue. Common areas were uncomfortably warm (hallways, restaurant, elevators). I live in the South, so I am well aware of heat & humidity.-On our last day, hotel staff informed us that the water would be shut off for up to four hours due to an emergency water repair-When I checked out, I explained that a large group of us was returning multiple times over the next month along with multiple conference rooms booked. I had concerns about the A/C. I was told that it's been broken since Monday (four days ago). I inquired as to when it would be repaired and was told "It will be fixed before you come back". I then said, that's interesting as I didn't tell you when I was actually coming back. I then said that I wanted to go check the conference rooms as we speak and see if the A/C was operating/effective. I was then told it would be fixed by tomorrow.-While it is a self-service sit down breakfast, I had breakfast at the restaurant five days in a row. Not once did a single employee approach me and ask if I needed anything. Good think I didn't drink coffee as it never would have happened.I typically saw at least four to five employees wandering around the small restaurant.My colleagues and I will be staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and walking back to this property for the upcoming conference rooms. I would suggest that you do the same.-Internet was painfully slow. Tested speed daily and it never go above 2.11 Mbps

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Modern decor, nice to see two queen beds and not two full size. As a gold HH member, I got two free continental breakfasts daily which was a huge plus in Waikiki! Fridge was a little small and would have liked a microwave but as a hotel it had the essentials. The larger vanity was great for all of our cosmetics! Lanai was also s plus!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been staying at this hotel 2-3 times a year since 2002. It's a very nice and clean property, and the staff are incredible - they're like extended family to my wife and me. Your Hilton HHonors Diamond and Gold benefits go further here. Personally, I refuse to pay resort fees of the Hilton Hawaiian Village when I can stay here.
user_name:
John M
Plano, Texas, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for business quickly over the weekend. It was simply fine for business needs in HI. Hotel was having some air conditioning issues, and weren't able t rectify before my departure. Great staff, rooms ok, good location
user_name:
Craig S
Chapel Hill, NC, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed 9 days at this hotel and despite the unexpected issues with the A/C not being functional throughout the hotel; the hotel was clean and in a good location in walking distance to the beach and the shopping. Watch out for that digital key...it may slow you down. The rooms were spacious, but not a lot of storage space for H&B goods in the bathroom on the mountain side rooms, but good storage elsewhere in the room from luggage and clothes. All the rooms have a balcony. The bartenders were good and the food was surprisingly tasty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I opted for the DoubleTree as it was the most convenient location to the highway, and I was not working in the Honolulu area. My stay was excellent, thanks to the great staff, especially Earl at the bar, and I'll definitely be staying again if I make another trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There is no smoking area at all. I had to sit with the bums and sit in the rain out front of the hotel. No free coffee was also a negative, even at a motel6 they have free coffee all day. This may seem trivial but it is a big thing for me. I paid $250 a night and had to sit with bums to smoke!!!! My first three trips to this hotel ( about a month each) I had no problem smoking on the balcony but this time I was told I would be charge $300 for it my first minutes there. I won't ever come back until something changes with your smoking policy. There is a Marriott on the north shore that is more accommodating

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am here for work and still currently staying at the Double Tree hotel, I have been here since Aug. 11th. Since my stay I have had no hot water for one day, was told the water was going to be shut off for the day and currently I have no A/C in my room and haven't had for the last 4-5 days. Not very comfortable to sleep at night when it's 80 degrees in your room. I called down to the front desk the first day and was told that the A/C would be turned on later that day or early the next day and that didn't happen. I called the next day and the day after that and no one can tell me when it is going to be turned on. The hotel has not offered to deduct some of the cost of my room or offer any vouchers for a free breakfast/dinner for having these issues. When you pay what you pay for the cost of a room here, I feel they should step up and be accommodating to the customers needs. Overall, the hotel stay prior to these issues has been wonderful, the beds are comfortable, the room is clean and quiet. Hotel parking is $33/day and you can't park your own car, they have valet do it for you so be prepared to tip twice a day as your leaving and coming back. If the customers needs came first I would definitely stay here again but if they do nothing to help ease the issues that I have been dealing with staying here, I won't be coming back.Sincerely, Frustrated

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We planned for this vacation for almost 1 year. Loved so many things about the hotel (especially the 1 1/2 block walk to the HILTON Hawaiian Village Resort beach, lagoon, 18Restaurants, shops etc, - as well as the large Aloana Mall within waking distance) with rooms almost 1/2 the cost. But we were fristrated with the lack of working AC. We set the thermostat to 68 but it never drops below 72 at night and can't get below 74 at day. When we inquired - all we got was that they having some trouble with Chiller on the roof. From some of the staff, this is NOT a unique problem during our 10-day stay, apparently this is same "explanation" they give to people every week. For that reason, we went to Target and purchased fans for all 4 of the hotel rooms we were occupying during this stay. (I really felt like they should at least reimburse us for our fans if they "can't seem" to get this AC working well "this week."The staff is really friendly and they try to be accommodating - within the limits of their authority. The "Trees" Cafe staff is excellent. If your stay includes the "continental" breakfast (juice, fruit, breads, oatmeal, cereal, coffee) then it's not bad. But if you want to upgrade to the Omlete bar, meat/egg Buffett, waffles - the cost toUpgrade (if you have the complimentary continental breakfast) the cost is $8 which is actually a very good price for "Hawaii prices."Basically, it's a great location, rooms are smaller than HILTON Hawaiian Village (based on our past experience/stays), location is good, staff is good, food is good. But watch the reviews or call ahead to make sure the AC will really cool below 72! Make them send you an email that confirms it will and of it doesn't - your stay will be free!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was pleasant, the location ideal to UH, the staff were exceptional (especially when I had TV Remote problem), the restaurant Happy Hour was great, food was good, drinks were good. Overall really enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were here for 5 nights on vacation and really warmed to this place the longer we stayed. Our first impression on check-in was average - we had been hoping for an upgrade being but due to it being so busy, there were no upgrade options available Gold/Diamond members. The staff member did take down our details and did eventually follow up which was thoughtful.Room (911) - Pleasant room with a bathroom had been refurbished recently and the shower was a Hansgrohe Raindance shower head. The internet was nothing to get overly excited about but given this was the standard service, nothing to complain about either.Breakfast service - HHonors Gold/Diamond members receive complimentary continental breakfast. This is a very good offering with access to a chilled items including fruit, yoghurt, salad as well as bread, pastries and cereal. I was particularly impressed by the croissants and a pineapple brioche which appears to be delivered daily by a local baker. The coffee was good too. What tops it off is the friendly service by the restaurant team particularly Colleen. In summary, it's the better-than-expected service and quality touches of this place that make your stay memorable for the right reasons.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pick another hotel. This feels dated with moist rooms and spotty hot water. Staff seems fine and the fellas parking your car will do just fine. Some nights you'll be a bit like on sleep as people and medical personal race up and down the roads.
user_name:
Joseph A
manassas park, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for 1 night and was welcomed like a long lost friend! I was thanked many times for my Hilton loyalty (a nice touch as some properties seem to expect you to be loyal) and I was upgraded to a suite with partial ocean views form a basic room.The room was well decorated, although I did think the rooms looked more modern in the photos than in actual reality. However it had all the amenities and my room had a lounge and bar area as well as a big bedroom. The only let down was the size of the bathroom compared to the rest of the suite - it was fine for me by myself but if you had booked the suite as a family/couple, then I think you would be disappointed with the size of the bathroom! The location is great if you fancy the amenities of the Hilton Hawaiian Village but it is too expensive or too busy. The Doubletree is just a very quick walk to all the restaurants, shops and beach that the Hilton provides - without the crowds! Breakfast was in the bar area and for Diamonds the continental part was complimentary - an extra $8 should you wish to eat something hot. I was quite content with the bagels and fruit that was out and thought it was a relatively good spread.Check out was very quick and painless. I would recommend staying here should you wish to be near the Hawaiian Village but it is just a shade too far away from the main Waikiki drag if that is why you are visiting.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here while working and then family came afterwards....hotel location is near beach walking distance...you can walk thru the other Hilton resort hotel across the street to get there...the pool forget it super small....the breakfast is okay ..guys who make the omelettes do a great job..Staff is friendly..except the front desk girls are hit and miss with attitude...even if you get a high floor very noisy. ..but it's okay after all you are in Hawaii...didn't like the crowds of Asians yelling and blocking a very tight check-in counter...food around this hotel is not good..all you can eat buffets catering to Asian visitors your best bet is walking down the main strip ..outside and to the left..also the burger joint attached to the hotel on the street is pretty good..tks!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Management knew at checkin even. Entire building no AC at all. 76 degrees in the rooms. Otherwise most comfortable sofa bed I've ever slept on. Memory foam and no bars! I am very disappointed that as a diamond member they separate the breakfasts.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Originally stayed here on business 5 years ago, it was decent, no frills but served it's purpose. This time came for vacation and was hugely disappointed. Was told when checking in that hot water was unavailable - a disappointment to anyone wanting to shower after traveling for 15+ hours. The worst part was the smell of mildew in the hotel room and the hallways. There were some sort of wet vacs in the hallway trying to alleviate the problem but that just added to the noise factor. Would not stay here again when there are many options to choose from in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Whem calling the hotel, i was not told about no self parking.So to our surprise upon checking in thats when i found out about being charged per day for valet.So if you guys don't mind paying $16 per night for valet then I would say yes to this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is pretty affordable considering it's close proximity to Waikiki Beach. The location is great with lots of restaurants in the surrounding areas. Area also felt really safe, we walked around both in the day time and night time with elderly and children. Overall it was a great stay, but we only stayed 1 night (we were leaving for a cruise). The pool is very small! Just go to Waikiki!Service: Hotel staff from valet to hotel check in/out were all very nice and polite. They all had the Hawaiian free-spirited vibe! You get cookies at check in :) Breakfast buffet is additional cost, I think it's around ~$20Atmosphere: My only complaint are the small elevators, there are only 2. The hotel has a lot of floors, I think we were on the 12th floor. Considering how many rooms they house and only have 2 very small elevators, it was a bit inconvenient. At most, the elevators could hold 6 people. Rooms were all very clean, small bathrooms and some have standing showers only. Pool towels are available for free. Nice small balconies with 2 chairs and 1 small table. Rooms have a small fridge.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great comfortable place to stay on my way off the island. At the beginning of the Waikiki madness but in a great location. Room service, pool and gym were awesome. Coupon for foregoing housekeeping. Check in cookies were amazing. Rental movies were $18. It was cheaper to go to the movies than stay in. Other than that, great stay.
user_name:
Xada D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: DoubleTree is Located down the road from Ala Moana Shopping Center. Valet parking only (32$/day) however 50% discount for Kamaaina's.Up a short escalator is the front desk. The front desk was very nice and efficient and check in process was a breeze. The best part about check in was the Warm Chocolate Chip cookies they give you! Such a small gesture but SO Yummy! We had a corner room 7th floor it was an (accessible room) so the shower was a walk in type not a tub. We had a city view and the balcony looked over Ala Moana Bl which was fine, i didn't need an ocean view. Pro's: -Warm Cookies on Arrival-50% Kamaaina discount on valet Parking-Room service is available and there is a small bar/restaurant in the lobby-Location is awesome walking distance to Ala Moana Mall, and other restaurants a few minutes away. (Waikiki Brewing company, Wailana coffee house, buffalo wild wings, Cinnamon's all close by)-Great customer service at the front desk-Room was clean and comfortable, toiletries were good but small size-Bed was Amazing one of the most comfortable that I've slept in at a hotel-Pool and fitness center in the hotel-Coffee maker in room-The have movies on Demand but the New Release ones are 17$ to watch-DID I MENTION Warm Chocolate Chip Cookies at Check in? I might stay again just to get some! Con's:-Although you can walk to the beach its not located directly across the street from the beach if that's what you are looking for.-Noise, I was on the 7th floor and unfortunately could hear ambulance, rubbish trucks, alarms from the room. Since the location is so central you might want a higher floor so that its quieter. -valet parking rate of 32$ is pretty expensive however most rates in Waikiki will be similar. Overall I would stay here again, the location was convenient for me and the bed was very comfortable. I didn't want to get out of bed at all. This was not a 5 star luxury place but its very solid for the price point. Great customer service!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, accessible, great hotel for the money. Walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants and the beach. The Hotel has a good restaurant itself and the rooms are always clean and appealing. This Double Tree is my go to hotel for business while in Oahu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked in for a little git away from home. When we walked in our room on the 15th floor there was a very obvious musty smell like mold in my opinion. After a short stay in the room, maybe 30 minutes my throat was scratchy and my lungs were irritated. It felt like my asthma was flaring up which has not happened to me in years. The staff was nice and professional and asked us to try another room on the 16th floor. As soon as we opened the door to the room the smell was obviously worse than the first room. We went down and told the front desk we did not want to stay at the hotel. They insisted we try yet another room on the 18th floor. This room was a little better than the other rooms but not perfect and the damage was already done. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone due to possible health risk in my opinion. I was unable to stay at this hotel because the rooms made it difficult for me to breathe. The staff was friendly and professional.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Not a bad place to stay. I stayed on the 14th floor with an ocean view. This property is 1 of 2 "company approved properties" for Honolulu, the other being the Holiday Inn Beachcomber in the heart of Waikiki. First the pros:Great location. Away from the madness of Waikiki, but right up the road (maybe a 10 minute walk) from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Anything you could possibly want is in the village.Very clean rooms and attentive staff. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping was very friendly. Room refrigerator worked well. TV was fine - but who goes to Hawaii to watch TV?Trees Restaurant was very good. Restaurant staff was very friendly and they took the time to get to know their guests, as most guests are business travelers. The food was actually very good, and not overpriced like other onsite restaurants.Pool area was nice. Granted, most people aren't going to hang around the hotel pool when Waikiki is 2 blocks away, but I used the pool quite often and I enjoyed the peace and quiet.Cons: On-site parking is valet only. $32 per day. However, this is the norm around Waikiki.No on-site laundry facilities. You have 2 options: find a laundromat out in town, or use the hotel provided laundry service. I opted for the latter. Very pricey, but my clothes did come back pressed/neatly folded.2 of the 3 elevators were out of commission for a few days, which led to long wait times. By the time the elevator showed up at your floor (14th for me) it would be packed and you'd have to wait for the elevator to return and hope it wasn't as packed. They finally let us use the freight elevator to help alleviate this problem.Hotel room was extremely humid. Not sure if this is a hotel issue or just a part of life in Hawaii, but everything from the towels to the sheets always felt damp. My papers always had that "damp paper" feel as well. The A/C did work, but the humidity in the room was always very high.Wi-fi was down on on my floor for about 5 days. I did get a 50% discount on my parking during my stay, so my company saved a few hundred dollars on parking fees.Coffee maker in the room is your very basic model. Paper cups and generic coffee.Overall, this is a fine hotel. Just be sure to stop at Target to pick up a portable fan and a small coffee pot if you're on an extended stay. I usually leave these items as "parting gifts" for housekeeping when I leave :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was the last place I could find that could sleep a family of 5 in Waikiki. I would says it is an overflow hotel for the Hilton hotels. The staff is great. The rooms are clean but small, even our suite. However the location was very loud and I had a claustrophobic feeling.I would say they did a great job but it just wasn't my thing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is a little out of the way from the beach, however the rooms where great. The service was great. I would recommend the Double Tree to anyone looking for an economical vacation in Waikiki. Have fun.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel and my entire experience in Hawaii was wonderful. I wished I'd stayed a couple of more days; since I had one rain delay that set my back on my excursions, but overall, the hotel was accommodating, and the attractions and sites were GREAT!
user_name:
Phaeydra M B
Lithonia, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is clean and rooms well kept. The staff is friendly and professional. There is only valet parking for $32.00 a daily rate. The location is just perfect since the beach and most shopping areas are a short walking distance. The rates are ok but try to book early.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the airport we took taxi and it was ca 35 dollars, if you prefer going cheaper there are buses, Uber and shuttle options also. The place is dated, it remembers 80ties easily. The room chosen at 15th floor (proudly named HH rooms) was having partial view of the ocean, but the problem was a) smell of mould and humidity in the room b) darkness, as room had only small balcony window and the design was rather dark colours. The rooms are equipped with tea/coffee machine and plastic cups. Breakfast was served from 6 to 10 am, and it was rather basis (cereals, fruit, processed cheese, 1 ham cuts, boiled eggs, some pastries). There was also an option of some hot items for additional 8 US dollars. Service was nice and prompt. It is possible to walk to the beach it takes ca 15 minutes, as the hotel is cheaper than beach resorts, it is an option to be considered if you do not mould, old furniture and mould smell.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was just average. Only one elevator was in operation for my stay and not very well ventilated or air conditioned. Room was comfortable but décor was a little dated. Service was very good and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It was close to places to eat and could walk to other shops and sights

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The friendly & efficient staff made it an excellent stay. Spent 4 days here following a cruise and enjoyed the breakfast buffet immensely, the proximity to Ala Moana Mall is great, the pool is enjoyable and the room had great views. the warm cookies on check in and upon request were appreciated too :-)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff, room and view were all amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel if staying in Waikiki! Check-in was quick and efficient. Location to Hilton Hawaiian Village was very nice as you had the access without the price increase. You even can catch the Hilton Fireworks from the balcony if you book the right room such that we did (1821).
user_name:
Christopher P W
Scottsdale, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'm a huge Hilton fan and still am. I was excited on booking this hotel.First impression was great, nice lobby and great remodeled room. Once checked in it went downhill fast. 1. Since I visited in the summer it was hot so the a/c was put to use. They didn't have a de-humidifier and so by morning everything was musty and wet. 2. The entire week there was only 1 elevator working so waiting 15 min for the elevator was aggrivating. 3. During the week my key card was erased twice. I'm very concious of storing my card away from my phone and wallet. We were informed that the key card programmer was broken. 4. I had to return our rental car early and so the last day I did not have a car parked but was still charged for it. Positive's1. Very friendly staff2. Great breakfast3. Great rooms

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel not right in the each but not too far of walk. Hotel staff were very accommodating. We had an issue with the a/c and they worked hard to get in touch with us to rectify it. We also needed to print a doc and sign it. The scanned it in for us and sent it to the email address we asked.The Wakiki Brewing house is next door as well as Cheeseburger Paradise. Beer was great and you just walked back next door when done. The $5.99 breakfast at Cheeseburger ideal!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for three weeks. From the front desk to the janitor, everyone was positive, friendly, helpful and professional. 100% valet parking might sound like a pain, but actually saves from hunting for a space. The valets were all fast and friendly. And remember to ask for your DoubleTree cookie at the front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The valet took my rental and when I received it the next day, they dented the rear passenger door. The staff and the security guard was not trying to take responsibility for the dent. The valet attended that took my car and did not mark any dents on the valet ticket. After 2 hours of the security guard and the Director of Front Office Operations trying to make me go through my insurance, I told them to call the local police so I can make a report of this because this was the hotel's responsibility. A police report was made. For this reason, I will never stay at this hotel ever again. If the staff had of just said they would handle this because it was something that happened while the car was in there possession, everything would have been fine. As I explained to the security guard, if that was my car that I owned, I would not be using my insurance to fix this dent, they would be getting there insurance to fix it. Just because it's a rental car does not change the situation and because I had insurance on it. It was not my fault so I'm not using the insurance I was paying for.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed two nights after completing a 7 day cruise. It is a very central location being waking distance to pretty much everything, eg Ala Moana shopping, Waikiki beach & bars etc. The staff were really helpful - we had issues with the in room WiFi that, despite the best efforts of the hotel employees, couldn't be fixed so we were moved rooms, no questions asked. All in all it was a great experience - good location, very affordable and helpful staff so we'd be keen to stay here again when we return.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was huge.. But not good for me cause I have problems walking any long distance. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived so we went walking around and got some lunch. Came back one hour later, like they asked of us, but room still wasn't ready. Walked around some more, went to the beach, but we weren't dressed for it since we couldn't change clothes .. Came back two hours later, now it's been over three, and once again were told " room not ready". My fiancé was getting red faced so the mgr. was called. They did find us a room after another half hour, and some drink and breakfast coupons ( which came in very handy ) the breakfast was awesome .. Overall, it was a nice experience, once we got a room.. ☺️

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really enjoyed staying at this property the staff was so nice an helpful especially the dinner staff in the restaurant even though it was very busy they still made time to smile thank you Kyle and Brandon for your service

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was very nice. Staff in all areas are extremely friendly, check in and check out was quick, easy and painless. My only complaint is that there was only ONE working elevator our entire stay! We stayed on the weekend so, not sure if that was why no one was able to fix it. This was very inconvenient as our longest wait time was 20 minutes. We had to wait more than once for the "next elevator" b/c they were always full! At one point my bf and I were in such a hurry to change and meet up with friends that we had to walk up the stairs... keep in mind we were on the 11th floor!!! Again, the hotel was great, my only issue was that there was only one elevator!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Conveniently located in Waikiki. The Hhonors digital check in and digital key allowed me to skip the line upon arrival and go directly to my room. Great place to relax, unwind and get a good night's sleep.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check in was fast using the app. Loved the key card on my iPhone had a little misunderstanding with breakfast but Josh and Kyle made up for that. Room was nice view for the price was nice and valet parking was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved the check in process, was recognized as a Hilton member and was also able to get a Kamaaina rate on the parking. That was awesome. Beds are comfortable and rooms are comfy and cozy. Loved my experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for a week while on a business trip. The hotel is clean and the staff is attentive. Like most of the hotels in Waikiki, it has valet parking only, which is fairly fast and allows in/out parking. The hotel is located at the west end of Waikiki across the intersection from the Hilton Village. My room was spacious and did have a partial ocean view which was nice. There are several restaurants within a block of the hotel and the closest beach is across the street at the Hilton hotel. I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff was exceptional. The bell staff especially. The location was fine, walking distance to everything. The rooms were clean but small and nothing to write home about. You can barely see the beach...dont waist $ on that view. Overall not bad

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: people here are really down to earth and friendly....the rooms are real comfy and modern and clean....the check in was kind of irritating....i checked in late and i was tired and groggy and i just wanted to go sleep but i kept getting shaken down for a credit card for incidental deposit or whatever....i mean couldnt it have been taken care of in the morning? otherwise everything and everyone here was on point....i loved it!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When traveling for work I always look for room cleanliness with a friendly staff. This place has it all. I recommend it. Go see Earl and Alana at the bar. They will take great care of you. Also if you are like me and don't like waiting for the valet always call in advance and you will not wait. To top it off you can save a little money if you don't mind giving up housekeeping, you will get a $10 voucher towards dinner This is my third stay here and I will book again when traveling next October.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Decent place for the price, its a little inland so seeing the ocean was difficult but it did make for an easy walk downtown. The restaurant was good and the free breakfast that we had hit the spot. At the time we were there some construction was going on but the location made up for it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff were exceptionally attentive and helpful and we only stayed one night, after an extended stay at the newly refurbished Garden Inn. While the beds are comfortable and the rooms are larger than most in Waikiki, the hotel is in desperate need of a makeover. Cracks in the doors, threadbare towels and sad surroundings do not make for a positive holiday experience. Ala Moana is walkable, it's easy to walk to the fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian village and the cheeseburgers at the joint a few doors down are delicious but it's deep in the almost tackier completely touristy part of Waikiki. So there are good and bad points but overall staying there left a bad taste and we preferred the Garden Inn.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in July.Location is great, close to the beach and the main shopping boulevard and other shops/bars etc.Staff were super friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them; this was reflective in each staff member I had an interaction with- a key point to this hotel.Room had air con which worked well; the bathroom looked as if it had recently been refurbished and was clean and well appointed.Bed was comfortable and the room was of a decent size with a small balcony (which I didn't use).Wifi worked well during my stay too. There is a small fridge in the room to chill drinks etc too.The cost of room service was stupidly expensive and was unnecessarily expensive, in my opinion. On top of the cost of the food itself, there is a 22% gratuity charge and then another $5 charge; that made the cost of eggs benedict, for example, almost $28, which is just silly. Therefore, I didn't use room service and would encourage the hotel to review their pricing.The restaurant/bar is only open during peak hours (breakfast and dinner) and room service is therefore only available during these times; the bar was also closed outside of peak times. Plenty bars and restaurants in the local area though- Cheeseburger at the end of the street was a welcome place to go.Would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel. I stayed during a conference so the room rate was high but that's standard supply/demand for hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful Hotel with Great Service, Rooms all upgraded and comfortable, A real Aloha feeling, have a drink or a meal in the restaurant and enjoy a walk just the block from the Waikiki strip, make sure you join the Hhonors program to keep up with the specials and all the program has to offer, I did and great deals and special floor for Hhonors guest is a big place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great business location, wifi had problems while I was there, digital key is awesome. Pool loses sun after 130, Earl the bartender is great !!!!!!Parking and valet staff is friendly and fast, no waiting.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: internet always down for 3 days, had to leave premises to repair. Called multiple times and could not resolve. Should have refunded some money and had a better idea when it would get repaired. Very bad experience with billing and parking

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great place for value. Drink and food next door. Easy access to Hilton Village. Well worth the cost and allowed our family the option of arriving a day early for a week's vacation at the Hilton. Would definitely use this Hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked Hilton expecting a great room and experience and were very disappointed. We stayed there 2 nights and they could not get the a/c to work properly for the 2 nights we were there. The a/c is automatically set throughout the hotel but our room was stuck on 60F (15C). Finally they agreed to disconnect it so we could stop sleeping with multiple blankets. Staff were friendly but wouldn't allow us to change rooms unless we paid extra because we the same class rooms were all booked. Will stay at Ramada next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Terrible experience. Too humid. Hallways overpowered with potpourri and hot, humid temperatures.My colleague was locked out of his room for four hours and we couldn't not go to the beach because he couldn't get into his room. The hotel comp'd food only, and their restaurant's food is not good enough to make that comp worthwhile.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is a short walk to Waikiki beach, clean, and has great staff. The views aren't stellar and it's not the fanciest hotel, but the beds are comfortable and it's a good value. We had a suite which worked well for our family and a pool. I appreciated the friendliness and helpful demeanor of the staff, from the front desk to the bellman/valet. The cookies at the front desk rock. (They're warm too :-) lol)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location. Friendly staff. Clean, comfortable rooms. Near everything. The pool was warm I think think its heated. But it get very windy in the pool area. It was nice to walk around in the evening. Close to both Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana Beach. Will definitely go back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent location and value. Very clean. Great staff. The restaurant provides a great breakfast and other good meals - with a very friendly staff. The pool and pool deck is nice, but the sun disappears around the corner of the building in the very early afternoon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were originally booked at the Hilton Waikiki Village. Stayed there one night and decided to move somewhere quieter. We loved the DoubleTree as soon as we walked in. We have a room on the 17th floor. Everything about our stay has been perfect, beginning with the bottled water and warm cookies at check-in. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are spacious and well appointed and clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good stay I would come back. Any time I go to Waikiki very nice place next to the beaches and the Waikiki strip nice view good food and good service love the Hotal and will be coming back very soon Alohaz

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked a last minute staycation to celebrate the 4th of July weekend in Waikiki. Of course our first hotel choice was the Hilton Hawaiian Village but because of the high price, we opted for a reasonably priced hotel, also a Hilton brand, that was a little way down the street. Although it is not on the beach, it is within walking distance to some decent restaurants, bars, and the beach. The Double Tree Alana is actually a really nice hotel to stay at. They have friendly and helpful staff. You definitely are getting a value for the quality, service, and cleanliness of this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed on the 15th floor on the ala moana side. Quiet for me and good view towards Waikiki. Buildings are blocking but you can still see the ocean. No microwave and no laundry facility in hotel. Over all great stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: i would stay again.if anybody would ask me about the double tree i would let them know that this hotel would be a very good place to spend their vacation because the staff is very friendly and they treated me like family and that is the aloha way for the guess that comes to island and it will make them come back for that aloha feeling.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall its a nice clean hotel with very friendly service. Its is a bit overpriced as are the rest of the hotel in the waikiki area. Despite it being an old building, they keep it looking fresh and modern. The partial ocean view suites had a good view to them, Being Honors Gold we got free breakfast which good. I would also recommend upgrading to the full buffet as you get much more variety to your breakfast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay The staff was kind and eager to help me with whatever I needed being cookies before bed or for breakfast and the cookies alway warm. I loved the fitness room. The valet staff was on point. Whatta great overall experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights whilst we were waiting for vacancy at the sister property, the Hilton Hawaiian Village.This DoubleTree is located probably in one of the best areas in Waikiki as it is very close to Kalakaua Avenue which is essentially like the 5th Avenue street in New York City for shopping, dining, and just be right in downtown Waikiki. When we checked in, we got our cookies, free Wi-Fi vouchers and upon exiting the elevator saw that they placed us on the Hhonors floor which was a nice touch. The hotel room was very clean, the staff were very helpful and always greeted us with a smile and were willing to assist us with whatever we needed. The hotel in September 2015 was doing a massive renovation of the main entrance which made things a bit difficult at the time to get in and out of the lobby but overall, it is a decent hotel. I felt the room we stayed in could use a face lift to make it look a little more modern like the lobby looked. Would stay here again and would recommend.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at the front desk greeted us with a smile and were courteous and the location is excellent in the Waikiki area.The rooms were neat and tidy. Room amenities were good. Fridge available to keep your items cool.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was average, though the staff were excellent all around. The most disappointing aspect was having to wait till almost 3pm for my room to be available. The hotel itself is "tired" but neat and tidy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was okay nothing special. A short walk to the beach but kinda of dirty outside the hotel. For the price would stay elsewhere next time. Dogs barked all night! So loud! View was awful!!! Not Hawaiian at all.
user_name:
Kathi E
ELK GROVE, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hopeless. Incompetent. We ran a seminar here and i have never in 40 years of business come across such an inept hotel. Wasted so much time due to their incompetence and inability to follow the most simple directions. Staff simply did not give a damn. Still trying to fathom out the billing two weeks later. In all fairnes though, the lunches were good. Breakfast left alot to be desired, unless you like grease! Breaks were - bsic. Room, poorly set up and lacking booked eqipment, and nobody about to help, and when someone did turn up, he simply didn't care. I went Hilton Honors Gold on this trip, not that it matters as it is my last visit to a Hilton Hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, very nice rooms, great value for the $'s spent. Very comfortable beds, updated rooms, very friendly staff, close to the beqch (within walking distance) and close to several restaurants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is very nice. Good sized rooms mine had a balcony, and was very clean. The staff was great and the breakfast was pretty good. The bar area that is used for breakfast is a little small so try to beat the rush. The beach is a few blocks away, not a bad walk. There are a couple of places to eat on the same block and many within a short walk. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked a room during Hilton's Black Friday special. With so many independent hotels in Waikiki I wanted to stick with a major brand. Upon arrival the driveway was clean and the valet was very helpful in taking our car. The lobby is one floor above the driveway. There was no line at check-in and the staff was very friendly. Once we got to the room it was typical for this class of hotel. However the view was dreadful. It was a view of the run down Island Hostel which is located next door, and part of the parking deck. It was so disgusting that we couldn't sit out on the lanai. We were right above and to the side of the pool which was loud at times. The room had two queen size beds and a large flat screen. The bathroom was small with a glass shower. The controls on the shower was difficult to use. The shower head was also very low.The location was just ok. It was not easy to access the beach. We found some good dining deals nearby. Cheeseburger Waikiki next door offers a good breakfast, $5.99 for adults and $2.95 for the kids. A block down we also liked the Wailana Coffee House who also had good kids specials. Wailana serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner..I did not find any fast food options nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: clean room, comfortable-convenience location with partial mountain and city view, not too far from the beach. A bit too pricy for a lot smaller hotel and amenities compare to Hilton resort across the street .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Saw this hotel under some type of renovation last year. Decided to try it this year. This is a nice hotel. Very nice but nothing you wouldn't expect from a Hilton brand. The breakfast was splendid. Selection was everything. Nice clean and crisp room. Room 1820 had two balconies. In hawaii you don't mind seeing the city lights early in the morning or late at night , or listening to the traffic below. Open balconies are a must.Pool area is nice, water was perfect. No hot tub here but much needed as it can be slightly windy at night when the sun has gone down. I'm not sure why they did not included a hot tub because there definitely is room for one. Front desk and hotel staff are always greeting you with a dmile, no matter the day or time. We have stayed at resorts in hawaii and love them, but we also like this hotel. I'm sure we will book again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I loved the clean rooms the staff was great the restaurant had really great food and they entertained me as a business traveler it us close to Ala Mona shopping and the rest of Wakiki it is close and easy access to the highways and not far from airport

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hilton Doubletree and it was a pleasant experience. The hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. The location was great. 5 minutes to Waikiki and the downtown shopping district. Our room was very comfortable and quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The pillows were amazing, staff (from the front desk, to the valet, to housekeeping) was extremely gracious and welcoming, and overall experience was beyond my expectations. Hotel is close to everything. Didn't use their pool, but loved that the gym was open 24 hours.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked this hotel because there was no other hotel room around the $300 range. All others were $600+My sheets always felt damp. I don't think the sheets get fully dried...My door kept getting stuck/jammed. I had to enter my key about 3-4 times before the door would open. Very annoying.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent service will definitely recommend to family and friends and stay here again. All staff were so accommodating. So easy to have a travel agent inside the hotel organising tours, car hire etc for us. Pool was beautiful

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property was wonderful, staff was helpful and accommodating, and my status as Diamond was fully utilized. I enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast, and the omelet I bought on my last morning. Baggage storing after checkout so I didn't have to take a backpack and suitcase to the mall for a massage was helpful. $10 dinner vouchers for refusing room service was great. Staff were friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Originally I made reservations for the Doubletree via a corporate reservation service. I was told the hotel had availability however upon my arrival the hotel told me that they did not have availability. As a result I was forced to change rooms twice. Upon the second room change the bathroom was not cleaned there was hair on the floor so I requested another room. However the bathroom for that room also had hair on the floor. So the assistant manager had the room recleaned. This made a total of four room changes. Lastly I was told when I made reservation at the rate for the room would be $200 per night because I am a Hilton honors member. however when I arrived at the hotel I was then informed that the Hilton honors rate is actually $239 plus $32 parking per night. Corporate reservations and the hotel itself represent the Hilton . Customers should be provided with accurate information regardless of where it comes from and the rooms should be clean and sanitized. This made for an overall poor experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our reservation had been botched and unfortunately deleted from the system. The staff bent over backwards to resolve the situation quickly. They upgraded our room for free. That part was wonderful. They ended up making us switch rooms, mid stay and that was quite inconvenient and unpleasant.The hotel has an abundance of beach towels, the valet attendants were a delight, the restaurant closes very early, location is so-so, there are no views (except other buildings and parking lots). Rooms were very clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: the service was excellent, the room was clean, the front dest offered assistant promptly when needed. the valet called for and assisted in getting transportation very promply. the restaurant food was superb. All was excellent.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just off the beach, this is a good hotel for the price point. I stayed because it offered per diem rates and I was on government business. It's close enough to everything you need. For the price, this is a great place to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am always very pleased with my stay. If you are over the top individual, then this may be too simple for you.I personally never had to complain about anything & don't get me wrong, as simple as I am, everything must feel right & in working condition.
user_name:
Mary M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed this hotel. Rooms were clean. Front desk was friendly and welcoming. Location was within walking distance to the beach and much much more... Restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff all around. Very friendly and courteous. No hot tub, but great pool area. Tiny elevators. Coffee shop was about a five minute walk, but hotel had a restaurant, and great brewery and restaurant next door .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had arranged an accessible room with a king and couch or 2 beds. I was told on arrival that there were no accessible rooms available. I was given a room with 2 beds. This would have worked out fine but...The space between the beds, doorway, etc. was very tight for a wheelchair. Okay, we could deal with this. The bathroom was tight and hard to get in an out of the shower because of the step up but there was a handrail and we could deal with that.I had to ask for a new room when the wall mounted sink started falling off the wall. I thought something was amiss when I placed the soap on the edge of the sink and it would not stay. Then I noticed how poorly it was mounted to the wall with large amounts of caulking on the back edge. The toilet then overflowed. I went down to discuss these issues with the manager. She said they were full and the next night we could change to an accessible room. We packed up the next day to change rooms. We found the accessible room to be a nice option but had a different issue. We needed a bed for our daughter. The rooms were remodeled and the couches removed. I asked for a rollaway bed and was informed that they had none on property at all. Okay, another room change and we had 2 beds and a bathroom that was at least accessible but with an old style tub. Hilton's promise is that they will make it right. I can say that 2 room changes and 2 nights and they got the room right, finally. I was offered an upgrade if I returned again. I planned to return to Waikiki in 2 weeks but will not choose this hotel again. I really do not expect to struggle this much for a Doubletree level accommodation. The pool area is small and not much fun. The workout room is acceptable. Location is good for beach access if you don't mind walking 3 -4 blocks. The property restaurant is okay. You will likely wait quite awhile for your food. As a Hilton Diamond member I usually get breakfast for free. I did get a continental breakfast for free, but if I wanted cooked eggs then there was an $8 charge. I have stayed at many Doubletree hotels that were far more hospitable and pleasant in far less scenic areas. I expected more from a Doubletree in Hawaii. I would recommend not renting a car. Instead take the Fly Shuttle for $10 each way per person.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the DoubleTree for eight nights. We booked the partial ocean view and were in level 15. We were very happy with the view, it's not ocean front but it's also not ocean front price. The room had plenty of space, with a very comfortable bed and a new bathroom. Front reception staff are truly the best we have experienced in any Hilton/Doubletree and pretty much from any hotel. Michelle checked us in an out and deserves an award, super friendly and helpful. Really did make you feel welcome. The Valet staff could probably learn a bit from the reception staff, as they kinda ignore you as you walk past, no big deal though. Pool area is perfect, again the hotel is affordable so it's no lagoon pool but you are not paying resort fees. We used it everyday and had it to ourselves mostly. Only real problem we had was on the last two nights a guest checked-in in the adjacent room and they smoked on the balcony (pretty sure it wasn't a legal substance either) and the smell came into our room. That's not really the hotels fault but also they opened and closed their balcony door constantly over those two nights and it was very loud and woke us up several times. Other than this we loved our stay and it was the perfect distance for us to the main centre and beach, gets you away from the crowds but 10 min walk to most main attractions! If you don't like or unable to walk for 10 mins due to illness/age etc then you may need transport or cabs but I would still look at staying here as the service and comfort is great. We would stay here again without a second thought and have recommended the Alana to several family and friends we know traveling to Waikiki in the next year. Mahola the team at the Alana.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was a bargain compared to most. You get the Hilton experience. They make sure you have a good stay. The front desk ladies were super nice. Room service was very quick. I don't like the lobby it's small and gets crowded.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I will never be staying at this hotel, and will be telling everyone I know about the terrible service provided by Double Tree. Not only did they mistakenly double charge my partner's card, they refused to even acknowledge it happened even though we have shown them two transactions on the bank statement, one for the correct full amount and one mistaken amount that is double charged! Very unhelpful and disappointed in receiving this sort of treatment, what is the point in being an Honors member? Will never use Double Tree anywhere in the world again. We are now $662 AUD short and running circles with the bank and Double Tree trying to get this rectified. Has left a sour taste about our holiday and stay at Double Tree. Thanks, but no thanks. Never again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room smelled like mildew. Bed was not comfortable. The location is great to walk for shopping and the beach. The parking at the hotel is 30 dollars a day. The staff was very nice . The breakfast was ok.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is wonderful. It is a smaller hotel that provides easy access to all it's amenities. The fitness center and pool are easily accessible - and best of all, not crowded due to the size of the hotel. All the staff I encountered were super friendly. It is off the beach, so it is not so crazy with traffic. Valet parking, provides easy access to the hotel if you have a car. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants easy access to the beach but not the craziness of some of the larger hotels right on the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms are really small with poor views. The rest is standard for a doubletree.Valet parking takes for eeeverrr and when calling so they would get your car ready ahead of time answer was that they were too busy!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we pulled up to the doubletree was the first time I got to meet their incredible staff. True aloha spirit. Our room was on the 18th floor and had a city/mountain view. I love a good bed and these passed with flying colors. The bathroom was a little small for my liking, but adequate. There is not a hot tub, but the heated salt water pool left my skin feeling great. Now I want a salt water pool. I can't review the breakfast because we left early to get day of tickets to Pearl Harbor. Recommend if you like sleeping and a super friendly staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed one night in April and had a wonderful time. Rebecca and Ewa at the front desk were wonderful, the room was very nice with a lot of space as a Hilton Gold member i really appreciated the effort into making my stay great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean and situated in a great area of access to all of the hotels and restaurants. Staff was phenomenal; Cookies were to die for at every staff counter contact service. Beds were so comfortable and the towels were very soft. Shower was hot and clean. All amenities were functioning and available during our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
