review_body: I stayed in this hotel at the recommendation of my local client. We had issues at check-in regarding room availability and front desk attitude. The shower leaked, the bathroom sink was slow, and the pool is all concrete and spare in its aesthetics. The business center was fine, the housekeeping staff was wonderful, and the room and bed quality (excluding bathroom) were fine. For the price ($189/night) I expected better. They also have a bazaar food and beverage setup where they first ask you if you quality for a free meal (due to Hilton Honors status) and ask things like, "Are you on the list" and, "You know, you'll have to pay for breakfast" as if you would be there at all if you couldn't afford to. They give you a full menu, but then you can only order two items (none of the rest of the menu is available) or you can have the buffet for $24. We spent most of our non-work time at Hilton Hawaiian Village a block and a half down the street and realized we should have been there or any number of other places.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree hotel is situated just outside the beach area in good walking distance to the beach bars and hotels. The hotel was very clean, staff friendly and the rooms were very spacious. A very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is in a great location because it's close to a lot of different places. Walking distance to the mall, ABC Store right around the corner, Hilton Hawaiian Village/Beach 3 minute walk away. Sadly, I was allergic to something in the two rooms I stayed in. I woke up with a swollen face and Thad trouble breathing any time I was in the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this DoubleTree for 5 days. The staff here was friendly and very helpful. Ex - Our AC stopped working so we called the front desk. As soon as we hung up, there was knock on the door and it was maintenance to check out the AC. I appreciate quick service and this staff did not disappoint. Oour room was small for a family of 4 and view looked right into the poor neighbors bedroom (it was a home). We didn't go out there much after finding that out. The sun is always blocked by hotel so son't expect to tan while swimming in the pool. All and all, I would recommend the hotel but with little caution about our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Oh where do I start. Well I will start with the breakfast. Local chefs make the best food here. From the Portuguese sausage to the rice n eggs and bakery foods oh lord I didn't want to leave. The rooms were clean and quiet. Great views anywhere you look. Oh and the cookies were amazing as usual

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel half a dozen times over the past 10 years and it's always been reliable. It's not my first choice cause it's farther away from where I like to stay but I do enjoy myself when I stay here. General location is good with beach and shopping within walking distance. Front desk is usually efficient and friendly. Rooms are clean and linens are fresh. $30 per day for valet only parking is a bit steep when you consider many of the hotels in the heart of Waikiki charge less.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff were exceptional. Only stayed one night. Conveniently located to amenities and shopping in walking distance. Room decor was fine. Only downside: view was terrible (rooftops and apartments). Price was reasonable for location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here while on business in mid-May 2016. It's a nice hotel, but I can't get around how hard it is to keep your room reasonably cool. Even the hallways were really stuffy and warm. My room's thermostat repeatedly kept resetting to 72 degrees, and the fan would switch to "AUTO" if I left it for just a few hours. I basically had to get into the habit of checking the thermostat whenever I got back from work, and at least once throughout the course of the night. "Frustrating" would be an understatement. Made for a couple of nights where sleep wasn't easy.That being said, the hotel was great, the valets were always super fast to get your vehicle when you needed it, and the housekeeping staff was always on their game. My digital key never worked for the duration of my stay, so I ended up relying upon the plastic keys. No impact, but important to note if you like the digital key option. I was also disappointed with the costs for laundry service. Everything appeared to by dry-cleaning prices, and overpriced at that. On top of that, $1.00 for a local call under 2 minutes? I'm not a cheap skate, but it just seems like they're using the fact that they're in a tourist trap to justify charging for EVERY little convenience. Don't go here expecting the usual complimentary continental breakfast that most Hilton properties are known for. It's like $14 for the continental and another $10 for the full on breakfast buffet.Again, I'm not a cheap skate by any means, it just seems that for the price of the room, you could expect a little bit more.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are looking for quality over quantity, this is the place to go. If you compare Doubletree to a higher end hotel like Hilton, there will be less perks for you here. However, the customer service at the Hilton is give or take. We have been here at least 5 times within the year either personal or on business and its the same every time. Greetings, great food, staff attitude and servitude is the same each time. Overall, its affordable, still close to shops and beaches and worth the stay. So check them out and remember to tip the valet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Have stayed at this Double Tree a number of times. This Double Tree just started offering the digital key check-in. Upon my arrivel the bell staff and concierge staff greeted me in the true Aloha spirit. Assisted me with my bags, took care of valeting my car. I alerted the staff that I was using the digital key. This means by passing the front desk at check-in which is a great thing!! The whole process from pulling up out front until I was in my room only took 5 minutes. During my stay the staff was always friendly and demonstrated the aloha spirit. The gentleman that park your car and bring it to you when you need to leave are among the best and friendliest I have experienced. Much nicer than other concierge personnel at more expensive hotels in Waikiki. The front desk staff is also available to help with anything I needed. Overall this is a great hotel for business travel and also is a convenient and affordable hotel for vacation travelers. Remember, everyone has access to the beaches so there is not need to spend big bucks to stay at an ocean front hotel. The beach is a 8 minute walk from this hotel. Overall this is my favorite business hotel in Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for our last honeymoon night in Hawaii. Had to change rooms upon arrival due to a clogged toilet, which would suggest that the room wasn't properly inspected prior to occupancy. Hotel upgraded us to a suite, which should have been the case anyway given my Diamond rewards status with Hilton. We also had a few things damaged in our suite (heating/air conditioning; coffee maker), the pool area had no towels, etc. Overall, hotel room was clean and staff responded to each issue promptly, but management needs to look at some improvements in their systems and practices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Found bugs in the rooms at this site. front desk say bugs can fly up to the ten floor. Highly unlikely the bugs fly. This were small and look like termite . Hotel send a tech to fugitage the room. No smell from spray

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this property for one night for business using my HHonors reward points (40K). I am a Diamond level member, so I typically receive complimentary upgrades. However, this time I received an upgrade to one of the Penthouse Suites. I was VERY impressed by the room and have nothing but great things to say. However, the only thing that ruined my "perfect" experience was not being told there is/was an $8.00 charge for the "full" breakfast option. I have stayed at Hilton properties around the world & have never been charged for breakfast as a Diamond level member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel good location. The complimentary breakfast was fair. There is an upgrade breakfast for $8.00 dollars that was pretty good. Hotel room was clean and the beds are comfortable the couch has a great hide a bed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family enjoyed our stay here. If you're looking for a "resort" where you don't leave the hotel, and have lots of shop/amenities within the hotel, this is not for you. If you're looking for a hotel to sleep, a comfortable room, and a staff that seems to genuinely care about your stay there, then this for you. Pros: On the outskirts of Waikiki, so you don't have the traffic and hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Hilton resort is a 5 minute walk, and Waikiki beach is 10 minutesNice facility with comfortable rooms.Hotel went out of their way to accomodate us (father in law had a complaint about locks on bathrooms, and they did what they could to fix it).Cons:Some furniture dated and worn.No locks on bathrooms (this a hawaii thing?)Pool area is a little underwhelming

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was good for what we needed: a one bedroom suite (although the sliding doors for the bedroom didn't really give much "sound" privacy from the living room) pretty close to the fun. CONS: We had a city view which was a view of one of your typical, creepier looking Honolulu buildings (so consider upgrading to a view of the mountain if you go with the one bedroom suite). The room, although updated, didn't feel fresh because maybe it hadn't had a complete overhaul or had already seen a lot of traffic. (Maybe it was the color of the sofa, but I just didn't feel the couch cushions were clean feeling.) The two queen beds in the bedroom were packed in pretty tight, so good luck moving comfortably in the room with your check-in luggage. You also get no TV in the bedroom. No complimentary happy hours or entertainment. Finally, if I had paid ($233/night) rather than used points, I would've felt this was way overpriced, so if you can afford a little bit more at a better hotel, I'd do it--especially if you're hoping for a Hawaiian/resort type feel. (We moved on to the Embassy Suites after two days--because we lucked out with a flash sale--and it was a 180 experience.)PROS: Friendly staff, fast valet, 10-15min walking distance from the strip and Waikiki beach (but may be a bit much of a walk for young children, elderly people, or someone in cute heels, so uber is handy if you stay here), and more "affordable" than hotels in the heart of the strip. Best thing I could say about this hotel though (besides the yummy cookies!) was BEST SOFA BED MATTRESS EVER!! This mattress was more comfortable than most regular beds--it almost had a memory foam feel. We just kept the mattress open the entire time and lay on it instead of the couch cushions. (I always take pictures of my hotel rooms and didn't do it for this one, so that kind of tells you how not so thrilled I was about the appearance of our room...)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed this convenient location in Waikiki...very clean property & staff friendly & helpful...just need a jacuzzi by the pool - my ONLY suggestion. Liked the new pool deck relaxing sofas & umbrellas & also the new "lime green" pool towels. Would definately return & I found staff very helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I require a wheelchair accessible room. The room is of sufficient size to get around easily with my battery operated device. Washroom is very accessible including a roll in shower with a pull down seat to transfer to if required. Call well in advance if accessible room is required. Hotel has steps down into pool but it also has a seat that will help you into and out of the pool. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and go out of their way to ensure your stay is memorable. I love the cookies when we arrive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Earl and Alana are great hosts in the bar. Service is outstanding, Mai Tai's are some of the best ever, and food is not bad. Front desk service is outstanding; always greeted with a smile they are very happy to help answer any questions you may have and provide you a cookie to make your day!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was a nice stay, but the item that needed immediate attention was the mattress. The front desk staff was receptive so I am sure it was taken care of it.I selected "average" for the sleep quality because it was quiet even though the room needs a new mattress (imagine having a good mattress... it would simply be a fantastic stay).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Doubletree was great! I dealt with the front desk staff, valet, and maintenance and they all showed great examples of true customer service. The hotel is about 2 walking blocks from the beach and about 1 mile from the area near waikiki beach that has 100's of stores and restaurants! So the location is great! The rooms were super clean of course as expected from a Hilton property. We were on the 6th floor and had a nice view of the city. I was really satisfied with my stay and we'll most definitely be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is located between Waikiki and the Ala Moana Shopping Center--perfect location to easily walk to either one. I like that it's right across the street from a park and the streets aren't crowded like they are downtown in Waikiki. The staff is super friendly and helpful and the rooms very comfortable and nicely appointed. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The people at the Hilton were very friendly and the room was lovely. The location was good and was an easy walk to Waikiki by going through the Hilton Waikiki Village. I would recommend the DoubleTree as it is easy walking distance to many lots of shops and the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, pleasant with friendly, helpful staff. Away from the crowds of Waikiki but a close walk to the beach, restaurants, and parks in a safe neighborhood. The breakfast buffet had real eggs/omelettes prepared by a real cook while you watch and indicate preferences.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a great place to stay. Everyone was very helpful when we had any questions. The room was always clean. The food was wonderful. Much better than the food at the Tropics Bar and Grill. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I originally had booked across the way at Hilton Grand Vacation Club, until I found out there was a daily resort fee. Then decided to book here at Doubletree instead with no fee at all. I was with my wife and two kids, and although it was a typical hotel room stay, it did us very well. It was very clean and posh to my liking with average sized rooms with balcony views of the city. Based upon where your room is, you may either have a city view or partial ocean. Great location as it is 5 minutes from Hilton Grand and all the restaurants and shopping. Within a 10 minute walk to Beachwalk and Lewers St where all the other shopping and restaurants are located. For military, it is a 5 minute walk from Hale Koa and all the amenities there, to include their $18 parking garage. I good alternate to Hiltons $35 valet. The beach is 5 minutes, or two blocks away from the beach. Check in, was smooth and easy with friendly staff. Breakfast was great as well, if you are Gold or higher you have complimentary continental breakfast which is pretty decent. For an up-charge, you can get a full breakfast to include omelets and waffles. Housekeeping was spot on and was a great stay over all, despite being gone most of the time, but when there, my family and I were able to relax and enjoy ourselves.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Booked this hotel based on prior babysitting reservation through concierge. Paid for a penthouse suite so that the sitter and the kids would be comfy while we were out. Sitter never showed up! Front desk offered a $20 per night discount! Frikkin clueless. In the process of writing corporate now. Front desk shifted the blame to Expedia! We never made a reservation with Expedia, it was made with the front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good location in walking distance to everything Waikiki. Priced lower than those on the Ocean which makes it affordable for folks on a budget, just two blocks away. Clean accommodations, friendly staff (Check out Maggie at the front desk) and all of the amenities you need for that nice Hawaiian getaway.
user_name:
Bill G
Gloucester City, New Jersey

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good hotel. Great location! Easy walk to Waikiki sites. Backside is quieter at night. Very friendly staff. The breakfast Buffett is a bit pricey, but close walk to other (cheaper) options. Valet is quick/no hassle.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Quick valet service. High priced parking for the area. Right at 31usd. Accommodations are nice. Room is a king bed, not big but not cramped. Staff very friendly and quick to help to suit your needs. A/C could be colder. Not a beach front property. 1 min walk to the beach. This property could save you $ by not staying on a beach property. Gave it an average rating because it's average for the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service at this hotel was great. As a HH member I got free breakfast in the morning but you can pay $8 for hot food items, which I did not. The continental breakfast was very good with several items that are regional. My room was a corner room that had two balconies with great views. The room was clean and quiet. It was only about a 10 minute walk to the beach and about 15 minute walk to the mall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was going into surgery and asked that the room be exceptionally clean it had Public Hair on the ledge of shower food on doors windows and do not disturbe sign.I asked to have it cleaned again and I still had to spend 3 hrs cleaning it my self instead of resting before surgery.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed in the Double Tree at least 7 times for business when traveling to Hawaii. This hotel has been remodeled the rooms are great. The service is excellent and is a good value. Will stay there again for business trips. I have never had a bad experience while stating at the Double Tree by Hilton Alana Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a Great hotel about 6 blocks from the beach and within 4-5 blocks of the trolley and The Bus routes. Hotel staff were very nice, pleasant and very willing to help with sight seeing and dining choices. We took the room choice with added breakfast which provided a choice of eggs, rice, sausage, bacon, spam, potatoes, pastries, oatmeal, fruit, juices, tea and coffee. The Doubletree cookies were always available. We stayed on the 18th floor and had a decent view of the mountains and city area. The bell captains were especially helpful to load and unload the vehicles. The room attendants took care of the rooms daily or as requested and were interested to know if there was anything they could do. The front desk staff and conserige were helpful with directions and choices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we arrived, Tianya was welcoming, kind, & she went above and beyond. The rooms were 1 bdrm suite. They had a good view of the mountain ad the city. Originally I had a partial ocean view- but the bathroom was not working the engineering team came quicky and they immediately changed my room. The resturant had a good breakfast, omlett bar and fresh waffles. Overall nice time and good stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location and fantastic customer service. We found hotel staff willing and going out of their way to help us. The concierge service was excellent and very helpful in taking care of our sight seeing needs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel has very nice staff. The location is decent. The partial view of the ocean was nice. The valet parking was fast and efficient. The room was clean and fairly peaceful. There was a fairly decent selection of dining choices within walking distance. The beach was close by and beautiful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great Place to Stay. Initially we were booked into the Hilton on Waikiki but for reasons were are not sure of we were booked into this hotel. Nice. Clean. Friendly staff. Open the door and sleep at night it was pleasant to wake up to the birds. Reasonable walk to the beach or down to the strip by the beach,Two negatives - the bathroom is oddly designed.The toilet paper hits your leg when you sit on the toilet. The towels are behind the shower door.You have to exit the shower and then close the door to get a towel. Don't pay more for an ocean front room. Ask for a chocolate chip cookie,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton Alana Hotel in Waikiki beach. We have stayed there before and enjoy the consistency of the hotel and service. The staff are amazing and always exceed our expectations! We were greeted by friendly front desk staff and they were always there to help. The rooms are large, bright, airy, and very clean. The housekeepers do an amazing job. The location of this hotel is perfect, being at the quieter end of Waikiki, adjacent to a huge park that you can walk through to get to the beach or the more populated part of Waikiki. The staff at Trees restaurant greet us every morning with a smile and make us feel right at home. There are many healthy breakfast options such as fat free Greek yoghurt, three to four types of fresh fruits, and even steel cut oatmeal! They also have the usual fare such as omelettes and bacon. The staff at Trees during the dinner hours are equally friendly and the food is amazing. The pool area is really pretty with turquoise umbrellas, plants, and lovely outdoor patio furniture. It's a great place to relax. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: outstanding facilities,great service at all times,great location for shopping and touring. great view from veranda. would stay here again. the cookies were super, liked the coffee and tea. ice machine was close and handy. extra towels were nice.
user_name:
Yoshio N
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A memorable 5 day stay from 20 Apr to 25 Apr 2016 at this facility.Arrived in an early morning flight from Tokyo for an international conference.The front desk staff was very attentive and aware of the long travel needing rest, made arrangement for an early check in. Tasty cookies were offered while we waited. Stay was filled with positive interactions with staff from different depts including concierge, house keeping, maintenance.All you have to request something and they are at your doorstep within minutes. This includes my wifi connection. On another occassion, at 4am my wife had very bad sore throat requiring salt to gargle to clear her mouth. We are extremely proud of your superb service rendered as this was our first experience visiting Hawaii. This facility is very close to the famous Waikiki beach and numerous shopping outlets.If you are too tired to go anywhere, located next to the hotel is a restaurant serving excellent burgers / steaks and drinks. There is a Thai restaurant too. Convenient ABC outlet is available at this location.Never a dull moment at this facility. Best wishes to all the dedicated staff in Double Tree. P Pathmanaban( Malaysia )

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I enjoy staying at this hotel, staff is very nice and helpful. I had no complaints so far and I've stayed at this place more than 10x. The location of this hotel is key, it's right in the middle. The cookie that they provide is the high light of my stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Located near the beach and Ala Moana shopping center, this hotel is very practical for a short stay. The staff is very friendly, and the cookies offered at the reception are so good. The rooms are clean. There are two sides, partial ocean view and mountain city view. The partial ocean view rooms are maybe more noisy because of the street nearby, and some rooms on higher floors are close to the air-conditioning machinery, which is noisy.The bathroom is small for two people. The continental breakfast is free for Hhonors gold and diamond guests, and 8 dollars more for a full breakfast. Globally, it is a good hotel, but the room can be noisy depending on the location of the room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: what I really liked about this hotel was to help me avoid a lot of traffic because it's location is key to both of the highways that connected me all over the island and I didn't have to deal with the downtown craziness of walkie ke what I really liked about this hotel was to help me avoid a lot of traffic because it's location is key to both of the highways that connected me all over the island and I didn't have to deal with the downtown craziness of wakiki. Further it was next to laundromat, five great restaurants and an outdoor bar in the neighborhood, less than 10 minute walk in a straight line to the pick up site for tourists and the beach... I also liked that it was a little more quiet in the evening and it was super simple to get to at the end of the day. Further it simplify things by having a little Vendig store who's prices were reasonable so I didn't have to go out looking for 7-Eleven I would definitely tell people stay there and although the pool with smaller it was warm and beautiful

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great place to stay. Great service, front desk very helpful. Concierge was awesome in arranging Pearl harbour visits. Cleaning staff with great. Bell boys were fantastic and very accommodating. Very comfortable stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, friendly, comfortable Hilton chain hotel on Waikiki. Valet was quick and convenient but expensive even for Honolulu. Beds and room very comfortable...nice shower. Staff is very friendly and responsive.
user_name:
BobBabooski
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed her for our ten year anniversary. We bought a fruit bowl from the store in the lobby. After eating the fruit my girlfriend developed severe vomiting. It continued thru out the afternoon. To add insult to injury the air conditioning in the hotel went out. We had to call a mobile doctor who came to the room and administered two IV saline bags and medications. We called management and they informed us the air conditioning would be out for the next four days. So for half of our stay we had temperatures in the room of 78 to 82 deg F. The management did get us a fan. The manager also brought up a tray of ice cream and another fruit bowl but he probably didn't realize the fruit was the likely cause of the food poisoning. We asked for a refund and the best they could offer was a 50% reduction on the cost of our stay at the hotel with a verbal promise for an upgrade in the future if we were to return to their hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Ask for room 1721 if you want these beautiful morning views of Waikiki Beach (double balcony). Comfortable rooms only 5 minutes from the beach without the resort fee price tag. Clean hotel, bar/restaurant a warm cookie upon arrival and little mini iceboxes in the rooms. Excellent stay and choice

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: What makes this hotel special? Purely and simply, The Staff! Each and every one of them...bell staff, valet, front desk, restaurant, housekeeping, maintenance and management. I have always known that if you want your staff to provide excellent service and treat customers well, it has to start at the top. Well, it is evident that it starts at the top here at the Doubletree Alana. Service is impeccable and everyone goes out of their way to greet you and make your stay comfortable. I don't care where you stay on this island, you are not going to find a perfect product, but I can tell you, if you stay at the Doubletree, when and if you run across an issue, it will be addressed quickly, efficiently and with the utmost care. This staff has the best follow through and makes you feel like you are important. When my husband and I checked in for our 9 day stay, I was laughing at my now nearly non existent HHonors status of blue since I have not been traveling this past year and a half; I had previously been a Diamond since 2001. I was remarking how I am nothing now but still happy to be an HHonors member. We are now on our 4th day at this hotel and I have to tell you, this staff has treated us so well, made us feel special. As a matter of fact, in all my previous years of staying at other Hilton properties, I can't remember a time of ever receiving such great personal service. This property is very quiet and only a couple of blocks away from the beach. I like that it is not nestled in with all the chaos of other Waikiki hotels. It is an easy walk from many great restaurants and 2 minutes away from two ABC stores in either direction. A huge bonus is that you are not charged a resort fee to stay at this property. If you stay at any other resort, you will need to add on at least an additional 30.00 per day to your hotel rate. And that does not include parking. There is a nice gym with Precor equipment and a view of the pool as you run off your Happy Hour Mai Tai's from the day before. If you are looking for impersonal service, large crowds, and over rated non service then do not stay here, but if you want personal service, caring and thoughtful staff who jump through hoops for their customers, then the Doubletree Alana is a 'Must Stay'. Hendrick, the Assistant Front Desk Manager, is the epitome of follow through and excellent service. I see a future General Manager in this fine young man. Thanks, Hendrick! You rock!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for a short layover before moving on to Maui.The staff at the desk were fantastic as we found we had an issue with our booking.The concierge was very helpful as well.The hotel is 15 mins from the beach ( through Hilton village) and 15 mins from Honolulu mall.The room was a large unit with a separate lounge and large balcony.The room was looking dated but was clean and well stocked - fridge , ironing board a iron and TVs in both rooms. ( note movies, music were chargeable as was WiFi.) The hotel had a small pool gym and sun area.No problems from me

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel, not perfectly clean (still some plastic on the bathroom floor). The location is good (5 to 10mm by feet to go on the beach) however a direct access to the beach (as the Hilton propose) is better. A good hotel in conclusion especially for business (for family I recommend a beach hotel).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Honolulu Double Tree by Hilton for a week. We reserved a room on the 19th floor which is the "penthouse" suite. The hotel is very clean, the staff is extremely friendly. The issue we encountered was when we did the reservation, it allowed us to book this suite for 4 people. 2 adults and 2 children. When we arrived - There was a king sized bet and a single roll away bed. We requested another bed and were turned down - the assistant manager said due to fire code we could not have another bed in the room.So for the week one of us got to sleep on the floor. Had the website said this room is really not suitable for 4 people we never would have booked it. I have stayed in some pretty bad places in my life - that is why we didn't freak out here. When we checked out, and mentioned it to Ewa, the front desk supervisor - she handled it better than the manager did. She threw us some discounts on parking which was nice - we turned those back into additional tips for the valet and cleaning staff. My advice would be keep your A playeres like Ewa - as we would revisit this hotel if they fixed the bed situation - but just be upfront with your advertising on your website.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a great place to stay. It was just off the beach but VERY easy walk to the waterfront so a lot less expensive with all the perks. The rooms were spacious, clean and quiet and the staff was wonderful. The concierge team was most helpful as was the front desk staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The two elevators were broke for two days. You should have elevators sevice. The air conditioning was not working at 100%. Ever time we turn it down it went back up to 72 degrees. It was 84 degrees or high while we were there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at hotel due to business meeting next day to avoid traffic. Friendly and sccommadatong staff , nice little bar with good drinks , only downside for me was the uncomfortable beds and pillows.  Fair price . Decent business rooms for med to large groups.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Got there early as our flight was early. Didn't think they would have a room ready but they upgraded us to the penthouse which was beautiful with a great view! Breakfast was outstanding! Of course who doesn't like the free chocolate chip cookies! Would highly recommend this hotel. Everyone was so nice!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This most recent stay was my 2nd stay. Hotel was very clean, staff was friendly and professional. Food are was clean, well staffed and food was delicious. I would consider return should my travels bring me to Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my second trip this year the air conditioning was not working properly -- the same complaint from a co-traveler in another room. A complaint at the desk gets a "Sorry" and nothing else for a response. Met many people in the elevators changing rooms -- not sure if it helped.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: No microwave. Small refrigerator. Did not clean under the bed. Always out of toilet paper. Good service, nice staff, and felt welcomed. No laundry in the hotel. Had to go to down the street to wash clothes. Elevators are to slow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: 3 mates staying one night in Waikiki before heading to the North Shore. Got a room on points and was upgraded upon request. Had a room with a partial ocean view, which wasn't bad being set so far back.Hotel is a little dated, but the room was terrific. Suite was spacious, bright and good facilities including a bar fridge. Waikiki Brewing Co is right next door, so you can give Trees a miss.Location is not bad. Short walk to the Hilton complex and close to major roads for airport access.Staff at front desk were really friendly. Hotel does its job admirably.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My mother & I stayed at the Double Tree (my second time, her third) on a business trip. Reservation was for Saturday-Thursday. We had a conference room reserved for a class we would be teaching through the week. We had our teaching supplies shipped to the hotel & were told at check-in to stop by the valet and they would get our boxes out of their hold cage. Sunday afternoon, I went down to pick up our boxes which had nearly $2000 in supplies in them. After nearly 30 minutes, I was told they could not locate them and they would let us know as soon as they found them. We never heard from anyone Sunday evening. Monday, the day our class started, still no boxes. We asked for some highlighters from the front desk, as they were part of the supplies we were missing. They were not very happy at our request, stating that those were the ones THEY used. We did our best with what we had, feeling less professional since we didn't have all of our class materials. Thankfully, our attendees were very understanding. The conference room was very noisy (it's a very busy area) & the lobby music was playing so loudly that people were having trouble concentrating. Tuesday, still NO boxes! They were nice enough to turn the music down since there was a speaker right outside the door (until the next shift came on & then it was cranked back up). I had to go buy calculators, pens, and pencils for the class at a 7-Eleven nearby that morning so we could get through our topics that day. Tuesday evening, we informed the front desk that we would be finished our class ahead of schedule and would be checking out Wednesday. They were going to charge us $100 for the early checkout until one of them noticed we were Hilton Diamond Members,so they waived that fee. Wednesday morning we packed up & dropped our things off with the valet and went to finish our class - still no boxes. I will say that the events manager, Jacob, did search the hotel high & low for our packages. He was in contact with us throughout this situation. The kicker is, this was not the first time this happened at this hotel, but the THIRD! Every trip for the same class, at the same hotel...they lost our supplies! On top of that two of the three elevators were not working most of our stay. And our room, while it had a partial ocean view, was a hefty downgrade from the room we had had previously. The sink was just a bowl mounted to the wall and angled downward so that you couldn't even set your toothbrush on it. We were both shocked that this was what they offered to their Diamond guests. I mention that again for a reason. After all of this, we were offered Hilton Points for our inconvenience. We were dumbfounded! This reservation was in my mother's name & she had over one million points at this time. What kind of compensation is that?! I was told that seemed reasonable since we were on business and must be reimbursed for all of our expenses. Wrong! When you own your own business, you don't get reimbursed for anything - it's all out of pocket! In the end, we were given a nominal amount refunded for our headaches. That amount barely covered one day in the conference room and didn't even touch the cost of our room. We would like to say thank you to sweet Elsa, who was at the front desk through most of this fiasco. She was very nice & as helpful as she could be. We did later find out that the hotel had shipped our packages out on Saturday. There was zero record of this anywhere. They did acknowledge this was a policy that needed to be corrected to prevent this from happening again. We were apologized to time and time again, but it just wasn't enough after a three-peat. We have a couple additional classes out there this year in which we had planned to stay at the Double Tree. We will not be giving them any more of our business.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is good for business and vacation . There are a seven eleven and a restaurant in walking distance. You can walk to the beach near Hilton hotel. You can not expect better quality for hotel staff because the hotel is located in Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff and great hotel. Perfect for business. My job requires me to sleep at weird hours and this is a perfect quiet place. It's short walking distance to all the fun places. Wing and Claire will check you in. They are finest in the hospitality industry! I was super impressed by how nice they are and their customer service!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We selected this hotel for its value using Hilton Honors points and walkable Waikiki location. Staff are attentive and professional. Rooms and overall hotel is tired. Our AC was weak in both rooms we stayed in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I usually want a beachfront hotel when I go to Hawaii, but we went here because my wife had a business meeting there, so I tagged along with the kid.PROSThe room itself and balcony are fairly spacious, and the price (corporate rate) was better than other chain Waikiki hotels. Check in/out was fast, and water was hot. The room also came with a fridge and plenty of drawer space. The bed and sheets were comfy. About 10 restaurants were within 2 blocks, and the beach was a 15 min walk (with stroller, you might be faster). The street is busy with plenty of taxis/Uber.CONSThe pool area was mostly shaded and had a layer of dirt/dust on the deck. Most of the hotel's common areas are cramped (halls, elevator, car drop off), as well as the room's bathroom (shower only). It's an old building, so this is expected. Also, the door did not shield hall noise very well. There was a lot of noisy construction outside, and the window didn't block the noise either. You have to walk a while to get to the tourist part of Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member, it's fair to say that I stay in hotels quite a bit. I've never been at a DoubleTree that felt so poorly managed and maintained as this hotel. Unfortunately, we booked this hotel for our honeymoon, and to say we were disappointed with our experience would be an understatement. First, a full breakfast is charged as a $8 upgrade for Diamond members-- what?! Since they couldn't provide a room upgrade for our honeymoon, I argued that at the very least they could upgrade our breakfast. I'm not sure why I had to ask for this (it's usually a standard benefit for Diamonds), but I did, and reluctantly, the front desk manager in duty agreed to do it... but not until I asked for it. So that was the start of our honeymoon vacation! Unfortunately, I didn't exactly know what I as asking for... the breakfast gave us diarrhea on 3 of our days. The restaurant was disgustingly dirty, and very poorly managed. Servers wore dirty uniforms and clearly weren't trained on how to offer a clean environment. Seeing how dirty the front of the house was, I can't imagine how disgusting the kitchen was-- but we didn't have to imagine, because we were made sick, which really ruined our honeymoon vacation. I'm reporting the hotel to the health department, because I'm quite sure they are in violation of health code.$30 per day to park your car, and there are no other options. You are required to valet your car. Sorry, but $30 a day is more than I paid for our rental car! That's a disgusting ripoff. Nothing like feeling you were ripped off by your hotel. And by the way, that doesn't include tips for valet staff... At that rate, the gratuity should certainly be included (but it's not). So expect to pay $35-45 per day to park at your hotel.The entire property was dated, dingy and dirty. The furniture in our room had stains. The mini fridge did not work. The replacement fridge showed up with black mold all over the door. The elevators weren't cleaned once (properly) during our weeklong stay-- gross! We just didn't want to touch anything in this hotel, because you could tell it was never cleaned properly.When we reported all of this, the front desk manager did apologize. And she told us they would finally upgrade us to a "suite". We got to our "suite" later that night only to find that it was in fact a downgrade. They wanted to give us HALF of a suite, with a pull down queen size Murphy bed (read kids bed). No thanks! We stayed in our regular room with king bed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had to stay over night due to Delta losing my keys. The stat was comfortable and the staff was excellent in helping me overcome the inconvenience. Room was average but clean and the shower was very nice (Rainwater adjustable).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member, I stay at quite a few Hilton properties across the Nation. And this stay has to rate as the worst one. I booked online with the additional option of upgrading at a discounted rate to their "Penthouse" suite. The listing on their website makes it appear grander than what you potentially get. On their website, they show a large room plus state that you get 2 balconies and they also show a private sun deck. And all of this is on their top floor leading one to believe you are getting something worthwhile. What they fail to tell you is that the sundecks are only if you get the rooms at the end of the hallway. So while I did get a Penthouse suite, all it meant was I had a separate bedroom from the living area and located on the 19th floor. In other words, something I would have received at an Embassy Suites or Homewood Suites. And let's not mention that the room smelled of dog. As for their breakfast, I skipped it even though I had a coupon. They have 2 types of breakfast, either continental or full buffet. With my coupon, I could only get the continental or pay $8.00 extra for the buffet. And the staff there is watching you like a hawk. I saw them go stand right next to a guy that was taking his buffet to go and not leave his side until he paid. This was my first stay here and my last. I definitely regret it since there are other Hilton properties to choose from.
user_name:
Daniel P
National City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The DoubleTree is a nice hotel. It is what I expected for a hotel on business travel. It seemed to cater to business travelers as well. The rooms are good with a nice desk work space and plenty of electrical outlets. The hotel is close to many excellent restaurants and the beach. The staff is friendly, the parking is 1/2 of what other hotels charge and you can't beat the warm cookie.It is just a 5 minute walk to Waikiki and the sister Hilton resort. This is a nice feature because you have access to much of the high end Hilton resort right on the beach. The downside is the pool is small and not fancy (hey Waikiki beach is a short walk) and the restaurant is more like a bar with a few tables and the bar doesn't open until 5:00 P.M.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a hotel with a good location (quiet and close to beach), a great service (parking, internet, and swimming pool, and gym) and a leisure room (living room, bed room, and bath room) cleanly everywhere. Nothing so good for stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here recently with the family while on a business trip. Had a room with two queen beds. Bathroom was nice with wood floors. Room was clean and ready upon arrival. Front desk staff was always friendly upon arrival back to the hotel, Enjoyed the stay. Car valets were awesome as well. Free Wi-Fi as hhonors member...must pay otherwise.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The positive the people were very nice, especially valet. However, for the room rate I was very disappointed. I will definitely go back to the Marriott next trip. The shower was super tiny. There wasn't even room to shave your legs. The bed wasn't very comfortable either and the "partial ocean view Lanai" was a tiny balcony and a view to a nasty parking lot complex below and a tiny view of the ocean far off in the distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Only major issue for us was that the a/c wouldn't get any cooler than 68. However, we text the front desk and they sent a maintenance guy up right away to override the thermostat and we were back to comfy again. We would stay here again for sure!
user_name:
Amy H
Little Rock, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel two nights while in Honolulu for a business trip. I found the hotel well kept, and the staff were very nice and friendly. Food in the restaurant/bar was fine and Earl the bartender was service oriented and treated you like a friend. Only issue with breakfast buffet (as most are) the food was not hot but a little north of warm.I stayed in a room on the 10th floor on the west side towards the very front of the hotel and from the balcony I could clearly see the ocean, Waikiki, and a nice park across the street.There are plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance of the hotel.Parking is valet only and was $30.00 daily.Overall positive experience and would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I can't rate this accommodation on value for money, as this was paid for by Jetstar due to cancellation of our flight.What I can say is that the room was large, clean, and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to fulfill all requests, even the little ones such as a band-aid! The hotel itself was a little further out of the way from the beach and from where we had been staying, and therefore, we didn't feel like hiking it down to the beach.Instead we made ourselves at home, lounging round the pool area which had lovely comfortable sun-lounges and two outside, big fluffy lounge settings with coffee tables.I would recommend this hotel for its comfort, friendliness, and it would be excellent for people in wheelchairs as they have a pool hoist, or for people who like walking, but for those who have bad backs, such as ourselves, it is a little too far out of from the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is okay if you're on business on Oahu. Easy to access freeways and your away from the Waikiki tourist stuff. Does not offer great dining but you have access to several close by restaurants that are within walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were very please with our stay at the Double Tree by Hilton Waikiki Beach. They were very helpful. It was very convenient to the beach, shopping and dinning. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The breakfast had a nice variety to choose from and if you needed to take it to go the staff was very accommodating. The rooms were roomy and quiet. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pretty poor check in process openly lied to by the checkin agent that no rooms were available as suites etc. probably got the worst room in the hotel facing a carpark with a loud air cond. is this how you treat diamond members? I got a great suite last time I have a choice when I stay at hiltons I will be staying elsewhere next time

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: On the positive side, hotel staff provides excellent service. Friendly and very accommodating folks. On the negative side, hotel rooms are in poor condition and in need of renovation/refurbishment. Furniture is dated and banged up with pieces of wood missing. Floor around door frames and in corners not clean. Rusting fixtures in bathroom. Air conditioning system did not cool room adequately. Upon entering room, there was a peculiar and unpleasant odor. There are many other hotel properties in Honolulu which offer better facilities and superior value.
user_name:
Ingemar G
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at the DoubleTree Alana a number of times for leisure activities, but this was my first experience I've had while traveling on business. As expected, the service was exceptional, from as early as booking my reservation to the check-out process. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family loves Hawaii, and when my college-age daughter suggested a trip over her spring break, I was happy to take her. We own a timeshare with Hilton, and typically stay at one of their Waikiki properties, but none were available on short notice.We chose the DoubleTree as a good alternative, close to the beach, close to shopping and close to the main part of Waikliki Beach.The hotel, while older, was well maintained, and seemed to have been remodeled in recent history. The lobby is a short escalator ride up from the entrance drive, with the restaurant on that level as well. There is an outdoor pool and seating area on the mezzanine level. While we didn't swim in the pool, the area was clean and we sit poolside to relax and read.Our room was medium sized, with a small refrigerator but no microwave oven, something that would have been handy. It was clean, and the housekeepers were conscientious and accommodating, bringing extra shampoo and conditioner for my daughter.As Hilton Hhonors members, we received a free continental breakfast each day. It was typical fare - breads, hot and cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, juices and coffee, with the option to convert to a full breakfast for an additional charge. Quality was good (especially the muffins and croissants), and service was quick.The big drawback for me was the limitation on parking. All parking is valet parking, and the attendants asked each afternoon if we would be going out again that evening, presumably to park vehicles two deep in the parking structure. It made for less spontaneity and longer wait times. That, and the parking charge ($30 per day at the time of our visit) were off-putting.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great Double Tree within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach, upscale shopping and good selection of restaurants. They offer a Noon check out - fabulous if you have a mid afternoon flight. Concierge and front desk folks were extremely helpful and personable.
user_name:
John J C
Camp Hill, PA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I continue to stay at this hotel as I feel safe, the staff is great, and the location is central to all my needs. This hotel is great for the business traveler. It is clean, comfortable and meets all my needs. I will definitely be staying here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We just stayed one night before flying home. The room was clean, roomy, and the view was better than I thought it would be. We overlooked Ft. DeRussey. We had a 5:00am wake up so we didn't use hotel amenities. Location is good, though not on the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I would like to say how awsome our visit was to your double tree. We stayed for about 2 weeks while we were looking for a place.to move too on the island. Everyone from valet, housekeeping and the front desk went above and beyond really showing that the Aloha spirit is alive.and well. Mahalo for your kindness

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff friendly & accommodating. Rooms could use some refurbishing. Safe and convenient location. Adequate pool on roof with a lounge area for social gatherings. Delicious cookies every day. One setting only for air conditioning. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at this place a few times before, this by far the best service received. Kuddos to the front desk team member MELISSA for checking us in, and upgrading us to a beautiful room. She definitely takes pride in her work that she does and is very genuine when speaking regardless of who you are and where you're from. I was greeted from ten feet away as I was approaching the desk. That never happens at some other places. You are usually the one Waiting in line to be acknowledged. Thank you Melissa!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was so friendly and clean. Arrived early and they accommodated us. Bar was fun and bartender was one of best ever encountered in a hotel bar. Food was fresh and good and drinks very good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone in Waikiki. Great location and excellent service. Wonderful cookies.
user_name:
Lorraine J
West Palm Beach, Florida

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Ok so this is a Hilton Property correct? We arrive around mid night and you can not self park and no one is their to park your car. We struggle with our luggage first up 4 or 5 steps and then try the elevator. Oh they close it down at night for the arrival floor. So up a very thin escalator with very wide baggage. Get to front desk and girl is friendly but says give me the keys and our manager will move it later. Oh yes sign this paper that says we are responsible for damage to your car. Well please have it move at this time as it is in the middle. No he is busy and will move it later. Busy at midnight? No one to help with bags and no baggage cart. You just got love it and we are paying how much to stay here? Get to room and it is ok. Bathroom very small. Bedroom was clean. Next morning only saving grace was the breakfast that was good. They forgot to make our room up. When I called they blamed me for leaving on do not disturb. That had not been on the door since 9:30 am. Then they said we sign up for dinner discount. No we never ate dinner nor did we intend to eat dinner at their restaurant. Finally cleaned but no coffee or bath items. Not very impressed for the cost of the room. They said we can go over to the Hilton just down the road and use it but then said no because we have not paid a resort fee. So which is it? This hotel needs help. Oh yes the room smelled from something and we had to air it out. Air conditioning only worked on high. No hot water in the morning on the first day. Wi-fi did not work well. You had to move yourself around the room to find a signal that you could use.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here over Chinese New Year (February). Average US style business hotel. Nothing exceedingly special or negative.A few blocks from the beach. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Small restaurant for breakfast. The restaurant/bar closes relatively early though at 11 PM (for a bar at least). Gym and pool were small. Not much of a lobby.Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Check-in, tour reservations, restaurant staff (despite being overwhelmed at breakfast with a large Chinese group) were great.If you just need a place to hang your hat and plan to be out during the day, this place was fine. Looking for a resort experience, this isn't it.No executive lounge for diamonds. Don't think our rooms were upgraded either. But that is common for US hotels I've found (Hawaii doesn't count as Asia/Pacific apparently, where hotels seems to be much nicer).Certainly would stay here again if on business. Probably not with family though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here on business for 4 days and it was just average. Great hotel staff however breakfast options can be better, the pillows in the hotel room can be bigger and free in room WiFi should be included. For a king sized bed, the pillows were tiny! Basic Gym with nice equipment and nice pool area overlooking Ala Moana Blvd. Waikiki Brewery next door made it worth it.
user_name:
MikeESanDiego
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We could walk everywhere from this location. There were some local restaurants within a few blocks, but the further away you walked the better they got, would not eat near hotel again. We were able to find our way all around, few minute walk to the beach, shopping, and marina area. We had a ocean view room with two balconies and love sitting out there in the morning having coffee. Also there were no resort fees added on to the rates like most of the rest of the Waikiki beach area hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is too far from the ocean, VERY NOISY, and the rooms are small and overpriced. The pool is tiny and shaded from the sun in the afternoons and there is no hot tub. Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I spent 4 days there, and got a nice upgrade to a suite (I have HHonor diamond membership) and have a nice experience. After checking out, I lost my charger there, I called them since I am still in Oahu, and got back smoothly later with the staff's help. Thanks for the nice help.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed twice at this hotel in the last few months on business-once in November and again in January. It is centrally located (but not on the beach and you can only glimpse the beach from the balcony if you're above the 10th floor or so.) Yes, it has the requisite cookies, but I'm not a fan of chocolate chip, so not a huge perk for me. Since I'm not a Hilton Diamond member, the hotel had no perks-no free coffee downstairs, no free breakfast, no free water. The hotel has some good points-central location, prompt valet service, and great bartender/servers in the restaurant, but the inconsistent service overall marred my stays. I called down to order room service the day I arrived and although I called several times over an hour, no one ever answered the phone. I decided to walk to ABC and get a salad instead (which was actually very good.) I was willing to give room service another try a few days later by ordering the continental breakfast delivered to my room at a set time-how can you mess that up? Well, you can if the food never arrives. I stopped in at the Front Desk in the afternoon to mention it and the lady simply looked at me--didn't even say I'm sorry-it was kind of odd. I then said I wanted to ensure I wasn't charged for anything and she double-checked and told me I hadn't been-then looked at me again. Very weird-it was like she was programmed not to say I'm sorry for anything. Call me crazy, but I tried again and actually got dinner to go once from the bar (fish and chips that was delicious). I ate in the bar a few times after that when I didn't feel like heading out for dinner and all of the meals were delicious and fast. Buoyed by my success, I decided to try the continental breakfast delivery again, and while it came to my door on time, it contained only coffee and juice. When I told the very nice man I had ordered the complete breakfast, he told me to hang on a few minutes and then brought me back double of everything at no charge and was effusive in his apologies. The valet service was also inconsistent--it was always fast, but not always pleasant. I realize that's not a great job, but a few times the guys at the counter were almost hostile. (It's also $30 per night to park-you have to pay to park anywhere in Waikiki, but this is at the high end of what I've ever paid.) Maid service was also all over the road. I think I had a great maid once, but the rest appeared to do nothing but change the towels and make the bed-some left trash in the trash cans, others didn't refill the used coffee supplies or provide new shampoo bottles, etc. Finally, my room smelled a bit like wet dog, at least that was my first impression. I thought it might've been a room that hadn't been used lately, but one of my coworkers mentioned the funky smell in her room, too. Not sure what it meant, but I got some air freshener that I used liberally and hoped I wasn't breathing in black mold living in the walls or something. All-in-all, I don't plan to stay here again unless I absolutely can't find anything else.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel to O'ahu every other week for business and have stayed at multiple Waikiki locations. I refuse to stay any where else these days after experiencing what the double tree has to offer. They are professional, courteous and just honestly care about our experience to the island. The hotel staff is top notch and always willing to help with a smile on their faces. The bartender Earl with his crew in the restaurant are always attentive and happy. There is no other place I would want to stay on the island for such a good rate. Mahalo nui Lao,Stan

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Thanks for the great stay. I like cookies! Note the parking priced did seem high from my point of view but I guess it was competitively priced compared to other hotels. Short walking distance from from all the places that were on and poppin.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem! It's located very conveniently to both Waikiki AND the Hawai'i Convention Center/Ala Moana Shopping Center. I LOVE staying here! The staff is friendly and SUPER helpful...and the beds are extremely comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: whole 10th floor and our room very musty nasty smell. talked to front desk numerous time but were ignored finally just gave up.desk would never call you back.best part of hotel is small gym.we used honors points but should have used them elsewhere.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located in Waikiki. The rooms are comfortably spacious and all have a little terrace with 2 chairs and a small table. I stayed in room 1004 and I must admit my only complaint was about the smell of the hallway. Although, it is not a spoiled meat or rotten fish smell it is a uniquely nauseating one. I mentioned this several times to the front desk team and they did pass the information along. I also received a credit towards my bill. However, in a time where almost every hotel is piping in wonderful lavenders and calming green tea scents I was very surprised at how bad the hallway smelled. I would return if this issue is corrected. Overall, great staff and nice quiet pool area.
user_name:
TomikaMorgan
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A Hilton Honors member, I arrived at 10PM to find that my room was "not yet available." The hotel staff was apologetic and was kind enough to buy my dinner while I waited for my room to be cleaned. 45 minutes later I was handed a key to my room and ascended to find that I had been given the key to a room that was piled with trash, had an unmade bed and no towels. The front desk staff was again very apologetic and by 11:15 I was finally in my room. The staff apologized profusely, but I expect the manager could have done more to ensure that the hotel was ready for guests arriving later at night. The room I finally got was clean and well maintained, and the food in the hotel restaurant/bar was adequate. Staff was friendly in spite of the difficulties upon arrival.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent Hotel. The staff had a high level of professionalism. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The Double Tree is within a short walk to the Hilton Resort, where you can use the Resort area as a Hilton member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: In Honolulu for business a few times to conduct leadership training based on my books and stayed at the DoubleTree. Walking distance of the beach and of the Ala Moana shopping center. Short taxi ride to the university and the East-West Center. Loved on arrival that they give you a warm cookie--better than a lei!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for six nights while here on business. The room was very nice except the bathroom is very small but way better than it use to be. The staff at this hotel was fantastic very helpful and I love the new text program they are doing. Just send a text if you need anything what a great idea. I also thought the breakfast was good. Perfect hotel for the business travelers.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms are clean and the hotel stuffs are cooperative but the Bell boys are not cooperative at all, and I am really very much shocked with their behavior pattern . Initially they were showing less interest to take our luggage upper stairs which was so annoying. I love the location because our conference was held on Hilton Hawaiian village which is just 5 mins to walk. The breakfast was standard American style, which is ok for us. But the price was a bit high compared to other hotel at this standard, may be this is because of Hilton . I love the hotel location

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here with a group and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are good sized, have mini refrigerators, terraces overlooking the city. Staff was extremely friendly. Many, many restaurants, shops and beaches are within walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's on the edge of Waikiki and easy to get in and out (Valet parking only - $30 per night). You can walk to Ala Moana mall and other places in Waikiki. Or take the buses that come by often. The property is corporate, clean, and friendly. They have a small workout room and a small pool. I would stay here again assuming the price is comparable to other locations (rates are all over the place on any given day depending on occupancy.)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I arrived in Honolulu at 630 am after an all night flight from Korea via Japan. I had meetings scheduled for the morning and really needed a shower and change of clothes. The hotel was sold -out the night before but my room was available by 920 am. I really appreciate the extra effort by the staff.
user_name:
Anthony G
san antonio, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is at the end of the Waikiki district nearest downtown, which was good for my needs. The place was clean, and the staff was helpful - especially the valets. Great service from those guys, and always a nice welcome after the work day. The lobby/public spaces are utilitarian and clean - but you're not in Hawaii to sit around your hotel lobby or restaurant, right? Rooms have a slight tropical smell - not dirty, just that little bit of mustiness you get in any room in a humid climate where they feel the need to have carpets in the rooms. I had two different rooms because it was a split stay, and both had this - but I got used to it quickly and there really wasn't anything else about the room to remind me of it once I'd adjusted. Comfy bed, decent view (not like breathtaking oceanic splendor, but ocean was visible between hi-rises. Bathrooms were really quite nice - took a sec to figure out how the shower knobs worked, but actually a clever system once you catch on. Glass doors to the shower, no tub. Very clean all the way around. If I go to Honolulu again on business, I'd be glad to stay here again. One warning for those going to Honolulu for the first time: rush hour traffic is nuts. Staying close to downtown so we didn't have to use the freeway at those times was a big plus, but I wouldn't stay here if I were working over by Pearl Harbor - just too far at commuting times.
user_name:
Rohrbach
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in a suite, with a family of five! It was quite small, however they were accommodating! We changed the room around a little so the three teenage children had their own space and there was a sliding door between us and the children which gave us a little privacy. There was a decent sized bathroom and housekeeping were fantastic as they replenished what we needed on request without charge. The location was fantastic, we were a 10 minute walk to the Waikiki strip which included all the high end stores. A 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach which was our relaxing spot with a spectacular view of Diamond Head. If thinking of shopping, it was only a 20 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Mall which has many shops! Loved shopping there! If needing your laundry done, it is a 5 minute walk to the laundramatte, which is behind the 7 Eleven store. The warm cookies were delicious which you can request every day! We ate their breakfast which was also delicious, especially the omelettes and waffles! The service was good as well!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a Hilton Honors Member (Diamond) I normally stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, Embassy Suites or Doubletree – unfortunately the Doubletree has deteriorated quite significantly in quality of the overall facility and rooms. On this trip travelled with two other business associates, both Diamond Members, and their evaluation of the facility are the same as mine – unfortunate as the hotel used to be a good choice when coming to Waikiki. Upon entering the room, from lights not working to cigarette burns in the bed cover to the door in front of the refrigerator broken – my initial impression was not good. One business partner had issues with his A/C not cooling the room and my other business partner had bathroom issues and we were all on different floors. There are much better Hilton properties in Waikiki.I must say, to be fair the check-in staff was very nice and efficient and the valet ($30/day) move quick to get your car out in the morning. Gym has good number of cardio and one weight machine for use – restaurant for both breakfast and dinner dining is average.Will remove this property from further stays in Hawaii until investments are made to improve the property and provide value for price paid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staying in Waikiki before heading to Kauai, a great location right downtown in a nice area surrounded by shopping. Rooms in need of updating and be careful or breakfast could cost you big. You pay a big price to be in Downtown Waikiki but a full breakfast is not even included. If you come with another couple or kids, well nothing is included for them. The rooms are not very exciting either, in need of updating for sure.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was afraid that I would not be happy with this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but it was fine for me. The staff here are all very nice and honored all my requests. The hotel also has free internet in the business center which is rare to find at some hotels in Waikiki. Of course, you do have free Wifi in your room if you are a HHonors member and book direct. There was also a microwave in the business center that guests can use to heat up dinners or leftovers. The gym was nice and kept clean. There were 2 treadmills, 3 Elipticials and 1 bike as well as a few weights. The pool area was a little small, but the water seemed warm (I did not use it but tested the water). The room was basic but clean. The refrigerator is small and can really only hold a few drinks. The bathroom was small and there was no counter space in mine, but the room did have a lot of shelves that you could store things on as well as a closet. Note that this hotel is a bit of a walk to the center of Waikiki. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is only about a 5 minute walk and you can take the beach path down to Waikiki from there which I prefer to the streets. I cannot comment on the restaurant. Breakfast was not included in my rate nor offered because I am only silver. I would stay here again but if you want to be down in the heart of Waikiki, it might be a little out of the way for some people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my first visit to the great state of HI. It was great. Looking forward to coming back. Staff was very helpful. I left a package in the room when I check out. My sister called, they located the package...called for pick up...so great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently stayed at the royal hawaiian, sheraton waikiki and the double tree. Yes, all hotels are very nice but I have to say when it comes to staff, I was amazed on how every single person from valet, concierge, maids and every person in the restaurant was so extremely nice, professional and friendly. They were all genuinely nice. I love this hotel just for the staff alone. Highly recommmded :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The pros: nice staff. Valet, front desk all were very pleasant to deal with. Nice view of the park. Location was perfect distance from the places we needed to be. Didn't have to deal with Kalakaua traffic. Beds were comfortable. Requested extra pillows which were in the room upon arrival. And those cookies!My biggest gripe was the bathroom. the small the shower looked nice but it leaked. I guess the seal in the door needs to be changed because after showing there was a huge puddle. There was absolutely no counter space.No where to place personal items. Had to stand to the side of the sink to brush teeth because of a small shelf on the wall next to it which made it hard to stand directly in front. Also, as soon as you even crack open the room door you look straight into the bathroom.Overall, this is an ok hotel. If you dont care about luxury then this'll do. In my opinion it was a little pricey for what you got (over$200/nt)I don't think I'd stay more than one night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
