review_body: Spacious room, comfy bed and a balcony to sit and enjoy the great ocean view. Small pool to dip in if you don't have time to hit the beach. Good restaurant, excellent location and close walking distance to the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree. The location is great for walking all over Waikiki and if you don't want to walk the entire distance there are buses within a 2 block walk. The staff were friendly and the room was immaculate. We had a room with a balcony and really enjoyed being able to sit outside. Breakfast was not included but very good. The pool is on the small size, but works. We would stay here again dependent upon rates.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Booked on points for 1 night. My friend checked in before me as he arrive earlier in HNL. Although I gave his name to the Hilton reservation team, he told me there was a bit of confusion given he was not the main guest. Finally, that was resolved.The room was smallish, with 2 beds, LCD TV, free wifi, decent view, smallish but clean bathroom. The gym was well appointed, with cardio and weight equipment, and the outside pool was decent depth. As a gold member, we were handed vouchers for continental breakfast (access to buffet, except warm items) and for 7$ more, we opted to gain full access: eggs made to order, Portuguese sausage, potatoes, pancake, etc...Parking is 30$ a night, valet...that's pretty much the norm in this area,Overall, liked this place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here overnight, after flying to Hawaii from Australia, on our way to Kona. It was simple at best, not terrible at worst. A few things in our room didn't work such as the sliding door to the bathroom, which was less than ideal. Our daughter played in the pool in the late afternoon, following our arrival and the staff give out free cookies. Overall it did the job but was a little costly given how much we paid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a very nice hotel with very friendly staff. We stayed in a penthouse suite on the 19th floor, which sounds awesome, but was a bit of a disappointment considering it was a penthouse. It has an entryway with a wet bar that opens into the large room with a desk, couch/chair/table and large bed all in one room. This would be fantastic for couples, but it's not so great with children, as everything is in one room. We put our baby's pack n play in the entryway, but nap times were hard on everyone. She was trying to fall asleep and our 4 year old was trying to be quiet so not to wake her, but it was difficult with us all in one room. The bathroom was very large and generous, with lots of wasted free space and the toilet was so close to the bathtub that you couldn't sit on it straight. The outdoor balcony was small but adequate. As for the hotel itself, it is very clean, with a decent heated salt water pool, though it shades up around mid day making it a bit too cool in the afternoon. The restaurant has decent, if overpriced food. Nightly drink and pupu specials. Free cookies and water for diamond members. I wish they had a play area for children located somewhere on the premises. Valet parking $30/day. The Wifi is free for diamond members, though it regularly goes out. Near shops, restaurants and the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at the Double Tree for 4 nights in business. They have government rates but you have to book quick because they fill up fast (not unlike any other hotel in HI). The valet were nice and quick, you do have to valet you're vehicle at this hotel and it's about $30 a day. The ladies at the reception counter were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The room was clean and the view was nice although I didn't spend too much time indoors. They have a 24hr gym that's pretty nice, 2 treadmills, 3 elliptical machines, some bikes and weight set. There was also a pool but I didn't use it. I had breakfast vouchers and thought the buffet was filling and met my needs. I would definitely stay there again, it's a great location and within walking distance to the beach and many restaurants and shopping places on the main strip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have no complaints about the location. Yes being located on a very busy street causes traffic in and out, noise in the lobby and rooms but you should expect that being in such a busy and congested city. The hotel itself is old and showing it's age. We had a constant draft through the sliding glass door that sounded like howling wind all night in addition to the traffic noise. Lots of things in the room were cracked or broken. Walls had cracks and paint was chipping. Short circuit in the bedroom light caused the light to turn on at random times (2 am). Beds were comfortable, but it ws hard to keep a constant temperature in the room due to the draft and open windows in the hallways.  Worst of all was the noise in the rooms. Walls are very very very thin. We could hear somebody in the next room snoring all night. Then at the crack of 6:30 am what sounded like 16 screaming children woke up and started crying, yelling, slamming doors, cabinets, drawers and being a complete nuisance. The volume of the noise was inexcusable. We didn't try the breakfast because the wait was about 40 minutes every morning. The lobby was always congested in the morning with people waiting for breakfast. The distance to the beach was fine for anybody capable of walking 4-5 blocks. No view of the beach from the room whatsoever. Hardest working valets in the business. Parking is by valet only and expensive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a hotel that is in the middle of town, kind of on the outer end of it. It is not in a great spot, but not bad. However, it is an exponential step up from the significantly more costly than Hilton Waikiki Village. The rooms are nicer, cleaner, better apportioned, and far more modern. The staff is warm and accommodating. I left the Village to come here due to a late flight and I cannot say a single bad thing about this place. Understanding that it is away from the beach and thus, not really a tourist spot - if you want to save money and go to a place where you will be valued, this is the spot. When compared to that disgusting, dilapidated excuse for a resort, the Hilton Waikiki Village, this was a massive improvement. BY THE WAY - the WiFi in this hotel is light years ahead of that Village... I mean, the difference between carrier pigeon (Hilton Waikiki Village) vs 21st Century (Doubletree).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We decided to take a 3-day vacation the last minute. Since it was during the Christmas/New Year peak season, I could only find this place which had relatively good location and price. Upon check-in, I got upgraded to a suite for the first night, but the free upgrades for the other 2 nights were sold out, so I decided to pay for them at $40 per night. Then I found out the suite is right next to the elevator; later a hotel staff told me that all of their suites are located next to elevators. This might not be an issue if they had good sound proofing. But I could hear the noises when the elevator was moving; worst of all, there was a constant, low humming noise that was really annoying at night. The staff was very helpful and offered to switch to a standard room for us, but we decided to stay put since it was a only short stay and we didn't want to repack our luggage and stuff. I just wish that they could have warned about the noise issue when they were upselling the upgrades. Also our suite came with double beds whereas my originally booked room had queens. Yet another detail they forgot to mention LOL.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just far enough from most vacation centric areas to make walking a pain and they had issues figuring out that we didn't have a car. Initially charged us for parking then it took 4 phone calls to get the credit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here my last night in town. Was at another Hilton property and needed to extend my original stay, so was booked here. The hotel is on the busy (and construction delayed) Ala Moana Blvd. When you arrive, you have to walk up some very steep stairs to get to the lower lobby. I had a heavy suitcase and it wasn't easy to handle. Once I completed the task, I noticed a bellman who was standing there watching me struggle. No assistance offered. Later, I discovered, I could have walked in to the garage and wheeled my luggage in. I went to the lobby to check in. It was 2pm. I was told my room wasn't ready and I could check my luggage. They took my cell number and told me they would call when it was ready. I never got a call. Just returned to the hotel after 5 and checked in. Not a good start.I was upgraded to a room on the top floor. It was nice and large. I wish I could have stayed there longer. The views were mostly of other apartment buildings. It is an older hotel, but if you can get a good deal, you might try it for a short stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: as a family we enjoyed our stay at the alana. it is a boutique hotel at the begining of waikiki. the hotel was a good value i booked a suite at the peak season and was one of the best rates around. staff was very friendly, and made every effort to make our family vacation comfortable. room was of good size and comfortable, quality of furniture and amenities was good. it is a boutique hotel, so scale and size of restaurants, pool, looby ets will be on smaller size, we found it to be a good value for time of year. Service was excellent. majority of suite rooms are next to the elevator, but noice from elevator bank was rarely noticeable. overall we had a very good experience
user_name:
Noshir P
carlsbad, ca, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The DoubleTree is in the Hilton chain and costs less than the rooms at Hilton Hawaiian Village. The location is great- easy walking distance to the beach and all the Hilton Hawaiian Village has to offer. The Expedia concierge (Christian- you rock!) was super helpful in setting up 5 days of activities for us. The room was comfortable, and we slept well. Wifi was good. It was nice having a restaurant attached to the hotel, but the seating capacity was limited, especially at breakfast time leading to 15-30 minute wait times for a table. As Hilton diamond members, we had no special treatment, and also had to pay $8 to upgrade our complementary continental breakfast to a full hot breakfast- even when I asked at the front desk. "That's the policy of this hotel"- but not Hilton policy. So- pluses and minuses.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The staff is incredible and will do whatever it takes to make your stay the best possible. Clinton Y. -- the manager is top notch -- again going above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay the best possible. We are using hilton honors points and our room is amazing. We have a mini-suit and well worth the cost to upgrade. Clean, comfortable, roomy. Our 2 boys have their space and we have ours. The hotel is near a lot of restaurants. 2 shortly blocks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village where you can play on the beach and in their lagoon. A short mile walk to Wal-Mart if you need anything. My luggage was lost by my airline and the front desk staff did whatever they could to get me the essentials I needed to get thru the night. The continental breakfast that our hilton honors diamond status gave us at the hotel Is just perfect to start the day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good clean hotel. A little out of the way from main strips of Waikiki but definitely within walking distance for adults. A little inconvenient if you plan to stay on the beach most days.It's on the main rain road so balcony pretty unusable due to noise. Buffet breakfast spread is ok but not enough variety to keep eating there for more than a 3 days. The rooms are pretty much as pictured on the website. I found the Shower pressure weak. Overall a good value hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here last week with my family. Short walking distance from Waikiki Beach. Lots of eateries around. Definitely a "middle of the road" type of hotel. Parking at $30/day is a bit high, but still ok considering how expensive taxis are in Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: They gave away the room I had (via HIlton Honors) already checked in to online, and put us in a room without enough beds. It took an hour at midnight with tired kids to sort it out. The front desk was ok but poor communication and when a manager got involved it got worse. He started making excuses. Finally we ended up with the desk clerks original solution from an hour earlier: rather than our lovely suite, they split us up into two standard rooms (fun Christmas morning tomorrow, huh?). Oh but they gave us a FOOD credit for their restaurant. I want my suite that sleeps 5 (yes, Mr. Manager, it says it on the reservation I printed out... Not a room for one like you claimed). And I want my balcony. And I probably don't want to eat in your restaurant. I assumed it was a Hilton property and would be fine. Guess this is why you should always read reviews. Fool me once...
user_name:
Ellen P
Haskins, Ohio, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family of 5 (3 children) stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We chose this hotel to be near the start line of honolulu marathon.The check in process was very efficient and we were given yummy choc chips cookies. The room was very comfortable and good enough size, with extra living room-like annexed to the main bedroom. Sofa bed in the living room and both main bed and sofa bed were very comfy.Location was great ! Close to everything, there's do it yourself laundry not far from the hotel, 7-11 nearby when you need some provisions, plenty of restaurants in the vicinity.We didn't try the pool but it's decent size, the gym looked great tho I didn't try as I prefer to run outdoor.Overall great stay !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Didn't find this place very pleasing, located at a 20 minutes walking distance from Waikiki beach. Rooms were good but services were ok.Not recommended for those whose need feel of a beach resort. Overall a fair experience nothing wow about this place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is located at a walking distance from the Waikiki beach. This is an economy hotel (although the hotel is a bit expensive if you want to visit Hawaii in Winter). The hotel room was different from what I expected (I expected similar hotels in San Francisco which I stayed before). The hotel looked a bit old, but the bed was comfortable though. However, the people at the front desk were very kind and nice. I am not sure if I will stay at the hotel again by paying for the room rate, maybe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is perfectly acceptable if you are just stopping over in Honolulu and staying for a night or two. I wouldn't recommend it for longer stays. It's not a resort style hotel, it's more of a business class hotel. The pool area is small and the beach is a decent walk away. The room furnishings and bathrooms are quite nice and our room had a balcony overlooking the ocean (partial) which was also quite nice. The restaurant area is small but the breakfast offering adequate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment of arrival, the valet staff was cordial and polite. The front desk clerk who checked me in was awesome and did everything to assure I had a quality room on an upper floor. The beds were so comfortable and the bathroom amenities and towels were excellent. The room attendant gave a warm greeting each of the three days I was there. Further, as a bonus, the chocolate cookies were to die for. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I decided to spend Thanksgiving in Honolulu without much advance planning. We were seeking a place that would serve as more of a comfortable, well-located crash pad than a fancy resort and this property met our expectations. The staff was always friendly and helpful and we had breakfast in the on-site restaurant once, which was decent. The hotel is close to the main walking and dining areas in Waikiki, but you really do need a car to get to decent snorkeling, hiking, etc. We decided to upgrade our room upon arrival and had a partial water view with lots of greenery (I think it was room 1611). Having a balcony was wonderful, as we could enjoy the view and allow our wet swimsuits and towels to dry outside. We also appreciated having a small refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave, but did not use them often. We had very few issues, but we found the walls to be very thin and could hear EVERYTHING in the hallways and nearby rooms. This included doors slamming at all hours, which was pretty jarring in the middle of the night. Additionally, we slept in our first morning after arriving and, as a result, our room did not get cleaned that day. We had to track down the cleaning staff the next day and ensure that our room would not be missed again, as we were desperate for new towels and for our trashcans to be emptied. If you are looking for friendly staff, a good location and basic amenities, this hotel is great. If you are seeking more of a resort feel or a beachside property, you will need to consider other options.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Would I stay here again? Yes, but it wasn't perfect, though it could have been.*Positive: Breakfast - the food is fresh (except the pastries were a bit dry and juice was reconstituted). Omelettes are delicious and super quick. Chef was happy to prepare the fillings without the egg (i.e. fried up my spinach, peppers (capsicum), onion & mushrooms but without the egg). B'fast from 6am, including take away if you have an early start or they can prepare a continental for you if you need it before 6am. Well stocked through to 10am (one of our party tested this).Size of room including bathroom - Room (1105) really good size for 2A and 2C (teen & pre teen). Plenty of storage space. Shower okay but would have been nice if a bit wider; plenty of length. Shower head beautiful.Lifts - (We were on the 11th floor) Great until the weekend when things got super busy then slow (obviously).Valet - Oh my, what friendly, beautiful, kind, lovely people. Thank you, thank you!Bar including evening restaurant - Oh, Earl, you are a beautiful person; so friendly and contributed to but never dominated conversation and no tall tales. Just a genuinely lovely person. Restaurant/bar was very handy when some of our party fell ill (totally unrelated to the accommodation/restaurant); healthy people could eat close by to those who stayed in the room due to ill health. Front desk - Helpful and patient except for a charging problem I'll address below.Street access - Easy entry driving and walking though signage for the hotel was set back from the street. We were dropped off by shuttle so this wasn't a problem but if arriving under your own steam, trust the GPS.Bag storage after check out - Yes and easy to collect (deposit and collect through valet).Pool area - spacious and a good sized pool including outdoor seating however, it is outdoors so if using the seating to relax, you'll need to take refuge when the showers come. Plenty of towels, near the gym, for pool use.Housekeeping - friendly and quick. Accommodated my needs due to illness.*Neutral:Bed - Too soft for us but it didn't dip. Feather bedding was lovely to sleep under.Gym - Can't comment as we're not gym users but it was there and there were plenty of towels.Location - Not close to Waikiki central but close enough to eateries, really close to car hire and we didn't have to drive through the horrible Waikiki traffic.View - We had ocean view. It is partial, through the gaps in a few buildings and set back well from the beach but the ocean is there. Outlook is over the main road (Ala Moana Blvd)*Negative: Charging - I had prepaid the room, which included wifi & breakfast. We didn't check in with a car. We were asked for a c/card at check in for "incidentals". A $200 hold was applied to the card but I wasn't told this would occur or the value of the hold. I noted this hold a day or 2 later and enquired at reception why so much was held. I was told the reason was not known & I'd need to speak to the staff member who created the transaction, I wasn't told how to contact this staff member so I emailed the Hilton Doubletree directly for an explanation but didn't receive a reply (email sent almost 2 weeks ago at the time of writing). I returned to reception a few days later and enquired again and was told it was likely a system error.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My stay was the third time spending a week working in Honolulu. I'm a huge fan. I love the location which is close to everything I want when I have free time - easy walk to the beach, great places to eat, drink and listen to music, watch the sunset - all without excessive cost, crowds and the somewhat irritating resort fee the Hilton Village implemented a few years ago. I especially appreciate the staff at this hotel who are incredibly welcoming, responsive and generally lovely people. My favorite is Brittany who works in the restaurant, is all of that and always offers wonderful hospitality.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at the hotel for over a week. The staff is what really makes this hotel good to stay at. Every single employee was super nice and friendly, especially the restaurant staff. The staff was accommodating and did their best to make as comfortable. I could not have found a better place. It is not a resort, but you can indulge in all the activities through the concierge or from the many many companies in Waikiki.I really enjoyed my stay, however if I had been upgraded it would have been really nice, since the room that I got was pretty small. With 2 queen beds in the room there was hardly any room for anything else. Also, there was no tub in the bathroom, but that was OK with me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel needs remodeling the room I had which was a penthouse had old furniture, bed was small and squicky and you can feel the bed springs when laying down. Bathroom was small, only thing nice was the private deck it provides with nice views.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room smelled and was not clean and fresh each day. The air conditioner was not capable of lowering the humidity in the room and it was so humid it ruined one of my books. Would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 1 night as a Hilton Diamond member. The room smelt musty and damp and the door to the room did not close properly. Breakfast was average and required an $8 upgrade to hot food which in fact turned out to be cold. Expensive property that feels run down and in need of a re-model. Will definitely not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The DT Hotel has the friendliest service in the Waikiki area. They are always welcoming and accommodating. The hotel rooms are comfy and relaxing, with high quality decor, especially the showers and beds. I am a frequent visit and it feels like being at home, but nicer.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good stay, hotel was very clean and close to everything. Service was great except housekeeper on the 6th floor was quite rude. We enjoyed the gym to include the outdoor pool.This year we finally had the best stay in this hotel. We come here every year and this stay was great by far. Thank you for the good experienced this time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I "had" to go to Waikiki for a conference. As a result my wife and kids and my wife's mom had to come with me. We stayed a week on our own at a timeshare and then into Waikiki for the conference. It was at the Hilton on the beach so we stayed in a really nice suite at the Doubletree for the same rate as the conference rates at the Hilton. We had a room with two double beds that had a sitting room with a pullout couch that was separated by a pocket door and the bathroom had access from either the bedroom area or the sitting room. It was perfect for three adults, one young boy (on the pullout) and our daughter in her crib. Everyone at the hotel was super helpful, our room was clean. We didn't have the best Hawaii view but for us we had a better view. Our room was immediately above the pool so my wife or I could swim with one kid while the other supervised the other napping in the room and we could chat back and forth from the balcony. The wifi was great we had three devices going all the time with no trouble. I had to get a suit dry-cleaned ( I know a suit in Waikiki, I was there for work remember) and they got it back to me next day and perfect. We didn't eat much at the lobby lounge but enjoyed what we did. Romeo was training at the bar and was a hoot. This property isn't on the beach but it's a quick walk through one intersection to get you to the Hilton, its lagoon and the beach. I took surfing lessons right by the Hilton for US$90 as part of a group and it was awesome. If you're trying to figure out how to sleep a complicated group like we were this is for sure the place for you. It might not have as many stars in the book as the Hilton across the street but it has way more stars in our hearts.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel a few times; I stayed this most recent time for a single night.Unfortunately, as an HHonors Diamond, they couldn't upgrade me to a high floor suite this stay, but they did give me a corner room.For breakfast, they provide a basic continental as the HHonors perk; for additional fee, you can upgrade to a hot breakfast which includes an omelet station and the ability to indulge in fresh sausage/bacon. Breakfast is fine, especially for the dollar paid.The hotel is a few blocks from the beach, with most ocean views blocked by the Hilton Hawaiian Village resort complex. However, if you turn your head just right, you can see some water. Otherwise you have views of the city, which aren't too bad on their own.This makes for a good business hotel --not many on-site amenities for vacationers (i.e.: scenic views, lavish pools, beach), but there are other Hilton family destinations better suited for that within blocks of this hotel.Room was clean, quiet, and cool...and provided good WiFi and good work space.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree is in Waikiki and located within walking distance of all the places you want to go. Beaches, shopping, restaurants, Ala Moana, etc. Very reasonably priced. This was my view and the PH room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location at the edge of Waikiki and close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, the bus line and the beaches. Very quiet hotel and recently updated. The continental breakfast was a very good value. Service was excellent and staff was both friendly and helpful
user_name:
Alan P
San Marcos, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a diamond member of Hilton and used my points to book our stay. Although it was a good location with an easy walk to shopping and the beach,.. I will most likely try the Hilton Hawaiian next visit as it was right on the beach with everything you would need right there. Our room was clean, but the area outside smelled like sewer and only one elevator was working all 4 days. (It wasn't Hiltons fault, it just is what it is) Diamond member breakfast is continental requiring paid upgrade to a hot one which is okay, just good to know. Front staff were kind to our Aspergers teenager who went for cookies every evening. No self parking, only valet... But we found you really don't need a car at all once you get here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is not along the beach but a walking distance to the Ala Moana Mall. Parking is by valet only but attendant deliver car at reasonable time. A little difficult to find the hotel if you're new in Honolulu with no easy U-turn if driving and coming from the airport. There is a mini-ref inside room and coffee maker that I did not use. My assigned room has balcony facing the Ala Moana Blvd. No bath tub, only standing shower. Local newspaper at the front desk in the morning. I called for wake-up call that did not happen. Fortunately, I woke up early. Good for business use to spend the nights which I was there for a week. I would pick a different hotel by the beach for leisure vacation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The facility and staff were really terrific. The manager (Hendrik) was so very helpful and accommodating. Colleen in the restaurant was awesome...she was pleasant and very courteous and was aware of the customer needs. She always had a smile... My only issues were 1. the magnified mirror in the bathroom would have worked really well if you didn't have to lay on the floor to use it..the mechanism that holds it upright would not tighten and I was in two rooms and it was the same in both 2. The shower floor when wet is quite slippery and I was afraid to fall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: People at the front desk are excellent, always listening to your request to make sure you will have an excellent stay. My wife and I had a flight delay with our Airline and they were good enough to keep our room and make sure we have a happy stay with them. I have to say thank you again to Tianya Malama, Assitant Front Office Manager. She made sure we would remember our visit at the Double Tree Alana Waikiki Beach. She was very comprehensive with our situation and she was very good taking care of us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed here our last night in Honolulu before heading home. We were interested in a location fairly close to the airport and didn't need a resort look or feel. Room: The room was a standard 2 double bed with a mountain 'view'. Pictures below. Nothing special about it. It was clean but they are dated and could use a refresh. Location: The hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach and the shopping area surrounding Hilton Hawaiian Village so there are several shopping and eating options within walking distance. Staff: We interacted with bell persons, front desk, and restaurant and everyone was nice and helpful. Value: We reserved and paid the Advanced Pay rate through Hilton so we got a discount. Anywhere else I would say the room cost more than it should but in Honolulu it was probably within expected range.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my second stay at this Double Tree. Each time I've had a good experience. The staff is very friendly and the location is great for exploring the Waikiki area. It's not right on the beach, but I don't mind; it's just a quick walk down the street and through the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Parking is valet and fairly easy in/easy out. The rooms have modern decor, including updated bathrooms. This last time I had a room on the fifth floor right along Ala Moana Blvd. The patio was extended since it was above the pool, but there was increased noise from the nearby intersection. I had stayed on the 11th floor closer to the Ena Rd side during my previous stay and didn't notice any noise. I have noticed the rooms and hallways can get warm and a little humid depending on the day. I've chalked it up to less than ideal air circulation. I wouldn't say it's a problem per se and it obviously hasn't deterred me from coming back! I ate at the hotel restaurant during my first stay here (summer of 2013) and thought the food was good--perfect for getting a quick bite after a long day of flying. Bottom line--I like the ease of staying here. It's less chaotic than the resorts and the staff has always been kind to me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for one night after our cruise. As we arrived straight from the ship, our room was not ready but they allowed us to leave our luggage with them so were able to go out and explore. By 1.30pm, we returned but were told that the room would not be ready until after 3.00pm. They allowed us to use their pool on the mezzanine level. The pool was nice with comfortable sunbeds and parasols. Once we had been checked in we went up to our room on floor 14 which faced the sea. The room was clean and had everything you needed. The hotel is situated on one of the main roads so traffic noise was a bit of a problem. I'm sure if you stayed longer than one night, it would be something you would get used to though.Free wi-fi in the lounge are was available.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed with some friends at the Alana this weekend during a medical conference that we were attending in Waikiki. The Alana has really nice comfortable rooms. We had a little suite with two double beds, and a little living room area. There was a wet bar area which made things super convenient and a mini fridge so we were able to keep some staples on hand. I would definitely recommend staying at the Alana Double Tree! Oh! and don't forget the cookies! Yum! As with all Double Tree Hotels they always have warm cookies at the front desk! The little restaurant was great for breakfast too! We had a nice continental for only $16. Good regular coffee and relaxing environment.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is your average hotel. It's great for business travel but would be disappointing for vacation travel. No frills hotel with tiny rooms. We had a view of the city and could hear traffic and sirens often.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I make a point of staying in this hotel every time I come to Hawaii; I do that because of the people who work there. It's a good location and the rooms are fine but it is the staff that makes it great. From the people at the front desk (Ms. Claire has always been extremely helpful and friendly) to the Trees Restaurant (Ms. Brittney and Mr. Earl have made it a home away from home) to the always-hustling valets to the ever-pleasant personnel in housekeeping, everyone at the hotel seems to try their hardest to ensure you enjoy your stay. It certainly works for me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very convenient location close to convention center and walking distance to the waikiki beach as well as good breakfast/ food places. Nice and clean rooms and friendly staff. The kids enjoyed the pool and we made good use of the fitness facility.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The good: the rooms were clean and nice, the "complimentary" continental breakfast was good, and the place was within walking distance of downtown and the beach.The bad:1. If you are a hotel near a beach, or if you have a pool, one towel/guest/day is just not sufficient. Chances are someone is going to use the beach or pool and will need to take more than one shower in a day.2. The first day having the "complimentary" breakfast was fine - good food choices - the waitress was lovely - no problems with the grand daughter who was below the age of needing a ticket ( which you were given when you checked in).....the next morning our daughter was charged for our granddaughters "complimentary" breakfast. Not sure if the rules changed or the fact our granddaughter was 1 day older is what caused the rules to change. And the waitress would not bring anyone out to discuss this change in policy.3. Within a few hours of checking in we recieved a copy of a reciept showing OUR credit card had been used to to pay for a stay in the room the night before - for some woman in Indiana. They had to track down the on duty manager to fix this - which they eventually did - with no explanation of why or how it occcured4. Our daughter had used reward points to book the rooms yet HER credit card was used the next day to pay for OUR room. Again they had to find a manager who eventually fixed it - but again could not explain why or how this occurred.These last two issues made us very wary of what was going on int the hotel and we kept close eyes on our CC bills. Not sure if they did not expect people to pick up these mistakes so quickly of if they were honest mistakes. It was interesting to overhear a discussion that at 5 PM they were having to take mashed potatoes off the menu for the night since the steamer broke and they had no other way to prep the potatoes for mashing. Even the wait staff was taken aback about thisWiFi was spotty - even with all the directions provided could not keep a signal in the roomAlso - it would have been nice if there had been some some of information - in the room or at check in - as to where all the facilities were located. We finally found a map in the lobby which told us where the pool was.....but no information about it at all. Dont think we will be staying at this hotel again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was clean and well kept. We stayed 4 days with a tour group. The front desk was always attentive and pleasant. It is about a 10 minute walk to the beach and since it is a Hilton entity, you can use the pool at the more expensive Hilton about a 5 minute walk away. The parking was $30.00 a day but you have unlimited in/out valet and they were quick and pleasant each trip. I had a convertible and left the top down without any issue or concern in the covered garage. One evening when it rained they put it up for me "just in case" which was nice. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable with a small balcony for two. If possible, while reserving a room I would ask for the view away from the beach and above the 10th floor. There is a nice view of the skyline and mountains from that side. There is not a beach view that I could see on the other side which is where our room was on both stays. We saw the other view from my sister-in-laws room. If you want a beach view this isn't the place. I didn't plan or actually stay in the room much so that wasn't a bother. I'd say you get what you pay for. If you're there and you like Cheeseburgers, I would walk down to Cheeseburger Waikiki, I don't think the reviews do it justice. Good Luck

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Melissa helped my wife and I so professionally and excellently. We're thankful she made our experience one to remember. She treated us as we were her priority. The ONLY critique we would have is that in the little things (such as railings in the elevators, Bell Desk area). They're trivial issues. For the most part, great hotel and staff. Lastly, the men in the valet are golden! They're great guys!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came with a group that flew in early. They allowed for early check-in and I got the last available room: a penthouse suite. Very nice and totally unexpected.I can tell the hotel has some age but the furnishings are nice and everything worked. I especially enjoyed the jacuzzi after a long flight.Terrific view from the lanai.The bartender was very friendly as was the rest of the staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoying dour stay at DoubletTree and had a good sized room with two double beds and a sofa which pulled out to another double bed. The room was big for the three of us (2 adults and a 15 year old) with views to the ocean. The pool is small but then we weren't there to lie around the pool. An easy walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, Waikiki main drag with shops and restaurants or down to the beach. The staff were all helpful and the signature cookies were very addictive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed at the Double Tree in Honolulu for 1 night and most of the next day,thanks to the amazing Melissa Castaneda.We were a family of 3 adults and my 10 year old autistic son,who was spending just 1 night in the hotel,but required a very late check out the next day,as or flight departed at 3am!!As a diamond member,I was entitled to a 2pm check out,which would have left us with 13 hours to kill before our flight.Fortunately,the amazing Melissa,gave me an excellent day rate and an 8pm checkout,so that we only had to survive a few hours in the lobby after going out for dinner before our flight.Melissa provided us with free wifi, plenty of water and a tin of awesome chocolate chip cookies to keep us fed and watered whilst we awaited our taxi at midnight.Melissa also upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite for our stay,which made it much easier for everyone to get ample rest before our long trek back to New Zealand.The hotel itself was excellent and actually far better value than the Hilton Hawaiian Village,where we stayed the previous 2 nights and I would definitely choose the Double Tree for my next stay in Waikiki.The staff were simply outstanding and Melissa actually ensured that we were able to endure our 15 hour trip back to New Zealand in a much more relaxed state.Thank you Melissa for being so accommodating to our special needs!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: In September my husband and I stayed at this hotel. The rooms are lovely and comfortable. The pool area is small but the pool is lovely and warm. The location is good for shopping and the beach. But the best part was the desk staff. Especially Claire, who went out of her way for us on several occasions. On our last day, our flight was late in the evening, after checking out Claire and the on duty manager ( I think his name was Jacob) were able to arrange a room for us to shower and change in before going to the airport even though they were fully booked that night. They both made a lovely end to our stay there and we WILL be going there again. I can't thank them enough for all the little things they did that made our stay special. Thank you to the staff at the Double Tree in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a terrific stay here for work. Inviting atmosphere, clean rooms. Quiet location, exceedingly friendly hotel staff. Easy walking distance to beach and other locations. Made my stay very relaxing and enjoyable,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If accomodating is important to you then - This is a place you should definitlely treat yourself and/or family to From the time I was dropped off by the shuttle, i was greeted with smiles from the entire staff. Very welcoming to see. The smiles continued at the front desk. I have to say that Melissa is simply the best!!! She was very personable and accomodating. She told me about various activities and shared a little history about the surrounding area. Having a background in hospitality industry, the front desk can make a repeat customer or gain referrals or they can turn a person off. MELISSA has made the choice easy for me- if I ever come back to HI I will stay right here. The cookies are tasty, the fresh water at desk is nice and cold. The Tree restaurant is tasty ( fish or the steak). Overall a great experience. Valet staff was friendly too. Nice little souvenier shops close by and not to far from mall. Nice partial ocean views. You can only get ice on the even number floors - thats the only reason i don't give it a 5. The suite was roomy and the a/c can be manually changed but I had it stay very cool and it worked great!!! Someone was getting married and to see her coming down the escalator was breathtaking with the fresh flowers inher hair. Hope you enjoy your visit as much as I did. Happy Visitor

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When on a cruise to several islands in Hawaii and had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton, Double Tree Hotel in Honolulu both before and after the cruise. The hotel was super nice and centrally located to buses and the beach. Even took a nice walk to Diamond Head and got to see the Honolulu Zoo, Aquarium and designer stores. The beaches near the Double Tree were so immaculate and never crowded. Had the best time and can't wait to return, after all we got cookies every time we asked for them and the cookies were DELICIOUS.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a very nice hotel just on the northwest end of Waikiki that I had the pleasure to stay in while visiting Hawaii on a business trip.The Location: It's located on Ala Moana Blvd just on the outskirts of Waikiki which made it easy to avoid the Waikiki traffic. There is plenty of shopping within walking distance, not to mention restaurants galore. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is a short drive away if you don't feel like walking.The Room: The room was clean and comfortable and I have a nice view of the ocean (although it wasn't very near). The bed was large and the mattress was perfect as were the pillows. There was an ironing board with iron available. Closet space was just fine. The Wifi signal was great, but if you aren't a Hilton member, it will cost you money.The Hotel: The hotel is nice enough and the valet attendants were friendly and helpful. Parking here will cost $30.00 per day and it's the only parking available. The elevators felt dated and slow.The Service: The staff was very helpful and efficient.You can't go wrong if you choose to stay in this hotel on your next trip to Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently stayed here for a week. First night I realized AC was not working so I complained to front desk. A old nice gentleman came to check and he couldn't repair it, He told me that Engineer has to take a look next day so whole night I slept in a hot weather condition. When I told this incident to front desk at check out timing, she asked me, if there is anything she can do to make it right. That was nice gesture. I was pleased with it so I didn't asked for any compensation. The lady told me that If I visit, there next time, she will get me a nice room. My overall stay in the hotel was good. Staff was very friendly and smiling, room was clean. The only issue was experience at the time of breakfast. I went there on Tuesday and it was nice. The guy making omelette was Great, the other Staff in restaurant were nice too. I went to breakfast on Thursday and there were two ladies in the restaurant, they didn't even said Hello or asked me " If I need any help". I couldn't tell them that I want upgrade to hot breakfast It was bad feeling but I let it go. Next day on Friday I went there and same two ladies were in restaurant. They behaved in same way. This time, I actually raised my hand towards one waitress and said excuse me, She looked at me from far and without coming towards my seat, asked me " Yes ?" I felt, its very rude. So I got up and left without breakfast. It kept going in my mind everything in the hotel is great but if this is the way to start the day then I don't like it. I am paying 300USD per night and this is not what you expect in return.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Service from the front desk, house keeping, and all in between was excellent. The employees always greeted you with a smile and made you feel welcomed. One of the front desk agents, Soohee Baek, was nice enough to teach me some Korean after a conversation of possibly going there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Double Tree in Waikiki for 4 nights. The staff was very helpful. The entrance was under construction, so it was a little inconvenient to enter and exit. The rooms were clean and had balconies. The restaurant was very good for breakfast. That was the only meals we ate there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had 4 nights in Honolulu; good location for the central part of Honolulu, access (walking distance) to Ala Moana shopping centre. A block or so back from beach front hotel strip so no real views to speak of.Comfortable hotel, room was a little dated, had to call down for shower head/hose to be fixed.....could do with an upgrade of shower fittings. Bed was very comfortable.Staff generally friendly, front desk, concierge etc. Front entrance/ porte cochere was under some construction/ upgrade so bellmen/ valet were a little scarce.Pool area/ lounge area was comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 2 months, friendly staff made the stay pleasant. The front agents always helped us the best way possible. Thank you so much for Claire, the front agent. She helped us staying comfortably and always asked what she can do to help us during our stay. The swimming pool was rather small but I enjoyed the breezy patio near the pool where you can just relax. We requested for a sweet room and the room was clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. A lot of great places in walking distance, with Waikiki Beach is just a mile away. Valet parking and great breakfast menu. I would definitely stay at this hotel again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent service, everyone helpful. Room was satisfactory except for the women arguing in the room next door at 4am. An easy walk to the Hilton Resort on the beach where the rest of our friends stayed. Continental breakfast satisfactory, no need to upgrade to hot breakfast. Very good hotel for our situation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Here are my feelings about my Doubletree Alana Waikiki stay ... this week.REGISTRATION: Perfect. Michelle (hope I have the name right) was buttoned up!RESTAURANT: Clear. Looks better in the photo. Kudos to the host, servers, and chefs/cooks. Timely and buttoned up. Cordial not friend but not cold either. Just right. Breakfast was just right. Actually, I had the best Omelette in a long time here.ROOM DESIGN: Efficient and plenty of room to move around. Cool views from the balcony. ROOM CLEANING: Clean but not SPIC N SPAN. Missing the simple things. So so. Beds were made. Bathroom picked and replenished. But, here are the list of the misses: 1) garbage can not emptied;2) paper left on the floor and counter (yes, I rushed out for a tour but expected better)3) hand towel in shower never removed (thus, most likely hot cleaned)ROOM WELCOME BINDER: Inner materials ... upside down. Like opening a book with the Title one way while the contents placed upside down. Really? Missing on the easy stuff.INTERNET: Speed ok. Good luck on securing support if you have to make a 4AM connection. Figured it out once reboot was completed (upon the local team's recommendation).AFTER HOURS / FRONT DESK: Called the Front Desk a couple of times. Let the phone ring 11 times one of the calls. Since I wasn't getting and response, I phoned the DIAMOND 800#. REMODELING: Be ready. But, you can figure your way around. They did a good job mapping things out to guide you thru.CONCIERGE: Two thumbs up!! The "really" young lady was totally BUTTONED UP!!! Loved the Helicopter and my private driver land tour.VIEW: Great city view. Spend some time on the balcony.Would love to give you a higher rating but I am bummed. I actually believe that you have a good location, nice team, and potentially a great product. Tough to pay what I paid then feel good about the lack of attention to details. I'd still recommend this place to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is the only place I stay for business. Very convenient, clean, good staff. They do need to get the work done on their up-grade to the entrance. It was going on when I was there in April and still is in September.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: You might want to lower your expectations. This seems like a property that's trying to fit into the DoubleTree brand. I didn't see or experience any advantage to being a Diamond member at this location.Check-in: Slow. The lobby was packed! Be prepared for the big-bus tourist groups. On this visit, if there was a separate line for Hilton Honors, I didn't see it. The desk attendant was friendly and provided the standard information about the hotel. She mentioned the construction and the temporary location of the breakfast service.Room: This side of boring. It was large enough for this 3-night visit. The aqua blue colors were annoying, but I'm guessing it fits the local flavor. The carpet seemed like the indoor-outdoor type. The bed was comfortable; the bathroom was small; the furniture seemed dated. The room was somewhat cool, but I couldn't get the room to a much cooler temperature that I preferred. If you're not planning to spend a lot of time in the room, it's sufficient. This was not a comfortable or inviting room where you'd want to spend a lot of time. I used it as a pit-stop, i.e., I didn't spend much time in the room during this long weekend visit.Breakfast: The space was cramped; overrun with people; tables not cleared sufficiently; and food was average at best. Don't expect much here.Common areas: I didn't see much of the hotel. The hallways had a musty smell, but I think that had to do with the humidity. The entrance to the hotel was under renovation which made the whole scene chaotic. Overall, the hotel seems like an older property that needs a 21st century update.Location: Good location; everything is walkable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here three nights in September 2015. We were upgraded,to a suite which gave us an extra living room and bathroom. Furniture and furnishings a little worn. Had small balcony with city view. In-house restaurant was fairly good with yummy drinks and nice happy hour. Bartender was great. All staff friendly and attentive. Overall I would rate 3 stars. 5 minute walk,to Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best part of the hotel is the staff. Everyone was friendly. Had a coupon for the continental but opted for the hot breakfast which was delicious as well as a great deal. Back to the staff... I had just purchased some Klipsch ear buds at ATL airport and promptly left them in my room. I called the hotel and told them what had happened. I spoke to Mr Austin Faletufuga of the hotel's security staff. They found my earbuds and then mailed them to me back home. Can't tell you how grateful I am for the time and effort he took to reunite me with my earbuds. Kudos to him and to the entire hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff. People always willing to help with a smile on your face. However, hotel was under construction which made parking extremely difficult. Elevators are old and small, and take entirely too long. I felt like I waited for an eternity on most days for the elevator to pick me up. The cooling system was below average in the room and did not get below 72 degrees which made for a sleepless night. The sheets felt wet at all times due to extreme humidity.
user_name:
Katy C
San Rafael, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The bad part first. The breakfast situation at this hotel is not great. Diamond and Golds can not touch anything hot. The selection is very limited in a very small bar/restaurant, too much $ to upgrade for a full breakfast. The upgrade for me was very nice, I was given a nice suite on the top floor with a roof top private area. Very nice. Room was very clean and modern, bathroom was the same. I do dislike the new doubletree shower amenities the shampoo is crap. Staff was always happy and helpful. Really liked the male bar tender, forgot his name but it was clear he loved his job. I did go back a few time and it was because of his happy service. You can do an easy walk over to the massive Hilton Hawaiian Village for food and shopping and all the people. The doubletree was fully booked but it was not crazy and felt more like a private hotel. Keep up the good work. Fix the breakfast thing, it sucks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for our wedding day prep and honeymoon. Clinton Yamashita was so accomodating and welcoming! the facility is very modern and upscale. the Amenities are great! The staff from the parking to the cleaning were friendly and we did not have any issues. I've stayed at other double tree's so i knew not to expect nothing but great service and hospitality!! It was a great way to spend our honeymoon staycation, and we will be sure to look to this hotel again for future staycations!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For business, this is a great location. Close enough to walk to Waikiki attractions, resturants and the beach but yet not in the middle of everything. Hotel employees have always been helpful. I will be staying here again in September 2015.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This place is squarely located where you want to be - easy to walk everywhere-They have a nice restaurant and a good gym- they do need to add a scales- but good equipment and is well kept upPeople very friendly and they are under construction in the front of the hotel but this does not cause any problems

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a great hotel for a business or single traveler. It is also fine for couples. Good central location. The pool is clean and functional but not a focal point, this is not a beach resort. However this is one of my favorite Hotels in Honolulu. Very friendly staff and very clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I use to stay at this hotel regularly for work.The staff are so friendly, and has a lovely feel as its only a small hotel compared to the main ones in Waikiki.It's a good location. Easy to walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, Easy to get to Waikiki Beach. There isn't to many options for food right near the hotel. There is a nice local vietnamese restaurant around the back neat 7/11 or up down the road towards the beach is the Hiking Cafe which has great healthy options for breakfast lunch and dinner.I only ate once at the hotel restaurant and wasn't to impressed with the food. Way to slow and not impressive for the price.The beds are super comfy (Being Hilton beds)No free wifi in the room however, just in the lobby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights, got a great rate of 151/per night. The hotel seems older, but they are obviously updating it with the renovation of the front entrance which is barricaded off making it a little difficult if you have a vehicle. First and foremost all of the staff I encountered were incredibly friendly and hospitable. I had a room facing inland. It was clean, comfortable and the sleep quality good. Each room has a small balcony. The bathroom was pretty spacious for a regular room which I really liked. What I did not like was the AC in the room, while cool... did not allow you to go below 68-69. I like it cooler at night so that was a con. The hallways were uber hot, no air flow at all including in the elevators which would not have been an issue had it not been 90 degrees plus. I did order room service one evening, and it was pretty decent food. All and all it was a comfortable stay... nothing more nothing less. While I would probably stay here again if I was able to get such a good rate again, I did find the beachfront properties more enticing. My colleagues were staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for maybe 15 bucks more a night than here and they were given meal/food vouchers and the property was chock full of services.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If the staff is paid for its infectious smiles, Natalia would bankrupt the company. Natalia has a "Million Dollar" smile, and she shares it unconditionally. Earl and Natalia form a great crew in the restaurant, and I appreciate their friendliness and positive attitude.Claire is wonderful! I go to her for insight about local restaurants and the area, she is always helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I LOVED this hotel!!!!! Didn't really know what to expect as this was my fist time here. They sent me a courtesy e-mail letting me know that they had renovations going on and that I'd have to park across the street so that was good to know so that I can plan out my daily activities. I pulled up and the valet and bell men were so welcoming and so eager to be of service, it was GREAT! We walked in and went up the escalators and while I was standing in line my eyes roamed the lobby area. I was very impressed as everything was very organized, clean and smell...my friends very important to me was very nice. It was finally my turn and as I walk up the lady that checked me in was so kind and made it so easy to get me in and up to my room fast. I drove an hour to get here so I really appreciated that. I wanna say it took less than 5 mins.  Get into the elevators and head to our room. It was very easy to find out room(don't you hate when you get into a hotel and have the hardest time finding your room or what tower). My kids enjoyed the smell of the hallways...they said it reminded them of my yummy lip gloss hahahahahaha. It really did smell good though. We walked into our room and was very impressed with the decor and pieces in the room. Everything was very updated and clean. Everything worked so that was great too. Our AC was working very well and with the crazy hurricane heat we've been having it was PERFECT to walk into a cool room and just drop into a down comforter(like a bed of clouds). Beds were very comfy and cozy. We got a city view and the bad was not bad at all. I did sit on my balcony and enjoy the fresh air a few times. The housekeeper that came in the next day was so nice and very patient as we had slept in and we didn't feel rushed at all to start our day. When we got back that morning right after she had cleaned the room I noticed I had a message on my phone...thinking to myself, who would be calling me on the hotel line? I couldn't believe who it was....the Concierge at the Front Desk....are you kidding me??? I just couldn't believe the service. I thought that was an awesome addition to all the attention to details that this hotel had done thus far. I felt so VIP.  I love to go to the gym so of course I checked it out and I was in LOVE!!! You overlook the pool so it was perfect to watch my kids through the glass. My kids are older so they're pretty well behaved and can swim on their own so it was PERFECT! The gym was nice and cool and had more than enough equipment to get a great workout in. Lots of room and I liked that it was so clean and organized. The pool was great of course my kids took full advantage of it and I really enjoyed that it was nice and warm even in the evening. Clean, warm towels were always available near the pool so we were able to stay clean and dry. The view from the pool was gorgeous and it did help that we had Mr.Sun that came out to play this weekend. There were enough chairs for everyone that came to enjoy the pool and even umbrellas for those like me who started to feel the sun was a little too strong at times.  We had the breakfast buffet at the Trees Restaurant and Bar. The spread was HUGE! I'm a pescatarian and there were lots of options for me. My fav had to be the omelette station and the waffles :) But the options were endless! I rarely see my hub looking like a kid in a candy shop...he didn't know where to start and stop hahahaha it was great to see him enjoy it especially since we were there enjoying our Anniversary. Oh and since I'm talking about food....can I say WHAT the COOKIEgasm?? Yeah, I said it LOL The cookies they have here were AMAZING!!! I would go there just for the cookies hahahahahaha no but really the cherry on top to tie in everything.  I have to end with naming a few people that stood out to me and really helped to make my stay so much more special. Clinton Yamashita played such a huge roll in creating such a memorable experience for our first staycation in Waikiki since our honeymoon 10 years ago. It was so good, we have decided to as a couple and family to make sure we come back every so often throughout the year. There was also a Jacob at the Front Desk that helped every time we came in super late (11:45pm and later) with any requests that we had and with a smile. I was thinking to myself...WOW even at the crack of midnight this guy is servicing us as if it was 8am in the morning and he just had a great big cup of coffee LOL I really appreciated that service especially when it was so late and I was so tired. I feel bad that I didn't get all the valet/bell guys but one that I do remember especially on our way out was Jeff. We had our kids towards the end of our stay and he was such a gentleman in making sure he had all our doors open and shut them for us. What service!!!! I tell you SERVICE here ROCKED MY SOCKS!!! I'm forever coming here and will make sure all my family and friends know about this amazing hotel! THANK YOU for an AWESOME experience!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Alana Waikiki is a hidden gem. The furnishings and amenities are high quality and modernistic, and the service is top-notch. The location is convenient, 15 minutes by foot from the heart of Waikiki but within easy striking distance of downtown Honolulu. Locals in the know send people here for a reason!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I only stayed a night at this location, but the rooms were clean (though a little cramped). Unfortunately there was a lot of construction going on at the time, so the outside was not very pretty to look at. Also, the elevators were QUITE frustrating. Sometimes, they opened on random floors, and it was always very, VERY slow. I was up on a high floor, and there was no indication on what floor the elevators were at. Also, the elevators themselves were VERY small and cramped as well. I would never want to be caught when there is a rush of people coming in or out, because you would have to wait forever.Be aware that they were very strict about early check-in. It may be a different story if you call ahead to request it (and if you think you need it, I suggest you call to check), but we had to wait until their standard 3pm check-in time before they allowed us into the room as we had arrived a little earlier than expected. There was absolutely no wiggle room. The employees also didn't seem quite as happy. Upon rolling my luggage out of the room and waiting at the elevator, a lady from housekeeping who was cleaning another room, asked quite abrasively what room I was in and if I was checking out. I told her that I was leaving, but another friend had the room still, and she gave me this weird look. It was a bit strange.Parking is valet only (free if validated at the front desk that you stayed at the hotel). They offer some food credit at the restaurant downstairs for not requesting room service for a certain number of days (I believe 3?). I only stayed one day, so I didn't really read into, but it seemed like a good deal at the time. The fridge was nice and spacious, and there was a small single-serve coffee maker (with room for up to two cups to be brewed at once). Ice machines are on every other floor. There was supposedly also a microwave somewhere downstairs in the lobby that you could use to reheat leftovers.There were lots of places within walking distance, including an ABC store, 7-Eleven, lots of restaurants and shopping. I would not recommend driving around Waikiki unless you know there is parking available at your destination.The room was clean, but with construction, slow elevators and the somewhat unfriendly employees who seemed more annoyed than anything that I was there, I would rate this location a 3/5. I would still recommend that if anyone does stay at this location, they might want to consider joining the Hilton HHonors Program for the perks, including free wifi. The proximity to everything was nice, but there are lots of ways to get around Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had to book a hotel at the very last minute for a three-week business trip. When I arrived I was greeted by the front desk immediately and checked in quickly. The room was very clean and organized well. The hotel staff, in general, were extremely courteous and accommodating. They brought up extra hangers when needed, delivered in-room food quickly, and helped out with any other issues I had. The valet service was excellent as well. The hotel is located in Waikiki within walking distance of the beach, many restaurants, stores, etc. Bottom line, I'd recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My Wife and I stayed here for almost 60 days straight as we had moved to Oahu and did not yet have a place. The staff during our entire stay was nothing but helpful, friendly and gave great service. We stayed in one of the updated rooms and the cleaning staff made sure we were taken care off. They were able to extend us last minute on three occasions even with very little notice and always with a smile. The location is perfect for getting to the beach and the main strip of Waikiki and there are great restaurants in every direction with in easy walking distance. A special shout out to one of the front desk managers Hendrick, and Pedro who is one of the valet and baggage managers, both great guys and extremely helpful.P.S. Make sure to take advantage of the free fresh cookies at the front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for three nights as a stopover between NZ and Canada and opted for a discounted upgrade to a corner penthouse suite. The suite was very spacious, clean and functional, but as another reviewer noted the aircon equipment on the roof above which supplies the whole building was very noisy and took a night or two to get used to. The deck off this room is very spacious although the daytime temps during our stay made it hard to stay outside long.Room service breakfast was average as was the Trees restaurant so we ate out after a couple of attempts.Easy walk in one direction to the Ala Moana mall complex and back in the other direction to Waikiki Beach, so quite handily located.The front entrance was being re-tiled during our stay so there was a lot of concrete cutting, dust, noise and dodgey driving going on, but we negotiated it OK.As always with the Doubletree chain, the warm chocolate chip cookies on checkin are tasty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here the last 4 days during a business trip. It's nothing fancy, but rooms have been remodeled and that's nice. The rooms are nicer than their sister hotel across the street, but the pool doesn't compare and you aren't on the beach. I was working, so I didn't mind. There was less touristy activity at this hotel, which suits me fine. People tend to smoke in the hallways - which aren't air conditioned and that was gross. The Tree eating establishment was honestly disgusting. I couldn't eat my $34 steak because it was all fat. Photo attached. The server didn't care and acted like I was an inconvenience to her from the moment I walked in. There are many better options close by.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Small glitch during stay and the manager compensated us very well with free breakfast. The staff is warm and friendly and overly helpful. The hotel is close to all amenities and the concierg was very helpful in getting us around.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I and my son stayed here for a night before taking our flight to Maui. The room was huge and spacious with a great city view. They welcomed us with warm chocolate chip cookies with walnuts. When my husband found out that he left his toiletries kit and electric shaver at Double Tree, we went back for it after 4 days , and lo and behold it was there at lost and found of the security section. Thanks Double Tree !

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was for our last night in Hawaii, after returning from the Big Island. The gentleman at the desk, was kind, courteous and found us a better room then we had paid for without additional cost. Although this is an older hotel, it has been renovated and was very nice. Everything was clean and the breakfast hit the spot before our flight out. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: PROS: great valet guys who always had a smile when we left and came back. The young ladies at the front desk were so friendly. How quiet it was at the pool and that it was salt water. The breakfast buffet had nice variety of hot and cold items at a reasonable price. I love the omelet and waffle station. Cookies upon arrival were warm and delish. Our suite had sliding doors to separate the bedroom from the living room. I love how the suite included a wet bar and a mini fridge. CONS: Furniture was outdated and had plenty stains on the couch. . Mattress on the bed felt a bit flat and wasn't as comfortable as i hoped to be. I think the drainage was on the older side so the water in the tub was slow and the toilet started to back up and all of a sudden the water started to drain. Construction in the drive way. The elevators were small and had only 3 elevators I believe and only 2 were working at the time. So it was a bit of a wait. Wifi was an additional cost.Overall the cons outweigh the pros but I would definitely stay here again. It was a relaxing weekend nothing else really mattered.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check in is 3:00 pm, my room was never available for my check in, was compensated with room on the Penthouse floor...This room was the worst room I ever stayed in! The furniture looked like old military barracks furniture, the couch was full of those type of stains, and no carpet on the floor just an old dirty throw rug that looked like it came from the trash! I will never stay in this hotel again as long as I breathe!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First of all, this property is _near_ Waikiki, _near_ other Hilton Resort properties, and just a couple blocks from the beach. Their salt pool is quiet and quite nice, though I was extremely buoyant. Restaurant is simple a nice for breakfast, either continental or full (the cook-to-order eggs and waffles were very good). It is showing its age in places, and they were redoing the entrance (retiling the drive), but it will show very well when they're finished.Service is where they excel ... breakfast, dinner and bar all were very pleasant and very helpful. Our toilet clogged for some reason, and they had someone up there within two minutes. Beds (queens) were moderately comfortable, no worse than anyone else. Refrigerator but no microwave. If you need speedy internet, you'll need to pay for the upgrade. Their regular internet service is on the low end of DSL speeds. Better than modems, but not much. My VerizonWireless gave us enough speed to watch Netflix, which theirs would never do. it's good enough for basic surfing and email though, so if that's what you need, you're good with the basic.And to end it all, it's quite reasonable a price, even with paying $30/day for valet-only parking. Hilton resorts would be double the room rate, at least, and you can walk their, use their beaches, use their Starbucks, etc.We'd come back here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property may not seem like a 5 star place, but to me its a 10. The employees from the Valet service to the Front Desk are absolutely awesome! I love staying here more than anywhere else - Feels like home every time I arrive. Thank you for being a great location for a traveler to many states and different hotels.
user_name:
Jeff G
West Haven, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, fresh, contemporary hotel. Very friendly and courteous staff from the front desk to the bell captains. No unusual smells or odors. No cigarette smoke residues. Clean, crisp, white sheets and towels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After 3 calls to confirm the rate, the rate was $30/night more expensive at check in. There is also an additional $30/night required for valet parking. Gotcha! The hotel is also under renovation and signage to direct travelers is sparse if present at all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My stay was organised and sponsored by an by a industry organisation so I had no say in the choice. However, having stayed at the Double Tree in New York I had high expectations, this hotel while adequate did not meet my expectations. The staff were helpful and very good at apologising for the various issues, but it did not really help. One issue was the internet speed, I tested the speed and it was Ping 285ms, Down at 0.30Mbps and up at 0.17Mbps so uploading anything was really difficult. This is not a business speed at all. As a HHonors member it was free but it was easier to pay and use my data connection. The Hotel did offer a higher speed at $14 extra but as I was only using it at night to upload my notes and spreadsheets I decided not to pay. If they offer free service it should be a reasonable speed. At about the same price you get a suite in New York so I was expecting something similar but this was just a small room but it was acceptable for just one person.
