The bathroom was of the most basic I have even seen in this class of hotel, no shelf space near the washbasin at all. I would not stay here again. On check out they did take some items off the bill, and they were very apologetic

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We are a frequent user of our Hilton Honor Points and have been upgraded many times but NEVER to a Penthouse Suite. After 4 nights is a tiny, musty hotel room we are totally BLESSED to be in this room, it's gorgeous, comfortable and we are so relaxed. Thank you Hilton for taking such good care of repeat travelers

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff was very friendly. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The bathroom needs some type of shelf to put your items....there is only a pedestal sink and no shelf...which made getting ready very difficult for 2 women. The price was a little too high for the accommodations. The pool area was nice and not busy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed on Aug 2015 for 7 nights with my family. Our suite was large, clean with nice view to the ocean. Cooling system was fully functional. the bed was very comfortable also the pull-out sofa. Parking is $30 per night. As always Doubletree cookies were delicious and staff was generous with them. Thank you and looking forward for next visit

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is not what we expected, when we booken a Double Tree, and it can only be categorised af a place to sleep. As a HHonors member you are entitled to a free cold breakfast buffet, however we were not informed of that, and therfore went out for breakfast, since the price for breakfast were high. Will not stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel for business every week and I always stay at Hilton properties. I have stayed at many Double Trees and this one was by far the worst experience I have ever had. I went down to the restaurant for breakfast every morning and the wait staff never once came to my table to ask what I would like to drink. I had to go up to the bar and tell them that I wanted coffee and water. Once I finally got my coffee they never came back to my table to fill up my cup. The worst service here is their valet drivers. When they brought me my car one morning I noticed that there was some extensive damage done to it. There were dents and scratches on both front doors, the small panel that is below the doors on the passenger side had a huge gash (an inch or 2 deep and about 2 feet long). This piece was so loose that it was about ready to fall off. There was some damage done to the front bumper as well. They parked my car so close to other cars that you couldn't even open the door to get out. When discussing this with the hotel manager, security guard, and police officer they kept asking me if maybe I hit something without knowing it. They were just trying to cover their own employees butt. They were not going to take any responsibility for the damage that was done to my vehicle. They would not credit me for some of the parking charges either. I sent several emails to one of the hotel managers asking him for reimbursement for some of the parking charges. I have stayed at a Hilton property almost every week for the past 2 years and have never had such poor service like I did with this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stay in a lot of Hilton hotels- enough to get Diamond status by July-August of every year. If you are a HHonors member you will be disappointed, your status entitles you for a free cold breakfast buffet. You can upgrade (pay) for the hot portion but it is not a great dining experience slightly better than a Hampton, not as good as a Garden Inn. Not what I expected from a Doubletree. The property is middle of the road in terms of upkeep. They have the whole front lower level of the lobby torn up and NO evidence of any continuing progress on the project during my week there. This makes access and the valet parking a pain. Great bar experience, Earl provides a good experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived at about 11PM, expecting check in to be closed. But we suspected it was open since there were bell boys waiting for us. We hauled our luggage up, and we checked in. They gave us their signature cookie, which was delicious. Our room was neat and tidy, as we expected. We frequently used the fast WiFi, the fitness and swimming facilities, and the computer room. It was a pricey hotel, but probably worth it. Will go the next time we come.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I originally booked hotel based on price and availability of large suites for familiesTripadvisor reviews scared me a bit but overall I stuck to my choice and I am glad I did.A wide room with dividing wall which fits comfortably 5 people - we slepts in large sofabed while 3 kids were sharing the 2 double beds in main bedroomTrue that there is only one TV and one bath, however everything else including very courteous and helpful staff, the nice pool and free wi-fi + breakfast as well as convenient location did more than make up for that.Tip in Honolulu for vacation with kids is rent a car and do not worry to much not being exactly in the middle of waikiki.Note hotel is also walking distance from Ala Moana Shopping Mall

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My first impression was not good when I saw the barricaded and boarded up main entrance, which is under renovation. It made me hope that the taxi had taken us to the wrong address. The room was basic and clean but not overly fancy - Internet options include a basic service for US$10 per day and a premium service for $15. 50 TV channels, more than 40 of which seemed to be dedicated to advertising. Paid In room movies are an option. Meeting/workshop rooms are an option in the business centre. This is NOT a resort hotel, with only a basic swimming pool in the shade of the building but it is after all, Waikiki. Restaurants and 24hour coffee shops are close by with Ala Moana shopping centre a 15 minute walk. Pay by the hour/day valet parking available. Overall, it is probably over priced for what is on offer.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our stay I'd was pretty good. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The lady at the Concierge desk Kerry, she was excellent, help us out on all our tours, I can't say enough about her. There was construction going on at the front of hotel, just making it better. Not a long walk to the beach either

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was super excited when we were upgraded to the Penthouse Suite...one would imagine that things would be more spacious and luxurious in the "penthouse", but instead of our King Suite with divisible room, Partial Ocean View and 2 balconies that we reserved...we got a single room with one balcony and a city view. I think they tricked us into a down grade if you ask me. Plus knowing that we were a family of 5 staying in the the room, we had to request the bedding and pillows for the sofa sleeper (was not already in the room as in most other hotels). An extra inconvenience was that there are no microwaves in the rooms...have to go down to the lobby to use the only one in the building...but guess that would be expected since you can't store anything in the refrigerator anyways...thing is so small can barely fit a couple drinks in there. Needless to say, I was disappointed with our stay here in a "penthouse" room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment of arrival when you are greeted by a professional team of valets through the perfect check in process all the way to final check out you are met with nothing but top notch service! The hotel is undergoing a significant update process but that is totally hidden by the professional staff at this hotel. I would like to name two staff members in particular for thier outstanding service both Earl Kono and Natalia Madrigal of the lounge ge

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is very nice located. The staff are great and friendly. From the valet through the bell man. The front desk make you feel so welcome. The room are huge and comfortable. As the Hilton chains the ice machine is locate in every floors and so convenient. The bed is so big and so soft :) Love it!!! The shower have a big pressure. The balcony is big,even it is not close to beach or have small part of view to the ocean. But the mountain view still can make you feel as in the heaven.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights in June as part of our honeymoon. The purpose of the stay was to visit Pearl Harbour. There was building work going on at the front of the hotel so first impressions weren't great from the exterior view. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in just felt dirty and dingy and from the moment we arrived we couldn't wait to leave! We didn't even want to use the tea and coffee making facilities in the room as it just seemed unclean. The room also smelt of smoke even though it was a no smoking room. We did inform reception who came to the room and claimed they couldn't smell anything and left us with some febreeze!! Honolulu itself appears to be quite a deprived area with many of the locals living there. There is a main road that within a short walking distance from the hotel where you'll find bars, restaurants and some nice shops . We also had a walk along the beach which also seems really nice, but it appears that behind all that, it's not a great area in our opinion. Pearl Harbour itself is a must see if you're in the area. We paid for the shuttle bus from the hotel and it wasn't too far away. Apart from Pearl Harbour, I wouldn't recommend going to Honolulu or staying in this hotel. We travelled on to Kona (Big Island) after Honolulu which was absolutely stunningly beautiful and what we imagined Hawaii to be like. A little piece of paradise!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Do your research first prior to booking. We arrived at the hotel and the front was under constrution. Valet parking only however, you were driving through the construction site. Not what you expected from the Hilton Chain. Be extremely careful as you walk to and from the parking area. Cars coming and going and area is extremely tight. Hopefully construction will be completed soon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is not for a long stay. Amenities are very limited. Entire hotel needs to be updated. Does not live up to Hilton name. Worst part of our trip was this hotel. Would not recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for two nights and were happy with our stay. The building is a bit old but I can see they are slowly improving it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The staff are a great asset to the hotel. Breakfast was usual hotel fare. Good location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were meeting a group at the end of Waikiki and the walk was very easy. The hotel was very comfortable although there was construction on the entry. The wait staff in the restaurant in the morning were very attentive and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel staff was pleasant but no helpful with and rewards problems. There was construction underway at the entrance of the hotel the staff tried to overcome but it was not convenient they should have founded a slower period of business to do the work.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I enjoyed every minute while I was in the hotel. The view from the hotel to the ocean was amazing. Other than a couple of condiments missing in the room, the comfort of stay was excellent. Very close access to restaurants, shopping and the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Came for some family vacation before setting sail on Hawaiian cruise. Stayed two days and had a very nice suite. Room was clean and very comfortable, staff was friendly and accommodating. Would recommend this hotel for your stay. Its only a couple blocks to the beach and has great views. Thanks DoubleTree!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A well positioned hotel, five minutes' walk to great places of interest in any direction good views from the rooms and close to public transport. The rooms themselves are clean, spacious and tidy and the staff are friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed her in May 2015. The hotel is undergoing a facelift and will be nicer when it is finished. We had deadlings with many of the staff including reception, management, restaurant and rooms and every single one of them was pleasant, helpful and professional. The room was very spacious and very clean. One small issue was that the dust ruffle was dirty and had to ask 3 times for it to be changed. Then it was! Despite that we would defineitley stay there again. It's in a great location about 10 minutes walk from the centre of Waikiki which was perfect as we were slightly away from all the hustle and bustle..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had reservation for 13 nights in mid-June 2015, but we moved to another hotel after 2 nights (had to pay an understandable $105 fee) due to not only the hotel construction, but also the major street construction that closed some sidewalks and jammed the streets. The bathroom was small, awkward with the toilet close to the side wall. Most ice machines were "removed for renovation", leaving only 1 machine on the 6th, 10th, and 16th floors. The room temperature was inconsistent, perhaps due to the motion sensor shutting it down during the day and after you go to sleep.We have stayed at Hilton and Hilton-branded properties world-wide and the numerous problems at this property place it at the low end.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 6 nights as Hilton Honors gold member. I had 2 separate reservations - paid and award and requested e-standby for PH upgrade. Additionally, my doughter with family was checking-in next day for 5 night stay. Hotel staff was very professional, forthcoming and friendly. Rebecca was able to combine reservations, honor request for upgrade and also upgraded my family(son-in-law diamond member) to the same floor. My suite 1907 was large, clean with nice view to the ocean. Cooling system was fully functional. Bed was very comfortable also pull-out sofa (kids argued each evening who will come for sleep-over).Housekeeping and restaurant staff were amazing. Happy hour prices was very reasonable for downtown Waikiki. For $ 8.00 we upgraded our free continental breakfast. As always Doubletree cookies were delicious and staff was generous with them. There was renovation at the front entrance but it doesn't affected our stay or service at all. Thank you and looking forward for next visit

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great Hilton brand on Oahu for the business traveler. The rooms are spacious and have wired and wireless connections. I'm kind of a neat freak so keep that in mind with my remarks on the room. Hotel was remodeled a couple of years ago so the rooms are still 'fresh' with a large spacious desk. Carpets are in good shape, no creepy feeling walking barefoot in the room. Showers in the rooms I've stayed in this year (4 different stays) have all been in good shape with none of the mold / cracks so prevalent in most of the Honolulu hotels. Some of the bathrooms make awkward use of the space but for clean that can be accepted. The desk is huge and has a power strip along side, something I don't know why every hotel doesn't do.The restaurant in the hotel is not good. Adequate for an after work beer, but just one. Plenty of places to go eat within walking distance. Front desk area can get busy and cramped with escalators right in front of the desk but the staff more than makes up for it with their good attitude and helpfulness.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: You arrive. Looks like a building site. The outside is being refurbished. I say this, however, nobody was working on anything. Just plastic construction tape and boards everywhere. You walk up the driveway with your bags, dodging the cards. No assistance from any doorman/valet anyone. You finally work your way around all the building material and go up the narrowest of escalator with your bags. It truly is an accident waiting to happen so have travel insurance if you go to this hotel.We booked a suite. What a disappointment at over $300/night. No breakfast included. However the following morning I saw that the breakfast buffet came out of the restaurant into the lobby area (which is basically the construction area). So gave all that a miss.Rooms are small. The bathroom is shockingly small. One small rack to hang a towel so maybe its acceptable if you are a single traveller. A bathtub that small should just be ripped out and made into a shower.I would never stay here again. Would never recommend it and honestly my advise to the hotel is SHUT YOUR DOORS UNTIL YOU STOP BEING A BUILDING SITE. Its a ripoff.PS outside they are digging up the main road so if you are forced to choose this hotel, take ear plugs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at Double Tree Hiltons before and they were absolutely beautiful. My wife and were on our honeymoon, and I just felt terrible to have chosen this hotel for us. The construction in the front of the hotel made it look like we were n the ghetto. Then they had the nerve to charge us for parking!! It cost more for parking then to rent the car. We had gone on an excursion and when the bus dropped us off, we were embarrassed to get off in front of this hotel. The food was sub par and did not offer many choices. You don't get a do over on your honeymoon. I am so upset!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A wonderful helpful server. The best on the Islands. Great Attitude. Give her a promotion & raise. Thank you, my wife & I are Gold Members Janice & Montford Williams 14425 Marwood Ane, Baton Rouge, La 70816 Go Tigers!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When you hear hilton you know its the best.I have stayed in many hilton hotels but this one was not.They have construction going on.What was bad about was one of their housekeeper cleaning next to our room.She asked me twice what time will we be checking out. It was only about 930 am. This is the only place where a housekeeper from a hotel asking a guest twice on the time of checking out.That was so annoying!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is a few blocks from the beach and doesn't really provide an ocean view. I would suggest finding a hotel closer to the beach if you are interested in a vacation spot versus middle-class business lodgins.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everything is easy going on Hawaii, this also goes for this hotel. Staff is friendly (american friendly) and rooms are ok. Being here twice I noticed that the sea view rooms are a bit more quiet. Sea view here means put your head around the corner and you can see the sea from a distance.Went during peak season so paid a premium rate. 10 minutes walk to Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Waikiki Beach is not very close. But do I think a walk. Location is not bad. Overall satisfaction was, I think if you go back to Hawaii to stay in this hotel ~ ^^ I love hawaii. I love DoubleTree by Hilton Alana Hotel Waikiki. Thank you.
user_name:
Dana K
Gwang Ju, North Korea

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is great. We're in Hawaii to get married in the North Shore but need to stay one night in Waikiki and a friend recommended this hotel to us. It is really great! The staff was very pleasant and professional. The kids loved the warm cookie younget whrn checking in. The entrance was under construction and a little tore up but I guess that's a small price for progress. The room was exceptional. The beds were very comfortable. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everyone at DoubleTree Alana--from the amazing front desk, telephone communications and restaurant staff to the wonderful valet and bell desk to the housekeeping and maintenance personnel--are so kind and spectacular. The rooms are really nice as well as the location. The entire DoubleTree Alana team truly cares so much for each guest and am so fortunate whenever I have a chance to stay there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was under renovation at the front entrance but that did not impede the quality of service, at all. From the front desk staff to the event staff the service was excellent! My room was clean, quiet and comfortable. It was the best night of sleep this hard working mom and teacher has had in a very long time. Thank you Double Tree...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent four nights here. We got a shuttle right from the airport, and they booked our return shuttle right then -- no hassle. Our dates were in late April 2015 and they were doing work on the lobby entry but staff was right there to assist us with our luggage. (They said lobby work would be done by June.) Our room was on floor five on the corner and had a wide balcony, where we ate breakfast and most dinners. Birds abounded, and the park across the street was a nice visual break in the welter of buildings downtown.One minus, not their fault -- the street outside is being worked on from 8 to 5 to install a new storm sewer. Did you want to spend most daylight hours in your room? If you do, check with hotel about completion dates.We had been in Waikiki/Honolulu before and had a rental car then and paid $30/night for parking. This time we did without a rental car. So much of what you want to see is easy to get to by bus (museums, etc,) The concierge was very helpful getting our shuttle to Pearl Harbor lined up, and she dealt with other questions we had also. Concierge and valets worked as a team.My wife had broken her leg and was hobbling on a cast and walker. Accessibility was fine, and again staff was helpful. I tried the pool once -- guess it was too tepid for me. We did not pay for WiFi but simply spent a little time in the lobby where it was free. Another VERY helpful thing -- I left some things in my room when we checked out (electric razor, pills, magazines), They called me and then shipped these things to me at their expense ($30+). GREAT service, Jim McShane (security manager) and Terrence McDermott (security manager)!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room was clean and up to date, however the construction was distracting, and made for walking out of the hotel needing to go through the parking lot. Rooms were clean and main lobby was inviting, however the stairs to the street were no accessible due to new construction on the building. I stayed there one week and not one time did I see anybody working on the updates in front of the hotel. Air conditioner was set at 68 and on a motion sensor, that made the room hot, Staff was able to put code in thermostat that helped make room cooler. Was not impressed with the morning parking attendant, had to get my own car out of the parking garage because he did not want to have to drive around the block, not really sure why we pay 30.00 a day if I have to get my own car everyday, would have been better if it was discounted price for self service.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The walls of the actual room were very thin and I could hear the neighboring guests and the staff that were in the halls. Despite being a room with partial ocean view, I mostly saw other high-rise buildings and the construction below. Our bathroom was not in the best shape either. The toilet paper holder was broken and the toilet overflowed at one point. Given the rates they charged, I expected more. Location is great in terms of distance to the beach though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at the Alana are fantastic. This is my fifth stay at the hotel and the experience is consistently great. From the valets, to the housekeeping, front desk and restaurant staff everyone was warm inviting, helpful and friendly. The hotel is convenient to Waikiki and all it has to offer. It is always a pleasure staying at the Alana Double Tree. Mahalo nui loa!
user_name:
Claire C
Corvallis, OR, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff was truly attentive, the food was always great, valet service was fast and my room was always cleaned with attention to detail. It doesn't get better than that, right? Well they found my tablet cover with all the adapters I left behind...they called me when I got home and said they were shipping it back that day. It just arrived and I wanted to take a moment and thank the staff at the Doubletree Alan Waikiki for everything they do!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here in November for a week. Eh. Nothing really special. When we checked in our room was not ready - it was undergoing renovation so to make up for putting us in the wrong room they gave us a large room/suite - next tot he elevators. The staff was nice but not overly helpful or friendly - the valet service was hit or miss - sometimes very quick, other times very slow. The restaurant was good.There are better hotels in Waikiki for the same price or less.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Traveled to Honolulu for a friend's wedding and thought I'd use some Hilton points to take the sting out of the unplanned travel expense. It's a DoubleTree so I didn't have lofty expectations. My room was decent, but the hotel is undergoing renovations so it isn't what one would call tranquil. It also isn't very well-located. It isn't miles from the ocean, but it is a good hike, and is noticeably down-market from other properties like to Moana Surfrider or the Outrigger. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, but ultimately that wasn't enough to make up for its poor location and mediocre facilities.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here from May 26 - June 2 and I must say that upon driving up to the hotel I was a little frustrated with the construction which seemed to slow down valet service however that was the only issue I found. My stay was absolutely amazing! So much so that I have to fill out this review giving kudos to those who made my stay so pleasant. Claire at the front desk was always extremely helpful and kind. I could show up at the counter and ask for a cookie (Doubletree's signature courtesy tool) and she was always happy to oblige. After a trip to the beach I came back to my room extremely sandy, so much so that I went to the front desk and asked her for a broom so that I could clean my mess. She refused and sent housekeeping right away and they fixed me up with a smile. Earl, in the restaraunt makes being away from home a little more like home with his warm greetings and kindness. He remembers your face and what you like and has everything ready for you before you can even ask. Jason in valet services was always very kind and friendly. He never hesitated to point out a good eatery or entertainment spot. I never met the manager but I must imagine that with such a wonderful staff that this is a direct reflection of their leadership. Thank you Claire, Earl, Jason and those of you behind the scenes that I didn't see who made my stay so wonderful. I also loved my room it was beautiful and the hot water lasted for as long as I was in the shower. Simply perfect trip. Thank you again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We chose the hotel to be close to the shopsWe booked an ocean view room and could see the ocean through the other buildingsNice balcony with a view of the very green parkVery comfortable room and great staff - friendly and helpfulSome street noise - not too intrusive

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was very impressed with the Waikiki DoubleTree by Hilton. A very nice modern room and bath, comfortable bed, very quiet and good price for the location. Clean and spacious, inviting lounge chair. Cookies upon check in. Express check out. A convenient restaurant downstairs with decent food and happy hour. Coffee house and convenience store close by and assorted restaurants and fast food in the area. Elevator was on the slow side. City view not that impressive and pool area did not have afternoon sun. A bit strange that a room was located on the edge of the pool. I appreciated the effort to think about the environment including trash bins with a divider for recyclables, a water flow option in the shower, and option to not have room cleaned for three days in exchange for $10 food credit. Watch out for the door, it was very heavy. Popular with business people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked the suite, which is roomy enough for 3 people comfortable and squeeze in 6. The refrigerator is a joke, to small, and wasn't cold. I had to keep my drinks in a cooler or Iced down in the sink. Overall it is a decent hotel, but my suite was located right next to the ice machine, very noisey. I would suggest if you are willing to spend the extra $$ hilton Hawaiian Village, Alli tower is a much better experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree in Wakiki is an oasis of luxury. The staff is friendly and caring and always attentive to your needs. The food in the restaurant was the best we had all week. I wish we had stayed there exclusively the whole week instead of just one night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Visited this hotel for our Annual Grand Communications and had a blast! However, a few things caught my attention. Short staffing during our lunch and dinner hours had the otherwise VERY friendly staff very drained by the day's end. During our BANQUET, where you would assume a facility should prepare to have additional staffing, our bar had to close numerous times so that the bartenders could assist with serving food. Of course, we can't be rude and walk around while speakers are presenting, but when you're notified that the bar will close five minutes into the dancing/social portion, that becomes frustrating. On another note, the elevator situation was horrible, bring that they were small and that one was constantly out of service, again, during a very busy and expected event. The high point to this hotel is indeed the friendly staff, who REALLY worked hard to accommodate and make up for the lack of preparation and facility issues. I believe we are set to return next year, but if the option is brought to the table, my vote will be No.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent stay.....helpful staff and very accommodating. The front lobby is being renovated so it looks a little funny on the exterior, however, once inside it is very much up to Hilton standards!! Would stay there again!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was disappointed in this hotel - Hilton is usually a great stay. There was construction on going which made entry and exit inconvenient. The workout room had a very low ceiling which limited the machines I could use. Breakfast was okay but never changed the 6 days I stayed. Street noise was a nuisance at night. Parking was $30 a day and valet only resulting in 10 to 20 min waits each morning to get my car out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff is amazing! Once the construction is complete this hotel will be the go to stop for staying in downtown Waikiki. Save yourself 300 dollars a night and stay here! The rooms are nicely furnished, the bed is super comfortable. The hotel bar has amazingly priced drinks for downtown Waikiki. Your within 15 minutes walking distance from Yard House and the Hard Rock, an easy choice to stay here for any occasion!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Quiet, Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Friendly staff. Free Cookies! Free Newspaper. Only gripe was $30/day valet parking. Right in the middle from Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki Beach. No problems with security or safety.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Kudos to the staff(front desk, housekeeping, valet) for their professionalism, outstanding and courteous service, especially to Rebecca at the front desk. I encountered a problem with my reservations and she remedied the situation way exceeding my expectations. A big shout out and Mahalo to her co-worker Joe as well and finally to Kai who was able to assist me with a urgent last minute request. While this was a work trip, thank you for making it stress free and enjoyable. Oh and not to forget the waitstaff at Trees, thank you for the smiles and cheerful attitudes each morning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Though the hotel was under construction, the location is still one of the most convenient places. Close to shopping and to the Wakiki area. Room rates are reasonable and the stuff are very helpful and nice.I have stayed here several times and would choose it again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at hotel two nights. Was disappointed with the amenities and the hotel itself. Very small, busy and in need of renovation. When we arrived, the staff was incredibly accommodating but overall I did not enjoy our stay. Construction in front of the hotel was an eyesore that added to my disappointment. Internet not included and breakfast at the hotel's restaurant is very expensive. Ensure you safeguard your valuables and do not forget anything in your room because you will not get it back. Had to check out early and forgot several items of clothing in the room. I went back to inquire about the items and was told housekeeping did not find anything. Spoke to manager and even offered a small reward but manager never called back. Will not stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A wonderful experience. Came here for a business trip and it was really close to everything. For the first couple days I had to go to the Convention center and it was only 15 minutes by foot. The valet I met was super friendly and the front desk gives cookies..well so did the restaurant. Great food btw for breakfast room service and at the Trees Restaurant. The room itself was beautiful although the side I got did not have that much of a view..got the neighboring apartments..anyway the bathroom was great and pristine..the bed was like a cloud and the cooling system was fully functional. I did have the hardest time contacting the front desk on the second to my last day..as I was trying to check on my check out date..good thing they write it on the card holder so that was not a huge problem; I just would have liked the option to double check which I could not. Back to the positive, if I have the option I would enjoy another stay at this hotel...if on leisure I'd be interested to check on the other amenities. I loved the bathroom and comfy bed! Restaurant bar tender was definitely fantastic to meet as he was kind enough to fix my drink twice and gave me a cookie lol 2 thumbs up!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hilton needs to update this property. It is showings it's age. We have stayed here on and off many times while doing things in and around Oahu. If it wasn't for the staff who continue to impress and care we would have stayed across the street at the Hilton. You can't say anything other than hats off to the staff.
user_name:
Tina B
kaiula kona, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: 1- HOTEL ENTRANCE/PARKING IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION. The hotel is not attractive upon arrival.2- Check in agent was polite but not very helpful. Cleaning staff did a wonderful job keeping the room clean and fresh.3- Hotel pool was not impressive. I guess it doesn't really matter if you are planning on spending time in the ocean anyways.4- Check out was painful. Don't take the agents on the phone for their word. If they say something is on file, get it in writing. 5- Valet parking required even though I could have parked the vehicle myself. Also WIFI not included!Overall, I loved Hawaii, not this Hotel. If I go back, I won't stay here again. Not even worth the discounted rate I paid.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Double Tree - Alana lives up to the brand standard. The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice and courteous.We were there celebrating our 5th anniversary without our kids. I have a newborn daughter who is exclusively breast milk fed. Claire Baek at the front desk went out of her way to store my milk in the freezer ensuring it stayed safe until we had to go back to Chicago. She was always so kind and pleasant to deal with.Knowing that the employees care about my needs and made sure my stay was worry free was awesome. The only draw back was the mandatory valet parking, although all the valet attendants were very kind and fast to get the car.I will definitely be back and look forward to seeing all the nice ladies at the front desk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Having stayed at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki for over 8 years. it just keeps getting better. More upscale these days, but the staff are and always have been what brings me back here. The rooms are well appointed, really nice since the remodel a couple years ago. Flat screen TVs, desk, frig, modern bathrooms/shower, coffee maker - always make my stay enjoyable. The workout and pool on Mezzanine, and business center near front desk are all very nice for a hotel this size. Free wifi in the lobby and Trees restaurant are critical since I'm usually on business here. The trees breakfast team, the valet parking and especially the front desk staff are all outstanding, so kind and friendly - my Waikiki Ohana, especially Rebecca at the front desk who always gives me tips about new restaurants and things not to miss in the Waikiki area. And the location could not be more convenient for Waikiki, Ala Moana or going to town and heading around the Island. I hope this hotel never changes, keep up the great customer service.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for our son's graduation from University of Hawaii. Our experience at this property was above and beyond my expectations. We were greeted with "Aloha!" and received warm cookies at check-in, one for each of us. Every staff member we encountered was very nice and friendly, and service was superb. The hotel was in the middle of renovation when we stayed (the lobby was blocked off in places and the drive-up was inaccessible) so we probably didn't get a great idea of the lobby, but what we saw was nice. The guestrooms appear to have been very recently renovated, and they were beautiful and functional. I especially liked the desk lamp, and the alarm clock has a USB plug in back to charge your phone. A nice. and needed, touch. There's a decorative frosted window between the bathroom and bedroom which is a nice touch, but it does let a lot of light through so it can disturb your roommates if you need the restroom at night. A minor quip, though. My only complaint was that the thermostat in the room was of the motion-sensing type. Ordinarily I think this is an awesome idea (why heat/cool a room so much when no one's in there?), but the thermostat in our room didn't seem to recognize that the room was occupied--it only sensed motion. We'd enter the room and the A/C would kick on, but when we went to bed after a half hour or so it would shut off because there was no movement. I slept a little warmly because of this, though admittedly I like the room very cool. Location of the hotel is great, just a short walk to Waikiki and also to the Hilton Hawaiian Village resort which is a great place to explore. Don't expect great views, though. Our room faced the mountains but there's another building very close to this one that dominates the view. I'm not sure what you can see on the other side of the building, but even a sub-par view in Hawaii is better than most anywhere else! I can't comment on parking since we did not bring a vehicle. Overall, a great stay. If they get better thermostats in there, I'd say a perfect stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: hawaii is part of my territory so everyone once in awhile I bring him along. They always give us a nice room but this time we got an upgrade. I spend about 90 nights a year in a hotel so I'm pretty picky and definitely have my favorite hotels. This doubletree is close enough to the beach for me and definitely far enough from the crazy crowds of Waikiki. This place has good partial ocean views, not a huge place so you aren't fighting for elevator space, and the staff rocks.The breakfast crew is very nice and I always get my warm food just the way I like it.Reception is great too and they are generous with their cookies!Good spot for beer adjacent to the hotel.Stayed here about 10 times within the last 3 years! They are my go to Waikiki spot and I am always I sad when they are sold out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is NOT the fanciest hotel on Waikiki, but it is also not the most expensive. The price was reasonable for its location which I thought was excellent. The room was nice, not great with a wonderful balcony. What made this property stand out were the ladies at the front desk, esp Rebecca who has been referred to in other reviews. They were very helpful answering questions esp about buses to take to various venues. As a senior citizen I could ride the bus for $1 and did that going to Pearl Harbor one day and Diamond head the next. There are complimentary computers in the business office and daily papers at the front desk. I did NOT eat any meals in the restaurant, but one should be prepared for "sticker shock" at food prices in Honolulu. One morning breakfast for 3 at the IHOP down the street was > $50 .

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My sister and I were looking for hotels to stay in for about 6 days and found DoubleTree, it was slightly pricier than other hotels but honestly it is so worth it! We saw the reviews and were still slightly skeptical but if you're looking for a hotel in Oahu, this is definitely one of the places to spend a few nights in. The staff were always so friendly and very helpful at all times, probably one of the best staff members i've encountered from hotels! The room was amazing, it was always kept clean and tidy! We didn't specifically request it but our room was on the highest floor even though it was just a normal room, no fancy suites or anything. If you can, you should request it! Honestly really enjoyed my stay here in DoubleTree, made my first visit to Hawaii really memorable and enjoyable :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've been a Hilton Honors member since 2006 and staying at Hilton properties many years before 2006. This property was under construction, elevators were dirty, bugs in the bathroom and prices for the breakfast buffet changed almost daily depending on which server we had. Other members of the staff were nice. I've never written a negative review about any hotel or a Hilton property before today. Very disappointing and not worth the price. I would not recommend the Double Tree in Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the word go, the staff at the Alana Waikiki were absolutely wonderful. This started from the staff behind the front desk (a very warm thank you to Rebecca) all the way to the cleaning staff and valets. They made the stay truly a wonderful experience. Upon check on, I had encountered issues with my credit card, and Rebecca did her utmost to make sure that our stay would not be hampered by a little banking issue. Upon rectifying the issue, and some of those awesome cookies, our first overseas family holiday went on without incident.The cleaning staff were very accomodating, and when we were not ready to have the room serviced, they would smile, say "not to worry" and would return like cleaning angels and have our room done when we were out. The rooms were of a good standard, but carrying the name Hilton, I may have had my standards aimed a little too high? It slept a family of five with relative comfort but space was a little small. Perhaps smaller bathroom to have a larger bedroom? The hotel was close to most amenities including the beach. The pool was heated but on the small side and the gym seemed functional. The restuarant was a little light on menu and the meals where a little underwhelming. A small issue of ongoing construction at the front of the hotel lost that "front of house" appeal, but easily negotiated via the valet parking ramp. I am sure that the improvements will help the hotel. But overall the stay was pleasant but the staff were beyond expectation and really made the stay enjoyable and without incident. PS Again, Thank you Rebecca.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff here at the Double Tree are definitely and amazing bunch. They truly try to create a home feel for their guest. I have been here a few times before and from about my second stay the Valet staff had remembered me and welcomed me back immediately. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an amazing hotel to stay at with great staff!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Melissa at the front desk was very helpful and a pleasure to interact with. She recommended the Trees Restaurant for dinner and the "Best Mai Tai Waikiki". Very enjoyable and a good value. I stayed overnight on Business. Our meeting room was fine with lunch and break service provided. The hotel is off the main drag in Waikiki so it was quieter than I expected.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Lovely hotel except when I telephoned booked they failed to declare construction work on the hotel and due to this construction no parking is available, instead valet parking would have to be used at the respective rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: So, I parked my car at the double tree. Gave the valet my keys after I parked it (the valet was not there to receive my car). Long story short, I was called down by the valet stating that my key was broken. They broke my key and after weeks of speaking on the phone and via e-mail, they are not going to own up and replace it. They stated that it was broken when they received it. If that was the case, why would the valet take a broken key(my mind is blown)? My bill for a new key for my car is nearly $250 from Honda. Not only will I never stay at a double Tree, but I will never stay at a Hilton either. Terrible customer service and nothing but excuses. Stay away, please.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: this was a great hotel, the staff were personable and the price and the location great. we were only in HNL for a few days for personal business, but this hotel is in a prime location. close to Ala Moana Mall, close to Waikiki. the room and bathroom was in excellent condition, clean and fresh. view from my room, not so good, but I was there for sightseeing, personal business and not for staying in the room all day, but I could have in that bed! The bed was so comfortable!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Entire staff was over the top friendly. Everyone made me feel at home. The room was clean and comfortable. On site restaurant was good and the hours they were open was very accommodating. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very conveninet location for those having to travel away from the Waikiki area on business. Many other hotels would require driving through the busy Waikiki area. This location makes it very easy to come and go on business. Could have been better on my Diamond upgrade but overall this hotel works well for my business travels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed in Doubletree by Hilton in many places, one of the reasons we enjoy staying there is that you know what you are getting and that it is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. When we recently stayed there an item was forgotten, I emailed to Hilton and in turn they sent my email to the hotel in Waikiki. I was thrilled to hear back from them, that my item was being sent to me. This is what I call customer service. Thank you Doubletree Alana Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Unfortunately during our recent stay, the entrance to the property was under construction as was the park area across the street. This made for a rather unpleasant visual impression about this hotel. One would hope that after all construction is finished this situation will improve. Once inside the hotel, the lobby is small and the property has the feeling of one that is getting a little tired. However our room was comfortable and the hotel staff is excellent. But why still not offer free wifi in the rooms unless you are Hilton gold or above. Free wifi is available in the lobby, but it is a pain to leave your room to use this service. Continued boooo to you Hilton for continuing this policy at Doubletree. Bar and restaurant choices are very close by and the beach is about a 8 minute walk away. When construction is complete, this should remain a good value property in expensive Honolulu

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I always thought DoubleTree Hotels were on a par with Hilton properties, but geared more toward business travelers. The DoubleTree Alana Waikiki is more on a par with a 30-year old Holiday Inn. It makes me wonder what chain owned this property before Hilton took over.The rooms were nothing special. Each room has a small balcony with a pair of chairs and drink table. The desk is okay, the chair comfortable, but lacking enough nearby outlets. I thought the bed was fine, with a choice of pillow firmness, but others weren't as happy. The bathroom is tiny, but with a pretty cool shower. At least there is a wealth of storage space, with an armoire, a settee with drawers, adjacent shelves and cabinets in addition to four drawers below the 40-inch TV. The rooms seemed clean enough, and tastefully appointed, except for the wall repair which had not been painted. This room should not have been sold until that was fixed. My "City View" room was more like a dumpster and tenement-view. I checked the, "Ocean View" room a co-worker had, and if you leaned far enough and had binoculars, you might see the ocean. I might have been able to get a better room, if I had the Hilton app on my phone, except it is not compatible with my cutting-edge smart phone. Still no word on when Hilton's Apple-fanboy developers will fix this problem for the majority of smart phone users.The public areas were pretty dismal. The doors on my floor, had shoe marks, or were missing paint. On the HHonors floor, the doors were at least covered with 70s-vintage wood grain contact paper. Speaking of the 70s, the hallway carpeting was spot-on for retro night. The lobby was cramped, and under construction, so ingress and egress was only through the garage, which gouged guests to the tune of $30 a night. I never tried the $25 breakfast buffet, so I can't comment on its quality. Another couple of gripes, $9.95 for internet when the rest of the free world now provides complimentary internet, and the hotel-exclusive television service provider has the slowest channel change and channel guide I have experienced anywhere. I finally wrote a list of channels (No AMC? No Fox Sports1? No FX?) so I could change channels directly, though that was problematic as the remote and TV didn't communicate all that well.This hotel really doesn't do much to accommodate its members with status. I talked to a Platinum guy, who was stuck on the same floor with me. At least he had free internet.On the plus side, Waikiki is only about a ten-minute walk away. There are plenty of restaurants within the same distance. The pool area has nice comfy sofas, and is a great place for evening cocktails. The staff was quite willing to help and most were reasonably friendly. Oh yeah, the cookies are still damn fine. In summary, this property appears to be getting a face lift outside, but the surgeon needs to do some major work inside as well. Additionally, this DoubleTree needs to work on a lot of the little things to earn its leaves. I can't expect Hilton to move the hotel to a beachfront location, but it sure can make what they have better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As I approached the drive way, I was unable to find the entrance. Circled backed a few times, drove up without seeing the valet sign. The porter was unset. I had to back down as if I am the porter and he is the guest, very rude. Others staff in the hotel are nice. I told them I am moving to the village. The hotel in general is an older establishment. It is my anniversary and I don't want to stay in a place that looks like a war zone. They allowed it without penalty. I have to say, if the hotel is in reconstructing. It is better to shut it down because it is not at the same level in appearance compared with others that charge the same rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The entrance to the hotel is under construction. The cotinental breakfast is limited, but for an additional $8.00 + tax you can get the buffet. The mattress was very soft and painful. There was a refrigerator but no microwave.The bathroom is is small and crowded. The shower is nice once you figure out the controls.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My brother and I ended up staying here the last night of our trip. We had to make last minute arrangements as the hotel we were in was awful and we couldn't stand another night. Maggie at the front desk made sure our room was everything our last hotel was not, and more. Room was quiet and clean, the new renovations are great. Everything in the room makes you feel welcome and like they really want you to have a good stay. If you forget little things like shaving cream etc they have that too. Also, great location. Only a few minutes walk to the beach and ala moana shopping center. We asked for a later check out and it was no problem at all. Also stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort at the very start of our trip, and I prefer the Double Tree Hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: very helpful and excellent service , good location, love the valet parking and the affordability, food was good in the hotel restaurant, very pleasant experience. i would definitely staff again and again :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A decent hotel within walking distance of Waikiki Beach. It was clean and quiet. They delivered on their promise. The breakfast was eggs, sausage, potatoes, rice, and continental for $24. Not worth that. The concierge was extremely helpful.
user_name:
Henry W H
Duluth, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There was no notice to me prior to checking in that there was going to be constructions on the hotel during my entire stay. They didn’t offer any for the inconvenience of the noise and filth due to the construction.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everyone at Doubletree Alana Waikiki always makes me feel at home. I enjoy their warm hospitality and the true meaning of aloha. Mahalo a nui loa, thank you everyone at Doubletree Alana for your warm hospitality.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here one night before starting a cruise. Good location to many restaurants and sights. Clean, modern, in tip top shape. Staff is very helpful and professional. My only complaint is that the hotel does not have shuttle service from the airport. Expect to pay $35 or so for the cab ride.
user_name:
BobB3664
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Hotel has been consistent with the keeping the standards, warm and welcoming staff, very clean in and out, great food, and most of all the display of Aloha! Upon checking in Miss Rebbecca remember me by name (extra star) greeted me with a smile, informed me on the renovations around the property checked me in and the best ahhhhhh the warm Signature DoubleTree cookie. All of this and cookie life is good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A good business hotel. Copies of the newspaper and a friendly staff are a plus. Also, the hotel is in a good location in relation to Waikiki so you are able to walk to a lot of places for food and entertainment nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Believe me when I say you can do better in the same area for the same price. I was traveling with four other business partners and two of them stayed at a much nicer location one block away for the same exact price with no problems.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is a good value and the location is close enough to many of the areas of interest. close to the Airport and Memorial along with the North Shore. The Army Museum is within walking distance. Most rooms appear not to have any view of the water.
user_name:
Alvin A
Suffolk Va., United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was excellent. I'm glad I had the chance to stay here. The hotel's location is both good and bad. It is just outside of Waikiki which makes access to Waikiki difficult. For some, this would be a welcome relief but for me it was a little too far. That being said, there are some great things to see and do around the hotel that I would normally not get to see and do. I would stay here again but may consider other locations too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First let me thank Claire Baek, Front Desk Agent, for her invaluable help in preparing several written business proposals that I needed help with. Bravo Claire! I was in town on business with a little R&R tacked on the back end. My room was on the 18th floor on the corner with ocean and (peek aboo) Diamond Head views (thank you Hilton Honors Gold status!). Two balconies with sitting areas on both. Room 1820 is the hot tip.Beautiful but just a bit noisy.Excellent service,great location a block and a half from the beach and well kept, well appointed room.Be advised that they are undergoing some renovations at street level, but there was no real inconvenience.Thanks again Claire!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is the number one view suite in this hotel! The view overlooks Ala Moana blvd. with Diamond Head in the background, and the Hilton Hawaiian Village on your right. There is one larger hotel that ruins the view a little further right, but that's the way it is. The patio deck is the largest I have been on. big enough to have a small gathering to enjoy the view. No free wifi in the rooms for everyone, not even in the penthouse. Whats up with that? All the higher end hotels have free wifi in this day and age, and everyone should have it, not just gold and platinum Hilton Honors members. The bathroom needs to be upgraded and the furnishings seems from the 60's, but you are really paying for the view, and it is pretty spectacular!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel would get an extra star from me if I we traveling for work but this NOT a place for vacationers! We stayed here two nights on the end of a ten day vacation. The view from the balcony was horrible! Lots of run down apartments directly across from the hotel made for a terrible view. The pool was relatively small but I doubt it ever gets busy so maybe the lack of ambiance poolside isn't a big issue. We we're offered cookies at check in, no biggie, but i was surprised considering we had two school-age kids in tow. The one bedroom suite we requested was just a big room with a sliding divider. It's easy to miss because the entry isn't well labeled. Only real plus is there is a descent bar downstairs and restaurants in walking distance. The honors floor is a joke because the rooms were so small and basic.The price is TOO HIGH for such small rooms. I'd stay again but I'd never stay longer than a day or two. Not a vacation location at all. It's just a basic place to sleep.*I was really annoyed that they didn't offer free wifi! Come on, it's 2015...give us the wifi already! Geez!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here on our first and last nights in Oahu. Our last night was at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Of the two resorts, we preferred the DoubleTree Alana. Perhaps if we had had time to use the pool and other amenities, we would have liked the Village better. But the rooms at the Doubletree were brighter. And, more attractive. We got an upgrade to a corner unit because we have Hilton Honors. The corner unit featured double sliders with two balconies and a nice view of the ocean. The hotel was attractive throughout and the bell and front desk service was warm and friendly. The warm cookies at check-in were a bonus. I liked the other guests too. A couple of conventions were taking place onsite while we were there and we enjoyed the conversations we had with the National Parks staff who were there to work on Hawaii's parks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is convenient to lots of places on the upper end of Waikiki. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. A coffee house is just up the street if you want something good and very reasonable. We really enjoyed our stay there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were looking for a relatively inexpensive place to stay before our our started. This met the bill. The room was clean; the beds were comfortable. The only negative is that they only have one restaurant with a limited menu. Free internet in the lobby but charged for in rooms.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A first class hotel with spacious room and very comfortable king-size bed. The staff was courteous, helpful and efficient. It is located within walking distance of shopping, very good restaurants and Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was beautiful. The staff is exceptionally courteous and attentive. The hotel is conveniently located. It is close to wonderful dining areas, shopping and the beach. And if you happen to be there on a Friday night, there is a spectacular firework show right outside your window.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel staff is very friendly. We didn't have any stress during stay in this hotel. チェックインのレセプションカウンターから掃除係の方まで，皆さん親切な方ばかりでした．ストレスに感じることは殆どありません．サービスは通り一遍ではなく，柔軟な対応をしてくれます．会議室を借りましたが，設備やコーヒーサービス等十分に感じました．

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was fine but nothing special and very out-dated in it's decor. The location was good but for the price paid I was expecting much more. I got a complementary room upgrade so the room was large but very plain.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: In town for only a few days to visit family, we decided to stay at the DoubleTree mostly because of our Hilton membership and its location to the entrance (exit?) to Waikiki. Check-in was easy and while the valet-only parking was a surprise, it's not that big a deal since the garage is so tiny and maneuvering would have been a pain (plus, the valets are FAST). They were kind enough to give us a very large suite on the 17th floor, perhaps to make up for having no ocean-facing rooms, but honestly, the DoubleTree is so far away from the ocean, I'm not sure we would have had much of a view. Room was enormous and the bed very comfortable, and curtains helped block out the sunlight, though unfortunately, not the traffic noise. Double-paned windows and sliders might help cut down some of the ambient traffic because on Oahu, man does traffic start early. We enjoyed drinks in the bar and found both bartenders extremely friendly to us and the other visitors. Clearly the DoubleTree handles a lot of business travelers, because we saw many individuals eating by themselves or in groups. You save money on the DoubleTree by not paying for a lot of resort amenities, but the lap pool and small gym was clearly getting some use. If you're okay with being in full view of the next door apartment building, it should not be a problem, but I can see where this may not be the most desirable of hotels for families looking for extras. The breakfast was not imaginative, but for Hilton Honors, it was free. Overall, the hotel worked out fine for our very short-term needs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff were very friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable, the shower was great. Rooms were clean.cookies were delicious. That being said, the Doubletree Alana is on ala mona boulevard which makes for a lot of street noise. The cops seem to run down this road with their sirens on in the middle of the night. The hotel is only a five minute walk from the Hilton Hawaiian village just in case you have friends staying there. And for another $70 per night you can stay there and have an ocean beach, a quiet room, and access to three swimming pools. One other note: the pool at the double tree is in the wind. It's little with no shelter. It is saltwater which is nice. We went over to the Hilton Hawaiian village and the wind went away. I think the big buildings block the wind at the Hilton. I'd opt for the more expensive choice next time. For business the doubletree would be great. For a vacation I'd opt for more amenities.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff here is outstanding! I had a late flight and they accommodated a late checkout. Always responsive to any concerns and the cookies are the bomb! Had to buy an extra can for family back home. I traveled here for work and I would stay here again in a heartbeat as it was very affordable and high quality. Close walk to some great restaurants and the beach. Valet parking is the only option here but they are so quick and kind. A joy to talk to every day. Wonderful experience. I'm an HHonors member so the Wi-fi was free for me but looks like there would be a cost for someone else.
user_name:
Laela E
Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Friendly smiles, clean hotel, comfortable and centrally located. You can always count on the Double Tree, from their professional valet staff, to the courteous front desk staff (and yes, warm yummy cookie!), to the friendly housekeeping staff...the Double Tree Waikiki is our families; go to spot in Oahu. Business, family or just a weekend get a way...we always stay at the Double Tree Waikiki!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here over Xmas & New Year..our first visit to Hawaii and the busiest time of the year...great location and an easy flat 8 minute walk into the action...nice quiet area with easy access to Hilton Hawaiian Village and beach. Not alot of facilities (no bar and nowhere to really sit and relax in the foyer) but rooms were good size and clean. Great views from upper floors and quick to get taxi to anywhere. Not too far from Al Moana Centre (10 min walk). Lots of sirens all throughout the night..not sure why. Pool pretty small. Plenty of great places to eat close by.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I feel like I am probably the only person who has to go to this beautiful place for work.Yeah, I know, just sad.Anyway, all that aside it is interesting to see how a hotel set up for tourists accommodates a business traveler. The answer is pretty well.There are no laundry services on Sunday, but the staff got me checked in quickly and efficently, no problem getting transport and packages were promptly deliverd to my room.The hotel, like most in the area, is set up for tourists and while I was there most of the other guests were groups from China, Japan and couples from Australia and mainland US.The rooms are comfortable and clean.On the negative side I was woken 2 nights in a row by drunk guest yelling in the hallway. This is obviously not the hotel's fault in any way.I would love to come back again as a tourist.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed here a few times , our family, as Hilton Village full, We have always enjoyed it,. Checked in, room upgrade, it just keeps getting better each time., Cookies and water on arrival, (thats hot cookies) breakfast fantastic, as an upgrade, well worth the extra,as we are gold/diamond members free wi fi, and breakfast, Bar tender great, and drinks were fantastic, pool a bit on the small side, but gym etc OK, plus 5 mins walk to beach and Hilton Village,and near local shops, plus burger in paradise ,next door.Staff from check in to check out great, we are off to Embassy suites later in the week, so see how it compares. all in all great value hotel,rooms excellent, very clean ,etc. many thanks to you all saunders family, ps free wi fi ,if gold member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel on business. We also had our business meeting at the hotel facility. The meeting facility was good but the service was absolutely pathetic. They did not serve the refreshments during the breaks properly nor ensured that there were cups for people to drink coffee or tea. The room was OK and very quiet being at the end of the floor away from the elevator. I ordered room service breakfast overnight for delivery within a set time frame but got it nearly 30 minutes late. Calls to front desk at times never got answered or were put on long hold. Overall customer service needs to really improve at this hotel. They however accommodated me with a late checkout until 6 pm at a cost of nearly $90.I have stayed at a number of hotels in Waikiki area and I would say this is one which I would avoid in the future.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic front fest team and great bartenders at the Tree. Great location , noting other than A plus! Lost a ring, security went above and beyond to help with the situation. Quick walk to the Hilton that has great ocean front bars as well. Great stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed 2 nights at the DoubleTree recently. I came here for work on my way to a week in Kauai for vacation. I wasn't expecting much, mostly b/c this was a work trip and I was mostly looking forward to my vacation. From the moment I walked in, I was impressed. Rebecca at the front desk greeted me warmly (after 10 hours of flying + 3 hours of waiting around airports). My room was AMAZING! Views of Waikiki and the mountains. The location was great and enabled me to get in some good running. I also needed a slightly later check-out and Rebecca once again was able to accommodate me.I will absolutely stay here next time. And if you stay here, say aloha to Rebecca for me :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree was our base for a week long cycling tour of Oahu. All the hotel staff provided excellent service! Including accommodating our bicycles for the week. Great location close to restaurants and other services. Thanks for a great vacation and the cookies are awesome.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Hotel was clean and comfortable. Everything was within walking distance. Had a very nice view from the 17th floor. The restaurant was pricey but the bartender was very nice. Will definitely stay here again when we come to Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I try to stay at Hilton properties and this was the lowest priced Hilton property in Honolulu. The overall experience was good. The location was a short walk (less than a mile) to Waikiki and a couple of blocks to the ocean. There is an ocean view here but you will not see the beach or hear the waves. I stayed in room 1511 and was more than pleased with the view. Only two complaints were the air conditioner and restaurant service. As many others noted the rooms are warm and humid, I had read the reviews prior to arriving so it was no surprise. The other complaint was the waitstaff at breakfast. Apparently they are used to getting stiffed in tips by those who have vouchers because there was absolutely no service for 4 mornings. The front desk staff and valets were excellent, always a positive experience. I would consider staying again based on the location and price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was on business from Virginia and I feel very lucky to have been able to stay at the Alana Waikiki. It was not my first choice but it will be next time. The guest service staff were absolutely outstanding, professional and very friendly. The room size was fine, clean, and beds were comfortable. Bathroom shower was great, plenty of water pressure and modern fixtures. Only complaint is the bathroom mirrors are too low due to after eating all of the delicious chocolate chip cookies for more than a week, I could see my gut began to lap over my belt!! (Dunlap). The clean elevator mirrors didn't help either!! The cleaning staff was very friendly. The valet parking team were great, courteous and prompt. Location was within walking distance to everything I wanted to walk too. Overall, I had a great stay. I have business later in the year and hoping a room will be available at that time. Highly recommended. David M.
user_name:
David M
Chesapeake, VA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is very efficent, friendly, clean, and courteous. What else could you ask for? Close to transportation for tour buses, appears to be safe neighborhood, and has friendly lounge for Happy Hour. If you are mosltly interested in the beach this hotel is about a 10 min walk to the beach at the Hilton Hawaian Vilage.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I wanted to plan a last romantic weekend with my lady and the Double Tree made it happen, the suite was amazing, service from check in to check out was superb, had Dinner, drinks and Breakfast at the restaurant, service was attentive, friendly and made it all feel special, This is a must do hotel, Double Tree Alana Waikiki makes you feel welcomed and like family, beds very comfortable, room spotless, Staff was Great!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here on a business trip. Four nights. My room was on the small side, and the bathroom was tiny with only a shower (very small). The decor was fine and the bed was comfortable. The Internet on the 12th floor was spotty and at times hardly worked. The tv signal was poor and unwatchable at times- it would go in and out of signal.I wanted to order room service one night and my room had no menu. I called twice to have one sent up and it couldn't be done correctly so I had to travel to the restaurant, review the menu, order, then come back down to pick the food up (to avoid a $5 delivery fee and 18% gratuity)- saved $9 on a $20 meal. The valet parking is super tight, but they seem to have it figured out. $30 for parking seems extreme. Good location for walking around to restaurants. Easy to hop on the Nimitz to drive west. There is virtually no real estate to this property to explore, just rooms, A pool exercise facility and the front desk. I'll try for the Hawaiian village going forward unless it is cost prohibitive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is in a convenient location. Within walking distance to beach, food, and shopping. My room was facing a busy road and traffic noise was very loud. Rooms do not have refrigerators or microwaves. They charge $10.00 per day each if you want a refrigerator or microwave put in your room! Hotel staff were all great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 2 weeks. We had a Mountain view room. Pros:The beds were one of the best beds I've ever slept on in a hotel. The hotel/rooms were clean nicely decorated. You were rewarded for NOT getting your room cleaned with a $10.00 voucher for the restaurant downstairs. I don't like getting my room cleaned so this was perfect for us. We ate "Trees" one night and surprisingly it was fantastic! My group got the Fish Tacos and Pork Nachos (they were on happy hour special) also the ribeye steak entree and a burger! All was awesome! Free Cookies everyday that were awesome Location not too bad about 3 blocks from the HHV. Bell, Cleaning, restaurant and Front Desk staff were all very friendly!We heard the HHV uses the Doubletree for its Overbooking....There is no way I would take a room at the Doubletree over the HHV!
