Cons:Pool only got sun in the early morning to early afternoon and is very smallThe construction across the street is so awful its hard not to wear ear buds at the poolTV signal was very poor for the HD channelsBreakfast is really expensive (but worth it if your a gold or diamond member and get free continental coupons...you can upgrade to hot for $8.00)no free wi-fi

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The corridors were dank, the AC barely worked, and the pool area was depressing. We booked seven nights, but left after one. Unfortunately, my experiences at other Doubletrees this year have been similarly disappointing. You'd be much better off to try the nearby Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: wife thought it was OK, so I averaged.Pretty good room (until it got cold out [59] and we froze [65 in room]), really good mattress, excellent hospitality staff, OK location. Poor property, terrible maintenance (repeated requests accomplished nothing), ridiculously noisy from inside and out.Will NOT go back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed 8 nights at this property and were completely satisfied.As a frequent traveler holding Diamond status with Hilton, as well as Platinum with Marriott, I am constantly dumbfounded by the negative reviews from people who obviously do not travel much, and evidently have elevated expectations. You people will never be satisfied, and probably should just stay home.We were given a corner room on the 15th floor. This room had two balconies, facing east and south. The room was quiet.The DoubleTree is somewhat removed from the general mayhem of Waikiki, which was perfectly fine with us. It was an easy stroll to the closest Trolley stop to get us wherever we wished to go,. Visiting HHV was a ten minute walk, maximum.In-room internet is free, provided you have Gold or above HHonors status.We *will* come back.Mahalo.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For the price the hotel is acceptable. It is an older hotel but the room although small was clean and comfortable. The mini fridge is a joke as I doubt it is cold enough to keep food safe. Bathroom is small but your in Hawaii how much time do you spend in the room let alone the bathroom. I did order some items to be in room for arrival (have 2 rooms) and they were not in one. Also disappointed in the fact that as a Diamond member no upgrade, however when checking online at checkin I could book a better room. Also I agree with a lot of other reviews about the "free" breakfast it is disappointing as a large number of Doubletrees do upgrade you to a hot breakfast. I can walk next door for the same $8 and get a great breakfast I am here for another 10 days and have no plans to move as it is less crowded than the Hawaiian Village and in walking distance to anything. The less crowded makes it a good choice as if you have been to the Hilton it can be a zoo. Headed to the beach that I can't see from my room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a great hotel at a great price point. Only spent a couple nights here, but was very happy with the staff and the short waits for our car from the valet staff. Parking was a little steep ($30/day) but I realize parking space and real estate is like gold in this area. Hotel was clean, modern, and friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the DoubleTree on a business trip, and additionally hosted 10 overseas guests here and ran a workshop in their conference rooms.I can't be complimentary enough about the diligent and helpful staff - they really did make our stay, and our meeting, run so smoothly. It was a real load off in terms of having to worry about logistics - they had everything sorted, and were always available if we had extra questions or needs.Rooms were clean and spacious, and amenities/facilities were good.Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was very clean, comfortable bed, quiet. The front desk staff, Rebecca and Ewa were great! They made my stay so nice and comfortable. Thank you so much! I would love to stay there again, and have some tasty cookies!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Booked for a corporate stay and feel that room was very overpriced for what it was. It also smelled damp. Was disappointed that complimentary wifi is not included in the price and at $9.95 for a day (be warned not a 24hr period) it is expensive to connnect. Breakfast is good but also over priced and the valet parking cost is likely a reflection of the prices in the neighbourhood but again expensive. Other hotels offered others at the conference a much better rate and extras. I will know for next time and will not recommended for other corporate stays.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome hotel staff...from the front desk to the valet and housekeeping. Hotel is just a short walk from the beach, but be warned, there are NO beach/ocean views from this hotel. Bar/restaurant are great, but expect Waikiki prices. There are plenty of dining options within a few steps of the hotel so you have a wide choice. Rooms all have outdoor balcony which help establish the island relaxation as soon as you arrive. Wi-Fi is not free unless you are a Hilton Gold or higher member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was fine, but doesn't really have anything to set it apart or make it special. Beds are comfortable, but the bathroom is quite small. It is about a 15 min walk to the main part of Waikiki as well. Finally, the breakfast for Diamonds is not all that exciting, and is just a standard continental breakfast. This may be all Hilton officially requires of their hotels, however the vast majority of them now provide an expanded continental or full breakfast for Gold and Diamond guests.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We decided on this hotel as we were able to obtain a room with a separate sitting room with a sliding door, which was great as we were able to put our young children to bed but still watch television or read in the evenings without disturbing their sleep. The room was clean and fairly spacious though some aspects were a little dated, such as the bathroom. The location is about a 15-20 minute walk to say Dukes or the Cheesecake Factory or about a $10 (USD) taxi fare. The location is not as convenient as the Sheraton locations for the beach and shopping. However, the upside is it is fairly quiet and has a trolley stop nearby to Ala Moana. It is also very near Hilton Hawaiian Village, which has a range of restaurants, shops and a day spa. Great service - particularly the front desk/check in team were excellent. Very accommodating with requests for change, additional pillows, maps, trolley/bus stop information etc. We didn't have dinner at the restaurant but the breakfast was quite good - nothing too fancy but the omletes the chef made were great and plenty of range (oatmeal, cereal, fruit, bagles/toast, yoghurt etc) that was well suited to giving the kids a good start to the day of touring. All in all, a good hotel for young families - we would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent hotel. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Onsite pool and good fitness center. King room with balcony is nice - we had a great view of the sunsets! Valet parking is convenient. Hotel is conveniently located near the beach and restaurants, all within two blocks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Double Tree is clean and had a friendly and courteous staff. That is one of the only reasons my wife and I didn't move immediately. The premium internet service was horrible, and too slow to stream movies. The movies offered were $17.99 each movie. Room service charges for meals were very expensive compared to the portions served and the food was mediocre at best. I was really surprised that this hotel was in the Hilton family.
user_name:
Patrick L. G
Seoul, South Korea

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: No complaints whatsoever...great location, friendly staff. It was perfect base to get to know the area. Minutes to the beach...good access to buses...we had a 7 day pass for the Waikiki trolley...great value, and hopped on the city bus (#20) to Pearl Harbour...2 Bucks each way.Our thanks to the manager for extending the military discount rate to Canadian Forces members and clearly indicating that in the booking info.I would stay again in a heartbeat. Occupants Room 1510 (8-15 Jan)Thanks Kevin and Susan (HiltonHonours Gold).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here on Hilton Honors points, so the bill was much lower than it might have been. To be honest, if I had paid full price, I would have felt ripped off. The staff are great, and the lobby is nice, but the wifi is absolutely horrible unless you pay for it in the room, and even then it's not great. I had to work during this stay, and was unable to get work done due to the poor connections. We had a number of problems with our rooms (plumbing, refrigerators not working, coffee maker broken, one door was broken and we were locked out during a critical time) but the staff were very helpful and quick to fix things. Bottom line: Hawaii is expensive to begin with. The amenities felt like insult to injury. The staff is better than their surroundings, and that's the redeeming factor here. A warm cookie doesn't make up for an aging building.
user_name:
Ron H
San Luis Obispo, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The lobby area and pool area are very nice. Our room was spacious, and the bed was comfortable. Although we had a private balcony, our view was of cluttered balconies from the building behind the hotel. The free internet is in the lobby area only (not in the rooms) Not a luxury hotel, but this is a good value in a very convenient location. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in a suite Dec 28-Jan 1 and found the room to be comfortable, the location enjoyable and the service to be excellent. The pullout couch was a good option to have. The pool area was pleasant and Ala Moana Park was just a short run away. This spot is away from Waikiki, but close enough to walk to all the attractions there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location, Location, LocationThis place is not in the middle of the Hassle but it is right there walking distance.The rooms are not Villa Great but are family ok.We spent 3 nights and we were happy all round.It is not a huge hotel don´t expect big facilities... it is a business hotel which caters forfamilies as well... but for us for a couple of nights it was great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here on a recent business trip. I prefer the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the street, but they were booked. This is very nice hotel, but I recommend it for business. While it has access to the Hilton Hawaiian Village's beach access and pools, the Doubletree itself doesn't feel "resort like" enough for a vacation stay. The hotel is clean; the staff is excellent; and the free cookies are delicious. Overall, a very good hotel for my business trip, but lacks the vacation atmosphere for me otherwise.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It all started out well enough on this Christmas vacation - as a Diamond member (77 nights in a Hilton property during 2014), they upgraded me to a suite. As it is, I'm paying almost four bills a night (includes thirty/night for parking), so I'm grateful, but not overly, especially when my cancellation date passes and they start advertising my room at under two forty/night. Also, every other Hilton property gives me a full breakfast as a Diamond - here I got continental BF with the option to pay eight dollars for an upgrade to include protein (you can get a full breakfast at four restaurants within 100 yeards for under seven dollars).The location appears great on a map, but it is not as convenient to the beach as any other Hilton property for miles. Also, there is bothersome construction on the street in front of the hotel, a one-way street which adds time (Honolulu traffic is bad enough).The "partial oceanviews" are 80% blocked by much taller neighboring buildings - no sunset to be enjoyed from the lanai, only views of neighbors A/C units.OK, it is the holidays are families are to be extpected. But unsupervised kids in the gym and kids playing games on the PCs in the Business Center are not supposed to be allowed, but the hotel staff does not police this.The worst part is the so-called restaurant. Not sure why, but the large restaurant is closed and they atempted to use the bar which seats 48 at tables plus 8 at the counter to serve what I estimate to be 1000 guests in their 317 rooms. After Christmas Day, waits for a table ran up to half an hour even begining at 7:30 AM. I still have leftover coupons which I could not use because they stop serving at 10 AM (and this at a "resort," during holidays).I tried to ask the Concirege to make a reservation for us at the Hilton Hawaiian Village luau but I gave up after waiting 30 minutes for her to finish with the couple ahead of me. (I did call the HHV direcltly, got VM, left a message asking for a call back and never heard from them).The final nail in their coffin came when I asked one person at the front desk if I could trade in some miles for the balance of my stay. She said Yes but I had to go through HIlton reservations, which I did. They confirmed availability for some of my nights but when I got to the desk, they informed me they would have to charge me a hundred dollar penalty - less than the nearly four bills/night I am paying but it became a matter of principal - some way to treat your best customers!We checked out options and plan to stay at the Hilton Waikiki next time and hope for better treatment and "value."

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was a clean hotel and located right where I wanted to spend time while visiting Hawaii for my ninth trip. I only placed reservation a week and a half before Christmas. The room was very quiet and allowed me to sleep off the jet lag quite easily. The hotel is very nice and the staff were all very friendly. It was perfect for a place to spend nights while exploring the islands during the day. Centrally located between the shopping mall and the strip of hotels along Waikiki Beach, as a single person, I was never worried about my safety. I have stayed in various hotels along Waikiki Beach and this one was one of the cleanest. Also a good rate!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms are clean need mirrors in the room. Location is convenient to the beaches and the other hotels. Several restaurants are close to the hotel and easy to walk to. Restaurant needs to hire more help since the wait for breakfast was long. We waited a long time to be served for dinner since the cook was very slow and the service was even slower.
user_name:
Felice S
lake worth, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a very good stay here. The room was clean and the staff very friendly. We used two rooms and they worked it out so that they were adjacent to each other on the same floor. Only negative is that with family the bathrooms became a little small.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: we had a great time great rooms, maid service was excellent. we had probems with meal tickets but hotel staff explained it to us. we will return one day soon. The hotel staff at the front desk where very understanding and professional always ready to assist. I was near the pool on the 5th floor was adults always with their kids at pool side, sometimes it was to dark to tell? a little noisey but not unbearable. My wife son and I had a great time, we hope to be back very soon, Thank You the Walkers

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I love Doubletree by Hilton and I am a Hilton Honors Member. So when we had to attend our Son's graduation in Hawaii, where else would we stay? It wasn't one big thing that disappointed us but just a series of small things. First, I always request a room on a high floor, away from the elevator; we checked in after a long flight around 11:00 p.m. and not only was our room on the 6th floor, right next to the elevator, but also next to the ice machine..really?? Then we woke up the next morning and when I went to make coffee, one of the pieces from the machine was missing, so i called the Careline. We went to the graduation the next day and brought friends back to the room for a bit and walked in to the foulest smell. It was like the room was cleaned with a dirty towel! I called the Careline again for air freshener and immediately left the room in embarrassment. Then, also on day 2, in the middle of the night, I discovered that the only roll of toilet tissue was the one of the roll and it was almost gone, there were no other rolls under the sink!...really? It just seems like they were not ready for this Hilton Honors Member's arrival...really? Also, where are the little perks? There was no free internet in the room, and $30 per day charge for parking; Needless to say that I was not in a happy mood paying a bill of $805, for this type of experience. Never, ever again will I stay at this hotel, and my husband and I have decided to just go back to staying at the Embassy Suites! I'll pay a little more for the service I feel I deserve.
user_name:
Yvonne Q
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The TV and room safe did not work after we checked in the first night. Repair person fixed both. On the 2nd night the TV did not work again and had to be changed out. After being seated at the restaurant on two different mornings no one ever came by to ask if we needed anything

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I wan't on vacation--rather on a medical visit to Honolulu. The genuine, authentic caring each of the staff members shared with me made that so much more pleasant. From the valets to front office to housekeeping, each staff member represented all the best of the art of hospitality. My guess is they have kind, caring, and professional management staff to guide them. Ideally located outside the mania of Waikiki, the DoubleTree is perfect to access all other parts of the island. Even the city view rooms have interesting views, comfortable lanai, and are well worth the price. The rooms are very large, and have a wonderful amount of storage space. But, even with all these amenities, it's still the staff who make it feel like home. The cookie and free business center is just a bonus.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: During our recent stay our overall rating was excellent. Only issue was at the beginning of our 11 night stay. Fantastic suite on the 17th floor. Loads of space, extremely quiet - could hear no street noise except the occasional ambulance/fire truck. Comfy bed and pillows. Air conditioner was fantastic - always cooled the room quickly. Loved the warm chocolate chip cookies every night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check-in was pleasingly quick after our 10 hour flight. Room was clean and ready for guests. Balcony had a great view. That DoubleTree cookie hit the spot until we were able to get ready to eat. The Tree restaurant, located on the lobby floor, was great. Reasonably priced, clean, wonderful staff, fast service and good food. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The mezzanine had a nice little pool with lots of chairs to enjoy the nice weather. Centrally located with a quick walk to the beach and all kinds of shopping and restaurants. The concierge was able to hook us up with care rentals and excursions that made the stay even better. The "Bell Men" were very accommodating and quick to meet our needs. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was dissapointed. With many stays all over the world - this was my least favorable. The hotel needs to start off with a management presence and a staff that is happy to be there. Parking at $30 per day is a little much. Restaurant is very dated for Breakfast and has not much of a welcoming experience. There really is nowhere in the hotel other than a few chairs in the lobby to hang and chat. Balconies are what they are with cheap furniture and it's very noisy outside. I could go on, it just was not the experience I was expecting from a Hilton property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: during my recent stay, my overall rating would be very good. Although the stay was overnight, the staff was very friendly, professional and attentive. The staff gave that warm welcome feeling along with the wonderful cookies given upon registration.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was clean and convenient, however, the air conditioning was very noisy and the bed was not great. There was no coffee available until 7 am outside the room. Since we had just arrive from the U.S. east coast, that was very late. I should add that the staff was very helpful. Free internet is only available in the lobby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree was a great hotel. All of the employee were very friendly and very helpful. They gave me pointers on where to go and what to do and everyone seemed like they were having a great day! I felt like i was at a five star expensive resort!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice hotel overall! Convenient location to all of the attractions, shopping and beaches. Be prepared for $30 per day parking and $16 continental breakfast. The staff were very helpful and accommodating considering the amount of guests that arrive and depart on a daily basis.
user_name:
Jerome A
Sneads Ferry, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very friendly front desk staff. Very accommodating, efficient parking valet team. Convenient location for both downtown business and Waikiki restaurants. One suggestion: Free Starbucks coffee in the lobby 6:00am-9:00am.
user_name:
Dennis M. J
Portland, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really enjoyed the short stay at this hotel thanks to Hertzig Werner (sp?) who really went out of his way to accommodate us. Rooms are nice, location is walking distance to everything. What made the difference was Mr Werner!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff is excellent, friendly and accommodating and you get a delicious cookie at check in. The walk into the main part of Waikiki gets old fast. You might lose weight staying at this hotel, but you will gain blisters. Wear good shoes. You will be walking a lot if you plan to visit the best shopping areas and restaurants in Waikiki. It's not easy or convenient to drive a car in Waikiki, though it's nice to have a car for some of the excursions to distant sight-seeing locations. The location of this hotel feels a little industrial, though it is not industrial. It is a hotel surrounded by other hotels. There is a park of some type opposite the front entrance, but it is under construction. Your view from most windows will be another hotel or construction. Ours was the rooftop parking for the hotel next door. The valet were quick and friendly, no complaints there and it is the only parking available. There is no public parking at this hotel. I believe the charges were another $30 per day for valet and add your tipping to that. There is no gift shop -- disappointing. Just a thing that I think many people, particularly women, love to visit at the hotels, particularly for last minute items they have forgotten or for late-night snacks. They had a rather useless vending machine on the main lobby floor. They should absolutely incorporate a small gift shop into this hotel. The beach is not in your backyard, nor is it across the street. You're going to walk about 10 minutes to and from the beach. There are far fewer restaurants and shopping areas near this hotel than other hotels you will find further southeast. There is an ABC store fairly close.Not too far from the hotel you will find one restaurant I can recommend. It's the Wailana Coffee House/Cocktail Lounge. This restaurant has the feel of a "mom and pop" restaurant, not a lounge vibe at all. It has excellent service, the food is good and the prices are reasonable. Avoid at all costs the in-room Round Table pizza delivery! The hotel advertises for this restaurant delivery. To make a long story short, we ordered our pizza at 6:31 p.m. At 8:12 p.m. I called to see if they had run into a problem. The guy at Round Table told me, "Well, it's only been 45 minutes since you ordered." Yet my phone shows me exactly when I called, so I'm laughing at his effort to fool me. He goes on to tell me that we are the next drop off. 15 minutes later he still isn't there, so I called back at 8:30 and I'm told he's coming. He arrived at 8:45 with a stone cold pizza and a nervous look on his face and apologizing all over the place. I should have just cancelled the order but I had already paid for it. They had my money. Worst pizza delivery ever -- stone cold pizza and no microwave in the room! Do not order it!So back to the hotel rooms: Unfortunately the layout of the room makes it difficult for them to position a large TV so that it faces both beds well. There isn't much they can do about this because there isn't a wall space, due to the sliding door between the living room and bedroom. You'll probably be too tired to watch television anyway because the walking is going to make you fall asleep early every night. The bathroom doors are annoying as they are heavy sliding doors. The sliding door provides less privacy as well. The bottom of the door is not on a slider so the bottom would swing out from the door frame itself and bang back onto the frame unless you were sliding it very, very slowly. Not good if you're trying to be quiet. The satellite/cable TV at this facility was not very good. It lost the signal several times while we were there. They don't provide many channels, but movie choices were plentiful. You have a small refrigerator and bar area with a sink just inside the front door. With wind, you can hear whistling off and on coming through the sliding doors to the deck, one in the bedroom, one in the living room. I used a sound machine when sleeping so it blended in and I was able to ignore it. There is a living room with another television and sliding doors, which is nice if someone wants to take a quiet nap in the bedroom. The hotel is very quiet. I could hear guests as they passed our room, but overall it was not a problem. We heard very little noise. The ice machine on our floor was broken the entire time, which was fine with me because our room was next to the machine. The bathroom is decently sized, with average décor. The trash cans in the bathroom annoyed me because they are divided, one side for recycle, one for non-recycle. The problem is the two slots are so small you can barely put anything in them before they are full. Overflowing in no time and we only had two of us in the room. Seems petty but I pay attention to details. There are two vanities, one inside and one outside the restroom. You have two closets, so plenty of closet space. There is a very small deck which, despite the view, was nice to sit on.We did stop by and take a look at the continental breakfast the hotel provided. To get the upgraded continental breakfast, you had to pay more, which was just silly to me. It seems smarter to provide all of your guests with an amazing continental breakfast and up the price of all your rooms just slightly rather than insult them with your "free" continental breakfast which was next to nothing. This is the worst "free" continental breakfast I have seen in a hotel. Overall, I'm in the middle with this hotel. I see this as a great hotel for people who want to visit Waikiki but are on a tight budget. I would recommend it to people who love walking. I wasn't fully disappointed with the walking for the simple fact that I knew I was burning off some of the meals I ate. I would return to this hotel if I were on a budget, but it is definitely not my first choice. I'd try everything I could to move closer to the action before I'd go back to this hotel. But it provided enough pros that I would recommend it to those on a tight budget who also want a clean hotel with friendly staff. The beds were comfortable as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice stay with good experience. Convenient location with short distance to beach and Ala Moana Shoppping Mall. Warm hospitality and quality service from most aspects. The car parking charge of $30/day is way too high and complimentary wifi/internet access service provided at guest room is expected

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had to find a convenient hotel for a stop-over in Honolulu, first going west and then two weeks later returning east. I chose the DoubleTree by Hilton, and it was a very good choice. All of the hotels in Honolulu are nice, so it is important to find a feature that makes one stand out over the others. That feature at this hotel is the quality of the hospitality of the attendants at the front desk. They were outstanding from the moment I arrived until I departed--both times. I don't believe that I have ever been so well treated.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I usually like to stay here for a couple days, nothing longer. The staff is nice, the rooms are not as clean as they used to be. If you're a Hilton member, this is not the place to waste your points on. Its not as fancy as the other hotels but its great for the price. The only thing is that they only offer valet parking, so get used to calling down for your car or waiting in a line. Overall, its a good property and its close to Ala Moana shopping center and the convention center. A short distance from a few good restaurants. Great place for a business trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was not as clean as I expected for a Hilton Hotel. The toilet and shower were not in very good working order. Otherwise, my grandchildren loved the pillows, blankets, A/c, TV, and most of all the cookies.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I don't know why guests complain about this property. Sure its not flashy as some of the other hotels in Waikiki but it was clean and comfortable and very well located to shopping precincts and the beach. We have never stayed at a Doubletree property before and were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews but for the room rate of other hotels, we decided on a suite and it was very spacious so we were very happy (and relieved) to spend 11 nights here. We didn't go for a partial ocean view as I'm sure you wouldn't see that much of the ocean due to its location but we didn't plan on staying in the room. You could hear the sirens of the ambulances and fire trucks that screamed along the main roads on occasion early in the morning but that would no doubt affect many properties in the area. The front desk staff were friendly and polite and assisted if and when required. I was pleasantly surprised and would go back just for the cookies.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Was met at registration with enthusiasm to meet my needs. Even though there was a minor mix up with my reservation, the staff handled it immediately. My stay was very comfortable and I will stay here when I return to Honolulu.
user_name:
Thomas V
Burbank, Ca., United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel and the staff were all lovely, and our room was simple, clean and had everything we needed. The view had a partial ocean lookout, but also a carpark roof. Not unpleasant - we were not there to spend all day looking out the hotel room window, and the price of staying here instead of the main drag was beneficial. Only took 10 mins to walk to the shops and beach. Cafe that is just up the road, called Hiking Hawaii, is AMAZING and has great gluten free options. Was disappointed that the pool is in the shade of other buildings in mid afternoon, but otherwise the place is a lovely spot to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I wanted to share the great experience I had with one of your staff members. I am from the island of Kauai and have stayed at your hotel many times in the past. Your staff is always fantastic however this time the care and concern for my situation was incredible. My husband was rushed via a medical plane from Kauai to Oahu and spent 14 days in Straub Hospital. I was frantic to find a hotel room for myself. I called the Doubletree Hotel in tears and I was so happy to hear a friendly voice on the other end of the phone. I told Danny Castillo my situation and he told me not to worry he would take care of it for me and call me back with a confirmation number. I knew there was a large convention in town and I knew it would be difficult to find me a room. In less than one hour Danny called me back and told me he had a room for me.  Now ten days later, my husband had completed his Heparin blood thinners and the Doctors were discharging him but wanted us to stay on Oahu for 5-7 days before we could fly home to Kauai. Again, Danny helped us find the perfect accessible room to allow my husband to recover from such a horrific ordeal. The staff greeted us with a wheelchair and helped me get my husband to our room. Housekeeping has been so accommodating with all my request. We are currently staying in the hotel and don’t know how much longer we will be here. Thanks to your wonderful staff, especially Danny Castillo, we would never be getting thru this difficult time.Thanks for being our “Special Home” away from home.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel and staff. It is nice to have such great hotel staff and hotel in such a busy and beautiful place. Nice!! The rooms are clean and well maintained. The location is perfect for walking to and from dining and drinking locations. I can't wait to get back for my next trip.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Appreciated location close to Hawaii Convention Center. Still close enough to walk to Waikiki Beach. Wonderful, accomdating staff. Very clean and comfortable. My only recommendation would be a quicker, guest friendly breakfast option. Would stay there again.
user_name:
Michael V
Kankakee, IL, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were at a convention in Honolulu and this hotel was on our list of hotels to pick for our convention. We booked it on the list's recommendation. We were pleasantly surprised. Our room was excellent. We were on the 16th floor and loved that we had a view of the city and of the water from our balcony. The front desk employees were friendly. Our bellhops and our housekeepers were very nice. Our room was spotless each day. We have only good things to say about our experience here. The hotel is located very close to the pink line trolley stop to it was easy to get back and forth to Waikiki for just $2 a trip. Walking distance to restaurants. The famous ABC stores for Hawaiian gifts just around the corner and another down the street. The room is very quiet. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We traveled to Honolulu for an International Convention of Jehovah's Witnesses and stayed here for 10 nights. Although the hotel was bustling with delegates to our convention, we found the staff to be very polite, always helpful and ready to take care of our requests. Our room was always clean and well stocked with towels, coffee, etc. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our hotel experience was great except for the nail clippings on the lanai. The housekeeper must have forgotten to check it out. The staff was very nice, friendly and accommodating. I would stay again, as I liked being in that part of town, which is less busy than being on the Waikiki strip. The location was walking distance to the strip, beach and everywhere else I wanted to go. It's also near several bus stops.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, clean and cozy. It was easy to get on the freeway or easy to walk to shopping or restaurants. Our room was quiet with a comfortable bed and nice décor, we would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed at the hotel before, sadly this experience was not as positive. Room was strangely damp, aircon was not cleaned and made us sick, pillows and bed were well below par even after seeking replacements and general service has dropped.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here one night before a cruise and two nights after. Of course we got the usual warm cookie upon check in and they offered us cookies other times as well. Always so yummy! The rooms we had were clean and spacious enough for us. There were others in our party that had smaller rooms. I think being Hilton Honors members helps! That also allowed us to get free wifi and a pass for a free continental breakfast. We had a late flight on our last day and the hotel was booked so we could not check out later than 1PM but the hotel stored our bags so we would walk around town. They let us use the pool after checkout, and even provided us a courtesy room for 1 hour to clean up before catching our shuttle. Maggie at the check in desk was our favorite -- very friendly and helpful (and she gave us extra cookies)! Also the guys at the bell desk were very accommodating with our bags, pulling them out of storage for us several times throughout the day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a good stay at the Double Tree Hilton, only implant was that my room backed onto the elevators so the noise of them going up and down was a little annoying and the street noise as my room was on the main street - All these things cannot be helped - room was great - clean and comfortable and spacious.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel with my employee benefits and got lucky with my rate. Since I don't pay much I usually don't complain but....The bathrooms were extremely small. I'm only 5'9 190 and felt like the walls where closing on me in the bathroom. The mattress was on the firm side, which most double tree mattress are. I wish they would take a page out of Hilton Garden Inn's book and use their adjustable mattresses. We didn't get a king no biggie, also didn't get our room serviced the next day but was too tired to leave and have housekeeping to clean it. Overall I would recommend this location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was there on business and my wife was in Hawaii for fun. The hotel booked my wife on a great tour of the Dole Pineapple farm, she loved it. very reasonable price. The room rates are very reasonable for where you are at in Waikiki.
user_name:
Dave K
Garden Grove, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Limited accomodation for such a expensive rate. Arrrived late at night. The greeter at the receptions was nice and attentive. Received a warm cookie but no water!!!! The bathrooms are so little. As a woman, we bring toiletries and stuff. There was no room to place my belongings and the condition of the furniture was quite old. Too expensive for such a small room.
user_name:
Lena Iriarte A
Irvine, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room was nice. It was clean, quiet, no smell, comfortable. Hotel men/women's hospitality was so great. But Wifi/LAN were needed to be paid for every day. No toothbrushes. I needed free internet connection in the room than the cookies which all guest receive when they checked in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of all staff throughout my stay. The "extra" help was frequent. On my last day, the maid helped me get my luggage to the elevator and the front desk offered me use of the hospitality suite for a shower after check out. I was very impressed. This is older hotel, but extremely comfortable and clean. ....and the service was exceptional....will stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed two separate times, most recently in March of this year.Rooms are clean, cool, and very fresh. It has the typical dark wood and modern décor of Doubletree hotels, with touch of Hawaiiana. I'm also a fan of the citrus bath amenities. Love the sleek lobby design. Hallways are a little behind-- a tad stuffy and drab. The front desk is friendly, but some of the staff are more reserved than others. Ask for extra cookies anytime and they will provide without hesitation. Parking is typical of Waikiki: expensive (30.00) and valet only. The bell/valet downstairs were always cheerful with good energy. It makes the price hurt a lot less. In the evening they weren't always present so had to wait around a bit. Not big a deal.Doubletree dining: breakfast and restaurant/room service, across the board seems to be a bit more expensive than other hotels of similar value (if they have dining at all). Because of that I usually prefer to pay a little more and book Embassy Suites and get a bigger room, free breakfast and nightly reception. In the end the price ends up about the same.This is one of the few hotels that offer a resort credit for declining housekeeping service for three (I think) consecutive cleanings. I wish this was something more places offered. Its a great way to help guests save $$ and hotel to save on cleaning costs as well. Most importantly its good for the environment right? Mahalo to the hotel for offering this.Everyone seems to take issue with the view. Myself included, though it doesn't enrage me like others. I've stayed twice in "City or Mountain View" category. You might get a high floor city/mountain view, OR a low floor looking over a seedy backstreet. Keep in mind the nicer view is noisier with street and traffic noise. I'm curious what keeps them from re-labeling the room types. The unit itself is great either way, but if you need any sort of view, the extra 20 a night is worth a "partial ocean" guarantee (to not look into the alley). Otherwise. This might not be the place for you. When travelling to Hawaii keep in mind that there are thee different "ocean-something" room types: partial ocean view, ocean view, ocean front. The latter is outrageous, and about $700-1400 a night, or more, depending on the hotel and season. For the price, the Alana is among the best for actual room accommodations. Many other places in the same range have extremely outdated interiors, basic (or worse: tacky) furnishings, and sometimes musty/antique smelling rooms. I'm partial to the clean crispy feel, dark woods and cool sleek design. I'm also a fan of the upper-tier Aqua hotels or Outrigger hotels. They will be more expensive though. Hard to beat the Doubletree value.Location is good, as long as you're aware that its a mile to central Waikiki, and a mile to Ala Moana shopping center. A leisurely 20 minute stroll in either direction. Its also one of the nearest to Hawaii Convention Center, less than 10 minutes away. If you're here for conference I'd pick this place over the Ala Moana Hotel any day.Lots of good dining in the immediate area. The concierge can reserve tables and book tours or transportation. The closest beach is at the Hilton Hawaiian Village about 5 minutes away. Nice, but crowded. Fort Derussy park across the street is big and beautiful. I'd rather sun myself and relax there, to be honest. Good for morning walks and always quiet. Couldn't speak for the pool or internet access. You're in Hawaii, so unless on business just ditch both and have fun!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: outstanding hotel.... in the heart of waikiki so close to all the action. the staff is awesome and they serve you a warm chocolate chip cookie when you arrive! who would't like that? highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Helpful porters at lower level. Room very comfortable. Staff eager to please, but may overpromise and under deliver at peak times. Otherwise they are very accomodating. I would suggest they get someone to answer phones so a person could call for and receive help when needed. They offered more services than I could use. Room is very welcoming.
user_name:
Jacquline L
Spokane Valley, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The maid left our door ajar so anyone could have gone in while we were out all day. We received a not even satisfactory apology. We HAD to valet park. When I checked my charges to my account after returning home I realized that an extra charge of $15.71 was put on my account (this appears to be for another day of parking). I will need to call and have this removed. We are local and have stayed at a lot of local hotels, this was the worst experience we have had.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed the desk staff, always very helpful. The concierge was less helpful, but that person changes day to day so the next one may have been more helpful. We were upgraded to a nicer room which was spacious and clean. The maid service always checked in with us to make sure we had what we needed even though we didn't want them to clean our room each day. Breakfast was expensive, but that is to be expected. Hotel is very close to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. Would definitely recommend staying here!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel location is good - near to the beach and easy to access but the pick-up/drop off area is often congested - way too small - 1 car at a time. The room had a nice view of the ocean and the mountains (18th floor) but the Air Conditioning was either on or off so it was 65 degrees in the room at night to keep the humidity under control. This was a business trip so the room was only used at night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We really like this hotel. We had our two teenage kids with us for college tours. It was more than sufficient to meet our needs. The staff were very nice and kind. Service was always with a smile. We always love getting the delicious cookies. We have stayed here and would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms we've stayed in have always been clean, neat and well-maintained. Our overall experience was wonderful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I arrived at the Doubletree in Waikiki on Thursday. I was there to teach a class on Crystal Reports on Friday, and also stayed the weekend for a little R&R. Even though I got there a little before the check-in time on Thursday, they let me use the business center, and they sent some faxes for me even though I hadn't even checked in yet. I really appreciated that. They also called the cleaning staff a couple of times to let them know that I was here , and to please get a room ready for me, which they did in reasonable time.The whole weekend was great at the hotel. The staff was unbelievably courteous and helpful the whole time, whether it was about my sleeping room or the meeting room where I taught the class on Friday. My sleeping room was very clean and comfortable, and it had everything I needed for a comfortable stay. I liked the shower. The hotel's restaurant is great for breakfast. I did not eat there for lunch or dinner, as there are many choices right around the local area, including a Cheeseburger Waikiki, which is right next door. The hotel's fitness room was great, and the business center had everything I needed. The hotel is close enough to all of the action in Waikiki, without being right in the middle of it. I like everything about the hotel, and I would highly recommend it to anybody. Melissa at the front desk was especially helpful. She is extremely friendly, courteous, accommodating, professional, and helpful.
user_name:
Tom F
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had a good six day stay at the Alana. Comfortable room, good shower, friendly staff, decent restaurant, and an under ten minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Minutes from shopping district, and convenient to highways, airport etc. Good choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service at the front desk was amazing as always with a Hilton brand hotel but the internet was slow and I did a speed check. When I pay 10.00 USD. for internet I expect a little better that a 2MBpS download speed which is ridiculous when LTE is running at 14 MBpS. When

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The personnel at the Double Tree make it a nice place to stay. I was disappointed that there are no bathtubs in the hotel. Also, it's a walk to get to anything. But, the customer service makes this a good value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My sister and I stayed here because of its excellent location-near the beach and all the activities we enjoy including car rental, shopping, dining. We felt very safe here and all the staff was helpful and friendly. There is a business center for printing out your boarding pass or using the Internet. The dining room was very pleasant and the food was excellent. The room was clean and pleasant with a city view. Bed was very comfy and we used the pool and exercise center often. We will stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed one night here (2 adults, 2 children). It was very clean and convenient to restaurants, etc in Waikiki. The pool is a bit small, but our 12 and 13 year old loved it...I like that it is outside. I'd recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Updated rooms, decent fitness room, on site restaurant meal was fine, cookies always good. Parking is steep at $30 a night. Central location. Internet service was good, but they charge you if you are not an gold or higher frequent stay level.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The shower valve is the worst designed and the least intuitive of anything plumbing that should be simple to turn on and off and adjust temperature. I left the hotel after two days and three showers and still could not figure it out. You give it a try and you will agree its a piece of junk and not worth the value of recycling.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Maybe I am just not accepting of what it costs to do business in Hawaii. This was one of the least expensive Hotels I could find for a business trip to HI and it was over $250 per night. For that amount of money and being a Diamond guest, I would expect a pretty nice environment.Not so. I had cramped room, the AC barely kept it cool. The stated view of the ocean was visible at the very top of the window over other high rises.As I have often called a visit to HI on business. It is going Brooklyn with Palm trees

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I loved the hotel, especially their wonderful chocolate chip cookies. The staff were really great and loved the service given. Even though 2 out of their 3 elevators were down, I liked that they used their service elevator for the inconvenience. I'm impatient, so I took the stairs (I needed the exercise anyway) on the second day. But that's ok.
user_name:
Sharon B
New York City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I just spend two days at the Doubletree in Hawaii. Because it is a Hilton you usually get a free Breakfast not here my eggs and 3 pieces of Bacon and pineapple juice which I thought it was orange juice was $24.00 plus tip. The shower was extemely nice but that first step will get you inand out of the shower. The shower is elevated approx. 9 inches so if you are a person of age it is a adventure getting into and out of the shower my first time out of the shower I almost ended upon the floor because I forgot to step down it is like missing a curb. Other than that I would think about the Holiday Inn which is downtown near stores and everything. The neighbor was a littlebit more shady that I would have thought because those Condos have to be at least $2000 a month or more. Plus my partial view which I pay for was if you step on the balony and look hardyou see water.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Following a week on the Big Island with another couple, we spent two days in Honolulu before returning to the mainland. We had booked our reservations separately. At check-in, we asked for rooms on the same floor. Although the hotel was fully booked, Rebecca and Elsa not only got us rooms on the same floor, but Penthouse Suites across the hall from each other. Like most Waikiki hotels, the only parking available was valet; unlike most hotels I've stayed at, valet retrieval was quick. Staff were unfailingly polite. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and provided a perfect setting to conclude our first visit to Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My boyfriend was in Oahu for work so I flew out to meet him. This hotel fit the company's budget and he used points for another night. The hotel was adequate. We stayed in this hotel for two nights and agreed any more might have been pushing it in terms of space. The room was small however my boyfriend was offered an upgrade for one of the nights but we didn't want to move rooms mid-stay. The staff also gave me free continental breakfast coupons when they learned I would be joining him which was very thoughtful. The room did have a fridge and a wet bar and balcony. The balcony was a nice touch and we enjoyed sitting outside in the evening. The bathroom was also smaller with not enough towels for two people. It was clean and nicely decorated however the shower (without a tub) was so small, there was no way I could shave in there unless I was a contortionist (which I am not). The hotel was very quiet. I wasn't quite sure what to expect as we were on Eastern Standard Time and up around 4 a.m. and heading to bed by 10.It was not far from the beach but not close enough to consider packing the chairs and beach bag and heading toward the sand. The hotels and buildings near the beach were unique and amazing, worth a nightly stroll. The beachfront bars and people watching is fantastic, not to mention the beach is beautiful.The hotel is close to a few great dive bars and Kalakaura Ave is literally around the corner. This street has fantastic shopping and the Royal Hawaiian Center is amazing. It is an outdoor shopping/dining/entertainment complex and is worth a few trips. We walked this stretch several times and always enjoyed it. Staff did their job well, but nothing over and above to make you feel especially welcome, although this hotel was very large so I wasn't necessarily expecting anything different. Kathrin at the front desk was an exception. She was very helpful and pleasant and helped us find exactly what we were looking for.Overall, this hotel doesn't stand out but for the price and location if you are ok not being walking distance to the beach it works. The location did offer us the opportunity to explore more of Honolulu than we might have otherwise.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Let me start by saying that the Valet Service ($30/day) is by far the best I've experienced in Waikiki -- fast and courteous -- and it made the hotel an enjoyable stay. Also getting in/out onto the main road was quite easy and avoids lots of the traffic other hotels experience. Overall stay was very nice -- check-in staff was very hospitable and the facilities were nice. Rooms large and well kept with a comfortable bed and meduim-size bathroom with stand-up shower. Wifi fast and facilites on property well taken care of -- gym was a little small given the desire of most people to stay in shape (even on vacation). There are multiple places to eat within a 5-min walk and an ABC Store within a 2-min walk from the hotel for drinks and snacks.Breakfast for Hilton Honors members is included but only for the Continental Buffet (cereal, fruit, etc.) and the Hot Meal line is $8 more for all if you want to use it. I think for Hilton Honor Diamond members the hotel should include the entire breakfast selection -- it is for every other DoubleTree I've been to on my travels. Other than that -- the hotel is a good selection if wanting to spend time on Waikiki; even if the hotel does not sit on the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel isn't close to anything. It was supposed to be a "few" minutes walk to the beach. It was a 15 minute walk in 90 degree weather. The staff was polite but nothing we asked for was "possible". Parking is valet only and $30 every time you use the car - not $30/day as we were told.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had stayed at this property several years ago and did not have a good experience. An outdated suite that I spent a lot on was disappointing, although the roof top lanai was fun. Tried it again for one night and was happy. The basic room was quiet, clean and spacious. Like many Doubletree's I have stayed at, very comfortable. Nice but not extravagant. Classy but not stuffy. Beware that the hotel is tricky to find and there is no self parking for your rental car. Valet is 30.00 per night.
user_name:
Kevin L
La Verne, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here several times for business, always the friendliest staff! The hotel is west of all the business of Waikiki but very close to everything you would want. If you are a Diamond member they are pretty good about an upgrade, which in Hawaii is rare. Room clean, well appointed. I eat here once or twice during my stay, I haven't had anything I didn't like, is expensive I would say for what you get but, it is Honolulu.........Earl is great at the bar, I have upgraded my continental and I think for a buffet type breakfast it is really good. I have stayed at several other places here, keep coming back to the DB Tree!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: They have recently upgraded the rooms. It is a great alternative to the overpriced hotels in Waikiki. Everyone treated us great, and very affordable. Its a block from the beach, but close to everything. Plus you get the DoubleTree Cookie, yum.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Got carried away drinking with my girlfriend last weekend. A lot of Police DUI checkpoints were out all over. I was not drunk but why take a chance. I knew that the DoubleTree was part of my Hliton Honors group so off we went. Got there and was greeted by a very friendly Valet who showed me to the front desk.A very courteous and polite young women helped me check in and made me feel very comfortable. I will defiantly be go there again sober! Thank you guys for possibly getting a DUI!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I went from staying at one of the worst hotels I have been in to the DoubleTree, which was one of the best. Unfortunately, this hotel was not available when we arrived in Hawaii, but we were able stay here for the last 3 days. It made my 1st trip to Hawaii much more enjoyable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel staff was the best, smiles and helpful folks. The restaurant was good, but dinning out was even better. The maid was very good at making sure the room was fresh for our return. The pool was warm but not to warm, but a short walk to the beach was the best. Many things to see and do in the short walk to the beach. Make sure you have reservations at the resturants.
user_name:
Howard S
West Melbourne, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in this hotel with 3 separate reservation the same type of room. Everyday we have to pack our luggage check out and check in to the new room reservation. I thought that was ridiculous!The whole moving everyday did ruined our vacation, it's a waste of our time to keep going back to the Front Desk instead making their decision to let us stay in the same room the whole stay since it's the same room type.I could see the failure management how they train their employee. They simply not making it easy to their guest which is pretty said. I'm a hilton honors and I have never experience like this to any of Hilton Brand before.My experience is enough for me and my husband not to stay here again nor recommend to any of our friends and family.We are very disappointed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My partner and i lobbed into the Double Tree late one evening, after a seriously failed and disasterous experience with an Airbnb booking for Waikiki.We waited 12 hours and were fearful of our person and belongings during our check in with our Airbnb host and after deciding to do the best thing for our holiday and personal being we trekked waikiki looking for sanctuary, and we found it and more at Double Tree.Quite simply, for the money, location and waikiki itself, this is a gem of a property and we would be back in a heart beat.Waikiki is very old, and run down in general and accommodation is expensive, the Double Tree is perfectly priced, located and equipped.When you look, look here, its perfect for waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Love this place! Apart from the great location - 2 minutes walking from the Hilton Hawaiian Village (Luau under the stars, beach, shopping, etc), from the moment we arrived to the very last day, it's been nothing but smiles and greetings, by everybody. You can't run from the "Aloha" here, that's for sure. The crew at the front desk are nothing short of awesome. Every time they saw us (separate occasions, multiple days) they offered us fresh cookies and bottled water (heat wave). They're all lovely, but ESPECIALLY Melissa and Danny. They went above and beyond, at every opportunity, with whatever requests we had, from extending my stay, to mailing home my box of laundry! Housekeeping made me feel right at home, always asking me if there was anything else I needed, apart from the replenished amenities. Even when I had trouble with Wifi (my fault), and then on another occasion the closet safe needed fresh batteries, engineering was at my room INSIDE of 3 minutes! Both times, problem solved, in one trip, no waiting. Amy, the concierge, was excellent as well. We were here on business, and only had a couple of hours to spare one day, for sight seeing. So we told her our parameters, and without hesitation, she told us exactly what to do, where to go, where to eat,(gave us a map of course), and it was perfect! Loved the 24hr gym! Used it almost everyday. Cardio + weights. Wish I had time to swim in the pool, but looks lovely.Can't wait to come back to THIS HOTEL! Thank you Melissa, Danny, Amy and team!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great central location. Staff engagement and service is excellent. Breakfast options were tasty. Wall Street Journal available and parking reasonable. Short walk to Wakiki and shopping, along with the convention center just three blocks away.
user_name:
Harold S
Marine City, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at the Doubletree Alana were wonderful. Love the cookies at check-in (standard at Doubletree, I know), but still a wonderful way to welcome people. They were very accommodating with special requests (late check-out and an unusual parking request). The only parking they have is valet, but as we walked where we needed to go most of the time, it was OK. Loved the renovated rooms...although the toilet is really close to wall and was uncomfortable for my husband.
user_name:
Naomi M
Kula, Hawaii, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's AOK in good location but too high for the value you receive in the room. But again location is great Just blocks from the beach and or shopping. I found it odd that the desk representative had a hard time with scheduling our excursions and getting data correct. But over all good location

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Poor Hotel in our opinion. Location is OK but the hotel has no heart or drive. Check-in was casual and laissez-faire, room was OK. Service was the usual "have a nice day" with no sincerity beyond the one line catch phrases. Breakfast was very poor - carbs, carbs and carbs and poorly cooked hot meal ($8 extra over the continental) (cereal was a choice of fruit loops, sugar coated flakes and sugar puffs!). Our coffee never came despite two reminders. Others have said 'go somewhere else for breakfast' we say "go somewhere else to say".

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel doesn't have the best location at the end of Waikiki but how much time do you spend in your room in Hawaii anyway? Room was clean, bed comfortable and the staff very helpful. I was staying for business so wasn't in room much except at night and gone most of the day. Breakfast was to expensive so walk the half block to Cheeseburger in Paradise for a good breakfast and coffee for around $10 USD, opens at 8 am so maybe too late everyday of trip. All and all a good stay at the hotel my fourth overall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We flew to Honolulu for a long weekend before our kids have to go back to college. We have stayed at this Doubletree in the past because of the convenient location and the ease of coming and going. I was quite pleased to see Danny at the front desk. I remembered him from our last stay...always smiling and very friendly...has that "Aloha Spirit"! Valet very fast and efficient. Parking is $30 a night which is normal for the nicer Waikiki hotels. Our room was quiet, nice and clean, beds were comfortable. We definitely will be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very good place to stay if you want to avoid the congestion og Waikiki. Easy access to hotel as well as walking didtance to all of Waikiki. Always use this location for mu business travel. Staff very friendly and customer orinetated. Business center available for those last min items.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Favorite part of this hotel is how clean the rooms are. It is a recent remodel (2010 I think) and it shows. While some of the remodel doesn't make sense, location of light switches in the 3 rooms I've stayed in or how close the toilet is to the shower in a giant bathroom, the parts that work really over compensate for any problem. I'm a business traveler who needs wired internet for work. All the rooms here have wired internet in addition to wireless, as an Honors member these are free to me so I can't speak to price. But the speed of the internet is good enough to stream netflix to the TV with no buffering. The desk alone had 10 AC outlets available, ridiculous but so cool.The cleanliness is well above par, specially for Hawaii (no that Hawaii is dirty but these hotels have a really high turn over rate and some don't think shower mold is a problem). The tiled shower could be a problem, but isn't. The linen is still fresh and duvet fluffy, good times.Breakfast isn't much even for Honors members. Can have oatmeal or cold cereal or for an upgrade fee there's a cook who'll make you some eggs.Overall recommend the hotel and don't forget it's a doubletree...COOKIES!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Not bad overall. If you are expecting the normal Hilton brand experience you will be disappointed. No free breakfast, no free wifi in room, no free parking. I have stayed in 100's Hilton brand hotels from NYC to LA and this is they first one that has charged for these things. The elevators and hall ways are hot and non-air conditioned, but the elevators are fast. Everyone is friendly, which helps. If the normal Hilton brand items as mentioned above were free it would be 5-star. However, no matter what good deal you get, you can expect to pay at least an additional $40-50 a night for the stuff that is normally complimentary. With all that being said I would probably rate it 3-star, but the food in the Trees restaurant and Earl (the bartender) specifically bumps it to a 4-star. I can't emphasis enough how much Earl does for this place. An attentive bartender that doesn't leave your glass empty, but isn't pushy at the same time. Earl is enough to make you want to stay at this place even if you expect the amenities that other Hilton brand place give you. Ownership should give him a pat on the back. He is the difference between a 3 and 4 star place. Maholo Earl. My next trip even if I don't stay at the Double Tree, I will stop by Trees to see Earl.
user_name:
Michael T
Raeford, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We came to Hawaii on Sept 9th- Sept 16 2014, I have to say we had a very long flight, and to get to the front desk and to see a big open smile, and the check in was perfect and to be offered a warm cookie , we knew we had make a good choice in selecting Double Tree to stay. The rooms was always clean when we return. This was our first visit to Hawaii and I would stay there again. The walks was nice, We slept well the bed and pillows was the best. Thanks to the Double Tree for a beautiful vacation. We was extremely pleased. Everyone was great, again thank you.
user_name:
Brenda S
Thomasville, North Carolina, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everyone at the Double Tree were very friendly and helpful. We were extremely pleased with the service, as well as the rooms. They were very clean. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. The Valet guys were awesome also.
user_name:
Lorrie M
Wichita Airport, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best hotel i've stayed at overseas. No complaints to be said, everything was there when we needed it and everyone was more than happy to help. All staff were very friendly and always happy, joking around, really made you feel comfortable. Our pillows were a little soft for our liking so straight away they gave us foam pillows which were much better. The safe didn't open (for some reason, and had never happened to anyone else before!) but the hotel lent us money (of which we paid back at the end of our stay) and then gave us a complimentary breakfast as an apology. Definitely exceeded our expectations!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a great hotel to stay at and walking distance to the shops in Waikiki and the Hilton VIllage. I would stay here again for sure! I had ample room to spread out my work stuff and did not feel cramped in the room. The bathrooms were also large. I had the one bed - so the room had 2 closets. The one thing I did notice was their wasnt a lot of drawer space.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: All the staff were very helpful especially the front desk. They were so generous in giving us their macadamian chocolate cookies which we loved. This hotel is eco-friendly, cares for the environment and even have an herb garden by the pool which they used for the dishes that they serve in the dining room. If you choose not to get your room cleaned for 2 or 3 days you will get a $10 voucher that you can use in the dining room.Although it's not by the beach, it's a short walk to the beach and the malls.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is in the right place, only a block from Hilton Village and blocks from the Mall and also great shopping area. The employees are great, from the check in and valet, everyone treats you like one of the family. They always welcome you with a smile and always willing to offer you any help you want, if you don't know what you want to eat ask and the recommendations from the staff will not dissappoint you. Directions or info on getting around ask.The rooms were a good size and the bathroom were well kept. Price is a lot cheaper than the Hilton Village. Room very quiet and clean. Bed is a king and very comfy. Will book here from now on.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Warm welcome, with no wait at reception. Straight to our room despite arriving before midday. Very comfortable. Great shower (v important to me) All staff lovely. Local attractions all in comfortable walking distance. Highly recommended

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property is a few blocks from the beach and you will walk through the Hilton parking lot to get to the sun and sand. Rooms are nice but have one major problem and that's the bathroom. There is a frosted glass window between the bathroom and the bedroom and if someone gets up during the night and turns on the light, it shines into the bedroom. Also the bathroom has a sliding door so don't expect much privacy. Beds are comfortable. The lobby is on the second floor but the elevator goes all the way to the parking garage, so that's no problem. Staff is wonderful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Second time in Oahu...had stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Waikiki the first time as it was more of a vacation and it was nice but pricey with the resort charge and parking fees. Was taking my daughter to her freshman year at UH so knew we wouldn't be spending as much time in the hotel itself. Was a cheaper place to stay but the rooms were still up to the normal Doubletree comfort and ambiance. Nice plus...they didn't have the $30/day resort charge!! Parking is limited at the hotel and is only valet. Was concerned that we would have to wait a long time as I expected we would be in and out of the hotel a lot going back and forth to school. Pleasant surprise! The Valet team was superb!!!! Never had to wait more than about a minute any time we needed to get the car. Would definitely stay there again just for the convenience and price factor.
user_name:
Dave F
Big Pine Key, Florida

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel staff very helpful and attentive. I commend the breakfast staff especially. I received a phone call that my room was ready and while that was not necessary, I thought that was a very nice, personal touch.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: All the personnel was very friendly and greeted us all the time whether we were coming or going. The room was very nice and clean as was the hotel. The cookies were very delicious. They also provided daily newspapers for us to enjoy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Due to my previous experience at a Double Tree in Austin, TX, I vowed to never stay at a Double Tree again. Never say never. Anywho (yes, anywho),I needed a spot near Addiction to hangout after my best gal pals bday celebration. I am military and even though I am a Hilton Honors member, a Hilton hotel wasn't my first choice. Given the choice between a Hilton hotel, a marriott hotel, and a really expensive hotel (for one night) I chose Hilton. This choice did not come without extensive deliberation and research. I read the many reviews on the Marriott and Hilton hotels by many other "trip advisors" and went out on a limb and dreaded the outcome. Least to say my stay wasn't bad, I thought the room was a little small as well as the in room fridge, but hey I'm coming from Texas and everything is bigger. Also, we didn't have a microwave, you always need a microwave and I was on the 9th floor and all of the Ice machines were located on the even floors only... Other than that, it was clean. Lastly, if you come up on DB Tree to your right) don't take the first entrance, take the second and go to the right (even though you'll see a sign that 'exit only') and vice versa coming from the left. I say this because I spent the better part of 15mins trying to figure out where the entrance was... yes, the joke was on me. Enjoy your stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We decided to spend the Labor Day weekend in town and be tourists, We checked in and go upstairs and can't get into our room. This past year I have had that problem at other hotels so I thought here we go again. I go back down to the front desk and have the key rechecked to make sure that it's working, The front desk clerk checked and found that she told me and wrote the wrong room number. At least it wasn't me this time.The hotel is located near the beginning of Waikiki, Near the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Modern Hotel, I liked that it was not in the busy part of town and didn't have to deal with crowds of people. The special treat of cookies when you check in is a nice touch.We were able to walk to Kapiolani Park to visit the Okinawan Festival and eat the delicious foods and see the entertainers. No worries about finding parking since we were able to park at the hotel.
