We even went to see the participants at the 45th Waikiki Rough Water swim, things we wouldn't normally go to see.We had a chance to try new restaurants that in my opinion are hidden gems, Hike Hawaii Cafe as well as Goofy Cafe both less than a block from the hotelOverall the rooms are clean, the location is good and staff is professional. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: During a recent stay, I failed to properly account for my entire stay. The day prior to my check out, I was called and advised that i was scheduled to check out that day. I responded that I failed to account the last day of stay and although the hotel was sold out, the supervisor on duty managed to provide for the additional night stay. That provided peace of mind as I was traveling to another Hawaiian island at the time of the call.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 2 nights. Excellent hotel. Awesome friendly staff. Took care of every minor detail. Great location...ocean view...wish we could have stayed longer. HAWAII in general is an awesome place and the hotel made it better. Will look for this hotel next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If this were a hotel in any other city, I'd say it's fine. But for Waikiki it's an overpriced place to stay considering what you get. The staff is great and the room was nice enough, but it's too far from the beach locations to walk to, and since it's valet only parking, that makes it a hassle to drive back and forth to the beach area. The view is nothing special - mostly the high rise apartment buildings in the area.We booked at a rate of $179, but by the time we paid the mandatory $30/day parking fee and a wifi charge, we were around $250/ night, and it didn't help being an Honors member. Definitely not a dive, but the price and mediocre location will prevent me from ever staying here again. Bottom line is that if you're in Waikiki for a vacation, pay a little more to stay somewhere closer to the beach so you can enjoy the view and be within walking distance to almost everything.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Despite being somewhat of a dated hotel, the rooms have been recently renovated and are quiet and clean. Staff very helpful and courteous. Close to the nearby local favorite Wailana Coffee Shop with excellent breakfasts for a good value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a Hilton Honors member and decided to stay here because I had one night free stay, and the other nights were within my budget. I must say, it was an excellent choice. The hotel was very nice, clean and in a great location. The beach was very close. The hotel says one block, but you have to go through the Hawaiian Hilton and I count that as a block, but it is a very easy walk. The Waikiki beach is beautiful and believe it or not, it was not very crowded. Back to the hotel. We had a ocean view room and it was very nice. You can see the beach but are far enough away from the beach do not spring for the ocean front. Customer service was very good. You get a free continental breakfast every day, or you can upgrade to a hot cooked breakfast for $7.00. We did that a couple of days. Hopefully you can get Michael as the chef. He made the best omelette I have ever eaten. My only complaints about the hotel was that we did not have a microwave in our room and that you have no option for parking except for valet. I expected to pay for parking, but I hate having to wait to get my car. It just seems easier for me to park my own car and get it whenever I am ready to leave. Other than these two things it was an excellent hotel. Lots of great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. My husband and I both agreed that we would definitely stay here again if we were in the Waikiki Beach area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for one night before heading back to the main land. The hotel and the room are clean and nicely decorated. We received a free upgrade, so we had 2 beds and a pull out couch in the living room for 4 of us, which was greatly appreciated! The pull out couch is the most comfortable pull out couch I have ever been on in a hotel!!! Very friendly and helpful staffs all around. The breakfast was standard, but fresh and yummy! The hotel is one block to the Hilton Waikiki Village and right on the corner of Kalakaua Avenue. An easy walk to all the shops and restaurant and to the Waikiki beach. We would stay here again.
user_name:
Linda B
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Crazy over-priced. Just a room... nice, but not anywhere near the price paid for value! It is a hotel that is not near where all of the places to see are... not near the beach and not near where shopping / restaurants are, so you end up having to drive to where you need to go. It just wasn't at all worth the price paid. Just a place to sleep and nothing more. Really just would have rather stayed farther away for half the price.... which could have easily been done. Don't stay here if on a budget for sure, and don't expect anything more than a bed.... ok, and a cookie.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is clean and the rooms are very comfortable. The staff was really pleasant and the cookies are always an added bonus. You are walking distance to just about anything you need to get to. The beach is about a block or so across the street. The only thing that you should know if you plan to stay here is that parking is $30 per night. The rooms had a fridge which helps a lot and the bed is very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again when I am in Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very friendly staff. Parking is only valet but they are quick and efficient so we rarely had to wait very long. They do have refridgerators in the rooms which was very nice and a rarity in most Doubletree hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I arrived to the hotel later than expected due to business; however, I was welcomed and promptly checked into the hotel. I even received a very nice upgrade from my HHonors Gold status. The hotel staff were all quite nice and made sure I had everything necessary to make the stay all the more comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The HOtel it is perfect, good value cost x benefit, the Recepcionist KIKA was lovely, the hotel it is 2 min walking from the beach and the Hilton complex, also 24hrs restaurant just next door. the room was clean. all good

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Modern decor, comfy beds, friendly and caring staff. Most importantly, within walking distance of excellent shopping and dining in Waikiki! Valet parking only, but it's worth it in the heavy traffic...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is great. The rooms are clean, nice, food is great. You can't hear people next to you. It's also located in a great area, not too busy around that area and if you want to eat out of the hotel Cheese Burger restaurant is right next door, they have happy hour that run late in the evening. if you have a rental car, be prepared to pay $30/day for parking, but all hotels around the area have the same deal...can't get away from it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice and clean hotel. Complimentary internet in the lobby and business center. Parking is $30 per night, valet only. Rooms are loud BUT it is located in the middle of the city, so whoever would want to complain about that would be just silly...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Alana strikes me as a medium range business class hotel which, due to its location, also caters to a lot of tourists. It’s not in the same class as the big resorts nearby, but it could be a good alternative depending on what you are looking for. I stayed here recently for two nights while in town on business. The hotel is on busy Ala Moana on the western edge of Waikiki. You will have to walk a few blocks to the beaches or most of the shopping and restaurants. There are a few restaurants close by, notably Cheeseburger Waikiki (see my separate review), Todai and Tony Roma’s. The hotel lobby area is up a short escalator (or one story up on the elevator) from the driveway. The lobby area is small. Parking is by valet only ($30 per day at this writing). I got free wireless internet access but this may not be available to everyone. The hotel met the basics for me: although my room was rather small, it was clean, quiet, had a comfortable bed, and the temperature control actually worked. My room also had a balcony and a small fridge (no microwave). The in-room safe stopped working after the first day, a minor inconvenience. There is no complimentary breakfast. I had breakfast at the on-site ‘Trees’ restaurant and it was fine. On a weekday morning during tourist season I had to wait for a table. I did not have the breakfast buffet, but it looked very good with an on-duty chef making omelets and waffles. The breakfast buffet was $23 which by Waikiki standards is cheap. Although not my preferred place to stay when in town, I would stay here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel located within walking distance of anything you'd like to see or do. Both standard suites and penthouse rooms are nice with a good view in upper levels.Offers shuttle to and from Honolulu international and taxi service if needed.Valet parking standard so no hazzle.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Belated review by only a few days:Here for overnight on a work trip, the Alana met most of my picky demands. At our arrival the staff was nice but present my coworker and I with the news that his room was not ready. So, they knocked off parking ($30'a day i'm guessing). It was a nice location and walking distance to the beach, which I sadly didn't have time to visit on this trip. Decor, beds, and small things were great.The downside to this place, most Doubletrees charge for breakfast unless you're a gold or diamond member. Not a huge deal. But since my stay was rather short, I never had time to veg out and surf the web. Seemingly this place must live under high pressed order. Most Doubletrees have wifi included it seems or staff are generous to give access. Not so much here. In this day and age, wifi might be a deal breaker for some...ie my Wife. If in the future I end up here, I might pressure my company to steer away from this Hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel to have a Comfortable stay and easy access to most of the places. All the basic facilities have been provided without any fuss. Only thing, I didn't like in the room is the distance of TV from the bed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: No problem with hotel. Met our expectations. If we had to stay at this hotel again we would. We would also recommend others to stay. Really loved the fact that as long as you had a room there you were able to get free cookies

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was clean, most of staff attentive. Hotel is a walk to the beach and restaurants. Need cabs or public transportation to get everywhere. Not a good hotel for family trips if you want to be on the beach or near major shopping. Does not offer complimentary breakfast like most Hilton properties. Within walking distance to a laundry mat. Bell staff and front desk staff are very helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel rooms and hallways have a strong mold and dump stench. Hallway carpet need vacuuming or shampoo. hallway walls need wipe down or fresh paint. The hotel rooms furniture and in great condition. The hotel is walking distance to Waikiki beach. DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A CLEAN & QUIET.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Cleaning crew did not clean room well, toilet overflowed 2 days back to back, not due to our fault, water ran in toilet continuously, first time they did not fix, just adjsuted , second time fixed didn't lcean up all the water put towel down to suck it up - would not stay here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is clean, staff is very friendly and you can actually relax by the pool without being surrounded by 100s of people. Even with Hurricanes coming in staff helped us make a good time of it while everything else was closed. Rooms were spacious at least in the suite we were in and had ocean view from one balcony and mountain view from the other.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Small rooms; small bathroom; poorly appointed; Lobby too small; poor lighting; in room refrigerator not cold enough; provided lukewarm cookies at check-in; chair and table in room were uncomfortable; not a good place to stay for business; restaurant was 2 star at best
user_name:
C Emmanuel A
Washington, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a small amount of business then a relaxing weekend at the hotel. Walking distance to restaurants and the beach. Close to Ala Moana shopping center. We had a nice view of the ocean, all in all, a great stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was clean and the staff was curtious and helpful. I would recommend it to everyone. I have stayed at nearby hotels in the area on business and this one was the best to date. There are numerous restraunts and shops within walking distance and there is a nice park 2 blocks away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is in a nice area, but not Waikiki. I was in town for a conference so the beach wasn't guaranteed. The biggest issue I had with the hotel is I was told I could log into the internet without a charge showing up on my bill. On the second to the last day, I decided to call the front desk to validate this was the case. Not true. As I suspected, I had been paying $10 a day for internet I won't be able to expense even though I was told I could get free internet. I will only stay at this hotel again if I have to.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stay here for 6 days, very nice receptions and staffs, location is very good, close to business street, breach and river. 非常好的酒店，工作人员热情，房间舒适。地点靠近商业区，步行到海滩和运河都很方便。下高速5分钟即到。就是停车比较贵。不过整个檀香山停车都挺贵的。需要娱乐建议去对面的希尔顿度假村，里面的泳池，人工沙滩泳池和海滩更好。酒店的泳池比较小而且很深，有1.8米！
user_name:
Qing Chun H
广州, China

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My Sister set us up with Double Tree in Waikiki and it was Awesome! my Brother and I enjoyed it for the first time. Our purpose of this stay was for my newphews baseball tourney. The staff was great and the room was clean and pleasant! Oh, the cookies is to die for! Over all I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The front desk staff was very good. Housekeeping was adequate but not great. The rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable, but lots of compromises apart from that. Like all Doubletrees, everything but the room itself is a la carte: pay for in room wifi ($10/day), snacks and drinks for purchase in lobby, very small business center (two PC terminals, I think), breakfast for purchase, parking is average price for Waikiki (which is expensive though), pay for early check in or late check out. The weirdest thing was that the lobby and restaurant/bar, gym and other common areas, as well as the rooms are all air conditioned, but for some inexplicable reason the halls between rooms are not climate controlled. That leads to the halls getting damp and musty (very typical in Oahu) that the cleaning staff then tries to cover with some pretty powerful air fresheners. This and the pay to play for everything, on top of the crowded and inadequate common areas really make this a hard sell, even though their prices are competitive and their general staff attitude positive.It is across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village (shops, restaurants and bar, beach access) and at the end of the Waikiki strip closest to the airport (~30 mins away in moderate traffic). The up-side is that there are several small restaurants, ABC stores, convenience stores, and gift shops right on the same block and not nearly as jammed as the ones on the strip in the evenings. The highlight might well be Wailana Coffee House, which is an absolute gem for people that want good, filling food for reasonable prices (average per plate meal ~$13 - which is a steal for Waikiki).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For my taste this doubletree is an average hotel, expensive like most hotels in Waikiki, the rooms are small, clean and comfortable, the lights are in the dim side. The view, well the room has not a great view, just some buildings. The pool is small.The beach is a 15 minute walk. A Subway restaurant is within walking distance.Now the things you never forget for a world class hotel chain, they overcharge my credit card for about US$250, I sent an email to the hotel, first they seem to try to help me, but then, no more email responses since one week. They just don't care about their customers.Please avoid this hotel, I use to travel frequently to San Diego, CA and Orange, CA and stay in their hotels, but no more. What a shame.Better stay in the Ramada is in the same street, is cheaper with more in room amenities like microwave, free Internet, cheaper parking and clean.AVOID ANY DOUBLETREE AND HILTON AT ALL COST

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very Good overall experience. Very nice counter and valet staff. I was provided good dining recommendations and found the valet staff very coordual. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. Well worth the Government rate.
user_name:
Keith P
St. Louis, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed this past week for work/holiday. Staff was awesome about getting me an early (for fee) check-in. I was thankful. Front desk, bell staff, custodial team are all super friendly & get to know you...Room had a nice limited ocean/city view -- and is beautiful noon or night. Balcony lets you and 1 enjoy. Leads onto the strip for a short walk or ride to where you need to go.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My room and that of my colleague were musty during the entire 10 day stay. The cost of valet parking is $30 per day and there is no self parking lot in the hotel. The location is on the West side of Waikiki and not a far walk to the center of the main Waikiki night life. Reasonable priced restaurants are located within 1-2 blocks of the hotel. The beaches are about 0.25 miles away. It is a reasonable walk to Alamoana Shopping center ~ 0.8 miles. If you get tired you can always take a bus back to the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our stay at the Doubletree in Waikiki was a much needed break from our busy lives. The room was clean, updated and nicely furnished. The staff at the Front Desk were efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. The Valets were also very kind, assisting us with our luggage and taxi needs. We had a very nice breakfast at the hotel on our day of departure. The location to restaurants, shopping, the beach and other attractions were terrific. We will be sure to stay there again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay, walking distance to shopping, beach and food. I would highly recommend it. The staff welcomed us warmly and were helpful during our stay. Room was very clean. No problems at all! Would go back!
user_name:
Hope & Larry H
yuma, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here just one night on the way back from Maui. Staff were friendly and room was clean. We were greeted with chocolate chip cookies which was cool. The hotel suited our needs; our flight came in the evening and we had to leave early so wanted to be near the action of Waikiki but not prepared to pay for being on the beach as we were only here for a short time. We didn't get to go to the pool or eat here. The location of the hotel is good but personally prefer Hilton Hawaiian or Sheraton for there amenities.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A very busy hotel a block back from Northern end of Waikiki. We arrived to room not ready. When we got in there filthy. Long black hair in bath, stains on everything, lounge looked like a dog lived on it. Curtains hanging off track, blocked sinks x 2 and stained and dirty, urine behind toilet, dirty dirty grout, nasty smell from drains. Our hallway from lift was not vacuumed in the 5 days we were there. I brought all of these issues to the attention of the front desk on two occasions and nothing was ever done, until I commented again on check out and they offered to comp the parking. Would of been nicer if they had cleaned. I didn't ask for any discount. I was just replying to the 'How was your stay question'. Staff seemed overworked and not happy, except for the valet parking guys. Horrible view of down rent flats next door and filthy balconies below and our own was very dirty and dusty.. Rooms have no overhead lighting and so are dark and the ceiling height is very low. Marks on walls and mirrors and even spills we made were never cleaned up off surfaces. One day housekeeping didn't make the beds up, just changed the towels. If you get a budget room rate it is ok for Waikiki where a lot of hotels are old, but if can't stand dirty, don't go. It is not two rooms, just a sliding panel between bedroom and lounge not a wall and there is only one TV which is in lounge with terrible channel offerings, though I didn't really try to find anything much. The sofa bed did have a foam tempur mattress which was comfy, however the fabric on arms of lounge was so dusty and stained it wasn't nice to lay your head on. The beds were small doubles. Easy walk 15 mins to Ala Moana Mall, bus stop is halfway there so you may as well walk. Return bus drops at 8 mins away at Hilton side entrance. Can get to the beach by going across the road and through the Hilton Resort 10 minutes. They let us have towels there, but didn't know of any reciprocal agreement, so maybe check that out. Laundromats nearby and enough restaurants and ABC stores convenient to buy sundries and meals. No smoking anywhere including balconies so all the guests hang on the front wall of the footpath to smoke which is not a good look.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My second choice for a very nice hotel is Hilton's Doubletree Alana.You are welcomed by warm chocolate chip cookies at the reservation desk, and after that the service is very good. The hotel suites were re-furbished a few years ago and they are spacious, comfy, and gorgeous. It is located about a block from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and guess what? You have access to all of the HH Village grounds, activities, sights and services.The doubletree has a restaurant, enjoyable room service pool, and a small shopping area. ABC stores are right on the corner. It is surrounded by scrumptious restaurants, Hawaiian stores ect.A short walk from the Bishop Museum located on the corner of the Hilton Hawaiian village.What a hidden gem. When the H H Village is fully booked I just book into the Doubletree Alana and whenever I want I walk to the Village and enjoy myself. Did I mention that you can ask for anocean view room? It is not as close to the beach as the HH Village and other hotels but it is so pleasant and enjoyable. The park is right across the street for walking, sitting and relaxing, and for jogging fun. What a gem.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is set back from the ocean behind the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Ala Moana Blvd. Its a great location, close to everything. A quick walk and your on the beach. Restaurants are all around you in every price category and the shopping is abundant. Access to the hotel is easy once you find its location which can be bit tricky, but once your there valet service (which is all that's offered) takes care of parking and your free to walk the area. This hotel does not have underground stores and shopping facilities. It is a quieter location with less people traffic which suited us perfectly! Our stay included free breakfast which was phenomenal, everything you could want. Service was great! We had a corner room with two lanai's overlooking Fort DeRussy Park on the 15th floor which gave us peek-a-boo views of the ocean. The bed was great, a/c quiet, very little street noise when windows are closed. Only a few things did not meet our needs. The room does not come with Microwave or Refrigerator. You can order a Refrig. for additional cost. The gym is weak, 2 treadmills, (both needed servicing) a couple elipiticals and weights, and the pool is not a resort, not really inviting to us but adequate. All in all for what we needed, it was perfect!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great place, located at the heart of Waikiki easy access to all points of east side of Oahu. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Great value for any family. Beds are heavenly, awesome room size. Pool has been always clean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We liked the hotel. Up to date, clean, quiet, and we liked the location. We like the fact that they have two queen beds. It was within walking distance of shopping, great restruants, and the beach. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel very nice and quiet not like the hotel across the street Hawaiian Village Hilton that place is massive people Did not have an ocean view so not sure how that was very clean hotel nice staff
user_name:
Kathy R
long beach, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's not as close to the beach as some hotels. They charge extra for internet in the room which was disappointing. I didn't care for the shower set up. Other than that, it was a solid hotel, but if you area Hilton customer, the Grand Hilton offers a better location with more amenities and is on the beach.
user_name:
Rufina W
Hong Kong, Hong Kong

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A good hotel to stay for a few days! Very friendly and accomodating staff - at the front desk in a small lobby where we checked in at 5 pm and not to mention 'Pedro' at the valet/bell desk in the lower lobby (instantly gave a phone call to the taxi driver we favored to bring us to the airport, likewise brought our luggages to the van), so with the chambermaid of our room - big but not too spacious. Asked for a quiet room, was given a corner room on the 7th floor, but one can hear the traffic from the main street, so with the 'drawers' banger' (successive) in the next room in the middle of the night and early morning:(. Boy, wonder what the 'guest next door' put in the small cabinet drawers that he kept on opening/closing (with intentional force) the drawers). Breakfast was ok, not the worst or the greatest. Omelette though was yummy, so with the cookies given to the hotel guests. Locationwise, the hotel was well-situated. Walking distance to Ala Moana Center as well as to Waikiki Beach Walk, Overall stay in Oahuis always a real pleasure for us!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Amy at the front desk was great, the Staff was was friendly, great location, room was nice But the air condition was loud and kept me up through the night when I had a meeting the next morning. Breakfast was not worth the cost, Eggs & Bacon w/OJ !!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is in great location and the staff extraordinary. My special thanks goes to Sharill who kindly managed to keep us in our rooms even though we made a mistake in the departure date. Their warm cookies were also great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good quality . . . room was very comfortable. Very convenient location . . . easy to get anywhere from here. Staff was very friendly and accommodating to any requests. Definitely will return. However, having a min. 200 character count on a review is annoying.
user_name:
Dennis M. J
Portland, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel located in a busier more congested area. Close to Hilton Hawaiian Village Shops and Activites. Decent walk to central Waikiki. Spacious, clean rooms with balcony views between other buildings. Small basic lobby, could use more help at the check in desk. Room was not available until after 7pm. Bell check was efficient and reliable. Was able to store bags before room was available, bags were then delivered to room upon request.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room was small compared to other hotels in the area. Location was great walking distance to places to eat. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if your looking for long term stay. Maybe for just overnight. I liked the Modern Honolulu better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Though there were a few minor issues with our room, the customer service at the DoubleTree by Hilton Alana Waikiki was great! The personnel at the front desk were very professional, greatly knowledgeable about the island, extremely helpful and just plain friendly. They were great at getting directions to sights/attractions. Skip the concierges ( pretty useless and not helpful or knowledgeable) and ask at the desk. We had a couple of problems with room, but maintenance staff was quick to repair. Good rates and great location. Rooms were nice and CLEAN!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great property and great location at the western edge of Waikiki (Hawaii), but staff services were sadly limited and disoriented. The first clue is when the restaurant staff indicate, repeatedly, that items from both their food and drink menu are not available. The food available was greasy (rarely do I use this term) and poorly prepared. The second clue was the 6:00 AM call from allegedly the front desk trying to scam my credit card. Fortunately, I refused to provide the number and received a blank look from the front desk when I reported it. Oddly, internet access is available for free in common areas, but $9.95 per day in the room for very, very limited and uneven wifi connectivity. It is though this property is an anachronism that just hasn't kept up with the times, including assuring that food and beverage supplies are available for restaurant, bar and catering services. On the plus size, the rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable. House keeping was thorough and reliable. A daily LOCAL newspaper was provided, which I greatly appreciate!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Affordable Rates and a Great Staff. Will definitely stay again. The room was exceptionally comfortable and clean. The food had great flavor and priced right. Lobby kind of small if a crowed shows up but with the knowledgeable staff your check in quick and up to your room you go.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good midscale hotel. Not beach proximate but beach access is an easy 5+ minute walk. Waikiki restaurants and stores are within walking distance but are farther than the beach. King room was fine. Queen rooms looked good for a family. Rooms was clean and the staff was friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The longer we stayed the less I liked it. We chose this place for two primary reasons, location and two queen beds. As a family of three two double beds just don't cut it anymore and that's what the vast majority of hotels offer if you want two beds. The location (two blocks from the beach) and beds were fine. The hotel staff was also friendly.The rest was disappointing. We were upgraded to a suite because I'm a Hilton Diamond member. The upgrade added a separate sitting area in our room which was nice to have. However the room is dated and much of it is of poor quality or disrepair. Large paint scratches or discolored repairs (i'm talking 3-4 inches) were on several walls and one door. The bathroom door is a slider and there's was a 1.5 inch gap between the bottom and the floor.The balcony overlooked the tiny pool and the parking lot and building next door. Our room was right next to the elevator and you can definitely hear it during the night. If you have trouble falling asleep this isn't the room for you.The breakfast was adequate and most people including us seemed to have a coupon. I'm not sure what it is about business hotel restaurants but they seem to some of the most inefficient eating establishments on the planet. The wait to be seated, get your check, a glass of water or something as simple as skim milk was ridiculous. What makes it all the more painful is that it's a buffet so it's not like they were busy taking orders. I can't believe how often 2-3 employees were just walking around but not doing anything in particular. Into the kitchen with empty hands and out of the kitchen with a single item. This was a real issue for us by the end of the stay.Overall the place isn't terrible but I seriously doubt we'll be back unless the rates are dirt cheap. And if we do ever go back we won't be getting a room by the elevator or eating breakfast in the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved this hotel. Very classy and clean we asked and received an upgrade. The pool was pretty and operated 24/7. Large thick beach towels you can take to the beach. Hotel staff is so nice and helpful. Chef cooked our local food for us. Best part is location. You are 2 blocks from the beach yet closer than most of the hotels that have construction all around them in the middle of waikiki. The hawaii hilton village is 1 block away from the doubltree. Their beach and amenities are great to use. However it is crazy like Disney land and just as expensive. We loved our quiet and classy hotel with great service and friendly people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Even as a gold member of Hilton Honors I still had to pay for everything. They serve better breakfast at the Best Western and it's free. The bed was hardly made each day. The room was small. The TV kept intermitting and losing volume. The internet connection was ungodly slow.... I had to tether from my phone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel many times on business trips and my wife and I enjoy the location. Walking distance to many of the attraction of Waikiki but quiet. Very clean, great staff. A little older hotel but great value. Very safe area. My wife walks to shopping while I am at work. I would\will stay again.
user_name:
Clayton D R
Shiloh, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice hotel and close to Waikiki Beach and shopping. The pool is nice and the cookies are tasty. the staff is very friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki. No views but very close to hilton Hawaiian Village

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice hotel in a great location on Waikiki beach. Wonderful staff; very friendly and helpful. Valet parking staff did a fabulous job in keeping up with all of our comings and goings. Would definitely visit this hotel again.
user_name:
Kelly S
san antonio, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I won a Raffle Prize at a Charity Golf Event and had a great time at this hotel for 2 nights. We decided to come on a weekday and enjoy the slightly less crowded Waikiki. The Staff really show Aloha and enjoyed us as Local Resident Guests! The hotel is located in a very accessable area on the edge of Waikiki

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were looking for a descent hotel for a layover in Honolulu. It's a busy hotel with Airline staff checking in and out. Thought I would be treated special as a Hilton Diamond member , but instead I had to wait longer than other guests for an early check in. Two of the four elevators weren't working and the one we used wouldn't open at the floor we had to get out. Our room was clean and quiet, so we got the rest we needed. The gym is well equipped with a nice view to the pool. The breakfast offers lots of choice, but could start earlier than 7:00am. There is only valet parking offered, therefore it's a bit of a hassle to drop off your car and get it back when you want to go out. But the valet parking staff is very friendly. PThe front reception doesn't seem very organized while one person doesn't know what the other one is doing. Again there was no special treatment for Hilton Diamond members in terms of late check out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed 7 nights and overall had a pleasant experience. The A/C was noisy but other than that no real complaints. Staff was friendly. We had a great view from the 18th floor. We loved the location close to everything and not too crowded like the other Hilton properties. We told the staff we're celebrating our anniversary and they sent us a very nice card w/ a cookie tin. Super thoughtful. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed here many times over the last few years. The staff has always been very good. Friendly, helpful suggestions for the tourist, and accurate reservations. Rooms were renovated a few years ago and are much better than they were. I would never pay the extra for a "view" room as there really isn't a descent view from any room. If you're here for the view, find another property. Also you can expect daily sirens. Can't say why other than location. Otherwise a very nice stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For the first 3 nights I couldn't figure out what the heck I was hearing. The elevators in this hotel resonate through all the walls and floors. I generally go pretty easy on places (see my profile), but this is worth mentioning since the main reason people go to a hotel is to sleep....and I'm not a light sleeper.Other than that, not a bad place. Decent location, although it's about a 1/2 mile to get to the center of all of the Honolulu action and shopping (area around Royal Hawaiian and Dukes). The front desk people and cleaning services were fantastic.$30.00 a day to park (mandatory valet). About a 5 minute walk to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and beach area.Overall, not bad...just noisy elevators!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Made this trip to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. Since hotel knew this, as our children had called and sent wine and fruit to our rooms, maybe they could have done a little something to deliver when fruit was fresh and cold.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location on Ala Moana Blvd. The mattresses were so soft they were very uncomfortable and caused sore backs for both my wife and myself. Parking is expensive at the hotel. The breakfast was excellent. Overall, I'd say the stay was okay, but probably would look for a different facility in the same general area. The hotel is in need of upgrades--baths smell of mold which is a common issue in Hawaii.
user_name:
W M
Kitty Hawk, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at Double Tree in waikiki were outstanding! My family of four decided to stay there & give it a whirl due to the Hilton being completely booked. Their attitude set the standard and is what I think all customer service should be like. It all started at the valet with a friendly greeting and off to the front desk with several freshly hot baked chocolate chip cookies which were complimentary from the front desk customer service representative, Melissa who greeted us with a very sweet smile & a super great attitude & excellent customer service skills. Check in was quick and easy. The price alone was more then fair considering how clean everything was in the room. Well from an alright day turned into an awesome night because not only was everything to our satisfaction but we even got comped to the penthouse at no extra charge so it was a totally free upgrade which we gladly took. As we checked out in the morning we completely forgot all of our personal items that we left in the restroom of our room & called the hotel who transferred me to their hotel security Mark, who said he was going to be leaving soon but would kindly pass the message to the next security who was going to be coming on duty and let me know his name was Michael. Mark then said don't worry about it I'm sure Michael will get the message and have no problem holding your items for you & he will have it ready by the time you get back to the hotel. As soon as the next Security Michael clocked in he gave me a courtesy call right away & said to just let him know when we get there & he will gladly bring our items down. As several hours passed by and as we made our way back to the hotel and parked in the loading zone while I quickly got out I asked the front desk for my belongings that I left behind and the security Michael had my belongings right there waiting for me :) He was very awesome and even checked the drawers in the room for us and found a brand new shirt my kids bought for there Dad for father's day & kindly returned it to us. I tried to offer him a tip twice and as he kindly refused and said im just doing my job and after forcing it upon him a couple of times i realized that he was so sweet and generous that when he finally took the money he dropped it right back in my bag when I wasn't looking. So I felt he needed to be acknowledged for that kind gesture. So my family and I would like to just say a huge Mahalo to the staff mentioned above for making our stay the best one we've ever had at any hotel. Also this was our first time staying here & will definitely NOT be our last!!! Thanks again for a very wonderful as well as comfortable and welcoming stay. P.S. Those cookies are so delicious thanks Melissa your the best!!! yummmy!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I enjoyed this place. Three nights. Good staff interaction, clean and mid-range. Mid way between beach and shops and not hard work with some sightseeing on the way. Simple, clean, nice and excellent staff. Breakfast is sure but simple but get there before 7 to avoid dudes checking out and redeeming breakfast chits Stay again with bride ... Yes. Not at all shabby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here and used our Hilton Points while in Oahu. The hotel was clean, welcoming, and of course we enjoyed the cookie. The hotel is in walking distance to the beach and multiple restaurants. We also really enjoyed the breakfast. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I were in this hotel for about 12 hours. It was just an okay experience. This DoubleTree was clean and centrally located, but there is not beach access. The staff was professional and polite, and the linens were completely satisfying. I have inclosed some photos of our room's views. The biggest issue we had was of the bathroom. (see photos) There is no space for storage and my wife was disappointed with there not being sufficient shelving for her essentials. Overall, for our one night stay before flying to Maui, we did sleep great, but I had a different expectation for for DoubleTree. I initially chose this property for being the least expensive room rate of all Hilton properties, but now would consider paying more for another property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Issue - I booked a room with a partial ocean view and was charged more for it, but was placed on a lower floor with no view of the ocean. Now I need to give Hilton a hard time to see if I can get the extra $20 back
user_name:
Daniel B
Richland, WA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I attended a conference at the Hawai'i Convention Center and stayed for a few extra days vacation. The hotel was centrally located to all of these activities -- about two city blocks away from the convention center and the same distance to Waikiki beach. I will caution you that if you expect your Hawai'i stay to include a view of the beach, then you should choose a different hotel. Since I only tend to be in the room after dark, a beach view is not that important to me. The rooms were spacious and economical. I rented a suite for what less than I would have paid for a standard room at other nearby hotels. The hotel staff was professional and courteous, and went out of their way to provide a high level of service. The in-house restaurant provided an awesome breakfast buffet and a good dinner, both at reasonable prices. While the pool and fitness center were a bit small, they were clean and well-maintained. Should I be lucky enough to travel to Hawai'i again, I would definitely return to the DoubleTree.
user_name:
Maureen L
Atlanta, GA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff friendly and very helpful. Good quality rooms. Very good value for the money. Location excellent for walking to the beach, and for partial ocean view, when upgrading to higher room. Good shopping nearby, and superb for quickly accessing quality restaurants.
user_name:
Rebecca M D
Heathsville, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I spent four nights at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki while on business in Honolulu. I was very happy with my stay. My room was clean and comfortable. I slept very well. My room was very quiet even though I was on a lower floor facing Ala Moana Blvd. There is a restaurant with a limited menu that serves breakfast (buffet only) and dinner. The continental breakfast buffet was $16 and the full buffet was $23. I ate there a couple of time and the food was good but opted to eat more often next door at Cheeseburger Paradise where the breakfast special was only $5.99. The staff at the hotel was very nice and I plan to stay there again when on business. It had the feel of a business hotel to me and not a vacation hotel although there were several tour groups staying there. The hotel seemed far from the beach but was only about 1/2 mile to Ala Moana Shopping Center if you like shopping. There is a full time concierge desk at the hotel and I was contacted my first day with a friendly phone call to let me know what services were available.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was absolutely great! Great service, very clean, and right across from the beach. The area is nice and there are several places to eat close by. The concierge helped us plan our trip to the North Shore and sent us to some amazing places! It was easy to book a rental car through her and just go!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel location, staff was friendly! We were in town for my daughter's graduation and everything was perfect. From check in to departure was quick and efficient! We were able to enjoy the pool and the valet servie was great, even though they seem to not be available round the clock, as cars were lined up the nights we were there to have their cars parked, so we had to do the same. Overall, it was a great hotel, and would love to return when we can!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in a "penthouse" for 7 days, for a total of $2,317. I was very disappointed at what would be COMPLIMENTARY at other hotels for a fraction of the cost that were not at this hotel. I could have stayed comfortably at a super 8 with FREE breakfast, Wi-Fi/internet, a microwave AND refrigerator in the room. The room was rather small for a penthouse and incomparable to the pictures and description that are displayed on the website. Booking sales are the bread and butter, (as they made roughly $30,000 off of the group I came to Hawaii with alone) I found it kind of a rip off to charge $10 a day for Wi-Fi access, (It was free in the lobby however) and $16 dollars for a breakfast buffet (I only ate a bagel, yogurt, and juice and was still charged full price). More customer appreciation! People spend alot of money with you!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice view of the electrical Transformers and roof. At least room was clean, Coffee in room was nice, because they did not have any downstairs in the Bar/Resturant, where the guy did not know how to operate the machine. Cookies were warm, just glad we did not book a longer stay. Used Hhonors points so we got a deal for little cash out of pocket.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here 2 adults and 2children for 10 nights on a family fun package in a 2 bed suite. Checked in early & was charged a $25 fee even though the room was ready. Not too happy with that considering we are hhonor member. Room was very clean and spacious for the 4 of us. Beds a little on the small side but okay for a child and an adult to sleep in. Bathroom very large. The room was right next to the lifts which could be noisy at times. We were able to close off the bedroom at night so noise did not affect our sleep. Kids loved the pool as not very busy and were in there twice a day. Breakfast was included in the room rate and found this to be great. Plenty to choose from with continental items and then hot items including made to order eggs, omelettes etc. Staff at breakfast were exceptional especially Colleen and Susan who were happy to chat and make sure our kids were well looked after. Front desk staff great especially Danny who kept my kids well supplied with cookies...yumyum. Great location as hotel away from the heart of Waikiki so a little quieter but close to the Waikiki trolley stops and tour pick ups. Also close walk to shopping. One downfall was the wifi in the room which was part of the package but not very reliable. We could only connect for short periods at certain times of the day. Better connection in the lobby. Cleaning staff were very accommodating as most of the time we just requested from hem fresh towels etc without cleaning our room. Saved them time. Would stay here again if returned to Waikiki just for the staff.
user_location: Dolans Bay, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Heidi2229
Dolans Bay, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here using our Hilton Honors points.So it was a great deal, but a splurge of our points...40,000 per night. Staff was very pleasant. Hotel was very nice. I wish the wi fi in rooms was free. We didn't use it because of the extra charge. AC was also set so we couldn't turn it lower that preset temp. I would have liked it a little cooler since we were there during very hot humid time. Rooms nicely were remodeled and I loved the walk in shower with glass door! Good location to the bus stops.There were plenty of places nearby to eat. We used the Subway around the corner a few times. Also ABC and 711 stores seemed to be around every corner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean room, comfy bed, refurbished bathroom with great shower head. Nice location, walking distance to bus stop, trolley and Waikiki beach / Waikiki Shopping area. Friendly staffs. Love the Double Tree warm cookies, I wish they gave us more than 1 cookie.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Traveling to HNL for business and was initially disappointed at the cost cutting measure of choosing a hotel off the beach front, but this hotel is great! I could not have had a better stay! The staff was very attentive, Malissa especially! She made sure leis were refrigerated for my son's arrival, and since I was working, greeted him and his wife with the traditional "Aloha!" and personally gave them their leis! As this was a working trip for me, I spent a great deal of time in my room and it was very comfortable, clean, and had a great bed. The restaurant has great food and prices are about the same as other restaurants in the area. It truly is a very short walk to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and there are several good restaurants and shops along the way. This would definitely be my choice for future travel. And what a surprise on the night before my departure to have delivered to my door a tin of those wonderful chocolate cookies and a hand written note from Melissa! Great job! I'll be back here my next trip to HNL and will be recommending this to my co-workers! It's great to stay very close to all the activity, but not be right in the middle of it...a little more relaxing!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed 1night pre cruise and the hotel was ok. All of the windows in the hallways were open so it made each floor very warm and humid. Not a great feeling about security either. The room felt musty and it was disappointing as we really liked our stay at the Doubletree in Orlando by the airport. We hoped for better but it was fine for one night. The location was good and not far to the cruise terminal and Waikiki beach. There is an IHOP nearby and a few ABC stores for reasonably priced snacks etc. the staff was fine at the hotel, nothing outstanding. I asked for help from the concierge one morning and he was remotely interested in offering some directions.We got to the hotel a bit later in the evening and went to the bar for a drink and to order something light to eat. We were the only people there and service for food was really slow. The bartender was quick with our drinks and friendly to talk with but the food was terrible. We had onion rings that could be wrung out from the grease. They must have been cooked hours ago and sitting in a warming tray. For the only people in the restaurant the food was lukewarm. We had buffalo wings which were poor quality. We watched the guy setting up for the buffet breakfast and he wasn't wearing gloves when handling the glasses and bowls. His hands were all inside the dishes and he was behind the bar touching the cash register. That turned us off from having breakfast there.For the price it was an acceptable hotel but we will not stay at this property on our next visit to Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent hotel. I am a regular for business and for pleasure and have never, ever, been disappointed. Rooms are clean, service is great, Danny at the front desk is outstanding, valet is extremely helpful and location is awesome. We love the breakfast buffet and eat there on every stay. We are customers for life.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family of two adults and four children under 11 all fit comfortably in a family room. The bar fridge was more of a half size so we weren't able to keep all 6 water bottles in there at once, no big issue though. The hotel itself was lovely, clean, and modern. Staff were friendly and the room service food and in dining food was very good. We all over indulged in the delicious complimentary cookies. You can ask for them at any time for a cookie. Location was good very close to AlMoana shopping centre, but next time would stay closer to the main are of Waikiki,however you can walk to the main area in about 20 mins. The Beach is much nicer at Central Waikiki, I am not a beach person but this was gorg, I could have stayed all day. However there are 'trolleys' which are like an open shuttle bus that takes you all area of Waikiki, charges are $2 e from memory. Bed was super comfy, pillows were not firm enough for our liking-again no big deal. We chose this hotel as we wanted too al be together and could not find any hotels that would guarantee interconnecting rooms, this one offered one large room (which had a door to divide) which fit us all. I had read reviews about complaints being put next to elevator and ice machine, our room was next to these but didn't bother us. Would definitely recommend this hotel esp to a larger family wanting to stay together and to people not wanting to be in the central busier area of Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The rooms were okay. It got pretty warm in the room even if we have the ac at the lowest temp we could possible put it. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The playpen loaner was not good. My daughter had a hard time sleeping on it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at DoubleTree after the Florida Georgia Line Concert. The room was very good with an upgraded bath. Everyone was friendly and didn't have any problems at all. Check-in and check-out was no hassle...but if you use a debit card remember there is a $50 hold after you check out just to make sure you left the room OK and there was no damages.
user_name:
Brian F
Ewa Beach, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed 11 nights at this hotel with my partner. The hotel is located on the western end of Waikiki between the busy Waikiki shopping streets and Waikiki beach and the eastern edge of Honolulu. You can walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center (10 minute walk toward Honolulu) and you can walk to the Waikiki shopping area (10 minute walk). Waikiki beach is just 5 minutes away. The staff at this hotel are friendly and helpful. I particularly liked the breakfast room staff, they were truly excellent. Breakfast was awesome and I ate the best pineapple ever. There is a small outside swimming pool where you can relax and enjoy the good weather and the views of the volcanic mountains. We booked one of the cheapest rooms available and it was excellent. It was located on the first floor. The room was spacious, clean, and modern. The bathroom was modern and clean, but there was only a shower available and no bathtub. WiFi was free in our booking, but I do not think this is always the case, so check beforehand in case you expect free WiFi. The beds were perhaps the best part of the room: clean and extremely comfortable. I wish I had a bed like this at home!
user_name:
João T
Utrecht Province, The Netherlands

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for 1 night, the first night of my 8 night trip to Honolulu. I had a loooong flight from the East Coast and arrived around 8pm. I had trouble getting to the hotel because there was road construction going on and detours. The hotel is situated on a circle so it was very confusing and took a few rides around the circle before I finally pulled up to the valet. Easy, pleasant check in. I had a free voucher to stay here so I'm not sure of their rates. My room was small and so was the bathroom. I don't believe there is a pool at this location. I basically just slept here overnight and checked out. This hotel is located a few blocks away from the beach and away from the main drag of restaurants and shops and for that reason I wouldn't stay here again. There are so many other better options in Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff is great, rooms are beautiful but we were disappointed by charges we did not expect and the inflexibility of the staff to address our concerns. Specifically, a $10 charge for "in room" connection to the internet per day and the hotel does not offer free coffee in the lobby between 5:30 and 10 AM.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the Alana Waikiki. Everything about the hotel is great. The rooms are very pretty and the rainfall showerhead fixture is totally an awesome upgraded bathroom fixture. Lots of storage areas in the room and sitting areas as well. Ultra comfy beds. All in all I loved this hotel and would definitely return if the price is right. MAGGIE ( Front Desk Clerk ) Very professional and kind.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, modern, spacious rooms. Helpful, friendly staff. The hotel is reasonably priced and located within walking distance to restaurants, shops and the beach. It's not spectacular but it's nice enough.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Highly Recommended for business and family...have stayed at this establishment for both business and family traveling. The excellent staff at the front desk are professional, caring, humble and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I need a room for one night until our rental house was ready and this was a great place to experience Waikiki/Honolulu area. Walking distance to food and shopping as well as a decent view of the ocean from our room. Hotel and room were very clean and would recommend hotel for couples or families!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The parking facilities are very poor. Your hotel does not offer a self park. Getting our car was very frustrating. My suggestion is to offer both. If getting our car is a problem, we will tend to stay in the room more than we should. This will result in less spending.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the hotel in March and could not imagine having a better experience! All of the staff were really friendly and helpful. They responded to our requests right away and always followed up with us to find out how our stay was going. The staff in Trees restaurant in the morning are fabulous! They always greeted us with smiles and made our mornings special. The breakfast food includes many healthy choices such as fresh fruits and vegetables and fat free Greek yoghurt. The room was very clean and comfortable with excellent beds. Great air conditioning. The pool area is very pretty. This hotel is in a great location right across from a huge park and in a nice neighbourhood at end of the really busy part of Waikiki, and not right in the centre. It is still a busy area, but a little less so. You can have a pleasant stroll through the park to get to the beach as an alternative to the busy roads. You can easily walk to all restaurants, shopping and to the bus stops. This hotel offers an excellent value for the price. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Small hotel but modernized, clean, and great service. Friendly front desk Staff and Valet Service was reliable and quick. Everything in the room especially the shower worked excellent. The bed was also really comfortable. Thank you Doubletree for making us feel home!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked at this hotel because we had a great experience at the Seattle Double Tree. We had an awesome time here at the hotel, meaning the service was excellent, and the people there were super friendly and very accommodating. Can't wait to stay here again!!! I am sure it was just an oversight, but the only thing that made this review perfect, was that there was hair in the bathroom sink and on the back of the bathroom door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stay here every time I need to go to Oahu, and it's like I'm coming home. Hats off to Danny at the Front Desk for providing great service. And also a thumbs up to William at the Valet. He was very friendly when he greeted me and parked my car and then again when he brought up my luggage. Love this hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We only needed one night just before attending a Hawaiian Village conference for which rooms had been arranged. The room was nice and clean, amenities were very good, beds were very good, and our brief stay found nothing wrong. However, the view out the fairly large window was of an adjacent building with a flat black roof below. Nothing living in sight. No restaurant.
user_name:
John H
Ponce Inlet, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Hilton Hotel fell below my expectations as far as what I was accustomed to. There is no free Wifi in room ($10 per day), no free breakfast ($16), TV didn't display sound very well, no fan in the bathroom, but an awesome shower, and clock aux cord didn't work. Also, it is usually $200 a night and totally not worth it. I would try to find another hotel! However, they do give you a free cookie with check in!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I think you are better off elsewhere. The staff lacks basic training in all areas. Rooms are not cleaned well, valets are not helpful, front desk is often confused with basic questions, I had to move 2 times due to maintenance issues. If you stay here, everything is an add on charge, parking, internet, etc. HH members receive no perks. Walk 1 block to Wailana Coffee house. The food is better and half the price than Hilton's restaurant.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room is average, but facility is standard or affordable American style. As Hilton group hotel, most of Japanease request and expect more helpful bath room like bath tab or more space. Air conditioning or other facility is good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I checked-in here with some of my colleagues for a review class we attended last year. We stayed there for 2 weeks. The location of the hotel is great. It's right in Waikiki and a walking distance to the beach, the touristy spots, the Ala Moana Mall, the Catholic Church and the restaurants too. The crew were very helpful and approachable and friendly. I really liked their service overall. They always keep our room clean. We stayed in a two-bed suite (with queen-sized beds). I love their bathroom, very clean and we can always get new towels. their shampoo and conditioners and soaps are all crabtree and evelyn, which i totally love because they are sulfate-free. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody who's going to visit Waikiki. I really had a good experience and will definitely come back to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After some trouble getting the correct rates upon check in we had a desk clerk step up and complete our checkin. She helped out the rest of our trip with other questions and services needed. There was a maintenance problem with our room, so we were re-located midway through our vacation but they were good to help us get moved. The highlight was happened after we checked out. I left my iPad in the lockbox. Double Tree (Clinton Yamashita and Jim McShane) proactively contacted me, confirmed my missing item, and promptly mailed it to my home.THANK YOU!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently had a 12 night stay at the Doubletree Alana for business. Had stayed here once before a few years back, and it definitely is much nicer now that it has been renovated. The rooms are nice and spacious, the showers are great, but the bathrooms are tiny. Same with the elevators - TINY! The public spaces are not air conditioned which is quite uncomfortable when it is very humid outside. Located on far end of Waikiki, closest to Ala Moana, across the way from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Quick walk to the beach, but a bit far from the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. Would I stay again? Yes, if the price was right - but I much prefer the Hilton Waikiki on Kuhio which has similar prices.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Clean, modern room with small fridge and balcony. Very comfortable bed. They only offer valet parking and it is $30. Close to everything. The breakfast was overpriced as there are plenty of better restaurants on the same block.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel to Hawaii 4 times a year and this was my first stay at the Double Tree. Even thought I'm a Hilton Honours member, I was put in a closet sized room with an adjoining door 1 floor above the pool.(5th floor) Not acceptable as I was there for work and didn't want to deal with the noise or the size of the room. I was moved to a Hilton Honours floor (16) and that was much better. Went to breakfast 1 morning and I had to ask to be served, after 4 more tables were seated and had been served coffee. I'll try it again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel, centrally-located, and 10 minute walk from Convention Center where I had business. Staff was friendly and helpful. Price seemed fair for the location. If there is a next time, and don't need ready access to convention Center, would probably stay at Marriott where I have Platinum status and qualify for various benefits.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this properety for years. It had become dated. But after the renovation, this hotel is much better. The rooms are crisp and clean and the service has improved (same staff, just happier people). Althought not on the beach, it is a short walk to all that is Waikiki. Will stay again!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My 3-night stay @ The Doubletree by Hilton was even more than I expect from a hotel. The service from the A+ staff always started with a smile and ended with a smile. The service was top notch no matter if I was dealing with Housekeeping; Porters/Valet Service; the Front Desk or the staff the small restaurant, Trees (their prime rib could stand up against the 5 star restaurants). Then there were the warm cookies, the heated pool, the lovely rooms, the crisp white linens, the fluffy towels and the in room coffee pots. My only request/suggestion would be to get rid of the paper coffee cups. Would I come back? Absolutely! Recommend to my friends? Most assuredly!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife. As a Hhonors Gold member I received a room upgrade and complementary continental breakfast. Thus the stay started out well, but then there were the small problems. 1) The room was too cold and even if you turn the A/C off it regularly comes back on.2) The water in the bathroom stank. I think that their water tank on the roof probably was due for a cleaning several years ago.3) The continental breakfast was disappointing. On the first day, none of the food had labels on it. We couldn't tell which container was 2% milk and which was skim, for example except by looking at the color of the puddle under the spout! The bagels were not real bagels -- too breadlike. We had oatmeal on all 3 days. One the last day, they finally put out some containers with brown sugar, raisins, etc. which they obviously had forgotten to put out the first two days.The location is a bit remote. It's about a 15 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center and perhaps a little less to the Waikiki section of Kalakaua. A car is recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We tried the Doubletree after a friend recommended it. I went on-line and found a deal with breakfast included. My husband called the Hilton directly and asked for the same deal. They told him he could get it through them with the government employee rate. Our first morning we were surprised to find no breakfast was included. We are a family of five with 3 teenagers and were counting on the breakfast. When we asked Rebecca at the desk if she could help us, she simply said "no you should have booked on the internet." Upon our return to Waikiki, we chose to stay at the ilikai. Still no breakfast, but the staff is kind and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice motel. Close to beach and other Honolulu places. Staff was very helpful. The room was very nice, clean and well maintained. The only complaint I have is no free WiFi in the room - you have to buy it per day.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very Unimpressed. As a HHonors Diamond member, I thought the benefits would be better. Received coupons for a continental breakfast (very sparse) with an offer to upgrade to scrambled eggs for $7. $30 a day for parking. Other Hilton hotels in the area offer much more at better prices and are closer to the beach. Was told I would be charged $100 for an early checkout, ridiculous! Had to request a late checkout of 2pm on the last day due to my flight leaving at 6pm and was asked by the cleaning staff several times when I would be leaving.Would rather sleep in the park.
user_name:
Tim F
Huntsville, Alabama, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are looking for a just a quick one or 2 night stay in Honolulu this hotel is the one. It's off the beach (but very walkable to it) so it's not a premium like the Waikiki hotels. We were on Oahu for just 2 days before continuing to Kauai. The staff was friendly, and warm. They all had smiles. Our room was clean and well done. It appeared pretty newly renovated. The bathroom was great...BEST SHOWER HEAD EVER....I have never had a great shower in a hotel before...but after a 12 hour flight from the east coast it was the best. Tons of water pressure and a great layout in the bathroom. Overall a wonderful hotel. Thanks so much!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice hotel with a great location. Room was very comfortable and a nice view from the balcony. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was excellent. And if your in the mood for a good hamburger or just a nice place for a drink, Cheeseburger Waikiki is right next door.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have always liked the Double Tree cookies but these people bought my love through their cookies! The young woman who is their concierge was great! She set my wife and I up with a couple nice tours around the island. If we are in the area again I would definitely consider going there again.Also, there is a Thai restaurant just a couple blocks away that is excellent!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our room on the 19th floor was spacious, sparkling clean, and had a great view of the mountain. There were sliding glass doors to a balcony from both the bedroom and living room. Unfortunately even on this high floor there was excessive street noise( sirens blaring, horns honking, car alarms going off and very loud motorcycles) that could be heard throughout the night. It may be that the other side of the hotel's rooms were quieter, but the mountain view side was incredibly noisy, and would certainly be a problem for light sleepers. The staff in this DoubleTree was excellent with the exception of the very apathetic server of our first day's breakfast. She sat us at a dirty table, never asked what we wanted to drink ( I had to get up and ask for coffee and tea), never cleared a single plate during the breakfast buffet, and in general was dedicated to filling sweetener and sugar bowls for a later meal, chatting with other staff and not attending to her tables. The second day's breakfast service was much improved by Hila's cheerful attention to her customers. As Hilton Diamond members we received complimentary breakfast coupons, but unlike every other Hilton property we have ever stayed in, this DoubleTree restricted the coupon's value to a limited item continental buffet. There was an additional $7 charge for access to the full breakfast.The location of this hotel is excellent, about three or four blocks from the ocean and two blocks from the bus stop for bus routes 42 and 20 that go to Pearl Harbor Park. Bus fare is $2.50 per adult and $1 for seniors. The trip takes about an hour. Getting from the airport to the DoubleTree Alana is also very easy by using Speedi Shuttle. The fare is $14, and you catch the shuttle right outside baggage claim H. The DoubleTree is the first hotel to be dropped off by Speedi Shuttle and is the last hotel to be picked up for the return to the airport. The shuttle for the return trip was very prompt, arriving exactly at the time we booked. (You get a discount if you book both trips together) All in all, I would recommend the DoubleTree Alana Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a nice hotel, can't say much for the breakfast or the bar, it's too expensive. Don't park a car here the cost for parking is way to high. There are some nice places to eat and drink around the hotel. There is an ABC (7-11) store around the corner and one down the block. The hotel is in a great location for walking down the main street to Waikiki or to a lot of restaurants. I have stayed here over 10 times and will continue to do so...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for a week for New Years back in DEC 12-JAN 13, but didn't have a TA account at the time. Came in from a 11 hour flight from Atlanta, starting my day in DC, and dealing with the worst experience at the DT Chrystal City-DCA Airport the night before. Showed up really not expecting much after my experience at another property the previous night, but I was completely astonished. The Rooms were phenomenal, the property was beautiful, and most importantly, the staff seemed genuinely happy to assist however possible. Bellman were courteous, Front Desk manager gave us our requested upgrade, and the restaurant was wonderful (I'm still laughing at some of the Bartenders jokes.) Would absolutely stay again,

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff here were the best ever on caring, efficiency and accommodating. I was traveling with elderly sick parents and they were there to assist me with any thing I needed and always showed concerned on how they were feeling each time I passed an employee staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
