review_body: Great value hotel which is not located directly on the strip but is close enough to everything within 5 to 10 minutes walk. The hotel was clean and the staff were excellent to deal with. It was quiet and great for business or a couple who want to go about there stay without the lots of people to deal with.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I had a fantastic stay at Double Tree by Hilton Alana Waikiki. Security was present, door locks worked properly. King bed was very comfortable. Lighting was very romantic. Flat screen TV was the perfect size. I enjoyed the bathroom shower glass door because it was clean and new, must better than shower curtain. Room decor was a great island theme. The partial view was great and birds would stop by for a snack. Don't forget the endless warm cookies. This was a very good hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had last minute reservations due to a canceled departing flight, so we checked in late and about an hour after the reservation was created. DoubleTree is ususally a great experiance with compentant employees. The check is missed several key items and took effort to correct. They missed count of people in my party and that my reservation included breakfast.
user_name:
Glenn A
Seattle, WA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: While checking in I happened to overhear the manager Jessica Heath talking extremely rudely to an Asian woman, possibly a tour organizer. Tonight sitting in the lobby, again, I can hear this woman being extremely loud and rude to another Asian customer, almost to the point of shouting. I highly doubt that any of them are going to to go and write a review, but I cannot stand it and dexided to write.As far as the accommodation is concerned, it is at best mediocre, the approach to my room with the open window screens reminded me of a student hostel I would have boarded in years ago. My single King room was spacious enough but cleanliness was obviously not their strong suit. Lovely shower but crud in and around the soap shelf. Glass tumblers had nastiness inside them, and I had to show them to the cleaning lady. I also had to personally ask her to smell the stale towels they kept leaving for me that simply stank, especially when wet. The Internet service was not good and while I could catch their complimentary lobby signal, there was barely any in the room. So I had to use the wired service. They charge for their Internet, so ne aware. There is also a $30 per day parking charge but thay is pretty much standard here in Waikiki hotels. The staff is extremely nice and helpful and the location walking distance from everywhere you want to be on Waikiki. It is the rudeness of Jessica Heath and the general drab decour and cleanliness issues that warrant the not so great rating from me. If someone from upper management had seen or heard her shouting just five minutes ago, she'd be sure ro be standing in the unemployment line tomorow. PS. I do not know this woman personally and I do not have any enmity towards her. This is just my very objective opinion based on my observations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My business didn't conclude as planned prior to Christmas so I had to go looking for a room (or be another of the homeless in Waikiki) and found a room at the DoubleTree. It was adequate, but accessing it via car was a hassle due to the location at the traffic crossroads of Waikiki, and it's almost the farthest hotel from the beach. Luckily the weather is usually conducive to walking so a few extra minute walk is good for you. Be sure and check this out if you can't find your usual favorite.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was very clean, as were the common areas. Very tiny lobby, valet area. Hard to get off the street into valet area because it is so small. Sometimes had to sit on the street waiting for cars to get moved in order to access valet area. $30 per day for parking + valet tips...pretty expensive. Beds were VERY comfortable. Wireless didn't work & had to call technical support. Got it working eventually, $10 for 24 hours.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at DoubleTree after realizing we did not book our previous hotel through Feb. 15th. We found out our hotel went from $160 a night to $500. Of course, we had to find a new hotel, and it was Valentine's Day in the middle of Oahu's busy tourist season. I called at least 12 hotels before DoubleTree. Thankfully they had a vacancy. Not as inexpensive as our previous hotel, but not as much as many of the hotels I called. The Representative who made our reservation was very efficient, helpful, polite, and just generally "excellent" at his position! I wish I would have gotten his name. We felt important and well taken care of throughout our stay. All the Staff were extremely friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Our room was gorgeous with a nice view. The linens were awesome! Definitely buying these online! Our rooms were very clean and the Maid Service impeccable. The hotel is within walking distance to all kinds of restaurants & food, so no need for a car. The continental breakfast was very good & satisfying. The front desk will validate your parking slip & will take it off the bill if you remember to do it. We are relocating to Oahu and had a fantastic experience with DoubleTree.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When you see the other hotels near by and the facilities on offer down the road you will be kicking yourself, they offer so much but the doubletree offers so little. If you're on a dream vacation then this might not be the hotel for you, but if you're on business then this will hotel will do great. We had a lovely room - can't complain about it at all, it's about 10 minutes from the beach, which isn't too shabby and there are plenty of buses near by if you don't fancy walking. Breakfast can get a little hectic downstairs in the morning, its a very very small space for such a large hotel, at times people are falling over themselves, we had our table stolen by some later arrivals one morning when we went to the buffet to get food and when we returned the waitress made us stand outside until another table free'd up. I would stay here again, although if I was on vacation I'd go for a bigger hotel near the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Service is excellent. Walking distance to beach, Waikiki and Ala Moana Shopping Center. Did not eat at the hotel, since there are many local restaurants. We generally get the small suite which has room to spread out. Only 1 TV. Mini-frig in room. Valet only parking.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was in a perfect location for a conference we were attending. Once we got our sense of direction, it was a straight shot up to the Hawaii Convention Center from the hotel. Only about a 10 minute walk. It worked really well for our party of 4 adults, three of us attending a conference. There is a bus stop within a couple of blocks; several ABC stores close within two blocks or less, selling sundries and souvenirs. A drug store is across the street and a 7 11 within a couple of blocks and a grocery store about three blocks away. Also many choices of restaurants around within several blocks.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very good location for me. Valet was excellet. Front desk needs lots of training....told me that 'it is troo late...you should have asked for upgrade before you checked in'. I did asked for an upgrade initially biut the FD was appeared to be undertrained. House keeping was OK but was very helpful on the last day of the stay (I stayed six nights)
user_name:
Asif A
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Given some of the TripAdvisor reviews, I was not expecting much from this hotel. It's location was very good in terms of the public bus service and walkability to Waikiki beach. Poor WiFi access in the room and so everyone was hanging out in the lobby with their devices. Front desk staff were very busy but also very helpful. I appreciate that they knew the basics of which buses went to Pearl Harbor and where to catch the bus. Valets also very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First of let me start by saying I wouldn't have been able to stay without the fine help from the staff. I booked my room through Hilton reservations. Although I specifically asked for Waikiki, I was booked on a different island. Immediately after booking five rooms for our work staff we thought of an accommodation issue and learned of the mistake. The other Hilton transferred us to the Double Tree Alana where I would encounter the first of many exceptional people. I spoke to Elsa who right away saw the issue and set out to solve this issue. Despite having many things to check every so often she came back on the phone and told me she was still working on the reservation and apologized profusely for it taking so long. When all was said and done she had fixed our rooms and clarified the issues. Later the hotel General Manager called and wanted to make sure the problem was resolved. I was able to tell him yes in complete confidence. Finally when it came time for us to check in I got to meet Elsa who remembered the reservation and greeted me warmly and sincerely. It was at that time I learned of the issues that she had to overcome in securing our rooms. Unbeknownst to us the NFL pro-bowl was in town and she had kept an eye on our rooms so that there were no issues with our reservations. Our rooms were comfortable and accommodating. During the week that followed I saw Elsa and Rebecca many times and they always had a smile on their faces and no matter what they were doing they always greeted me by name and offered me a fresh warm Double Tree cookie. As a side note I want to thank Josie G. for taking the extra steps in keeping my room clean and her super pleasant demeanor to make sure she was not bothering me. The folks there at the Double Tree, every person at the desk and that I came across made sure to spread Aloha at every chance they had. My Thanks to Mr. Wilding for a excellent team.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my first ever stay at a Doubletree. The room and amenities were excellent. The location was easy to get to. The hotel is easy walking distance to restaurants/ shopping/ other stores. The 200 word minimum is a bit excessive
user_name:
Michael H P
Smyrna, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Standard double queen room in Honolulu that could be found anywhere stateside. Everyone at the counter was extremely helpful. Only negative was that $20 breakfast was a little unreasonable. Otherwise clean bed and room, decent stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I travel for work and when I go to Honolulu I stay at this hotel. It is within walking distance to Waikiki without paying the super high room prices. Most people who stay here are business travelers so unless there is a big tour bus it is normally fairly quite. The rooms are decent and the beds are plenty comfortable. Parking in all of Honolulu is horrid so if you have a rental car be prepared to pay for valet which I think is $30 a day. The breakfast is just ok. The continental breakfast is your basic fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, pastry, etc.. If you want eggs you will need to pay for the buffet breakfast. It is very tasty but for the limited options and the high price I wouldn't pay for it everyday. The bar/lounge opens at 5pm and the dinner food is some of the best food in the area. I recommend eating at least one night there, besides, the bar staff at night is fantastic. The combo of Earl, Wilfred and Natalia always make sure you are taken care of. Plus I regard Earl as one of the best bartenders on the island. The front desk and management staff have always been friendly and helpful with any of my needs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel staff was patient, knowledgeable and helpful with every inquiry. The management team was very caring, you could tell this carried over to the staff. The room was comfortable and very close to anything you wanted to do. I slept better on their bed/pillows than I have in 5-6 years. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to everyone I know that travels there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pretty Average. Rooms were reasonable and well appointed. Just love those cookies at check in. The location in general is downtown and there are lots of city noises - sirens people in the room above you. The complimentary breakfast was on the week side, but you could buy up for hot food. Parking is horrendous so having valet parking is nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We live in Oahu and sometimes need to stay in Waikiki for business. We stayed at this hotel the first time simply because it was affordable. We found it to be better than any other hotel and now we ONLY stay here. The customer service is genuinely great (as opposed to the sugar coated phony you might find in other hotels.) It is also clean and updated, We love it

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Another great hilton hotel. Staff was friendly and very helpful which was awesome seeing how it was our family vacation with all 6 of my kids. No noise from traffic/tourists. Rooms are very spacious. Bathroom was same size as bedroom! Livingroom area came equipped with pull out couch, mini fridge, sink. The only complaint I would have with any hotels I stay at in hawaii is the parking fee you have to pay everyday-25 to 30 bucks. My husband was able to find a parking garage a block away that was 10 $ a day. He would drop our kids and I off and go park. Other than that, family friendly, beautiful hotel. Oh! And the fresh baked cookies you receive everyday, another perk-double chocolate chip chunk!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Unusually for a Hilton I had a poor experience, it started when I arrived around 14:15hrs to be told my room wasn't available till 16:00hrs only to sit down in the lobby and watch non Hilton Honors members be given rooms. Then when I finally got a room I had to move as the toilet cistern was leaking.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Hotel delivers! This property which honors military with competitive rates brings great value to anyone looking for a updated hotel with great service and location! We were greeted warmly by all the staff, and this service continued throughout our stay! The suite we booked was well appointed, and the housekeeping staff kept it super clean! Breakfast was included in our Hilton Honors benefits thus giving us a great way to start the day, and save some $36.00 dollars a day. The property is located center to Waikiki Beach and Downtown giving you great options to walk any where with ease! We have stayed at many properties in Honolulu and this property delivered well above the others with a very competitive rate! I highly recommend this property to all to enjoy, and we will be back for sure to experience another great vacation!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel before and service seem to have improved since I last visited a year ago. I love the location and the ammenities offered. Valet park is my only dislike but realized it is easier than parking afar off and having to walk to my destination. I recommend this hotel to my friends every time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I cant believe how much I paid here and its quite a way from the beach. I went with my two sons on a breakfast package and found that even though one was not an adult we still got charged another $25 for breakfast. (That is between 12 and 17 they are allowed in the room, but dont get to eat free even if you are on a breakfast package). I thought this was a bit over the top. The room was smallish, and the beds were more double than queen sized. The entry to the hotel is very downmarket and the prices very upmarket. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hawaii gets very busy during XMAS and NY and I was really happy that we chose this hotel. The hotel is close to all the major attractions like Waikiki beach and shopping malls. There were many restaurants on walking distance as well. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The Hotel was clean and quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: we booked for xmas and new year, arrived earlier, than planned, but reception got a room straight away, and did upgrade, to suite,many thanks. nice cookies and water on arrival, nice touch. we had breakfast coupons for continental breakfast, but you could pay extra for upgrade to full breakfast, which we did most days, and well worth it. staff were great and helpful . we booked to be picked up from airport by vip transport, who were great, waiting for us in arrivals, all seven, took our bags to the van, and straight to hotel, great friendly service,best we have had for large group,def recommend them…we had dinner at night, again great food fairly priced, but not a lot of atmosphere, but still great.all in all a great value hotel, well worth a visit,saunders family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. Rooms were nice, cookies and water upon arrival. We spent all of our days on the beach. We walked through Hilton Hawaiian Village to get to the beach (about 1/2 from the Doubletree) and stayed at their beachfront area and lagoon. Restaurants nearby. Parking is $30 (valet only) and room rates are based on 2 persons (even when staying in a room with two double beds - the front desk told us they charged $40 per extra person, per night).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel staff very welcoming. Lower lobby was cramped and the elevators and hallways somewhat tight. Small dining area for breakfast buffet and food quality could have been a little better. Service wasn't fantastic, could have done with some more staff on restaurant floor. Having said that it was high season.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This review comes a few months late as I stayed in this property in early November 2013.While it would be easy for me to just forget about penning my reviews, I just didn't feel it would be fair as I had a very good stay at this hotel.The hotel is along Ala Moana and at the start of the main shopping area - Kalakaua Avenue.An easy 10-15mins stroll and you'll get to stores like VS, Sephora, Cheesecake Factory etc.Tony Romas is right across the street (less than 5 mins away) and there is a burger cafe right next to the hotel's front door. (Bear in mind the stretch of Kalakaua Ave is pretty long, so if the store you want happens to be located at the other end of Kalakaua, then it won't take just 10-15mins. But, you get the idea.)If you prefer not to walk to the main shopping street, there are several tourist trolleys/buses that ply the Ala Moana - Kalakaua route. But these are chargeable. If you walk towards the Hilton Hawaiian village (7-12mins stroll away, going the opposite direction, away from Kalakaua), I believe there is a free shuttle bus service from there that takes you to the DFS Galleria. And that's located smack in the centre of the shopping area - Kalakaua. (This free shuttle makes a loop, that's why you have to walk away from Kalakaua, even though that might be your destination.) Otherwise, most trolley buses charge a free of $2, one-way.The receptionists should have a clearer idea of which buses to take and from where, depending on where you want to go.There is no Concierge services here, so the Receptionists double up as your Concierges.Waikiki beach is again a simple 10-15 stroll away.The hotel itself is pretty modern and updated. Bell services is located on the ground level, facing a sort of military space (I think it's called Fort Derussy.)The main reception is located on level 2. At check-in, I was pleasantly surprised to find the Director of Front Office himself doing the check-ins, along with his subordinates. I used to work in the hotel industry and to have someone from top management doing the actual work alongside the rank and file isn't something that happens often.3 of us stayed in a junior suite and found the room to be of a comfortable size. There was enough space for us to put 2 big suitcases and 3 cabin bags.Bathroom was again, of a nice size.No problems with noise even though our room faced the main street.As far as I know, wifi is chargeable but there is a business centre next to Reception, for use should you need to log onto the internet for a quick booking or checking-in for flights.Staff were all very friendly and in particular, Al from Bell Desk deserves to be mentioned. He was very knowledgeable regarding what buses to take and from where, and even advised me not to go to a particular museum as I might not have enough time to enjoy the museum properly. He then proceeded to suggest what to do with the remainder of my 5 hours of free time.I didn't use the gym or the pool facilities as we were out at the museums or hitting the shops most days. Overall, a really good stay here. Will MOST definitely be back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is way overpriced. The location is ok, but there is little to commend the place. Long walk to the beach and hotel facilities are tired. Staff was friendly though. Charged a lot for internet access so I went to starbucks. My wife almost made us move to another hotel, but the room charge was too high to sacrifice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights over New Years Eve. The hotel is not on the beach but it's within walking distance and close to the main shopping & dining areas. The room was a good size and the bed comfortable. The bathroom needed a bit more lighting but was large enough. We also had a balcony but weren't in the room long enough to use it. My only issue was the service at breakfast. There were often large lines of people waiting for a seat and the staff weren't very attentive. I also think extra tables could be fit into the room at the far end to accommodate more diners. If you are hungry, it's worth paying the extra $7 for the full breakfast where the chef cooks you omelettes how you like them. The valet staff were great and our car was always brought around straight away. I would be happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree was okay for a stopover on our way to Australia. The hotel is not in the middle of Waikiki insanity, so it was much quieter than hotels right on the beach. And much less expensive. I ALWAYS ask for a room on a high floor, away from the elevator. I was given a nice room, and it was virtually noise-free.The service was very good, and the choc. chip cookies are wonderful! There are several cafes and restaurants in the area, and we found a 24-hour cafe a few blocks away. Their breakfast was excellent.We enjoyed our stay here, and will return when we visit Honolulu again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The first room was actually dirty with some trash from the previous people before us. We then got upgraded to a room with a ocean view and higher up in the hotel. This hotel ended up being very nice with an excellent staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband & I, plus our 2 adult children, were in Honolulu for just one night. Wanted a hotel close to the Waikiki beach that wasn't so pricey. Booked 2 rooms with 2 beds each. They upgraded one of the rooms to a King bed suite b/c room with 2 beds weren't available. Very nice staff and great stay. The cookies were delicious!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed 8 nights on the 18th floor. Room was nice, decor looked like the picture. Beds comfortable. Nice little balcony with mountain view. Used the fitness centre a few times, which was good. The pool is nice too. Good location to walk to ala moana shopping mall, just across the street from Hilton village and access to beach. Also easy to get in and out of with the car compared to other hotels on kapiolani blvd. Only negative, expensive parking @ $30 a night plus tips for valet only parking. It would be better if free wi fi through out hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I thought the hotel was really modern and cute. The beds were super comfy. Lay out of room was great. We got a suite to save money my hubby and son and I were sharing a room. The room had a separate sitting room with a pull out couch its own flat screen T.V. separate air conditioner plus sliding doors that made the room totally private. My son loved it. We had 3 balconies. Partial ocean view meant seeing the ocean during the day and the spectacular lights of Waikiki at night which we would have totally missed if we had a full ocean view. Hotel staff was great. Accidentally left my car keys in safe after we checked out. DUH! The security staff mailed them out to me right away. The only bummer was they ran out of blankets for the pull out bed. We had plenty of sheets just no blanket.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has been perfect for our needs in Honolulu. We're stopping over for 2 nights on our way to Australia. The purpose of this stay has been to simply relax and we've been able to do that with ease. I took the advice of other reviewers and asked for a room on a high floor, away from the elevator, and with an ocean view if possible. Mission accomplished! The staff who greeted us were friendly and helpful. Who wouldn't love the Doubletree tradition of giving each guest a warm chocolate chip cookie? The room was modern, clean, most importantly, comfortable. Continental breakfast is included with the room which is all we need. There is an up-charge for a cooked -to-order breakfast, however. The location of the hotel is good -- an easy walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Considering what other hotels in the area charge, this is a good bargain. It's also a good place for families. If you want a high end, luxury resort, this is probably not the place for you. It's been a great fit for us though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: the only problems we had in our 7 day stay , was ( 1 ) with the pillows , they were to small and very didn't offer any support even with 3 pillows , ( 2 ) I had to call the front desk often to request more towels even tho I had requested a certain of towels daily , I finally gave up calling the front desk and just took them off the housekeeping cart 3 different days , they didn't finally get the right amount of towels that I had requested 2 days of our 7 day straight

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: rooms need to be upgraded...front desk was very helpful...being Hilton Honors got us on a high floor and away from most of the traffic noise....they must offer special group rates because we saw several different college teams staying at the hotel...the location is okay; not being on the beach and not having any reciprocal relationship with any of the other HIlton hotels meant that we did not spend any time at the beach...(a shame)...the $30 fee for parking discouraged me from keeping a car for a second day

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor and seeing pictures. Some trick photography because while the rooms looked similar they must have been made up just for the photo shoot! We were on the 7th floor. Corridor hadn't been vacuumed in days, was filthy. Room was dark and dingy with gouges in the door frame by the balcony. Bathroom was no bigger than a single closet with absolutely no bench space. Lobby area looked nice but was tiny, couldn't sit and have a chat, really only suitable for somewhere to sit while lining up for reception. On the upside staff are very friendly and did their best to assist on the front desk. Hilton honors gold got me breakfast and wifi here but they charged my 8 year old son the extra. Extremely disappointed as all other Hilton's let kids eat free. This was the deal breaker. Checked out the next day and went back to the hotel I stayed in previously. Would rate it a 3 star hotel with a backpacker vibe.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at 3 different hotels during this trip and this hotel had the best room of the 3. I booked a double Jr suite and it was just the right size for my family of 4. The room is updated in typical Hilton style so it looks like every other Hilton room that I stay in throughout the year. Not much in the way of views here and kind of loud being next to a busy street but just a short walk away from Waikiki Beach. The prices were also much more reasonable once you walk outside the bounds of the Hilton Hawaiian village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is very clean. The location is great, just across street from the Waikiki beach. Their front desk staff are all very friendly and helpful. Our only complaint is the $30 daily parking fee is way too high.
user_name:
Amy C
San Ramon, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I found the hotel staff extremely helpful and friendly. I enjoy the convenience of this hotel in relation to where it is at the edge of Waikiki. It's easy to get onto Ala Moana Blvd and head out of the area either to walk, drive or run.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff throughout our stay! Melissa at the front desk was awesome and truly went above and beyond to make our stay the best! She is a true asset to your hotel and deserves to be recognized. Thank you for a memorable stay and I hope to return again to this hotel!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When I made my reservation, I specifically said I needed a one-bedroom suite because I had a baby. They\ woman I spoke to assured me that I would have a one-bedroom. When I checked-in, I asked if I had a one-bedroom suite. They confirmed that I did. When I went up to the room, I found that it was a standard hotel room and that did not have an additional bedroom. I had to go back to the lobby and get a one-bedroom suite and had to pay an additional $20/night. Additionally, the drain in the tub was not working. I contacted maintenance and was unable to use the tub to bathe my child for the first night of our stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were stay for 3 nights. It was really good location and great view. The room was clean and employees were very nice. This hotel just one block away from the beach. And very close to ABC Store and other store plus restaurant. We were happy to stay here overall.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary while our daughter's basketball team played in the Iolani Girls' Basketball Classic. The Doubletree was centrally located to everything we needed including the shops and restaurants on Kalakua, the beach across the street behind the Hilton, and the Ala Moana Shopping Mall. The hotel staff, especially Tianya, provided top notch service and assisted with all of our questions and needs. The rooms on the 17th floor were spacious, the view of the mountains was good, the bathrooms were particulary nice, and the housekeeping service was excellent. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would definitely choose this hotel if we have the opportunity to revisit Oahu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Not your regular double tree... Room mediocre at best. The hotel it self is on a super busy road and sirens are going every couple of hours.The staff are what made the stay nice. melissa at front desk was wonderful and Jon who works at breakfast time. Both of these staff are wonderful.the convenience of the hotel is pretty good just a short walk to the beach.We would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As always, the Double Tree check-in staff of the Waikiki location were very friendly and informative. Also, as always, the room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Although the location is great at the end of Waikiki, you can only make a right-hand turn into the hotel, but this is just the nature of the busy Ala Moana Boulevard. In any case, keep up the good work!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here just one night before we made a preplanned move to a condo for the rest of the week. The room was lovely but the stained sofa bed cover/mattress pad gave the place a yucky feel. We were also given a room by the elevator and could hear it through the wall. There was free WIFI just in the lobby but would have been $10 in the room. That seemed pretty cheap for a pricey hotel. It accommodated our family of six though without our having to rent two hotel rooms. The kids and my husband had fun in the morning down in the pool while I slept in and there were no complaints about that! Everyone loved the cookies too. We had to call for bedding for the sofa bed but they came quickly as they did in the AM when I called for extra cream for my coffee. Still can't figure out why hotels often have teeny, tiny, little, bitty trash cans. These were even smaller than normal. There was literally no place to dispose of our take out containers from dinner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Convenient location approx. 10-15 minutes walk from the beach, 15-20 minutes walk from the main shopping area and restaurants in Waikiki. Located on Ala Moana Boulevard which is also convenient if you have a car. Major downside was valet parking only ..and charge of $30 per night. Also charged half room rate to extend stay from 1 pm to 5 pm, but what can you do when your flight is at 9.30pm. Staff were friendly, room was adequate although only a shower, no bath . Food was expensive and not very appealing, bar had short opening hours. Overall a hotel which is better for business travelers, not for a couple on vacation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond Member, I was looking forward to using my points for a nice stay in O'ahu. This hotel was in a very convenient location to a number of typical tourist destinations. My girlfriend and I had a pleasant 3 night stay, but I do want to point out something that got under my nerves as a veteran traveler and frequent Hilton guest. They split up their 'free' breakfast menu so that a typical eggs, waffle, bacon, etc. breakfast that you would expect from any other DoubleTree is actually on their 'upgrade' menu. I know it's a minor detail in an otherwise acceptable stay, but it really got under my skin. Maybe it's because I was on vacation and trying to relax. Maybe it's because it puts you in an awkward position when you only brought a couple bucks for a tip and now have to go get more money from your room. Maybe it's because this is the first time I have ever seen this (I stay over 100 nights per year with Hilton alone). Whatever the reason, this practice really put a sour taste in my mouth and I don't think I'll be returning next time I'm in O'ahu

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Me and my husband first time to stay here. We arrive around 11:00 in the morning and hotel check-in time is 3:00 PM.. But since theres available room, they check us in early..checking in was fast with very friendly staff plus they gave us the double tree signature cookie..(yummy!!!) We stayed at 5th floor.. room was clean and we have lanai overlooking the pool.. but we had an issue with the shower glass door..reported it and maintenance team immediately come up to our room and fix it.. so i give them 5 star for it.. beside the hotel is a restaurant called cheeseburger waikiki serving breakfast for $5.99... theres also subway,abc grocery storeear bus stop etc.. just 8 minutes walk to waikiki beachwalk where you can find luxury shops like prada,lv,coach and a lot more...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Won this hotel on Hotwire, loved the staff and location even though traffic noise was quite loud even from 18th floor. Super nice staff, clean rooms, pool area, fitness room and lobbies. Easy walking to restaurants and the beach. Paid an extra $20 per night to upgrade room to upper floor and room was huge, two balconies with lovely partial ocean, Diamond Head, skyline and mountains. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Loved the front desk staff, the maids and the folks in the bar, especially Earl the Best Bartender in Waikiki! The staff here really get it, even the night front desk manager - I forget his name, but he remembered mine.The food at this hotel is not the reason to stay here. Stay for location, great staff and clean reasonably priced sleeping room with nice view from upper floors (above 7 or 8th)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had an excellent stay in this hotel. Staffs were all accommodating esp in the concierge special mention to Pedro who went out of his way to give excellent service to our group of 10 people. Thank you.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: great hotel; mediocre breakfast experience. diamond member status only covers continental breakfast. hot food was $9.99 extra. with a tip, you may as well went down the road to the IHOP for more food choices in a preferred non-buffet style.
user_name:
Aaron B
los angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service of the doubletree Hotel is very professional.And the bed is very comforble!I enjoy the hotel simple & concise.All the staffs are so kind and professional. If the hotel can offer the free WI-FI Service, it wiil be better. Thank all the Staffs! Tank you for all helps! Your Sincerely!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Double Tree Alana Waikiki twice (both stop overs from our trip from USA to Aus. & back. The staff Danny, Melissa, & Ewa was excellent. They all went out of their way to help give us special help when needed. Good Job for these employees for I certainly would recommend spending time at this hotel for the special service that was given. Thanks again to all three of the above mentioned people. Good job to all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel, stayed in a two room with a king bed. The room was nice, no complaints. The bathroom had a shower tub with an amazing shower head that adjusted with a slider that made it easy to give my 5 year old a shower! The staff were very nice even when there was a mix up with our rooms that they fixed right away when we checked in. The neighborhood, despite being a few blocks from the ocean didn't have a nice feel to it. It wasn't dangerous but just a little run down. I would definitely recommend this for business travel. For families, I would recommend staying closer to the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed for a week at this property while on business. The hotel was selected by the site I visited and I couldn’t have been more pleased with their choice. The property is contemporary, clean, and understated (dignified) “island”. From the valets to the front desk staff to the housekeeping folks, every single employee was gracious and smiling and genuinely, warmly friendly in the way you imagine they would be in paradise. And those warm cookies offered up by the front desk are, alone, worth the price of admission! Mmmmm!Parking is valet only and $30 a day. For a slightly naïve Midwesterner, this seems pricey, but is probably very reasonable for the location. The car was safe and sound at night and appeared very quickly in the morning when business was at hand and time was of the essence.The property is right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, endless shopping and dining venues, and the Waikiki beaches. Except for the pedestrian crossing light at the corner of Ala Moana Boulevard and Kalia Road, which may be the longest “Don’t Walk” in the history of pedestrian crossings, the beach is literally a five minute walk away.Trees Restaurant & Bar on the Lobby Level was welcoming and the food was very good. I recommend the lemon chicken soup with white beans and crumbled feta, the shrimp and cucumber cocktail with charred lemon and horseradish, and the ubiquitous Mai Tai, as solidly expressed by my new all-time favorite bartender, Earl. Among the warm, friendly, “real” people I met during my stay, Earl and waitresses Natalia and Kira were among my favorites and stood out even among the great staff at this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I forgot some credit cards and other items I typically store in my wallet, in the hotel safe. When I realized I had forgotten them in the safe, I was already at the airport waiting to board my flight. I called and talked the security officer and he promptly retrieved my items and placed them in the mail. Since it was on a Saturday, I received all of my forgotten items via priority mail on the Tuesday. I am so grateful to the professional staff and their attention to details.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was in Waikiki and close to Ala Moana, a very good location. Everyone that I interacted with on the staff, from the valets, the front desk, and housekeeping was very pleasant and helpful in every way. I look forward to visitine the Doubletree in Waikiki again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Double Tree Ala Moana is very clean with friendly staff. Nice gym but only 2 treadmills with a long weight. Gym needs a fan too. Guest rooms really need dehumidifiers too. Restaurant not vegan friendly. Street is one way with a bush devider so you cannot walk to hotel without going to the street corner. Street closed each night during my stay (not hotel's fault but very annoying). Parking on property is $30 per day! Even for hotel guests.
user_name:
Susan R
San Diego, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A well maintained and SUPER located hotel. Close to the beach, shopping, and restaurants--one can comfortably walk to any venue. Staff is professional and sincere in making one's stay enjoyable. From check-in to check-out the staff is thorough and accomodating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Super location, only a couple of blocks from beach and key down town shopping areas. Hotel very nice for couples-can't address it for families. We were on the 17th floor so could see the ocean and mountains and downtown Waikiki. Lovely location, was able to walk to beach each day we were there. Less expensive then other hotels, but rooms was lovely, large and had a refrigerator. I rated the bed as average, was able to sleep fine, but I'm used to nicer beds in Hilton hotes. This one just needed replacing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Always an excellent place to stay. The staff and helpful and filled with ALOHA!! Will stay there every time I can make a reservation. :>)) I had 2 meals in the restaurant due to exhaustion from working. The food was tasty and with excellent service. It was not gourmet. The bar tender Earl was exceptionally helpful!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was clean. Service was great - check-in and check-out was quick and efficient. Price was reasonable - we paid the government rate. Good location - it is located near Waikiki and Ala Moana Shopping Center. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My trip to the Double Tree was very nice. I was greeted by very friendly staff and they were helpful to find places to eat and get me needed information. My room was very clean including the bathroom. I really have no complaints other than I wish it was closer to the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location was very good. It was in walking distance to the shops, beach, and more. And, the staff were some of the best hotel staff we have seen. They were friendly and helpful. I don't often recommend a specific hotel to people, but I would recommend the Doubletree Alana because of the location and staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The site, the staff, location, safety all were amazing, it was comfortable, quiet, a place that I could return to after a long day of work and feel at home. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the island it was a pleasure from start to finish.
user_name:
Marguerite P
Elk Grove, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at the DoubleTree Waikiki for five nights when visiting Hawaii. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. The room rate is reasonable and the amenities are great. I used the gym each morning which has great equipment and was never overly busy. The pool area is lovely and both times I used this I had the area to myself!!! Gets good sun a lovely breezes. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of the beaches but close enough to walk to the beach and the centre of Waikiki. It is also only 10 minutes walk from Alo Moana Shopping Centre. I loved the small hotel feel and the genuine helpfulness and friendliness of the staff and am so pleased I chose to stay here vs. in one of the big impersonal resorts right on the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: With friendly and helpful staff, the Doubletree in downtown Honolulu is conveniently located near the many local attractions with easy access after a 10 min walk to Waikiki beach and many of the other beach front hotels. The rooms were clean and very comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everything about the Double Tree Alana was nice except that only valet parking is available and they charge $30 a day to park (plus valet tips). The service was truly outstanding. The Front Desk went above and beyond to make sure our stay was as pleasureable as possible. They offered input on what places were best visit and even called on our behalf to purchase tickets.
user_name:
Adrian A
Long Beach, California, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: very pleasant stay, great staff, food was excellent, the cookies they provide on arrival were very good and warm, hotel was very clean, Hotel is close to shopping, and Food establishments, though a good walk from the beach, still worth the money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Place was very disappointing. The rooms are just to small as well as the TINY fridge. Enjoy the cookies because that will be the highlight of your stay in this hotel. You also need to like city noise and traffic.
user_name:
David L
colorado springs, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is beautiful. Michelle at the front desk was GREAT; a real pleasure. Beds were soft and we were in the middle of everything. The bathroom was very swank and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently renovated hotel with modern decor. Not a bad walk to the beach. One time on the way back from the beach I cut through the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the street, and was really happy I stayed here instead. Too much hubbub over there! Breakfast was good, especially the baked goods. You won't find a cellophane-wrapped Danish here! No free wifi in the rooms is a drawback. Awesome black-out curtains allow you to sleep even though it's very bright outside (while you're recovering from jetlag, adjusting to time zones etc).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff were very nice but I think most people in Hawaii are very friendly. We were greeted with yummy cookies and smiles every morning. Our boys loved the experience and can't wait to come back. The room was clean and we had a nice view of the fireworks on New Year's Eve. We walked to the beach most days and loved that it's close to the Hilton Village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service was outstanding, the staff were so accommodating nothing was too much trouble. This contrasts with our experience in other hotels during our month long US holiday. For example when we arrived (10.30am) some rooms were ready and they were happy for us to check in immediately. When we were leaving they gave us a late checkout no problem and allowed us to use the business centre after we had checked out at no cost and to use the beach towels for an afternoon swim. The beds were comfy and the sheets and pillows were excellent quality. This is the first time in 40 years of using hotels that I've asked for the duty manager in order to compliment him on the quality of service we had received. The hotel is not beach front but is really well located close to beach shops and restuarants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for a couple of night and it was great. I arrrived at the hotel well before checkin time but they were nice enought to accommodate with an early checkin even though I hadn't requested it. They gave me some warm cookies upon arrival plus a couple bottles of water. The room was clean, air conditioning was on. Its in a great location, restaurants and even a laundry facility within walking distance. The pool location is nice, you can people watch from the deck as people walk by the hotel. My only complaint was the shower, you have to make sure you put the removable shower head securely back in its holder, if you don't and bump into it, it comes crashing down on your feet. It only takes one time to learn that and you'll be fine but thats my only complaint.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just returned from a weekend at the Hilton Alana Waikiki and was blown away by the great service we received at the property. We were there for just two days, but left feeling part of a new fun family.  The property itself is in a great location for walking anywhere in Waikiki, but right by the park so it feels less crowded than some. I enjoyed the modern décor and boutique feel. It was also VERY clean. Jacob and Terrance were two standout employees, but everyone was helpful and very friendly. I work in the travel industry and travel often for pleasure , and I was very impressed with the level of service we received.  I will be a repeat visitor to Alana there is no doubt.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room was very nice, very comfortable and I especially loved the shower. Staff was always very friendly, especially the valets. The beach, tons of restaurants & shopping are within easy walking distance. Easy drive to Hickam AFB. Only issue I had was my room was right on the street corner, so it could be noisy at night (to be fair though, I had just spent a week in Korea, so to say my sleep schedule was off is an understatement lol). Overall, a great way to spend a week in Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our first time at this property and their exuberant friendliness, outstanding service, and crisp, clean, modern accommodations exceeded all of our expectations. On a business/weekend getaway of 3 professional women who have an extensive background in the hospitality industry and travel frequently within the Starwood, Hilton, Marriott families for business and pleasure, I would recommend this property for anyone. Jacob, the Front desk manager, and, Terrance, the hotel security officer were both so helpful as well as all of the amazing staff at the property!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at The Doubletree Alana in Waikiki after moving out of hotel I initially booked for the weekend, which was a dump. I had heard of the Doubletree for years, but never thought to stay there. But we are so glad we gave it a try! It is a very modern hotel, with clean, stylish rooms and décor. The staff were all VERY accommodating - love the added touch of warm homemade cookies at check in! Proximity to restaurants and stores is great - and the beach is just across the street! We'll definitely stay there on a future staycation.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for two nights, prior to boarding a cruise ship. The place was clean and quiet; the staff pleasant and accommodating. The rate was great considering it is Honolulu and the center of the city. The hotel restaurant was also very good. We dined there, Tony Roma's across the street and IHOP down the block. Overall, a very pleasant experience!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a great hotel. The rooms are very nice and the restaurant is very good. It doesn't have the great views but it is off the main drag and is nice and quiet. I was there on business and it was perfect for me.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We are moving to Hawaii and have been waiting for our house to be completed for 8 weeks. We are in our 5th hotel. The DT was the 4th hotel we stayed in (26 nights). We had to hotel hop because we could not get all the nights in the same hotel. The Holiday Inn, Hale Koa and Hilton Hawaiian Village met all of our expectations in price, service and convenience. So does the Banyan Tree Condo's which is where we are for the next week.The sliding glass doors on two sides of our room were old and leaked. The wind howled, windows leaked and view was only good from one side. The cleaning staff took our blanket and swore up and down that they didnt. The manager could only apologize... thats it, nothing more but apologize. They consistently harrassed us to pay our bill every time it reached $2K... at 301 a night, that was often over 26 days!!! They stated that they could not charge my card without my consent, but when I stopped by two days after the 4th time it reached $2k they had charged my card, WITH ERRONEOUS CHARGES!!! The restaurant was the worst, had the smallest selection of food but charged more than any other we've been to in SIX WEEKS!!! The managers consistently apologized, the cleaning staff apologized and the desk clerks apologized... everyone in this dump apologized at every opportunity. APOLOGY NOT ACCEPTED. We checked out last FRI and today I see an extra nights charge on my credit card... They FORGOT TO CHARGE ME A NIGHT and tacked it on a day AFTER i got my final bill. I get reimbursed by receipts... and now I have to make a correction to one that has already been submitted. WORST VALUE FOR $$$$!!! I would use profanity to describe this hotel besides old, unprofessional, no locking doors in the suite AT ALL, ice machine on every other floor (not ours) and there must be an emergency room in the basement. We were woken up by ambulances/firetrucks on average twice a night, EVERY NIGHT! The old sliding glass doors do not keep the street sound out and we were on the 17th floor. We had NONE of these problems in the other hotels and they were all within the same area, save the Holiday Inn. The HI was on the same street without the sound. PROs: The kids liked the small pool and the cookies that they offered at every complaint were very good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Hotel is were we stayed at before our Cruise around all the Islands. The staff was extremely nice and the rooms were recently updated. Yes, they really do hand you a gift bag with some goodies. The chocolate chip cookies are warm when they give them to you, NICE!!! Clean rooms and the Air worked great. Conveniently located in Waikiki with great restaurants and plenty of shopping. Beach is about a 5-7 minute walk. Parking will cost you $35.00 per day. I guess that's the going rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There aren't enough superlatives to describe how well the Doubletree staff treated my wife and me. From front desk to housekeeping and restaurant to the bell desk, the staff was great! The trip was a combination trip: I was there on business and my wafe was there to vacation! ;)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location of Hotel good - Easy assess to leave and enter by car. Not a far walk to the Hlilton Village and Beach. Took less than 15 min. There is a lot of traffic noise but that is the same for any Hotel in Waikiki. Can't beat the price for the amenities. Should be a Hilton HHonors member - you'll get the WiFi for free. The valet parking was expensive but my company paid for it. All the staff were great.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed for two nights for a business trip. It is in walking distance to a shopping mall as well as to the beach. However, it is not a beachfront property. The check in was slow. The rooms are typical of what one finds in a Double tree. A little worn and tired compared to many other Doubletree hotels that I have visited in the past. The service distinctly lacked a personal touch. As a HH Gold member, they gave me a coupon for a drink and continental breakfast was included. The breakfast had plenty of fresh fruits (as expected in Hawaii). Overall it was good. I would have given them very good rating, but it is the service after the stay that was lacking. I forgot my shaver power cord in the room, attached to the outlet in the bathroom. When I called, they were not helpful or courteous. This was in sharp contract to . service standards of Hilton Mumbai. (They contacted me after they found my t-shirt in the room. They offered to ship it to me, which I declined as the cost of shipping would have been more than the value of the t-shirt.)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great accommodations for the price. Location is great! Walking in either direction easy. We appreciated the room's modern decor. Room was comfortable and clean. Restaurant was okay--we ordered a pizza and it tasted like a DeGiorno's that you can warm at home. Definitely not made to order and pricey for the quality. But our waitperson/cook provided great service. Registration folks were very helpful and personable as well. I would suggest, however, that a small microwave be available in the rooms. We had leftovers and would have liked to heat our food. We discovered the microwave in the media room too late. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will definitely consider this Double Tree again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We got this hotel through hotwire and we were so pleased with it. We stayed for only one night but when we checked in they gave us free cookies that were delicious! The room was on the top floor so the view was great. We recommend that. The hotel room and bath were updated and nicely done with a fine bed and lots of pillows. We were very comfortable here and enjoyed our stay. We had breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel the next morning and it was one of the best brunches we had on our trip. The omelets made fresh and to order were wonderful!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room and location are excellent, and the service from all staff is WELL aboave board. The only complaint (and this is minor) is that the bathroom is quite cramped. Other than that, the beds are great, and the lobby and pool areas were never ever dirty or cluttered. Location is great as there are more places to eat within walking distance than we could actually eat at.
user_name:
Joseph L L
Coupeville, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A few blocks from the beach, but it's close to the convention center. Lots of amenities, including the beach, within walking distance. The hotel food better than average. A straight shot to the airport.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice rooms, but no internet or wifi in the rooms unless you want to pay $10.00 per day. The valet wasn't as slow as they stated on yelp, but it's costly... The wifi is free in the lobby area, but very slow! But they do have a decent business center. My friends live on the island and came to show 2 of my other friends around during the trip. Well when I got the final bill, they charged me an extra for my friend. The manager cleared things up, but it put a damper on the last day of my trip!!! The breakfast was decent. I enjoyed my time in Hawaii, but not my stay here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Alana Hotel welcomed me with an aloha greeting and a warm cookie. My bags were delivered promptly to my room and the valet service was fast and personable, with each valet remembering my name. How's that for service?
user_name:
Jan L
San Anselmo, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: No microwave in room, no free breakfast without status and even then you don't get much depending on your status unless you pay (no eggs or meat). No wireless internet. The elevator from the 17th floor moved really fast which was nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was happy as;-There is iHop, famous pancake restaurant, near hotel in walking distance.-Room upgrade to suite.-Could see nice sunrise at beach with 5 minutes walk.I must stay again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were pleasantly surprised with our room at Double Tree by Hilton Alana Waikiki Hotel. Everything in it was modern like the lamps, the chairs, the bathroom, etc. The bathroom was small though but functional. There's a small lanai and the view from the 8th floor is spectacular especially at night. The reception staff were very nice ditto the bell-desk staff. We'll certainly stay at Double Tree by Hilton Alana Waikiki Hotel when in Oahu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good place to stay. I frequently travel on business and the Double Tree Alana offers reasonably priced accommodations. The only drawback is the valet parking requirement which is probably an issue caused by how the hotel was originally built.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Initially, we chose to stay at the Doubletree during our destination wedding weekend because my husband is a HUGE fan of their cookies - in addition to the proximity to our venue however upon arrival and the duration of our stay proved without a doubt this was the right choice for my family and myself. We arrived a couple hours early and they allowed us to check-in as a room was ready - however the suite that was assigned was not with the views we paid for. Upon alerting the front desk - they immediately changed our room with a beautiful view. A bonus was that it was near the elevators - a great convenience to my 89 year old grandmother. The beds were super comfortable and the bathrooms were clean. I wanted to also review the PH suite I stayed in the night prior to the wedding. I needed a large enough space for all my bridesmaids to get ready in as well as the hair stylist, photographer and videographer, make-up artist, parents etc. Understandable that real estate in Hawaii is expensive therefore the suite wasn't exceptionally large when comparing it to suite in other locations however it turned out to be perfect for what we needed. Not to mention the VIEW! We received one of the two suites with the balcony and boy, the view was amazing. We ended up taking all of our initial wedding pictures there with that beautiful backdrop of the ocean/sky! There was enough space for everyone walk through and hangout comfortably. Everyone was so great in coordinating our stay - Echo Gu, Director of Catering/Event Services, was so patient & helpful in assisting with setting up our room block. Leimomi Kamiya-Nada, Event Services Manager, was beyond awesome & accommodating in helping sort out any issues during our stay (including booking another room last minute) and helped to ease my stress as a destination bridezilla. I would definitely stay here again - in addition to it's prime location to Ala Moana mall, the shops on Kalakaua and my fave coffee shop, Wailana - it's the overall experience from the valet service to housekeeping and everything in between that really helps me to relax and enjoy my time there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment we arrived the staff were full of Aloha and hospitality. The location was central and the property is beautiful, especially the herb garden surrounding the pool area with brand new stylish furniture. The food was amazing!!! Wednesday night's Pasta Night with all-you-can eat freshly made to order by Brandon, delicious rolls and healthy salad bar! And while you're at their Trees restaurant please consider having their bartender Earl make you one of his original Mai Tai! Delicious! But nothing beats the welcome warm DoubleTree cookie!!! Everyone is so friendly! Even the GM Michael stopped by our dinner table to say "Hi!" Aloha Lives!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Even the location doesn't seem to be the most spacious hotel I've been to, the DoubleTree maximizes what they do have and make it an enjoyable experience. Valet parking, beautiful decor and up-to-date rooms made my experience terrific. The walls seem a little thin, but the service of the staff is warm and friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A Hawaii and Waikiki resident for the past ten years, I've watched this hotel quietly go through various changes, Recently I had a chance to experience the great service and quality dining personally. The staff was friendly and helpful, the bathrooms were clean, and the restaurant had a nice ambiance. The fresh herbs from the poolside garden really enhanced my pasta dinner, and it was great to watch it made in front of me to my specifications. Despite our having a large party of around 20 people, the waitstaff was very attentive to our needs. I look forward to returning and seeing how the restaurant menu evolves. I will definitely consider this hotel as a venue for any future events, and I will definitely recommend this hotel when I make suggestions to visitors. It's worth it for those famous cookies alone... :-)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a very nice stay. The employees here are 5 stars. Everyone was outstanding. Especially Earl at the Tree Restaurant. Do not miss him. The Hotel is in a good locations. Walking distance to the beach. Very clean Hotel. Good price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: To start off, the food was excellent thanks to Brandon Mezurashi, the executive chef. Pasta night was loads of fun too. The manager, Jessica Heath, runs a great hotel with an amazing staff, all friendly and so helpful. Ask them about tours, good shopping, etc. and they have the answers. Jennifer is very hands on with her guests, making you feel extra special.A big shout out to Earl at the bar, amazing cocktails and conversation, Danny at the front desk, really nice person, Jacob, front desk manager, also extremely friendly and informative, and finally, Lemomi, hope I spelled it correctly, she's a doll, events coordinator, great meeting her.I will definitely come back to this hotel the next time I'm in Hawaii. Thanks again to the staff for making my stay so wonderful.
user_name:
Matthew R
Los Angeles, California, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were looking for a hotel close to Ala Moana Shopping Ctr for our last day on the Islands to shop for gifts to bring back home. Being a former resident of Hawaii we are very familiar with this location and picked it because it is not in the heart of Waikiki and away from the crowds and noise, and we knew it was nice! We also needed to be at the airport early in the morning and did not want to get stuck in traffic with a long way to go through Waikiki which can be very bad. The room was clean, well stocked with coffee, refrigerator, and everything else to be comfortable, and we were given extra warm cookies to bring back home too. Would definately stay again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are looking for good value in Waikiki you can"t go wrong here. My wife and I stayed here at the end of our cruise and were really surprised at the comfort, convenience and hospitality we experienced here. The location is the only factor separating this hotel from the pricier options on the beach. For us, this was not an issue. The hotel was conveniently located in the downtown area close to great restaurants, stores and only a short walk to the Beach. If you want a great hotel at a better price point, you won't go wrong here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our last stop on our 2 month mammoth Honeymoon trip around the States and we wanted to treat ourselves by staying at a nice hotel. We are glad we chose this hotel, everything was excellent. Very comfortable bed, friendly staff and we got a warm cookie on arrival which was nice after a long flight from New York.The only downside to this hotel is that you have to pay for wifi in the rooms, its free in the lobby but didnt really fancy sitting in the lobby all night to use the internet so we ended up tethering our phones.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent property. Close to beach, but not so near that its crowded. Same for shopping. Great staff. Pool in shade majority of day, north side of building. Some lounge chairs are in sun - perfect combination.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There was a security/safety issue during our stay there. Asked to switch rooms because of this and was put on the lower floors. (Hilton honor members stay on the higher floors). Lower floor was dirty and grungy. The room itself was dark and gloomy. (did not look like the picture on the website). plus it was on the street level so did not want to open up the curtains. Door would not completely shut, had to tug on it to lock into place. side light by the bed did not work. Shower stall leaked water and there was a flood in the bathroom when you were done. Waitresses at breakfast weren't helpful and only after we were done eating did they ask if we needed ketchup, more coffee, etc. Elevator and vallet service stops after a certain time at night, so you could be left stranded on the lower level for a while until you find security to send the elevator down so you can go to your room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was nice and clean, the staff from bell desk to the front desk and everyone in between were friendly and efficient. Warm cookies...yummy! The valet staff were especially nice and helpful. Special mahalo to Jeff for the hospitality. ..true embodiment of aloha spirit! Would recommend to family and friends, kamaaina and from out of state.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Valet is $30, they did not bring up all of our luggage, the bell hop stood around and waited for his tip. We paid over $300 for 1 room. There were 4 adults and one child...2 FULL size beds, no breakfast, had to pay for internet service. The pool was out of service, there was NO view. It was an awful experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Double Tree Alana is a very pleasent place to stay with avery pleasent staff through out the facility. The rates are reasonabale and accomodations good. They start you off with a warm cookie at check in and this sets the stage for a stay with a great bed, great blanket and great pillows.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hilton in Honolulu believes if you have a warm cookie you will be a happy customer. Don't get me wrong, the cookies are great -- they are warm with nuts and chocolates but they don't make up for a lousy hotel and bad customer service. They set the room AC so it can't be lowered below 68 --- you want it lower? Well it takes an Engineer who is never on duty - but have a cookie. You want a cab? Sorry they only do business with one cab company and too bad the 5 minutes turns into 50 -- have a cookie. You're trying to sleep and the idiot next door had come in at 3 am with 10 of his best friends and they are throwing beer bottles off their balcony and puking in the hallway -- so sorry Security is unavailable but they can send up a plate of cookies. Are they serious -- yes they are. Collect the cookies, set up a pop-up on the beach and try to re-coup something against the bad experience you've paid for. Don't even think of accessing the restaurant unless you need experience in being ignored and need to collect more cookies.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After my young daughter had heart surgery, our insurance company arranged for us to stay at a (different) local hotel. It was a nightmare. We ended up paying out of pocket to change hotels and decided on the DoubleTree, without any regrets. In fact, we wished we could have stayed longer. The room was clean, comfortable, and inviting. But what stood out the most was the service. Everybody we dealt with was over-the-top pleasant and helpful. They made an extremely stressful situation almost stress-free. Given the choice, I will always stay here while on O'ahu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at the DoubleTree Alana Waikiki for a friend's wedding and found the hotel to be a very good value. It was my first time visiting Honolulu so I admittedly don't have much basis for comparison, but I was pleased with the condition of the property, the amenities offered, and most of all the friendliness of the staff. From the front desk, to the restaurant's breakfast attendants, to the parking valets, everyone was very pleasant and helpful.The location is perhaps not ideal, as it's at the edge of the Waikiki area so everything is a bit of a walk to get to. Also, getting to the hotel from the west requires turning left at the street before the hotel, driving around behind it, and making a few right turns - a bit confusing and convoluted, but something you get used to after the first couple of times. Despite this, I would definitely consider staying here again should I have the opportunity to make a return visit to Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our hula Halau recently stayed at the doubletree Alana Waikiki and were so pleased with the service we received from the front desk, bell desk, valet, and manager Clinton Yamashita who provided the outmost professional and superb customer service. All of our needs were met with efficiency and aloha spirit. The valet employees were all so friendly and personable, we felt right at home. Housekeeping staff were also very helpful and provided service with a smile and were at our door with whatever we called for no matter what time of day! We couldn't have asked for a better staff, and beautiful rooms that accompanied us. This hotel truly showed the meaning of aloha in this beautiful place we call Hawaii our home, and that's what it should be about! MAHALO Doubletree!!! Aloha, Halau Helele'i Pua O Waipio from the Big Island of Hawaii

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I think it is time for some major updating at this location. This hotel is very dated. The pool decking is slippery and dangerous. The workout room is nice. One thing I like is the large shelf in the bathroom but that is about. The valets are very friendly. Breakfast too pricey for what you get. Although a convenient location not my favorite place here. We can to call housekeeping to fix various things including an outdated toilet that keeps running.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Doubletree Waikiki is located in the beginning of the strip. I can compare it to staying at the Stratosphere hotel in Las Vegas, not a bad location but you can definitely get a better hotel and location. The hotel is not located on the beach, and the pool is very small. The pool's location offered little sun because of the tall buildings in the surrounding area. I would recommend staying on Kalakaua Ave. That is the main strip that offers shopping, dinner options, and a lot of different hotels with similar prices. The hotel gym is small, but I have seen worse. The hotel offers a continental breakfast for $16 that includes cereal, fruit, muffins, toast, and coffee. If you want any hot items, eggs, pancakes, etc add an additonal nine dollars. Cheeseburger in Paradise is right next to the hotel and offers a $6.00 breakfast. They also have great happy hour specials. The hotel lobby is nice and modern and has free wifi. If you want wifi in your room, you have to pay $10. The service is in and out and not worth it. I was not impressed with the room at all. The view from my room was a partial ocean view, unfortunately the building and parking lot made me keep my blinds closed. The bathrom is very small and only has a shower.A positive with this hotel is that the staff did have the "aloha spirit." They were helpful and friendly.Dining Recommendations - Make sure you check out Dukes. Great atmosphere and right on the beach. Make life a little easier and call for a reservation. Hula Grill is located right above Dukes. The menu is small but the food is good, especially the Banana Mac pancakes.
