Hula Dog is located on Kuhio St. The lemonade is great and the bread for the hotdog bun is delish. Spam musbi's are cheap at 711 ( I know that sounds weird but that's where the locals get them). Finally don't forgot to try a local favorite "Loco Moco." Aloha

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a Hilton Honors member, I appreciate the Hilton family of hotels. When I booked the DoubleTree Alana for two days before our cruise, I had little exposure to the Doubletree brand in the family. I had regularly used Hampton Inn and Hilton's. I can't say I was disappointed as the service was extremely friendly, while the rooms were more than adequate and clean. We normally get breakfasts at the Hilton hotels, but in this case, there were plentiful breakfast places in the area, as it wasn't an option at the hotel. The site did have a cocktail manager's reception, but we missed it. Still a nice touch. I have to commend the bar in the lobby. I bought a couple of large Kona's (brewed in the Islands) at one of the many ABC Stores in the area, but didn't have an opener (didn't want to pack one due to security's sake - airlines). The bartender on duty graciously opened my two separate bottles that I brought down to the bar from our room; I greatly appreciate that - nice service! The location was quite central and we had a great time. We did get the famous Chocolate Chip Cookies, but we never got a chance to indulge and we couldn't take them on the ship. In any case, a terrific way to start our vacation. Thank you DoubleTree Alana!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Doubletree Waikiki is located 15 minutes walk from the beach. The neighborhood is not the most beautiful view because of the large number of high-rise buildings, however, it is possible for small amounts extra partial ocean view. I took advantage of that and have no regrets rather, I would not recommend paying all stay extra for the view from the window, instead of sitting there will be more pleasant to go and see ocean yourself.Standard room size is not especially distinctive in size or equipment. Very comfortable beds and pillows and a large selection of delicious hot biscuits handed out during checkinu a very positive memories.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is the second time we have stayed at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki and will continue to stay there on our visits to Waikiki. Hotel is clean, friendly staff, and location is good for both spending time in Waikiki and getting to other parts of the island. Wife and daughter would stay just for the cookies. Only issue is daily parking fee is expensive which is part of hotel life in most of Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The service is terrible. There are so many great hotels with much better view and service and better deals. My kids and I came here with the hope of a great vacation from Seattle. We got room 1708 thinking its high and in the HH section. The room smelled terrible and very load. When I requested a change of room after the third date my request was ignored and forgotten. I basically did not sleep on this trip. I was told to state when I got bottle waters etc. I did every time but at the end I was threated with complete disrespect indicating it was my fault for not stating it. I had requested more shampoo and condition my request was completely forgotten every day. the pool is dirty and filled with bugs. The drive way has oil spill all over, the elevator, the hallway, the lobby is all dirty. I brought a Manager named Jessica to my room to show her all the issues, she did not seem to care at all and left me completely feeling disrespected as a customer. Couple of our items were taken and we never were able to find them. This hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. I travel a lot and I would never recommend this hotel. ITS the worst hotel and Hilton needs to remove their honorable name from this very hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: After a long arduous flight, my stay at the Double Tree Alana was comforting and effortless. I travel extensively for a living, and this was by far one of the best hotels in Waikiki that I've stayed in. And that includes some very posh, 5 star hotels. The value at this hotel and the location is excellent. I will probably make this hotel my first choice fro now on when staying in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a work trip and it was just lovely. A really nice experience. It was my first time in Hawaii and the staff were very helpful with giving local advice. They also sell cookies and give you one on arrival so no arguments there!The hotel itself has a great location. It doesn't overlook the beach but its very close to the centre of Waikiki and all the restaurants and bars. It is a slightly longer walk to the Ala Moana centre, and also just near the Hilton if you want shops, beach and Starbucks.We had the full American breakfast everyday and it was amazing, its is really worth getting this included if you can. There is also a nice bar in the hotel that we visited a couple of times.Rooms are great and overlook the mountains. I'd definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a very nice stay. Comfortable beds, clean rooms and quiet. Used the gym and found it satisfactory. Open 24 hrs which is a big plus. Nice pool and very tasty cookies. Our only complaint was the cost of the breakfast. Wouldn't mind paying if it was quality and quantity. Would surely return.
user_name:
Tom W
Santa Ana, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at the Double Tree countless times before and have always enjoyed staying there, I have even put 2 of my sisters up at the DT for their weddings however this time was not the same. I can only think that if I had taken the time in my many years of work travel to create a Hilton Honors reward acct this wouldn't have happened with the staff able to see how often I stay at a Hilton owned hotel but no way to tell. I found myself in Hawaii for work last week and had previously planned to stay on one of the military bases but when I went to check in I was told there was a mistake with my reservation and I was "bumped". I was on military travel and the Army sets our allotted Per Diem rate at a specific dollar amount so if I choose to stay "off-base" I'm on the hook for the difference. I brought my son and mother along so figured it well worth the extra cost to stay near the beach versus on base so I looked up the Double Tree and was pleasantly surprised that they had plenty of rooms available (Sunday-Thursday). The hotel itself was beautiful however my 2 bed suite was located literally next door to the elevator. The Honolulu Double Tree is quite large and the elevator ran non-stop, not 5 minutes went by the entire 5 days I was there without the sound of the elevator cables, bells etc! I asked to me moved to another room but was told that was the only room "My government discount would allow for". Now I have deployed numerous times so can deal with less than favorable conditions but I was paying darn near the exact same rate as anyone off the street so quite thrown when that was their response. The DT's fix was to give me a single day voucher for the continental breakfast with the stipulation that I could only eat the fruit/cereal bar and not "aloud" to partake in the meat/omelet portion of the buffet! With the amount of times I have stayed with a Hilton owned hotel this was very disheartening to say the least. I can guarantee the Hilton group I will not only reconsider staying with any of their hotels during my future work travels (minimum of 10-20 trips a year) but inform any and all soldiers (200+) that work for/with me of my experience and Hilton's opinions of what type of room my "Military Discount" makes me deserving of.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our visit started with a friendly greeting at the taxi by the bell hop. The friendly and helpful front desk staff was able to check us in very early, well before the posted check-in time. This was very important to us as we had arrived on an early flight from Los Angeles and had two young children with us. Aside from getting our bags to our room and then from the room back to the taxi pick-up, we required little else. The concierge even arranged for a van from the taxi company for the flight out the next morning (we were moving overseas and had two bags each plus carry-ons and personal items). Could not have asked for friendlier staff to help us with the check-in/checkout process. Mahalo!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: WIll never recommend this establishment. The decor is what one expects from a modern Hilton chain hotel, but that is where it ended for me. Two things I would consider a must in a a modern hotel of this stature are free WIFI and a Continental Breakfast. (I would get as much from the super 8, I should expect no less from a Hilton chain). Nope the WIFI was an extra $10 and then it would not work, weak and sporadic signal. And the continental breakfast is insulting, $16 for yogurt and cold cereal and another $9 for a pot of coffee. Biggest rip off in Hawaii. AC was loud, and I had to leave it off to sleep in the heat. Couldn't leave a window open because of the street noise. The bathrooms are small and no counter space whatsoever in the room I had. And the hotel staff smiled and payed lip service, but not helpful at all (exception was the bellhop). And the hotel is not very conveniently located to anything of interest in Waikiki. There are far better options and less expensive elsewhere.Just in case I have not been clear enough: DON'T GO HERE.
user_name:
Gary D
Cold Lake, Alberta, Canada

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was up to par however, being a Hilton Honors Member we did not get any perks! Prepare yourself because it's expensive! There was no warning with regards to breakfast (2 separate breakfast stations) no sign indicating charges. No free continental in fact, the American buffet (omelets, meats, & potatoes) cost more! When all was said and done, the breakfast was $69 for 1 adult and 2 children! My children only had eggs! On another note, do not I repeat do not let them give you a room next to the elevators/housekeeping closet! That's right, we got a room next to both and we could hear the elevator all night cleaning crew AM! When ask to switch rooms, they said the hotel was booked and we could not be moved!
user_name:
Cindy N
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is short walking distance to shopping and the beach. The staff is great about recommending places to go on the island as well as best transportation options. Valet group does a fantastic job...waited a couple of minutes for the car each morning. For hilton honor members, having complementary daily breakfast is top notch. Definitely will be the first choice on the next trip back to HI.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Go to the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the street. The Double Tree has no laundry, could not set my AC for any temp above 66, failed to give me spare toilet paper 2 days in a row and had no decaf coffee for 4 days.
user_location: San Juan Capistrano, CA, United States
user_name:
Cynthia J
San Juan Capistrano, CA, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Hotel was very nice. Rooms were kept clean, rooms were quite and security excellent. Good value for the money. Location is within easy walking distance to Waikiki Beach, via the Hilton Village Complex. There are numerous stores close by. You also have short walking distance to various bus stops.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall the hotel was clean and the elevators worked. It was not too noisy because it is at the end of the busy area. Parking is ridiculously expensive ($30 a day) and they require it to be valet. There is also no free wi-fi in the rooms and nowadays Internet is a must.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There was a time not too long ago that you could not pay me to stay at the Waikiki doubletree. Those days are behind me. This is still not my first, second, third, or even fourth choice, but I will stay there again. The hotel itself has undergone a massive overhaul. Before i thought an antibiotic ahoild jave come standard with each room. Now the rooms are bright, spacious and keeping with the times. The bathroom on the other hand is small enough that changing your mind about what you were going to do there requires you to go back out into the main room. The valet (valet parking only) is a little more put together than other area hotels, but be careful driving your car into the driveway, its a tight turn and I nearly pulled a fender off my rental car. If your going for vacation the hotel is a food choice, if you travel for business then you might be in the same cup as me, that Doubletree will do in a pinch, but give me something with a microwave and a fridge big enough to holds more than a thought of a drink.
user_name:
k-mart78
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for five nights and this is a wonderful hotel. The staff were exceptionally friendly and very efficient - front desk, breakfast, security and housekeeping. Somehow, the manager found out we were celebrating our 49th wedding anniversary. She called and arranged to have a fruit plate with chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room with a card from the staff. If I were traveling to Honolulu again, I would definitely stay at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I spent 5 nights at this hotel. The hotel is on a small side - it does not have any shops on the premise except for the few snack items sold near the front desk, and it is on a major street with lots of car traffic. However, it is about 10-15 min walk to the beach and to the convention center. The front desk staff was friendly and courteous and the bell desk helpful. Although the lobby was small, I never had trouble finding a comfy spot to sit for awhile to take advantage of the free wi-fi in the lobby. My room was clean and comfortable, and the A/C control was good. All in all, I was pleased with my stay.
user_name:
NYC-mom-500
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent value; great location with easy access to both the beach and Hawaii Convention Center. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff; clean and well managed facility; room were efficiently arranged and attractively decorated.
user_name:
Norman S
Honolulu HI, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were there for only one night. The room was very nice with a large balcony and view of the park. This hotel is not on the beach, but it is close enough by a quick walk and shops and restaurants are also within a short walk. It was more affordable than other hotels in the area. The staff was friendly, the room very clean, and the furnishings were updated. I would recommend it if you don't mind being a little off the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: well-maintained and updated hotel; excellent location very near Waikiki and convention center, able to walk; able to print boarding passes in business center; good fitness center; comfortable bedding; burger place nearby very very good!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a great experience at the Double Tree Waikiki. It was walking distance to the beach and the Hilton Hawaiian Village shopping and resort area. The Vallet was very helpful and allowed us to check our bagage even after we checked out so that we could enjoy our last few hours on the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is an upscale nice hotel close to waikiki. Staff was helpful getting cabs and mapping walking trips, and locating points of interest we wanted to see. The only negative is there was not free wi-fi offered in the rooms. Unfortunately this is pretty common in Waikiki area. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and free cookies. (yummy fresh baked cookies) This hotel was very clean also, unlike many of the over used hotels in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was up to standards for this caliber hotel. The restaurant was not up to standards. Service was slow and unattentive, others were serviced who ordered after we did and the kids were served bad/old guava juice, tasted fermented.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at the Doubletree Alana in Waikiki for 22 days while on business in Hawaii. I thought that it was a nice hotel, but nothing to get worked up over. The hotel has the feel of a Howard Johnson or Best Western with a facelift. The rooms are somewhat boutique looking, but small. In fact, everything in the room is small. The bathroon area was extremely small, to the point that you could rarely use the facebowl without getting water on the floor. There was no free internet -wireless or ethernet in the room.The room had a "cooler" as it was described to me in the room, only capable of holding a few drinks. There was a restriction on the A/C allowing it to only get to a cretain temperature without a maintenance override. When I asked for a fan to assist in airflow, I was told that none were available because they were a "fire hazard". The maintenance personnel were able to override they A/C selection and cool the room off, but anytime that it changed, they had to come and adjust it again. Overall, thge highlight of this hotel is it's staff. They were extremely professional, friendly, and helpful!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here as a staycation for my husbands birthday for 2 nights and our room was on the PH floor, but a one bedroom suite. Everything was immaculate and very roomy, especially the bathroom!! I will definitely stay here again!! Loved my entire experience and we all loved their delicious cookies as well. Lol

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had an infant with us and we mentioned this before heading to Hawaii for our vacay. They put us in the corner room which was great as they are usually bigger. The service was fantastic and so as the valet guys. We were close to everything and always were able to get cookies when we return to our room at night. Will definitely stay here again. thanks for the fantastic service.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were very pleased with the accomodations and the staff were very efficient and accomodating, with the exception of the receptionist at check in. This is the second consecutive year we have stayed at the DoubleTree Alana Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is well situated - close to Waikiki beach and the Ala Moana shopping center, but guest rooms are a bit tired. Valet parking only. Breakfast buffet was good. Good choice for an overnight stay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: the hotel is in a great local out of the busy area of waikiki but you can walk to the beach area from the hotel the room are ok but not a 5 star hotel we only stayed 1 night because we came in a day early and needed a resonable place to stay and the rates or good

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel, though not right on the beach, has great rooms, great staff and the restaurant has super food. The rooms were beautifully furnished and the staff was super friendly and super helpful. We were able to leave our bags in storage there even after we checked out of the hotel to get that last little Honolulu experience without all our luggage.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We only stayed a few nights and did not have the chance to try out all the amenities, but had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The rooms were nice and clean --- with contemporary decor similar to the W Hotels. Beds were comfy and A/C quiet. We had a partial ocean view. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The only drawback was the bathroom, which at the time of this posting was not included in the DoubleTree website's slideshow photos. Don't know if all the double bed rooms are the same, but our bathroom was tiny (!) -- no place to put your toiletries, and the shower stall was small and must have been sized for a 5 ft tall hotel guest. If you are taller than 5 ft, please inquire about the bathrooms before you book a room here. The bathroom wall was also thin as we could hear the guy next door in his bathroom! Other than that, our stay was a relaxing one and a short walk to the beach and Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We found this hotel to be up to the usual good standards (clean, well decorated, good staff) of a Doubletree. It was about ten minutes walk to the beach and main tourist area - easily doable. The very satisfactory continental breakfast (cereal, plenty of fresh fruit. fresh pastries, yogurt and juice) was $16; the hot add-ons (eggs to order, waffles, etc.) took it to $22. There was a restaurant next door (Cheeseburgers) that offered a $6 breakfast, but we did not try it. The suite option worked great for us. You can separate the suite from the main bedroom by closing a sliding door. It's a smallish room containing a loveseat sized couch with a fold out bed, a desk, and a flat screen TV. It gave our teen and us a bit of space from each other. It would also give a business person a bit of extra elbow room. The only downside was the suite was next to the elevators so you could hear them move up and down (noticed it mostly during the busy times of the day). The receptionist said all the suites are next to the elevators - not sure if that is true or not. I watched the Hilton website to get the best deal I could. All in all it was a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location! Walked everywhere! Really good hotel!! They have a great pool and workout area, awesome continental breakfast, and very friendly, helpful staff! Very clean!!! great location for walking everywhere in Waikiki!! The view of the ocean is not that great, but why stay in your hotel to see the ocean anyway!!! Restaurant located right next door and an ABC store right next to that if you need anything at all!! Would stay here again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was kids friendly since the quality of baby bed and swimming pool were great. And the public space are very quiet and the room was spaciaous as well. We want to go back to this hotel again for our next visit to Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location and very friendly staff helped make my first visit to Hawaii stress free. No one minded answering my questions about directions, transportation or recommendations for food. I enjoyed it very much!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: You cannot beat the Kamaaina rate at the Double Tree. While I wouldn't say the rooms or views are something to write home about, are you in Waikiki to sit in your room? For the price there is not another option downtown. Plus the staff are super friendly and it is right across the street from a park and the beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent value for location. Walkable to beach. Easy cab ride to pier. Arrived day early, booked Pearl Harbor tour for morning of cruise day, hotel granted us a late check out. Very accommodating. Warm cookies on arrival are a plus.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For the price the room should be cleaner.Dust all along baseboards, especially in the bathroom.Completely glasa shower enclosure has soap scum build up.No complementary coffe bwcause the homesa will help themselvea.Coffee maker in room does not work.Refrigerator had something left in it that might have once been a mushroom.Very little bathroom counter space.No electrical outlets near any mirror in the room.Cable for some channels are constantly pixelating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very friendly and professional service. My family and I had been taking a driving tour of the island for two hours so by the time we checked-in we were hot, tired and cranky. The warm smiles (not to mention the warm cookies at check-in) turned everything around! The room was clean and quiet and the air conditioner worked very well. The American-style breakfast was delicious and a good value for the money. Free internet and printer services in the lobby for flight check-in, etc. but not free WiFi in the rooms unfortunately. The hotel is a bit of a walk to the beach but it does have some nice restaurants nearby. Overall a very positive experience. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I spent three nights in this Hotel last may: only 10-15 min walking from Waikiki Beach and the main stores and restaurants in Honolulu, nice and confortable rooms, well equipped and very clean; everything seems brand new and the staff is extremely nice. At the front desk you can ask for complimentary just baked chocolate chip cookies.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Required valet parking $30/day. We didn't knowuntil we drove up. The Internet is only available in the room for a fee. Free internet in the lobby is inconvenient. The room was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The cookies were delicious. We used the pull out bed and is was very comfortable.
user_name:
Dana B
Silver Spring, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Housekeeping staff should go through a re-fresher course on how to clean a room. Front Desk staff and Bell Desk were helpful and friendly but housekeeping was less desirable. Overall ok but if you can find another property please do. Hilton Hawaiian Village is across the street and hotel is near various attractions
user_name:
AirForceONEMD
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently stayed here one night. Check in was quick and efficient. The clerk was very cordial and even upgraded us to a suite. (I think it was because of our hilton honor status.) She offered us yummy warm chocolate chip cookies, which we look forward to every time we stay at Doubletree. The room size was decent and the bed was comfortable. It was nice to have a small fridge in the room. The only negative I would say is that the size of the bathroom was kind of small. But looking at photographs from other travelers, I think the bathroom size varies. There was a small gym and pool. Overall it was a great one night stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Convient location for the purposes of our trip - Pearl Harbour, beach & shopping.Staff very helpful, room clean & reasonable size.Not really sure why people have reported problems with the air con, it wasn't required most of the time. The weather is not that hot, especially at night it is pleasantly warm.Would be happy to stay here again

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was very comfortable with a large king size bed. However, the bathroom was rather small with no room for personal amenities. The area of the hotel is quiet and in a great location. The valet service for parking was excellent and the staff was extremely friendly. The cookies were great and served warm. Perfect for a late night snack.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki Hotel for 9 days in May. Location: Great location but not directly on the beach. A short walk will get you to many excellent beaches, but if you MUST have a room overlooking a beach or water, this is NOT your hotel. Otherwise, very centrally located with plenty to do nearby and an easy stroll to all the best that Waikiki has to offer. (side note: this review is about the hotel, not really about Waikiki but I will say that if you want a non-touristy location on Oahu, you should probably avoid Waikiki)Staff: The staff is extremely nice and very accommodating. You really couldn't ask for a nicer bunch of people. 5 stars to the staff--desk clerks, maintenance, bar, management and housekeeping. They really do a great job. They are a credit to the Hilton chain.Rooms: The rooms are nice and about average size. Nice bathroom, always clean. No complaints whatsoever.Amenities: We never used the pool but we did use the gym. Again, no complaints.Restaurant: We did make it to the bar a few times and had appetizers that were good. The bartenders were all nice and helpful.Considering the price differential between the big beach hotels and the Doubletree, I'd say it was more than worth it to stay here. Again, if you MUST be on the beach, you'll need to look elsewhere as this hotel is a few blocks from the beach. But considering the Hilton will cost you easily twice as much per night then it would all be a matter of what you're willing to pay.If I have to go to Waikiki again, I'll probably stay here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel was renovated in the last year or so and is starting to get worn again.The reception staff are wonderful and breakfast is actually very good.Located across a park from the Hilton Hawaiian Village on the edge of the Waikiki. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach, which didn't matter to me because I was working.Good, decent business hotel.Value is only three stars, because I feel that Honolulu hotels are very expensive for what they are.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff made all the difference, but would recommend taking pictures of the car sides before turning over to valets and then comparing everyday you picked up the car and making sure that the sliding door did not bleed air, because it makes the room noisy and warm. The staff kept resetting the AC everyday, so the room was always a little too warm upon return everyday.
user_name:
Jules G
Colorado Springs, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was great aside from the fact that I had a pair of expensive sunglasses stolen from my room. The beds and room were very comfortable and the front staff were very friendly. The view I had though from my window was not the greatest as all I could see were roof tops and car garages.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The young waiter who served us dinner found my expensive sweater on the back of my chair in the restaurant and delivered it to my room! I was very grateful that he went through the trouble of finding out my room # since we did not charge the dinner to our room. I might have driven all the way home the following day without realizing that I forgot the sweater.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I should preface this by saying I am a Hilton diamond member (I spend over 60 nights/ year at Hilton brands) and have stayed at many similar properties. This is probably one of the few Hilton properties I wouldn't go back to, for two reasons. 1. The air conditioning didn't work consistently. The AC would somehow periodically reset itself to a higher temperature throughout my stay. i.e., I would go to bed with the temp at 68 and awake a few hours later with the room at 74. This meant I kept having to get up in the middle of the night and set the thermostat back to 68. I called the front desk to see if they could fix it. They sent a manager up who did an override to let my thermostat go down to 62; he said it would last for 3 days. During the second night at that setting, however, I woke up with the temperature back in the mid-high 70's and had to reset the temp back to 62. This was really disruptive to my sleep cycle. I travel Hilton for business, and the poor quality of sleep was a definite deal-breaker.2. The hotel restaurant was seriously understaffed. I ate a few breakfasts and dinners here. At one point in time the continental breakfast, which is mostly cereal and fruit, was out of bowls (they told me they were washing them but it would be a 10 minute wait). On another occasion they were out of cereal. The buffet always looked destroyed. The staff was running around trying to keep up, but with so few staff, they could only do so much. The same thing could be said for dinner. I waited over 20 minutes for my waiter to even notice I needed a check because that single waiter was working the whole dinning room.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Like many of you, I’m a heavy business executive who doesn’t have a “low set bar” related to service. In my industry - healthcare, high levels of service are to be expected – no tips, no awards, no pat on the back. You and your family’s health and livelihood are vital to us. I travel to Honolulu quite often to work in one of our facilities there. I’m a very loyal Hilton member and will stay at a property up to sometimes 15 miles further, if I have to. If you’re in Honolulu, you don’t have to do that. Most people (including myself at times) will stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which is a great property. It has everything a vacation traveler would want in a small village atmosphere. But few people know or realize that just 150 yard away is one of Hilton’s best kept secrets in a property – The Doubletree Alana. Whether you’re staying for business or pleasure, this place is great. It’s great first and foremost because of its service offering. Beginning with their welcome team, you’re made to feel very welcomed and secure. From there, the front desk, restaurant and even cleaning personnel are top notch. I’ve been to the island more than 70 times in the past 6 years and The Doubletree Alana is the perfect place for business traveler who require and deserve a higher level of responsiveness, follow through and attention to detail – Starting with getting the type of room you requested (I hate it when hotels screw that up, how simple). I can hit the same shops at the village, run the same running paths and even shop Waikiki faster than when staying at the village. Some don’t remember that Doubletree is now part of Hilton. Some want to stay in a place that reminds them of Disney. Others would like great surrounding with high-touch service and does what they promise they will. If that’s the case, the next time you’re in Honolulu, hit the Doubletree Alana. You won’t be sorry. Marcus Williamson
user_name:
Marcus W
Nashville, Tennessee, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is quaint and perfect and a great value for what we paid, very competitive for the area. It's within walking distance of the beaches, shopping and dining. The rooms are spacious though the gym is pretty small. The staff is exceptional and they have a car rental kiosk in the lobby- you can rent green cars by the hour. That's genius as we only needed a car for 2 days out of 5. Will be back for sure!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Between good and very good but not great. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable, the neighborhood isn't the best with some shady types around: homeless and hookers late night / early morning. You can walk to the beach (10 minutes) but not on the water. Bathrooms have counter space BEHIND the sink not on a vanity. No vent or fan in the bathroom, keep the thermostat on 68 or it will get muggy. Maid staff didn't always replenish our soap, etc. free cookies are great, I am HH Gold so I had free wifi which was pretty fast and breakfast vouchers. The breakfast staff will freak if you don't eat in the restaurant and attempt to take your food to your room! Valet parking is the only option and you need to tip the valet guy. You can walk to anywhere in Waikiki...so that makes the properly ideal. The pool is small, the exercise room is decent. I would recommend the property overall but frankly we chose it due to our HH point level as the trip was covered by points.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 15th floor for a week in June with 2 friends. We had a city view and it was amazing. I loved staying in Honolulu. I thought the hotel was very nice and very much in the center of everything in Waikiki. My complaints are listed below: - I do not like the sheer bathroom door that separated the bedroom from the bathroom since I was traveling with friends and that was not appropriate. - Housekeeping do not know how to following signs; i had the "do not disturb" sign on the door but she barged in anyway. - There was no bedding for the pull out sofa bed. - Housekeeping did not throw out all garbage. I had obvious garbage in the room and she only threw out garbage that was in the pail. - I felt that security was lacking. There were no cameras on the floors or on elevators. I felt that anyone could walk in from the street and not get stopped. - Free wifi should be in the guest rooms too. Wifi is free only in lobby area. - The pool area was plain but was 6 feet at the deep end which was great. - Very comfortable bed but pillows were very flat in the morning. I do like Doubletree though and I would definitely still recommend that someone stay here. The staff were very friendly and followed up with all requests. Very good price at $169 per night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: this is a great boutique hotel well situated across from the park. Very nice walk to to the waikiki beach and to the Ala Moana Mall. Hotel has excellent facilities for the price range. The hotel staff were very attentive and accommodating.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice and friendly staff. Enjoyed my stay. Location was excellent. The mandatory parking and the cost per day was a little steep for my taste. They always had a hot cookie when I got back from work. The view from my balcony wasn't great but I didn't spend much time there. Did not eat at the restaurant, but the menu looked very good. It was walking distance to Waikiki and to Ala Moana if you didn't have a car.
user_name:
Miles S T
Hilo, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, within walking distance from the lovely beaches of Waikiki. We were upgraded to a ocean view suite on check-in. The suite was small, but it was lovely.. Every room had a balcony and we had a view of the ocean (with a little obstruction from other buildings)-very pleasant. The room was immaculate. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped us find our way around the Wailkiki area. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and was very good. Would definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay for anyone

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel with great service. Rooms were very clean. On the down side, Valet parking is mandatory if you have a car, $30/night. Internet is $9.95/day unless you are a Gold/Platinum Hilton Honors member, I am only Silver, which got me two free bottles of water. Also, I would have preferred accommodations on the beach. Although, the walk is about 10 - 15 minutes or so, not too bad.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: While staying in Honolulu from May 20th-28th we stayed at the Doubletree. From first walking in you can see the renovations they have made. Wonderful service and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We had a small issue with the air conditioner temperature being turned up by the cleaning staff, but it was quickly handled and the staff made a point of leaving a message in our room to tell us it had been delt with. The pool is lacking compare to other hotels but was still enjoyable. The warm cookie upon arrival and the staffs willingness to dole our more to our boys when asked was a nice touch. The restaurant food was extremely good and althought they have delivery to your room from Roundtable I would recommend gettting a pizza from the reataurant downstairs. Way better tasting and the bartender will even call your room when its ready for pickup.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here during a work trip to Hawaii. The rooms are big and the beds are comfortable. The beach isn't too far away but its not right on the water and, at least from my room, you couldn't see the ocean at all. I was disappointed that there was no free breakfast and the buffet is pricey, but there are plenty of coffee shops nearby you can walk to. If you get hungry you can also pick up a free delicious chocolate chip cookie from the friendly staff at the front desk. All you have to do is ask!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: For a hilton hotel of any sort, i was highly disappointed. Your not on the beach, but thats ok. The rooms are average, nothing to brag about though. I am positive there are plenty other 'average' hotels with better virws for around the same price. The hotels location is prime but thats about it. I won't be going back.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My twins daughters and myself just returned back to Anchorage Alaska after spending five wonderful days in Hawaii at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki. Hats off to this hotel and its staff. We never wanted for anything during our stay. This hotel was very clean and had comfortable beds. Everyone had friendly smiles and helped us with anything we needed. Our TV went out during our stay and within minutes, the maintenance crew was in our room installing a brand new tv. Traveling with women only, we felt very safe and secure at this hotel. It is in a great central location in walking distance to anything you may need. I would like to recognize three people that stood out to me and my daughters our entire stay. Theresa and Elsa from the front desk, always friendly smiles, gave us those great cookies every day and was just so kind to us our entire stay. And we definitely could not forget our GREAT bellman, BRETT FORSTER! I personally work in the hospitality business and know what great customer service should be and Brett Forster went over and beyond for me and my girls.... Told us about the best restaurants, shops and places to sightsee while we were in Hawaii. I think we made him laugh everyday with funny things we would do.... Like renting an electric car and was scared he might have to come get us if it didn't start.....Brett is a one of kind person and without him guiding us I don't think our stay would have been as enjoyable....He had a great personality and should be recongnized for his work and all he does at the Doubletree. We will definitely be back and no doubt stay at the Doubletree Alana Waikiki. Thanks Again, Holly, Megan and Morgan Wolverton

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was damp and moldy! The contents of my suitcase became damp, the bed was damp, our bathing suits wouldn't dry. It was HORRIBLE. There was MOLD growing on the ceiling of the bathroom. I would rather stay at the Hilton Waikiki Village across the street for the extra money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful location. It is just in front on the Hilton Hawaiian Village and it is a 5 minute walk from the beach. Comparing with the Hilton Hawaiian Village, the Alana DoubleTree is significant less expensive for great rooms with balconies.The bedding was comfortable. The only minor annoyance was that we couldn't set the AC below 68 degrees, but we were never uncomfortable.We would definitely stay the Alana Doubletree on our next visit to Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is always a good value for the business traveler, great staff, comfortable rooms, well equipped fitness center, walking distance to dining and downtown Honolulu I stay at this hotel several times a year and am never disappointed. Great for business traveler, well equipped to handle business and personal needs

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall, this hotel is a wonderful place to stay. There were a few small quirks, but nothing that outweighed a wonderful stay at this location.PROS:- Big, comfortable beds. I had a very restful night's sleep each night. Thank you!- Very clean.- The shower was warm and inviting. I love the remodeled bathrooms!- Stunning views of both the mountains and the ocean (depending on the room you get to stay in).- I love that you can step outside of your room and enjoy the weather outdoors. Wonderful.- Friendly staff that communicated with me before my arrival. I was impressed by this.- I hate a late flight, and I was accommodated -- another impressive surprise.- The ability to get $10 credits per night for use during dinner in the restaurant downstairs if you decline housekeeping services each day. Nice.- Right across the street from the beach. You simply cross over the street and the beach is on the other side of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It's a perfect location. Many of these reviews say that it is far away from the beach. This is simply not true. It's a safe five minute walk. I walked late at night all the time while I was here and never, ever felt unsafe. There are people everywhere at night, and they are almost all tourists.- The location is wonderful. It was in a perfect spot for me.- Bell and valet staff were super-friendly.CONS:- The charge for parking was ridiculous at $30 per night (when you figure in tip, you're looking at $32 per day for this valet-only feature of the hotel). My car rental, including taxes, was only $37 per night. When the parking is as much as your rental, you know there's a problem. Yes, I understand that many of the other properties in Waikiki charge around the same amount for parking, but just because you CAN charge for something doesn't mean you should.- As a previous reviewer noted, you will here sirens throughout the night. It didn't bother me in the slightest, but if sirens bother you, look elsewhere.- The free breakfast for HHonors Gold and Diamond members is pretty bad. Dry cereal, yogurt, and some bread/pastry items are pretty much all that are available. If you want a hot meal, you have to pay to "upgrade" to it. This seems pretty silly when there are two restaurants on either side of the hotel that you can pay less than the "upgrade" for and get a much bigger meal. They should rethink this breakfast strategy, especially for their Gold and Diamond members. Why? They aren't making much money off of it (even for the upgrade), and if so many reviews are speaking negatively of it, then it's not really worth continuing (just my thought). I had a free breakfast for four mornings because of my HHonors status, and I only took advantage of it twice.OVERALL IMPRESSION:This is a solid Doubletree location, and I had an outstanding time on Oahu. I will return to this hotel the next time I stay in Waikiki. Thank you to the staff for your consideration and your helpful attitude.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Its a average hotel with very compact/small rooms. Moreover we can easily listen what the neighbours at next door talking about. The bathrooms are very small too. No bath tub in bathroom. Initially we got only one set of towels. I had to call the house keeping at 5 am in the morning to get another set for my wife. The reason they gave was that they only had one guest name in their records which is why they put one towel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Totally a valuable hotel for business, you can see the sea from the terrace, but not relate to the beach, if you want to have a leisure, it is not very convenient. 40 min to the airport, bathroom is a little small, I will touch the door when bathing. Types of food for breakfast is idential American, a bit less to choose.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for work, good location while still being a a Hilton property. Not far from the beach, nice wal to the mall and convience store virtually next door for all those things at a lower cost. Parking cost is ridiculous, cheaper to park in Boston! Staff is friendly and accommodating, nice sitting area for people watching too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Decent service and good quality, great location. Staff was friendly and courteous. Not much help from Desk staff for facilitating sightseeing tours to see local attractions. Location is prime and overall experience is good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent hotel for the price and a 5 minute walk to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and beach. Only problem is that they are located between Waikiki and the Fire Department. As with any big, city vacation spot...the fire department runs all night long. I'm sure it affects everyone, not only the DoubleTree. Consider this...FD will be there within 5 minutes if you need them. Still worth staying here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: THANK YOU, Doubletree, for having queen-sized beds, a rarity in Waikiki from what I can gather. I could only find full-sized beds---uncomfortable, imho, for 2 adults and 2 grown children or any family of 4. We all slept well! We gladly sacrificed a hotel on the beach for bigger beds.First came the warm chocolate chip cookies when we checked-in. I wanted to secretly tag along behind the next set of guests who were checking in so I could get more... Excellent staff---from the parking valet (extremely prompt---never waited more than a minute or two for him to get our car) to the front desk staff who helped me when I was locked out. Accommodating and helpful. Comfortable mattresses, good sized bathroom, nice balcony for two, quick elevators, great little workout room, and it was quiet in our hall! My only complaint would be that the wi-fi wasn't free :(

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff were very helpful. Rooms were clean and quiet. Hotel is older, though renuvated. Pool, fitness room are very small. No jacuzzi. Hotel is in walking distance to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, shopping and so convenient option to stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: great stay! best location, not too busy and nice walk to beach and waikiki. Great restaurants in hotel and valet. pool is very nice.. has everthing you need and staff are incredibly nice and accomodating! will stay there every time i am in honolulu

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: OK, you're not on the beach, it's not a tropical paradise, the pool is almost depressing - BUT it's so much less expensive than the beach properties, you're only a couple of blocks to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and its beach and restataurants (and the mobs of people), there is easy walking to the shops you may (or may not) want to visit, the restaurant is quite good, and the hotel staff, to a person, is extraordinarily kind and caring.It's a basic urban Doubletree plopped onto a Hawaiian street setting - but weighing the pros and cons above, you might want to consider it. Just temper your expectations.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is 10-20 minutes walk to the beach and major shopping. There is an ABC store at almost next building for your needs, drinks etc... The rooms are renovated that includes flat TV. My room had shower and was large enough to have a huge twin couch with pretty Hawaiian floral design, lots of storage, huge built-in area to put your luggage up, safe deposit box, coffee machine, empty refrigerator and an office corner. I had a corner location, Room #801 at 8th floor but not an attractive view. The internet connection was with a fee but was flawless and fast. The staff was great, the front desk was always helpful with great positive attitude to assist as well as the Bell staff. The room service dining offered some really good items that included fish and salads. The hallways are not air-conditioned but the room air condition was sufficient. The elevators were very efficient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I traveled yo Honolulu on business for four days at the end of April and was looking for a convenient hotel that would continue earning points as an elite level Hilton Honors member. The Doubletree was much less expensive than the nearby Hilton Hawaiian Village, so I gave it a try.At check-in I was "upgraded to a suite" (room 720), given "free internet access" and 2 bottles of water as a Hilton elite Traveler. Interestingly, the was a a suite adapted for disabled customers (e.g., wheelchair accessible, walk in shower with grab bars and bench seating). I did not need or request such accommodations, but appreciated the suite upgrade with on exception. The closet hanger bars were available only at wheelchair height making having of linger garments a challenge.The staff were generally helpful and friendly, but in a laid-back Hawaiian fashion. For example, when I went to check out two of us different customers) waited for the only available clerk as she chatted of the phone for a good 2-3 minutes. In addition I could not get the WiFi internet link to work consistently. After two sets of complaints about that I learned (on the evening of my final day) that my room had poor WiFi reception because it was adjacent to the elevator shaft which somehow compromised the signal. They offered to move me to another room or give me a $10 dinner coupon, but it was 8 pm and I was scheduled to leave the next morning at 6 am. It would have helped more if they'd addressed this issue when i first raised it 48 hours earlier.The room was generally clean, but with a few non-roach insects. They did a planned fumigation on my second day.I was at business meetings all day x3, so I only really used the room to sleep and shower. The desk was nice, but not helpful without the internet access. The bed was comfortable, but the thermostat was in the living room of the suite and would not go below 68, keeping the bedroom at 72-74 most of the time (a bit too warm for my tastes).The maid service was okay but borderline inattentive on detail (e.g., did not refill empty tissue dispenser or empty water from ice bucket).It's a good enough alternative to the flagship Hilton across the street, but does have lestt than stellar attributes.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful property, great and friendly service, great location, great restaurant and Bar, the staff made my stay a memory, looking forward to my next trip to this property :) recommend the breakfast and stop at the bar for a cocktail, walk to Waikiki and the Ala Moana Mall, enjoy all what this property has to offer and the location.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stay here anytime we are on Oahu. Best of the best! Service is outstanding, rooms are clean and comfortable, easy access to a variety of sites and locations, parking is by valet only but very good, and of course the cookie!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I like DoubleTree, and in some cities they are even better than the local Hilton.....not here. Here in Waikiki the poor DoubleTree sits two blocks from his grand big brother Hilton Hawaiian Village and is totaly ignored. The place looks like a dump compared, and guests don't enjoy any of the privledges across the street. This is just plain bad company policy, because there is no reason DoubleTree guests should not enjoy other Hilton amenties that are so close, especially considering how BAD the pool facilities are at the DoubleTree. Neverthelesss, still has a Hilton bed and basic room, so at least that was good.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've been staying here since February and at my corporate rate, it is definitely worth it and allows me to stay within the state contractor budget. Hilton honors members with of gold or diamond status receive free wireless in rooms, but the breakfast is just a standard continental breakfast but you have to pay nine dollars for the upgrade to a warm breakfast. The thermostats are restricted to a low temperature of 69 degrees and occasionally the cleaning staff will turn it up to 72 degrees so you could be greeted by a nice warm room when returning home from work. This has even occurred when the cleaning staff had no reason to enter my room because I had the do not disturb up and had requested no room service that day. This is inexcusable and the management should inform their staff to never enter a room when the occupant has the expected right to privacy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Be wary of the "cheap" rooms here - they have tiny bathrooms w/ showers, no fan, and air conditioners locked down at too warm a temperature. We stayed in a room right across from the elevators and ice maker and the room was very loud (I'd guess that other rooms wouldn't have this problem, but these are the reduced rate rooms). The air conditioner was locked at a temperature that did not cool the room, I can only imagine how awful it would be in the hotter months (we where there in April).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recent stay in March 2013 was a good experience. Love the convinent location walk to every major sights, especially Ala Moana Center to make grocery shopping. Room was ok size for 4 and the beds were very comfortable. The down side are expensive $30 per night parking: we actually found affordable $16 p/n parking at a parking lot building close to the hotel. Would be nicer to have free in-room Wifi for the price we paid......

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel before and will stay again. Parking is $30/night, which is almost as much as I paid for the daily rate of the rental car. My only issue is the degraded breakfast you get. At EVERY other Hilton property I stay at I can at least get a hot meal. For almost $200/night I wasn't expecting to pay extra for the hot breakfast. Yes, it was located outside the restaurant area, but I thought that because of the lack of space for seating. On my previous stay I ate at another restaurant and there was a hot meal at that time. A minor disappointment compared to the overall stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at this hotel was very polite and friendly. They went out of their way to have an early morning breakfast packed up for us when we headed out at 5 am. It's within walking distance of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, so it is a relatively short walk to the beach, as well as many restaurants and shopping. We had a pleasant stay and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean, comfortable, quiet hotel with a very pleasant staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have just stayed four nights at DoubleTree Waikiki and have to say we were pleasantly surprised with our choice - this is our first trip to Hawaii and were expecting it to all be outdated, however our room was modern, the bed was comfortable with nice bedding, and the service was excellent. We were in room 1601 which had partial sea views off the balcony which was nice but as we both suffer from vertigo we didn't spend much time on our balcony!! All of the staff were friendly, prompt and happy to help and the location for us was perfect. We didn't have a car and easily found buses and trolleys near by. However, it is an easy walk to Ala Moana centre and even the Royal Hawaiian shopping centre. If we are lucky enough to come back to Hawaii we would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I like the Double Tree brand & Hotels - I think they are just above most mid market hotels. Nice extras - Chocolate Cookie on arrive, funky décor and good facilities (mostly). Hence why I booked 8 nights at the Waikiki one. Price wise its more than there other locations but that's Hawaii for you. It's location is on the edge of Waikiki a few blocks back from the beach and to the west end of the main drag. So good if you don't mind a 15 minute walk and you prefer a quieter part of Waikiki. So where did they fall short? Firstly there is only valet parking at a $30+ a night. it's not cheap and there is no deal if you stay over 5 nights. They have electric cars to hire by the hour and if I'd have known I would have probably used them. WiFi is free in lobby but pay as you go everywhere else - unless your a "gold / diamond" frequent stayer. That's a rip off and this is not the case in other Double Trees. Couple of other small points - no complementary bottled water in room, soap not shower gel - which you notice when you have just stayed 6 nights in another Double Tree in California. On the plus side: We had breakfast included (buffet & hot selection) and was good with good staff. I noticed lots of people had only gone for buffet and had to pay to add cooked hot items. We had a suit style room with living room and both Mountain & Sea Views well worth the extra for additional space and comfort (and of a good clean standard). We were high up in the building and there was some noise from the wind through the patio doors. Our air con stop working on day 3 - but after a quick "word" with reception an engineer was called and it was sorted out. There is a nice pool, gym and sun deck. Would I stay here again? - if in Waikiki and wanting a mid price hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of Hilton branded hotel in walking distance from Waikiki beach. We stayed twice, two nights first time and just overnight the second time. Overall impression is positive. We were upgraded to junior suite in the first case. Room was spacious, equipped with classical Hilton stuff and of course clean. It seemed to me, that there was no ventilation in the bathroom. Even after a short shower I had the feeling, its steam bath. The second stay we had a double, as booked. It was refurbished and actually better, than the first suite. Staff was friendly and responsive. Complimentary breakfast was very limited, but that’s a standard in US. I liked the porridge with blueberries. Omelettes or full American breakfast are for additional 10 USD. Hotel offers in house parking – more on that later. This hotel performs on the scale of 10 for me as 4. I had two major problems. First was one of the two TV sets in the suite. Unfortunately the one in the main room did not really work. Usually I do not care much about TV, but we arrived on the night, when new Pope was elected and we were curious, who he is. I alerted the reception and a guy tried to fix it, with limited success. I asked twice more to fix it, and nothing happened. Funny enough, the second set in the other room worked fine – but it was in the other room. We arrived with a rented car. Efficient staff parked my car and it was prepared within seconds, when we need it. We were not informed about the price of this service, however on the coupon was written 3$. I found that cheap, but given the hotel price level somehow nice. The biggest trouble was the bill. First of all, we were charged for pay TV, which we can hardly use, given it did not really work. After me pointing it out, this point was removed. Second, parking fee of 30 $ + taxes appeared on the bill. Its ridiculously high, smaller car rental cost about that! I complained about lack of information about the price, reception offered me 15$ discount. However, when I presented mentioned coupon (issued by DT Hilton staff with handwritten 3 USD), parking fee disappeared totally. I just hope, it was a misunderstanding, not a unsuccessful attempt. We parked elsewhere during our second stay. You can agree on it in some of the restaurants nearby during your dinner there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was basically adequate. The staff were not terribly friendly, the rooms were very small, and the breakfast was nothing spectacular. If you can, do the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Otherwise, just prepare yourself. The parking is a nightmare and always takes forever to get your car.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: this was a great hotel with friendly helpful staff. The location is nice and close to the the beach, shops and Waikiki without being right in the middle of everything. The public transport is close by if needed or the staff can arrange a taxi or shuttle from either Hilton complex opposite each other. This hotel is not a resort and great for a couple or business person.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First time at this hotel. Biggest plus is the friendly, accommodating staff. Biggest minus is the $30 per day valet parking only. In the area behind the hotel, there is minimal street parking which is metered during the day and free in the evening, if you are so lucky to snag a space. Our 18th floor room with partial ocean view and overlooking Ft. DeRussy was directly across one wall of the adjacent hotel and gave a feeling of privacy. Air conditioning was comfortable and turned off when the balcony door is open to save energy; thermostat control was intuitive and easy to operate. Bathroom fan runs continuously and effectively dries steam, but while it isn't excessively loud, it may still not be okay for guests who need a totally quiet room when sleeping. Easy to charge our many devices (cell phones, Kindle, laptops, camera) as needed with multiple outlets. Bedding consisted of feather pillows and comforter; Because I have allergies, I asked for and promptly got a foam pillow. Room was clean but a little dusty (from the feather bedding, I presume). Especially like Hilton's practice of encasing the comforters in sheets to keep the bedding cleaner. Free continental breakfast buffet as a Gold HHonors perk was nice because it seems pricey to pay $16 for continental and $23 for complete breakfast (waffles, eggs, etc.) when there are more reasonable options within a short walking distance from the hotel. In fact, everything needed was within walking distance - Hawaii Convention Center, the beach, drugstore, 7-11, ABC stores, other shops and restaurants - and it's a fairly easy walk to Ala Moana.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this Doubletree -- good location and room amenities. We stayed in a ocean view suite. It's worthy as it was able to accommodate 4 people comfortably and had a nice partial ocean view. Although there was some billing problem with the stay, the hotel staff was nice and tried their best to help me. I will recommend this hotel to people who want a safe and nice stay with reasonable cost in Waikiki.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: ..it's an older hotel that's been given a facelift. We stayed in a 2 room suite with 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa in the 2nd room. Maid service was excellent, with extra towels and toiletries given with no comment or complaint. My major complaint was the cost of parking a car....$30 per day, NO self park, valet only. We ate breakfast only in the hotel restaurant; buffet or menu. Food was good and reasonably priced with a Hilton Honors coupon, otherwise breakfast was $23.00 per. Continental breakfast is free with a Hilton coupon. Immediately next door is a Cheeseburgers Waikiki that serves a basic breakfast for $5.99. 1 block west is a coffee shop that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. We did not utilize this location, so I cannot comment on the quality. Hotel is close to Hilton Hawaiian Village (5 minute walk), Ala Moana Mall (5 minute drive) and easy walking access to Ft De Russey all of the "attractions" on Kalakaua Blvd. We did not use any spa facilities, so I cannot comment.  All in all, I would probably stay here in the future, but the parking fees are tough to take.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a very nice hotel a few blocks of the beach. If you are looking for an ocean front property, this isn't the choice for you. If you are looking for something a little quiter and quaint, you'll be very happy here.Event banquet rooms are various sizes and there are several to choose from. Rates are very competitive to other Waikiki hotels. Many hotels in the area require you to book multiple sleeping rooms in order to reserve event space, which is not the case with this hotel. That's something I really appreciate! Hotel is great for families and business travelers. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed about 3 months at the hotel, generally very happy about the hotel with the following exceptions: 1) I received a voicemail -- after I had checked out -- saying that they had received a mail item for me, would i come by to pick it up. I came by, they could not find the item and a manager promptly deleted the voicemail from my phone. She tried once and failed--I assumed she tried to delete it in error -- I showed her something else (date/time of call) and she deleted item on second attempt.2) Prices are hugely inflated -- corporate rates are OK but please don't pay the rack rate.3) Breakfast at $10 for cereal or $17 for hot is expensive in my view. Very nice breakfast, just make sure you have or get status (gold, diamond) in which case you get vouchers for breakfast.Apart from these gripes, I was very happy with the staff (one exception) and would recommend the hotel highly if you can get breakfast free and a good rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree by Hilton was very good, all and every each of their staff were so friendly and helpful, every day we stayed in was a pleasure to interact with all of them. Walking distance to restaurants, buses, trolley, stores, mall, entertainment and fun beach. I will stay at this hotel next time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: we stayed in January/february of this year. what a great value hotel. We are Gold Members of hilton honors , so we got free breakfast for two,for which you can upgrade to full breakfast for a few dollars extra., 5 mins walk to the beach, near shops cafe,s etc. rooms great size, and clean, great maid, and bell service.The Outback restaurant 5 mins away, great service and food, the manager , Mr Nelson came over and introduced him self, and comped our sweets, so ask for him.all in all a great value hotel, staff go out of their way to help, thx Craig, and Lis

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I shopped around alot and got a pretty decent rate here. No airport shuttle. Used Speedishuttle to get there which worked fine for me. No executive level or lounge. Nice view from balcony. Rooms updated fairly recently. Small restaurant/bar that opens for breakfast and then closes until dinner. If you are Honors you get continental breakfast, upgrade to full was kind of pricey. Don't remember exactly but about $10.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in February 2013 and were impressed. The hotel was very nicely maintained. Our room gave us a fantastic view of the city! Staff was exremely helpful. The valet service was without fault. We would call for the car and by the time we were downstairs, it was waiting for us! The continental breakfast was fun and filling!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is super! The staff were welcoming and gracious. The valet parking is convenient and your car is available VERY quickly. The restaurant is good...wide choice of food and the staff are wonderful! The rooms were large and the beds are very comfortable. I was there for several days and had NO complaints the whole time. I travel every week and I would come back to this hotel in a flash!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is very nice except that the carpet and walls on our floor need a redo. The room and common areas are nicely updated and the staff is friendly and efficient. A GREAT feature is an onsite Green Car (www.greencarhawaii.com) hourly car rental service. You can rent an electric car or a hybrid for around $10/hr. Very convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great place for some dinner in Waikiki!I normally don't like valet parking only, but the valet service was very welcoming and accommodating. I took my date over there and we were placed by the window across from the street by our wonderful waiter, Earl. We got the Macadamia Nut Mahi Mahi and Rib-eye steak. Both were cooked exactly to what we wanted. The garlic mash potatoes were very tasty and the presentation of the food was fantastic. Chef Brandon definitely made our meal a memorable one.
user_name:
Klinton K
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I arrived at 4:00am (late flight in from the Marshall Islands). Even at that time, the front desk was very pleasant and welcoming. My original room reservation was not available so they upgraded me to a suite. I honestly didn't know what to do with myself. The suite was large and comfortable.... oh soooooooo comfortable. When I laid down on the bed, I just about melted right into it. And NICE pillows too! Unlike my previous stays in some other hotels, I had no issues with noise at all. I finally got some much needed sleep as I started my return trip home from business. I wish I could tell you more about the amenities, but really all I did was sleep. And sleep I did!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for a nice weekend "staycation" for a friend's birthday. The hotel itself was very nice -- the room was updated, modern and very clean; and the lobby area was also very clean and modern, too. The location is also good, it's right at the "beginning" of the Waikiki strip -- across the street from Fort DeRussy. The hotel also has very nice workout facilities. However, keep in mind that I stayed here as a Hawaii resident, and not as a tourist. You do have to pay for parking (I believe it's $15/ night) and the hotel does not have a hot tub (?!), but does have a heated pool. It's also not right next to the beach and the view is mostly of the strip / roads (and not the beautiful Pacific ocean) -- but you're only a short walk away from the beach. Also, there is no full-length mirror in the room (clearly, they were not thinking about females) -- but there are full length mirrors throughout the hotel. My friends also ate at the restaurant (I did not) and they said the service was not very good, and the food was alright (I had some cold leftovers). Overall, some definite pluses but also some definite minuses. However, I've definitely stayed in worse hotels in Waikiki (with better locations) -- so it's kind of up to you on what you're looking for. I would definitely stay here again, though! :)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very modern, clean, quiet an surprisingly close to the bigger hotels and beach. If you want to be near everything but not sleep in it too, this is the place. I experienced everything everyone else did and had a quiet nights sleep. The tour company picked up just a block away. Very convenient.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was at the Doubletree in December, my kids' high school band was performing in the Pearl Harbor Memorial Parade. A very pleasant hotel, comfortable and clean. Rooms are not the largest, but efficiently designed. The hotel is in the "city," a few blocks from the beach and a $7 taxi ride from the hotels and shops at Waikiki. The Doubletree is also few minutes' walk to the Hilton Hawaiian Village property. That's fun if you want to get a resort feel for a while, and the beaches in Hawaii are public, open to all. I walked over to HHV a number of times, and had lunch in their restaurant by the beach. The Doubletree staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and the guys at the bell stand are, as well. I had not rented a car, so I needed to arrange transportation to Pearl Harbor, and to confirm my return trip to the airport. They graciously helped with all, and held my luggage after checkout on the last day as I awaited my flight home. Traveling alone, I am always concerned with security. I felt very comfortable at this hotel. Ordered room service breakfast a couple of days (had to be out early), and it was very prompt, delicious, and professionally delivered. There is an outdoor pool, it is on the second level (along with the beautiful, airy lobby, front desk, and restaurant). It is not large by resort standards, but nice for a swim. When I was there, a couple of families had their toddlers there. Very pleasant. (In the later afternoon, the pool goes into the shadow of the building, so not a lot of sun.) There are lounge chairs on the sun deck. Did not visit the restaurant. I got a fabulous price for my stay, and the location worked well for me...there are a few restaurants and some handy shops around the corner on Kalakaua Avenue. Rooms have a small terrace. From my 8th floor room, the veiw was not a highlight, but it was pleasant, and any time outdoors in the beautiful Hawaiian weather is lovely. Two thumbs up for the super-attentive and friendly staff.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a last minute reservation, room rate on a week night was $250 incl tax. room was nice, clean, no view, just a little pricey for what it seemed to be. 200 characters seems like a lot for average.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very close to Waikiki and the Ala Moana Center and of course the cookies were warm! The staff was courteous and helpful. Short wait for car to come up. Room was big enough and clean.
