Rate was reasonable. We spent all of our time with family, but this hotel was easy to find and convenient for us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is very good value for money and is walking distance from the Convention Center, Waikiki beach, shopping and dining. It is unlikely to have a beach view but any higher floor should give you something to look at in Honolulu. Staff were helpful and HHonor gold members get free Wifi access, but you need to re-new the access every 24 hours. Cookies are great as always! Note if you park at this hotel there is no self-park option your car MUST be valet-parked.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Your like or dislike of this Double Tree all depends on how you like to travel. If you want a resort, lavish pools, private beach, etc. then this is not the hotel for you. We really enjoyed this property though - it is clean, modern and a good central location. I believe the property was recently renovated, which I loved, so everything felt rather news. Only drawback was the mandatory $30 a day for valet parking (but give or take a few bucks, that is what all the hotels charge). Hotel is in walking distance to several restaurants and Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is a great hotel and has very helpful and courteous staff. I will come back to it because it is a fantastic hotel. All the staff were ready to help in any way. It is the best hotel in the whole of Wakiki. Soad Mansour

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for business Feb 9th-13th. We travel quite a bit and this hotel meet every need. It seems to have been updated recently, the decor was modern and clean. Internet worked great, and we used a conference room which was perfect for our group. Even though we prefer King size beds, we usually get a room with two queens since they seem to be larger rooms. This room was quite large for an average hotel room. The noise when the lanai doors are open is loud, but that is Waikiki not the fault of the hotel. The hotel is not on the beach and does not have an ocean view, at least not from our room. But it did have a nice mountain view, we were on a high floor which I think is more desirable all around.Would not hesitate at all to stay here again for business. Employees were welcoming and quite friendly.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Sorry Hilton. Im an Honors member but it sure was not an honor to stay here. On line showed great suites, nice beautiful Lobby and rooms...you name it. This place was a dump. I had a suite....Stained curtains, carpet. The fold out couch was a mess. The mattress was so old my friend slept on the floor. I can see things being out dated etc.....but this place was bad. The location isnt too bad but please.....clean it up some.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice location on the quieter end of Waikiki. A few block walk to the convention center and to the main portion of Waikiki, which was very convenient. The bell staff were all Very helpful!!! We utilized them to arrange cabs, ask for directions etc. would definitely stay there again if returning to the area. We didn't have time for the beach so the proximity wasn't important. If you want to be close to the beach I might stay somewhere closer.Rooms were nice, clean and a standard hotel room. Beds were comfortable and there was a nice lanai with a glimpse of the ocean.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent 9 days at the DoubleTree in February 2013. The hotel is small. Most of the rooms have either mountain/city views or city only views. A few with ocean views. This was not an issue for us. I would recommend requesting a higher floor if possible. We spent 2 night on the 6th floor and then moved to the 15th floor for the duration of the stay. We did experience a lot of city noise, but I think that is common for Waikiki. The rooms were adequate size and clean. I would prefer more bathroom counter space, but not really a problem. Enjoyed sitting on the balcony off of our room. There was a small fridge, but most importantly, lots of shelves for storage. We walked to the WalMart and stocked up on snacks and drinks. In the end, the ABC stores (which are everywhere) had decent prices. The staff was wonderful! We spent the most time talking with and receiving help from the bell staff. Eddie, Edward, and Jeff were great! Housekeepers were very friendly and did a nice job each day. My favorite interaction was with our housekeeper who came to clean our room while we were still there. She jokingly ordered us to the beach. The front desk staff was great as well. I am pleased that we booked with the Alana Waikiki hotel instead of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We were close enough to walk to the shops and beach without too much trouble. The only drawback was that the Hawaiian Village pool was pretty nice. I would have enjoyed that. However, I went to the beach instead, which was great. We enjoyed our stay and will be back!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: so happy to have been assigned as room as soon as i arrived - really needed to sleep after a long trans-pacific flight. appreciated the proximity to the convention centre and the relatively small scale of the hotel as it provided a calmer experience than either the hilton hawaiian village or the embassy suites. the staff were also friendly and efficient - good to see familiar faces everyday. a few downsides : the windows are not double glazed and was woken up by the wailing of sirens from emergency services (no idea why they have to be so noisy in the middle of the night), plus the breakfast selection did not vary much

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff, room and location were all commendable. We were able to check in very early after a long international haul. Whilst not right on the beach, being a little bit away from the hustle bustle of the main, noisy Waikiki area, was good. We could still walk to the main shopping area and beach. The room was clean, nicely rennovated and the bed extremely comfortable. We were not up too high and there was no great view but for a short stay, this motel proved good value for money compared to more overpriced motels/hotels in the hub of it all.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was recently updated, and the renovations are very nice! The rooms are now nicely decorated, and the bathroom has been re-vamped to include a nice handheld shower head. The rooms are a little small, but clean, and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the location of this hotel is just perfect to get in and out of Waikiki. We rented a car, and their porters were always really courteous! Probably the only downside was the $30 cost per night to park the car. I always love to come back to this hotel, because it is so close to Ala Moana and easy to travel to and from this location, (and the warm cookie they offer at check-in)! Would highly recommend for a nice stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My first impression was good with the nicely decorated lobby. I booked a suite. I get right off the elevator and take literally three steps to find my suite is right next to the elevator. The room was pretty modern looking. You could hear the slight noise of the elevator going up and down. The room was quite small for a suite. We pulled out the pull out couch for the is where a family member would be sleeping. What we found was multiple hairs and little bits of what could have been food or I don't even know. I called the front desk asking for a cleaner suite and one away from the elevator. The manager came up and was very apologetic and nice. All the suites in the hotel are by the elevator so we ended up staying in a regular room. The manager gave us a discount on the room for the inconvenience. The new room was clean and much more modern looking. From this point on we had a nice stay at the the Alana. The staff is very friendly as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Received an upgraded HHonors room - beautiful hotel, great experience, friendly staff, breakfast staff was great. Location is off the beach, but close enough to reach by a short walk. Just get the continental breakfast; if you want more, walk down the street to Eggs and Things.We'll be back.
user_name:
Craig T
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is the perfect hotel if you keep busy seeing the island and Waikiki, but want a clean modern room. It is newly renovated and well cared for and less than a 5 minute walk through Hilton Hawaiin Village to the beach, which is much less crowded on this end. Its a much less busy secretion of Waikiki, but you are still close to everything. My room was not facing the ocean but had a nice view of the city and mountains. Hilton honors got us a decent simple breakfast with good Starbucks coffee. The front desk was very helpful in getting me transportation to Pearl Harbor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is in need of updating. Facilities are very 1980's in appearance. The staff from front desk to housekeeping is excellent. The restaurant is at best average. They try for a boutique type hotel but come across as just being cramped.
user_name:
BuzzCzar
Coastal South Carolina, South Carolina

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a room with 2 queen beds which included a separate living area and a wet bar. The room and bed was clean and comfortable, the staff helpful.It was worth the priced charged for expensive Honolulu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Efficient check in, great value for the location, and overall fantastic. Was able to check in early, close to all the great locations in Waikiki from shopping, eating, and to the beach. Solid workout room and friendly staff. If you are looking to save on the pricey beach front hotels but still have walking access, this is the place!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Ok, not on the beach and not five star but it is a decent hotel and staff are super nice. Room was very clean and all seem to have a balcony. Breakfast was food and not expensively priced. Don't like paying for wifi, especially as it did not work too well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A nice Doubletree in a very good location, this is a better value alternative to the other Hilton properties on the island and does the job nicely so long as you don't have unbelievably high expectations.There is no parking on site, only very expensive Valet parking but if you drive around the local streets you can sometimes find free on street parking (be sure to read the signs very carefully!). There are some nice views to be had from the rooms, albeit a little further back from the sea with some buildings in the way, nothing bothersome however.Overall a nice hotel, clean & comfortable. If on Honolulu you should be spending most of your time outdoors anyhow!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Only spending 3 nights on Oahu and not looking for beachfront so this hotel was great. The room was as expected, a standard hotel room, nice bathroom, although the shade btw bathroom & bed area could be akward for a family. Small refrigerator in the room was convenient. The price was good value for Waikiki standards, with the exception of the "valet only" $30 policy! However vale tstaff were very friendly and certainly helpful. Internet worked well. Pool is quite small and shaded in the afternoon. Location is about 15 min walk to the hustle and bustle area of Kalakaua Ave, we didn't go to the beach but I would estimate about the same, 15-20 min walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room was nice/clean, etc. However, use of the parking garage/fee was outrageous. When you pay this amount of money for a room, parking should be included! Doesn't happen in Vegas! The valets and all employees were very nice and friendly. Also very helpful. Various gift shops & eating places are close by with good food at a reasonable price. They could have put more coffee in the room. You could only make two cups of regular coffee, and we were a party of two which only gave us one cup per morning. We would prefer at least two per person.
user_name:
Carol S
Henderson, Nevada, United States

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: my partner and i came to the doubletree alana to perform our civil union ceremony.we had the penthouse suites,the view was spectacular,the rooms its self was perfect for our small and casual ceremony.when we first arrived the porter valets greeted us with a friendly smile,even though we had like five carts of luggages.the front desk staff also made us feel welcomed,<loved the warm chocolate cookie>.the housekeeping staff was also very friendly and took care of our every need...i am so happy i chose the doubletree alana waikiki for our special day,will be returning again...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rarely can I find such a warm welcome from the valet, registration, housekeeping, meetings, events, banquet, restaurant and security who all welcomed me the same way "Aloha, Welcome" and made my day! Exemplary at all categories...my only challange is to make this review credible I'd have to have a negative thing to say to counter balance all the positive, but the only negative thing I have to say is I had to leave at some point, but I'm looking forward to conducting business here again (and it's close enough to the beach, just a short walk, that I can play too!!!) I CAN NOT RECOMMEND THE PENTHOUSE ENOUGH!!! ;) Tell them Paul Klink sent you!!! I bet they'll remember me...had to thank each one individually and tried.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent six nights here on business. It's a nice hotel with OK interior. Rooms have been upgraded and the Bathroom was much better. $30/day for parking is maybe a little much for this hotel. Wi-Fi is pretty good, but will sporadically drop and the Tv cut in and out they said it was from the wind it's always windy i might get that fixed if I was the GM. As a Diamond member I did get a room upgrade to an Ocean view and the breakfast was very nice. But for the price they are charging for the doubletree and Parking for a few dollars more I would stay over at the Hilton Village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family of four stayed here for three days at Christmas. It's an average hotel, pretty much like other Doubletrees. Need to tighten up some maintenance and housekeeping standards. We asked for a room with two queen beds, and as Hilton Gold hoped for an upgrade. We got a "suite-like" room with two double beds and a sofa-bed, and sliding panels that separated the bedroom from the living area (not a door, hence not sound- or light-proof). Oddly, when checking in, we were assured there were two queen-size beds in the room. Fortunately the sofa-bed was a queen, so there was room for two parents and two teenagers. No upgrade, right next to the elevator, and a very low floor. The bathroom had a frosted glass door to the bedroom, meaning the light disturbed anyone trying to sleep.No bedding for the sofa-bed, but it did arrive within minutes of request. Similarly with minor maintenance issues - burned out light bulb, stopped-up toilet - quickly resolved. The room was spacious and fairly clean, but the sliding glass door to the balcony was covered with greasy fingerprints and never cleaned during our stay. The TV remote battery was dead. The second day we noticed some trouble with the door lock upon return from breakfast - the light would turn green, indicating the key worked (in other words, it had not been deprogrammed due to proximity to a cell phone), but the door wouldn't open. But after two or three ties, it worked so we forgot about it. Went out for the day, to return around 6 pm and find no housekeeping! Told the desk, who called back five minutes later and said, "The deadbolt was locked." Excuse me? What part of "We were out all day" was not clear? And of course we were blamed for deprogramming the key...which was not the problem. The lock was sticky or malfunctioning in some way. In any case, as with other issues, housekeeping came up quickly to make beds and replace towels - inconveniently of course as we had hoped to relax before dinner. If you want proximity to the beach, or any kind of ambience, I would not recommend it. We wanted only a convenient base of operations for a few days in Honolulu, and the Doubletree provided that.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at many so called renovated properties and feel like its only 50-80% redone. I am very, very impressed with how doubletree alana waikiki did with itself. The room is very, very modern and comfortable. I normally stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village, Sheraton Waikiki, Westin Moana or Royal Hawaiian. I have to say, although this hotel is located in the location that's less touristy or lacked of the beach wow factor, but the value that I received I believe it surpassed those mega resorts.From bell desk to front desk to housekeeping and people worked at the bars were all super-friendly and efficient. I felt very relaxed from the moment that I walked into hotel.New room now have brand new built in AC that is very quiet and cold, bathroom is one of the best example of how they utilize the limited space. The shower is one of the best!! Rainfall shower and I love the huge counter space which you can leave all the stuffs without feeling cramped. The beds were all brand new (Mine was only a week old when I inspected). Comfortable sleep at night with the new sun blackout curtains. Also the new LED desklamp which I wonder where they got it from? I am interested to purchase one at home if someone from hotel can contact me directly that will be nice.Definitely worth the price and value, I think this is one of the best kept secret in town and I will definitely return soon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very convenient for two old pals from different neighbor islands to meet in Honolulu to see the musical "Wicked." This hotel is a short walk away from the bus stop at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We were on the 17th floor and had a view of the ocean straight across Fort Derussy and the Hale Koa and a view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village to the right. Queen size beds were comfortable, the Moen fixtures in the shower were beautiful as well as functional, and the coffee was great. We were impressed with the courtesy of the staff on all levels AND the availability of an Eco-car rental. Although we got around by foot, bus and cab, we still appreciated that level of consciousness.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our recently renovated single-king room was very clean with a big, comfy bed. Cleaning staff on our floor were very friendly and efficient, brought us extra towels and pillows promptly! Surprised by the amount of city noise on the 16th floor. Need better soundproofing glass? But all in all a great value in Waikiki!! If you need lots of bathroom space when you travel, you had best not anchor here. But for us simple folk, the Doubletree was a perfect oasis, we made good use of the in-house restaurant and bar, which were workable but not stellar. Because the hotel is located on a one-way street at the beginning of Waikiki, it was a slightly difficult location to drive to/from when navigating the area, but, we will always remember this spot for the great jogging trail around the adjacent Fort DeRussy military reservation which has fantastic access to a portion of Waikiki Beach!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: we had 7 days at hilton village, which is a great hotel, but then me, and t up with more family, and stayed at double tree for last 3 days, excellent value, great staff. good breakfast, nice bar, pool very small, but mins from beach. this must be one of the best value hotels, if you use it well,.ie by going to local outback restaurant, which again is 5 mins away, and excellent value,plus ABC stores next door, for drinks for your room, which has a small fridge.Next door is also burger bar, so if your tired you can fall out of this hotel. Its also well situated, near Alloa Mona centre(center), and other way is the town centre.tax is under 5% , so great buys to be had. If hotel not busy, they will upgrade, if Hilton member. saunders family.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: True, I picked the smoking room as it was the right size and there were no non-smoking rooms left. We did make it clear that we would prefer a non-smoking room but it seems none was available. "Smoking Room" is an understatement. It was a "Smoking Den". The first night we could not sleep because the stench was so intense. We advised the front office and they cleared the smoke and put a special filter which made it more bearable for the next couple of nights. Now the good part: Great Doubletree Service. Great Doubletree Cookies (plenty of them). Nice size room. Excellent in room Coffee (Wolfgang Puck). Perfect location in Waikiki. Near the action but not too near. Easy access. Nice surroundings. They do respect the HHonors Gold Status (Internet, Continental Breakfast and Cookies) Nice Bell Boys. Nice supervisor (gave us Cookies). If it wasn't for the smoke I would have rated it better. They should have done the smoke cleanup before we arrive and not waited until we complained. It was really unbearable. Otherwise good value (if you get a non-smoking room).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was not our first choice, as we preferred to stay in a more upscale and larger beach-front resort. However, visiting Hawaii during Christmas week made our options extremely limited, even though we booked our trip in September. The nicer resort hotels were either sold out, or the rooms started at $500/night. Although the location isn't ideal, it was still very good. It's a 5-minute walk to the beach and about a 10-minute walk to the central Waikiki shopping district. Lots of good restaurants within a 10-minute walk. It's one block from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which is a large beach-front resort with a big collection of nice shops and restaurants. We had a city/mountain view room and paid about $200/night. Our view consisted of more city than mountains, but being from Florida, we were more interested in seeing the mountains than the beach. The staff was extremely friendly, and the hotel was very clean and well-kept. The pool was very basic, and not one where you would want to spend your Hawaiian vacation. The food at the on-site restaurant was excellent. If you want a hotel with a lot of resort-type amenities (beach, lagoon-style pool, multiple restaurants on-site, etc.), you will want to stay somewhere else (and pay considerably more). However, if you plan to spend most of your time exploring Oahu and just want a nice place to spend the night, this hotel is a great option.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Let's start by getting one thing clear, this hotel is not in Waikiki proper but Ala Moana. This is good if you don;t want to be on the busy strip that is Waikiki. The good news is that it's about a ten - twenty minute walk to Waikiki so you can enjoy the business there but stay in the relative quiet down the road. Here are my thoughts on the hotel:1. The location is good with lots of restaurants and amenities nearby. The area is also relatively quiet.2. The staff are friendly and helpful especially the concierge folks3. We had a "suite" which is really one room divided by sliding doors. For a few days with two adults and two teenagers it was fine but think twice for a longer stay. 4. We had two problems... the first was a water glass that had medication left in it by the previous occupants and the second was the room was not set up for four people when we arrived. Both problems were quickly rectified but probably should not have happened at all.5. I read the comments on parking...it is $30 per night and is valet only. I knew this in advance and so was prepared. This was added to my bill later and not requested in cash as one person has written previously.We did not use the restaurant or pool. The pool did not look very inviting and frankly when you are a few minutes from a beach why go there?Overall if you get a deal which was under $200 per night for us I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Especially during 'high season' a good, affordable hotel is hard to find. While it is a challenge, I've stayed at this Doubletree twice now and believe it is an excellent choice for many visitors to Honolulu. Staff is competent and friendly (front desk, housekkeeping, and especially valets) and the rooms are clean with excellent, comfortable mattresses. You won't have a lot of extra space in the room, but there is a small pantry, swimming pool and business center. The biggest disappointment is the restaurant where the 'free' breakfast is absolute minimal and the dinner menu will have you walking down the block (in any direction) for much better fare. The hotel is one block from the beach (and the much more extensive and expensive Hilton Hawaiian Village) but what you lack in beaches here, you get back in terms of peacefulness and freshness, as this is Hilton's newest property on Oahu. It is also convenient to Honolulu's well designed public transportation system. In my opinion, this hotel is an excellent choice for couples and single travelers.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for a family reunion. We were unaware that we were staying during the same week as the marathon when Waikiki is overrun by Japanese tourists! Waikiki was crowded, tours were cancelled and overbooked (we were pipped 3x by tour groups for the submarine, pearl harbour and a waikiki tour). Our little Aussie group of 4 was very unhappy with our Waikiki experience.However - our hotel experience triumphed. Although we are Sheraton preferred guests, we had read bad reviews for the Princess Kaiulani and the Moana was booked out. I had stayed at other American Doubletrees and had enjoyed the experience. When I told my partner we would get warm cookies upon checking in, the deal was sealed and we booked here.From the moment we walked in, we felt at home. Our flight landed at 8.30 and at that time only one room was available. The staff allowed us to check in early - and although I had only booked a city view, we had a King Ocean View on the 16th floor. The room was very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. I'm not kidding about this, I usually can't sleep in strange beds and the mattress and the duck down pillows were heaven after long days walking, walking and walking more through Waikiki. Our parents were upgraded to an Ocean/City corner room when it became available early that afternoon.The staff were incredibly accommodating to all of our requests and they all knew Waikiki very well and were able to give walking/tram/bus directions to all of the spots that we wanted to get to. The valet staff were very courteous and quick to call cabs and shuttles when we needed them. The cleaning staff made sure that our rooms were spotless. I have read some of the reviews about the noise, but we were pleased that when shut completely the glass sliding doors blocked out almost all of street noise - and there were nights that road crews were working - not to mention a marathon outside the hotel.We would visit Hawaii again (we have plans for the other islands) but we would only spend 1 night in Waikiki again (mostly for Waikele!) but we know that we would only stay at the Doubletree again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very courteous. The room was clean and spacious. We were on a high floor facing the mountains, so it was relatively quiet for Waikiki. I recommend this location for all of you marathoners. It's a short walk to Ala Moana, and after the marathon busses drop off at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which is just across the street. The only inconvenience is that we requested a late check out, so that we would be sure to return in time from the marathon, but they couldn't confirm that until after 6am, which is later than the start of the marathon. So, we decided to check out. However, they kept our luggage for us, so we picked it up afterwards. It all worked out.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a great doubletree. We recevied all of our diamond advertised benefits. The continental breakfast was good and then ten dollar upgrade for a hot breakfast was well worth the price. The room looked to be recently renovated as did the halls. The staff were all friendly and accomodating particularly the dining and breakfast staff. My only complaint is tha that the internet was unbearably slow.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a Hilton Honors Gold Member and my last visit here was June 2012 and from what I have seen recently done to the property was GREAT IMPROVEMENTS. I felt obilgated to write a review as I was very pleased with my stay. This is my 8 stay here at the Doubletree Alana and each time I return it seems to be getting better and better. They now have "Grab and Go" food items (which is fantastic idea for those on a tight schedule), The Bistro has improved with more delicious food /choices (I ordered dinner room service and that blew my mind - 200% improvement with service, taste, and plating - thank you). I am very happy to return as I am always greeted by name form the front office staff - Thank You Elsa, Danny, Ewa, Kristen and Manager - Jessica for continueing to provide that 5-Star service I am used to. Pros: Valet staff very quick and promptFront Office Staff very accomodatingLocation (not in the hustle and buslte of Waikiki)Warm Chocolate Chip Cookie +++++Free Upgrade (as a Gold HH) to OceanviewCons:No longer pet friendlyCounter space in bathroom a little tight (especially if more than 1 person is staying)AC unit can only be lowered by Maintenance staff I have already booked my next 3 overnight business trips in December here - and will continue to use Doubletree Alana here on Oahu.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We moved to this hotel after not getting any sleep at a previous noisy hotel. I slept like a baby. We had a room on the 12th floor and a view of the ocean. It was my first Hilton hotel and we were greeted with fresh warm cookies which is apparently routine for Hilton hotels. Our room was a typical sized hotel room and the bathroom was very nice. We did receive free wifi in the room as they are having a free trial(not sure why but it was free so I wasn't complaining). This hotel is about as far away as I would want to be from downtown Waikiki but given how much I ate it was probably a good thing! The staff were very friendly especially the valet staff. They were happy to give advice and were fast at their job. We didn't have a problem with paying for valet parking using a credit card so I'm not sure why a previous person had a problem unless she was not a guest and was only there as a daytime guest. I would stay here again if the price is right.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff:-The directions to find the conference room were written in acronyms that only the staff would understood “PB Communication Seminar” is what the sign stated-When I asked the staff at the front desk where is the Communication Seminar, it was rudely stated to me, “it’s written on the sign” and then she gave me very vague instructions, stating only “Take the elevator to the next floor up” -After getting lost a few times, I found out it was actually: take the elevator one floor up, go to the left down a long hallway, go all the way to the end - past the administration offices of Doubletree, go through a double door, take a left through an outside tunnel where there were apartment buildings to the left and right and then go through another set of double doors – where there was another hallway and the conference room was to the left (this was multiple buildings away from the initial building and elevator)Valet Parking:-There is ONLY valet parking, no other parking is available so folks are forced to pay any fee they set-Even though they do accept credit cards for hotel stays, they do not accept CC’s for their valet parking at the front desk, like all other hotels I’ve ever seen do -It can only be paid in cash, at the front desk, you can’t pay the valet guys…and that required me (and most the other seminar folks also complained) to use their ATM for a $3 total fee that of course, the hotel receives – plus a $2 fee that my bank charged me-When I arrived the 2nd day, I waited in line for valet parking (with only two cars ahead of me) for over 10 minutes, just idling in my car…that was actually sticking out in the road, because there is so little space available to wait-When I picked my car up at the end of the first day, I had to wait about 15 minutes for it to be brought to meConference Room Amenities:-There were no pens/paper/water supplied at the tables like there usually are at other hotel seminars…just one jug of water in the back of the room on a table-The bathrooms were always extremely smelly, like super gross smelly – the entire time I was there the smell never changed, it was very stomach turning-The bathroom trash was overflowing from the beginning of the day to the end, to the point that if you wanted a clean paper towel, you literally had to touch the dirty ones because the trash and the clean paper towels met…so folks had to just wipe their wet hands on their clothing-The air conditioning was so old and loud that it was a distraction from the speaker and made it difficult for the folks in the back of the classroom to hear him

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for business. Very good location. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and Waikiki Beach. Valet parking only, no self park. $30 per day with in/out priveledges. Staff was friendly, valet quick. Very expensive and after all the fees and extra charges it cn add up quickly. Overall a good place to stay as long as you keep in mind it comes with a price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel! I can tell it's been recently renovated, which is always nice. A little pricey but it's expected. Here on business...staff was very nice, and helpful with helping me pick places to eat dinner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's a short walk to the beach and very centrally located. The pool is almost always in the shade because of the location of the pool among the high rises but that's usually okay. Nice staff. Good business location!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we first checked in at Alana, we were tired & exhausted. All we wanted was a comfy bed & a cookie! The staff here did much more than that thanks to a warm & wonderful person named June. We were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary & my husband is awaiting a heart transplant! So getting here was exhausting as you can imagine. She checked on us daily to see if we needed anything!!! She sent a gorgeouse fruit tray & a card signed by all of them wishing us congratulations!! It was exactly what we had hoped for. We 'd already stayed at the busy & noisy beach hotels many times, we needed peace with a view. All the staff are so eager to assist you from the valet to the front desk!! Mahalo to you all, we will definitely be back!!!!! Mary Bordman

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: First the good. The valet attendants were very helpful. The location is good for shopping and the beach is reachable via a mile or so walk.The bad. I have been traveling for more than 20 years 40+ weeks a year. In the past I have worked in Hawaii more than 25 times. This was by far the worst hotel I have stayed in. I was led to believe based on the website that the 2bed suite had two bedrooms. If you check the picture of the 2bed suite it is NOTHING like the room I stayed in. Needless to say the room didn't meet the size requirements for 2 adults and 2 older children. When I complained to the front desk I was told "yeah, I guess the website is sort of misleading". The picture is nothing like the room I received.The really sad part of this is I spent ~250,000 Hilton Honors points for this place. I guess my $25,000 spent at Hilton just isn't worth much to them. Now I get to rebook the next five months of my current project somewhere else.The breakfast was overpriced. Take a walk to Eggs n Things or iHop for better quality.Just stay clear of this hotel. The low price just doesn't justify the end results of a poor experience.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stay at this hotel for 3 weeks every month. I feel like I am at home. The staff is great. The hotel is in the middle of Waikiki. Rooms are clean,nice and comfortable. Each time I spend time in this hotel is very enjoyable for me and I would definitely recommend others.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice hotel right in the heart of Waikiki. Hotel check in was poor as I offered a smoking room which I declined and then was told that there were no other rooms available. I got sold an upgraded room ($30 extra per day) for a non-smoking room.Rooms are nice, well appointed and comfortable. All of the amenities you'd expect.. Internet for a fee of 9.95 per day and parking at $30 per day (!)The gym is nice and overlooks the outside pool.Getting to the beach required walking about 5 minutes across the street and through the Hilton village. Shopping (including the ala moana mall) and dining options abound within walking distance.Recommended.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed one night as a rest point on our way to Maui. Our room wasn't quite ready as we were too early for check in. We were politely told that we could go and come back again if we wished. We declined as we were beat from a 10 hr flight over and so sat in the lobby quietly. Musta been the thing that spooked em cos our room was quickly ready! Ta-dah!I quite liked our superior room. It wasn't big but it did the trick.But it did look clean & fairly newly remodelled. Nice colours of browns & teal.I cant comment about traffic noise as we hit the hay hard but woke refreshed. Abundant pillows & a big king bed.Breakfast was..well...a little uninspiring. $16US got a cold breakfast but $22 would get you a fresh, made to order omelet by the chef right in front of you. Quick frankly, we could've found a better breakfast. I love that there was vit D in my milk! You guys are smart!!!But we loved the location. We walked to Ala Moana shopping centre in about 15 minutes. Theres plenty to see along the way.PS: We adored the cookies (biscuits here!!) they were slightly warm too! mmmmm

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent five nights here on business. It's a nice hotel with OK interior. Rooms are not the largest but adequate. Bathroom was nice. $30/day for parking is maybe a little much. Wi-Fi is pretty good, but will sporadically drop.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was in oahu for just 3 nights, was in Kauai for a wedding before and figured I would extend my vacation a few extra days. Some of the good things about the Doubltree-nicely remodeled rooms. The gym is available 24 hrs. Location is great, walked everywhere I wanted to go. Some of the negatives- since I have gold hilton honors status i receive free continental breakfast. The free breakfast at Hapmton Inns are MUCH better than at this Doubletree. You have the option of spending $9 extra to get the hot buffet items, which were all cold, the only thing hot was the omlete that was made to order. Very disappointing. Also frustrating, the internet connection was SLOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW. Also not sure when the hotel was built but the pool location is not very good. By 2pm there is no sun left on the pool.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent three nights here on a business trip and was looking forward to yet another stay at a DoubleTree Hotel.Positives:-Bathroom was attractive and well set up-Room was cleaned well--Pool was heated and very comfortable-Fitness room adequately fitted-Express checkout made leaving quick and easy-Complimentary newspaper-Ice machine very accessible-Very comfortable bedNegatives:-Outside noise (bus, sirens, people yelling) can be heard into the room and I was on the 16th floor. Hotel is located in Waikiki which is not known to be a quiet zone.-Internet access is charged per device-No self parking-Had to talk to the front desk staff several times, however, there was only one occasion where I was acknowledged (I'll be right with you) I really appreciated hearing it that one time. Another time, I was trying to explain a situation to a Chinese front desk person seemed to be getting frustrated with not understanding a situation I was trying to explain. It was never resolved (she said she would check with the person I spoke with) and I ended up paying for something I was promised would be waived. Obviously she never checked nor got back to me about what I spoke to her about.Despite that, I had an enjoyable stay again and would definitely recommend others to do so as well.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Always stay here when in Honolulu but always expect something different. Room was small. I work a lot in the evening and depend on the internet and the wi-fi here is very poor. Seems like I had to log in dozens of times each night. Room and hotel is so-so clean. Continental breakfast didn't offer much but the supervisors attitude made up for all the deficiencies, a very hard working girl that knows what service is about.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for a week on our honeymoon and had a fabulous experience! It is very rare to encounter a hotel where every staff member from front desk, to bar, to valet, to housekeeping treats guests to the very best of his/her ability. Each question we had was treated with urgency, respect, and knowledge. An especially big rave review for Ace at the front desk. He was always extremely pleasant and helpful. He really went above and beyond on every question we had. When we asked him about buses to Pearl Harbor, he was knowledgeable and went so far as to print off a schedule and dig up some brochures to personally deliver to us in the business center. A true class act. Also our housekeeping woman was always friendly and asking about our stay. This hotel was apparently recently remodeled and was always clean. Showers were a little small, but awesome and very adjustable. They room was laid out in a way that you don't feel like you are in a perhaps somewhat smaller room. We really appreciated the opportunity to skip a few days of room cleaning in exchange for $10 meal coupons. As for location, we really liked it. It was a quick 5 minute walk to the beach, and a fairly easy stroll to the action of downtown. So you aren't really in the middle of the 'party' action, but that makes for a more quiet sleep, imo. We didn't mind the 10 minute walk to the big shops and restaurants, although there are still a good little selection of restaurants right next to the hotel and with a nearby ABC store you have everything you need at an arm's reach.Of course have to end with, as everyone is raving, the cookies are delish!!!!! Wish they would leave one on your pillow at night! ;) I would strongly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here the first time I was in Waikiki and I have to say I was disappointed. The hotel was old in the hallways and reminded me of old Miami Beach before the building were demolished. They should have finished the remodel. There is only 1 restaurant and the service is very slow because the kitchen is on another level. I just ordered a Cesar salad and it almost took 40 minutes. I almost fell asleep at the table and asked for it to go. I also didn't feel like the front desk staff knew much or made any effort. I've been back to Waikiki 2 times since this trip (I've been there 3 times within the year) and I will not come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights on a business trip. The hotel is a few blocks back from the beach, but not too far to walk, so actually a good location if you're not a tourist, but probably not the best if you are. Arrived early in the day, room not available (that's understandable) so asked if they could store my bags--'sure, just go back downstairs to the bell desk & they'll deal with it!' Hmmm. When actually able to check in the receptionist seemed friendlier, and the warm chocolate chip cookie is a nice touch. The rooms are reasonable size, and generally of good standard. My room had two double beds; the bed was OK, but not the best sleep I've had. I particularly found the aircon to be inconsistent: cool enough to get to sleep was hot during the night. The room had a bar fridge & for coffee lovers, a coffee maker. The pool area is small. The bar staff were very friendly and helpful, but I didn't eat in the restaurant with lots of (better value) eating establishments in easy walking distance. Checkout was efficient; the bill slipped under my door during the night & a quick call to confirm and express checkout was done! Overall, there's nothing wrong with the hotel, but for a 'Hilton' brand name I guess I expected a little bit more. The room price fell into the 'little bit more' (than average) category so I would not regard this as great value for money.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are looking to get an experience that is very business-travel oriented with very unhappy front desk and poor service at the restaurant with very average rooms, this is your place. Surprised by the very un-hawaiin attitude at this hotel. I had to stay here for one night with family with 2 kids since our resort hotel was booked up for the first night, it was a terrible mistake to start our hawaiin travel with this hotel stay. They seem to cater to average business traveler but the lack of any welcome greeting or stale service would turn off anyone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check-in went smoothly at the front desk. Very professional. Was impressed with the FRESHLY BAKED COMPLIMENTARY COOKIE! Arrived in hotel room, everything looked decent. Was happy to see the to-go cups for the complimentary coffee, which was a plus for us being that my sister and I are coffee drinkers! Used the bathroom and noticed the previous guest BLACK HAIR in the shower drain....definately grossed me out! Floors were dirty and no face cloths were provided. Looked around for a directory book (which most hotels provide in the room) to see what kind of amentities the hotel offered and where the pool and workout room was located, but could't find one. Decided to walk around the hotel to check out our surroundings . Looking lost, a staff member asked if we needed assistance. She was very attentive, and we were very appreciative that she acknowledged us! We voiced our concerns, also asked if the hotel provided face cloths which was delivered by the time we returned to our room. Valet staff friendly, fast and helpful! At the end of our stay we realized it was just the housekeeper that preped our room who did poorly! By the way, I liked the fact that your hotel is dog friendly!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall my one night stay at this Doubletree was very good.The positives:Comfortable room, nice bed, nicely decorated. I loved the modern look of the flooring and the bathroom. The in-room refrigerator was a nice touch. The in-room coffee is good, it is the Wolfgang Puck brand that Doubletree uses in all of it's hotels. The service at check-in was fast and friendly. I had room service for dinner and it was good, but as always, costs more than dining in the restaurant. The warm chocolate chip cookie that DoubleTree offers at check in, is always a nice touch.You can walk to the beach from here, and lots of restaurants too.The negatives:The main issue for me was the pool area. It is a small pool area, with a small pool. I knew this before I booked, so it wasn't a surprise.I wish the hotel would make the pool area accessible by room key only. There were several pool crashers there the day I was there. Two families that were loud, letting their kids go wild, taking up over half of the patio area. Key access would eliminate this problem, right?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed many times at this property for business and my stays have been comfortable, satisfying and very convenient. I would not however recommend this property for a vacation stay. If your intention is sun and fun on the beach or by the pool the hotel may not be the best choice. Meanwhile if shopping, restaurants and sight seeing are your desire, the Doubletree location provides a very good comparative value on Oahu. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member I have often found it necessary to negotiate for upgrade consideration at the front desk during check in. I do find this not to be an unusual experience when traveling in Hawaii. Depending on the person you are engaged with, this is either a pleant or unpleasant conversation. I would be remiss not to compliment the property for having Danny as an associate on the front the desk. Danny always endeavors to provide an exceptional level of service. My impression would be that the inclination of whoever assigns rooms at this property, is to wait and see if you press the issue....versus proactively providing Honors members the benefits of the program. Getting back to a business perspective, the hotel has a nice early evening happy hour with reasonably priced appetizers and a great bar staff. If you are fried from a long day the accomodations and service are appreciated. I will continue to book this property as my experiences have been so very positive. When on business that is a valued attribute.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed 6 nights and LOVED it! We looked forward to going to sleep each night because the beds were so comfortable. We even wrote down what kind of bed it was, thinking we might want to buy one! Service was great. A fresh, warm cookie at check in. Great location too. Just a 10 minute walk to the beach. Would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Okay, I think that maybe saying Excellent is an overstatement. I mean if excellent means the BEST, this isn't that hotel. But this hotel is better than very good and if you don't need the beach view but want a better- than- very good hotel in Waikiki than this is the one. On an average arrival it is less than 5 minutes from curbside to the room. Each step of the way is not only fast but very courteous and warm, including the cookie!. The rooms are all newly renovated so they are up to date and very functional! And, if you want for anything, the first class front desk can handle any request - at least any request that I've ever made.Location wise, you are a five minute walk from dead center waikiki and only a ten minute stroll to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Honestly, if you are in Honolulu on business, this is the place to stay. If you've visited Oahu on vacation before and want great service but don't need to have a beachfront lanai, this is the place to stay. The only problem is that it's not a secret anymore so the prices have edged up as the occupancy has increased over the past year, particularly in the aftermath of the renovation. It is, however, always my first choice when I am in HNL.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Well located a 15 minute walk from the Waikiki craziness, it presents a well priced alternative option for those not wanting to drop $300/night for beach proximity ..This is NOT the place to lay at the pool- very tinyNOT the place for gourmet dining - walk or cab to many optionsIS the place to use as a base to visit various sites in Honolulu by carIS the place to use to walk to public beach- as all of Waikiki isGood value place with GREAT staffFront desk,valet ,cafe staff all friendly and greatWe will return when again in honolulu

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My stay was from 8/4 - 8/10. At first I was hesistant to book at the Doubletree Waikiki due to a few of the negative reviews, but this hotel exceeded my expectations by far!!!! The room's decor was updated, nice bathroom, quiet room, ok view from the balcony, and excellent housekeeping service. The workout room is nice , with a nice view of the hills and storm that comes in the morning time. The location is convenient to the Ala Moana Blvd, the park across the street, restaurants, and Waikiki beach is within a 10 min walking distance. I would definitely stay hear again. NO BUGS, NO NOISE, GREAT HOTEL!!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just stayed here for one night. The hotel only has valet which is $30. Valet workers were great, offering to take our bags out of the car and up to the room. They directed us to the lobby. The room was very nice and modern. I loved the bathroom. The hotel is newly renovated and it really makes a difference.Pool is small but it wasn't crowded. I suppose most people walked to the beach.The breakfast is great. Patrick and the team at Alana Bistro are very friendly. He greeted me right off the elevator and explained the whole breakfast setup.I have one negative thing to say about the front desk. It was not a good first impression or experience for me checking in. This does not reflect the whole front desk, but just the one girl checking me in. Everyone else was very friendly. Unfortunately I did not get her name and I hope that she was new. I won't go into detail, but she came across as rude.Luckily for me, the stay got better and this review is 99% positive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed August 2012 with a special group. People were friendly, service good. The parking is expensive $28/day, but that's everywhere. Wish wifi had a better range. You can easily walk to Waikiki beach and shopping areas or catch the trolley. They also held all of our bags for free all day because we had a night flight. The staff always greeted us with a friendly smile when we would come and go.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: When I visit Dole, I try to stay here. The staff is great. The room accomodations are perfect for me as a business traveller. The location is perfect for downtime, it is an easy walk to the best area of Waikiki beach to hang out and enjoy the sun, sand, and surf. The work out room is great. The food and drinks at the bar are always great and great service. I have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Holiday Inn Beachcomber too over the years. The Alana Waikiki is the best of those for me, especially with the renovations. Again, the staff has always been great to me. I am looking forward to heading back in October to see customers and enjoy Waikiki. We will book our stay soon.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'he stayed in several hotels on the waikiki strip and for the price, the doubletree is so great.The room is big enough for two and there's a balcony and a nice shower. It looks as if the hotel is brand new and the service is great. also, the location isn't bad. Only 10 min walk from ala moana shopping center and about the same for the beach. Just adjacent to the hotel is a convienence store so that you can get some smacks whenever you like.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a good price for the location. Don't plan to have breakfast here as it is very expensive. Room view was of a very small pool and not much else.My husband and I traveled to Hawaii for the first time in January 2012. We planned to spend three days touring Oahu before moving on to the island of Hawaii for five more days. We had a wonderful morning touring the eastern part of the island before meeting an acquaintance at a Thai restaurant near the hotel. Several hours after lunch, my husband became ill and by 9 that evening we knew he was dehydrating and needed to go to the hospital where he was diagnosed with food poisoning. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. They contacted an ambulance for us and within a minute or two had a hotel employee, who was a local fireman, at the room to assist us until the ambulance came. The next day, the hotel desk called us to inquire about my husband's condition. We ended up staying in the room for the rest of our stay prior to moving on to a great experience on the big island.We were very unhappy with a local tour company with whom we had arranged a tour of Honolulu and side trip to Pearl Harbor. Although I sent discharge papers from the hospital outlining my husband's condition, we were still charged for a tour that we did not take. In all, I would not go back,to the Waikiki area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed on this property for 3 nights while we toured Oahu. It was a nice hotel with very friendly service. I would recommend staying here, unless you're looking for a resort to hang out in. This place is within walking distance of the beach and restaurants and is a better value than a beach front resort. We did not do a lot of hanging out at Waikiki beach, so this was a perfect fit for us. Waikiki beach is too crowded anyway!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Warm greeting, excellent room accommodation as well as warm delicious at check in....can't get any better! Great and very professional service by all of the staff.Hotel location is a plus. Accurate billing was very good too.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We found this hotel to be rather mediocre. The rooms were ok, but nothing special. The view (city view) was of a parking deck. The grounds were quite plain compared to other Waikiki hotels. We only stayed one night (our arrival night, using points to save money), but I would definitely not recommend staying here for a long time. There are better options in the same price range (Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, for example).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Honolulu Advertiser proudly boasts the State of Hawaii is on pace to break a 2007 record set for number of tourists this year. With tourists from all over the world and two major military exercises involving over 30 nations in town, occupancy rates approached 100% in the final week of July. When business is good, hoteliers don't care about you, your status with a brand, or anything except making a buck and keeping the rooms full. My observations follow for your consideration:- HHonors status was never especially recognized at anytime during the visit. It didn't get me a larger room, free water, or make me feel handsome and powerful like other Hilton properties I've visited in the past.- Parking is $30--period. That's the way it is on the island; don't say you weren't told. If you're on an expense account, don't complain, because you're not paying for it anyway.- THIS IS A BUSINESS HOTEL THAT TAKES PETS. If you're interested in luxury, the beach, or are allergic to pets, this isn't the place. I was surrounded by pets on the 16th floor and my room, bathroom in-particular, had the residual smell of urine. - The rack rooms are tiny by Western standards. Internet connections good, Newly rennovated rooms with clean air conditioning ducting. . .except. . . that the AC never was able to keep such a small room cool. Housekeepers shut the AC off after daily cleaning so that when you come home from work around 6 or 7, it's a sweaty, tropical mess.- Elevators tiny, slow, and overused. During my visit the service elevators were out of commission, forcing the hotel staff to use the main elevators, making a bad problem worse.- No laundry on premises; staff advises there is a laundry half a block away; pool is tiny, exercise room small also.- Front desk staff are entry level, inexperienced employees; friendly, but don't know the ropes well. Front desk clerk by the name of "Ace", a new employee, was working hard to get me a larger room. 10 for the effort.- Dining Room: Staff task-saturated during breakfast. One morning when I came down with only my key, and making it half-way through my meal, I realized I left tip money upstairs--I let my server know I was going up just a moment and to leave my meal on the table, even using the international symbol of covering the glass with a napkin. When I returned, no meal, clean table. . .sorry. . .no tip.After 3 days of a tiny room that smelled of urine, poor air conditioning and the world's slowest elevator, I went to several properties close by, begging for room at the end.I moved to a competitor property that had a cheaper rate, a larger room, an AC that could let your room double as a meat locker, and a balcony big enough to pass for a 2nd bedroom.How bad was it? Bad enough to give up four additional days of triple HHonors points without thinking twice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good Business Hotel. Close to business district. Lobby, bar, and restaurant are fine. Workout facility is small but decent. Get a room on 7th floor or above. Views will be so-so. Walk to beach is about 10 minutes and remember you are on the far end of Waikiki a bit away from the main section. Parking is $28 a night and there is no self parking. Rooms have been remodeled and bathrooms are small but well done. Cheesburger of Waikiki is next door and a great lunch spot. IHOP and convenience store around the corner. Closest resort is Hilton Hawaiian Village with shops, restaurants, and bars - but pricey.Scooter rental next door. Great way to get around if you are so inclined. This section of Waikiki is mainly locals and some tourists but you're not in the thick of the beachfront hotel section so it's a little more relaxed. Walking to Lewers Street for shopping or some of the more notable restaurants is a fair distance from this hotel. If you want to be in the heart of the Waikiki scene, this is not it. For business or a good value "off strip" ... this hotel is workable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was in Honolulu for a conference with work and did not choose our accommodations, but for a home away from home, it was suitable. Our office manager was initially told that cots were available as we were booked three to a room, this is incorrect. We were given additional rooms right away (in total we had 8 rooms). My roommate did pay for an in-room internet connection, this was rip-off as you pay PER device, not by room. If you needed internet, you could get free wi-fi in their lobby and if you needed some privacy ( I was Skyping home) the computer room/"business center" was normally empty.Overall the hotel was comfortable, clean and within walking distance to the convention center, beach, shops, and restaurants.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel needs some TLC. The bathrooms are small. There is no place to put your stuff. There is no bathtub. When we arrived at the hotel we were given two bed room. I am a silver Hilton Honor member. My profile states that I like king bed, non smoking and on a high floor. I went down to ask that I asked for a king bed room. The gal at the front desk said that there was no king rooms available. I asked to speak to the manager. Danny the Manager found a room with a king bed. Nice hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Comfortable hotel in the middle of Waikiki. Close to lots of shops and restaurants. Ideal for an overnight or few days stay. The 1-bedroom suite easily accomodated our party of 5. Separate living area with sofabed was very comfortable. Great view from the balconies by the bedroom and living room. Great space for storage of all our suitcases. Nice bathroom. The pool and pool area are small but the location to the beach and other hotels is ideal so you'll have other options. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the valet attendant was always available.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at this property on half a dozen different occasions, each time on business. The hotel is clean and centrally located, within easy walking distance to the beach and to downtown Waikiki. It is also walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center. If you're adventurous, you can also walk to Honolulu. The hotel could be more "business friendly," but the staff it's a reasonably priced option for downtown. I will definitely return to this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Arrived to a power outtage...phone doesn't work in my room.... rude customer service. Menu isn't updated with options they actually have.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a fantastic stay at this wonderful hotel. Our criteria: high-quality value-for-money home-base to explore Oahu. Family of 4 on our third of three islands. Great beds (2 queens ... we found no other high quality hotel that would guarantee queen beds in the Waikiki area), large clean bathrooms, balcony views of the city of Honolulu and the mountains, fast elevators ... free cookies every day ... reasonably cheap parking (valet only). We are explorers. Walking is how we experience our world on vacation and we preferred not to pay a huge premium to stay on the beach but to spend the difference on food and fun activities. The hotel is walking distance to all of Waikiki and surrounding Honolulu ... it proved to be a perfect location for us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We are military, stayed for a week during our move out. The staff helped us from the beginning ... We had reservations for all but 1 day, they found us the extra day when we checked in. Set us up for 7 days with adjacent rooms for our kids. The housekeeping personnel were extra friendly and always helpful (same lady all week, Elvira ... Tops). On checkout, took care of all the 'military' stuff (tax exemption, faxing TLA paperwork, etc.). Even got us a late checkout on a full occupancy day because we are flying out late. This is the best service I have had in a long time. Room was clean, nice blankets, my wife is a hotel snob and the blankets even lived up yo her expectations. Pool was clean, nice workout rom. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came to Honolulu on business -- yes, some of us do that. We were a group of four; each of us had complaints (which will be going to Hilton management). First issue was check-in. Three of the four of us were Gold status with Hilton; none of us were given the perks that should come with it when we checked in. I asked about it, and was assured by the clerk that I wasn't Gold. So, I called corporate -- of course I am Gold. Corporate refused to call the hotel to straighten them out, but when I called the desk and asked them to call corporate to check, they said "Oh yes, we made a mistake." Mistake times three? Doesn't work that way, sorry. In general, reception was busy and surly. They were not at all useful in recommending restaurants.Then, I got a handicapped room -- not a huge problem, but it would have been nice if they had asked if that was OK. Issues were that the shower, since it was open, flooded the bath, and there was no counter space because of wheel chair allowances. OK, maybe they were short on rooms. The room was adequate, although there was no place to hand wet towels or bathing suits. No microwave, but a coffe maker. Another of my companions asked to switch rooms after his first night -- his had a cockroach invasion -- bathroom, counter and floor, and the coffee area. (They did so and gave him a nice room.)The pool is on the 3rd (or so) floor. I went out one night and was surprised it was empty but soon learned why. The way it was set up strong winds were channeled through the pool area making it cold to swim; there is no spa. Also, the design of the pool stairs made it difficult to swim laps -- there was no real turnaround area at one end.My room had a lovely view of the roof of the downstairs and the next door hotel. Couldn't see anything green unless I went out on the lanai and leaned over to see the park at the end of the street. As I type this, I can't hear my music over the sounds of the road (and possibly construction) that are coming through the (closed) window. I was also unable to bring the temperature of the room below 74 degrees – a bit warm for sleeping. I would have left the door open, but the proximity to the next door balcony, not to mention the street noise, made that an unwelcome option. Not a holiday hotel --- I've done worse in downtown Pittsburg!Being Gold, once it was straightened out, gave me complimentary continental breakfast buffet. OK meal (cereal, toast, bakery), although short on fruit choices. My non-Gold colleague paid for his breakfast; $16 for a bowl of oatmeal and a pot of tea! If you opt for the hot breakfast it is $22! Definitely not worth it.I won’t come back, even for business. There has to be someplace better to stay. Hilton, get your act together! One expects better than average in a resort town, not worse!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is the only Plus to this hotel. Its located on the downtown strip and close to the beach. But, I had to ask for towels several times and the worse part is the roaches that were in the bathroom walls. I dont mean a few but there were even baby roches. I told the front desk so maybe they can get some one to spray.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great group stay. We had a group stay at the Doubletree Waikiki on for 53 nights and the other 25 nights. The staff is very accommodating and very welcoming. The travelers raved about the new rooms and the service received from the staff. We have had some customers travel back in the last six months and they always request the Doubletree. OurExtendedstay

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great stay within walking distance of beach, restaurants, shopping and sites. Good room with city view. Friendly staff

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here because I wanted a hotel that accepted pets. While they do accept pets, it is a hundred dollar fee which is ridiculous. The parking is valet only-$30 per night which is crazy when you're already paying 197+tax (13%) for a room here. Just a heads up the rooms are small and not really ocean view because there are too many buildings in the way. Internet is free in the lobby but not in your room, but if you want Internet in room it's $10 per night. Frige not even big enough for bottled waters. Getting in was ok but you can only come in from one side of road so prepare to do u-turns or go around the block. Room is semi-clean..no dirt but no real maintenance (my shower door pops really loud because the hinges are corroded-I'm waiting for it to break). The people and staff were nice but the overall greediness of the hotel is outrageous...stay away from doubletree unless you want to spend a ton of money for items that should be free..

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I chose this hotel for a 2 night stay as it is an easy walk to both the heart of Waikiki and the Ala Moana shopping centre.Bed was comfortable with modern upgraded furniture and bathroom.I booked a partial ocean view room which was on a high floor and offered a distant water view and a small balcony.Breakfast was adequate but not exceptional, and included eggs cooked to order.Wailana Cafe is a 24 hour restaurant located a 2 minutes walk away that serves decent reasonably priced meals.All staff I came into contact with were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Centrally located in Waikiki and close enough to the beach and shopping when you have time for diversions. Every staff member was super friendly and helpful...especially Junie in the Bistro. It would be nice, however, if Hilton would allow their Doubletree guests to have Hawaiian Village pool privileges.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was in town for business, but my stay included the weekend as well as a couple of weekdays. The hotel is in a location that allows easy walking to both Waikiki Beach or the Ala Moana mall in the other direction. You're a 10-15 minute walk away in either direction. The hotel is nice and clean. The bed wasn't the greatest but the shower was; great water pressure. The hotel staff, from the door men to the front desk folks to the cleaning staff, were all friendly and helpful. When I was checking out, the cleaning lady even thanked me for staying there, and I thought that was really nice. I asked the front desk for a late check out and the lady at the desk was helpful with that, telling me that it might be available but they'd have to check on occupancy the next day. She provided the possibility of paying for an extra half day for a 6pm checkout or a simple late checkout, if either was available. I called the next morning to find out and they said they could let me checkout only an hour later, at 1 pm. The only complaint I have is that they require you to pay for internet service in the room, although it is free in the lobby. Since I was out most of the day and night, I decided to rely on my cell phone for 3G internet rather than paying for it.This is a solid hotel for business or pleasure.
user_name:
fwy
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I will just put into list the things i felt about my stay.1- Room was clean and cleaning staff was polite.2- 1st breakfast ran into an issue with my partner having a pc of toast off of my plate, "so are we charging you for two meals"...I didnt know it was all you can eat and felt bad about that, i understand some can take advantage. (still poor response).3- the front dest was helpfull when asked, and polite.4- Not a fan of the pay for internet in my room situation, my co workers stayed elsewhere and payed nothing. (it is free in lobby) i was on 15th floor.5-pool is on front of bldg, (not a great tanning spot), yet still very clean and welcoming.6- close walk to beach- cut through other resorts to save a few min. walk.7- Helpfull with tracking down things you would like to try etc at the desk. ( 1 min walk to rent 3 wheeler- kinda like a moped ) Very fun!!!!> i recommend!!8- If you are on a tight budget, go to Walmart...prices are the same as the states.9- try the Loco moco @ the Rainbow....Its as local as it gets10- Drinks and food can be MUCH cheaper if you ask prices 1st on the beach, some are $11 for a beer and some are $4 within a short walk.11- haggle with locals when buying goods(abc) if you are spending a decent chunk. they will toss in free stuff.12- Take a rt out of Hotel and walk a short bit, you will find a sunk down tavern called Snappers..they have a $3.99 Breakfast that is great. (if your picky about food do the in hotel all u can eat) Was $16.99 when i was there but had it all....13- if you have questions about anything you can email me and ill get back to you asap.( i dont work for them i just stayed there and like to help)...Email: dive436@hotmail.com ..say Hawaii so i know.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I spent a week at this hotel, and we had a wonderful time! We have been to Waikiki many many times before, and this trip we were mainly going to be SCUBA diving, so we didn't need to pay for an oceanftont room, when we were spending a good chunk of time under water. The location is actually great, a short walk to the beach - close to the other hotes/shops/restaurants as well as the international market. The hotel interior was nice. One note - if you are a Diamond and have "high floor, away from elevator" as your profile - just know that the bigger rooms that they consider "upgrade" actually are rooms that wrap behind the elevator. We were surprised at first, but it was wonderful to have the extra space. You only really heard the elevator in the bathroom, not in the bedroom. The breakfast was nice, a bit overpriced if you had to pay for it but we had continental free with my husband's status and it was more than adequate for the time we were there. The staff was very friendly and made the whole experience very lovely! Highly recommend this hotel if you don't want to pay and arm and a leg for the beachfront properties.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: "Great Location, clean rooms, Friendly and Helpful Staff." Got lots of Delicious cookies. The beach and shopping area was a couple of blocks away. So worth the walk.That was awesome! Nice to be around the corner from Wailana Coffee Shop which opens 24 hours. We had a wonderful experience!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here over memorial day weekend had had a great experience. I travel for work and try to always stay at a hilton property. This one did not disappoint. Our first time together in Hawaii, so we wanted to be close to the beach and all of the action. The location relative to the Hilton Hawaiian Village is perfect, (easy access to rental car, vacation information, beach, bus stops etc) without being too crowded. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I had a screwy reservation issue (made multiple reservations back to back) and the management made accommodations to keep us in the same room without moving our bags around.
