The staff was friendly and helpful for getting around.Walking distance to great shopping (incl International Marketplace), the beach and restaurants, those with a local feel as well as "touristy". There is a laundry right next to the property. We had a city/street view room, however the distance from the other hotels gave us a beautiful view of the mountains. I had to work one afternoon and was able to get email/internet/VPN without any problem...as to be expected, video downloads were a little slow in the evenings. We will be back...Mahalo!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good: Staff were great, especially Earl and Patrick in the bar. Rate was good, had a special with free parking and free 25 dollar a day dinner voucher. Cleaning crew were very kind and always waved hello and good bye. Got plenty of cookies. Bad: Experience two different night with cockroaches. Internet is very slow at times.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checking in was smooth and painless, plenty of helpful staff at the desk after a long day of traveling. I had a King suite on a high floor and the view was quite nice. The room was of good quality although not very big and the bathroom was quite small. I'm an average-sized guy and I found the shower to be a little claustrophobic... The rooms have been renovated recently and did look quite nice. The location was good, only a 2 min walk over to the Hilton Hawaiian Village with all the shops and restaurants. The hotel restaurant is not recommended. The food is ok, but just getting our bill for three printed correctly turned out to be a 45 min ordeal. Like most things on Oahu you pay for every detail, valet parking is $29 per day and internet in your room is $10 per day or $50 per week (make sure you ask about charging "per device". The internet signup website says "per device" but the clerk said it should only be "per room" (I travel for work with 2 computers)). If you can find a room at the Hilton Hawaiian Village or the Embassy Suites down the road I highly recommend those over the Doubletree.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We just stayed here one night, but the service was great and the location was a couple of blocks from the heart of Waikiki. Our room was upgraded to a nice sized suite above the pool. The pool seemed a bit small, but why do you need a pool when the beach is a couple of blocks away!? The rooms were nicely updated with a very comfy bed.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just completed a 7 night stay at the Doubletree Alana Moana Hotel, nice rooms, property is located in good area near the hilton hawaiian village and many other hotels.The big negatives: Pool area is not worth hanging out at, only one bar/restaurant on property, service is hit and miss.Don't bother asking for late checkout if you are on a redeye flight back to the mainland, I am a hilton diamond member and they did not care.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checking in, usually the worst part, was a breeze. Kristen was super patient in helping me with room options, and was really friendly and welcoming. Every employee we encountered was friendly, actually. The room was well decorated and clean, and just perfectly laid out. This is not a luxe hotel, of course, but terrific value at this price point. The only neg would be parking, which is expensive ($30/day for valet only) and limited. Kamaaina is free though, so this is more a comment for out of towners.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Because, heaven forbid, if your plans change (or there is a problem w/your flight), & you try to cancel less than 3 days from your expected arrival date, they will charge you anyway. Like another reviewer, I have never had this kind of problem w/a Hilton hotel but lesson learned-will not book another stay here; I'm sure the Marriott will be more than happy to have me back anytime.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here near the end of March. Anyway, I'll just dive right into it. At check in, we were met with a sense of false security. The agent just wanted us to go right to our room. We were offered cookies, both of which were cold. Our room was located in the dull part of the hotel-the 5th floor, near the streets. Walking out of the elevator, our floor looked completely dilapidated. Our room however, was very clean and the bathroom even better. Shower products were by Crabtree and Evelyn and came in mini shampoo, conditioner and body lotion bottles containing citron and cucumber. Our balcony unfortunately did not shine nearly as close as the rest of the room. The view was street side and noisy. Also, our air conditioning was broken. No upgrade offered to us for being members. Also, do know that it is valet only and charged every day.The service was tiresome. On my first night, I requested a toothbrush. The front desk handled my request in a very timely manner. The person that delivered it to me though handed me the toothbrush by holding his hand in front of me, didn't look/acknowledge me and walked away without saying anything-very cold response. We did enjoy the daily newspaper though. On our last day, we printed our boarding passes complimentary at the business center. We were handed a copy of our bill and two cookies, this time warm. My take on it is simple. There is a cold arrival and a more than warmer get the hell out of the hotel already attitude. I wish I could have experienced what others speak of on their comments-in a positive light. I'm glad they enjoyed themselves. I, on the other hand, will not be returning.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for 12 nights at the end of February and prior to arriving and reading all the reviews for this place on a variety of travel sites we were a little afraid that we had chosen to stay at the wrong place......we were wrong. This hotel is a hidden oasis!! From the moment we checked in the whole stay was a pleasure. The cookies at check in were divine and we managed to get two lots of them!!! The pool was reasonably sized and wasn't ever crowded when we used it, who goes to Hawaii and just uses the hotel pool anyway? Our room was on the 18th floor and had great views to the mountains. The room had been recently renovated and was very nice. In all the reviews that I read people were complaining about the size of the shower and that you couldn't turn around in it... maybe not if you were the size of a sumo wrestler! It had fantastic water pressure and a huge shower head. As for all the complaints about noise well you are on one of the main roads into and out of Waikiki, we weren't bothered by road noise. The hotel was within walking distance to the heart of Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping centre. Close to the lagoon and Friday night fireworks. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting Honolulu!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed several nights before and after a cruise. The location was excellent.We were only 1/2 block from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which was right on the beach. We were able to walk there in 5 minutes. The Round Table Pizza Restaurant had delicious pizza at a reasonable prices, which is in the Hilton Village. Breakfast was not included in our room rate, but there was a Coffee House & IHOP just down the street. I was very please with thesenior rate of $119.00 per night, which I booked months in advance. I had read on the reviews that all the rooms had been recently renovated, and they were just like new. The standard double queen room was extremely roomy with a large shower & bathroom with separate vanity. There was a small fridge in the room and a balcony. The beds & pillows were extremely comfy.There were delicious warm chocolate chip w/walnut cookies always available. We stayed on the 7th & 8th floors and it was quiet. A coffee machine was available with complimentary coffee & teas. The hotel had free wifi in their lobby, but it was an extra charge in your room.They provided complimentary use of their business center for printing our boarding passes.There is a $29.00 per day charge for valet. I would highly recommend the Doubletree Alana Hotel. Be sure to book in advance, as I checked the rooms a few weeks before we were to travel and the price was $50.00 higher per night.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Now, I have to begin this review with a disclaimer: my husband and I had enough Hilton Honors points to get us our room for free for 3 nights. So, I cannot really give a fair review in terms of value because, for us, it was a very good value!The Doubletree in Waikiki is your standard business hotel. I believe this to be an older hotel with recently updated rooms as the rooms were smaller than your typical American hotel room these days. The room was well-appointed with your typical Hilton decorations. We had 2 standard beds, a desk and chair, a dresser and flat-screen TV. There was a bench with drawers to provide additional storage. The closet was built into the wall with cabinetry which provided a European feel and was a good use of space in this otherwise smallish room. I think the best thing about Hilton properties are the beds. I find them to be super comfy!The bathroom was small but also efficient. Doubletree provided the standard soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. A hair dryer was available in the room. The towels were thick and fluffy.I do believe there was a safe provided in the room.Overall, our room was very clean and the hotel generally quiet. The front desk staff didn't go out of their way to greet you like at other Hilton properties I've visited, but they were helpful and happy to mail our postcards for us. The valet staff were VERY nice and helpful. They arranged our airport shuttle for us quickly and were happy to flag a cab. This property also participates in the Green Car program where you can rent a hybrid car for $15/hour or $95/day. We didn't take advantage of this service, but I liked the idea, especially in Honolulu where having a car isn't a necessity but it could make your commute to see some of the sights a tad quicker.We felt the hotel was very conveniently located with plenty of restaurants within walking distance and bus stops close by. There is an ABC Store just around the corner...a small pharmacy-type store basically across the street...and an International House of Pancakes within walking distance to grab a cheaper-than-the-hotel breakfast. The walk to the main part of Waikiki is several blocks long, but the weather is so awesome in Hawaii that who wouldn't want to take a stroll? And, the hotel is near Fort Debussy Park which is nice to stroll through and has great beach access.I have two complaints, and these are pretty standard for me with most properties: 1) Eating on-site is EXPENSIVE and the food isn't that special. We ate at the breakfast buffet our first morning in Honolulu and spent $57 for 2 buffets and the tip! The buffet was your standard American and continental breakfast fare, with some local favorites like Portuguese sausage and rice thrown in. Is $57 worth the chef they keep on hand to make an omelet for you? Not in my opinion. 2) We ladies would like to have a magnifying mirror, preferably lighted, in order to take care of our beauty needs. This wouldn't be that hard to provide, nor that expensive. I have found one hotel that provided a magnifying mirror. I was so excited! Come on Hilton! With your nicely appointed, want-to-feel-like-a-boutique-hotel rooms, a magnifying mirror would really add to to your customers' comfort!All in all, there is nothing horribly wrong with this property. Would I recommend it for a romantic honeymoon? No. Would I recommend it for business travel? Yes. Was it worth the Hilton Honors points? Well...that depends. But, given that hotel rooms in Honolulu usually start around $200, it worked for us. Just don't expect anything special...cozy...boutique-y...but you are staying in Waikiki within walking distance of all of the shopping and beaches. You could do much worse!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were at the Double Tree in Honolulu, Hawaii from Feb 1 to Feb 22 then again Feb 29th. Had lovely mountain view from 17th floor the first stay. On the 29th we were on 5th floor all we had for a view was the back side of a crappy apt. building and parking lot. They did get us in a room before check in time though so didn't complain. For the most part the room was fine, the corners needed a little better cleaning. The maids didn't dump the ice bucket daily so finally left a note for them to dump the ice bucket daily. Had to leave a note to keep enough towels for our use. Was a hole in sheet which isn't Hiton standards, called and told them about it. Changed it the next day but a few days later had it back on the other bed...figure out how that happened. If you stay here the Coffee House about a block and a half west is and EXCELLENT place to eat. Large selection on menu and get a LOT of food and the prices are reasonable. The front desk people were always very good about giving us information. One day they had the water shut off for maintance said there would be bottled water at front desk. I went to get some water there was three of us and they would only give me one bottle of water. They do let you print your plane tickets for free but charge $9.95 per day for internet service in your room and a $1.00 per call if you local calls from their telephone in the room....think that is a bit much. Elevators are small with wheel chair three of us in the elevator filled it up pretty good. Over all it was a good place to stay and would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Honolulu. Just make sure you get above the apt. view as it isn't a nice view at all. There is a laudramat across the street so that was handy. No laundry facility at the motel unless you want to pay them to have your laundry done.....very expensive.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Do not stay at this hotel, roaches, bad service, I order a cheese plate and the crackers were saltines and ritz crackers. Both nights I stayed there were roaches in the bathroom, I complained to the front desk staff and got no where....The manager refused to refund any monies for such a horrible stay. I am a Hilton Honors member and complained to Hilton.com, which I have never done...this hotel is terrible on every level.After several emails, and calls management still did not handle to my satisfaction.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice reno, good service, and relatively clean.Note - we had to change rooms (no problem w/front desk) - the x22 series rooms are a bit cramped, but front desk was more than happy to accommodate a move; including moving our luggage to the new room while we were out & about (awesome!)Location is conveniently located near the Hilton Hawaiian Village, with easy access to the beach and the Wailana Coffee House.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The "newly" renovated hotel makes an ideal location for shopping, being between Ala Moana Center and the shopping are of Waikiki. Friendly staff and being a small size hotel luggage assistance is prompt. Bathrooms one of the best around with walk-in glass showers with oversized "rain" shower-heads. Comfortable rooms and accommodations, would highly recommend this small friendly hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very friendly staff, and nice rooms. No view really, but quiet rooms with good service. Great bell services and valet. Only negative, bathrooms are small. Has been remodeled over the past year or two. Much improved.Have stayed here several times, and will continue to do so. Not the Hilton Village, but cheaper and a good stay.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at the HHV a few times, and have often walked past the DT and wondered what it'd be like to stay there ... it's certainly cheaper.Well I'm here right now and I am very impressed. Location wise it's 1 block from the Kalia Tower at HHV. Rooms are nice, I understand that it's been recently refurbished, which no doubt makes the rooms a pleasant place to be. Bathroom is a little small, but the walk-in shower is excellent. I wonder if they could have made the bathrooms a little bigger when they refurbished?As a Diamond I got a high floor, free Wi-Fi (which I'm using now - it's fine) and free continental breakfast ... however, given that there's the excellent Wailana Coffee House, an IHOP, a Denny's and other breakfast places very close by I wouldn't pay for breakfast here ($16), or even the $9 uplift for hot breakfast.There's traffic noise when the doors is open or when sitting on the balcony, but I quite like the buzz from the city. Quiet with the door closed though. I can just about see Diamond Head from the balcony (over the top of the Waikiki hotels) ... so called mountain view.Air conditioning is also very good and really quiet.I like this place, I'll be checking the prices here for my next visit.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was in Honolulu for business and a great rate was offered. I've stayed at this property several times because of its value. I am happy to say that the hotel has finally undergone renovation and the rooms have been significantly updated. If you are a visitor on vacation, I would recommend you stay elsewhere if you want to be close to the beach and the attractions of Kalakaua Avenue. For business, it's great because you can get in and out of Waikiki easily. The staff, particularly the valet parking folks, are efficient and friendly. So, too, the front desk. I was disappointed in two things. First, the hotel charged for Internet use in the Business Center. That didn't seem right, particularly for a Gold member. I also was disappointed that I couldn't take a few things to go from the breakfast buffet before heading off to a meeting. I never had a problem before taking fruit and yogurt, for example, if I don't have the time to sit down and dine. I've been able to do this at other Hilton properties, from Hilton resorts to Hampton Inns), but I was told it couldn't be done at the Alana. Oh, well. I guess every location has its own policies. Thanks to everyone else who made this stay at the Doubletree Alana so comfortable. Great job on the room remodel, too!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I normally prefer to stay more in the thick of things in Waikiki but decided to cash in some HHonors points and this was the only hotel available. The location was definitely a drawback if you like to be in the heart of the action as it is on Ala Moana Boulevard at the far edge of Waikiki. There can be some street noise from the traffic. Still, I got some good exercise walking back and forth. The rooms were definitely the high point of the stay. Very recently remodeled, immaculately maintained, great shower and air conditioning. I had a lanai with a view of the ocean off in the distance. The service from the employees was friendly and cordial. They have a nice pool but it tended to get rather windy on the pool level. The gym had a great selection of cardio equipment. However there were a few minor bumps in the road that colored my stay. There were repeated elevator issues and one day 2 of the 3 elevators were out of service. This was a huge inconvenience in a very full hotel that was almost 20 stories. The breakfast in the restaurant was always disorganized with stacks of plates on empty tables and buffet trays that had not been replenished. I couldn't really complain because breakfast was free for me but it was obvious they were having some organizational issues. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I'd stay here again, if the hotel were right in the heart of Waikiki it would be perfect!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is very clean. The hotel is very nice. Management very professional. Excellent hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed one night before running the Honolulu Marathon. As a result, I cannot comment on the hotel as a whole but I had a very good experience. The property is on the Ewa boundary of Waikiki and is a comfortable 15-20 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center (where the race started), and the same time to the middle of Waikiki, or to the beach. I booked a king/mt. view room for one hundred thirty five bucks, which was a great price for the time and place. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. At check-in, I was given a (space-available HH Gold) upgrade to a penthouse king suite. The room itself was fantastic and since my stay was so short, I really did not get to take advantage of the space. However, it was very comfortable and was all that should have been expected. I loved having the fresh breezes blow in from the balcony. The view was “okay” and the Wi-Fi was fine, though, I did not stream content. I didn’t use the whirlpool tub but the shower was excellent. Because of the marathon, I requested and was given a late check-out without any second thoughts on the hotel’s part. I had three nasty blisters and asked the nearby housekeeper for a sewing kit. Within a couple of minutes, the kit showed up at my door and staffer refused to take a tip. I didn’t have a car but had a visitor park for two hours at a very small rate. The Sunday paper was complimentary where a number of Hilton properties I have stayed at, any paper delivered is automatically charged to the room unless a request is made to stop delivery. For HH members, the points/money splits could end up being very good values. Not all properties do that. Obviously, because of the upgrade, this stay was a tremendous value. On price alone, it appears that the stay would have been a good value. This property is away from the major crowd crunch. If I need to stay in this area again, I will consider this property.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff was VERY nice, but I felt like I got less than I ordered. Room was clean, modern, but had no bath (only a shower). For the price there are hotels with complete rooms. Valet parking was only 4$ more expensive than at the Hilton parking garage, but it would be nice to know there were no other options. Pool was small, fitness area was adequate. Def not the worst, but nothing to write home about.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Earl in the Bistro is awesome... Best bartender in the state!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights with Family in one of the Suites as part of a larger vacation to Oahu and the Big Island.Last time we were here, we stayed at the Ali Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village – the Room and Tower were superb, but you can’t disguise how big/impersonal the HHV is, a fact I was reminded of, when went down there one evening for a Firework show by the beach.The Doubletree is what I consider the Hilton Hawaiian Villages “Little Brother” – its 10mins walk from the HHV and the beaches, and you can easily get to the other parts of downtown Honolulu, either walking, driving or taking the “Trolley” buses. There are several stores and places to eat within the area, either local or one of the chains – although if you are a Red Lobster fan, be prepared for a wait, I was told the one by the Hotel is the only one in the area.Because it is smaller, it almost has a boutique feel to it, a big plus is that getting to/from the room and out and about was quick and east.Granted the Hotel Building is a little older, but it has had a renovation recently and I was pleased with the room and the public areas. Being in a Suite was definitely a plus, gave us a little more room to move around, so if you have the option I would go for it. As others have mentioned, try and get a higher floor room, but don’t worry about a view, the ocean view is one of those – “Its over there” typesThe Staff was fantastic, warmly greeting us when we arrived after a Very Long and Tiring flight, and remembering us throughout our stay, asking how things were and asking after my Son – who sadly was unwell for one day, which sucks on a vacation!As others have mentioned, the Parking situation isn’t great – but $30 a day is in line with most other hotels in Downtown Honolulu so I guess you cannot fault them for that, a little investigation and if you don’t mind a little walking back/forth there are cheaper options.I didn’t like their business center– we needed to print out tickets for an activity, but to do anything in there – even check email - required $$$ in the slot .I guess it depends what you want – this isn’t a resort hotel , but it doesn’t pretend to be, it isn’t a 5 star Hotel with all the trimmings, but it doesn’t pretend to be that either. Unless you need either of those, or you need to be right in the middle of the action, I don’t think you can go wrong staying here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is an ok and quiet 3 star hotel close to the shopping district. Not too much hassle on the street. However it is about 10 min to the closest beach and is sharing with Hilton village a few minutes away.If you are a honors member, you will be disappointed due to the lack of amenities that other doubletree hotels provide in the mainland. E.g. Are 30 buck overnight parking, no American breakfast buffet, no complimentary upgrade of the room and very slow Internet. Despite which side your room is, the views are the same, so I suggest not paying extra to have a higher floor or a sea view room . The biggest thing is that there is no self parking and we are stuck using services from valet. I think this is quite annoying as every time you pull your car in or ask them to bring your car, a tip is expected ( and I mean not just a couple of bucks) but about 10 dollars. The front desk is ok, I will not rate them as ooh- wow. The breakfast was also sub standard and I don't know why they are charging nine bucks to upgrade from a continental breakfast. The fitness centre also needs renovation.After walking in the nearby shopping district, I saw plenty of other hotels and with cheaper rates plus breakfast options. If I was not a honors member, I would have chosen them over doubletree. In fact I would go ahead and advice all honors members, particularly diamond members to not to stay here - I know your expectations and this hotel cannot fulfill any of those. While it was an average experience here, the bathroom shower and the bed was comfortable. This may have been the reason I agreed to continue my stay, else I would have left and stayed at a nearby hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Located about a block from the beach. Came to Hawaii to spend time on the beach, not hang out at the hotel, so the location was great and the price was less than properties right on the beach. Check in was efficient, staff was pleasant, continental breakfast was good and free as an HHonors Member. Higher floors are quieter. You can park in the public garage on the next block for $16 to avoid the $30 valet parking. If you want to save $40 a night and don't mind walking a block to the beach, this is a great choice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If this property had free WiFi in all rooms, it would be superb although you can pay $10 per day for WiFi in your room. It is a nice 5 minute walk to restaurants and shops in Waikiki as well as Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Beach Park.Staff are friendly, but hotel probably lacks a good concierge. Rooms spacious and clean with nice decor.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Alana the first week of January, 2012. It is a nice place in a location that makes it convenient to walk to both shopping and the beach. The rooms are nice, but be aware that there is only a shower, not a bathtub. Light passes freely from the washroom to the sleeping area, so it is not ideal for guests who wish to rise and sleep at different times. The employees were friendly, but seemed somewhat less knowledgeable and helpful in arranging transportation, dinner reservations, and activities planning than I would expect from most hotels of this type.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Seven minutes walk to the beach, five to Waikiki or about 10 to Ala Moana shopping. Decent breakfast, nice rooms and of course the doubletree chocolate chip cookies are to die for. About 3 minutes walk to the Hilton Center, across the street from Ft. Derusy.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Employees are great. Not great for a business person. Near most downtown stuff but missing Airport shuttle, very slow internet, have to pay to use the business facilities. Was told there was a shuttle but none when I arrived. Careful using the other shuttle services. Reliable shuttle isn't that reliable. Wanted to stack people like cord wood then the dispatcher supposed to have sent the second unit, that got screwed up.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We chose this hotel because it is a little cheaper than the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Here is the good;- It is quiet, comfortable and all that you would expect in a 3 star hotel- The exercise room is pretty good for a hotel- Service is friendly- Most shuttle services pick up at this hotel though some will tell you to wait at Hilton Hawaiian VillageHere is the not so good- If you plan on renting a car, you should know that parking is 30 bucks a night. Probably true of anyother hotel in Honolulu- Breakfast is available but it's expensive as is the case with everything in Hawaii- Housekeeping comes in at very strange times like 2 or 3 PM. This is not a huge deal but it's a little unexpected- The hotel is about 0.7 Miles from where everything happens on Waikiki i.e. The major shopping strip, beaches - If you are on higher floors (we were on 17) and you page 10 bucks more, you get a view that includes a slice of the ocean somewhere over there. - The pool is tiny. Feels awkward to be in there with anyone else. They really need to fix the pool situation ASAP. No one expects an olympic size pool but come on, that pool is pitiful. - Internet is free only if you have status with Hilton otherwise, it will cost you 10 bucks a day I believe.I like this hotel but if I wasn't a Hilton Honors member that also wanted to save about 40 bucks a night, I would have stayed at hotels that were closer to everything with private beaches. They were cheaper than both the Hiltons on Waikiki. All in all, this hotel will not blow you away but it's all good. Only stay here if you want to be in quieter area that is a few minutes away from the beach and shopping.
user_name:
Gabriel S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was only here for one night and it was not a great experience. I found 2 roaches in the room one was in the bed. I also ordered room service for dinner and it was not great. The hotel itself was really noisy, with lots of street noise coming through even though it was a little away from the main area.I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff was responsive but for 229 per night, this hotel did not live up to the hilton name. Pool was not in working order. Beds were comfortable and it was quiet.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: One or two blocks sire makes a difference and this hotel is about two blocks out of the way on Ala moans so it's much quieter than those right in the middle of Waikiki. The rooms are well done and staff very friendly. If you are a Hilton frequent traveler than things get better with free wifi and also you can a complementary breakfast which is nice. What makes this place work though is the friendly staff. This is a just 3 star so in our stay there were basketball teams booked there and you have to be ready for the crowd. Fortunately the outside noise isn't. As but in hotels like this having eyeshade and earplugs are always a good idea. Some think it is quite out of the way but it depends on your pov. It's about a ten minute walk to the halekulani and the heart of Waikiki but certainly not on the beachside price is reasonable however and you don't really need a car. And for $20 a day it's expensive. They have a green car rental there. U can get an all electric car for $15 an hour. We didn't try it but given how small Oahu is, it makes so much sense to be green and get one of these Net net a good value in very expensive Waikiki

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Arrived mid morning, extremely jet lagged. Staff said our room wasn't ready yet, but changed our room so we could use it straight away, first impressions: fantastic service! Cookies on arrival, beds were really comfortable, bathroom was small but nice, good shower pressure too. Balcony had nice views of Waikiki lights at night. We were here middle of summer and air conditioner worked perfectly. Also the wifi reached our room on 8th floor (as long as we logged in from the lobby) It's about a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach from the hotel, not too bad, but during middle of summer can be a hot walk. Great little restaurant if you turn left after exiting the hotel, just don't expect fast service from the staff in the mornings. Would defiantly stay here again, no complaints about the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed here four times since the hotel's total room renovation earlier this year. It has become my default place to stay in Waikiki for value, location, and service.PROS:-location: on the western edge of Waikiki, away from the tourist congestion on Kalakaua Ave. 4 blocks from the beach.-price: the best rates of the Hilton chain (Hilton Waikiki, Embassy Suites, HHV)-great renovated rooms with large flat-screen TV and excellent beds.-bathroom shower: incredibly high-end German-made HanGrohe detachable showerhead is probably the nicest showerhead (ease of use, temp and flow control) I've seen in a hotel.-wired and wireless in-room HSIA, free to gold and diamond members-very friendly helpful staff, especially at front desk-decent free continental breakfast (for gold and diamond members) in a nice bistro setting with windows!-nice fitness center and small outdoor (usually devoid of guests) poolCONS:-no tub in regular room (tub in suites only)-tiny fridge -analog programming (such a waste on a great big HDTV set)-slow HSIA (oxymoron?)-easily-clogged toilet (outlet tube seems unusually small); were they replaced during the renovation, or are they the old ones?

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice clean rooms. Terrible wifi and Ethernet, do not pay for it as a it's dial up speed at best. Had 4 false fire alarms go off in the middle of the night during my week stay. Front desk didn't seem to care. Super clean rooms with no bed bugs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent 4 nights at this property and were mostly satisfied with the stay. Check in was quick and easy. The hotel is in a great location: just a few blocks from the beach, restaurants and great shopping. I was, however, disappointed with the size of the room. It was clean and well maintained but very small in comparison to other Doubletree properties I have visited. We had several pieces of luggage which did not make matters any easier as the storage within the room was also very limited. There was an excellent view downtown from the balcony (we were on the pool side because it was quieter) and of the ocean from the balcony at the end of the hall. We may stay here next trip but I'll first make sure that the hotel has larger rooms and that I reserve one of those!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for 8 days in October. I can't tell you if it was good value for the money because my client paid for the room. I can however tell you about the room.The decor is dark... kind of like chocolate-brown wood... very upscale and very modern. It helps a lot when you open the curtain on the sliding door and let the natural light in. The decor also seems European, a strange dark European look to it. The bathroom is very modern and the walk-in shower is fun and shot out plenty of water. It also had a nice sitting area for... perhaps... the application of make up.I thought the bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet even though I was right over the street. No noise and I slept like a bear in hibernation. Had a flat-screen TV and an adequate desk. I only wish they had a power outlet up on top of the desk instead of under it on the wall.Anyway, there were two things that stand out that I just love in a good hotel room. First of all, it had a small couch, a loveseat really. I really like to have an alternative place to sit when in a hotel room. The office chair is OK, and sitting on a bed becomes tiring on my back. This loveseat was comfortable and nice.Second, there was a small refrigerator in the credenza. I wish more upscale hotels would just get rid of their mini-bars in favor of an empty refrigerator instead! I like being able to get snacks and sodas from the area convenience stores and keep them cold. This little amenity just makes my stay great.Also, I need to mention how friendly the staff is. Anytime I encountered a staff person, they always said hello and had friendly small talk for me. That is another touch that is worth more than money to a guy who travels for a living.With all the hotels that I stay in every year for the past 25 years, I can honestly say that I really enjoyed staying here.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I think this hotel would be better if either the breakfast, wifi, or parking were included in the fee. The DT Alana charges like it's a fancy place but the interior and amenities don't really justify the prices. The front desk staff was just so-so, they didn't really bend over backwards to help us.The valets were really good. They had lots of helpful suggestions.The guy working the hot breakfast buffet was good too.The rooms had old worn out carpet and really tiny bathrooms. The kitchenette area was decent - big sink, small fridge, coffeemaker.The living room had comfortable furniture but it didn't look very nice. The beds were comfortable. We had a weird room divider separating the living room from the bedroom. It looked like it was constructed from leftover closet doors and they made a big commotion when you closed themThe patios were a nice feature but they had crappy views and the views would even be okay if they updated the balcony railing and furniture.We had an issue with our air conditioner that maintenance fixed very quickly - that was nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel for 10 days and there were good and not so good aspects to it.I travel to Honolulu yearly for work and have stayed in a variety of hotels.The staff were very pleasant and accommodating. They were in the top 3% of hotel staffs that I have encountered in Waikiki. When I had to move rooms due to excessive noise from roadwork below my room at 10pm at night, the night manager Alan was exceptionally courteous. Grade = A++.The bed was very comfortable and the pillows soft. I had to switch out my pillows after the first night because they smelled moldy. Grade = B+Proximity to major roads in/out of Waikiki (Ala Moana and Kalakula) was good. It was nice not having to drive down from east Waikiki through the troves of tourists on Kuhio. Grade = B+Cleanliness: Grade = B+Noise from street: Grade = C this is a problem due to the location, depending upon the room I supposeAccess to shops/restaurants etc.: Grade = C+ you'll have to walk to get to decent shops/eateriesLaundry services: there is no laundromat for hotel guests. To get your clothes cleaned in the hotel you'll have to dish out exorbitant prices (e.g. $6 for one pair of pants). There is a laundromat across kalakula next to a drug store. It's across a busy street and puts you into the local environment, which is not as safe or convenient as being in a hotel. Grade = DFitness center - small but very nice for a hotel fitness center. very clean and free to hotel guests Grade = APool - small swimming pool next to fitness center. Not for young children as shallowest part is 3 feet. But it is heated. Grade = B+Internet - You'll have to pay a ridiculous $10+ fee per 24 hour period. Internet service is important to me and in my mind there is no excuse why any hotel charges for internet use. Grade = DOverall, a nice hotel that is still a work in progress.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed two nights before heading off to new Disney resort. Staff was very friendly, it was an easy walk to beach. Room was very comfortable, and as always, the cookies were great. Location worked out well for us since we like to walk, but nothing was too far. We were using Hilton points so it was a bargain for us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton Alan Waikiki for 5 days in September. The location is centrally located near the Hilton Hawaiian Village (walking distance). You are a 10minute walk to the beach (walking through the Hilton Hawaiian Village), which is pretty convenient. For the price (and avoiding the resort fees), it's a great alternative. We enjoyed our room, which was very spacious (1 king bed, oversized arm char, patio area, desk area). The bathroom was one of the smaller bathrooms, which was only a shower (no tub), but it was more than adequate for our needs.Staff were helpful and very accommodating. the few cons included a small pool (smaller than expected at least), and spotty internet, expensive (but comparable to all of waikiki) valet parking.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I agree with many of the reviews that this hotel has a great location and is a cheaper option than being right on the beach. I've stayed here twice and each time I was upgraded to a suite because of my status with Hilton Honors. The one thing I don't like about their suites is that they are situated around the elevator shafts. In fact they wrap around them, so in the living room there is elevator noise. The bedroom can be closed off though and it's quiet. The service here is great and they seem to value your patronage. Beware that there is only valet parking and it's $29/day which is typical of Waikiki. If you don't have a car, you probably don't need one there if you only want to see Waikiki and Ala Moana because they are both very close walking distance.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Double Tree by Hilton Alana Waikiki is centrally located between Ala Moana shopping centre and the the up market area of Honolulu. The service was great. When we arrived we were promptly looked after and given choc cookies as a welcome! After a 10 hour flight from Sydney it was nice to check in and put our feet up in a clean and friendly hotel.The hotel has a gym and pool, but we used the beaches on the northern part of the island. There is a bar in the hotel but it closes at 10pm. There are tea and coffee facilities in the room and wired internet access. Wireless internet is available on the 1st 3 floors for free, which was great for Skype calls. nb.they charge if you use the internet service in the rooms. Whilst the hotel was clean and friendly, I did find that the shower design a bit of a problem- you had to make sure you sealed the glass doors tightly or water would end up all over the floor. There was no need to add cold water to your shower as the hot water was just right.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The overall feeling that I got from the hotel was that it was just average. On the plus side, it was relatively inexpensive, but these people who posted that it was an "easy walk to the beach" are being generous, in my opinion. The beach is at least 3 blocks away. There are some restaurants nearby, and better ones within about half a mile. The outrageous charge for valet parking ($28 a night) deterred me from renting a car, so I was relegated to the city bus for the duration of my stay. As a gold member in HHonors, I was upgraded to a suite, but the "suite" was nothing special. I was stuck with a view of numerous other surrounding buildings. The pool is fine, again, nothing special. Perhaps the best part of the stay was the housekeeper, who, upon seeing me leave my room in swim trunks literally RAN to me to offer me towels -- now THAT is service. I guess you get what you pay for; an inexpensive hotel, but overall just okay. Next time, I think I'll pay a bit more to stay somewhere better.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed one night to make an early work related appointment more manageable. The online directions from the airport are easy to follow. It was easy to pull-up and hand my keys over to the valet ($29/day with NO other options...not too atypical for the area). My greeting at the front desk was fantastic and my HHgold got me upgraded from a king room to a penthouse suite. It was FANTASTIC in this instance to have the dining/conference table in my room to spread out and do last minute work. The bed was VERY comfortable and decor was fresh and modern. I had a light meal at the restaurant that night which was perfectly tasty and well priced. To address the negatives written by previous reviewers- the bath: yes, its slightly small and NOT meant for more than one person BUT I am an average height woman and found there to be no issues with sitting comfortably in the tub. In fact, I really appreciated how deep the tub was and enjoyed having a jacuzzi bath in my room. The shower is also very nice and the shower head is on an aesthetically pleasing sliding rod to fit even the tallest people. The tile scheme was very pleasant and everything was CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN!Location- its about a 5 minute walk to the start of all the big shopping in Waikiki, a 5 minute walk to the beach, and I felt completely safe walking as a single woman. Although I enjoyed my upgraded room, I did use a standard room as part of their hospitality suite (so if you have a later flight you can still wash up before heading off) and it was also clean, well decorated and relatively spacious. The negatives- the pool is a simple but functional pool with plenty of chaise chairs...some of the beachfront places have more creative pools (not a big deal to me...). Its pet friendly WHICH I THINK IS GREAT!!! but there was a yappy dog next door to me. I called once to notify the front desk which did not seem to do much to help the situation. Luckily I was exhausted and the bed was REALLY comfortable....once I was asleep, I slept through the night like a baby (i hardly EVER sleep through an entire night!). For allergy sufferers, I saw firsthand the steam-vac type of industrial machine head into the neighboring room the next day and despite being an animal lover, I am allergic and I had NO issues. There were a couple of minor hiccups (dog barking/confusion around the hospitality suite) along the way for me but the manager was wonderful at check-out and I am already trying to plan a leisure trip back. Thank you for helping my visit for work run smoothly at a great cost (room price of $119+taxes etc)

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed here just one night en route to Lana'i. We did not want the Waikiki Beach scene, just a nice place to stay between flights. The hotel does not have it's own airport shuttle, so you have to either take a taxi for $35-$40 or one of the shuttles for about $9 per person. We opted for a taxi because it was late, then were in terrible Friday night traffic. Upshot is, next time I would stay near the airport. But the Doubletree is a lovely hotel and cheaper than the mega beachfront properties. You can still walk down the block to the beach. We paid $119 for two queen beds.The room was newly redecorated and very attractive and clean. One reviewer mentioned bedbugs, so I was concerned, but we had no problem at all.There are a couple of restaurants on site and we had dinner in the Bistro there. There is also a breakfast buffet, but we walked down the street to a coffee shop for a lighter meal.Exercise room was great for hubby and there is a large outdoor pool.My only complaint was the configuration of the bathroom. There is a large vanity behind the sink but no mirror, so hair drying was difficult since I had to put my brushes and dryer in the sink. The vanity counter has a large opaque window over it that could easily have been a mirror. Also, when hubby got up during the night and turned on the bathroom light, it lit up the bedroom!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's nice that you don't pay for the little slip of beach to be in Waikiki. Doubletree was a good stay for us for a few nights because we knew that we wouldn't be hanging out at the hotel very much. Otherwise clean, decent and fairly priced for Hawaii.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Please do not make reservations at this hotel. Our rooms should have been charged to my creditcard immediately after we made our reservations. Despite our remarks, they charged us at departure with that we lost approxiately 10% (at the dollar).Breakfast was included. However, this management did not believe us and despite of our vouchers confirming this, it took them over 24 hours, without excuses, to admit that a mistake had occured. They gave us coupons for a continental breakfast which was not mentioned at the vouchers. At last they gave us the full-breakfast.At arrival they swiped my creditcard for authorization purposes. I agreed to that. Late in the evening the day prior to our departure the announcement came that my creditcard had problems. At that time we came back from a fine last evening at Waikiki and found the doors of our room locked. The manager was kindly requested to open these doors as we need our personal (medical) gear. At that point he warned security, getting them behind me with handcuffs in reach, before declining our request, as he wanted authorization first. If only we had knew ...I told him the rooms should be prepaid and if not, why not informing me earlier about problems as they knew it already at our arrival. We warned you!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at this hotel on Sept 2nd and had just an average stay. I am somewhat disillusioned with the Doubletree's I have stayed at in past couple of months. This one was better than the others but only for the location, which was nearby the Hilton Hawaiian Village area. Rooms were small but clean and the upgrade they teased me with online was non existent (not available per the front desk). No free WiFi in the room only the lobby area. The front desk staff was helpful with dinner recommendations (ask for the printed list). Overall for the price it was just OK.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for a couple of days of fun after going to a convention.Location is great, walking distance to the Ala Moana jumbo mall and of course waikiki beach. Staff was super pleasant, and loves to treat customers with their delicious cookies. They also were helpful to organize a tour to Pearl Harbor in a concierge manner. I was upgraded to a suite which was great.I'm not putting excellent to Breakfast because it could use a few more items like scrambled eggs and a larger choice of fresh fruits. Also, a breakfast room with windows would be appreciated.Apart from those micro draw back, it's one of Waikiki's best value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a newly renovated hotel right in the heart of the city, walking distance to shopping, dining, and the beach. The rooms are small and a little cramped. We got the rooms right above the pool which was fun during the day when you can watch the people swimming. But this became a nightmare at night. People hang out in the area, chitchatting, partying, way into the morning. It was the 4th of July weekend all right, but people still had to sleep after the celebration, right? Maybe the admin was just lax that time but the interest and comfort of every guest should be foremost all the time. They should lock the doors to the pool so no one can sneak in during the night. Also, staff were not quick in addressing concerns and requests. I'll blame it on the crazy holiday for now. But that's never an excuse. But we did enjoy the comfy bed and huge fluffy pillows.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Reservation staff ensured we could check in as soon as possible after arriving at reception around midday even though official checkin was 3pm.This is a dog friendly hotel though we did not know conditions and fortunately it did not inconvenience us but we were wary that dogs may have been in any guest room.We did have to report safe not working (batteries flat) and suggested to management they do a routine check of safe batteries as obviously batteries had not been checked for some time and had corroded, but maintenance staff fied promptly. Unfortunately tv remote also failed due battery problem. Assumed previous guests did not report but probably left dissatisfied.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Despite the vaunted Hilton provenance, the Double Tree Alan Waikiki hotel turned out to be the worst hotel stay I've ever experienced in my life (okay with the exception of the rat-infested hostel in Mumbai,India). Don't get me wrong, I was impressed with the check-in and valet services but it was downhill from there on. The room (523) was described as smoke free. NO! It reeked of smoke like a seedy poker parlor! I complained to the front desk and was told that they would ask housekeeping to "spritz" the room (and yes, no other rooms were available-take it-or leave it.) It got worse, as we turned-in the bedding had that "feeling" and "aroma" of having been previously slept-in...hmm., say it ain't so! Worse of all, we were bitten by bed bugs throughout the night (my wife says it probably came from the carpeting because she felt bites when she sat at the table). Again I complained (showed evidence too), but all they said was, "we'll check on it.Now, it wasn't all bad, parking was reasonable, that is if you don't have the option of parking across from hale koa hotel ($7/day vs $29 at the hilton) and you don't have surly valet folks who sneered at a $5.00 tip. Oh well...charge it to experience and add to my trove of hotel stories.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Doubletree for 1 night upon our arrival in Hawaii last week as we could not check in to the Hilton Hawaiian Village until the next day. The rooms are very spacious, the bathroom and shower is one of the best I have seen for a hotel of this rating/price. After our numerous dilemmas at the Hilton Hawaiian Village I wish we had of stayed at the Doubletree, which was way cheaper very close to the HHV! Great hotel - recommend you stay here if you are staying in Waikiki, and are willing to pay more than "budget". This would be what's considered to a mid-range priced hotel. Sure it doesn't have the fancy resort or pools like the HHV, but the beach is not far away and FREE!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently moved to Oahu courtesy of the USAF and this hotel has been our home for five weeks. We initially booked here because it was the only hotel that could accommodate us and our dog. However, I am so grateful nothing else was available! Staying here has been a treat.The staff is wonderful and responsive and caring. They know our entire family and ask about our day (my children have started school while we're living in the hotel); they are great to the dog; they know what we want for breakfast before we even ask. They truly anticipate our needs.Breakfast is very pricey here ($13 for continental and $6 to add on eggs/bacon/omelette) but if you're a HHonors member, you can get a voucher for a free continental breakfast. The breakfast staff is great and the made-to-order omelettes are worth the extra $6. If you don't want to eat at the hotel, Cheeseburger Waikiki has a $5.99 breakfast and Wailana Coffeehouse has reasonably priced food. There's also a McDonald's within a few blocks.The pool is a nice feature when you don't want to walk to the beach and we use the well-equipped workout room regularly. The views from our room are incredible and the balcony is a great place to spend some time with a glass of wine and a book after a long day.There are several restaurants very close, including Cheeseburger Waikiki and the Wailana Coffeehouse. The beach is a short walk away; thankfully, the beaches at this end of Waikiki are wide and less crowded than further down in the middle of Waikiki proper. And there's food available at the Hale Koa resort snack bar for reasonable prices. (They also have the "best Mai Tais on Oahu" according to their advertising.)There's a park right across the street from the hotel for dog-walking and for bored kids who need to run (Fort DeRussy Military Recreation Area). Ala Moana Park is not far away and has both beach and walking/running paths. Ala Moana Center is an 8-minute walk away and has a ridiculous number of stores and restaurants. Wal-Mart is about 15 minutes away by foot and has plenty of parking if you want to drive.If you have a car, parking is really expensive at the hotel: $27 per night valet only. If you're military, you can park for $90 a month across the park at the Hale Koa parking garage. Even if you're only staying a week, it's worth it. Hale Koa also has public parking but I don't know the cost.I read some not-so-positive reviews of this hotel prior to its recent renovation and I can say without reservation that we have had no problems here at all. Everything is beautiful and clean and new. It has been a pleasure to stay here! We will miss our Home Away from Home when we leave!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed the weekend of August 12 thru August 14. The room size seemed to be on the smaller side for Waikiki. I had a King bed and couch in my room. I could not imagine having two beds crammed into the room. The bathroom was nice but kind of tiny also. The shower was extremely small but it had great water pressure. there was no space in the shower to put things, so I had to keep my shampoo, conditioner and bodywash on the floor of the shower. It was tough having to bend down and pick things up because the shower was so small and it flooded a bit after every shower. I got a lousy view of a parking lot so I did not spend much time on my balcony. The hotel is no where near the ocean and is on a pretty busy street so do not stay here if you are looking for a good view. One thing that really irritated me is the internet. When I booked my room, it mentioned there was high speed internet available in the rooms. When I got to the hotel I found out that you had to pay $10 for 24 hours of internet use. They have free internet in the lobby but the last thing I wanted to do was lug my laptop and charger downstairs. I thought the valet guys were great, very fast and friendly. The staff at the front desk are wonderful and helpfull as well. I did not eat at any of the restaurants so I cannot give any kind review on that. I was going to order room service one evening but the menu was quite small and a little expensive so I decided against it. Overall, for the cheap rate I recieved, I would definantly stay again. I would not pay any more than what I was charged though.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent two weeks at the Alana Waikiki in July; unfortunately for business. The hotel was very nice; the staff very friendly and professional and the price was good for Waikiki. The restaurant was being renovated, but the Alana Bistro was open with a free continental breakfast. I ate diner there one night and it was very good. The only drawback was entryway. It was very narrow and if there was more than two cars waiting for the valet you had to wait on the street to enter. Also, a couple of days they were painting the facade which made it even more difficult to get in. Otherwise it was a very pleasant stay and I would stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for one evening prior to departing on a cruise with NCL. We came early to experience a bit of the city. Our hotel room was on the 16th floor - we had two other rooms in the family, one on the 12th, one on the 14th. Seeing that we had reservations as a family and had asked to be somewhat near each other, this was peculiar. Our room had a pretty lovely view of Honolulu and a balcony. My husband and I (we were sharing a room with my sister in law who was asleep) spent about an hour and a half in the evening on the balcony watching the city. The hotel's location is pretty close - walking distance for us - to everything, but it definitely was not walking distance for my husband's grandparents who we were also traveling with. For a younger couple, this was just perfect though. There are also a couple of good restaurants/places within the block - we got a drink at the restaurant next door before retiring. The room itself was clean. The shower was a pain as it got water EVERYWHERE and was pretty bad as I was the third one to take a shower. The bed was a little uncomfortable on our side - we kept sinking towards the middle which is highly unusual for us. But nothing too bad. All of the amenities are nice, and in general, we enjoyed it. I would go back again, but I would believe there are better hotels. At the time, they were renovating some things so the price was slightly lower because of this.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had purchased a complimentary night's hotel stay from the Windward Community College Ho'olaule'a silent auction last year, and we finally decided to use it this month. My boyfriend had paid $160 for it, which was half of what they claimed the ocean view room was worth per night. Of course, we found out they only had valet parking and it was $27/night, so we decided to get dropped off. When we checked in, the customer service we received was friendly and professional--they also gave us warm chocolate chip macadamia nut cookies and then we went off to our corner room. It faced up the Ala Moana Boulevard toward the shopping center, so the view wasn't that great. There was also construction going on across the street, but they can't control that...My main issue was the fact that our "ocean view" included 2 small strips of ocean on the horizon because the hotel is a few blocks from the beach. The room, on the other hand, was recently renovated, so it was pretty nice. It had a contemporary feel to it. By the way, they charge $10/day to use their internet service. We thought about ordering room service, but they didn't have many choices and it was only available for breakfast. In any case, overall, we enjoyed a relaxing night's stay, but I don't think it would be worth it to come here again, even at 1/2 the valued price because you could get a better deal (with a better view) elsewhere.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is in a good location for people who want to explore the island of Oahu. Not real good for the handicapped tho. Bus stops are a bit of a walk from the hotel. Rooms are nice with lots of storage space but little room to move around. We had 4 people with 2 beds and 2 walkers and it was hard to move around. Bathroom was very small and had no shelves or such to put toiletries.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The pros: The staff was very courteous. typical laid back and friendly Hawaiian natives mostly. The facilities were clean, and the hospitality was great. The restaurant food was also superb and the fresh cookies which guests have access to in the lobby, was definitely a bonus. The location is not right on the beach, but about two blocks over, so it wasn’t that bad of a hike.The Cons: Checking into the hotel as a military member on PCS orders using TLA was a complete disaster! Paper work was lost/misplaced by staff, they didn’t delay charges until TLA was reconciled, and even over charged our cards when attempting to make a payment! I would recommend that military personnel, who plan on using advances/TLA to stay, try to get that paperwork done before they check in if possible. The staff practically reinvented the wheel when it came to our stay, but the island is practically %40 military! Also, plan on parking at the Hale Koa lot across the street to save money, or suck up a $27 a day charge to have your car valet parked. There is no self service parking. The internet is only free in the lobby, and must be paid for while in the room. That was another negative. For what you pay for the room, free WiFi should be standard.-USMC Captain

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: we were supposed to have a room with two beds, they assigned a room with a single bed for 2 adults and 2 children. The hotel was sold out, so no other rooms were available. Finally, they gave us a room with king bed and a sleeper chair for one person, then the staff brought a mattress that they laid on the floor. Not an ideal setup. They are going through renovation and their inventory is messed up. The don't know which rooms has which beds. You would think someone would physically check the room with you have four guests assigned to a room, specially when the guest is a highly ranked Hhonor member.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in the hotel in June 2011 for one night.It was, basically, fine. The check-in desk was efficient, and we got a promotional free hot cookie, which was nice. We were upgraded to a "partial ocean-view" room on the 11th floor... the "partial" being far to one side of our parking lot / rooftop view, about a mile away, past all the other hotels. No surprises there.The room was an OK size, with a couple of stylish touches. Big modern flatscreen TV, comfy bed, hot and powerful shower, and nice toiletries (Crabtree & Evelyn). I would feel cramped if staying more than a couple of nights here, but overall, it was comfortable, reliable and decent for a stopover, at a reasonable price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently remodeled, the rooms are very nice with subtle hints of Hawaii in the decor. The fitness center has everything you would need for a good workout, but why stay inside when you have paradise right outside the window? Very good for a Hilton property. Trivial cons: city view room options are not an incentive to book a CITY VIEW, the view is out the back and of run down apartment complexes; towel hooks in the bathroom are incoveniently placed a distance away from the shower door. Location: great location for access to DeRussy beach and the HHV-beach lagoon. Be aware of your surroundings late at night when walking back to the hotel.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here 3rd week of May with family (2 adults/2 children). Room was a little cramped for 4, although it had 2 queen beds and newly remodeled. Bathroom was small, and had no counter space, but there was plenty of storage outside. TV signal quality was pretty bad when we were there. We were told that they're moving to digital HD soon. Room was facing the back of some other slightly run-down residential buildings, and a busy road beyond, but it was fairly quiet (ninth floor). WiFi was not free, but you could get it free in the lobby. Parking was an extra $27 a night, which we didn't take (rented daily from Hertz in the nearby Hilton Hawaian). Didn't use the smallish pool, and beach access is a ten-minute walk via Hilton Hawaian. We had opted for the room rate which included breakfast (for an extra $40 per day for the 4 of us), but this was not a great value. At the restaurant right next door, you get breakfast deal for $5.99 (2 eggs, hashbrown, toast and coffee), which is more than adequate. Location is good if you want to go to Ala Moana center, but a little away from the main Waikiki shopping. There are restaurant choices within minutes of walking, including Thai, and an ABC store and 7-11 are just around the corner. The front courtyard where you arrive is very small, and the bellman service is inadequate. Overall, a functional place to park yourself at a reasonable price (and good savings) in Waikiki. Nothing terrible, and nothing exceptional, this doubletree is a simple decision based on budget - and for the price - it's not disappointing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for three nights in February on an impromtu little getaway. The hotel is a 5 to 10 minute walk away from the Waikiki shopping and beach area. It is very clean, comfortable, and the rooms are large. I love the new contemporary look. The staff was extremely friendly both at check in and at the restaurant.There is a pool to cool off in if you don't want to get sandy from the beach. It is small but nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our main criteria for looking for a hotel was - believe it or not - having dual queen beds. Most of the Waikiki hotels seem to have either two doubles, or a single king. That's not good when you have teenagers. About the only ones that DID offer dual queens were on the beach and more than double the price. No thank you. Once that was out of the way, we realized how well it would serve our needs. The hotel is within walking distance of everything. The beach is a 5-10 minute stroll, and there are a lot of stores and shops nearby to find those knick-knacks everyone wants you to bring home. The rooms are a bit cramped, but still comfortable - it's not like you're there for more than sleep anyway, though.We didn't try the hotel restaurant, the one morning we tried was our last day and they didn't open until later since it was Saturday. Most of the restaurants are down towards the beach, but there were a couple close by. We ate several times at the 24-hour Wailiana Coffee House which is just a block away and enjoyed it. We tried the Cheeseburger Waikiki next door as well. I wouldn't bother with it again, though. Overpriced tourist chain, in my opinion. The hotel does force you to do valet parking - something I always dislike, but there's no street parking so you have to add an extra $25 per day that you have a car there. We did a lot of roaming throughout the week, so it was mandatory for us. We noticed there were several car and motorcycle rental shops nearby so if you can plan your trip with sightseeing on certain days, this might be the better way to go.The hotel web site says their renovations were complete in early March. We were there late March and early April and there are still some going on. Not on our floor, though, and they kept what little noise there was during waking hours and to a minimum. Water was cut off a couple of times, but we always had notice the day before, so that was helpful.If you are taking bus tours, you will have to be picked up elsewhere, the hotel doesn't have good access for buses to drive up or wait.The biggest gripe I really have about the hotel is that we asked for a mountain view room on a high floor and were given a low floor with an ocean view. Maybe they figured the ocean view was an upgrade, but when there's a lot of buildings between the hotel and the beach, an "ocean view" doesn't offer much. By the time we opened the windows to check, though, we had already unpacked everything for the week and we decided it wasn't worth the hassle.We were very pleased with the value we got here. If you just want a place to keep your things while you venture around, this is a great place.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has some negative reviews in its past but it has been completely renovated and we found it great. It is located a few blocks from Waikiki beach just outside the main tourist district. We stayed three nights for sightseeing at Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head and other areas and, since we are not beach people and didn’t want to stay at a resort hotel, we found this place perfect for our needs. It is an easy walk to the beach, perhaps a half mile, but if the purpose of your trip is to spend most of your time with sand and surf, you might want a place that is closer to the ocean.The staff was terrific, particularly in helping us with the shuttle buses that run around the island. When we needed help in our room, someone was there within minutes. On our second day, the manager greeted us in the lobby and asked us if we were happy with their facility.The room was spotless as were the public areas. We did not try the restaurant since there were several eateries within a block that suited us just fine. Fresh chocolate chip cookies were available at the front desk each afternoon (yum!).Many of the guests appear to be business people, and we saw some airline flight crews, which meant that it was less likely that we’d have a noisy night, and this turned out to be true.As vacation travelers without a beach agenda, we would definitely stay there should we visit Honolulu again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family, including 2 dogs, stayed just one night at the Doubletree Alana Hotel. Overall, it was fantastic. And of course, we were greeted with those famous warm cookies...mmm, mmm, mmm.Cleaniness: Overall very clean. However, the ice bucket was gross and had no plastic liner for use. Service: Everything we asked for, we received with a smile.Location: Close enough to walk to most places in Waikiki. But do not expect an amazing ocean view.Value: Good room rate but high pet fee and it is not refundable. Parking is $27 per day and you are expected to tip each time you retrieve your car.Rooms: Simply gorgeous, newly renovated rooms. You will love them!Sleep Quality: Great mattress, new pillows, nice sheets, slept like a baby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed here in late May 2010 while we waited for on-base housing to become available. This hotel is wonderful! I can't say enough great things about it. The service from the staff was excellent--everyone seemed to be happy to be at work and had ready smiles and great eye contact. We LOVE the cookies they give out upon check-in and check-out! So tasty. The room was beautiful, and we had a partial ocean view! The hotel was quiet, the bed HUGE, soft, and comfortable, and the room was as clean as I like to keep my home. Didn't find a speck of dust or stray hair once during our 3 week stay. The pillows were plentiful and comfortable, the sheets soft and plush, and the room temperature was easy to regulate. There were also TONS of towels readily available, and we received a morning newspaper every day of our stay. The gym was great--not huge, but nicely kept, with great equipment. The pool was also really nice--lots of kids and families on vacation! The hotel also has a small business center, which was great when we needed to print out and make copies of lots of PCS paperwork.The hotel itself is in a great location--just minutes from the Waikiki Strip/Kalakaua Ave, and within easy walking distance of Subway, two ABC stores, Ala Moana Shopping Center, Cheeseburger Waikiki, and many other great restaurants and shops. Parking fees seemed a little steep, but as our car hadn't arrived yet, we walked everywhere :) My one complaint was that the in-room internet was $10 per day, but the lobby provides free wi-fi and internet via the business center computers, so it's really not a big complaint. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to visitors and to military PCSing to any of the bases on the island.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'll start by saying that I stayed at the Doubletree for a business trip so I am definitely not as picky for business as I would be for a vacation stay.Check-in was a breeze. I read a review or two that said the front desk was not friendly and I had the complete opposite experience. I arrived a little late and they were especially gracious.... I definitely experienced Hawaiian hospitality from everyone to front desk, housekeeping, to bellperson...My room was newly renovated and pristine. The bathrooms are updated and modern however, there is almost no counter space. I was a solo traveler so it was no big deal. Also, 5 stars for housekeeping. They do a great job and were very friendly.All good so far.The down side is I had absolutely no view at all... I had a small balcony but it looked straight at another building. Not the end of the world because I was working and barely at the hotel. The property is walking distance to the beach (a short walk). Also, it is undergoing renovation. This was not a problem for me because I left the hotel every morning by 8 am to go to an office. But I definitely would have been bothered if I were staying here on vacation.Here is what I know from the time I was actually there. The water was turned off intermittently between 10am - 3pm for 2 of the 5 days I was at the hotel. There was also extremely loud, constant drilling / banging the one day that I was free from work. Luckily I had plans to be out of my room in the morning but it was relentless from the time I got back to my room around 11am until I checked out around 1pm. I'm sure it probably went on all day and most likely the days I wasn't there earlier in the week. Again, this wasn't a problem for me because I was working during the day and things were quiet by the time I got back. But vacation travelers should be aware of this renovation and maybe contact the hotel to see if it is going on before they stay here. Definitely not noise you can relax or sleep in to!!!Overall it is a nice place in a very good location - easy access to Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants. My rate was also reasonable. $189 for the weekend night I stayed and $149 the rest of the week. I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
