review_body: After reading the reviews, I was thankful we were in a recently renovated room which was beautiful and clean. The hotel is perfectly located at the entrance of Waikiki yet still within walking distance to Waikiki strip. I was very pleased with our accommodations & the helpful staff. However, I do feel that parking should be free for hotel guest. I hope $27 valet parking is a one-time fee and not a daily rate.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently we moved to the beautiful island of Ohau and while we secured housing we had the pleasure of staying at the DoubleTree Alana for 2 1/2 months. The hotel staff was the best I have ever experienced. Everyone was so friendly and made us feel like family. We had our two dogs with us and having Fort Drussey Park across the street made their lives so much happier. The housekeeping staff was so wonderful. We would just let them know when we were taking the dogs to the park and they would clean the room while we were out. It could not have been a more perfect arrangement. The valet staff were always smiling and welcoming. The front desk was so helpful in extending our stay multiple times and were quick to offer up those wonderful fresh baked cookies. Good thing there was a gym on property or I would have really put on the pounds. Its not a large gym but it had everything I needed to get a good workout. The pool was clean and refreshing. It was perfect for our needs. It was an easy walk to all the restaurants in Waikiki and to the Ala Mona Mall. The beach is within easy walking distance. This is not a resort hotel so if you are looking for a large pool and an activities desk you won't find that here. This is a quiet hotel and was just what we needed during out stay. The hotel has microwaves and refrigerators available, coffee pots in room, daily newspaper and restaruants on property. We had breakfast there many times and they make a great omelet. We had dinner and it was pricey with small servings, but very tasty.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed our stay - clean and well-furnished with very hospitable staff. Property is undergoing renovation. We were in one of the newly-renovated rooms. Short walk to Waikiki but quiet! And good bus service to downtown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. After reading some disappointing reviews, I was very apprehensive to stay here. However, when when I arrived with my family, we were greeted by a --very friendly staff. They allowed us to check in earlier than the 3 pm check-in time. The room was recently renovated and better than I expected; it looked very contemporary. First thing I did was to check for bed bugs--thank goodness none were found. The room was clean and better than other Waikiki hotels. The view wasn't very spectacular--overlooking balconies of nearby apartment buildings. But who stays in their room when the beach is just a 10-15 minute walk away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: At the beginning of October 2010 our entire vacation was ruined. This was our first Hawaii vacation and we chose the Doubletree because of its fairly good reputation on the Continental US.The hotel is going through some renovation and although the website (which is deceiving in so many ways) claims that the work will be limited to 8.30-to 4.30 the banging and drilling would start between 7.30 and 8AM – so pretty much we were waking up to annoying drilling and unattractive views of old houses that surround the hotel, dirty balconies and our neighbors’ laundry. There is more to that – the Doubletree Alana hotel Waikiki has the worst front desk staff ever – there was no eye contact with the guests, nobody ever smiled or showed the acclaimed Hawaiian hospitality, I would rather describe their attitude as neglectful, uncaring and rude. And that might be because the apple doesn’t fall too far from the tree. On one of the days I was having a conversation with the hotel’s General Manager and the next day he didn’t even greet us when passing through the lobby. We were truly disappointed. We came for a vacation; however it never felt like one at this hotel. We will definitely never come back and Double tree hotel doesn’t exist for us as a brand.To end on a happy note: kudos for the housekeeping department – we’ve had the nicest and most pleasant housekeepers – thank you for being great and making us feel welcomed!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked this hotel with the understanding it was under renovation. I knew the furniture would be warn and the wallpaper would probably be peeling. I did not expect how filthy the bathroom would be. An old and warn hotel can still be clean.I checked in, and went straight to the beach, which is quite close. When I came back I was exhausted and climbed right into the very comfortable bed. The next morning I woke up and saw the nightmare filth that was the bathroom... mold in the tub grout, urine on and around the toilet, hair in the corners, rust in the fixtures, and the bottom of the tub had pink mold and black stains.The management appropriately comped my night and I moved to the Hilton Hawaiian Village for the rest of my stay. I will re-visit the hotel after the renovation to consider staying again, but would not consider staying here again until that time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii, and we went with the Double Tree as it is a sister Hilton Hotel. We had a one bedroom suite, and the king size bed was truly a Hilton Bed, very comfortable and clean. The living room had a hide a bed, the mattress was a typical of a used hide a bed, not extremely comfortable, but adequate. The room had a small fridge, and a sink in the living room. We couldn't cook in the suite, and that was the only drawback. The service was excellent, daily room cleaning, and when we asked for anything at the front desk, it was delivered immediately. The pool was closed for most of the time we were there, which was the month of February, due to an accident, and hotel guests were allowed to use the Hilton Hawaian Village pool, but we did not know this. My only suggestion would be if this happened again, to send a note to all the guests so they that they were informed. I only found out, by making a complaint of the pool being down so long. Friendly staff, clean premises, excellent service. We would stay there again. This hotel is a bit far from the "action" of the Waikiki beach strip, but is very quiet, which we appreciated. The beach is within walking distance, and bus service is a couple of blocks away.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you don't know what a bed bug bite looks like, now is the time to find out. If you stay at this hotel and get bites like this: http://www.bbsteamatic.com/Portals/42676/images//Bed%20Bug%20Bites.jpgdon't blame it on the hiking trail that you just went on because these are bed bug bites. We did not know what it looks like prior to our travel so we thought the hiking from earlier in the morning did it.Overall the hotel is not that bad, it's just I would not come back to this hotel knowing now that there are bed bugs.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed four nights before continuing to Waikiki. Great beds and quite location fifteen minutes walk to nice beach near Waikiki Hilton, which is a public beach. Good alternative for those looking for an alternative to the Waikiki strip and the sound of idling tour buses. Small pool with nice lounges for morning sun accross from park in a pleasant setting. Bus down the street gets you to Waikiki entertainment in minutes. One of the few hotels with a smoking floor. Very clean. Effiicent friendly staff. Good value. Nice continental breakfast.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've switched to the Doubletree. As a business traveler this hotel is nice for avoiding the tourist stuff. Most of the rooms are clean but some showing their age. That said it still much better then most of the dated rooms further down the road. The good news is this hotel is scheduled for remodel this summer. The lobby is done and I was shown the two sample rooms. Both samples look great and bring major upgrades to improve this hotel. I can't wait to return to see the improvements.Fitness room is above average with Precore equipment. Restaurant is OK but there are better options elsewhere. Staff is small but helpful. Bed are better them most of the standard Waikiki fare. Showers, well they'll improve soon.Now what could be improved. Location is challenged but has a great view of the park. Valet parking is too pricey. The room rates are lower but over $24 a day is robbery even for Honolulu. PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE put in laundry. I'd pay $10 extra to be able to throw a load. Again we'd pay extra for a washer!!!!If your looking for the total Waikiki experience you should stay elsewhere (recommend Ohana East for budget travelers). This hotel is a bit of a walk to the beaches and many of the food options. If your looking for a better then average Waikiki hotel that is affordable, this hotel is a great buy and perfect for business travel or those that don't mind a little walk off the beaten path. Plus new updated rooms....

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: PROS:cookies anytime you want oneclose to beach (but not right on)in waikiki - but a more quiet areaclose to shops/restarauntsnicely heated poolpeople were all very nice and helpful - desk-valet-housekeepingCONS:expensive valet parking (standard for area though)free wifi only in lobbyI cant really think of much bad to say about this hotel, but it did not wow me either. It was not too expensive, but it was not a super baragain either. close to a great beach, but far enough away to make it just enough of a hassle with small children. close enough to shps restaraunts - but still a walk.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was very pleasantly surprised with my recent stay at the Doubletree Alana Hotel Waikiki. The room was spacious and clean. With 2 double beds, a family of 4 can easily stay here. As other reviewers had mentioned, the tub is too small for bath, but it is okay for shower. I just never knew they make bathtubs that small! Although our room was only on the 7th floor facing a big street, the room was quiet and serene. From the lobby to the room, most of the visible areas have been updated and well kept. While it doesn't have the luxurious feel, this property is clean, functional, and in close proximity to many tourist sites. Definitely a good value!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Doubletrees have a lot variation in quality level. Some, like this one, are basically a glorified Howard Johnson's. That's ok though, because most people don't go to Hawaii to sit it the rooms. The hotel is clean, and is not all that long of a walk to the beach. The best thing, besides it's good price, is that guests at this hotel are given access to the public facilities in the Hilton Hawaiian Village, about a five minute walk from the Doubletree. That's a great deal, giving you pool, spa and lagoon access while paying about 1/3 of the price.My only complaint is the my bed was not all that comfortable.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel during newyears and it was better than we thought it was going to be, the staff was really friendly especially house keeping she was the sweetest lady who came every single day to clean the room and restock everything which was nice. the beds were super comfy the room was a good size very hawaiin with a balcony the bathroom was nice but bathtub pretty small the room did have a refrigerator which did come in handy and every floor had a ice machine the pool was ok but they did provide beach towels and lounge chairs, there was a fitness room and a place where u can use your laptop.with our room we got free tickets to a luau which is a must! its such a blast with a huge free buffet and you also get 2 free drinks which include alcoholic drinks. they do offer parking which was about 27 dollars a night but theres a parking garage across the street that we paid 50 bucks for 7 days and they give you a card to go in and out as u please which was good, this is a really nice hotel with lots around it

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Oahu is beautiful, amazing, phenomenal... my husband and I never wanted to leave! From the moment we boarded our Hawaiian Airlines flight, we fell in love with Hawaii. We had never been to the Islands, and it is true what people say: one visit will change your priorities. I booked a long weekend at the boutique Doubletree Alana Waikiki at a great package-rate to surprise my husband for Valentine's Day (coincidentally, there was also a corporate business meeting in Honolulu which he could attend while we were there, so he had the chance of visiting with associates as well - bonus!). While the Doubletree hotel is pretty basic in amenities and in need of some updating, it was clean and comfortable, and check-in went smoothly. We had a standard room with no view and the bathroom tub was quite small, but who goes to Hawaii to stay in their hotel room anyway?! The staff is very knowledgeable and excellent at restaurant recommendations, and this hotel has a partnership with the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has many bars, shops, and restaurants conveniently located on the 5 minute walk to... world-famous Waikiki Beach! Even in February, the sun was shining and the water was wonderful! We also rented a car from National - remember, most Waikiki hotels only offer Valet parking, so that is an extra nightly charge to consider (the costs vary). However, it was worth it for the beautiful drive up to the Polynesian Cultural Center on the other side of the Island (excellent luau experience), as well as the Diamond Head crater (gorgeous view from the top of the walking trails!) and Pearl Harbor - all of which are must-sees! Basically, if you are in paradise, I do not recommend spending much time in your hotel room anyway... but if you do happen to stay at the Doubletree Alana (and it does cater well to business travelers), expect basic amenities and friendly service in a FANTASTIC location and you will not be disappointed!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Me and my two friends ventured out to Waikik for spring break, i booked the room at a special rate of one hundred dollars a day, which was great for my poor student budget. Since i'm 20 i was happy to know I didnt have to be 21 to make a reservation. The room we had was great, we were on the 14th floor. We stayed for a week, every day our room got cleaned and everything was restocked, all of the staff was more than happy to help us if we has a request. They are not too knowledgable about tours though, we didn't plan anything before hand but i knew where to get the information online. Pets are allowed to stay, but we didnt hear any noise while we were there. Its about a 3 minute walk to the hilton hawaiian, theres a diner right down the block for breakfast or cheesburger waikiki right next door. It is a bit out of the way from the main drag, but its a 10 minute walk to th heart of the main shopping and hotels. All in all there was nothing negative about the hotel, don't listen to the other negative reviews, you don't stay in the room anyway your in Hawaii!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The room seemed nice enough and after sleeping in a single bed with sheets with the softness of sandpaper, the queen sized bed with nice sheets were a haven. Had a room on the 18th floor and view was nice, but specificallly booked a NON-SMOKING room - this one was NOT non-smoking and opening the lanai door to let in fresh air only let in smoke from smokers on floors below. Although the walk to Waikiki wasn't bad, the area isn't the best and I was sure to make it back to the hotel by dark (wouldn't want to be out in this neighborhood after dark).

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was okay except for the EuroAsian bathtub. It was so small I could not get my legs over the sides and then have room to move. Because of this problem the hotel was gracious enough to transfer us to a suite with a larger tub and an ocean view.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked a room at the Doubletree as I have stayed there twice before. This trip would be a business trip where my wife would accomodate me so she can sit on the beach all day as I work. I called for weeks before out trip to see if there would be an upgrade availble when I arrived. I was told over and over that there would be an upgrade. When we arrived, we found out that not only was there no upgrade (even though I am a diamond member) and on top of that we would have to wait 2 hours to check in (even though I requested early check-in). After waiting two hours to check in, we were given a normal room. When we got off the elevator on the 11th floor, we found an entire SWAT team in the hall way with guns drawn. There were guys on the floor being arrested and the SWAT team guys were yelling and telling them to get on the floor. The SWAT team had to escort us to our room and when we walked in we immediately saw a couple cockroaches. I called down to the front desk and told them that I wanted to switch to the Hilton across the street. All of a sudden there was an upgrade available. They told me that I could move to the 9th floor into a suite. I agreed and switched rooms. The room was bigger but still felt old and dirty and looking out the window we could see the dirty area around the hotel. My wife was instantly turned off by this hotel, so we decided to make the switch to the Hilton. I paid almost twice the original price to stay across the street but it was totally worth it. I still wasn't completely impressed with the Hilton either but it was a lot better. Don't waste your time at this hotel! BAD, BAD, BAD!!! P.S. I am usually not picky at all but I had to get on and right this because it was ridiculous! I stay in Hilton family hotels almost three weeks out of every month. This was probably the worst experience I have ever had in any Hilton family hotel!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a last minute change due to a flight cancellation. They gave us an excellent last minute price for one night. the room was large, clean, they provided excellent coffee, teas, etc. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Of course their warm cookies hit the spot after a trying day. The food was good in the restaurant and good prices. The only questionable thing was the size of the bath tub. It had high sides, difficult to get in and out of. and was only about 3 ft x 3 ft. Mainly just a shower box. Not a place to take a bath. The room had a nice balcony to relax outside. The beds were very comfortable and the bedding was wonderful. However, the pool was being refinished and we were not told that ahead of time.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really do not have unreasonable expectations when staying at a hotel, but the Doubletree Alana Waikiki struggled to meet the most meager of them. In the hotel's defense, it was undergoing major construction during my stay; however, that did not account for a dirty bathroom, cold water for the morning shower, and absolutely NO perks for HHonors members - no complimentary Internet, bonus points, breakfast vouchers, room upgrades, not even a bottle of water..........nothin'! Although I do not stay at Hilton properties for free bottles of water, I do usually frequent Hilton properties (HHonors Diamond) because they are dependably clean. I recognize my experience may be an anomaly, as it surely was based on my experience with Hilton properties.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We somehow ended up on the PH floor, can't complain about that! The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The weirdest thing was the shower/tub was a single person one you had to practically climb into. We had booked with a Bed and Breakfast special and had a nice breakfast every morning. The Valets were knowledgeable and fast, the staff always willing to help. Short walk to the Hilton Hawaiian hotels for restaurants and shopping and access to the ocean. Did see some folks who were basically living on the beach near the docks though. Never felt uncomfortable but we didn't wander too much after dark in this area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am surprised at the low quality of this hotel. The rooms were DIRTY. And I don't mean tropical humidity, old building dirty (which I am very aware of as my immediate family has lived in Hawaii for a very long time and I can distinguish the difference), I mean the cleaning crew is not cleaning dirty. Our room had a wetbar with a sink; My husband thinks the uncleaned mess in the sink was from oranges that someone had eaten and I still think it may have been vomit. However, it was there the WHOLE TIME we stayed; We stayed for 3 nights. The room hadn't been dusted for months. There was so much dust build up on everything, from the lamps to the TV to everything. It was a really thick layer. The tub hadn't been cleaned for at least a few months. The floor of the tub had a very thick layer of black, the kind you get from not cleaning your tub. If my tub at home isn't cleaned about every two weeks we begin to get this dirt build up; however, this had been built up for a long time, which means it hadn't been cleaned for a long time. I loved the card in the room that read " my name is (fill in the blank here), and I have scrubbed, dusted, and polished your room for you". I can't believe they have the nerve to put something like that out in the rooms! Our ultimate favorite though; the roommate we had. It was a lovely large roach who also hung out the whole time in our room. I do have to say that the beds are very comfortable but I seriously doubt the cleanliness since there does some to be an unkept trend here. We did get a good nights sleep! You have to walk to Waikiki but it definitely is doable and not too long of a walk. We weren't on vacation so it didn't matter to us. I would not stay here again AT ALL. The filth scared me off.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is not one of the best, but it is in a good location with quite a bit around it. The rooms were clean and did not have any problems at all. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Good value.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived at the hotel exhausted after a flight that was over 6 hours. Upon arriving at the hotel we checked into our room quickly enough which was a junior suite on the 5th floor. The room seemed OK size wise as far as sleeping our 3 young children and us. It had 2 twin beds and a fold a bed couch. View was of the pool and parking area. Bathroom full of mold and mildew. Carpet was in terrible shape and I found all kinds of junk and old food under the beds. The room is very noisy, right next to the elevator and the road noise round the clock was very loud. The second day we were over run with ants small little red ands covering the entire sink and everything around it. They send someone to deal with it and we ony saw a few here and there the rest of the stay. Our 3rd night while on the balcony beer bottles came flying down and into the pool. Called the front desk and they send someone to look and that was the end of it. Noticed a lot of people with dogs and the hallways usually smelled of dog as well. My wife got bit by something on the face as well but not sure what. Parking is $27 a night!!!!!!! Right around the corner is several abandoned buildings and a large concentration of hookers. The last night we caught a roach the size of a silver dollar, and a huge silver fish we found in the process and took it to the front desk. They claimed it was an outdoor roach, but did comp us one night for free. I would not stay here again as the cleanliness level is terrible. The staff seemed friendly enough and the valet parking was always quick. I didn't tip the valet as I shelled out so much for parking in the first place. One tip for you. As you depart the hotel (one way) turn left at the second light and head back to the marina. Huge parking area (FREE) and access to the beach area right next to the Hilton Village lagoon pool and a huge stretch of beach. Head toward the dock as there is less rocks. 60 feet out is a reef for snorkling with lots of fish, eels, and other sea creatures. If you park at the Hilton Hawaiian Village its $28.50 no matter how long you park there. In a nutshell if the cleanliness was better and the insect infestation went away and the parking was cheaper, I'd come again. My kids are still terrified about the roach incident. Hey we're Alaskan and don't have em.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Old dated & moldy rooms! Our clothes stink from the smell! Molded bathtus & since we booked through Expedia we couldn't even get Hilton points! Room was so bad we booked another room across the street at Hilon Hawaiian Village!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel for a number of years now. The hotel is in a quieter area away from the noise of the Waikiki area but still within walking distance. Every year they seem to upgrade one area of the hotel. Last year it was the exercise room and pool area. This year the lower lobby is getting a face lift and I have been told that next year some of the rooms will start to be renovated. The rooms are not large but certainly adequate for the price paid if not a little tired looking.I was more than a little put off with the amount of dogs (as in canines) staying at the hotel though. I like dogs as much as the next guy but I don't think a good hotel is the place for them. I am not talking little dogs either. Ones I did notice was a boxer and a 'not friendly' husky as well as a myriad of small dogs. We had at least 3 on our floor that I noticed and the husky (who was not on our floor) could be heard at night barking from the balcony.Pet friendly hotels are okay but there should be a maximum number of animals at any one time or a maximum number of rooms that can be used for animals and when they are booked thats it. It makes me wonder what was living in our room before we got there.I would probably recommend the hotel to a friend with the proviso of what to expect in the animal kingdom.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: far away from the beach.rooms had poor views.hallways very hot.elevatior was stink and hot. rooms very noisy. ( we could hear every thing out side. like garbage trucks& cop cars etc.. )no one told us about the construction that was going on at the hotel. we had trouble getting to our rooms.room keys did not work more then once.staff did not offer and did not help us with our bags.parking is expensive especialy if they put their hand out for tips.did not give us cookies.( had to ask for it .)WE WILL NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL EVER AGAIN!!!AND WE WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!!!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this hotel because our timeshare was not available for the first three days, it was certainly cheap for that time of the year, but we should have known,you get what you pay for!Besides President Obama being in town so the coast guard occupied the hotel and you waited 10 minutes for the elevator to reach your floor!We were happy to move into the Hilton Hawaiian village after three days.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Doubletree for a holiday visit to Honolulu. The hotel is located in a convenient location and our room was wonderful. Breakfast is good but pricey unless it's included in your room rate.The staff is great!Be prepared for the valet parking fee, but that's common in the area.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here at the end of Christmas in 2007 after spending the first week at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki. The Doubletree Alana's rate actually costs me more than what I paid at the Hyatt. That may have had an impact on my impression of the hotel. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and stored our luggage as the room was not ready yet. We waited at the pool while waiting for the room. The place advertises a gym and we laughed out loud when we saw their exercise equipment. There were 2 pieces of equipment by the pool that were rusting away. We laughed more when we saw the showering area to rinse off before/after going in the pool. It was in the corner hidden by make-shift lattice barrier and anyone walking on the street by the hotel looking up can see you rinsing off. We were so disappointed that we were immediately started searching the internet to find another hotel in the area if we could get one at a decent rate knowing that we would loose the prepaid rate we paid at this hotel. But since it was peak holiday season we could not find anything and ended up staying here. We booked an ocean-view room, which again was laughable. You had to lean over the very small balcony very far and you could see a sliver of the ocean far off in the distance. The room itself was decent (standard Hilton room) and room service food was decent as well. We ate at the hotel restaurant and I was in the mood for edamame and ordered a meal on the menu that included edamame. I was surprised when it arrived and no edamame. I asked the waitress about it and she checked with the chef who explained that they were changing the menu. This should have been told to us beforehand, but I did not want to wait for them to cook something else. When we tried to use the television check out service it did not work and had to wait in line to check out. We were not expecting this and were nervous because we had a scheduled ride coming to pick us up to go back to the airport. Since we spent most of our time on excursions and not at the hotel the stay was not as miserable as we had thought it would be. However, we would not stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you're looking for a warm "aloha" and a great walking location, check into the Doubletree Alana Hotel Waikiki. Directly across from an open park (great for walking, jogging or pets) the hotel is near Hilton's Hawaiian Village --- a multi-acre paradise of waterfalls, nightly torch-lighting ceremonies, great dining and upscale shopping. Also nearby are Red Lobster, Outback Steakhouse, IHOP and a host of local dining options. Anything you care to see or do is an easy stroll from your room here.We spent five days and four nights here in January 2010 and discovered that the hotel has nearly completed a ground-up renovation. There's a heated pool on a view deck about three stories up; adjoining the pool is a first-class fitness center and workout room. Our continental breakfast featured fresh-squeezed juices, an array of fruits that tasted local and fresh, plus excellent Kona coffee. Every face in the Doubletree is friendly; every "aloha" comes with exceptional service and courtesy.This was our second stay at this property: We returned on purpose because of the prime location and the amazing service. The hotel was everything we remembered and more: warm, friendly, walkable, refreshing.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Doubletree Alana this past week and were generally satisfied. The room isn't fancy but it does the job. The bed was comfy and each room has a small patio with chairs to sit and relax. The bathroom was fairly small (especially the shower) but it was good enough. Wireless internet and parking are expensive but checkout was quick and easy. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: A nice partially renovated property. The hotel is probably 35 years old, and over the years it's had many owners and face lifts. The most recent renovation of the lobby brings it up to date. The rooms are being upgraded slowly, and I would say that most are circa 2003 island style. Front desk personnel are efficient and friendly. Rates can vary from $99 and up, and many include continental breakfast making it a good Waikiki value. Location is across from Fort De Russy and beach is accessible there or via Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: There's absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel . . . Of course, the reason I picked this hotel is I had a free room coming to me from Hilton . . . and was only staying in Waikiki one night (which is about all I can handle . . . too touristy) If you want Hawaii, the real Hawaii, go rent a house, like we did on the Big Island . . . and rest.But anyway, we were greeted promptly. Even arrived early and the room was ready! Actually, we got upgraded to a junior suite . . . I guess being a member of Hilton Honors pays off! We were on the 14th floor. I noticed no mildew smells, the windows in the hallway were closed. The air conditioning in the room worked fine . . . nice large balcony, living room, bedroom. Room was nice and clean. Yes, the hotel's older . . . what building in Waikiki isn't? Most of the high-rises were built in the late 50's, 60's and early 70's.Yes, it is undergoing renovation . . . didn't know about it either. Big deal. It's nice to see a company reinvesting in its properties. Didn't hear any noise from it. Saw the artist's renderings and samples of the furniture . . . will be real nice when it's done. Never heard any garbage trucks. The view from the suite on the 14th floor was absolutely fine . . . could see the ocean, the green tree tops from the park across the street . . . and yes, some high-rise apartment buildings. A rather nice view I would say, but then I like high-rise living and enjoy seeing different styles of architecture.Staff was helpful and friendly, answered our questions, called the taxi service for us . . . taxi was there at the time we requested. The chocolate chip cookies (a Doubletree thing) were delicious as usual.Best of all is this hotel's location! It's a little bit away from the heart of central Waikiki (just fine with me!) But we like to walk . . . so no big deal to walk down to the Royal Hawaiian for Mai Tais! There's a Cheeseburger in Paradise restaurant right next door! Delicious. ABC stores abound . . . and the Hilton Hawaiian Village is an easy walk at just one block away. Fort DeRussy Park with its nice section of beach is also very close.Again, take these reviews with a grain of salt . . . I've noticed there's a lot of fussy travelers out there when there's really nothing wrong with the place at all. I'd stay here again . . . you bet!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was very disapointed with my stay at the Doubletree Alana Hotel Waikiki. Here are the good points, so as not to come off as a complete downer...1 - The people who worked there were excellent. They really tried to make our stay comfortable. 2 - We got a good deal with the Aloha special - 5 night stay, the 5th night is $50, we also got 2 commemorative Quarters with the state of Hawaii on them, and $50 towards the spa at the Hilton Hawaiian Village or towards the restaurants.3 - We got free continental breakfast each day. If we wanted to upgrade to the Full American Breakfast or have eggs or waffles with the continental, they didn't charge us for the full meal, just he difference in price. So that was a good deal there. The food was good, both at the breakfast and at dinner. No lunch is served because of the renovations.Here are the complaints:1 - They did not inform us that the hotel was under renovation.2 - The first room we were put in smelled like mildew.3 - The hallways had windows open, so as soon as you left the room, you were hit with the heat and humidity of the outside.4 - The hallway was not vacuumed all week.5 - No good views from either side of the hotel. Both overlooked residential apartments. We heard the trash collection from the 15th floor daily as well as the police and fire truck sirens.6 - The spa at the Hilton Hawaiian Village was terrible - had the worst manicure of my life. All the nail polish was old and very little left. No wonder when they charge $40 for a manicure and $60 for pedicure. And it's not like they gave you any special treatment for that money - would have been cheaper to go to the mall for the treatments instead.7 - Not within walking distance of Waikiki. So I'm not really sure this hotel is in Waikiki. It was only close to the Hiltan Hawaiian Village, which is a very impressive hotel. I wish we had stayed there.Anyway, I do not recommend this hotel. We travel a lot with Hilton properties and this is not one to go back to.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel last week visiting family who live on Hawaii. I was not interested in spending a great deal for a hotel since I planned on spending most of my time away from Honolulu. Despite that this is a decent location for the price and is very near DeRussey, and the Hilton Hawaiian village (think Starbucks!). It is within walking distances of the tourist attraction areas and shopping areas. Be aware, this is not on Waikiki beach. Parking is an additional $27 day and there is a $10 day charge for internet (or you can go to the business center and pay $.20 per minute if you only need a little access. The bathroom was a little tired but very clean. There is a refrigerator in the room which is nice for water, soda, etc.,I didn't eat at the hotel so can't rate any of that. The staff were all extremely helpful. Love the choco chip cookie on check in.I would stay here again. I ended up with AAA paying $98.10 per night. I considered it a bargain and worth the price

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here to attend the ADA convention in Honolulu last week, I mainly choose this hotel for it's proximity to the convention center, which is around the corner and three blocks away.The hotel is fairly clean, we had an 'ocean view" room , well it was on the ocean side of the hotel!. not really there for that so it didn't matter. Beds were quite comfy plenty of pillows and nice linens....room was a bit smallish but not New York small. Bathroom was clean and as someone mentioned the shower is small. A/C was good and room did have a mini fridge which I alway appreciate since I like to have beverages cold and in room.I ate at the small restaruant for breakfast.......go for the continental buffet. THe ordered breakfast was ok........as with all hotels breakfast was pricey........if you want down home coffee shop style american breakfast with a local touch , walk down the block to the wailana coffee house...open 24/7 it's somewhat of an instutition with locals .....and food reasonable and quick......the alan waikiki worked great for what we were there for, and that was work......I would think twice if you're going for a romantic waikiki adventure near the ocean....which is probably a 15 minute walk from this hotel

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: negative - stayed here last week for my Hawaii trip and sad to say this is a wrong choice of hotel. the restrooms are okay but the shower area is so small. i lost my phone gadget and the housekeeping didnt even bother to look for it. i booked an ocean view, room which is a little expensive room, thinking that il see a good view of the ocean but what i had was just a view of the other hotels. i just wish that they dont advertise an ocean view because what i has is a "other hotels" view.positive - the bed is so comfy with the soft pillows. good water supply and nice AC.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here for one night enroute to Kauai from LAX. My son arrived earlier in the day from Australia, and the hotel let him into the room before lunch, even though it was in my name. I did however let them know about it. And I thank them for that.I arrived around 10pm, so the stay wasn't long, but the staff were very friendly and the room was great. Although the bath tub was rather small. My own shower at home is bigger, but it didn't really matter. Just loved the warm chocolate cookies on arrival and departure! And the bed was soooo comfortable! We didn't have breakfast, as we walked to Ala Moana for that. I'd stay again. It was in a quiet area with a lovely park across the road and walking distance to Ala Moana as well as there being plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Although the hotel was renovated recently, our room showed some wear. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. We got a good rate, so the value was reasonable. The parking is expensive (as with all hotels in the area), but the valet service was very quick. As Hilton Honors gold members we were given free continental breakfast, but were not offered a room upgrade. It is a reasonable hotel if you use it as a base to explore the island, but it is away from the beach in a crowded neighborhood. The pool was nothing special.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had a great room, great stay, and great service.I really don't understand why anyone would give this place a bad review.I'm gonna stop listening to others twisted opions.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 8 days early June 2009. The room was nice, clean, in good condition and provided a sizeable wet bar with microwave and mini fridge. My only issue is this is a pet friendly hotel (I didn't know this) and there are no specific floors designated for pets; if there are I was on a pet floor.I love pets, have two dogs of my own, but I do not want to deal with barking dogs at all hours when I travel, especially for business. It was disturbing Hilton did not ask if it is okay to place me on a floor with pets. I also was shocked the hotel did not provide 'free' internet service in the rooms and did not like the $27.00 valet charge. The attendants had an attitude because I didn't tip them; for $27.00 per day the hotel can pay them more. As a Hilton Honors member, I did not receive free breakfast or free business services as with other Hilton hotels.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is located right near start of hub-bub of Waikiki. Relatively short walk to Hilton resort and Kalakau Avenue and all the stores and hotels along there. Valet parking only at $27 is steep but if you are going anywhere outside of immediate Waikiki it is worth it to get a car as taxis are also expensive. Free wireless in hotel lobby. Breakfast at hotel not worth it unless you get a free coupon as a Hilton Honors member. Rooms are fine, generally clean. Shower/tub is small with a shower curtain that is partially transparent. Water always seems to seep out. For the price it's a good deal and since you spend most of your time outside of the room anyway, the fact that it doesn't have all the bells and whistles didn't bother me. I've stayed here before and will do so again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Used my debit card to pay for my hotel room, come to find out that they put a hold on my account and I started to get other charges. I like the hotel. It was nice, good bedding to me. Nice people.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I got one of the $99/night rates and was very happy with that. The room was average but got an upgraded larger room with a small balcony facing the "beach." The hotel isnt on the beach but it's a pretty easy walk to the beach & Hilton Hawaiian Village. The valet was surprisingly fast but of course it's a little pricey (as is everywhere else in HI) so be aware of the charge. The con't breakfast (with Honors coupons) was fine and it was VERY cheap to "upgrade" and add eggs (or other things you can probably work out with the server. We were very busy on the trip and spent little time in the hotel room, so the DT was perfectly fine for our purpose. There are definitely better hotels in HI, but this was a great rate for a hotel that I can earn Honors points.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My fiance and I wanted a weekend getaway downtown, so we searched for the best deal. We found the Doubletree Alana had the best local/Kamaaina rate at $99 including parking. We had viewed the room prior to our stay and found it more than adequate for it's price. However, we were presently surprised upon our check in to find out that we had been upgraded to a larger suite with a kitchen and extra room. I believe it was the handicap room. It came with a large bathroom and a huge walk in shower. Upon arrival we were greeted with warm cookies and a smile. The Bistro seemed like a great place for drinks but we opted for Subway right around the corner. The pool was heated and uncrowded. A nice options outside of going to the beach. For toursist, don't fret, the beach is only a few minutes away. If you are looking to spend time in a resort like environment, you are free to use the ammenities at the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the street.We didn't use the gym, but we noticed that had one and it was in great condition.Overall, I give this hotel two thumbs up for the cost, location and service.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for two nights and was attracted by the 99.00 " spring special" on their webpage. We had a rental car as we had to be mobile for several sporting events we were attending. There is no self park, valet only and it costs 25.00/night. Paid for it and found out while talking to another guest that the hotels regular rate is127.00 or so and includes valet parking. Other than that no big complaints. Rooms were clean and not old, staff friendly and helpful. We thought we were getting an excellent deal and as it turned out it was just regular price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came to Honolulu for a conference and got a really good deal for this hotel on priceline. The hotel is located at the edge of Waikiki, about 8 minute walk to both convention center and Hilton beach - for me the location was perfect. It is definitely a business hotel - the pool was tiny and overlooked a parking lot, but who needs a pool when there's ocean nearby?The staff was very friendly and helpful. After checking in I was surprised that they gave me a suite! The room was in great condition and clean. There was a refrigerator, but no microwave. The internet - both wired and WiFi costs around $10/day or $50/week. The speed was limited - around 512 KBit, but consistent. WiFi is free in the lobby. I did not go to their restaurant - but I would highly recommend Wailana coffeeshop a block away for breakfast. Overall, it was probably one of the most convenient and well-maintained hotels I ever stayed in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in the Doubletree Alana Waikiki for 4 nights checking in on April 30 and out on May 4, 3009. I booked on the Hilton Website and was surprised as I was searching for a hotel they had a AAA rate called the Spring Special of $ 99.00 plus tax so I jumped on it. I was actually considering using points at either the Hilton or the Marriot but for the $ 99 rate it was not worth it to use the number of points either of those properties wanted.I did not rent a car due to the Stiff valet charges of $26.00 per day for parking. When I arrived at HNL I used Robert’s Hawaii shuttle. The cost is $9 one way or $15 round trip and you can reserve your return pick up in advance via phone. You are allowed two large bags which are placed under the bus for free and your carry-ons may be taken into the bus. You find the stop in the airport and can pay the driver upon boarding. I was offered an requested a “Standby room upgrade” on the web site when my reservation was made to a Suite Supposedly 650 Square feet with kitchenette and Ocean view for an additional $9 per night. Upon check in this was not offered or even mentioned and as a Hilton Diamond member it was kind of disappointing. I had reserved a room with two queen beds which was supposed to be upgraded to an Ocean View but received a room with a city view. Since I saw the property- I did not think you could even see the Ocean from any room as you were surrounded by other tall buildings. I suppose if you were on top floors you could catch a fleeting view of some water. The only perk I was offered as a Diamond member was the same cookie everyone else received and I did choose free internet ($ 10.95/day instead of the free continental breakfast or points). There is no executive or Concierge level thus there are no free drinks or breakfast here for the Gold/Diamond members. Since I had requested a quiet room not facing the busy street I did not complain as my room 801 was quiet even though it was not the upgraded room which was printed on my reservation.As others have commented the room was not very big. It did have a mini fridge and microwave and was the 2 queen kitchenette which I had reserved. I wanted to be able to keep my beverages chilled instead of purchasing from the hotel at the sky high prices Hawaii is famous for.The fitness center was nice and had 4 treadmills. The pool area was also ok for taking a quick dip for those not interested in going to the beach. These are located on the Mezzanine level.The bathroom was also small and the Japanese tub was kind of cramped even for showering as other reviewers have mentioned.Housekeeping was fine and did not bother me when my “Do not disturb” sign was out. I left a small gratuity on the bed daily to assure reasonable service.I requested late check out on my final day as my flight was not until 10 pm. I was given until 2 pm and after that I checked my baggage with the Bellman and went sightseeing. Unfortunately the hotel does not have a hospitality suite to allow guests to shower an change before their flights. Since I had a late one I got my bag from the Bellman and donned a swimsuit, then used the shower in the pool area which is outdoors to wash, and used the pool towels and changed and freshened up in the bathroom by the fitness center. This is the only way around them not having the Hospitality Suite. I have suggested that they get one as most guests do have late flights out.The Doubletree is at the top end of the Waikiki strip so it was the first stop for the shuttle. It is only about 1.5 blocks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and about a 5 minute walk across Ala Moana Blvd. That is where the beach is if you are interested. Dining options are numerous within walking distance as there are some fast food places like Subway, IHOP, and ABC stores (3 within 2 blocks), There is a a Tony Roma’s across the street. There are also numerous local places (Cheeseburger Waikiki, Kobe Japanese Steak house, and all the eateries in the Hawaiian Village) nearby.I would walk to Waikiki (about 15-20 minutes) for shopping and food and the Convention Center is about 3 blocks. One could also walk or take the bus to either Waikiki or to the Ala Moana Shopping center which is about 4-5 blocks up Ala Moana Blvd. There is a nice Asian style food court there with many choices from Korean BBQ to Lahaina Chicken.I visited the Honolulu Aquarium which is at the far end of Waikiki and was not impressed. For the $ 9 admission it was very small and there is minimal to see. I would not recommend.I also went on the “Haunted Honolulu Ghost Walk”. It cost about $ 30 and was about two hours. It was more for the history and the views then to see any restless spirits. They do have a bus our to some “Haunted places” but I could not make that due to my schedule. They say the bus tour is really scary??Overall I would say that the Doubletree Alana was worth the price I paid but if I was to pay $150 or more (which was what some of the published rates were) I think I could find a place that had a little more to offer such as the Hilton Kuhio or the Waikiki Marriott.I would recommend for those on a budget who are not afraid to walk as I was. Email me if you have any questions and I will try and respond as I can.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My choice to stay at the Doubletree Alana was driven by the hotel's proximity to the Hawaii Convention Center and my desire to stay at a Hilton property to accrue more Hilton Honors points. The room was clean but rather small for an American hotel. I bruised my leg when I slipped trying to get into the shower/tub the first day. It's a big step up to get into and very slippery. The shower head was a little low for me, and I can't imagine how awkward it would be for taller men and women - although a hand-held attachment is also available. The toiletries provided are from Neutrogena and include a face moisturizer with a strong SPF. We were able to book a room with a small refrigerator and microwave (not all rooms had a microwave) for a discounted rate. The view from the 7th floor on the ocean side was nothing to write home about, but we didn't spend much time in the room. My colleague's room on the other side (mountain view) on the 8th floor was a little nicer. The fitness center is small but well-equipped. The hotel is a short walk from the convention center, the Hilton resort for beach access, and the restaurants/shops/hotels in Waikiki. I stopped at the ING Cafe across the street each morning for a bagel and coffee (large coffee for $1!!). The air conditioning never seemed to get our room very cool. We found out in the middle of the week that a colleague had a room in the nearby Ilikai Hotel that was twice as big with a complimentary continental breakfast and a large balcony with an ocean view for only $30 more a night. If it weren't for the Hilton Honor points, I might have wished I was staying there. Overall, the hotel was fine but not great. I'd recommend it if you are attending something at the Hawaii Convention Center.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the doubletree while in Honolulu to attend our sons wedding. The staff was friendly and accommodating allowing a family member to check in even though flights delayed our arrival several days. He big shock came when a large security guard and front desk manager pounded on our door within 15 minutes of our days late arrival aggressively alleging we were smoking something funny in our room. Although I appreciate their desire to monitor the activities in the hotel, I did not appreciate the approach. It made for a uncomfortable stay. The GM was less than sincere with his apology and a veil of suspicion hovered over what should be a happy occasion. On the last day of our stay the our room attendant finally noticed there were three guests registered. She left a few extra amenities and a extra packet of coffee without charge (they normally charge you for additional coffee packets.) Loreta was a small bright spot in an otherwise uncomfortable stay.There are better hotels in better locations for less in Honolulu. I doubt I will stay there again.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed at this property a number of times and we are never disappointed. We know the property is not on the beach, but an easy walki to the Waikiki beach and shopping areas. We enjoy being away from the crowds and the smell of suntan oil. The employees are terrific, especially Danny who made certain we were pleased with our stay. The rooms are good sized, well maintained, and I believe offer a good value when compared to the other beach properties in the local area. Previous reviewers commented on the dated furnishings and mildew. Guess I don't go looking for this and given that most hotel rooms are used by thousands of guests, some who take care of their surroundings, this hotel has very well maintained rooms and facilities. There was no mildew in the bathrooms or carpeting, both were very clean. The suite we stayed in had a separate bedroom area, a living room area, and a small wet bar area with an in room coffee maker, sink, and small refrig. The room had a combo of tile and carpeting, with an extra wide/long lani. Thick white towels in the bathroom were great. The bedding was excellent, including the pillow topped king bed. There is free internet service in the lobby and for a fee available in the room. The lobby is quiet and was handy when using the internet. We did not come to Hawaii to work so the lobby area was adequate for our daily searches of things to do in Honolulu. The staff was very helpful in providing printed directions to various sites using The Bus, Honolulu's public transportation. The pool area is nice, with chaise lounges and tables provided for guests. Large pool towels are provided for guests in the pool area. But who wants to use the pool when there are miles and miles of beautiful sandy beaches in Hawaii. The fitness center is nicely equiped with gym equipment. While there the hotel had a very large group of high school students staying there. The staff did an amazing job of keeping them on certain floors and from bascially taking over the property. Hats off to them! I will continue to stay at this property for it's value and comfort. Thank you Doubletree staff for making our stay an enjoyable one. Aloha! P.S. Those chocolate chip cookies are the best!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a nice new tower hotel. It is not a resort and is not on the beach, but if you are planning on just using the hotel as a base for other activities, it is good. The rooms and bathrooms are new and clean and you get Neutrogena products in the bathroom. The fitness center is bright and clean with new equipment. The pool is nice, although pretty small, but good for an evening dip. The hotel is on a main street, so you do hear some street noise, but it did not bother me. also, there is a mini-fridge in the room, which is nice for keeping drinks or food cold.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent a week at Alana Double Tree. They are one of the very few hotels that are "Pet Friendly". Rooms are not great compared to Hawaiian Village across the street but our room had a great view and very large patio. It isn't the rooms that make this place special though... The staff makes it -- that and the on-site restaurant - J's... Breakfast is included but average at best. Dinner though - under chef Johan - is over the top. We have eaten at all the eateries on the island - Roy's in Waikiki and Hawaii Kai; Alan Wong's, etc -- and just spent two years eating our way through Italy. We know our food and appreciate quality. The menu at J's is great and each presentation has gourmet touches. The wine list is interesting and we tend to enjoy eating in the Bistro wine bar upstairs where Erin tends the bar on weekends. The atmosphere is dark and intimate -- more often than not, Johan will bring our food to the table himself -- a touch we learned to appreciate in Italy and never thought we would see back in the USA. We have eaten most things on the menu and would recommend all - wouldn't be surprised if the Filet was better than Ruth Chris' -- appetizer menu is special and you can easily make a meal on them alone. Realize this is a rave but then we typically look forward to eating there about once a week -- enough said...

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is in a good location. Ten minute walk to central Waikiki shopping district. Also, a ten minute walk to Ala Moana mall. Also, a ten minute walk to the convention center.Only valet parking here. It's expensive like all the other hotels in the area. But, each time was a breeze and very courteous staff.Check-in/out was relatively fast. Upon check-in, they give you hot-out-of-the-oven cookies. Pretty good.We had a "mountain view" room on the 7th floor. The view was okay. You catch glimpses of the mountain in between high rises. The balcony was nice for sit-n-chill time. The bed was comfy; it's the best part of the room. The furniture is dated but clean. The washroom was adequate, but the "square" tub was very small - not for soakers. The lip counter above the sink was inconvenient; banging against your forehead if you were to sip water out of the faucet.Wolfgang Puck coffee and tea. Didn't like the coffee, but the tea was good.Safe was usable and so was the mini fridge.Didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but heard live music almost every night. Didn't use the pool but saw people there.Just outside is a Waikiki Cheeseburger joint. Good, but overpriced...like most things there.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We (husband, pre-teen daughter and I) stayed 5 nights while my husband was on business. On the weekends on either end of the trip, we stayed at the Ilima (see my review of that property) for half the price and a bigger room, so I'd recommend the Ilima over the Doubletree any day. However, the room was nice, if not spacious, and the beds were comfortable. My big complaint was the bathroom, which smelled dank. The smell turned out to be because the just-bigger-than-a-phone-booth sized shower had a curtain which was 3" too small on each side, so it was impossible to shower without flooding the floor and getting the outer curtain wet, which then smelled. A bathroom exhaust fan would have been a wonderful thing, because our swimsuits and beach towels never dried overnight (adding to the funk), even using the handy retractable clothesline in the shower. The mini-fridge was a nice thing to have. Our daughter thought the fourth-floor outdoor pool was novel, if small, until she realized how very chlorinated it was. She took a long shower afterward trying to get all the chlorine washed off. The valet-only parking just makes the cost-to-value worse. My husband discovered that if he took his laptop down to the lobby, where there was free wireless, then he could continue to get the free wireless in the room for the day. Overall, there are better places to stay, but the property could solve a lot of my issues simply by having shower curtains that actually fit the opening. Since I know I'm not the first TA reviewer to note this problem, and the Doubletree is not exactly a low-budget hotel, it seems like they would fix it.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband I just returned from our vacation in Hawaii. I work for the Hilton Hotel system so my review is pretty particular when it comes to cleanliness and the attitudes of the staff. I believe the staff & the cleanliness of the hotel can make or break your stay. Anyway, here's my opinion.... The hotel is slightly above average. I say slightly because the hotel was just a hotel. An average size room, a bathroom, and an older style TV (no LCD screens here). It had a balcony that overlooked the mountains & the city, and the lighting was nice. We had a large closet, a fridge, & a safe in the room. The room was extremely clean, and although we didn't use the housekeeping service the entire stay, the housekeeping workers were always on our floor and always friendly. There are 4 things that weren't satisfactory in our room. The air conditioner couldn't be turned down past 70 degrees. I understand that Hawaii is trying to conserve electricity, but it was definitely hot on the 15th floor when you were trying to sleep. Also, our room faced the mountains & city. It was pretty loud at night because of the main street (kalakua avenue) that people constantly cruise at night. Sometimes it sounded like the police sirens were outside of our window! Another complaint is the ridiculous bathtub/shower. I read all the previous reviews about the "furo" asian soaking tub, but I seriously laughed out loud when I saw this thing. To take a bath/soak, you would have to sit Indian Style. It was pretty humorous. We took showers the whole week, but you can forget about 2 people fitting in this tub/shower thing together! haha. The last complaint is the parking. We rented a car, and paid more to park the thing at the hotel than it was to rent it! This hotel is not located in the middle of Waikiki, it's actually on the outskirts, so why is parking so ridiculous? It was 25.00 a day to park, PLUS TAX! I actually work valet & front desk at a Hilton hotel, and wow I have never heard of tax being charged on the parking... oh well. (Hawaii tax is pretty cheap but still). The valets were not very helpful & some of them were pretty rude. They didn't open the doors to help out, they didn't offer directions, and they didn't thank us for staying there. They didn't even put my 2 very large suitcases in the car... my husband had to do it. Please make sure you tip these valets for the service they give you, not because you are supposed to. Anyway, now for the good parts. The check-in was smooth, the front desk people were very helpful & knowledgeable, the cookies they give you at check-in were pretty great! The area is pretty good, to the left of the hotel is a couple restaurants including Tony Roma's & Cheeseburger Waikiki (both very good) around the left of the hotel is a Subway, and an ABC store. The hotel is on Kalakua & Ala Moana (2 main roads in the Waikiki area) and within walking distance of ALOT of fancy stores & great eats! The hotel also has a martini lounge & restaurant.... didn't eat there, but it looked pretty nice. The hotel wasn't fancy, but it was sufficient for what we needed it for. It was about a 10 minute walk to the beach, and many times we just walked over to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and used their beach, lagoon, and pool..... these were VERY nice. I highly recommend you using their facilities. The Doubletree's pool is heated (which is a plus because the ocean is FREEZING!) and it goes up to 6 feet deep. The pool at the hotel was never crowded because many people head over to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The fitness center looked extremely nice here in the hotel though. The concierge wasn't very helpful, we asked about tours and what we should go & eat while we were in town, and he handed us a book of all of the islands, that's all. Didn't recommend anything, just gave us a book. We had a late flight on the day we were due to check out, and the manager allowed us to stay all day for a $40 charge... very nice & helpful. The 12:00 check out time wasn't long enough for us... our plane was due to leave at 10:10pm. We were able to go to the beach all day, then shower before we had to get on the long flight back to Indiana. Overrall, the hotel was a little above average, and they definitely have the room for improvement. I wouldn't pay more than $150 a night for it, but the front desk staff is nice. More advice----get an entertainment book for the area! Let me know if you have any more questions.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was here chaperoning a soccer team for a tournament. The rooms were adequate--we had 4 teenage girls to a room. The staff was helpful and accommodating to our needs and were always friendly. The continental breakfast was generous and tasty, and not bad at the price.The location wasn't bad-there were restaurants and convenience stores nearby, and it was a short walk to the beach. There is a park across the street that we used to practice and a laundry around the corner.The negatives, for me, were the need to valet park (although we got a price break, it was still expensive and inconvenient), and the fact that my room's view was another building. That being said, this is not a resort hotel, so don't expect fancy rooms or a lavish pool. Considering that we only spent time at the hotel mostly sleeping and eating, it worked well for us.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: My cousin booked this hotel for me and this hotel was centrally located and within walking distance to Waikiki and Ala Moana. My room is on the 5th floor and is a suite and the pool is just below the balcony so it is very noisy when peoples are playing around the pool. Also, there is a construction on the mezzanine floor, and they start working at 9:00 am. The room is OK without any view. However, they do not have parking lot, ONLY valet parking. I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and thanks for the previous reviews, I request no newspaper send to my room so it save me some $$. I would probably book Ala Moana Hotel next time since it is about the same price.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent one night at the Doubletree before embarking on a Navy Tiger Cruise aboard the USS Nimitz. The hotel was reasonably priced compared to others in the area but it was uninspiring, seemed very old and outdated. There is an apartment building next door and some questionable activity at all hours of the night. The area seemed safe but a bit seedy. We walked to the beach and spent some time at the Hilton Hawaiian Village-very nice. I would probably recommend spending a little more and staying at the Hilton.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was centrally located and within walking distance to everything in town. The rooms were ok...my room flooded and ruined some of my luggage and shoes; However the manager met with me and ask me what would compensate me. I stated a weeks stay for next year and he abliged!!!Staff was very nice and frendly and valet parking was great!Rooms were very basic and nothing was fancy or ultra dirty that stood out about the rooms...they were just average....switch rooms until you are satisfied!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are a business traveler looking for a central location than maybe this hotel works..... Otherwise keep on looking you will be extreamly dissapointed. The hotel is extreamly outdated, the rooms are small, the view is not good unless you came to hawaii to look at other buildings. The parking at the hotel is 20 dollars per day that IS NOT inluded with the room. The workout facility only has one eliptical, one bike and one treadmill all in horrible shape. The pool is tiny and has very minimal space around it for seating. Over all I would not reccomend this hotel. The only positive thing I can say is the staff is extreamly nice.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked into hotel the Friday before the pro-bowl and it was a busy place. The front desk staff was working fast to get others checked in and assured me they would get to me soon. I was in no hurry so I didn't mind and they gave me an extra cookie for being patient. The first room I had was ocean view on the 7th floor. Room was nice and I had a small wedge view of the water but because of the overnight noise level of other occupants on the floor, I asked to switch rooms the next day. I had booked a city/mountain view room so I must have lucked out at check in to get the ocean view room. The next afternoon the hotel staff was very accommodating and moved me to the 12th floor to a corner room. This time I was facing the city/mountain side (like I booked) and faced a large apartment building. I think the room was smaller and it was not very clean (dusty) but it was quiet and since I was there for a business trip, much appreciated.The rooms have a small refrigerator but no honor bar. There are safes but in my second room it was not bolted down so I didn't use it. There are Neutrogena products in the bathrooms and the beds are very comfortable with lots of pillows. My second room had a couple of bottles of water on the wet bar.The staff at the hotel bar was great and the food was good too. I recommend the macadamia crusted mahi mahi. There is a Cheeseburgers Hawaii next door to the hotel and I had a pretty sad burger there. There is an ABC store, Subway and a 7-11 right around the corner from the cheeseburger place. Lots of shops and restaurants in walking distance but the beach was a bit further than I would have liked. I heard a rumor you could use the amenities at the Hilton Village but I didn't check that out. Nice hotel for a business trip but I would probably not book this hotel for a vacation since it was just average.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I just returned from the NFL Pro Bowl 2008 and I stayed at this property almost as a last resort because Waikiki was really booked! I read all the good and bad reviews about this place before I arrived and I gotta say that I really enjoyed the hotel. It helped that I splurged a little extra on a penthouse suite which gave me a great view of the city mostly but I could still see the ocean clearly. The extra space definitely helped as I do have friends on the island that I entertain. As the previous reviewer noted, the staff were very friendly and quick to respond to requests with absolutely no attitude whatsoever and i must admit I was really relieved to see that. The high shower stall didn't really bother me because the water pressure (which is really more important) was perfect so I didn't mind my morning 'hurdle jump' into the tub that much, lol! The beds were as comfortable as I could ask for and after 4 nights of partying non-stop (this is the Pro Bowl, remember?), a good nights' sleep is just what the doctor ordered. I love sleeping surrounded by pillows and they definitely give you enough. The location may be a problem for some since it's not exactly 'oceanside' but the beach is about a 5 minute walk so I considered it my morning exercise before relaxing in the beautiful waters of Waikiki (let's get our exercise on people, lol!)My only suggestion to the hotel is maybe upgrading the TV's to Plasmas, after all this is 2008 and the big bulky televisions are old-school! It would really dress the room up even better. Enjoy your stay!

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really have mixed feelings about this property. First of all, I stayed here for business-it is within walking distance of the Convention Center-but I would not choose this hotel for a family trip. If you're going to put up with the traffic in and around Waikiki, you might as well stay somewhere with a view and easier access to the water. That said, there are a few areas I loved:Service: The desk staff was very responsive to my requests for assistance. When I couldn't print my boarding pass through their in room printing service ( a great idea....if it works), the clerk quickly did it for me at the front desk. They also allowed me to leave materials for someone to pick up at a later date. The housekeeping staff also responded quickly and efficiently to several special requests. The staff at the restaurant and bar were equally attentive and the garage attendent had a cab for me in less than 5 minutes.Beds: Quite comfortable with plenty of pillows.A small fridge was also in my room.Bath: Nice towels and ammenities.What was not so nice:View: I had a great view of two apartments from my 14th floor room. Not much else.Noise: Sitting on my lanai was like sitting on the stoop of a row house on a busy street. But, that's Waikiki.Bath: If you are a senior or anyone who has difficulty moving about, stay away from these rooms. The small tubs have very high sides and I'm sure anyone with mobility issues would find it difficult to shower. As someone over 6 feet, I also hate low shower heads. I really had to duck down in my shower.Would I stay here again? For business-most likely. For a family trip-not likely.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Doubltree seems nice enough at first glance, but there are some definite problems. I chose this hotel because I am loyal to the Hilton family for the points, and the big Hilton down the road was a bit out of my budget. Next time, I will spring for the Hilton.I was traveling on business, so I don't need anything fancy. Cleanliness, however, is not negotiable. The room seemed okay at first, if you can ignore the noticeable mildew smell and noticeable wear on everything in the room. However, the bathroom and floors were just disgusting. The carpet was filthy and black along the edges of the room, the shower curtain and walls had mildew on them, and the faucets and shower knobs all had soap scum crusted all over them.My companion and I tried to arrange for a late checkout to ease the pain of our red eye flight on departure, and the whole thing was a complete debacle. The front desk staff didn't seem to know what to do with our request and had to refer it to a manager, who then called to confirm but failed to make note of it anywhere. When we stopped by the front desk to check, we talked to the same woman as earlier in the day, who acted like she had no idea of the conversation we had had with her about 4 hours earlier. After all that, there was still confusion on check out and I had the maid repeatedly knocking on my door asking when I was leaving. I didn't eat at the hotel at all, so I can't comment on that. The location is nice because it is within walking distance to both Ala Moana shopping mall and the downtown area, as well as Waikiki. It took a while for taxis to come in the morning, however, so it is probably best to arrange those in advance or just walk out to one of the bigger roads. The views are questionable if you're not a high floor. I had a "mountain view", which really looked out over a parking garage and a scuzzy apartment building with a mountain in the distance.Overall, this hotel is okay and has a lot of faults that would all be forgiveable if it was cleaner.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Alana - Waikiki Beach
review_body: We picked this hotel originally because of the AAA rate we got for it. We had an ocean view room. Looking at the website we figured if we got to actually see the ocean, it would be amazing but our view was WONDERFUL!!!! We could see the ocean and looked down on Fort McRussy park - gorgeous! We were much closer than it looked from the website. The beach is about a 5 minute walk. Downtown Waikiki was a minute outside the hotel door.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were greeted with a warm cookie on check-in. It was a quiet hotel even though it was full.Our room and bathroom were clean. I can not say much for the shower, though. It was a stall with a VERY high side that I almost fell a couple of times while trying to climb over the side to get out.
